mahabang panahon at halos ibigay mo na ang sarili mong pangkain para hindi sila magutom ay magagawa ka pa ring traydorin. even the people that you have been in company for a long time and you have almost given your own food so that they will get hungry, could still make it to become a traitor against you. <3> Marami na tayong naranasang ganyan na kung saan kayang-kaya kang ipagkanulo ng sarili mong kaibigan dahil lamang sa kakaunting halaga ng salapi. we have experienced a lot of that where you could be still put in harm by your own friends just because of the small amount of money. <4> Sa hirap nga naman ng buhay sa Pinas ay napakarami na sa atin ang nakalilimutan ang kahalagahan ng dangal kapag pera na ang pinag-uusapan. in the dire difficulty of the life here in the Philippines, many of us have forgotten the importance of dignity when money comes to the discussion. <5> Ang hindi alam ng mga ito ay panandalian lamang ang mga ganitong uri ng diskarte. what they have not known of, these types of tactics are only momentary. <6> Hindi maglalaon ay mabubuking din ang iyong style at tiyak na mawawalan na rin ng tiwala sa iyo ang mga taong maaaring makatulong sa iyo. not later, your style will be exposed and surely, those people who can help you will lose their trust in you. <7> Ganyan na ganyan ang nangyari sa Art Gallery Philippines na nabiktima ng sarili nitong supervisor. that is exactly what happened to the Art Gallery Philippines which was victimized by its own supervisor. <8> Mukhang nasilaw sa kakaunting salapi ang supervisor ng AGP na si Rita Orr at ngayon ay kailangan niya itong panagutan sa batas. the supervisor of the AGP Rita Orr seemed to have been blinded with the glitter of small sum and now she needs to be accountable in law. <9> Kamakailan kasi ay pormal na siyang sinampahan ng kasong qualified theft ng Makati City Prosecutors’ Office. recently, she was formally filed a case of qualified theft in Makati City Prosecutors' Office. <10> Ito ay batay na rin sa reklamo ng AGP na diumano’y itinakbo nito ang P250,000 na kabayaran para sa dalawang piraso ng likhang sining. this is based on the complaint of the AGP that she has taken away the P250,000 payment for the two pieces of artworks. <11> Ayon sa reklamo ng AGP, si Orr na siyang tumatayong supervisor ng art gallery ay nakapagbenta ng dalawang likhang sining na nagkakahalaga ng P250,000 sa dalawang regular na kliyente nito noong September 16,2013 subalit sa halip na ibalik sa kaha ay ibinulsa umano nito ang naturang halaga. according to the complaint of the AGP, Orr stood as the supervisor of the art gallery which sold two artworks which cost P250,000 from its two regular clients last September 16, 2013, but instead of returning it to the case, she put the said amount in her pocket. <12> Pagkatapos ng pangyayari ay bigla na lamang umanong nag-AWOL (Absent Without Leave) itong si Orr at binalewala nito ang pakiusap ng AGP management na ibalik nito ang kanyang itinakbong salapi. after the incident, Orr suddenly made an AWOL (Absent without Leave) and disregarded the plead of the AGP management to return the money she has taken away. <13> Sa resolusyon ng Makati City Prosecutors’ Office sa pangunguna ni Makati City Chief Prosecutor Jorge G. Catalan, Jr., malinaw umano na nagkaroon ng “grave abuse of discretion” sa panig ni Orr kaya’t makatwiran lamang na sampahan ito ng kasong qualified theft. in the resolution of the Makati City Prosecutors' Office led by Makati City Chief Prosecutor Jorge G. Catalan, Jr., it is clear that there has been a grave abuse of discretion on the side of Orr so it is justifiable to file a case on qualified theft. <14> Hanggang sa kasulukuyan ay pinaghahanap pa rin ng pulisya si Orr na nagtago matapos nitong isagawa ang krimen. until the present time, the police is still searching for Orr who hid after she made the crime.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_63277249 <1> Buhay ng tao higit sa lahat KAHIT pa malaki ang epekto sa aming budget ng pagpasa ng Sin Tax Bill, minabuti naming Public Information Officers na suportahan ito sa pamamagitan ng isang resolusyon na aming pinirmahan nu’ng monthly meeting ng Association of Information Officers in Metro Manila (AIMM) na ginanap sa Philippine Information Agency sa Visayas Avenue sa Quezon City. human life most of all even if signing the Sin Tax Bill has a huge effect on our budget, we public information officers decided to support it through a resolution we signed during the monthly meeting of the Association of Information Officers in Metro Manila (AIMM) held at the Philippine Information Agency on Visayas Avenue in Quezon City. <2> Bisita namin nu’ng Biyernes si Health Undersecretary Ted Herbosa, ang napakahusay na advocate laban sa paninigarilyo. last Friday, our guest was Health Undersecretary Ted Herbosa, the great advocate against smoking. <3> Ngayong araw ang kritikal sa pagpasa ng batas na ito sa Senado kaya’t humihingi ang DOH at mga doktor ng suporta para maipasa na itong Sin Tax Bill. today is the critical signing of this law in the Senate so the DOH and doctors are asking for support so that the Sin Tax Bill will be passed. <4> Ngayon lang daw nangyari na sinuportahan ng mga kapwa niya doktor ang panukalang ganito. supposedly it is only now that this happened, that his fellow doctors support a proposal like this. <5> Para raw kasi sa kanila, higit sa pagiging isang revenue measure, ito ay isang health measure na makababawas sa mga magiging biktima ng sakit dulot ng paninigarilyo. because for them, more than becoming a revenue measure, it is a health measure that can lessen the victims of diseases caused by smoking. <6> Sa atin pala ang pinakamurang sigarilyo kung ikukumpara sa ibang bansa kaya nga raw pansinin nyo ang bitbit ng mga turista palabas ng ating bansa – ream ng mga sigarilyo. turns out ours are the cheapest cigarettes if compared to other countries so you will notice what tourists carry out of our country - reams of cigarettes. <7> Namatay raw sa lung cancer ang ama ni Herbosa dahil sa paninigarilyo kaya biglaan niyang itinigil ang paninigarilyo sa edad na 33. Herbosa's father died from lung cancer due to smoking so he immediately stopped smoking at age 33. <8> Nagsimula siya sa bisyong ito nu’ng 9 years old pa lang siya. he started with this vice when he was only 9 years old. <9> Dulot ito ng peer pressure at ang pagnanais na maging “in” at “accepted” ng mga kaklase niya noon sa isang exclusive school. it was a result of peer pressure and a desire to be "in" and "accepted" by his classmates back then in an exclusive school. <10> Ayon sa kanya, ginagawa niya itong kampanya para maipasa ang Sin Tax bill dahil gusto niya na mas maraming tao – higit sa lahat mga kabataan – ang maligtas ang buhay dahil sa pagtigil o pag-iwas sa paninigarilyo. according to him, he made it a campaign so that the Sin Tax Bill will be passed because he wants the lives of more people - most of all the youth - to be saved as a result of stopping or avoiding smoking. <11> “Sinasabi ng mga kontra sa Sin Tax Bill na marami raw mawawalan ng trabaho dahil dito. "opposers of the Sin Tax Bill say that many people will lose jobs because of it. <12> Ang masasabi ko lang, ang trabahong nawala ay maaaring palitan ng iba pang trabaho na mapapasukan. what I can only say, the job that will be lost can be replaced with a new job. <13> Pero, ang buhay na nawala dahil sa sakit ay hinding-hindi na natin maibabalik,” paliwanag ni Herbosa. but we can never bring back a life lost due to disease," explained Herbosa. <14> Ang dagdag-kita raw dahil sa tax na ito ay magagamit ding pampondo ng health programs ng gobyerno ayon kay Herbosa. the additional revenue from this tax can be used to fund government health programs according to Herbosa. <15> Mapalad tayo na mayroon tayong tulad ni Dr. Herbosa na nagtataguyod nitong bill na libo-libong pamilya ang makikinabang pag naipasa ito bilang batas ngayong araw na ito. Tulad ng sinabi ko kanina, isa kami sa maaapektuhan sa pagtaas ng presyo ng alak at sigarilyo pag naisabatas ngayong araw ang Sin Tax Bill – ngunit, sinusuportahan namin ito dahil sa mas higit na benepisyong idudulot nito sa mas nakararaming tao. we are lucky to have someone like Doctor Herbosa who supports this bill that will benefit thousands of families when it is passed as a law today. like what I said earlier, we are one of those who will be affected by the price increase of alcohol and cigarettes when the Sin Tax Bill becomes a law today - but, we support it because of its greater benefit to more people.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_53124462 <1> Nueva Vizcaya power coop, handa na sa elections Nueva Vizcaya power coop, ready for elections <2> May 06, 2016 Ben Moses Ebreo May 06, 2016 Ben Moses Ebreo <3> BAYOMBONG, Nueva Vizcaya, May 5(PIA) – Handang-handa na ang mga kawani ng Nueva Vizcaya Electric Cooperative (NUVELCO) dito upang magbigay ng tama at tuloy-tuloy na daloy ng kuryente sa darating na election sa lunes. Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya, May 5 (PIA) - employees of the Nueva Vizcaya Electric Cooperative (NUVELCO) here are very ready to give proper and continuous flow of electricity in the coming election on Monday. <4> Ani Engineer Narciso Salunat, NUVELCO manager, walang magaganap na power interruption simula Mayo 6 hanggang isang lingo pagkatapos ng halalan upang magkaroon ng tuloy-tuloy na daloy ng elektrisidad na kailangan sa transmission ng mga election results. Said by Engineer Narciso Salunat, NUVELCO manager, power interruption will not occur starting May 6 until one week after the election so there will be continuous flow of electricity needed in the transmission of election results. <5> “Isinagawa na namin ang mga power interruptions upang hindi maantala ang daloy ng halalan at upang maihanda ang aming mga pasilidad para sa darating na halalan sa lunes,” pahayag ni Salunat. "we carried out the power interruptions to not disrupt the flow of elections and to prepare our facilities for the coming elections on Monday," said by Salunat. <6> Ayon pa sa NUVELCO manager, nasa stable na level ang kuryenteng dumadaloy sa lalawigan at hindi ito nanganganib na bababa at magkukulang sa darating na mga araw. according also to the NUVELCO manager, the electricity flowing to the province is at a stable level and it is not in danger of decreasing and lacking in the coming days. <7> Ayon pa kay Salunat, naikalat na rin nila ang kanilang mga technicians sa mga iba’t-ibang lugar upang magbigay ng tulong at serbisyo kung sakaling magkaroon ng problema sa mga linya ng NUVELCO kasama ang mga poste at pasilidad nito. according also to Salunat, they also dispersed their technicians to various places to provide help and service in case a problem occurs with the lines of NUVELCO including the posts and its facilities. <8> “Maganda ang performance natin hinggil sa pagbabayad ng kuryente sa National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP) kung kaya’t pwede tayon humingi ng karagdagang kuryente sa oras na bababa ang daloy ng kuryente sa lalawigan,” dagdag ni Salunat. (ALM/BME/PIA-2 Nueva Vizcaya) "Our performance is good with regard to paying for electricity to the National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP) which is why we can ask for additional electricity if there is a time the flow of electricity to the province decreases," Salunat added. (ALM/BME/PIA-2 Nueva Vizcaya)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_61718726 <1> Walang saya para sa mga obrero ng Coca-cola no joy for employees of Coca-Cola <2> by Macky Macaspac by Macky Macaspac <3> March 19, 2012 March 19, 2012 <4> Happiness for Coke Workers in the Philippines from mayday multimedia philippines on Vimeo. happiness for Coke workers in the Philippines from mayday multimedia Philippines on Vimeo. <5> Taliwas sa ipinagmamalaking islogang “100 Years of Spreading Happiness” ng Coca-cola, malungkot, at hindi masaya, ang mga manggagawang Pilipino ng multinasyunal na kompanya ng softdrinks. contrary to the slogan "100 years of spreading happiness" Coca-Cola is proud of, Filipino employees of the multinational soft drinks company are sad, and hot happy. <6> Tumatanggi ang Coca-cola Philippines Inc. na magbigay ng dagdag sahod at iba pang benepisyo sa pamamagitan ng pag-atake sa karapatan ng mga manggagawa sa Collective Bargaining Agreement (CBA) at pagtungo sa kontraktuwalisasyon, paglalahad ng mga unyon ng manggagawa ng Coca-cola sa isang press conference kamakailan. Coca-Cola Philippines Incorporated denies to give additional wages and other benefits by attacking the employees' rights through the collective bargaining agreement (CBA) and heading to contractualization, reveals the union of employees of Coca-Cola in a press conference recently. <7> Sa kanilang CBA, ipinipilit umano ng manedsment ng Coca-cola ang bagong iskema na tinaguriang 3P. in their CBA, the management of Coca-Cola allegedly insists on the new scheme called 3P. <8> Sa ilalim ng 3P, dadaan sa appraisal o ebalwasyon ang bawat manggagawa kada dalawang buwan batay sa kanilang presence, performance at participation. under the 3P, each employee goes through appraisal or evaluation every two months based on their presence, performance and participation. <9> Ang ebalwasyon na ito ang magiging batayan ng anumang dagdag sahod at mga benepisyo na kanilang matatanggap. this evaluation will be the basis for any salary increase and benefits they will receive. <10> Gayundin, maaaring matanggal ang sinumang manggagawa na hindi pumasa sa 3P. furthermore, any employee who does not pass the 3P may be fired. <11> Walang saya sa Coca-cola? no joy in Coca-Cola? <12> Tinututulan ng mga manggagawa ng Coca-Cola ang kontraktuwalisasyon, pagbarat sa sahod at pagdurog sa unyon sa bagong iskema ng manedsment na 3P. the employees of Coca-Cola oppose contractualization, bargaining their salary and destroying the union in the new scheme by the management, 3P. <13> (Macky Macaspac) (Macky Macaspac) <14> “Mahigpit naming tinutulan at kinukondena itong iskema ng individual performance-based appraisal na ipinipilit sa amin ng Coca-cola Philippines Inc.,” sabi ni Alfredo Maranon, tagapangulo ng San Fernando Coca-cola Rank and File Union (Sacoru). "we strongly oppose and condemn this scheme of individual performance-based appraisal forced on us by Coca-Cola Philippines Incorporated," said Alfredo Maranon, head of San Fernando Coca-Cola Rank and File Union (Sacoru). <15> Ayon kay Maranon, magdudulot ang 3P ng kawalang seguridad sa trabaho, pagbarat sa sahod, at pagbuwag sa kanilang mga unyon. according to Maranon, 3P will cause job insecurity, bargaining of wages, and dissolution of their unions. <16> “Paraan ito ng kompanya upang maisagawa ang malawakang tanggalan sa hanay namin at pagdurog sa aming mga unyon,” ayon sa lider-manggagawa. "it is the company's way to conduct mass firing in our ranks and crush our unions," said the labor leader. <17> Inilahad ng Sacoru na tinanggal na ang dalawang pangulo ng magkahiwalay na unyon sa planta ng Coca-cola sa Meycauyan at Ilocos matapos pumayag sa iskemang 3P. Sacoru shared that the head of two separate unions of Coca-Cola in Meycauyan and Ilocos have been fired after agreeing to the 3P scheme. <18> “Paano na ang mga manggagawa sa mga plantang ito? Parang wala na rin ang unyon dahil inalis ang pangulo nila,” sabi ni Maranon. "what will happen to the employees in these plants? it's like there is no longer a union because their head was removed," Maranon said. <19> Mayroong 45 na unyon sa loob ng mga planta ng Coca-cola na nakakalat sa buong Pilipinas. there are 45 unions inside the Coca-Cola plants spread through the entire Philippines. <20> “Kung tatanggapin namin itong 3P sa aming CBA, maaring ito na ang huli naming CBA,” ayon naman kay Faustino Aguillon Jr., tagapangulo ng United Coca-Cola Workers Union (UCCWU) sa planta ng Coca-cola sa Imus, Cavite. "if we well accept this 3P in our CBA, it may be our last CBA," according to Faustino Aguillon Junior, head of United Coca-Cola Workers Union (UCCWU) in the Coca-Cola plant in Imus, Cavite. <21> Paglalahad ni Aguillon, isa-isang kinakausap ng manedsment ng kompanya ang mga manggagawa at hinihikayat na tanggapin ang alok na 3P. Aguillon reveals, the management of the company talked to the employees one by one and encouraged them to accept the 3P offer. <22> “Tinatakot nila ang mga lider at manggagawa. Kung hindi raw namin tanggapin ang 3P, magreresulta ito sa pagkalugi at pagsasara ng kompanya,” aniya. "they threaten the leaders and employees. supposedly if we do not accept the 3P, it will result in the loss and closure of the company," he said. <23> Sinasabi rin umano ng manedsment na kapag tinanggap nila ang 3P, lalago at uunlad ang kompanya. the management supposedly also says that if they accept the 3P, the company will grow and advance. <24> “Totoo ito, magkakamal sila ng napakalaking tubo dahil kaming mga manggagawa ang isasakripisyo, tatanggalan kami ng karapatan at benepisyo,” sabi ni Aguillon. "it is true, they will amass a very large profit because it is we employees who are sacrificed, we will be deprived of rights and benefits," said Aguillon. <25> Apat na taon na umanong hindi nakakatanggap ng anumang bonus ang mga manggagawa ng Coca-cola. the employees of Coca-Cola supposedly have not received any bonus in four years. <26> Sa kasalukuyan, deadlock ang negosasyon sa CBA ng Sacoru samantalang hindi naman umuusad ang negosasyon ng UCCWU. currently, Sacoru's negotiation of the CBA is in a deadlock while there is no progress for the negotiation of UCCWU. <27> “Ang tunguhin ng Coca-cola Philippines ay outsourcing o kontraktuwalisasyon,” sabi naman ni Yolito Fadriquelan, tagapangulo ng Ilaw at Buklod ng Manggagawa-Kilusang Mayo Uno (IBM-KMU), isang pederasyon kung saan nakapaloob ang mga unyon ng Coca-cola. "the goal of Coca-Cola Philippines is outsourcing or contractualization," said Yolito Fadriquelan, head of Ilaw at Buklod ng Manggagawa-Kilusang Mayo Uno (IBM-KMU), a federation where the unions of Coca-Cola are a part of. <28> Laganap na sa malalaking kompanya, pabrika at planta ang kontraktuwalisasyon, at unti-unti nang ipinatutupad ng Coca-cola. contractualization is already widespread in large companies, factories and plants, and is gradually being implemented by Coca-Cola. <29> Nananawagan ang IBM-KMU sa publiko na suportahan ang mga manggagawa ng Coca-cola sa kanilang laban sa nakaambang kontraktuwalisasyon. IBM-KMU calls to the public to support the employees of Coca-Cola in their fight against impending contractualization. <30> “Mahalaga ang imahe sa isang kompanya tulad ng Coca-cola. Mahalaga din na makita ng mga tao ang pagtrato ng Coca-cola sa kanyang mga manggagawa,” ani Fadriquelan. "the image of a company like Coca-Cola is important. it is also important for the people to see Coca-Cola's treatment of its employees," said Fadriquelan. <31> Hinikayat ng mga manggagawa ng Coca-Cola ang mga tao na panoorin at palaganapin ang bidyo hinggil sa kanilang kalagayan, at sumulat sa manedsment ng kompanya para itigil ang 3P. the employees of Coca-Cola encourage the people to watch and spread the video about their situation, and write to the management of the company to stop 3P.

(DA-BFAR)-Mimaropa for the fishermen in Palawan. <4> Ito ang inihayag ni DA-BFAR Regional Fisheries Research & Development Center Chief Roberto Abrera sa isinagawang press conference kahapon ng umaga kaugnay ng pagpapatupad ng closed season o ang pagbabawal sa panghuhuli ng isdang galunggong sa bahaging hilagang silangan ng Palawan na nagsimula noong Nobyembre 1 at magtatagal hanggang Enero 31, 2017. this was announced by DA-BFAR Regional Fisheries Research & Development Center Chief Roberto Abrera at the press conference held yesterday morning on the implementation of closed season or the ban on fishing of mackerel near the north-eastern part of Palawan which started on November 1 and will last until January 31, 2017. <5> Ayon kay DA-BFAR-Mimaropa Officer-In-Charge Regional Director Elizer S. according to DA-BFAR-Mimaropa Officer-in-Charge Regional Director Elizer S <6> Salilig, isinagawa na ang public bidding para sa magiging distributor ng seaweed seedlings at kapag handa na the end of year 2016. <7> Nagkakahalaga aniya ng kabuuhang Php11 milyon ang pondo para sa programang ito. the fund for this program is allegedly worth a total of Php11 million. <8> Ang hakbang na ito ng DA-BFAR ay bilang pagsuporta sa mga mangingisda ng Palawan na nahaharap sa mga suliraning tulad ng closed and open season sa ilang uri ng isda tulad ng galunggong at lapu-lapu. this step of the DA-BFAR is to support the fishermen of Palawan faced with problems such as closed and open season in some type of fish like mackerel and lapu-lapu. <9> Ayon naman kay Abrera, sa pamamagitan ng pagtatanim ng seaweed o tambalang ay matutulungan ang mga mangingisda na magkaroon ng alternatibong hanapbuhay sa mga panahon na ipinagbabawal ang panghuhuli ng piling uri ng isda. Abrera said the planting of seaweed or tambalang can help the fishermen to have an alternative livelihood during times when fishing some types of fish are prohibited. <10> Dagdag pa ni Abrera, pangunahing mabibiyaan ng programang seaweed farming ay ang mga mangingisda na rehistrado sa municipal fisherfolk registry ng bawat munisipyo sa Palawan. he added the primary beneficiaries of the seaweed farming program are the fishermen registered with the municipal fisherfolk registry of each municipality in Palawan. <11> Sa kasalukuyan ay nasa mahigit 30,000 mga mangingisda ang rehistrado na at patuloy pa rin ang isinasagawang pagrerehistro sa iba pang mangingisda na hindi nakasama sa talaan ng munisipyo. currently, there are already more than 30,000 fishermen registered and there is an ongoing registration of fishermen who were not included in the municipal registry. <12> Nasa 25-30 porsiyento naman sa kabuuhang farmable area para sa seaweeds ang nagagamit na ng mga mangingisda, ani Abrera at mayroon pang 70 porsiyento ang hindi nagagamit at ito ngayon ang target ng DA-BFAR para sa mga mabi- benepisyuhan ng programang ito. (OCJ/PIA-Palawan) Abrera said only 25-30 percent of the whole farmable area for seaweeds are used by the fishermen, and 70 percent are not utilized and this is now target of the DA-BFAR for the beneficiaries this program. Ibaan, Batangas, August 16 (PIA) - around 32 swine raisers have benefited from the Organic Pig raising seminar conducted by the local government last August 9 which is upheld in partnership with the Municipal Agriculture Office and International Training Center for Pig Husbandry (ITCPH). <4> Sinabi ni Ibaan Mayor Juan Toreja na ang pagsasanay na ay layong makapagbigay ng kaalaman at mapalawak ang kasanayan sa pag-aalaga ng baboy sa natural na pamamaraan. Ibaan Mayor Juan Toreja said that the training has an objective to be able to give knowledge and widen the skills in raising swine in a natural way. <5> “Bukod po sa pag-aalaga ng baboy, nais kong bigyang diin ang importansya ng pagrerecycle ng dumi ng baboy upang maiwasan na ito ay makaapekto sa ating kapaligiran lalo na at isa ito sa mga contributory sa polusyon," dagdag pa ni Toreja. "aside from raising swine, I want to give assertion on the importance of recycling the manure of the pigs to avoid this in affecting our surroundings especially that this is one of the contributors of pollution," Toreja added. <6> Tinalakay ni Gng. Amy Eguia mula sa Career De velopment and Management Services ng ITCPH ang iba’t-ibang lahi ng native na baboy tulad ng Meishan, Landrace, Berkshire at Pietrain gayundin ang mga dapat isaalang-alang sa pag- aalaga ng baboy tulad ng pagkakaroon ng forage area para sa pakain at concoction sa bawat pagkain ng baboy. Mrs. Amy Eguia from the Career Development and Management Services of the ITCPH discussed the different breeds of native pigs such as Meishan, Landrace, Berkshire and Pietrain as well as those needed to be considered in raising pigs such as having a forage area for feeding and concoction every time the pig eats. <7> Ilan sa mga pointers na ibinigay sa paggawa ng wastong tirahan ng baboy ay ang paggamit ng pawid bilang bubong, pagkakawang ng sulirap o kugon para sa magandang bentilasyon; paglalagay ng isang metrong ipa o kusot bilang beddings at lalagyan o painuman ng tubig malapit sa pinagkukunan ng tubig. some of the pointers given in making a proper shelter for the pigs is the use of Nipa palm as ceiling, creating spaces between the cogon or cogon grass for a good ventilation; putting a one-meter rice husks or sawdust as bed materials and container or receptacle of water for drinking near the water source. <8> Ipinaliwanag naman ng Gng. also explained by Mrs. <9> Jenny Hornilla na ang natural pig medication ay hindi ginagamitan ng anumang gamot o antibiotics bagkus ay herbal na medisina ang inilalagay. Jenny Hornilla that a natural pig medication is not used with any medicine or antibiotics but rather herbal medicines are applied. <10> Ilan sa mga maaaring gamutin na sakit ng baboy gamit ang herbal ay ang scours o diarrhea, internal parasites; dehydration bunga ng pagtatae at buni o iba pang sakit sa paa. some of the illness of the pigs that can be treated using herbal are scours or diarrhea, internal parasites, dehydration caused by loose bowl movement and shingles or other foot diseases. <11> Nagpapaalala pa si Hornilla na kung sakaling hindi maging epektibo sa alagang baboy ang paglalapat ng medisinang herbal ay maaaring komunsulta sa beterinaryo. Hornilla is reminding that in case the treatment of herbal medicines are not going to be effective to the pet pigs, veterinarians can be consulted. <12> (BHABY P. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_74891793 <1> Linggo, Marso 18, 2012 Sunday, March 18, 2012 <2> Ang Komyun ng Paris - Unang Gobyerno ng Manggagawa the Paris Commune - first government of laborers <3> Komyun ng Paris (Marso 18 - Mayo 21, 1871) Paris Commune (March 18 - May 21, 1871) <4> UNANG GOBYERNO NG URING MANGGAGAWA first government of the working class <5> ni Greg Bituin Jr. by Greg Bituin Junior <6> Dalawang buwan lamang ang itinagal ng Komyun ng Paris, ang itinuturing na unang gobyernong pinamahalaan ng mga manggagawa, ngunit ang kasaysayan nito'y hindi matatawaran. the Paris Commune lasted only two months, considered as the first government managed by laborers, but its history is priceless. <7> Sa loob ng dalawang buwang iyon na pinangunahan ng mga manggagawang kababaihan ng Paris, pinamahalaan ng mga manggagawa ang bagong anyo ng lipunan, ang lipunan ng uring manggagawa. within those two months led by the female laborers of Paris, laborers governed a new form of society, the society of the working class. <8> Ngunit nakabalik ang pwersa ng burgesya, at tatlumpung libong (30,000) manggagawa ang minasaker ng tropa ng gobyernong pinamamahalaan ni Adolpe Thiers. but the force of the bourgeoisie was able to return, and thirty thousand (30,000) laborers were massacred by government troops led by Adolphe Thiers. <9> Nagbubo ng dugo ang mga manggagawa ng Paris ngunit ang kanilang ginawa'y nagmarka na sa kasaysayan ng uring manggagawa sa daigdig. the laborers of Paris shed blood but what they did left a mark on the history of the working class in the world. <10> Sa akdang The Civil War in France (1871) ni Karl Marx, kanyang isinulat na ang Komyun ng Paris ang “the finally discovered political form under which the economic emancipation of labor could take place” (nadiskubre na ang isang pormang pulitikal kung saan ang pang-ekonomyang kaligtasan ng paggawa ay maaari nang maganap.) in the piece The Civil War in France (1871) by Karl Marx, he wrote that the Paris Commune was "the finally discovered political form under which the economic emancipation of labor could take place" (the finally discovered political form under which the economic emancipation of labor could take place). <11> Kalagayan ng Pransya bago ang Komyun ng Paris state of France before the Paris Commune <12> Nasa gitna ng digmaan ang Pransya laban sa bansang Prussia (na Germany ngayon) na pinamumunuan ni Otto von Bismarck. France was in the middle of war against the country Prussia (Germany today) led by Otto von Bismarck. <13> Ang digmaang ito, na kilalang Franco- Prussian war ng 1870-71, ay digmaan sa pagitan ng Ikalawang Imperyong Pranses at ng Kaharian ng Prussia. this war, known as the Franco-Prussian War of 1870-71, was a war between the Second French Empire and the Kingdom of Prussia. <14> Nasakop na ng Prussian Army ang Paris, ngunit hindi nakipagmabutihan ang mga manggagawa ng Paris sa mga sundalo ng Prusya. the Prussian army had invaded Paris, but the laborers of Paris were not in good terms with the soldiers of Prussia. <15> Bumagsak ang Paris sa kamay ng Prussian Army noong Enero 28, 1871. Paris fell into the hands of the Prussian army on January 28, 1871. <16> Nagkaroon ng halalan sa Pransya noong Pebrero 8, 1871, na di alam ng mayorya ng populasyon; Pebrero 12 nang maitayo ang bagong Pambansang Asambleya; Pebrero 16 nahalal si Adolphe Thiers bilang punong ehekutibo ng Pransya; Pebrero 26 nang nilagdaan sa Versailles nina Thiers at Jules Favre ng Pransya, at ni Otto von Bismarck ng Germany, ang isang preliminary peace treaty sa pagitan ng France at Germany. an election was held in France on February 8, 1871, which the majority of the population were not aware of; February 12 was when the new national assembly was established; on February 16 Adolphe Thiers was elected as the chief executive of France; February 26 was when Thiers and Jules Favre of France, and Otto von Bismarck of Germany, signed a preliminary peace treaty between France and Germany. <17> Isinuko ng France ang Alsace at East Lorraine sa Germany, at nagbayad sila ng bayad- pinsalang nagkakahalaga ng 5Bilyong Francs. France surrendered Alsace and East Lorraine to Germany, and they paid damages worth 5 billion francs. <18> Unti-unting aalis ang German army pag naibigay na ang kinakailangang bayad-pinsala. the German army will gradually leave when their necessary damages are paid. <19> Mayo 10, 1871 nang nilagdaan ang final peace treaty sa Frankfort-on-Main. it was May 10, 1871 when the final peace treaty was signed in Frankfort-on-Main. <20> Noong Marso 1871, kumalas na sa pamumuno ni Thiers ang Pambansang Gwardya at sumama na sa mga manggagawa ng Paris, at itinayo ang isang Komite Sentral. on March 1871, the national guard broke ties with the leadership of Thiers and joined the laborers of Paris, and set up a central committee. <21> Inilagay naman ni Thiers kanyang pamahalaan sa Versailles noong Marso 20. Thiers meanwhile placed his government in Versailles on March 20. <22> Ang Komyun ng Paris the Paris Commune <23> Noong Marso 18, 1871, sa permiso ng Prussia, pinadala ni Thiers ang hukbong Pranses upang kumpiskahin ang mga nagkalat na armas sa Paris na hawak ng mga manggagawa upang tiyaking hindi na lalaban ang mga manggagawa ng Paris sa hukbo ng Prusya. on March 18, 1871, with permission of Prussia, Thiers sent the French army to confiscate the weapons that had spread in Paris at the hands of the laborers to ensure that the laborers of Paris will not fight against the army of Prussia. <24> Balak dalhin ni Theirs ang mga makukumpiskang armas sa Versailles. Theirs planned to bring back the confiscated weaponry to Versailles. <25> Ngunit tinanggihan ito ng mga manggagawa. but the laborers refused it. <26> Pagdating pa lang ng umaga, hinarangan na ng mga manggagawang kababaihan ang pagdating ng hukbong Pranses na inatasan ni Thiers na nagtangkang kumpiskahin ang mga kanyon at iba pang armas. by the break of dawn, female laborers had blocked the arrival of the French army ordered by Thiers who attempted to confiscate the cannons and other weapons. <27> Hanggang sa magdatingan na ang taumbayan at pinalayas ang hukbong Pranses. until the people arrived and drove out the French army. <28> Kahit na inatasan ni Thiers, di sumunod ang mga sundalo sa atas nitong pagbabarilin ang mga tao. even if ordered by Thiers, the soldiers didn't follow his instruction to shoot the people. <29> Sina Heneral Claude Martin Lecomte at Heneral Jacques Leonard Clement Thomas ay pinaslang ng kanilang sariling mga tauhan. General Claude Martin Lecomte and General Jacques Leonard Clement Thomas were killed by their own subordinates. <30> Apat na ulit inatas ng araw na iyon ni Heneral Lecomte na pagbabarilin ang mga tao, at pinakita naman ni Heneral Thomas ang kanyang brutalidad at pagkareaksyunaryo, at nahuli pa siyang nag-eespiya sa barikadang itinirik ng mga tao. on that day General Lecomte ordered four times to shoot the people, and General Thomas displayed his brutality and conservatism, and he was even caught spying on the barricades erected by the people. <31> Nag-alisan na rin ang maraming tropang sundalo habang may ilang natira sa Paris. many troops of soldiers also left while some remained in Paris. <32> Dahil dito'y nagalit si Thiers, at nagsimula na ang Digmaang Sibil sa Pransya. because of this Thiers was enraged, and civil war started in France. <33> Nang sumunod na araw, Marso 19, 1871, nagising ang mamamayan ng Paris sa kanilang kalayaan, at masaya nilang tinanggap ang natamong kalayaan. on the next day, March 19, 1871, the citizens of Paris woke up to their freedom, and they happily accepted the attained freedom. <34> Ang tanging namamahala na rito ay ang Komite Sentral ng Pambansang Gwardya, na binubuo ng mga matatapat na tao, na hindi mga pulitiko, at ng mga manggagawa ng Paris. the only ones governing here are the central committee of the national guard, composed of honest people, not politicians, and the laborers of Paris. <35> Marso 23, 1871, nagpahayag ang International Workingmen’s Association at Federal Council of Parisian Sections ng pagkakaisa at panawagang magkaroon ng halalan sa Marso 26, habang ipinapana-wagan ang ganap na paglaya ng mga manggagawa, at matiyak ang ganap na halaga ng kanilang lakas-paggawa. March 23, 1871, the International Workingmen's Association and Federal Council of Parisian Sections declared unity and the appeal to have an election on March 26, while calling for the absolute release of the laborers, and ensure the true worth of their workforce. <36> Tinawag nila ang Komyun ng Paris na isang Rebolusyong Komyunal. they called the Paris Commune a communal revolution. <37> Noong Marso 26, 1871, inihalal ng mamamayan ng Paris ang konsehong tinawag na nilang Komyun ng Paris, na binubuo ng mga manggagawa, kasama ang mga kasapi ng Unang Internasyunal. on March 26, 1871, the citizens of Paris elected a council they called the Paris Commune, consisting of laborers, including the members of the First International. <38> Ipinroklama ang Komyun ng Paris noong Marso 28, 1871, kaya umani ang mga manggagawa ng Paris ng mabilis at malawak na suporta sa buong Pransya. the Paris Commune was proclaimed on March 28, 1871, so the laborers of Paris gained quick and widespread support from the whole of France. <39> Direktang kalahok sa pag-aalsang manggagawa ang mga lider ng internasyunal na kilusang manggagawa. directly involved in the laborer revolution were the leaders of the international movement of laborers. <40> Sa araw ding iyon ay umalis na sa pwesto ang Komite Sentral ng Pambansang Gwardya nang isinabatas nito ang paglalansag sa "Morality Police". on that day as well the central committee of the National Guard resigned when they enacted the dissolution of the "Morality Police". <41> Marso 30 nang nilansag ng Komyun ang sapilitang pagpapalingkod sa hukbo at ang mismong hukbo; ang tanging armadong hukbo lamang ay ang Pambansang Gwardya. March 30 was when the commune removed the compulsory service to the army and the army itself; the only armed troop was the National Guard. <42> Kinumpirma na rin ang pagkakahalal sa Komyun ng mga dayuhan, dahil "ang bandila ng Komyun ang bandila ng Daigdigang Republika". the election of foreigners to the commune was also confirmed, because "the flag of the commune is the flag of the global republic". <43> Idineklara naman noong Abril 1 na lahat ng kasapi ng Komyun ay tatanggap lamang ng kaparehong sweldo ng manggagawa, maging ito'y nasa pamahalaan o karaniwang manggagawa. on April 1 it was declared that all the members of the commune will receive just the same wages as the laborers, whether he is in the government or an ordinary worker. <44> Ipinahayag din ng Komyun ang paghihiwalay ng simbahan at ng gobyerno, at ang pagpawi ng lahat ng kabayaran ng gobyerno para sa layuning pangrelihiyon, pati na ang transpormasyon ng lahat ng pag-aari ng simbahan upang gawing pambansang pag-aari. the Commune also declared the separation of the church and the state, and the elimination of all payments of the government for religious purposes, as well as the transformation of all church properties into public properties. <45> Idineklara ang relihiyon bilang pribadong bagay na lamang. religion was declared as a private matter only. <46> Nagsagawa rin ang Komyun ng isang kautusan upang di barilin ng gobyernong Pranses ang mga kasapi ng Komyun. the Commune also carried out an order so the French government will not shoot the members of the Commune. <47> Sa kautusang ito, lahat ng mga taong mapapatunayang nakikipag-ugnayan sa gobyernong Pranses ay ituturing na bihag o hostages. in this order, all the people proven to liaise with the French government are considered hostages or hostages. <48> Ngunit di ito naisagawa. but it was not carried out. <49> Isang guillotine, o pamarusahang pamugot ng ulo ng nasentensyahan ng kamatayan, ang inilabas ng ika-137 batalyon ng Pambansang Gwardya, at sinunog sa harap ng taumbayan, na ikinasiya ng marami. a guillotine, or punishment to behead the sentenced with death, was released by the 137th battalion of the National Guard, and burned in front of the people, which pleased many. <50> Isa pang kautusang ipinatupad ng Komyun ang pagtanggal sa lahat ng paaralan ng lahat ng simbolong relihiyoso, litrato, dogma, dasal, at "lahat ng nasa ispero ng indibidwal na budhi". one more order implemented by the Commune was the removal in all schools of all religious symbols, pictures, dogma, prayer, and "everything within the sphere of individual conscience". <51> Agad itong ipinatupad. it was immediately implemented. <52> Upang madurog ang Komyun, nagpasaklolo si Thiers kay Bismark upang gamitin sa Versailles Army ang mga binihag na hukbong Pranses na sumuko sa Sedan at Metz. to crush the Commune, Thiers asked helped from Bismark to use in the Versailles Army the captured French troops who surrendered in Sedan and Metz. <53> Kapalit ng 5Bilyong Francs na bayad-pinsala, sumang-ayon si Bismarck. in exchange for 5 billion francs as damages, Bismarck agreed. <54> Kaya nilusob na ng hukbo ni Thiers ang Paris. so the army of Thiers already attacked Paris. <55> Umatras ang mga umatakeng tropa ni Thiers sa katimugang Paris nang malagasan sila ng maraming tauhan. the attacking troop of Thiers withdrew in southern Paris when they lost many men. <56> Abril 16, ipinahayag ng Komyun ang pagpapaliban sa lahat ng utang sa loob ng tatlong taon at pagpawi ng interes sa mga ito. April 16, the Commune announced the suspension of all debts within three years and the eradication of their interests. <57> Nag-atas din ang Komyun ng pagtatala ng lahat ng mga pabrikang isinara ng mga kapitalista at nagsagawa sila ng plano kung paano ito patatakbuhin ng mga manggagawang dating nagtatrabaho sa mga ito, na kanilang oorganisahin sa mga kooperatibang samahan, at planong pag-oorganisa ng lahat ng kooperatibang ito sa iisang unyon. the Commune also ordered the registration of all factories shut down by capitalists and they carried out a plan on how the laborers who formerly worked there can run it, that they will organize into cooperative associations, and planned organization of all those cooperatives into a single union. <58> Tinanggal ng Komyun ang panggabing trabaho ng mga panadero, pati na mga registration card ng manggagawa, na inisyu ng Ikalawang Imperyo. the Commune removed all evening jobs for bakers, even the registration cards of laborers, which were issued by the Second Empire. <59> Itinatag ng Komyun ang walong-oras ng trabaho bawat araw. the Commune established the eight-hour shift every day. <60> Binuksan nila ang mga nakasarang pabrika, nagsagawa ng bagong patakaran sa pasahod at kontrata, at nagtayo ng konseho ng manggagawa sa mga pabrika. they opened closed factories, carried out new procedures on wages and contracts, and set up a council of factory workers. <61> Binigyan ng tamang pasahod ang mga manggagawang delikado ang trabaho. laborers with dangerous jobs were given the right pay. <62> Tinanggal ang mga multa sa manggagawa na nagkakamali. fines on laborers who committed mistakes were removed. <63> Abril 30, inatas ng Komyun ang pagsasara ng mga sanglaan (pawnshops) sa batayang ang mga ito'y pribadong pagsasamantala sa paggawa, na balintuna sa karapatan ng mga manggagawa sa kanilang kasangkapan sa paggawa. April 30, the Commune ordered the shutdown of pawnshops (pawnshops) on the basis that they're private abuse of labor, against the rights of laborers to their own tools for work. <64> Mayo 10, 1871, nilagdaan ang Treaty of Frankfurt, isang tratadong pangkapayapaan bilang pagwawakas ng Franco-Prussian War. May 10, 1871, the Treaty of Frankfurt was signed, a peace treaty for the ending of the Franco-Prussian War. <65> Mayo 17, 1871 ng gabi, ipinatawag ang pulong ng Central Committee of the Union of Women, upang organisahin ang mga delegadong dadalo sa pagtatayo ng isang “federal chamber of workingwomen”. May 17, 1871 evening, a meeting of the Central Committee of the Union of Women was called, to organize the delegates attending the establishment of a "federal chamber of workingwomen". <66> Pagkadurog ng Komyun destruction of the Commune <67> Mayo 21, 1871, nakapasok ang tropa ng Versailles sa Paris. May 21, 1871, the troop of Versailles was able to enter Paris. <68> Ginugol ng French army ang walong araw hanggang Mayo 28 sa pagmasaker sa mga manggagawa, pinagbabaril ang mga sibilyang makita. the French army spent eight days until May 28 on the massacre of laborers, shooting civilians they see. <69> Ang operasyong iyon ay pinangunahan ni Marchal MacMahon, na sa kalaunan ay naging pangulo ng Pransya. that operation was led by Marchal MacMahon, who eventually became the president of France. <70> Tatlumpung librong Communards, manggagawa at mga walang armas na sibilyan at mga bata ang pinagpapatay; 38,000 ang ibinilanggo, at 7,000 ang sapilitang ipinatapon sa ibang bansa. thirty Communard books, laborers and unarmed civilians and children were killed; 38,000 were imprisoned, and 7,000 were forcibly deported to other countries. <71> Saan nga ba nagkulang ang mga lumahok sa Komyun ng Paris? where did those involved in the Paris Commune fall short? <72> Bakit ito nadurog sa loob ng dalawang buwan lamang? why was it crushed within only two months? <73> Maraming mga ibinigay na rason ang mga nakasaksi noon. the witnesses back then gave many reasons. <74> Una, may kakulangan sa paghahanda ang mga manggagawa upang depensahan ang Komyun kung sakaling magkaroon ng paglusob sa lungsod, bagamat may ilang mga barikadang naitayo. first, there was inadequacy in the preparation of the laborers to defend the Commune in case there was an attack within the city, despite a few barricades set up. <75> Ikalawa, mas inuna nito ang pagtatatag ng mas maayos na hustisya sa buong Paris, imbes na durugin muna ang mga kaaway nito, lalo na ang tropa ni Thiers, upang di na muling makabalik sa kapangyarihan. second, it prioritized the establishment of a better justice system in the whole of Paris, instead of crushing its enemies, especially the troop of Thiers, so that they could not return to power. <76> Dapat ay naglunsad na sila ng opensiba laban sa hukbo ni Thiers na nasa Versailles upang di na ito magkaroon pa ng panahong makabawi. they should have also launched an offensive against the army of Thiers in Versailles so it would not have time to recover. <77> Ayon kay Marx, "Ang Komyun ng Paris, sa esensya, ay isang gobyerno ng uring manggagawa. according to Marx, "the Paris Commune, in essence, is a government of the working class. <78> Ang hukbo ng gobyerno ay pinalitan ng armadong mamamayan, ang kapangyarihan ng lehislatibo at ehekutibo ay hinawakan ng mga kinatawan ng manggagawa, na hinalal, may pananagutan at maaaring tanggalin anumang oras, at ang sahod para sa lahat ng opisyal na gawain sa pamahalaan ay kapantay ng sahod ng karaniwang manggagawa." the army of the government was replaced by armed citizens, the power of the legislative and executive were held by representatives of laborers, who were elected, had responsibility and may decline any time, and the wages for all official government activity was equal to the wages of the ordinary laborer." <79> Para kay Lenin, hindi nasyunalismo kundi internasyunalismo ang ipinakita ng Komyun ng Paris. for Lenin, it was not nationalism but internationalism shown by the Paris Commune. <80> Ani Lenin, mahalaga ang paghihiwalay ng kaisipang nasyunalismo sa uring manggagawa: "Hayaan nyo ang burgesya sa pananagutan nito sa pambansang humilyasyon - ang tungkulin ng manggagawa ay pakikibaka para sa sosyalistang paglaya ng paggawa." according to Lenin, the separation of the nationalist mentality is important in the working class: "leave the bourgeoisie to their responsibility of national humiliation - the role of the laborer is to fight for the socialist freedom of the laborer." <81> Idinagdag pa ni Lenin, "Ispontanyo ang pagkakatatag ng Komyun. Lenin further added, "the establishment of the Commune was spontaneous. <82> Noong una, ito'y isang kilusang may kalituhan. at first, it was a movement in confusion. <83> Ngunit nagkahiwa-hiwalay na ang mga uri sa takbo ng mga pangyayari. but the classes separated amidst the events. <84> At tanging mga manggagawa lamang ang nanatiling matapat sa Komyun hanggang sa huli." and only the laborers stayed loyal to the Commune until the end." <85> Mga Tampok na Isinagawa ng Komyun features of the Commune <86> Ang Komyun ng Paris, bagamat sa loob lamang ng Pransya, ay hindi isang makabayang pakikibaka. the Paris Commune, despite only within France, was not a patriotic protest. <87> Ito'y isang makauring pakikibaka ng manggagawa laban sa burgesya, laban sa kapitalismo, laban sa kapital. it was a classist protest of laborers against the bourgeoisie, against capitalism, against the capital. <88> Ang Komyun ng Paris ay isang makasaysayang paglaban ng mga manggagawa ng Paris, isang pagsulong tungo sa pandaigdigang rebolusyon ng manggagawa, isang pagtatangkang wasakin ang burgis na makinarya ng gobyerno, at ito rin ang siyang dapat pumalit sa makinarya ng estado. the Paris Commune was a historic fight by the laborers of Paris, a movement towards the worldwide revolution of laborers, an attempt to destroy the bourgeois that is the machinery of the government, and it should also replace the machinery of the state. <89> Ang Komyun ang unang tangka ng proletaryong rebolusyon na wasakin ang burges na makinaryang estado at ito rin ang siyang dapat pumalit sa winasak na makinaryang estado. the Commune was the first attempt of the proletariat revolution to destroy the bourgeois that is a state machinery and it should also replace the destroyed state machinery. <90> Ang mga tampok at mahahalagang hakbang na ipinatupad ng Komyun ay ang mga sumusunod: the features and important steps carried out by the Commune are the following: <91> a. Pagbuwag ng regular na hukbong militar at pagtatayo kapalit nito ng armadong mamamayan. a. dissolving the regular military army and setting up armed citizens as its replacement. <92> b. Pagtatakda na ang lahat ng opisyales ay ihahalal subalit maaaring alisin sa pwesto anumang oras. b. declaring that all officials are elected but can be replaced any time. <93> c. Pagtatanggal ng lahat ng pribilehiyo at pagbawas ng pasahod o alawans sa lahat ng naglilingkod sa estado upang ipantay sa antas ng pasahod sa mga manggagawa. c. removing all privileges and decreasing the wages or allowance of everyone serving the state to match the level of salary of laborers. <94> d. Ang pagwasak sa pulitika’t parlyamentaryo ng burgesya, mula sa isang talking shop ay naging isang working institution, isang institusyon ng paghaharing sabay na gumagampan ng gawaing ehekutibo at lehislatibo. d. the destruction of politics and parliament of the bourgeoisie, from a talking shop that became a working institution, an institution of a rule both fulfilled by executive and legislative activity. <95> e. Ang organisasyon ng pambansang pagkakaisa. e. the organization of national unity. <96> Itinayo ang mga Komyun hanggang sa antas ng pinakamaliit na komunidad. the Communes were set up on the level of the smallest community. <97> Isinentralisa ang mga Komyun sa isang sentralisadong kapangyarihan, upang ganap na wasakin ang paglaban ng mga kapitalista at ipatupad ang paglilipat ng pribadong ari-arian — pabrika, mga lupain, at iba pa — sa kamay ng buong bayan. the Communes were centralized on a centralized power, to fully crush the fight by the capitalists and implement the transfer of private property - factories, land, and others - to the possession of the whole nation. <98> Mga Aral lessons <99> Sa pagkadurog ng Komyun, maraming aral ang idinulot nito sa atin: with the destruction of the Commune, we were given many lessons: <100> a. Hindi sapat ang pagkubkob lamang sa mga makinarya ng estado upang gamitin ng mga manggagawa, kundi ang buong estado'y dapat tuluyang wasakin upang di na makabalik pa ang burgesyang pinalitan ng Komyun. a. it is not enough to merely contain the machinery of the state for the use of laborers, but the whole state should be completely destroyed so that the bourgeois replaced by the Commune can not return. <101> Dapat tiyakin ng Komyun kung paano mapoprotektahan nito ang kanyang sarili mula sa kanyang mga kaaway. the Commune should ensure how to protect itself from its enemies. <102> b. Kailangan ng maagap na pagdedesisyon kung paanong di na makakabalik at makakaporma pa ang burgesya. b. making a prompt decision is needed on how the bourgeois cannot return and reform. <103> Maraming oportunidad ang Komyun para madurog ang mahinang pwersa ng gobyerno sa Versailles, ngunit dahil hindi maagap na nakapagdesisyon dito, sila’y binalikan at agad na dinurog. the Commune had many opportunities to crush the weak government forces in Versailles, but because a decision on it was not made on time, they came back and were immediately crushed. <104> c. Dapat maitaas pa ang kamalayang makauri ng mga manggagawa upang maitayo nila ang sarili nilang lipunan. c. the classist consciousness of laborers should be heightened so they can set up their own society. <105> d. Ang pag-aalinlangan ng Komyun na tuluyang durugin ang banta ng kaaway ay nagbigay pa ng panahon sa burgesya upang muling maorganisa (regroup), magpalakas ng pwersa, at makipag-kasundo sa mga Prussians. d. the hesitation of the Commune to destroy enemy threat gave the bourgeois time to reorganize (regroup), strengthen their forces, and ally with the Prussians. <106> Masyado pang mabait ang mga manggagawa sa mga kapitalista’t burgesya. laborers are still too kind to the capitalists and bourgeois. <107> e. Kailangan ng Komyun ng isang rebolusyonaryo, sosyalistang partido na magtitiyak ng tagumpay nito hanggang sa transisyon patungong sosyalismo. e. the Commune needs a revolutionary, socialist party that will ensure it success until its transition to socialism. <108> f. Dapat kinumpiska agad ng mga manggagawa ang mga bangko, lalo na ang Bank of France, na siyang sentro ng kapitalistang yaman, na siyang ginamit ng kapitalista laban sa Komyun. f. laborers should have immediately confiscated banks, especially the Bank of France, which is the center of capitalist wealth, that was used by the capitalists against the Commune. <109> Dapat isentralisa sa Komyun ang mga bangko upang tustusan ang rebolusyon. the banks should have been centralized on the Commune to fund the revolution. <110> g. Dapat nakagawa ng paraan ang mga manggagawa upang maging alyado ang mga pesante. g. the laborers should have found a way to ally with the peasants. <111> Dahil ang mga pesante ang ginamit ng burgesya at ng hukbo ni Thiers upang durugin ang Komyun. because it was the peasants that were used by the bourgeois and the army of Thiers to crush the Commune. <112> Ang Diktadurya ng Proletaryado the dictatorship of the proletariat <113> Sa karanasan ng Komyun ng Paris hinalaw ni Marx ang teorya ng diktadurya ng proletaryado. Marx based the theory of the dictatorship of the proletariat on the experience of the Paris Commune. <114> Ito ang papalit sa diktadurya ng burgesya o kapitalistang estado. this will replace the dictatorship of the bourgeois or capitalist state. <115> Ang diktadurya ng proletaryado ay isang sosyalistang lipunang pinamu- munuan ng uring manggagawa, o proletaryado. the dictatorship of the proletariat is a socialist society governed by the working class, or proletariat. <116> Kongklusyon: conclusion: <117> Ang Komyun ng Paris ang isa sa pinakadakila at inspiradong yugto sa kasaysayan ng uring manggagawa. the Paris Commune is one of the greatest and most inspired chapters in the history of the working class. <118> Pinalitan ng mga manggagawa ng Paris ang kapitalistang estado ng sarili nilang gobyerno at tinanganan nila ang kapangyarihang ito ng dalawang buwan. the laborers of Paris replaced the capitalist state of their own government and they held this power for two months. <119> Nagsikap ang mga manggagawa ng Pransya, sa kabila ng mga kahirapan, na wakasan na ang mga pagsasamantala at pambubusabos ng lipunan, at maitayo ang isang lipunan sa isang bagong batayan at pamantayan. the laborers of France worked, despite difficulties, to end the abuse and slavery of society, and to establish a society with a new basis and standard. <120> Ang mga aral nito’y nagtiyak ng tagumpay ng Rebolusyong 1917 sa Rusya na pinangunahan ni V. these lessons ensured the success of the Russian Revolution of 1917 led by V. <121> I. Lenin, at naitayo ang isang Unyon ng Sobyet (konseho) na binubuo ng manggagawa. I. Lenin, and one Soviet Union (council) consisting of laborers was set up. <122> Ang dakilang aral ng Komyun ng Paris ay isang malaking hamon sa uring manggagawa sa kasalukuyang panahon. the great lesson of the Paris Commune is a huge challenge to the working class of the present time. <123> Kailangan natin ng mas mataas na antas ng daigdigang pagkakaisa at mas matalas na kamalayang makauri upang matiyak na maipapanalo natin ang lipunang sosyalismong ating hinahangad para sa ating kagalingan at ng mga susunod pang henerasyon ng manggagawa. we need a higher level of worldwide unity and higher classist consciousness to ensure that we can plan the socialist society we desire for our welfare and for the next generation of laborers. <124> Mga Sanggunian: references: <125> (a) The Civil War in France, Marso-Mayo 1871, Karl Marx; (b) Introduction on The Civil War in France, by Frederick Engels, 1891; (c) Lessons of the Paris Commune, Leon Trostky, Pebrero, 1921; (d) History of the Paris Commune, Prosper Olivier Lissagaray, 1876 (a) The Civil War in France, March-May 1871, Karl Marx; (b) Introduction on The Civil War in France, by Frederick Engels, 1891; (c) Lessons of the Paris Commune, Leon Trostky, Pebrero, 1921; (d) History of the Paris Commune, Prosper Olivier Lissagaray, 1876
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_96183497 <1> AKO, tunay na PILIPINO AKO, tunay na Pilipino, nananalaytay sa aking mga ugat ang diwang kayumanggi, sa kaibuturan ng aking puso, kaisipan, at kaluluwa, ay taga- pagpatuloy ng magiting at makulay kong kasaysayan noon, ngayon, at magpakailanman. I, I am a true Filipino, true Filipino, brown spirit flows through my veins, in the depths of my heart, mind, and soul, one who will continue my heroic and colorful history, then, now, and forevermore. <2> Masikhay kong tinutupad ang aking likas na tungkulin alang-alang sa kapakanan ng aking Inang-bayan. I diligently fulfill my natural responsibility for the welfare of my Motherland. <3> Laging akong handa na ipagtanggol ang aking lahi at pamayanan nito sa anumang kapahamakan, kalapastangan, at kapighatian. I am always ready to defend my race and community from any harm, abuse, and grief. <4> Ako ay wagas na mapagmahal, dumaramay, at kapanalig ng mga simulaing nagtataguyod tungo sa malayang pagkakaisa na; makaDiyos, makaPamilya, makaBayan, makaKalikasan, at maKatarungan. I am absolutely loving, sympathetic, and a supporter of principles working towards a free union that is pro-God, pro-family, pro-nation, pro-environment, and pro-justice. <5> Iisa lamang ang aking nilulunggati at pinakamimithi, ang makita’t maranasan na maging isang tunay na bansang malaya ang Pilipinas; demokratiko, maunlad, makatarungan at may bukas na lipunang Pilipino. I have only one ambition and biggest desire, to see and experience the Philippines become a true free nation; democratic, prosperous, just and with an open Filipino society. <6> Likas ang yaman ng aking bayan, mula sa mapanlikha at mapagtaguyod na mga kamay ng mga mamamayan nito, sa 7,107 naggagandahang mga pulo na naglalaman ng mga masaganang lupain, sa mga ilog, lawa, at nakapalibot nitong mga karagatan na mabiyaya sa isda at kayamanan nito, sa mga kagubatang nagbibigay-buhay at pangangalakal, sa mga kabundukang nagtataglay ng mga mineral at yamang-likas, at sa pagiging pangunahing sentro nito sa Asya at pandaigdigang kaganapan. natural is the wealth of my nation, from the creative and supportive hands of its people, the 7,107 beautiful isles containing rich lands, to the rivers, lakes and its surrounding seas that is generous with fish and its wealth, the forests that provide life and commerce, to the mountains containing minerals and natural resources, and being the primary center in Asia and current events. <7> Karampatan lamang na tawagin ang aking bansa na, Perlas ng Silangan. it is simply fitting to call my country the Pearl of the Orient. <8> Aking pinahahalagahan at ipinamamalaki ito, saan mang sulok ng daigdig, sinuman ang aking kaharap, at anumang panahon. I value and take pride in it, anywhere in the world, whomever I encounter, and at any time. <9> Kailanman ay hindi ako nangingimi na ipakilala ang aking lahing kayumanggi. never have I been shy to introduce my brown race. <10> Maraming ng dayuhang banyaga na may kanya-kanyang ideolohiya at relihiyon ang nabighani nito; Magmula sa Islam ng mga Arabo, Katoliko ng mga Kastila, Protestante ng mga Amerikano, nasyonalismong pasista ng mga Hapon, sa mga pansariling kalipunan at pulitikang banyaga ng mga ito, na nagpasiklab ng himagsikan; mula kay Raha Lapu-lapu sa Mactan, Gat JoseRizal sa Bagumbayan, Gat Andres Bonifacio sa Balintawak, Hen. many foreign strangers with their own ideologies and religions were enchanted by it; from Islam of the Arabs, Catholicism of the Spanish, Protestantism by the Americans, fascist nationalism by the Japanese, to their personal organizations and foreign politics that set fire to revolution, from Raha Lapu-lapu of Mactan, Gat Jose Rizal in Bagumbayan, Gat Andres Bonifacio in Balintawak, General <11> Gregorio del Pilar sa Pasong Tirad, Hen. Gregorio del Pilar in Tirad Pass, General <12> Macario Sakay sa mga kabundukan, at marami pang iba. Macario Sakay in the mountains, and many more. <13> Patuloy pa ang laban. the fight goes on. <14> Hanggat may mga sakim na dayuhang banyaga at huwad na mga Pilipino na patuloy na nagsasabwatan at nagpapairal ng buktot at bulok na sistema sa lipunang Pilipino, ay nag-aalimpuyo ang aking dugo sa ipinunlang binhi ng kagitingan ng aking mga ninuno. as long as there are greedy foreigners and fake Filipinos who continue to connive and spread the twisted and rotten system of the Filipino society, my blood swirls around the seed of heroism planted by my ancestors. <15> Ang silakbo nito ang siyang nagpapaalab na, its flare is the one that sets the flame that, <16> AKO, tunay na PILIPINO. I, am a true Filipino.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_60984427 <1> Sabado, Hulyo 9, 2016 Saturday, July 9, 2016. <2> ANG AKING KAPWA: Reflection for 15th Sunday in Ordinary Time Year C - July 10, 2016 - JUBILEE YEAR OF MERCY my neighbor: reflection for 15th Sunday in ordinary time year c - July 10, 2016 - jubilee year of mercy <3> "At sino naman ang aking kapwa?" tanong ng isang eskriba kay Jesus. "and who is my neighbor?" asked by one scribe to Jesus. <4> Ito rin marahil ay katanungang napapanahon ngayon. this might also be a question that is timely right now. <5> Halos araw-araw ay may nababalitang pinapatay. almost every day there is murder reported. <6> Marami sa kanila ay sinasabing drug user o pusher. many of them are said to be a drug user or pusher. <7> Salot ng lipunan. a plague to society. <8> Walang pakinabang. useless. <9> Sanhi ng kriminalidad. cause of criminality. <10> Banta sa katahimikan at kaligtasan. a threat to peace and safety. <11> Kaya ang sabi ng iba ay nararapat lang na sila ay lipulin. so some say that it is only right to eradicate them. <12> Mabuti na mawala na lang sila. it would be good if they would just go away. <13> Ayos lang na sila ay mamatay! it's okay for them to die! <14> Sigurado akong hindi ito ang "kapwa" na nais nating ituring. I am certain that this is not who we want to consider a "neighbor". <15> Kung ganito ang ating pag-iiisip ay wala tayong pinagkaiba sa mga Hudyo noong panahon ni Jesus. if our mentality is like this then we are no different from the Jews in the time of Jesus. <16> Mayroon din silang hindi maituring na kanilang "kapwa". they also have some people whom they cannot consider as their "neighbor". <17> Sa simula pa lang ng kanilang kasaysayan ay itinuring na nilang kaaway ang mga Samaritano. since the beginning of history they already considered the Samaritans to be their enemy. <18> May malalim silang hidwaan na kahit ang pagtigil sa kanilang mga lupain ay iniiwasan nilang gawin. they have a conflict so deep that they even avoid stopping by their lands. <19> Nang tinanong si Jesus ng eskriba kung "Sino ang kanyang kapwa?" when Jesus was asked by the scribe, "who is his neighbor?" <20> ay isinalaysay ni Jesus ang talinhanga ng "Mabuting Samaritano". Jesus narrated the parable of "The good Samaritan". <21> Narinig na natin ang kuwentong ito. we already heard this story. <22> Kung paanong sinadyang iwasan ng mga hudyo ang kanilang kapwa hudyong nangangailangan ng tulong. about how the Jews intentionally avoided their fellow Jews who needed help. <23> Tanging ang "kaaway" na Samaritano ang huminto at nagpakita ng awa sa taong dapat niyang iniwasan! only the "enemy" who was a Samaritan, stopped and showed mercy to the person that he should be avoiding! <24> Hindi layunin ni Jesus na ipahiya ang eskriba. it was not Jesus' intention to embarrass the scribe. <25> Ang nais niya ay maunawaan nila na hindi mas mababang uri ang kanilang itinuturing na kaawaay at maari pa silang higitan sa kabutihan. what he wants is for them to understand that who they consider as enemies are not lowly creatures and may even surpass them in kindness. <26> Kaya nga't ang sagot ni Jesus ay isa ring katanungan: "Sino ang nagpakita ng pakikipagkapwa sa taong hinarang ng tulisan?" which is why the response of Jesus was also a question: "who showed compassion to the person who was stopped by bandits?" <27> Hindi masagot ng eskriba si Jesus ng diresto sapagkat kaaway nila ang mga Samaritano. the scribe could not directly answer Jesus because the Samaritans were their enemies. <28> Kung minsan ay ganito rin ang ating pag-uugali. sometimes this is also our attitude. <29> Hirap tayong magpakita ng pagmamahal sa ating mga itinuturing na kaaway. we have difficulty showing love to those we consider enemies. <30> Hirap tayong magpatawad sa mga taong nakagawa sa atin ng masama o nakapagbigay sa atin ng sama ng loob. we find it difficult to forgive people who have done us wrong or have caused us resentment. <31> Hindi natin matanggap na sila rin ay ang ating "kapwa". we cannot accept that they are also our "neighbor". <32> Malinaw ang mensaheng nais paratingin ni Jesus sa atin: Ang ating kapwa ay ang mga taong nangangailangan ng awa, ng ating pang-unawa at higit sa lahat... ng gawang pagpapatawad. the message that Jesus wants to show us is clear: our neighbors are the people who need mercy, our understanding, and most importantly our forgiveness. <33> Ang utos ng Panginoon na mahalin natin ang Diyos ng higit sa lahat at ang ating kapwa gaya ng pagmamahal sa ating sarili ay hindi lamang utos na nakalimbag sa Bibliya o sa ating Katesismo. the commandment of the Lord to love God above all, and our neighbors the same way we love ourselves, is not just a commandment that is written in the Bible or in our catechism. <34> Ito ay nakalimbag hindi sa papel kundi sa ating mga puso. it is written not on paper but in our hearts. <35> Ibig sabihin ay napakalapit sa atin sapagkat ito ay nasa ating kalooban, kabahagi ng ating pagiging tao at nang ating pagiging anak ng Diyos. it means that it is very close to us because it is within ourselves, a part of our being and of being children of God. <36> Ang mga drug users at mga drug pushers ay mga kapwa din natin na dapat ituring. the drug users and drug pushers should also be treated as our neighbors. <37> Marami na sa kanila ang sumuko. many of them already surrendered. <38> Baka nga ang iba diyan ay mga kamag-anak natin, kaibigan o kakilala natin. maybe some of them are our relatives, friend or someone we know. <39> Handa ba natin silang tanggapin bilang ating "kapwa?" are we ready to accept them as our "neighbor"? <40> O baka naman sa kanilang pag-amin ay lalo lang nilang maramdaman na sila ay hiwalay at hindi na katanggap-tanggap sa ating lipunan? or maybe in their confession they might feel to a greater extent that they are outcasts and are not accepted in our society? <41> Sa taong ito ng Awa o Jubilee Year of Mercy, ang hamon sa atin ay ipakita ang AWA, PANG-UNAWA, AT GAWA ng Diyos lalo na sa ating mga kapwang nangangailangan ng pagkalinga. in this year of mercy or jubilee year of mercy, the challenge for us is to show the mercy, understanding and deed of God especially to our neighbors who need protection. <42> Hindi solusyon na sila ay patayin o lipulin sa mundong ibabaw. it is not a solution to kill them or wipe them out from the face of the earth. <43> Tugunan natin ng kabutihan ang kasamaan. let us respond to evil with kindness. <44> Palitan natin ng kapayapaan ang karahasan. let us replace violence with peace. <45> Pairalin natin ang kultura ng buhay at hindi ng kamatayan! let us allow a culture of life and not death to prevail!

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_86397045 <1> Tax incentives sa sports donors By Tina ­Mendoza November 20, 2016Aprubado na sa House committee on youth and sports development ang panukalang bigyan ng incentives ang mga donors ng mga atleta na nagwagi ng medalya sa Summer Olympic Games. tax incentives for sports donors by Tina Mendoza November 20, 2016 the House committee on youth and sports development has approved the proposal to give incentives to donors of athletes who win medals in the Summer Olympic Games. <2> Ayon kay House committee on Youth Chairman Rep. Conrado Estrella III sa ilalim ng House Bill 4054 na isinusulong nina House Speaker Pantaleon D. Alvarez, Majority Leader Rodolfo Fariñas, Minority Leader Danilo Suarez at 1-Pacman Party-list Rep. Michael Romero at PBA Party-list Rep Jericho Jonas Nograles ay bibigyan ng tax incentives ang mga indibidwal at korporasyon na nagbigay ng donasyon o kontribusyon sa nanlong atleta, layon ng nasabing panukala na hikayatin pa ang nakararami na suportahan ang mga Filipino athletes. according to House committee on youth chairman Representative Conrado Estrella III under House Bill 4054 supported by House Speaker Pantaleon D. Alvarez, Majority Leader Rodolfo Fariñas, Minority Leader Danilo Suarez and 1-Pacman Party-list Representative Michael Romero and PBA Party-list Representative Jericho Jonas Nograles individuals and corporations who give donations or contributions to winning athletes will be given tax incentives, the said proposal aims to encourage the majority to support Filipino athletes. <3> Ipapasa naman ng komite sa Committee on ways and means ang panukala para syang magtakda kung magkano ang insentibo na maaaring ibigay. the committee will pass the proposal to the committee on ways and means who will decide how much incentive can be given. <4> Matatandaan na si Hidilyn Diaz,25 anyos mula as Zamboanga City ang muling nakapaguwi ng silver medal sa weightlifting para sa bansa noong nakaraang Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Olympics, taong 1996 pa nang huling makakamit ng silver medal ang Pilipinas nang manalo noon si Mansueto “Onyok” Velasco sa boxing. it can be recalled that Hidilyn Diaz, 25 years old from Zamboanga City was able to bring home a silver medal in weightlifting for the country in the recent Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Olympics, it was year 1996 when the Philippines last obtained a silver medal when Mansueto "Onyok" Velasco won then in boxing. <5> “The bill provides that any donation, contribution, gift and grant of real and personal property to any Filipino athlete who has won for the Philippines a bronze, silver, or gold medal in the Summer Olympic Games shall constitute an allowable deduction from the income of the donor for income tax purposes and shall be exempt from donor’s tax, in accordance with the provisions of the National Internal Revenue Code”nakasaad sa panukala. "the bill provides that any donation, contribution, gift and grant of real and personal property to any Filipino athlete who has won for the Philippines a bronze, silver, or gold medal in the Summer Olympic Games shall constitute an allowable deduction from the income of the donor for income tax purposes and shall be exempt from donor's tax, in accordance with the provisions of the National Internal Revenue Code" stated in the proposal. <6> Limitado lamang naman sa P1M kada taon ang exempted sa donor’s tax at sakop nito ang mga insentibo na mula sa gobyerno at mga pribadong sektor. the exemption from donor's tax is limited to P1M only every year and it covers the incentives from the government and private sectors.
