MATERIAL_BASE-1B_81525007 <1> Erotisismo ng salita at imahen eroticism in words and images <2> by Rolando B. Tolentino May 5, 2012 by Rolando B. Tolentino May 5, 2012 <3> Rebyu ng Ang Sayaw ng Dalawang Kaliwang Paa (Alvin Yapan, 2011) a review of The Dance of the Two Left Feet (Alvin Yapan, 2011) <4> Sa indie cinema, madalas ay dalawa lang ang modelo—komersyal na umaalinsunod sa template ng genre at narrative development, na may kalkuladong talas dahil indie cinema nga, at mataas na production value, tulad ng sa komersyal na pelikula; at neorealismo na isang-araw-sa-buhay na may kapasidad makapagbigay ng hayag na panlipunang komentaryo, nanggigitata sa pang-araw-araw na detalye, at open-ended na pagsasara ng naratibo. in indie cinema, usually there are only two models-commercial, which follows the template of the genre and narrative development, that has a calculated brilliance because it is in indie cinema, and a higher production value, similar to a commercial movie; and neorealism which is a day-in-the-life-of that has a capacity to give a bold social commentary, be gritty in everyday details, and is open-ended in concluding the narrative. <5> May ipinapakilala, marahil ikatlong modelo, si Alvin Yapan sa kanyang Ang Sayaw sa Dalawang Kaliwang Paa, ang literary mode. Alvin Yapan is introducing, perhaps, what could be the third model, in his The Dance of the Two Left Feet, the literary mode. <6> Sa isang banda, nasa lebel ng abstraksyon at metapisika ito, o may kapasidad na tumalakay sa unibersal at transhistorikal na katotohanan at tema tungkol sa buhay at pag-ibig. on the other side, this is on the level of abstraction and metaphysics, or has the capacity to discuss the universal and trans-historical truth and the theme is about life and love. <7> Sa kabilang banda, dahil nakaugat ang piniling panitikan sa kulturang Filipino, ito ay nakaangkla sa panlipunan at historikal na kondisyon ng bansa—sa pelikula, ang kontemporaryong bansa. on the other hand, because the chosen literature is rooted in Filipino culture, this is anchored on the societal and historical condition of the country - in film, the contemporary nation. <8> May kakayahan ang literary mode na pansamantalang idiskarga ang bagahe ng indie cinema—bilang anti-tesis ng komersyal na pelikula, ang pagmamarka ng kontraryong posibilidad sa indie kahit na komersyal ang trajektori o/at panuntunang makapagbigay ng panlipunang komentaryo—at tumalakay ng aspekto ng pagkamamamayan at pagkabansa na wala (pa) sa anino nito. the literary mode has the capacity to temporarily unload the baggage of indie cinema - as anti-thesis of the commercial cinema, the marking of the contrary possibility of the indie even if the trajectory or/and the formula to give social commentary is commercial - and discussing the aspect of citizenship and nationhood which is not yet in its shadows. <9> Umuubra at nagtatagumpay ito dahil ang pusta ay nasa lebel ng idea at konsepto, parang kung at baka sakali lang, ganito naman ang mapapag-usapan… Sa pagtahak ni Yapan, bilang scriptwriter at direktor, sa literary mode, lumalabas na figuratibo ang mga karakter at ang kanilang tunggalian sa buhay: isang maestra ng panulaan at sayaw na namumuhay mag-isa pero kumukuha ng lakas sa imahinaryo ng sapilitan pero temporaryong komunidad ng mga klase; isang mayamang estudyanteng lalake na naghahangad makapuntos sa guro at ginamit ang kakayahan para makapasok sa klase sa sayaw din nito; at isang mahirap na estudyanteng lalake na may pagnanasa sa mayaman na kaklase. it works and succeeds because the bet is in the level of idea and concept, similar to if and maybe, something like this will be talked about. in the exploration of Yapan, as a scriptwriter and director, in the literary mode, the characters and their conflict in life are shown as figurative: a theater teacher and dances to live alone but gathering strength in the imagination of a forced but temporary community of classes; a rich male student who is aspiring to gain points from the teacher and used his ability to enter her dance classes; and a poor male student who has desires for his rich classmate. <10> Tanging sa panitikan at sayaw sila nakakapag-usap, o double-speak. they are only able to talk in literature and dance, or double-speak. <11> Gamit ang pagbigkas at pagtalakay sa mga feministang tula, ang erotisismo ng salita at imahen ang kinakasangkapan para makapaglahad ng tunay na damdamin sa isa’t isa. using the utterance and discourse of feminist poems, the eroticism of words and images are utilized to express the real feelings for each other. <12> Sa pelikula, ang double-speak ay nangyayari sa pamamagitan ng parallel editing ng dalawang eksena: ang eksena na binibigkas ang tula, at ang eksena na siyang kontexto ng pagbigkas ng tula. in the movie, the double-speak happens between the parallel editing of the two scenes: the scene where the poem is recited, and the scene which is the context of the recitation of the poem. <13> Jean Garcia at Paulo Avelino sa pelikulang "Ang Sayaw ng Dalawang Kaliwang Paa" Hindi nila masabi ang tunay na saloobin sa isa’t isa. Jean Garcia and Paulo Avelino in the film, "The Dance of Two Left Feet" cannot tell their true feelings for each other. <14> Sa tula, nailalahad ito, at sa sayaw, nakikita ito. in the poem, this is expressed, and through dance, this is seen. <15> Abstraksyon-kontextualisasyon-abstraksyon na hanggang sa huling eksena ng pelikula, ang unrequited love ng mahirap na lalake, si Dennis, sa insensitibong mayamang lalake, si Marlon, ay may katugunan sa epikong sayaw ng Humadapnon—ang girian at digma ay nagtapos sa close-up shot ng dalawa na hindi gumagalaw, maliban sa lumabas na isang patak ng luha ni Marlon. abstraction contextualization abstraction until the last scene of the movie, the unrequited love of the poor man, Dennis, the insensitive rich man, Marlon, has a connection to the epic dance of Humadapnon - the matching of strength and war which ended in a close-up shot of the two without movement, aside from the Marlon's one tear flowing out. <16> May ilang isyu na tinutukoy ang pelikula: ang makauring isyu ng kaibahan ng individual na ahensya nina Marlon at Dennis, at ang kaibahan ng rekurso sa kanilang predikamento at damdamin; at ang queer na paggamit sa feministang tula nina Rebecca Anonuevo, Joi Barrios, Merlinda Bobis, Ophelia Dimalanta, Ruth Elynia Mabanglo at Benilda Santos bilang dalumat ng pag-aangkat ng tunay na damdamin, lalo na ng homoerotisismo ng dalawang lalake. there are some issues pointed out by the film: the class issue of the different individual agencies of Marlon and Dennis, and the different recourse to their predicament and feelings; and the queer utilization of the feminist poems of Rebecca Anonuevo, Joi Barrios, Merlinda Bobis, Ophelia Dimalanta, Ruth Elynia Mabanglo and Benilda Santos as deep mental reservoir of real emotions, especially of the homoeroticism of the two men. <17> Ang kapangyarihan ng literary mode ay ang kapasidad nitong gawing abstrakto ang naratibong kondisyon, at kung gayon, magkaroon ng espasyong makakahinga mula sa lipunan at kasaysayan. the power of the literary mode is its capacity to make abstraction of the conditional narrative, and if it is, it will have a space to breathe from society and history. <18> Ang limitasyon nito ay nasarhan ang posibilidad na makalabas sa kulungan ng literary mode, ng mismong panitikan at sining. its limitation is closed with the possibility to go out of the cage of the literary mode, literature and arts itself. <19> Matutunghayan din ito sa pelikula sa one-dimensionality ng mga tauhan, at ang rendering nito sa acting na subtle at hinahabol sa huling minuto ang transformasyon, na naganap lang ito sa huling dalawang eksena ng pelikula para sa dalawang lalake. this is also observed in the film through the one-dimensionality of the characters, and the rendering of its subtle acting and transformation is chased in the last minute, which only happened in the last two scenes of the film for the two men. <20> Hindi ko sinasabing hindi magaling ang mga aktor kundi ang fundasyon ng kanilang pagkatao sa naratibo ay nakabatay sa figuratibong antas—bilang kapamaraanan ng pagdalumat sa unibersal at transhistorikal na tema. I am not saying that the actors are not good, but the foundation of their character in the narrative is based on the figurative level - as a way of mental conception of the universal and trans-historical theme. <21> Sa pelikula, tula, sayaw at sining ang repositoryo ng tunay na damdamin. in the film, poetry, dance and arts are the repositories of real feelings. <22> Ang sandali ng eros at erotisismo ay nagaganap sa bisa ng pagtingin at pagtunghay, sa pakikipagkapwa ng mga tauhan na tinitimbre ng pagbigkas ng tula at pagsasayaw. the moment of eros and eroticism happens effectively through seeing and observing, in the sociability of the characters reverberated through poetry and dance. <23> Hinuhudyat ang eros ng slow motion bilang ritmikong kasangkapan para pahabain ang sensation ng sandali. eros is signaled through a slow motion as a rhythmic tool to lengthen the sensation of the moment. <24> Alam ni Yapan bilang guro rin ng panitikan ang limitasyon ng literary mode. Yapan knows, as a teacher of literature himself, the limitation of the literary mode. <25> Kaya nga sa closing credits, bilang Brechtian self-reflexive gesture, ay nagpasok siya ng production footage. therefore, in the closing credits, as a Brechtian self-reflexive gesture, he included a production footage. <26> Para maiugnay ang naestapwerang panlipunang antas, pwes, ang paalaala na ang natunghayan ay isang pelikula lang, na ang kontexto ng literary mode ay ang mismong lipunan at kasaysayan, kasama ang maggagawa nito, na umakda sa pelikula. to connect the dismissed social level, then, a reminder that the what has been witnessed is only a film, that the context of the literary mode is society and history itself, including its creator, the author of the film. <27> Mahalagang interbensyon ang pelikula ni Yapan dahil may inaalok itong bago, at mula rito, maari pang pagyamanin ang potensyalidad ng literary mode. the film of Yapan is an important intervention because it has an offering of something new, and from here, the potentiality of the literary mode can be enriched. <28> Sa dagdag pang bisa ng sinematograpiya ni Arvin Viola, editing ni Mai Dionisio, at musika nina Christine Muyco at Jema Pamintuan tunay na nagningning ang Ang Sayaw ng Dalawang Kaliwang Paa, at masasabing mahalagang pelikula ito sa ginintuang edad ng indie cinema. additional effectiveness of the cinematography of Arvin Viola, editing of Mai Dionisio and music of Christine Muyco and Jema Pamintuan. the Dance of the Two Left Feet truly glittered, and it can be said that this film is important in the golden age of indie cinema.

City of Antipolo, Rizal, August 31 - the city government of Antipolo recently held a "basic orientation on health emergency management seminar" on August 19, 2016 in Antipolo City Hall. <4> Dinaluhan ng mahigit 100 opisyales mula sa 16 barangay ang seminar na ang pangunahing layunin ay mai-handa ang mga mamamayan sa anumang sakunang darating lalo na ngayong panahon ng tag-ulan. the seminar that aims to prepare the people for any incoming calamity this rainy season was attended by more than 100 officials from 16 barangays. <5> “Prayoridad po natin ang kaligtasan ng bawat isa kung kaya’t walang sawa po tayong nagbibigay ng libreng seminar upang mas palawigin ang ating kaalaman sa mga paghahandang dapat natin isaalang-alang sa panahon ng kalamidad. accommodations are safe and far from landslides for the safety of ourselves and of our loved ones," said Antipolo City mayor Jun Ynares. <7> Binigyang diin sa seminar ang responsibilidad ng mga barangay na ipaalam agad sa kinauukulan ang nangyaring sakuna upang mabigyan ng mabilis at nararapat na aksyon. the responsibility of the barangay to immediately inform the authorities of accidents that happened in order to be given quick and appropriate action was emphasized in the seminar. <8> Pinaalalahanan din ang mga barangay na tungkulin nila na siguraduhing ligtas, malinis at maayos ang mga evacuation area na pansamantalang paglalagian ng mga biktima sa panahon ng kalamidad. barangays were also reminded that it is their responsibility to ensure that evacuation areas and temporary accommodations of the victims during periods of calamity are safe, clean and orderly. <9> Tinukoy din ang importansya ng pagkakaroon ng sapat na pagkain at inumin at ang pagpapanatili ng proper hygiene upang makaiwas sa sakit. also pointed out were the importance of having enough food and drink and maintaining proper hygiene to avoid illnesses. <10> Ipinaliwanag sa programa ang mga gampanin ng mga opisina sa panahon ng emergency at ang kahalagahan ng mabilis at maaayos na koordinasyon ng mga barangay sa City Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (CDRRMO), City Social Welfare and Development Office (CSWD), City Health Office (CHO). the program explained the roles of the offices during emergency periods and the importance of quick and orderly coordination of the barangays with the City Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (CDRRMO), City Social Welfare and Development Office (CSWD), City Health Office (CHO). <11> Tiniyak naman ng CDRRMO na nakahanda ito anumang oras I seek no confrontation. <6> I only pray and will strive for a genuine national reconciliation founded on justice” Unang bahagi ito ng nakahandang talumpati ni dating Senator Benigno “Ninoy” Aquino Jr. "I only pray and will strive for a genuine national reconciliation founded on justice" this is the first part of the prepared speech of former Senator Benigno "Ninoy" Aquino Junior. <7> sa pagbabalik Pili­pinas matapos ang tatlong taong pananatili sa Boston, sa Amerika noong Agosto 21,1983, gamit ang pa­saporteng nakapangalan sa Marcial Bonifacio. in coming back to the Philippines after three years stay in Boston, America last August 1983, using the passport named to Marcial Bonifacio. <8> “I am prepared for the worst, and have decided against the advice of my mother,­ my spiritual adviser, many of my tested friends and a few of my most valued political mentors. "I am prepared for the worst, and have decided against the advice of my mother, my spiritual adviser, many of my tested friends and a few of my most valued political mentors." <9> A death sentence awaits me. a death sentence awaits me. <10> Two more subversion charges, both calling for death penalties, have been filed since I left three years ago and are now pending with the courts,” ang sa­sabihin sana ni Ninoy. "two more subversion charges, both calling for death penalties, have been filed since I left three years ago and are now pending with the courts," Ninoy was supposed to say. <11> Pero hindi na naide­liber ni Ninoy ang talumpati niyang ito dahil bago pa man bumaba sa sinakyang eroplano habang nakahimpil sa tarmac ng dating Manila International Airport (MIA) ay sunud-sunod na putok ng baril ang narinig at da­lawang tao ang humandusay, isa na siya roon. but Ninoy wasn't able to deliver his speech because before he even went out of the airplane he traveled in, while stopped at a tarmac of former Manila International Airport (MIA), successive gunshots were heard, and two people fell flat, and he was one of them. <12> Hindi na pinaharap si Ninoy sa korte na sinasabi niya dahil pagbaba pa lang ng eroplano ay sinentensyahan na siya ng kamatayan ng mga taong hanggang nga­yon ay pinagtatulunan pa kung sino ang nagbigay ng kautusan sa mga sundalo na siya ay itumba na. Ninoy wasn't even summoned at court because just as the plane landed, he was already sentenced with death by people who up until now are argued who gave the instructions to the soldiers to shoot him. <13> Pero bago namatay si Ninoy, itinututuring siyang haligi ng oposisyon sa panahon ni Marcos at bagama’t mula sa mayamang pamilya sa Tarlac ay gumawa ng sariling pa­ngalan nang maging war correspondent sa Korea war sa edad na 17-anyos. but before Ninoy died, he was regarded as a pillar of the opposition during the time of Marcos, although, born in a rich family in Tarlac, he made his own name when he became a war correspondent during the Korean war at age 17-years-old. <14> Sa edad na 22-anyos ay nahalal si Ninoy bilang Mayor ng Concepcion, Tarlac at sa edad na 27 ay naging Vice Governor ng Tarlac at na­ging Governor ng Tarlac sa edad na 31-anyos. at the age of 22, Ninoy was elected as the Mayor of Concepcion, Tarlac; at the age of 27, he became the Vice-Governor of Tarlac, and became the Governor of Tarlac at age 31-years-old. <15> Noong 1967 sa edad na 35-anyos ay na­ging Senador si Ninoy Aquino at naging kritiko ni Pangulong Marcos at pinaniniwalaang malakas na kandidato sa pagkapangulo noong 1973 ng Partido Liberal. in 1967 at the age of 35 years old, Ninoy Aquino became a senator and critic of President Marcos and was believed to be a strong candidate for president in 1973 by the Liberal Party. <16> Ilan sa mga privilege speech ni Ninoy ay ang “Jabidah! one of the privilege speeches of Ninoy is the "Jabidah!" <17> Special Forces of Evil?” "special forces of evil?" <18> na kanyang idineliber noong March 28, 1968 na patungkol sa pagmasaker umano ng Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) sa mga Muslim recruits na sinasanay para bawiin ang Sabah na hawak ng Malaysia. that he delivered on March 28, 1968, which was about the Armed Forces of the Philippines' (AFP) alleged massacre of Muslim recruits, who are being trained to take back Sabah that is under Malaysia. <19> Natunugan din ni Ninoy ang nilulutong ‘Oplan Sagittarius’ ng Marcos administration na ang layon ay isailalim sa Martial Rule ang Pilipinas, halos isang taon pagkatapos bombahin ang political rally ng LP sa Plaza Miranda. Ninoy also hinted the cooked 'Oplan Saggitarius' of Marcos administration which aimed to put Philippines under Martial Rule, almost one year after bombing the political rally of LP at Plaza Miranda. <20> Hindi nagkamali ang senador dahil noong Set­yembre 21, 1972 ay idineklara ni Marcos at binuwag ang 1935 Constitution at inaresto may may 400 katao kasama si Ninoy dahil nagpaplano umano ang mga ito na agawin ang gobyerno. the Senator wasn't mistaken because last September 21, 1972, Marcos declared and demolished the 1935 Constitution, and arrested 400 people along with Ninoy because of their alleged plan to take over the government. <21> Nilitis si Ninoy kasama ang lider ng komunista na si Ka Dante Buscayno subalit tumanggi ito kila­lanin ang military tribunal sa pagsasabing “I would rather die on my feet with honor, than live on bended knees in shame” noong 1973. Ninoy was investigated, along with their communist leader, ComradeDante Buscayno, but he refused to recognize the military tribunal by saying "I would rather die on my feet with honor, than live on bended knees in shame," last 1973. <22> Naghunger strike si Ninoy habang nasa loob ng kulungan bilang protesta subalit hindi ito pinansin ni Marcos hanggang sa tulu­yan itong magkasakit at itinakbo sa Veteran Memorial (Medical Center) kung saan nanatili ito sa nasabing pagamutan ng halos isang buwan. Ninoy rallied with hunger strike while at prison as protest, however, he wasn't paid attention by Marcos until he got sick and was rushed to Veteran Memorial (Medical Center) where he stayed at the said hospital for almost a month. <23> Noong Marso 1980 inatake sa puso si Ninoy kaya dinala ito sa Philip­pine Heart Center at sa pamamagitan ni Uni­ted States (US) President Jimmy Carter, napapayag si Marcos na magpagamot ang Senador sa Amerika noong Mayo 8, 1980 at matapos makarekober sa kanyang sakit ay kabi-kabila ang Speaking engagement nito sa Estados Unidos para sa pakikipaglaban para sa mga Filipino. on March 1980 Ninoy had a heart attack so he was brought to the Philippine Heart Center and through United States (US) President Jimmy Carter, Marcos allowed the senator to seek treatment in America on May 8, 1980 and after recovering from his condition he had numerous speaking engagements in the United States about fighting for the Filipinos. <24> Dito nagkaroon ng maraming paha­yag o qoute na kapag nari­nig mo ay maaalala mong si Ninoy ang nagsabi tulad ng: “A time comes in a man’s life when he must prefer a meaningful death to a meaningless life.” it was here that statements and quotes were remembered to be icons of Ninoy, such as: "a time comes in a man's life when he must prefer a meaningful death to a meaningless life." <25> “I will never be able to forgive myself if I will have to live with the know­ledge that I could have done something and I did not do anything.” "I will never be able to forgive myself if I will have to live with the knowledge that I could have done something and I did not do anything." <26> “We only ask that freedom be returned, we ask for nothing more but we will accept nothing less”. "we only ask that freedom be returned, we ask for nothing more but we will accept nothing less". <27> Totoo nga sa kanyang sinabi, bumalik si Ninoy para tulungan ang mga Filipino na makalaya sa pagkakagapos sa matagal na panahon sa ilalim ng pamamahala ni Marcos na tinaguriang diktador. true to his words, Ninoy came back to help the Filipinos be freed from the chains of Marcos government, known to be a dictator, after a long time. <28> Gayunpaman, ang naging kapalit nito ay ang kanyang buhay dahil hindi bago nito mailapag muli ang kanyang paa sa lupa ng Pilipinas ay isa na siyang bangkay dahil binaril na siya habang pababa sa eroplanong naghatid sa kanya sa sinilangang bansa matapos ang tatlong tatlong taong exile sa Amerika. however, the exchange was his life, not before he landed his feet on the ground of the Philippines, he was already a corpse; because he was shot while coming out of the plane that flew him to his birth country after three years of exile in America.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_36501201 <1> Pagbangon at paglaban ng mga biktima ni Yolanda rising and fighting of the victims of Yolanda <2> Sariwa pa sa alaala ni Anna Patricia Monteroso, 23, ng Sta. Rita, Samar ang takot sa bagsik ng bagyong Yolanda nang kanyang ibahagi ang karanasan niya mahigit dalawang buwan na ang nakararaan. it is still fresh in the memory of Anna Patricia Monteroso, 23, of Santa Rita, Samar the fear from the ferocity of typhoon Yolanda when she shared her experience over two months ago. <3> Hindi rin niya malaman kung paano magsisimula at bubuhayin ang pamilya matapos wasakin ng bagyo ang kanilang kabuhayan. she also does not how to begin and how to take care of her family after the typhoon destroyed their livelihood. <4> “Walang dumating na relief goods kahit isa. "no relief goods came at all, even one." <5> Nakakalungkot na imbes na magtulungan nagtaasan pa ang presyo ng bigas. it is saddening that instead of helping each other, the price of rice increased. <6> Isang kilo P60, eh wala kaming pera. 60 pesos a kilo, we don't have money. <7> Ang bumuhay lang sa amin yung tanim naming saging at kamote sa loob ng isang lingo,” ayon kay Anna. "what sustained us in one week were the banana and sweet potatoes we planted," according to Anna. <8> Dagdag ni Anna, kahit humingi na ng tulong ang kanilang barangay pero wala pa rin silang nakukuhang relief goods mula sa gobyerno. Anna added they still did not get any relief goods from the government even when their barangay asked for help. <9> At hanggang ngayon, wala pa rin silang nakukuhang anumang tulong mula sa gobyerno. and until now, they still have not gotten any help from the government. <10> Hirap din ang asawa na makapasok sa trabaho sa Maynila (kung saan sila naroon ngayon) para bumuhay sa kanilang pamilya. it is difficult for her husband to get a job in Manila (where they are now) to raise their family. <11> Ilan lamang si Anna sa mga biktima na nagbahagi ng kani-kanilang karanasan sa ginanap na pagtitipon ng mga biktima, kaanak, kaibigan, at taga-suporta ng bagyong Yolanda na tinawag na Day of Solidarity sa pangunguna ng Tindog People’s Network (Tindog) at Task Force on Urban Conscientization (TFUC) sa Lungsod ng Quezon. Anna is just one of the victims who shared their own experiences at the gathering of victims, relatives, friends and supporters of typhoon Yolanda which was called Day of Solidarity led by Tindog People's Network (Tindog) and Task Force on Urban Conscientization (TFUC) which was held in Quezon City. <12> Administrasyong Aquino, hindi handa at naging pabaya Aquino administration, not prepared and was negligent <13> Sa nasabing pagtitipon, ibinahagi ng mga biktima ang anila’y mabagal, kung mayroon man, na pagdating ng tulong mula sa administrasyong Aquino sa kabila ng sinasabi nitong kahandaan bago dumating ang bagyo. at the said gathering, the victims shared what they said was slow, if there were any, help from the Aquino administration despite claiming readiness before the storm came. <14> Bago dumating ang bagyo, inanunsiyo mismo ni Pangulong Aquino na handa ang pamahalaan sa pagdating ni Yolanda. before the typhoon hit, President Aquino himself announced that the government is ready for Yolanda's arrival. <15> Mayroong 32 na eroplano at helicopters daw mula sa (Phillipine) Air Force at nasa 20 navy ships mula sa Philippine Navy ang nakaposisyon sa Cebu, Bikol, Cavite, at Zamboanga City. there were allegedly 32 airplanes and helicopters from the (Philippine) Air Force and 20 navy ships from the Philippine Navy positioned in Cebu, Bicol, Cavite and Zambaonga City. <16> Nakahanda rin daw ang relief goods sa maraming lugar na tatamaan ng bagyo. the relief goods were ready in places where the typhoon will hit. <17> Pero iba ang naging mukha ng kahandaang sinasabi ng Malakanyang, ayon kay Bro. Philip Michael Benavide, Nicodamus, kasapi ng TFUC. but countenance of Malacañang's readiness was different, according to Brother Philip Michael Benavide, Nicodamus, member of TFUC. <18> “Bagamat nagpakalat ng impormasyon ang gobyerno sa internet, nagkulang pa rin ito ng paliwanag sa kung gaano kalaki ang magiging epekto ng bagyo. although the government spread information through the internet, it failed to explain how big the effect of the typhoon will be. <19> Hindi nga alam ng mga tao kung ano ang storm surge,” ayon kay Benavide. "the people do not even know what storm surge is," according to Benavide. <20> Sa presentasyon ni Benavide, wala raw isinagawang search-and-rescue operations ang gobyerno sa krusyal na mga araw matapos ang bagyo. in Benavide's presentation, there were no search-and-rescue operations made by the government in the crucial days following the typhoon. <21> Inabot pa ng anim na araw nang magsabi ang administrasyong Aquino na mayroon na silang adjusted disaster management plan. it took six days for the Aquino administration to say they have an adjusted disaster management plan. <22> “Inabot pa nang mahigit isang linggo para magkaroon ng ‘workable system’ ng pamimigay ng relief goods. "it took more than a week to have a workable system in the distribution of relief goods. <23> Pero sa loob lamang ito at karatig lugar ng Tacloban. but this is only within and in nearby places of Tacloban. <24> Mas magiging mahirap pa ito kung hindi tumulong ang mga pribado at dayuhan,” ayon kay Benavide. it will be more difficult if not for the help of the private sector and foreigners," Benavide said. <25> Pero ayon sa mga biktima, sadyang kulang pa rin umanoa ng nakuhang tulong mula sa gobyerno. but according to the victims, the help they got from the government was really lacking. <26> “Nung magdala sila ng relief goods sa amin 40 bags lang. when they brought us relief goods, they were only 40 bags. <27> Eh nasa 600 katao meron sa lugar namin,” sabi ni Anna. there are about 600 people in our place," said Anna. <28> Ayon naman kay Joven Pagupay, 27, taga-Eastern Samar, hindi niya masisi ang mga taong ‘nag-looting’ umano dahil sa desperasyon na nais may makain. according to Joven Pagupay, 27, from Eastern Samar, he cannot blame the people who allegedly looted out of their desperation to have something to eat. <29> “Nakakadurog ng puso na makita mo na ganoon. "it is heartbreaking to see something like that." <30> Nakakaawa ‘yung negosyante na tinutukan para mapasok ‘yung tindahan nila, pero nakakaawa rin ‘yung mga taong hindi pa kumakain nang ilang araw,” ani Pagupay. "it is pitiful to see the business person whose store was entered at gun-point, but the people who have not eaten for days are also pitiful," Pagupay said. <31> Maliban sa problema sa pamimigay ng relief goods at hindi kaagad makolektang mga bangkay, naging isyu rin ang turuan o paninisi ni Pangulong Aquino sa lokal na gobyerno dahil sa kawalan nito ng kahandaan sa pagdating ng bagyo. apart from the problem in the distribution of relief goods and corpses not collected immediately, President Aquino pinpointing the blame to the local government because of its unpreparedness for the coming of the typhoon also became an issue. <32> Hanggang sa kasalukuyan, marami pa rin ang nangangailangan ng tulong at serbisyo-medikal. until now, there are many who need help and medical services. <33> Marami pa rin ang mga nagugutom at walang hanapbuhay sa mga nakaligtas sa bagyon, ayon kay Benavide. "there are still many hungry and unemployed survivors," according to Benavide. <34> Marami sa kanila, balisa pa rin dahil sa kalamidad, at hindi alam kung papaano makakabangon–lalo pa’t wala silang maramdamang tulong mula sa gobyerno. many of them are still in discomfort because of the calamity and do not know how to recover especially when they do not get any help from the government. <35> “Hindi namin alam kung paano kami magsisimula. "we do not how to start" <36> Wala kaming trabaho, yung asawa ko mahigit 50-taon na kaya walang tumatanggap sa kanya. we do not have jobs, my husband over 50 years old so no one accepts him. <37> Hindi namin alam kung paano namin bubuhayin ang tatlong anak namin. we do not know how we can support our three children. <38> Kailangan namin ng trabaho o ikabubuhay,” ayon kay Lilia Singh, 44, taga-Magallanes, Tacloban City, we need a job or a livelihood," according to Lilia Singh, 44, from Magallanes, Tacloban City. <39> Pansamantalang nakatira si Lilia at ang pamilya niya sa Bgy. Corazon de Jesus, San Juan City. Lilia and her family are temporarily living in Barangay Corazon de Jesus, San Juan City. <40> Nangangamba raw sila dahil di nila kakilala ang kanilang mga kapitbahay. they are fearful because they do not know their neighbors. <41> Lugar din ito ng nakaraang marahas na demolisyon, kung kaya natatakot din sina Lilia na pati sila’y saplitang palayasin dito ng gobyerno. it is also the site of a previous violent demolition, so Lilia also fears that the government will forcefully evict them from here. <42> Nakarating sina Lilia sa Maynila sakay ng eroplanong C130 matapos dalawang araw na pumila sa airport ng Tacloban na pawang biskwit lang ang kinakain. they reached Manila on board a C130 airplane after lining at the Tacloban airport for two days with only biscuits as food. <43> Korupsiyon, kakulangan ng tulong corruption, lack of aid <44> Para kay Mark Lui Aquino, convener ng Tindog Network, di-makatao ang pagtrato ng administrasyong Aquino sa mga biktima ng kalamidad. for Mark Lui Aquino, convener of Tindog Network, the treatment of the victims of calamity by the Aquino administration is inhumane. <45> Aniya, ano pa nga ba’t pati ang mga ahensiya ng gobyerno na may kontrol sa pasilidad na para sa mga biktima ay nasasangkot sa mga isyu ng korupsiyon. he said even government agencies with control over the facilities for the victims are involved in issues of corruption. <46> Tampok na rito ang balitang overpriced at subs-standard ang ipinatyo ng gobyerno na bunkhouses para sa mga biktima. particularly the news about the overpriced and sub-standard bunkhouses built by the government for the victims. <47> Samantala, itinuturing din ni Aquino na di-makatao ang pagtrato ng administrasyon sa mga nasawi: mahigit dalawang buwan na ang nakalilipas pero hindi pa rin naililibing ang marami sa mga bangkay ng nasawing mga biktima. meanwhile, Aquino also considers the treatment of the casualties as inhumane: more than two months have passed but the remains of the dead victims have not been buried. <48> Ganito raw itrato ng administrasyong Aquino ang mga biktima: Biniktima na nga ng bagyo, ninanakawan pa ng mga tulong na para dapat sa kanila, ayon kay Mark. this is how the Aquino administration treated the victims: victimized by the typhoon, robbed of the help intended for them, according to Mark. <49> Ayon naman sa TFUC, ang matagal na kahirapan sa rehiyon mismo na dahilan ng mga maling patakaran ng gobyerno ang lalong nagpapahirap sa kalagayan ng mga biktima. according to TFC, the poverty in the region itself caused by the government's incorrect policies make the situation of the victims worse. <50> Atrasado umano ang agrikultural na sektor na pangunahing ikinabubuhay ng mga nasalanata. the agricultural sector which is the primary livelihood of the victims is slow. <51> Isinisisi rin nila ang kahirapan sa pangkapaligirang mga patakaran gaya ng pagmimina na sumisira sa kalikasan sa ngalan ng tubo na pinahihintulutan ng gobyerno. they are also blaming poverty to the environmental policies, like mining that destroys the environment in the interest of the income allowed by the government. <52> Administrasyong Aquino, panagutin Aquino administration, to be charged <53> Sinabi ng TFUC dapat na managot ang administrasyong Aquino sa kapabayaan nito sa mga biktima ng bagyong Yolanda. TFUC said the Aquino administration should be accountable for its neglect of the victims of typhoon Yolanda. <54> Itinuturo nila ang kakulangan ng kahandaan ng gobyerno bago dumating ang bagyo at ang mabagal na pagresponde ng tulong para sa mga biktima. they are pointing to the lack of preparation of the government before the coming of the typhoon and the slow response to aid the victims. <55> Gayundin ang pamumulitika at korupsiyon sa oras kung kailan higit na kinakailangan ang tulong na lalong nagpapalala sa sakit at paghihirap ng mga biktima. politicizing and corruption in times when help was badly needed aggravated the suffering and poverty of the victims. <56> “Bagamat totoo na ang pagpasa ng paninisi at turuan ay maaari lamang makadagdag sa pinsala at makapagpabagal ng proseso (ng pagtulong), hindi dapat natin lituhin ang ating mga sarili kung ano ang tama. "while it is true that passing and pointing the blame can only add to the damage and slow the process (of helping), we should not confuse ourselves with what is right." <57> Sinasabihan tayo na gawin kung ano ang makatarungan,” sabi ng TFUC. "we are told to do what is just," TFUC said. <58> Ang kapabayaang ito ng administrasyong Aquino ang sinasabing krimen, ayon sa TFUC at sa Tindog. this negligence of the Aquino administration is allegedly a crime, according to TFUC and Tindog. <59> “Ang kawalan ng kahandaan ng pamahalaang Aquino bago dumating ang bagyo at ang hindi agarang pagresponde sa mga biktima para sa relief and rescue ay ang disaster na ginawa ng rehimen na lalong nagpalala at nagpahirap sa mga biktima ng bagyo,” ayon kay Benavide. "the lack of preparation of the Aquino government before the typhoon and the not immediately responding for the relief and rescue of the victims was the disaster done by the regime worsened and afflicted the victims of the typhoon," according to Benavide. <60> Ayon pa kay Benavide, imbes na pagbibigay ng relief operations sa mga biktimang nagugutom ang ginawa ng mga sundalo, mas magpapanatili pa ng peace and order ang inuna kesa sa kumakalam na sikmura ng mga mamamayan. according to Benavide, instead of the providing relief operations to the hungry victims were done by the soldiers, they prioritized the maintenance of peace and order more than the growling stomach of the people. <61> Pagbangon at paglaban rise and fight <62> Para sa Tindog, may kailangang managot at habulin mula sa pamahalaang Aquino sa naging kapabayaan nito. for Tindog, someone from Aquino government should be accountable and charged for its negligence. <63> Naririyan pa rin daw ang mga isyu ng korupsiyon at pagtatakip nito sa pananagutan at iyon ang hindi nila papayagang mangyari. there are still issues of corruption and cover-up of liability and that is what they will not allow to happen. <64> “Hindi natin hahayaan na patuloy pa tayong biktimahin ng pamahalaang ito ni Aquino. we will not allow to be continually victimized by the Aquino government. <65> Makikiisa tayo sa lahat ng biktima para manawagan ng katarungan at igiit ang mga karapatan natin mula sa gobyerno para sa ating mga nakaligtas at para sa mga nasawi,” ani Mark. we will join all victims to call for justice and to assert our rights from the government for us who survived and for those who died," said Mark. <66> Ilan sa mga panawagan ng Tindog ang pagkakaroon ng P40,000 subsidyo para sa naging mga biktima, kabuhayan para sa mga nasalanta, bigyan ng disenteng libingan ang mga nasalanta, at tiyaking sapat ang batayang pangangailangan ng mga biktima ng kalamidad. some of Tindog's appeals are to have a 40,000 pesos subsidy for the victims, livelihood for the devastated, a proper burial place for the casualties, and to ensure the basic needs of the victims of the calamity are adequate. <67> Mahigit dalawang buwan na matapos manalasa ang bagyong Yolanda mula noong Nobyembre 8, pero tila hindi pa rin natatapos ang pinsalang dulot nito sa mga biktima— buhay man o patay. more than two months after typhoon Yolanda's destruction on November 8, but it seems the damage it brought to the victims has not yet ended - whether alive or dead. <68> Pero para sa mga nakaligtas, hindi sila papayag na manatiling biktima na lamang. but for the survivors, they will not allow to remain victims.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_35991249 <1> South Cotabato nakikiisa sa pagdiriwang ng National Women’s Month South Cotabato joins the celebration of national women's month <2> March 03, 2016 LUNGSOD NG KORONADAL, South Cotabato, Mar. 3 (PIA) – Ang buwan ng Marso ay National Women’s Month. March 03, 2016 city of Coronadal, South Cotabato, Mar. 3 (PIA) - the month of March is national women's month. <3> Kaugnay rito, nakatakdang magsagawa ang pamahalaang panlalawigan ng South Cotabato ng Women’s Congress sa Tropicana Beach sa General Santos City sa Marso 17 hanggang 18. Dadaluhan ito ng may 1,500 kababaihan mula sa iba’t ibang sektor sa sampung bayan at isang lungsod sa South Cotabato, pati na ang mga miyembro ng Kalipunan ng Liping Pilipina sa lalawigan. related to this, the provincial government of South Cotabato will be holding the women's congress at Tropicana Beach in General Santos city on March 17 to 18. it will be attended by 1,500 women from various sectors in ten towns and one city in South Cotabato, including members of the "Kalipunan ng Liping Pilipina" in the province. <4> Ayon kay Joy Londres ng Provincial Population Office, bibigyang diin sa pagtitipon ang kapakanan ng mga kababaihan sa politika batay na rin sa tema ng pagdiriwang na “Kapakanan ni Juana, Isama sa Agenda.” according to Joy Londres of the provincial population office, the meeting will be emphasizing the welfare of women in politics based on the theme of the celebration "the welfare of Juana, include it in the agenda." <5> Kabilang sa inaasahang panauhing pandangal sina dating Justice Secretary Leila De Lima at TV personality Korina Sanchez. among the expected guests of honor are former Justice Secretary Leila De Lima and TV personality Korina Sanchez. <6> Layon din ng pagtitipon, dagdag ni Londres, ang mabigyan ang mga kababaihan ng isang “day-off” mula sa kanilang mga gawain sa tahanan at tanggapan kung kaya’t sa tabing-dagat isasagawa ang women’s congress. the purpose of the meeting, Londres added, is to give women a "day off" from their home and office activities that is why the women's congress will be held at the beach. <7> Bukod sa pakikinig sa mga mensahe ng imbitadong mga personalidad, panahon rin ang pagtitipon para sa pagsasaya dahil nakatakda rin silang maglaro ng mga larong Pinoy at humataw sa isang Zumba session. apart from listening to the messages from invited personalities, the gathering was also a time for fun because they are also set to play Pinoy games and dance in one Zumba session. <8> Naglaan ang pamahalaang panlalawigan ng halos PhP400,000 para sa women’s congress. the provincial government allotted about Php 400,000 for the women's congress. <9> (KCSenillo- DevCom Intern/DEDoguiles-PIA 12) (KCSenillo-DevCom Intern/DEDoguiles-PIA 12)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_25323570 <1> Sabado, Nobyembre 14, 2015 Saturday, November 14, 2015 <2> WAKAS NG PANAHON at TAMANG PANAHON: Reflection for 33rd Sunday in Ordinary Time Year B - November 25, 2015 - YEAR OF THE POOR the end of time and right time: reflection for the 33rd Sunday in ordinary time year b - November 25, 2015 - year of the poor <3> Kailan nga ba ang pagdating ng "wakas ng panahon?" is the coming of "the end of time" necessary? <4> Katulad din ba ito ng "sa tamang panahon" na walang makapagsasabi kung kailan? is it similar to "the right time" which no one can say when? <5> Marami sa atin ay natatakot sa pagdating ng "wakas ng panahon." many of us are scared of the coming of "the end of time." <6> Bakit nga ba natin ito kinatatakutan? why do we really fear it? <7> Tunay nga bang nakakatakot ang "katapusan?" is the "end" truly scary? <8> Sa isang malaking mall na kung saan ay dagsa ang mga tao dahil sa papalapit na Pasko ay bigla na lamang may sumigaw. in a large mall, where many people flock to because of a fast-approaching Christmas, someone suddenly shouted. <9> Isang taong nakadamit na kakaiba at may karatulang hawak-hawak na nakalagay na "The end of the world is near!" a person dressed differently and holding a sign with "the end of the world is near!" <10> Sumisigaw siya ng malakas na "KATAPUSAN NA! KATAPUSAN NA!" he was shouting loudly "it is the end! it is the end!" <11> Nang bigla na lamang may sumagot ng: "TANGA! I am not referring to the "end of the month" because of the monthly pay that is anticipated. <15> Sa ating mga kristiyano ang katapusan o wakas ng panahon ay hindi dapat katakutan kundi bagkus ay dapat pa nga nating kapanabikan. to us Christians the end or the end of time should not be feared but instead we should even anticipate it. <16> Sa katunayan ang mga unang Kristiyano ay atat na atat na sa pagsapit ng katapusan ng panahon. actually to the first Christians they really looked forward to the coming of the end of time. <17> Ang kanilang parating sinasambit ay "MARANATHA!" what they always said was "maranatha!" <18> na ang ibig sabihin ay "Halina, Hesus! which meant "come, Jesus! <19> Halina!" come!" <20> Ang kanilang akala ay agaran ang kanyang pagdating kaya marami sa kanila ang nagbenta ng kanilang ari-arian at hindi na nagtrabaho. what they assumed was his arrival was immediate so many of them sold their possessions and no longer worked. <21> Ngunit itinama ni San Pablo ang ganitong pag-iisip. but Saint John corrected this mentality. <22> Hindi ganito ang inaasahan ng ating Panginoon na uri ng paghahanda. this kind of preparation is not the one expected by our Lord. <23> Nakakatakot ang wakas ng panahon kung mali ang ating paghahanda at lalo na siguro kung hindi tayo naghahanda. the end of time is scary if our preparation is wrong and perhaps especially if we are not preparing. <24> Ano ba ang tamang paghahanda sa "wakas ng panahon?" what is the right preparation for "the end of time?" <25> Una, tanggalin natin ang masamang pag-uugali at kung kinakailang dumulog sa kumpisal ay gawin natin ito. first, remove bad habits and if it is necessary to go to confession we must do it. <26> Walang hihigit pang mainam na paghahanda sa pagkakaroon ng isang malinis na puso. there is no better preparation than having a pure heart. <27> Ikalawa, gawin nating makatotohanan ang ating mga panalangin at pagsisimba sa pamamagitan ng paggawa ng kabutihan at pagtulong sa mga nangangailangan lalong-lalo na sa mga mahihirap. second, let us make our prayers and church-going realistic through doing good and helping the needy especially the poor. <28> Magtatapos na ang "Taon ng mga Mahihirap" o "Year of the Poor", may nagawa na ba akong pagtulong sa kanila? the "year of the poor" or "year or the poor" is about to end, have I done any service to them? <29> Wag nating idahilang mahirap din tayo. let us not reason that we are poor as well. <30> Para kay St. for Saint <31> Theresa of Calcutta, hindi kinakailangang malaki ang pagtulong ang sabi niya: "Kung hindi mo kayang magpakain sa isangdaang katao, kaya mo naman siguro ang isa!" Theresa of Calcutta, it is not necessary to give big she said: "if you cannot feed one hundred people, you can feed one!" <32> Kaya nga't tama ang sinabi ng Simbahan na walang taong mahirap para hindi magkaloob ng tulong sa iba. so what the church said is correct that there is no person too poor to not offer help to others. <33> Hindi naman natatapos sa Year of the Poor ang ating pagtulong sa kapwa. our helping our neighbors does not end in the year of the poor. <34> Araw-araw ay may pagkakataon tayong gumawa ng maliit na kabutihan para sa ating mga kapatid na mahihirap. every day we have the chance to do small acts of kindness for our poor fellowmen. <35> Sa ating Ebanghelyo ay nagbabala ang Paningoon sa darating na "katapusan", hindi upang takutin tayo, kundi bagkus ay upang tulungan tayong maghanda sa pagdating ng araw na ito. in our gospel the Lord warned of the coming "end", not to scare us, but instead to help us prepare for the coming of this day. <36> Totoo, walang nakakaalam ng araw, oras at lugar kung saan ito mangyayari. true, no one knows the day, hour and place where it will happen. <37> Hindi na mahalaga kung kailan at saan. it is no longer important when and where. <38> Sa ating pananampalataya ay ipinahahayag natin ang WAKAS NG PANAHON. in our faith we announce the end of time. <39> Sa katunayan ay lagi nating sinasabi sa Misa na "Si Kristo'y namatay! actually we always say in mass that "Christ died! <40> Si Kristo'y nabuhay! Christ has risen! <41> SI KRISTO'Y BABALIK SA WAKAS NG PANAHON! Christ will return in the end of time! <42> Ibig sabihin, naniniwala tayo na may tinatawag na katapusan ng mundo at naniniwala rin tayo na may Diyos na makatarungan at mapagmahal na hindi tayo pababayaan sa araw na ito. meaning, we believe what is called the end of the world exists and we also believe there is a God who is just and loving who will not abandon us on that day. <43> Ang WAKAS NG PANAHON ay parating pa lang... the end of time is only about to come... <44> Ang TAMNANG PANAHON ay ngayon na! the right time is now! <45> Kumilos tayo ngayon at paghandaan ang kanyang pagdating! let us act today and prepare for his coming!

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_20609703 <1> Living by the Honor Code: My personal experience (Part 3) Living by the Honor Code: My personal experience (Part 3) <2> Kaming mga militar ay nai-expose sa tunay na 'mundo' sa labas sa panahong nakakasalamuha na namin ang komunidad na aming ginagalawan. we, the military, are exposed to the real outside world during the time when we are interacting with the community where we are moving in. <3> Dahil kinakailangan naming makasalamuha ang mga sibilyan at maging ang mga ahensya ng pamahalaan, doon namin nakikita ang kaibahan ng ideal environment sa isang institusyon na kagaya ng PMA at ng katotohanan na dapat naming harapin sa labas. because we needed to interact with the civilians and even the agencies of the government, there we are seeing the difference of the ideal environment in an institution such as the PMA and the reality that we need to face outside. <4> Ang karanasan ko sa aking field assignment sa San Miguel, Bulacan ay ang unang hamon sa akin paano mapanindigan ang natutunang Honor Code sa Philippine Military Academy. my experience in my field assignment in San Miguel, Bulacan is the first challenge for me on how to stand by the Honor Code learned in the Philippine Military Academy. <5> Sa aking unang naibahaging kwento, umusok ang aking tenga nang mapanood ko sa Magandang Gabi Bayan ang segment na kung saan ay naakusahan ang Army na tumanggap ng P500.00 bawat truck mula sa mga illegal quarry operators sa Mt. Mabio. in the story I have shared first, my ears fumed when I have watched the segment in Magandang Gabi Bayan where the Army was accused to have received P500.00 per truck from the illegal quarry operators in Mt. Mabio. <6> Para sa akin, kabastusan yon at paglapastangan hindi lamang sa aming dangal bilang sundalo ngunit sa buong Sandatahang Lakas. for me, that was indecency and disrespect not only to our honor as soldier but to the whole Armed Forces. <7> Paano na nga lang ba kung makilala ang kasundaluhan bilang kotong boys? how would it be if the military will be known as corrupt boys? <8> Habang ako ay nasa serbisyo, hindi ko hahayaan na mangyari yan. while I am in service, I am not going to allow that to happen. <9> Nagbunga ang usapan namin ni Kapitan Ado nang nagkaroon na ang 7th Scout Ranger Company ng dokumento na nag-deputize sa amin na manghuli ng mga trak na may kargang tea rose marble. our conversation with Captain Ado bore fruit when the 7th Scout Ranger Company already got a document that deputized us to arrest the trucks with loads of tea rose marble. <10> Para sa amin, peanuts lang na mission iyon. for us, that was an easy mission. <11> Kung ang mga bandido nga na mahirap hagilapin sa galing magtago ay naiisahan namin, yong mga trak na maiingay pa kaya? even if the bandits, who are difficult to search because of good skills in hiding, are outwitted by us, why not those noisy trucks? <12> Simula noon, paisa-isa na naming nahuhuli ang mga trak na nagpupumilit magkarga ng tea rose marble. starting then, we have been arresting the trucks one by one which are forcing to load tea rose marble. <13> Agad din naman namin itong dinadala sa PENRO office sa Malolos upang i-turn over sa kanila. we have been immediately bringing this to the PENRO office in Malolos to be turned-over to them. <14> Ang masaklap nga lang, nababalitaan din namin na na-release at naglaho ring parang bula yong pinagpaguran naming huli. but the bitter part is, we are hearing the news that those we have tiresomely caught are released and also vanished like bubbles. <15> Tila merong 'mahika' bakit nangyari yon. seems there is magic why it happened. <16> Dahil doon, nagpasya kami na sa Fort Magsaysay na dadalhin ang mga trak na mahuli. because of that, we decided that the trucks we caught will be brought to Fort Magsaysay. <17> Don kasi sa kampo ay meron ding Task Force na ang katuwang ng DENR para protektahan ang kalikasan. because there in camp, there is also a Task Force whose in support of the DENR to protect the environment. <18> Kaya namin gusto na doon ang turn-over ng trak dahil wala ring 'are-areglo' ang mga boss doon sa 7ID sa mga panahong iyon. so we wanted that the turn-overs of the trucks would be there because the bosses there do not have settlements at 71D on those times. <19> Naging cat and mouse ang laro ng mga quarry operators at ng aming hanay. the game of the quarry operators and our rank became a cat and mouse chase. <20> Gumawa sila ng mga taktika kagaya ng paggamit ng bagong lusutan na mga daanan. they made tactics such as using new roads to pass through. <21> Mabuti na lang, ang mga inis ding mga residente ang mismong nagturo sa amin kung saan at kelan abangan ang mga nakikipagpatintero sa amin na mga illegal quarry operators. good thing, those angry residents themselves pointed to us where and when to anticipate the illegal quarry operators who are playing tag and chase with us. <22> Para masiguradong mahinto mismo ang pagdi-dinamita nila at pagtibag ng mga bato doon sa mismong quarry site, nagpasya akong magpatrol para i-surprise ko sila doon. to make sure their use of dynamite itself would be stopped and the quarry of rocks there in the quarry site itself, I decided to patrol to surprise them there. <23> Sa madaling salita, ginulantang namin ang mga tao doon sa mismong quarry site at nahuli namin ang kanilang mga kagamitan pati mga pampasabog at mga low-powered fireams. in summary, we surprised the people there in the quarry site itself and confiscated their equipment as well as their explosives and low-powered firearms. <24> Ang insidenteng iyon ang naging hudyat na mahinto ang quarry operations sa lugar, na syang rason kung bakit natapyasan ng malaki ang isang bahagi ng bundok. that incident became a signal to stop the quarry operations in the place which became the reason why a part of the mountain was largely cleft off. <25> Ramdam ko ang galit nila sa aming ginawang pagpahinto sa kabastusan nila sa kalikasan. I felt their anger at the stoppage that we have done against their disrespect towards nature. <26> Ang areglo the settlement <27> Isang hapon noon nang merong dalawang bisitang nagdatingan para bisitahin ako sa opisina. it was afternoon then when there were two visitors who had been arriving to visit me in the office. <28> Nagkataon na kasama ko sa mga oras na iyon ang aking Company Commander na si Lt Aquino at ang kanyang mistah na si Lt Jono Pasamonte. by chance, on those hours, I was with my Company Commander who is Lt Aquino and his colleague Lieutenant Jono Pasamonte. <29> Lumapit sa amin ang aming First Sergeant na si Msg Rufo Guigue na syang unang kumausap sa bisita na noon ay nag-aantay sa tindahan sa labas. our First Sergeant who is Msg Rufo Guige approached us who had first talked to the visitor who was then waiting at a store outside. <30> "Sir, andyan yong isang quarry operator. "sir, one quarry operator is there. <31> Me dalang alak at mga pagkain," sabi nya. has brought alcohol and foods," he said. <32> "Makipag-ayos ata kasi nahuli natin iyong bago nyang trak na ngayon ay nasa Fort Magsaysay." "might want to make a settlement because we caught his new truck which is now in Fort Magsaysay." <33> Naka-smile ang dalawa kong upperclass at agad nakaisip ng isang 'maitim na plano'. two of my upperclassmen had smiled and had immediately thought of a dark plan. <34> "Ganito gawin natin Harold. "we would do this, Harold. <35> Ikaw umupo sa aking table at kunwari ikaw ang CO. you sit at my table and pretend you are the CO. <36> Pakinggan mo lang kung ano ang sabihin nila at desisyunan mo," sabi ni Lt Aquino. just listen to whatever they say and decide on it," said Lieutenant Aquino. <37> "Makikinig kami dito sa kwarto ha. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_89833725 <1> Pushing the offensive pushing the offensive <2> ni Jerome Tagaro by Jerome Tagaro <3> Nitong nakaraang linggo, naging matunog sa mga balita ang mga pambobombang naganap sa pagitan ng gobyerno ng Israel at ng Hamas, ang grupong kumokontrol sa Gaza Strip. this past week, news of the bombing that took place between the government of Israel and the Hamas, the group controlling the Gaza Strip, made noise. <4> Ang lahat ng mga pambobombang ito ay bahagi umano ng opensiba ng Israel na nagsimula noong Nobyembre 14 upang tuluyan nang matigil ang pambobomba ng Gaza sa nasasakupan nito. all of these bombings are supposedly part of the offensive of Israel that started on November 14 to completely stop Gaza's bombing of its territory. <5> Itinatag upang pigilin ang pananakop ng Israel at palitan ang estadong Israeli ng isang Islamic Palestinian state, isa ang Hamas sa dalawang grupong kumokontrol sa mga teritoryo ng Palestine, na binubuo ng West Bank at Gaza Strip. founded to stop the colonization of Israel and replace the Israeli state with an Islamic Palestinian state, Hamas is one of two groups controlling the territory of Palestine, consisting of the West Bank and Gaza Strip. <6> Madaling sabihing lohikal ang kadahilanan ng Israel para sa opensibang inilunsad nito. it is easy to say the excuse that the offensive Israel launched is logical. <7> Tunay nga namang tungkulin ng gobyerno na alagaan ang nasasakupan nito. it is truly the responsibility of the government to care for its jurisdiction. <8> Ngunit kung sisipatin natin ang pinakahuling bilang ng mga nasaktan sa mga pambobomba, malalamang tatlo sa mga namatay ang Israeli, habang higit sa 100 naman ang mga Palestinian na karamihan ay mga sibilyan. but if we will examine the last number of casualties from the bombing, we will know that three who died are Israelis, while more than 100 were Palestinians many of which are civilians. <9> Napakalaki yata ng pinagkaiba ng dalawang bilang na ito para sabihing ipinagtatanggol lamang ng Israel ang mamamayan nito. the difference of these two numbers seem too big to say that Israel is just defending its citizens. <10> Ipinaliwanag ng gobyerno ng Israel na ang mga civilian casualties na ito ay hindi maiiwasan. the government of Israel explained that these civilian casualties cannot be prevented. <11> Hindi sila umano masisisi sa mga nadadamay na sibilyan dahil ang mga target nila ay nakapuwesto sa matataong lugar. they supposedly cannot be blamed for the civilians involved because their targets are positioned in crowded areas. <12> Kasama sa mga tinamaan ng bomba ng mga Israeli ay mga residential area, ospital, ilang media outlet, at isang dating national security compound. included in those hit by Israeli bombs are residential areas, hospitals, some media outlets, and one former national security compound. <13> Kung babalikan ang kasaysayan, mga Palestinians ang orihinal na nagmamay-ari ng lupang nasasakupan ngayon ng Israel hanggang sa pormal na hatiin ang teritoryo sa dalawa noong 1948 sa isang deklarasyon ng United Nations. if we return to history, Palestinians are the original owners of the land covered by Israel today until the territory was formally divided in 1948 in a United Nations declaration. <14> Ang pangunahing dahilan ng paghahating ito ay upang magkaroon ng sariling bansa ang mga Hudyo na naging biktima ng mga Nazi noong World War II. the primary reason for this division is for the Jews who became Nazi victims in World War II to have their own country. <15> Mula noon ay unti-unti nang kinamkam ng Israel ang mga teritoryo ng Palestine sa pamamagitan ng dahas. since then Israel gradually claimed the territories of Palestine through violence. <16> Sa puntong ito, anong estado nga ba ang talagang dinedepensahan lamang ang sarili? at this point, what state is just really defending itself? <17> Mahalagang isipin na ang mga pambobombang binabanggit ng gobyerno ng Israel ay naganap lamang nitong mga nakaraang buwan. it is important to consider that the bombing mentioned by the government of Israel only happened in the past months. <18> Ilang dekada na ang hidwaan sa pagitan ng dalawang grupo, kung saan hindi mga taga-Israel kundi mga taga-Gaza ang nawawalan ng lupa at nababawasan ng mga sibilyan. the conflict between the two groups is decades old, wherein it is not the Israelis but the Gazans who lose land and lose civilians. <19> Ibang usapan pa ang dami at kalidad ng militar ng dalawang bansa. the quantity and quality of the military of the two countries is another issue. <20> Mahina at kakaunti lamang ang mga puwersa at mga handcrafted rockets lamang ang pinapakawalan ng Hamas. the forces are weak and few and only handcrafted rockets are released by Hamas. <21> Samantala, armado naman ang Israel ng mga tangke, F-16, drones at ilang-daang-libong bihasang sundalo, dagdag pa ang ibinibigay na tulong ng US na umaabot sa $8.3 milyon kada araw. meanwhile, Israel is armed with tanks, F-16s, drones and hundreds of thousands of skilled soldiers, in addition to the assistance given by the US that is worth up to $8.3 million per day. <22> Sa gulong ito sa Gaza, makikita ang walang paumanhing pakikialam ng US. in this conflict in Gaza, the inconsiderate involvement of the US can be seen. <23> Patunay nito ang pagpanig ni US president Barrack Obama sa Israel sa inilunsad nitong opensiba. proof of this is US president Barrack Obama siding with Israel in the offensive it launched. <24> Hindi na kagulat-gulat ang aksyon niyang ito sapagkat ang Israel ang tumatayong outpost ng Estados Unidos sa Middle East. this action of his is not surprising because Israel serves as the outpost of the United States in the Middle East. <25> Malinaw ang mensaheng ipinaparating ng nakaraang eleksyon sa US, kung saan bagama’t magkaiba ang pinanggalingang partido nina Mitt Romney at Barrack Obama, wala halos ipinagkaiba ang mga isinusulong nilang foreign policies. the past election in the US expresses a clear message, wherein despite Mitt Romney and Barrack Obama coming from different parties, the foreign policies they are pushing for are almost the same. <26> Ibig sabihin, kahit sino pang manalo sa naganap na eleksyon, wala pa ring pagbabagong maaasahan ang ibang mga bansa, partikular sa Gaza. meaning, no matter who won the election that took place, no change can be expected in other countries, particularly in Gaza. <27> Para sa kapangyarihan, patuloy pa ring lalala ang digmaan sa Gaza at patuloy pa ring dadami ang mga mamamayan na madadamay sa kaguluhang ito. for power, the war in Gaza will continue to worsen and the people involved in this conflict will continue to increase.
