­silang tinatanggap. more saddening that not all countries are receiving them in welcome. <8> Hanggang ngayon, habang ang maraming nasyunalidad, tulad natin ay abala na sa Kapaskuhan at sa pagsalubong sa papasok na bagong taon, sila na itinataboy ng giyera palayo sa kanilang mga tahanan ay wala pang bagong bubong kung saan nila puwedeng ipagdiwang ang mga okasyong ito. until now, while many nationalities, similar to us, are busy for Christmas and meeting the arrival of the New Year; they, who are driven away by war from their own homes, have no new homes where they can celebrate these occasions. <9> Maaaring ang ilan sa kanila ay walang Pasko dahil sa ibang pananampalataya, pero ang paghihiwalay ng taon ay ipinagdiriwang ng lahat ng tao, anuman ang lahi at ­relihiyon. some of them might not have Christmas because of a different faith, but the parting of the years is celebrated by everyone, whatever be the race and religion. <10> Sadyang napakapalad natin na dito sa ating bansa ay walang ganitong uri ng kaguluhan. we are so fortunate here in our country that we do not have this kind of chaos. <11> Walang suicide bombers, walang giyera na likha ng ISIS at mga Muslim extremist. no suicide bombers, no war created by ISIS and Muslim extremist. <12> Kung mayroon mang bahagi sa Mindanao na tila nababahiran ng ganitong uri ng karahasan, sinisiguro ng ating sandatahang lakas na kontrolado ang sitwasyon. if there is a part in Mindanao which is tainted by this kind of chaos, our armed forces ensure that they are in control of the situation. <13> Sa simpleng pagtingin, hindi tayo bumibilang ng daan-daan sa bawat pagsabog o matinding bakbakan ng mga bala at mortar. at simple glance, we do not count hundreds in each explosion or severe firefight of bullets and mortars. <14> ­Hindi rin binubulabog ng air strike ang ating pagtulog. the airstrikes have not been disrupting our sleep. <15> Sana ay matuto tayong magpasalamat sa napaka­laking biyayang ito. hope that we learn how to be grateful for this big blessing. <16> Pero bilang mga nilikha ng Poong Maykapal na mayroong pagmamahal sa kapwa,­ tungkulin natin na maging instrumento ng kapayapaan, hindi lamang ngayong Pasko at sa sari­ling lipunan kundi sa lahat ng pagkakataon at kaninuman. but as creations of the Almighty God who have compassion for others, it is our duty to become instruments of peace, not only this Christmas and in our own society but at all times and to anyone. <17> Gamit ang social media, maaaring ipalaganap ang kapayapaan at pagmamahalan, hindi lang sa mga kababayan kundi­ maging sa ibang lahi, lalo na sa mga biktima ng ­giyera sa kanilang sariling bansa. using social media, we can spread peace and love, not only to our fellow countrymen but also for other races, especially to the victims of war in their own country. <18> Kung wala man tayong magawa para sa kanila, malaking bagay ang panalangin para sa kanilang kaligtasan at sa kapayapaan ng kanilang bayan. if we cannot do anything for them, a prayer is a big thing for their safety and for peace in their country.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_95230579 <1> Fraternity at sorority, bawal sa public schools fraternity and sorority, prohibited in public schools <2> Ni Mer Layson by Mer Layson <3> MANILA, Philippines - Mahigpit na ipinagbabawal ng Department of Education (DepEd) ang pagbubuo ng mga fraternity at sorority sa mga public elementary at high schools sa bansa. Manila, Philippines - the Department of Education (DepEd) strictly prohibits the creation of fraternities and sororities in public elementary and high schools in the country. <4> Ang pahayag ay ginawa ni Education Undersecretary Tonisito Umali kasunod nang pagkamatay sa hazing ni Guillo Cesar Servando na 2nd year Hotel and Restaurant Management (HRM) student ng De La Salle-College of St. Benilde nitong Sabado ng gabi. the statement was made by Education undersecretary Tonisito Umali after the death from hazing of Guillo Cesar Servando who is a 2nd year Hotel and Restaurant Management (HRM) student of De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde on Saturday evening. <5> Ayon kay Umali, ang kautusan ay ginawa upang proteksyunan ang mga mag-aaral mula sa mga karahasan na dulot ng mga naturang samahan. according to Umali, the order was made to protect the students from violence caused by the said organizations. <6> Hanggang sa ngayon aniya ay patuloy ang mahigpit na tagubilin ng DepEd sa lahat ng kanilang regional officers at high school heads na masusing i-monitor ang mga binubuong grupo sa loob ng kanilang mga nasasakupang paaralan. according to him up to now the DepEd strictly orders all their regional officers and high school heads to carefully monitor the groups being set up in their school jurisdictions. <7> Paglilinaw pa ni Umali, tanging mga club lamang na may kinalaman sa edukasyon tulad ng Art Club, Math Club at Science Club at mga kagaya nito ang pinapayagan ng DepEd na mamayagpag sa mga pampublikong paaralan sa bansa. Umali clarifies, only clubs related to education like the art club, math club and science club and the likes are allowed by the DepEd to run in public schools in the country.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_50805427 <1> Pastor Ariel Hernandez…Nagpapatunay na Posibleng Mabago ang Nasirang Buhay Pastor Ariel Hernandez proves that it is possible to change a ruined life. <2> Posted by penpowersong posted by penpowersong <3> PASTOR ARIEL HERNANDEZ…NAGPAPATUNAY Pastor Ariel Hernandez... proof <4> NA POSIBLENG MABAGO ANG NASIRANG BUHAY that it is possible to change a ruined life. <5> Ni Apolinario Villalobos by Apolinario Villalobos <6> Nang magbukas ang Perpetual Village 5 sa Bacoor City (Cavite) ay isa ako sa mga naunang tumira, at naging unang Presidente rin ng Homeowners Association. when Perpetual Village 5 in Bacoor City (Cavite) opened, I was one of the first occupants, and also became the first president of the Homeowners Association. <7> Hirap kami noon dahil sa pagmamadali naming lumipat agad ay hindi na namin hinintay na magkaroon muna ng street lights at maayos ang mga kalsada. we had a hard time then. because of our haste to move immediately, we did not wait for it to have street lights and proper roads anymore. <8> Todo tiis ang ginawa namin sa pagsuong sa trapik ng Zapote, Las Piἧas sa pagpasok sa trabaho dahil wala pang Coastal Road noon. what we did was to be extremely patient in dealing with the traffic in Zapote, Las Piñas when going to work because there was no Coastal Road back then. <9> Makalipas ang isang taon ay may lumipat sa subdivision na mag-asawang galing sa Makati, sina Ariel at Precy Hernandez at anak nilang musmos pang si Jaymie. after one year, a couple from Makati, Ariel and Precy Hernandez and their little child, Jaymie, transferred to the subdivision. <10> Nang pasyalan ko sila upang i-welcome sa lugar namin ay nalaman kong basketbolista pala si Ariel kaya agad-agad ay pinakiusapan kong mgaging Sports and Youth Officer ng homeowners association. when I visited to welcome them to our place, I found out that Ariel was a basketball player so I immediately asked him to be the sports and youth officer of the homeowners association. <11> Hindi naman ako napahiya dahil malugod siyang pumayag kahit may trabaho siya sa bangko mula Lunes hanggang Biyernes at kung minsan ay hanggang Sabado. I was not shamed because he graciously permitted even if he has a job in the bank from Monday to Friday and sometimes until Saturday. <12> Hindi ako nabigo sa pagtalaga sa kanya dahil makaraan lang ang ilang linggo ay naging aktibo na agad ang mga kabataan sa lugar namin. I was not disappointed in appointing him because just after a few weeks, the youth in our place immediately became active. <13> Ang pagkilala sa kanya bilang coach ng basketball ay nakarating hanggang sa “bukid” at mga kalapit-subdivision na sakop din ng Barangay namin. his recognition as a basketball coach reached the "farm" and nearby subdivisions that are also covered by our barangay. <14> Mula noon, basta mabanggit ang basketball, si Ariel agad ang sasagi sa isip ng mga nakarinig. since then, when basketball is mentioned, it is Ariel who immediately crosses the minds of those who hear it. <15> Noon pa lang ay nakitaan ko na siya ng compassionate attitude – madaling dumukot ng pera para sa mga nangangailangan kahit walang matira sa bulsa. even then I already saw a compassionate attitude in him - easily handing out money for those in need even if nothing remains in his pocket. <16> Nai-intimidate lang ang ibang hindi siya gaanong kilala dahil noong kabataan niya at nasa amin ay para siyang “pader”, malaki kasi ang katawan,may katangkaran, at dumadagundong pa ang boses. others who do not know him that well are just intimidated, because in his youth and while he was with us, he seemed like a "wall", because he had a large body, was somewhat tall, and had a thundering voice. <17> Si Ariel din ang humimok sa mga homeowners na mag-jogging mula sa amin hanggang Imus Cathedral/Plaza tuwing Linggo ng madaling araw. it was also Ariel who encouraged the homeowners to go jogging from our place to Imus Cathedral/Plaza every Sunday at dawn. <18> Walang magawa ang tamad gumising dahil nagtitiyaga siyang manggising sa mga homeowners sa madaling araw, at sa laki ng boses niya ay talagang mapapagising ang tatawagin niya. those who are lazy to get up can't do anything because he works hard to rouse the homeowners at dawn, and with his big voice, anyone he calls will really wake up. <19> Isa rin siya sa nagpursige na mabuo ang basketball court ng subdivision namin. he was also one of those who worked hard to build the basketball court in our subdivision. <20> Bumigay ang katatagan niya dahil sa sobrang pakisama sa mga barkada na humantong sa madalas niyang pakikipag-inumang naging sanhi naman ng palaging pag-away nilang mag-asawa. his temperance gave in because of trying too much to get along with friends that led to his frequent drinking which became the reason for the couple's recurring fights. <21> Hindi sila iba sa akin, kaya madalas ko siyang payuhan subalit dahil bata pa siya noon, madalas din siyang makalimot sa mga pinapayo ko. they are like family to me, so I often gave him advice but because he was still young then, he also often forgets my pieces of advice. <22> Sa kabila ng lahat, hindi pa rin nagkulang si Ariel sa pagtaguyod ng nasimulan niyang adhikain na maipamahagi sa mga kabataan ang kaalaman niya sa basketball. in spite of everything, Ariel did not fail to carry on with the goal that he started, which is to impart his knowledge in basketball to the youth. <23> Pati ang mga magulang ng mga kabataan ay nahimok din niyang maglaro kung may espesyal na okasyon o di kaya ay bilang pampalipas ng oras. he was also able to encourage the parents of the youth to play when there is a special occasion or as a pastime. <24> Makaraan ang ilang taon, lumipat sila sa Camella Homes ng Bayang Luma 3, sa Imus City. after a few years, they moved to Camella Homes at Bayang Luma 3, in Imus City. <25> Malaking bagay ang paglipat nila dahil maski papaano ay nailayo siya ni Precy sa mga barkadang mahilig uminom. their move was a huge deal because, in a way, Precy was able to distance him from friends who like to drink. <26> Subalit hindi rin maiwasang siya ay pasyalan ng mga ito, at nadagdag pa ang mga bago kaya naudlot ang pagtahak sana niya sa “Bagong Landas”. however, it was inevitable that he will be visited by them, and with newbies too, which was why his supposed voyage on the "new path" was postponed. <27> Ganoon pa man ay itinuloy pa rin ni Ariel ang pakikibahagi ng kaalaman sa basketbol sa mga kabataan ng Barangay Lumang Bayan 3 na nasimulan niya noong 2006. nevertheless, Ariel still continued sharing his knowledge in basketball with the youth of Barangay Lumang Bayan 3, which he started in 2006. <28> (Ang tungkol sa adbokasiya sa larangan ng basketbol ay iba-blog ko nang hiwalay dahil makulay din ang sinuong niyang mga pagsubok upang tuluyang magtagumpay at lalo pang makilala.) (I will blog separately about the advocacy on the field of basketball because the challenges that he faced in order to fully succeed and be more famous were also colorful). <29> Humantong ang hindi pagkakaunawaan ng mag-asawa sa tampuhan hanggang pansamantalang iwanan si Ariel ng kanyang asawa upang makitira sa anak nilang si Jaymie na may pamilya na. the misunderstanding between the couple led to hurt feelings, until his wife temporarily left Ariel to live with their child, Jaymie, who already had a family. <30> Ang tikisan ay inabot ng halos isang taon, Subalit naging tulay ang kanyang panganay na kapatid at bayaw na sina Nora at Jett Crisostomo upang mapahinuhod si Precy na bumalik sa bahay nila. the intentional separation lasted for almost a year, but his eldest sibling and brother-in-law, named Nora and Jett Crisostomo, served as a bridge in convincing Precy to return to their home. <31> Sa pagkakataong ito ay naging aktibo sila sa spiritual sharing kaya nag-host na rin sila ng Bible Study sa kanilang garahe. this time, they became active in spiritual sharing so they also hosted a bible study in their garage. <32> Dahil nakitaan si Ariel ng pagpupunyaging magbago, pinag-aral siya upang maging pastor ng WWCF-Imus sa pamumuno ni Pastor Eli Famorcan. because the desire to change was seen in Ariel, he was made to study to become a pastor of WWCF-Imus with the leadership of Pastor Eli Famorcan. <33> Kabilang si Pastor Ariel ngayon sa mga ministro ng Word for the World Christian Fellowship-Worldwide at nakatalaga sa Noveleta. Pastor Ariel is now among the ministers of the Word for the World Christian Fellowship-Worldwide and is assigned in Noveleta. <34> Sa grupo ng mga pastor, siya ang “pinakamatanda” pagdating sa edad, subalit “pinakabata” pagdating sa karanasan dahil nagsimula siya sa pagmi-ministro noon lang 2010. in the group of pastors, he was the "eldest" when it comes to age, but the "youngest" when it comes to experience because he started in the ministry only in 2010. <35> Hindi madali ang maitalagang ministro ng simbahang bagong “tanim” sa isang komunidad dahil kailangan ang ibayong pagpapakilala upang makaakit ng mga miyembro. it is not easy to be appointed as a minister of a church that is newly "planted" in a community because twice the effort in introduction is needed in order to attract members. <36> Masuwerte ang mga pastor na sinusundan ng mga dating kapanalig dahil nakakatulong sila sa pagpapalago ng sampalataya. pastors who are being followed by old allies are lucky because they are able to help in spreading the faith. <37> Kasama rin ang responsibilidad sa pagkalap ng pondo dahil ang inaasahan lang ay mga love offerings o tithes ng mga kapanalig. also included is the responsibility of gathering funds because they rely only on love offerings or tithes from followers. <38> Ganoon pa man ay tiniis ni Pastor Ariel ang lahat ng pagsubok nang siya ay palipat-lipat na italaga sa Imus, General Trias, at sa kasalakuyan ay sa Noveleta. nevertheless, Pastor Ariel endured all the challenges when he was fleetingly assigned in Imus, General Trias, and currently in Noveleta. <39> Buong pagpapakumbaba niyang inaamin na mahina siya sa Ingles, kaya hangga’t maaari ay Tagalog ang ginagamit niya. he humbly admitted that he was weak in English, so as much as possible, it is Tagalog that he uses. <40> Epektibo at maganda ang ginagawa niyang paggamit ng Tagalog at binabatay naman niya ang mga pinamamahagi niya sa mga tunay na pangyayari sa paligid at buhay ng tao. his use of Tagalog was effective and good, and he bases what he shares from real events in the environment and life of people. <41> Ang isang payak na mensahe mula sa Bibliya, halimbawa, ay nagagawa niyang palawakin upang mai-apply sa buhay ng mga nakikinig sa kanya sa pamamagitan ng pagbigay ng mga halibawang nakikita sa paligid. for instance, he can manage to expound a simple message from the Bible, so it can be applied to the lives of those who are listening to him by giving examples that can be seen around. <42> Ang “preaching style” niya ay hindi siguro niya sinasadyang maging hawig sa ginagamit ng mga sikat na “Born Again Christian” preachers na ang mga pagtitipon ay dinadagsa ng libu-libong tagasunod. he may have unintentionally patterned his "preaching style" to be similar to the ones used by "Born Again Christian" preachers, whose gatherings are mobbed by thousands of followers. <43> Hindi siya ang tipo ng preacher na halos lahat ng sinasabi ay quoted mula sa Bibliya na sa tingin ko ay “complicated” dahil magdudulot ng kalituhan sa mga nakikinig. he is not the type of preacher whose speeches are mostly quoted from the Bible, which I think is "complicated" because it will cause confusion to the listeners. <44> Paano halimbawang maitanim sa isip ng nakikinig ang tungkol sa hypocrisy o pagkukunwari kung puro galing sa Bibliya ang sasabihin, samantalang marami naman ang puwedeng banggitin na mga pangyayari sa paligid na siyang magbubukas ng kanilang isipan? how, for example, can hypocrisy or hypocrisy be ingrained in the mind of the listener if what is said are all from the Bible, when there are many things that can be mentioned from events in our surroundings which can open their minds? <45> Samantala, ang nangyari kay Pastor Ariel ay pagpapatunay na lahat ng tao na may hangaring magbago ay may pagkakataong matamo ito basta siya ay magsisikap. whereas, what happened to Pastor Ariel proves that all persons who have the aspiration to change have a chance to achieve this as long as he works hard. <46> Nakakabilib din ang pag-iwas ng kanyang asawa dahil sa hindi nila pagkakaunawaan noon kaya hindi humantong sa tuluyan nilang paghihiwalay. also amazing is the avoidance of his wife because of their misunderstanding before, which was why it did not lead to their absolute separation. <47> Maidadagdag dito ang pagpursige ng mga kaibigan nilang namagitan kaya ang lamat ng pagsasama nilang mag-asawa ay tuluyang natapalan. the perseverance of their friends who mediated can also be added to this, which was why the damage in their relationship as a couple was completely resolved. <48> Upang lalo pang tumibay ang love na naging stronger the second time around, nagba-bonding ang buong pamilya sa bahay ni Jaymie, kasama ang asawang si Aris (Gatdula), at dalawang anak na sina Lance Quint at Luke James. to strengthen the love that became stronger the second time around, the whole family is bonding in the home of Jaymie, together with her husband, Aris (Gatdula), and two children, Lance Quint at Luke James. <49> Nag-iisang anak si Jaymie na hindi natuloy sa pagka-abogada tulad sana ng kanyang lolo na ama ni Ariel, subalit mapalad namang nakapagtrabaho sa Regional Trial court sa Las Piἧas. Jaymie is an only child who was not able to pursue being a lawyer like her grandfather, the father of Ariel, but was luckily able to work at the Regional Trial Court in Las Piñas. <50> Si Precy naman ay sa Regional Trial Court ng Imus nagtatrabaho. Precy, meanwhile, works at the Regional Trial Court in Imus. <51> Mapalad si Pastor Ariel dahil kabilang sa mga naniniwala sa kanya ay ang kasalukuyang mayor ng Imus City na si Emmanuel Maliksi na kumuha sa kanya bilang Sports Consultant simula pa noong 2008, at si Joe Lipa, Consultant ng Mahindra-Kia, na nakakatulong upang makakalap siya ng sports scholarship para sa mga karapat-dapat na naging bunga ng Basketball Clinic na ginagawa ng King David Basketball Camp. Pastor Ariel is lucky because those who believe him include the current mayor of Imus City, Emmanuel Maliksi, who appointed him as a sports consultant since 2008, and Joe Lipa, consultant of Mahindra-Kia, who is able to help him obtain a sports scholarship for deserving graduates of the basketball clinic held by the King David Basketball Camp. <52> Maraming napariwarang kabataan ang napabago ng Basketball Clinic nina Pastor Ariel. many youth who have gone astray were changed by the basketball clinic of Pastor Ariel. <53> Ang iba ay lalong nagkaroon ng tiwala sa sarili kaya nakatapos ng pag-aaral, o naging manager sa kumpanyang pinasukan at ang iba ay nakapagtrabaho sa ibang bansa. some had more confidence in themselves so they were able to finish their studies, or became a manager in the company they worked in, and others were able to work abroad. <54> Tinutugaygayan si Pastor Ariel ng alituntunin niya sa buhay tungkol sa pagkakaisa ng mga tao na maaaring mangyari kung iiral ang unawaan sa isa’t isa, lalo na ng iba’t ibang mga pananampalataya o relihiyon. Pastor Ariel preaches about his principles in life about unity among people which could happen if understanding one another will prevail, especially among those with different beliefs and religions. <55> Nanliit lang ako nang sabihin niya sa akin na ang alituntuning yan ay lalo pang pinatibay ng mga nakita niyang mga ginawa ko at pakiharap sa iba’t ibang tao, sino man o anuman ang kanilang paniniwala, noong sa subdivision pa namin sila nakatira. I just felt inferior when he told me that principle was strengthened even more by the things he had seen me doing and how I dealt with different people, whoever they were or whatever their belief was, when they were still living in our subdivision. <56> Sa kababasa din daw niya ng mga isinusulat ko ay lalo pang tumibay ang paniniwala niya tungkol sa “universal love” na dapat ay walang hangganan. he said that in reading my writings, his belief about "universal love", which should be forever, was strengthened even more. <57> Tumaba naman ang puso ko nang banggitin niyang ipinagmamalaki niya ako sa mga kapwa niya pastor at mga kaibigan…. my heart was filled with joy when he mentioned that he boasts about me to his co-pastors and friends. <58> subalit higit sa lahat ay masaya ako dahil may nagpapakalat pala ng adbokasiyang naging timon ko sa buhay…. but most of all, I was happy because there is apparently someone who is spreading the advocacy that became my guide in life. <59> at isang new Christian pastor pa! and a new Christian pastor at that!
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_29233474 <1> World War II World War II <2> World War II (Mk. 3: 22-30) World War II (Mark 3:22-30) <3> Ikalawang Digmaang Pandaigdig. second world war <4> Nakita ng mga tao ang bunga ng pag-aaway-away ng mga bansa. people saw the consequence of fighting among nations. <5> Naranasan ng mga tao ang hirap ng pagkakawatak-watak at hindi pagkakaintindihan. the people experienced the difficulty of being divided and misunderstanding. <6> Marami ang namatay. many died. <7> Maraming mga gusali ang nawasak. many buildings were destroyed. <8> Maraming mga pangarap ang nawalan ng katuparan. many dreams did not come true. <9> Dahil sa karanasang ito nag-usap ang maraming lider ng mga bansa at pinag-usapan kung papaanong hindi na mauulit ang malaking hidwaan na ito. because of this experience, many leaders of the countries talked and discussed on how this huge conflict will not be repeated again. <10> Dito nabuo ang United Nations noong October 24, 1945 na magbibigay ng mapayapang kaayusan sa mga pagkakataon na hindi nagkakaunawaan ang mga bansa. this was when the United Nations was formed on October 24, 1945 that will give a peaceful arrangement in instances where nations are in conflict. <11> Ito rin ang tutulong sa mga bansa na nakakaranas ng kalamidad at kahirapan. this will also help those countries experiencing calamity and poverty. <12> Ito ang bunga ng paghahanap ng mga bansa ng pagkakaisa para sa mga tao. this is the result of nations seeking for unity for the people. <13> Ito rin ang nais ni Hesus para sa mga tao…na ang lahat ay maging isa katulad ng siya at ang Ama ay iisa. this is also what Jesus wants for the people... that all will be one just like he and the Father are one. <14> Inakusahan si Hesus na ang kaniyang ginagawang pagpapagaling ay buhat sa kasamaan. Jesus was accused that the healing he does comes from evil. <15> Pero sinabi ni Hesus na hindi pwedeng mangyari ito sapagkat kapag kinalaban ng demonyo ang demonyo din sila ay magkakawatak at sila ay mawawasak. but Jesus said that this is not possible because if a demon will go against a demon too, they will be divided and they will be destroyed. <16> Nagdala si Hesus ng kagalingan dahil ito ang humihilom sa sugat na dala ng kasalanan. Jesus brought healing because this is what cures wounds caused by sins. <17> Sa tahanan, kapag ang mga myembro ng pamilya ay nag-aaway at nagbabanggaan, ang pamilya ay hindi nagdudulot ng kasiyahan ay bagkus nagdadala sa kanila na lalong lumayo sa isa’t-isa. in the home, when members of the family are fighting and clashing, the family does not cause happiness and instead leads them to become more distant to each other. <18> Sa basana, kung ang mga tao lalo naang mga namumuno ay walang pagkakaisa, wala ring paglago ang bansa at sa halip ay hinahatak ang bawat isa pababa. in a country where the people especially the leaders are not united, the nation also does not grow instead it pulls each one down. <19> Sa Simbahan ay gayun din. it is likewise with the church. <20> Kung ang mga myembro ng Simbahan ay nag-iinggitan, nagtsitsismisan at hindi pinagkakatiwalaan ang kakayahan ng bawat isa, hindi rin magiging maganda ang pagsulong nito. if the members of the Church are jealous of each other, gossip, and do not trust the ability of each one, its growth will also be not good. <21> Kung tayo-tayo ay may kanya-kanyang agenda na pansarili lamang, ang Simbahan ay tiyak na mapupunta sa kawalan. if all of us have our own selfish agenda, the Church will surely go nowhere. <22> Kung tayo-tayo ay nagbabangayan siguradong sa kangkungan ang ating hantungan. if we are always fighting surely our destination will be the swamps. <23> Let us unite under the one banner of Love! let us unite under the one banner of love!
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_93923181 <1> SUPORTAHAN DAPAT ANG MGA GURO ISANG press release mula sa Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) ang aking natanggap na kung saan ay hinihikayat ng pamunuan ng ahensya ang mga umuuwing overseas Filipino worker (OFW) na mga licensed teacher na maging public school teacher sa bansa. teachers should be supported: I received a press release from the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) where head of the agency is encouraging returning overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) who are licensed teachers to teach in the country's public schools. <2> Sinabi pa sa press release na sa ilalim ng programang “Sa Pinas, Ikaw ang Ma’am/Sir (SPIMS),” ang mga OFW na nakapasa sa Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET) ay maaaring mag-apply para makapagturo sa ating mga pampublikong paaralan. it was stated in the press release that under the program "in the Philippines, you are the ma'am/sir (SPIMS)", overseas Filipino workers who passed the licensure examination for teachers (LET) are allowed to apply to be able to teach in our public schools. <3> Ang SPIMS ay ang reintegration program para sa mga OFW na umuwi nitong nakaraang tatlong taon at nagkaroon ng karanasan sa pagtuturo sa nakalipas na limang taon. the SPIMS is the reintegration program for overseas Filipino workers who returned this for the past three years and had experience in teaching for the past five years. <4> Habang ang mga nakapagturo nang lagpas sa limang taon o mga wala pang karanasan ay kailangang muling dumaan sa isang online refresher course. while those who taught for more than five years ago or those who don't have experience are required to undergo an online refresher course. <5> Ayon kay Labor Sec. Silvestre H. Bello III, ang programa ay naglalayong bigyan ng disente at regular na trabaho ang mga dati at umuwing OFW at maging mga public school teacher. according to labor secretary Silvestre H. Bello III, the program aims to give decent and regular jobs to past overseas Filipino workers who came home to become public school teachers. <6> Sinabi rin ng kalihim na ang programa ay tutulong na makabawas sa kakulangan sa mga guro sa mga paaralan sa bansa, lalo na ang mga nasa probinsya at malalayong lugar. the secretary also said that the program would help mitigate the lack of teachers in schools around the country, especially in provinces and remote places. <7> Subalit nakatatawa at pilipit ang PR na ito sapagkat halatang ang tanging layunin lang ay para makakuha ng publisidad at wala nang interes na isakatuparan ang nilalaman ng balita. however, the press release is laughable and twisted since it is obvious that its only objective is to get publicity and there is no interest in putting the contents of the news in action. <8> Napansin natin ito sapagkat walang ibang pigurang binabanggit halimbawa kung magkano ang magiging suweldo ng mga guro sakaling dito sila magtrabaho. we noticed this since there were no other figures mentioned, for example, there was no mention on how much the salary of the teachers would be if ever they will teach here. <9> Alam naman natin na milya-milya ang layo ng sweldong tinatanggap ng mga gurong nagtuturo sa ibang bansa, lalo na iyong nasa mayayamang bansa tulad sa Estados Unidos at Europa, kumpara sa kayang ibigay ng ating pamahalaan. we know that there is a stark difference in the salary of teachers teaching in other countries, most especially those who are in rich countries like the United States and Europe, compared to the salary that the government is capable of giving. <10> Mas magiging kapani-paniwala sana ang PR ng DOLE kung inilagay na nila kung magkano ang magiging sweldo ng mga guro at nakalatag na rin ang comparison sa natatanggap ng mga guro sa ibang mga bansa. the press release by DOLE would be more believable if they already included the potential salary of the teachers and a comparison against what they are receiving in other counties was provided. <11> Gusto ko lang linawin na hindi ako tutol sa programa dahil kung kaya ng gobyerno na ibigay ang disenteng sweldo sa ating mga guro ay wala nang dahilan pa para umalis sila at mawalay sa kanilang pamilya. I would just like to clear that I am not against the program because if the government will be able to provide a decent salary to our teachers, they would have no reason to leave and be apart from their families. <12> Tiyak naman kasi na ang mabibigyang benepisyo rito ay ang pamilyang Filipino pero dapat ibigay ng gobyerno ang nararapat at tamang sweldo. because its already certain that Filipino families would be the beneficiaries but the government needs to provide the appropriate and right salary. <13> OPEN LINE/BOBBY RICOHERMOSO open line/Bobby Ricohermoso
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_78389504 <1> Hebreo Series 31: Huwag Kang Bibitaw! By Zayith Hebron November 12, 2016 “At ano pa ang dapat kong sabihin? Sapagkat kukulangin ako ng panahon kung isasalaysay ko pa ang tungkol kina Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jefta, David, Samuel, at sa mga propeta; na ang mga ito, sa pamamagitan ng pananampalataya’y lumupig ng mga kaharian, naglapat ng katarungan, nagtamo ng mga pangako, nagpatikom sa mga bibig ng mga leon, pumatay ng bisa ng apoy, tumakas sa mga talim ng tabak, lumakas mula sa kahinaan, naging makapangyarihan sa digmaan, nagpaurong ng mga hukbong dayuhan.” Hebrew Series 31: do not let go! by Zayith Hebron November 12, 2016 "what else should I say? because there would not be enough time if I would narrate about Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jefta, David, Samuel and the prophets; who through their faith, they conquered kingdoms, administered justice, obtained promises, shut the mouth of lions, extinguished the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, gained strength from weakness, become mighty in battle, make foreign armies retreat." <2> (Hebreo 11:33)Nagpapatuloy po tayo sa ating pagsisiyasat sa mensahe ng Liham sa mga Hebreo na matatagpuan sa Bagong Tipan ng Banal na Bibliya. Nasabi na nating sa liham na ito ay ipinaliwanag ng manu­nulat ang pagka-superyor ng Anak ng Diyos na si Jesus—superyor sa lahat, kabilang na ang mga anghel. (Hebrews 11:33) we continue with our analysis about the message of the Letters to the Hebrews which can be found in the New Testament of the Holy Bible. we already said in this letters the writer explained the superiority of the son of God who is Jesus - superior above all, including the angels. <3> Tinapos na Niya ang pangangailangan para sa mga animal sacrifices ng Lumang Tipan. he ended the need for animal sacrifices of the Old Testament. <4> Si Jesus na mismo ang Tanging Alay para sa mga pagkakasala ng sanlibutan. Kinukumbinsi ng manunulat ang kanyang mga orihinal na mambabasa. Jesus himself is the only offering for the sins of the world. the writer is convincing his original readers. <5> Huwag na silang magbalik sa Judaismo. do not go back to Judaism. <6> Isang Bagong Tipan sa pagitan ng ­Diyos at ng tao ang umiiral na, at ito’y dahil tinapos ni Jesus ang Kanyang misyon doon sa Krus ng Kalbaryo. a new testament between God and man already exists, and this is because Jesus ended His mission on the Cross of Calvary. <7> At kung nahihintakutan sila sa mga maaaring mangyari sa kanila dahil dala nila ang pangalan ni Jesus bilang mga ­Kristiyanong Hebreo, pinalalakas ng manunulat ang kanilang mga loob. and if they are afraid of what might happen to them because they carry the name of Jesus as Hebrew Christians, the writer strengthens their courage. <8> Alalahanin sana nila ang tapat na pananampa­lataya ni Abraham. they should remember the faithfulness of Abraham. <9> Naging handa siyang ialay ang kanyang anak na si Isaac sa Diyos; siya’y pinagpalang lubos. he was ready to offer his son Issac to God; he was greatly blessed. <10> Alalahanin din nila si Moises; tapat na tagapagligtas ng mga naunang ­Israelita mula sa pagkakaalipin sa mga Ehipcio. they should also remember Moses; faithful deliverer of the early Israelites from the slavery to the Egyptians. <11> Gayundin, sinunod niyang maigi ang mga bilin sa kanya ng Panginoon, kaya’t ­nakita niyang kumilos ang Diyos na si Yahweh sa isang makapangyarihang paraan bilang banal na Protektor na nanganga­laga sa bayang Israel. likewise, he strictly obeyed the Lord's instruction to him, so he saw God who is Yahweh act in a powerful way as a Holy Protector who cared for the people of Israel. <12> At ngayon, dito sa kabanata 11 ng kanyang akda, ang ­manunulat sa mga Hebreo ay nagsasabing huwag nilang ­isiping sila’y nag-iisa sa kanilang pinagdaraanan. and now, here in chapter 11 of his writings, the writer to the Hebrews say they should not think they are alone in their journey. <13> Napaka­raming mga nauna sa kanila nang nagpakita ng kakaya­hang maging tapat sa pananampalataya, sa pamamagitan ng ­kapangyarihan ng Banal na Espiritu! there were many ahead of them who showed how to be steadfast to their faith through the power of the Holy Spirit. <14> Nagbanggit siya ng mga pangalan ng mga kilala nilang mga banal sa Lumang Tipan: sina Rahab, Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jefta, David, Samuel. he cited the names of the saints they know from the Old Testament: Rahab, Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jefta, David, Samuel. <15> Bawat isa’y may natatanging istorya ng kagitingan at tagumpay na ipinamalas sa gitna ng mahirap na sitwasyon. each one has a unique story of valor and victory shown in the midst of a difficult situation. <16> Nagbanggit din ang manunulat ng mga ehemplo ng mga tapat na mananampalataya, na kahit mukhang mga talunan sila sa kanilang buhay sa mundo ay itinuturing ng Diyos na pinagpala dahil tatanggapin nila sa langit ang kanilang mga pinananampalatayang pangako. the writer also mentioned examples of faithful believers who seemed to be defeated in their lives on earth but were considered by God to blessed ones because they will receive in heaven the promises of their faith. <17> “Ang iba’y nagtiis ng pagkalibak at paghagupit at maging ng mga tani­kala at pagkabilanggo. "others endured mockery and scourging and even chains and imprisonment." <18> Sila’y pinagbabato hanggang mamatay, nilagari, pinagpapatay sa tabak, sila’y naglibot na may suot na balat ng mga tupa at kambing, mga naghihirap, pinag-uusig, inaapi (na sa mga iyon ay hindi karapat- dapat ang san­libutan)…“At ang lahat ng mga ito, bagaman pinuri dahil sa kanilang pananam­palataya, ay hindi nila tinanggap ang ipina­ngako, yamang naghanda ang Diyos ng lalong mabuting bagay para sa atin…” (Hebreo 11:36-38a, 39-40)Kapatid sa Panginoon, ang nangingi­babaw na mga mensahe: Tapat ang Diyos, Siya’y maaasahan. Ang Kanyang mga pangako ay tiyak. Kung minsan, pakiramdam mo’y nag-iisa ka sa iyong pananampalataya, lakasan mo ang iyong kalooban. they were stoned to death, sawed, slaughtered with the sword, they wandered wearing sheepskins and goatskins, suffering, persecuted and oppressed (of which the world is not worthy)... "and all of these, though they were praised because of their faith, did not receive what was promised, because God prepared something better for us..." (Hebrews 11:36-38a, 39-40). brothers in Christ, the clear messages are: God is faithful, he is dependable. his promises are certain. sometimes you feel that you are alone in what you believe in, have courage. <19> Malalampasan mo ang mga pagsubok sa tulong ng Panginoong Jesus. you can overcome trials with the help of the Lord Jesus. <20> Tumingin ka lamang sa talaan ng mga banal sa Hebreo 11 at Hebreo 12. Maaalala mong hindi ka nag-iisa, at ang Diyos na nag-ingat sa kanilang pananampalataya ay Siyang Diyos mo rin. just look at the list of saints in Hebrews 11 and Hebrews 12. you will remember you are not alone and the God who kept their faith is your God, too. <21> Huwag kang bibitaw. Papalapit na ang pagbabalik ni Jesus! do not let go. Jesus' second coming is near. <22> Ito’y maligaya at matagum­pay na araw para sa lahat Niyang mga anak, subalit araw na malagim para sa mga patuloy na tumalikod sa Kanya at sa Kanyang paghahari. it is a joyful and victorious day for all His children, but a day of horror for those who continue to renounce Him and His reign. <23> Habang may panahon pa, siyasatin natin ang ating mga puso. while there is time, let us search our hearts. <24> Hingin natin ang kapang­yarihan ng Banal na ­Espiritu upang makapagsisi sa kasalanan at makalakad sa buhay nang tapat kay Jesus. let us ask for the power of the Holy Spirit to repent from our sins and to live our lives faithful to Jesus. <25> Dalangin ko ang kaligtasan nating lahat sa dakilang araw na iyon. I pray for all our salvation on that great day. <26> Shalom and God bless! shalom and God bless!
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_61857726 <1> PNOY HUWARANG EHEMPLO SA PAGKAKAROON NG BARIL PNoy is a great example of gun possession <2> BAGAMAN siya ang pinakamataas na opisyal ng bansa, hindi nagdalawang isip si Pangulong Benigno Aquino III na maghain ng ‘gun ban exemption’ sa Commission on Elections (Comelec) noong Huwebes upang patuloy niyang madala ang kanyang personal na baril. although he is the highest official in the country, president Aquino did not hesitate in issuing a 'gun ban exemption' to the Commission on Elections (Comelec) last Thursday to continue carrying his personal gun. <3> Subalit nilinaw ng ahensiya na bilang pinakamataas na puno ng bansa ay hindi kailangan ng pangulo, commander-in-chief ng Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP), sapagkat ang gun ban ay hindi para supilin ang military sa kanilang operasyon. however, the agency clarified that as the highest leader of the country it is not necessary for the president, commander-in-chief of Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP), because the gun ban is not there to suppress the operation of the military. <4> Dahil isang gun enthusiast, nais ni Pangulong Noynoy na dala niya madalas ang kanyang personal na baril na gamit niya sa kanyang practical shooting. since a gun enthusiast, president Noynoy wanted to always carry his personal gun that he uses for his practical shooting. <5> Isa lang ang ibig sabihin ng aksyon ng pangulo – isa siyang responsableng nagmamay-ari ng baril. there is only one meaning behind the actions of the president - he is one responsible gun owner. <6> Hindi sinasamantala ni Pangulong Aquino ang kanyang posisyon upang kontrahin ang batas. president Aquino did not take advantage of his position to violate the law. <7> Puwedeng-puwede namang hindi siya kumuha ng exemption para sa gun ban kasama ang mga miyembro ng Presidential Security Group(PSG) si Pangulong PNoy subalit ipinakita niya sa mga mamamayan ang pagiging pantay-pantay at hindi dapat gamitin ang palakasan. it is definitely possible for him to not get an exemption for the gun ban together with the members of the Presidential Security Group (PSG) however president PNoy showed to the nation equality and to not use biases. <8> Para kay Pangulong Aquino, hindi dapat matuloy ang total gun ban sapagkat magiging daan ito ng lalo pang kaguluhan sa bansa sapagkat ang mga responsableng nag-mamay-ari ng mga baril ay mapipigilan na sa pagdadala ng kanilang mga gamit at tanging ang masasamang loob na lang ang may karapatang magdala ng baril sapagkat wala namang inaalala ang mga ito kapag nahuli sa kaso nang pagdadala ng baril na walang sapat na papeles. for president Aquino, the total gun ban should not push through because this could make way to worse chaos in the country since responsible gun owners would be restrained from carrying their things and only bad elements are the ones left carrying guns because they worry about nothing if they ever got caught for carrying firearms without enough documents. <9> Katwiran ng mga masasamang loob na ito, mahuli man sila, makakapagpiyansa naman. bad elements logic would be, if ever they get caught, they can always bail themselves out. <10> Basta huwag lang silang mabuko na may mga iniingatang sindikato. as long as they will not be revealed to be protecting syndicates.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_11719068 <1> Saturday, February 02, 2013 Saturday, February 02, 2013 <2> Maglingkod Tayo let us serve <3> Makapagbibigay ka kahit na walang pagmamahal, subalit hindi mo magagawang magmahal nang wala kang ibinibigay. you are able to give even without love, but you are not able to love without giving. <4> PAGDAMAY sympathy <5> Nangyari ito noong matapos manalanta ang bagyong Sendong. this happened after the destruction of typhoon Sendong. <6> Kumakatok sa bawa’t pinto ng magagarang bahay sa isang malaking subdibisyon ang mga madre ng isang simbahan, upang manghingi ng anumang tulong para sa mga kapuspalad na sinalanta ng bagyo. nuns of one church knocked on each door of the fancy houses in a large subdivision, to ask for any help for the less fortunate affected by the the typhoon. <7> Isang madre ang pinapasok sa sala ng may-ari ng bahay na walang paniniwala sa relihiyon. one nun was let in to the living room by the owner of a house without faith in religion. <8> Nag-alok ito ng dalawang libong piso, kung magagawa ng madre na tumungga ng isang kopitang alak. he offered two thousand pesos, if the nun is able to drink one cup of wine. <9> Nabigla ang madre sa magiging kalagayan niya, sakalimang tanggapin ang inaaalok ng lalake. the nun was taken aback by what her condition will be, in case she accepted the offer of the man. <10> Bagama’t nakasalang ang magiging reputasyon ng madre, sandali lamang ang naging pag-aalinlangan niya, dahil ang P2,000 ay katumbas ng maraming kilo ng bigas at kabusugan sa mga nagugutom. even if the future reputation of the nun was at stake, her hesitation was only short, because P2,000 is equivalent to many kilos of rice and the fullness of the hungry. <11> Madaling kumuha ang lalake ng isang bote ng alak at binuhusan ang kopita. the man immediately got a bottle of wine and poured a cup. <12> Matapos mag-antanda ng madre ay mabilis nitong tinunggga at sinaid ang laman ng kopita. after the nun did the sign of the cross she quickly drank and emptied the contents of the cup. <13> At matapos mailapag ang kopita sa lamesa, ay walang kagatul-gatol na hinamon ang may-ari ng bahay, “At ngayon, Sir, kung maaari lamang, isa pang kopita ng alak sa ganoong ding presyo!” and after setting down the cup on the table, without any interruption challenged the owner of the house, "and now, sir, if possible, one more cup for the same price!" <14> Nagulat ang lalake at pinaunlakan ang hamon ng madre. the man was shocked and obliged the challenge of the nun. <15> At nang ilapag ng madre ang sinaid na pangalawang kopita,ay bubulong-bulong na inilabas ng lalake ang P4,000 sa kanyang pitaka. and when the nun set down the emptied second cup, the man, whispering, brought out P4,000 from his wallet. <16> Aral: Huwag mong subukan ang nangangailangan nang hindi ka mawalan sa iyong kabalbalan. lesson: do not challenge those in need so that you will not lose in your foolishness. <17> PAGLILINGKOD service <18> Isang tanyag na psychiatrist ang nagbigay ng lecture tungkol sa mental health, at matapos ito ay nagsimulang sagutin ang mga katanungan ng mga nakinig. a famous psychiatrist gave a lecture on mental health, and after this started to answer the questions of the listeners. <19> May isang nagtanong, "Ano ang imumungkahi ninyo sa isang tao na kailangang gawin, kung ang taong ito ay nagkaroon ng matinding nerbiyos at lubhang naliligalig?" there was one who asked, "what do you suggest a person must do, if this person has serious anxiety and deeply troubled?" <20> Karamihan ay umaasa na ang isasagot ng psychiatrist ay, "Kumonsulta ng psychiatrist!" majority expected that the psychiatrist would answer, "consult a psychiatrist!" <21> Sa kanilang pagkabigla, hindi nila inaasahan ang naging tugon nito: "Isarado mo ang iyong bahay, pumunta ka sa isang pook na tirahan ng mga iskwater nating kababayan, humanap ng sinuman na talagang nangangailangan, at gumawa ng anumang maitutulong sa taong ito." in their shock, they did not expect his answer: "shut your house, go to a place inhabited by our squatting fellowmen, find anyone with a real need, and do anything to help this person." <22> Aral: Masusumpungan lamang ang katiwasayan ng kalooban, kung nasa paglilingkod nakatuon ang isipan. lesson: peace of mind will only be chanced upon, if the mind is focused on serving. <23> PAGPAPAHALAGA valuing <24> Kung pupunuin ng tubig ang isang timba sa pamamagitan ng patak lamang, maraming oras ang kakailanganin bago ito mapuno. if a pail will be filled to the brim by means of drops only, a lot of time is needed before it is filled. <25> Kahit na makitang halos puno na ito, kailangan pa ring dagdagan pa ng maraming patak para ito masabing puno na. even if it is seen almost full, it is necessary to add more drops to be able to say that it is already full. <26> At sa kalaunan, matapos mapuno ito ... sa isang patak lamang na karagdagan ay aapaw na ito. and eventually, after it is filled ... with only one additional drop it will overflow. <27> Ganito din ang paggawa ng kabutihan. doing good is similar to this. <28> Karamihan sa atin ay nagagawang tanggapin kahit na isang karaniwang tulong, subalit isang malaking kaabalahan ang maipakita o maipadama ang ating pagpapahalaga para dito. many of us are able to accept even a simple act of help, but it is a huge inconvenience to show or make felt our appreciation for it. <29> Napakahirap na mabigkas man lamang ang maikling kataga na, "Salamat." it is very difficult to even pronounce the short word, "thanks." <30> Mistulang may bikig ang ating lalamunan para mapakawalan ang ating pasasalamat. as if a bone is preventing our throat to release our thanks. <31> Gayong higit na pinagpapala ang umuusal nito kaysa ang tumatanggap, sapagkat katulad ito ng isang dalangin na pagbuksan pa upang makamtan ang maraming biyaya. whereas it is greater appreciation to say it rather than receive, because it is like a prayer that will allow to gain more blessings. <32> Kung sa maikling kataga ng pagpapahalaga ay nagkukulang ka, papaano na kung may kapagurang inaasahan mula sa iyo? if with a short word for gratitude we are lacking, what more if there is effort expected from you? <33> Huwag magmaramot at patigilin ang mga biyayang nakalaan para sa iyo. do not be selfish and stop the blessings allotted for you. <34> Alalahaning ang nakabukas na mga palad ay may nasasalo kaysa nakatikom ang mga ito. keep in mind that those who open their palms receive rather than those who close it. <35> Aral: Kung marunong kang magpahalaga, ikaw ay mahalaga. lesson: if you know how to value, you are valued.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_20425735 <1> Dressing Formation: My 1st day as a PMA plebe dressing formation: my 1st day as a PMA plebe. <2> Ang aking unang araw bilang isang plebo ay isa sa milestones ng aking military career na hindi ko makakalimutan. my first day as a plebe is one of the milestones of my military career that I will not forget. <3> Malamig ang ihip ng hangin noong ika-1 ng Abril 1990 ngunit napakainit ng aking katawan dahil sa matinding pagod na dulot ng aming reception ceremony. the breeze was cool on the 1st of April 1990 but my body was very hot because of severe exhaustion caused by our reception ceremony. <4> Tila matatapang ang lahat ng mga kadete na nakatalaga sa aking grupo. all the cadets assigned to my group seem to be brave. <5> Nandidilat ang mga mata at panay pasigaw sa pagbibigay ng kadami-daming instructions. their eyes were wide open and were often shouting when giving numerous instructions. <6> "Simula ngayon, kayo ay tatawaging Plebo!" "starting today, you will be called plebes!" <7> "Bawal kayong mag-Tagalog kundi English sa lahat ng panahon na makipag-usap sa mga seniors." "you are not allowed to speak in Tagalog, but in English, at all times when speaking to seniors." <8> Sa sobrang 'war schock' ay panay "Yes seeerrr!" na sigaw ang aming isinasagot. in our utmost "war shock", we often answered, "yes sir!", with a shout. <9> Lumalabas ang ugat sa aming leeg at galing sa ilalim ng dibdib ang pagpalabas ng boses para mas malakas. the vein on our necks would bulge and our voices would come from below the chest to be louder. <10> Ang aking grupo ay tinatawag na squad at binubuo ng 6 na plebo, isang Yearling (2nd year cadet) at isang Squad Leader. my group was called a squad and is formed by 6 plebes, one yearling (2nd year cadet) and one squad leader. <11> Nagmartsa kami patungo sa aming barracks area na kung tatawagin ay New Cadet Battalion (NCBn) para maghanda para sa aming pinakaunang hapunan na kung tawagin sa cadet lingo ay 'mess'. we marched towards our barracks area, which is called New Cadet Battalion (NCBn), to prepare for our very first dinner, which is called "mess" in cadet lingo. <12> Napakaraming bawal ang itinuro sa amin. many restrictions were taught to us. <13> Kapag nasa formation area o kaya ay mag-martsa ay bawal ang makipag-usap sa kapwa kadete. when in the formation area or when marching, it is forbidden to speak to fellow cadets. <14> No rolling of eyeballs. no rolling of eyeballs. <15> No moving in ranks. no moving in ranks. <16> Mahigpit ang bilin ng aming SL (squad leader) na parang naghahayag ng Code of Kalantiaw. the instructions of our SL (squad leader) were strict, as if stating the Code of Kalantiaw. <17> Nakakatakot ang kanyang babala. his warning was scary. <18> "Bawal sa inyo ang mag-connive. "it is forbidden for you to connive. <19> Pag me mahuli kami, lips to lips ang abutin nyo!" if we catch anyone, you will kiss each other on the lips!" <20> Pagdating sa aming kwarto, nakita ko na magkakasama kaming lahat doon at magkatabi ang aming double-deck na higaan na kung tawagin ay 'bunks'. upon arriving in our room, I saw that we were all together in there and our double-deck beds, called "bunks", were next to each other. <21> Meron kaming tig-iisang duffel bag na puno ng mga uniporme at mga accessories. we each had one duffel bag that is full of uniforms and accessories. <22> Me maraming underwear, handkerchiefs, shirts, sweatshirts, jogging pants at marami pang iba. there were many pieces of underwear, handkerchiefs, shirts, sweatshirts, jogging pants and many more. <23> Ang pinakauna naming uniporme ay olive drab na kung tatawagin ay Drill B uniform, ka-partner ito ng combat boots na tila ay nag-aantay na aming suotin. our very first uniform was an olive drab, which was called a drill B uniform, partnered with combat boots that seem to be waiting to be worn by us. <24> "Iyan ang inyong mga gamit bilang kadete. "those are your things as cadets. <25> Alagaan ang inyong gamit at huwag kayong magkalat. Sa lahat ng panahon ay maayos ang pagkatupi ng kagamitan at malinis ang inyong kwarto," sabi ni SL. take care of your things and do not make a mess. how your things are folded should be neat and your room should be clean at all times," said SL. <26> Kanya-kanya na kaming kuha ng aming uniporme nang kami ay binigyan ng kautusan na kumuha ng mga damit na kailangan para sa next duty, ang 'Evening Mess'. we individually took our uniforms when we were given an order to get clothes that are needed for the next duty, the "evening mess". <27> "Gentlemen, lahat ng duties natin ay inoorasan. "gentlemen, all our duties are being timed. <28> Hindi pwede ang pabagal-bagal at pabakla-bakla kumilos," ang bilin ni SL na matalim ang paningin lagi sa amin. it is not allowed to be slow and to move like a gay boy," instructed by SL, who was always looking at us sharply. <29> "Ngayon, gusto kong suotin nyong lahat ang inyong bath attire sa loob ng 10 counts!" "now, I want all of you to wear your bath attire in 10 counts!" <30> "One! ....... two! ..... three..." "one! ... two! ... three..." <31> Kanya-kanya na kaming hubad ng aming damit sibilyan at kandarapang isuot ang bathrobe at tuwalya. each of us took off our civilian clothes and scrambled to wear the bathrobe and towel. <32> Napatawa si SL dahil sa kanya-kanya naming porma. SL laughed because of our individual appearances. <33> Paano ba naman kasi, pati pagtali ng bathrobe, pagdala ng tuwalya at sipilyo at kailangang nasa tama ayon sa kautusan. how could this be when even in tying the bathrobe, bringing the towel and toothbrush, needs to be in order according to the command. <34> "Ang tuwalya ay naka-fold ng kalahati at nakaipit sa kaliwang braso. Bitbitin ang sipilyo at sabon sa kanang kamay!" "the towel is folded in half and is tucked under the left arm. carry the toothbrush and soap on the right hand!" <35> Ganon na lang ang kalituhan namin kasi lahat pala ng gagawin ay merong 'rules'. that was how confused we were because it seemed like all activities had "rules". <36> Sinunod namin ito lahat at parati ay pasigaw ang sagot na "Yessssssssssss seeeeeeeeeeeeeeer!" we followed all of them and always shouted out our answer, "yes sir!". <37> "Plebos, we have 20 mins remaining before our first evening mess formation. Gusto ko makaligo kayo sa loob ng 10 counts!" "plebes, we have 20 minutes remaining before our first evening mess formation. I want you to take a bath in 10 counts!" <38> Nalalabuan ako sa mga sinabi nya. I was confused with what he said. <39> Paano ka nga naman makaligo sa loob ng sampung bilang? how could you take a bath in just ten counts? <40> Parang natulala ako sa pag-iisip nang narinig ko uli ang boses ni SL. I was lost in my thoughts when I heard the voice of SL again. <41> "In 10 counts, nakaligo na kayo! 10! ...... 9! .... 8! " "in 10 counts, you are already done bathing! 10! ... 9! ... 8!" <42> Kandarapa kami lahat. we all scrambled to our feet. <43> Nang naisabit ko ang aking tuwalya at bathrobe, gumawa na ako ng diskarte. once I have hung my towel and bathrobe, I already made my strategy. <44> Sa kaliwang kamay ay ang tabo na nagbubuhos ng tubig. on my left hand is the dipper that pours water. <45> Sa kanang kamay ay gamit sa pag-toothbrush. the right hand is used for brushing my teeth. <46> Sinigurado kong mabasa buong katawan at makapag-sipilyo na rin. I made sure that my whole body got wet and to brush my teeth too. <47> Umaalingawngaw ang boses ni SL sa harap ng aming kwarto. the voice of SL echoed in front of our room. <48> "7! ..... 6! .... 5! .." "7! ... 6! ... 5! ..." <49> Nasa numerong 4 pa lang, naisuot ko na ang bathrobe sabay karipas ng takbo pabalik sa harap ng nakangising si SL. at only number 4, I was already able to wear the bathrobe while making a mad dash back in front of SL who was grinning. <50> "Tsuuuunnnnn!" "tsuuuunnnnn!" <51> Ewan ko ano yong command nya. I don't know what his command is. <52> Busy ako sa pag-aayos ng aking bathrobe habang humihingal pa. I was busy fixing my bathrobe while still panting. <53> Ang ibig sabihin pala don ay "Attention!". apparently, it meant "attention!". <54> Shortcut pala yon! it was a shortcut! <55> Malay ko ba don? how would I know that? <56> Sorry na lang sa mga nahuli kong mistah. sorry for the classmates that I caught. <57> Meron na agad kaparusahan sa kanila. there is already a punishment for them. <58> Ganon pala ang tinatawag na 'dressing formation' sa militar. so that's what you call a "dressing formation" in the military. <59> Nakakainis ngunit nakakapawis. it is irritating but makes one sweat.

Dagala is included in the seven judges in the list of Duterte wherein only four of them will be placed under investigation because the others are still active in service. <3> Ang naturang pagbibitiw ay nangyari nitong Agosto 8 kay Supreme Court (SC) Administrator Jose Midas Marquez. Kaugnay nito, hindi tinanggap ng korte ang pagbibitiw ni Dagala dahil ayon kay SC public information chief Atty. the said resignation happened this August 8 with Supreme Court (SC) administrator Jose Midas Marquez. related to this, the court did not accept the resignation of Dagala because according to SC public information chief Attorney <4> Theodore Te sumasailalim na ito sa administrative investigation bago pa man masama sa listahan ni Duterte. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_13012474 <1> Pag-aangkop (Adaptasyon) adaptation (adaptation) <2> BURADOR (DRAFT) draft (draft) <3> PAG-AANGKOP (ADAPTASYON) SA NAGAGANAP NA PAGBABAGO NG PANAHON adaptation (adaptation) to the ongoing change in climate <4> ni Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. inihanda para sa Komite sa Adaptasyon ng Philippine Movement for Climate Justice (PMCJ) by Gregorio V. Bituin Junior prepared for the Committee on Adaptation of the Philippine Movement for Climate Justice (PMCJ) <5> Dahil sa pagbabago ng klima, naganap ang maraming delubyong hindi inaasahan ng taumbayan. due to climate change, many calamities that the people do not expect happened. <6> Lumubog sa tubig ang mga kalunsuran, ang mga kanayunan, at maging ang kabundukan. cities, villages, and even the mountains, were submerged in water. <7> Nanariwa sa akin ang sinabi ng isang kasama na mismong ang Lungsod ng Baguio ay nilubog sa baha. I remember when one of my colleagues said the City of Baguio itself was submerged in flood. <8> Napakataas ng Baguio para bahain. Baguio is too elevated to be flooded. <9> Ngunit binaha ito dahil sa mga basurang bumara sa mga kanal. but it flooded because garbage clogged the sewers. <10> Maraming konsepto ng adaptasyon o kung paano tayo aangkop sa ganitong nagaganap na kalamidad. there are many concepts of adaptation or how we are going to adapt to this ongoing calamity. <11> Napakaraming aghamanon (syentista) at mga propesyunal ang nagbigay ng iba't ibang kahulugan o depinisyon kung ano nga ba ang adaptasyon. there were many scientists (scientists) and professionals who gave different meanings or definitions to what an adaptation really is. <12> Tingnan natin ang bawat isa. let us look at each one. <13> a. Adaptation - Adjustment in natural or human systems in response to actual or expected climatic stimuli or their effects, which moderates harm or exploits beneficial opportunities. a. adaptation - adjustment in natural or human systems in response to actual or expected climactic stimuli or their effects, which moderates harm or exploits beneficial opportunities. <14> Various types of adaptation can be distinguished, including anticipatory and reactive adaptation, private and public adaptation, and autonomous and planned adaptation (IPCC TAR, 2001 a) various types of adaptation can be distinguished, including anticipatory and reactive adaptation, private and public adaptation, and autonomous and planned adaptation (IPCC TAR, 2001 a) <15> b. Adaptation - Practical steps to protect countries and communities from the likely disruption and damage that will result from effects of climate change. b. adaptation - practical steps to protect countries and communities from the likely disruption and damage that will result from effects of climate change. <16> For example, flood walls should be built and in numerous cases it is probably advisable to move human settlements out of flood plains and other low-lying areas…” (Website of the UNFCCC Secretariat) for example, flood walls should be built and in numerous cases it is probably advisable to move human settlements out of flood plains and other low-lying areas. (website of the UNFCCC Secretariat) <17> c. Adaptation - Is a process by which strategies to moderate, cope with and take advantage of the consequences of climatic events are enhanced, developed, and implemented. c. adaptation - is a process by which strategies to moderate, cope with and take advantage of the consequences of climatic events are enhanced, developed, and implemented. <18> (UNDP, 2005) UNDP, 2005 <19> d. Adaptation - The process or outcome of a process that leads to a reduction in harm or risk of harm, or realisation of benefits associated with climate variability and climate change. d. adaptation - the process or outcome of a process that leads to a reduction in harm or risk of harm, or realization of benefits associated with climate variability and climate change. <20> (UK Climate Impact Programme (UKCIP, 2003) UK Climate Impact Program (UKCIP, 2003) <21> Kung ibubuod ang mga kahulugang ito, ang adaptasyon ang mga hakbang upang umangkop sa mga nagaganap na pagbabago sa kapaligiran nang isinasaalang-alang ang kaligtasan ng buhay at mapababa ang panganib ng sakuna. if definitions were summarized, adaptation are the steps to adapt to the changes happening in the environment taking into consideration the safety of lives and to reduce the risk of disaster. <22> Sa karaniwang masa, napakakumplikado ng mga terminong ito ng agham, ngunit madali naman nila itong mauunawaan kung ipapaliwanag sa kanila ito sa mga payak na salita. for the common people, these scientific terms are very complicated but they can easily be understood if they are explained in simple words. <23> Simple lamang naman kung ano ang adaptasyon - umangkop ka sa kalagayan. what adaptation means is just simple - adjusting to the condition. <24> Ibig sabihin, kung mababa ang iyong kinalalagyan, pumunta ka sa mas mataas na kalalagyan, o kaya naman ay itaas mo ang kinalalagyan mo. it means, if your position is low, go to a higher position, or raise your position. <25> Kung mahuna na o magato ang materyales ng iyong tahanan, aba'y gawan mo ng paraan kung paano ito magiging matibay. if the materials of your house are already weak or dilapidated, you make a way to make it durable! <26> Maaaring palitan mo ng bagong kahoy ang mga mahuhuna at ginagato na, o kaya naman ay gawin mo nang bato ang iyong dingding na sawali. you may replace the already weak and dilapidated with new wood, or make your woven bamboo walls concrete. <27> Halimbawa, laging binabaha sa Dagat-Dagatan, ang ginawa ng mga tao ay tinaasan ang kanilang bahay para pag bumaha ay hindi aabot sa kanilang sahig. for example, it is always flooding in Dagat-Dagatan, what the people did was make their house higher so when it floods, it would not reach their flooring. <28> Dumating din ang panahong tinambakan na ang mababang lupa at ginawang sementado sa pamamagitan ng pamahalaang lokal. the time also came when low-lying lands were filled and were cemented care of the local government. <29> Gayunman, hindi ganito kadali, lalo na't kaligtasan ng buhay ang nakasalang, at di sampung tao lamang ang pinag-uusapan dito, kundi milyong tao. however, this is not so easy especially when survival is at stake, and not only ten people are being talked about here but millions of people. <30> Kaya marapat lamang itong pagtuunan ng pansin, pag-aralan at paghandaan, di lamang ng pamahalaan, kundi ng mismong mga taong direktang maaapektuhan. so it is deserving to receive attention, to be studied and prepared for, not only by the government, but by the very people who will be directly affected. <31> Hindi maaaring ang mga ibon ang magpapasiya sa kapalaran ng mga isda. it cannot be birds who will decide the fate of the fish. <32> Dapat mismong ang taumbayan ay kasama sa pagdedesisyon sa kanilang kapalaran at kaligtasan. the people themselves must be involved in deciding their fate and safety. <33> Noong 2009, nilikha ang Climate Change Commission (CCC) ng Pilipinas sa pamamagitan ng Batas Republika 9729 (Climate Change Act of 2009). in 2009, the Climate Change Commission (CCC) of the Philippines was created through Republic Act 9729 (Climate Change Act of 2009). <34> Ito ay binubuo ng 23 ahensya ng gobyerno, lokal na pamahalaan, at kinatawan ng akademya, sektor ng negosyo at mga NGOs. this is comprised of 23 government agencies, local government units, and representatives from the academe, business sectors and NGOs. <35> Ang Komisyong ito ang may mandatong magsagawa ng opisyal na National Framework Strategy on Climate Change (NFSCC) at ang National Climate Change Action Plan (NCCAP). the Commission has the mandate to implement an official National Framework Strategy on Climate Change (NFSCC) and the National Climate Change Action Plan (NCCAP). <36> Ang Pangulo ng Pilipinas ang siyang namumuno sa Komisyong ito. the president of the Philippines leads this commission. <37> Ang NCCAP ay nilikha upang isulong ang abotkayang programa ng pagkilos para matugunan ang adaptasyon at mitigasyon sa isyu ng nagbabagong klima. the NCCAP was created to promote a reasonable program of action to address adaptation and mitigation on the issue of climate change. <38> Ang pitong istratehikong dapat pangunahing tugunan nito ay ang isyu ng mga sumusunod: the seven strategies should mainly address the following issues. <39> 1\. Seguridad sa pagkain (food security) 1. food security (food security) <40> 2\. Kasapatan sa tubig (water sufficiency) 2. water sufficiency (water sufficiency) <41> 3\. Pangkapaligiran at pang-ekolohiyang katatagan (environmental and ecological stability) 3. environment and ecological stability (environment and ecological stability) <42> 4\. Kaligtasan sa tao (human security) 4. human security (human security) <43> 5\. Kapana-panatiling enerhiya (sustainable energy) 5. sustainable energy (sustainable energy) <44> 6\. Mapag-angkop sa Klimang Industriya at Serbisyo (Climate-Smart Industries and Services) 6. climate-smart industries and services (climate-smart industries and services) <45> 7\. Pagpapaunlad ng Kaalaman at Kakayahan (Knowledge and Capacity Development) 7. knowledge and capacity development (knowledge and capacity development) <46> Mandato rin ng CCC na magbigay-tulong sa mga pamahalaang lokal sa paglikha ng mga ito ng LCCAP (local climate change action plan). it is also the mandate of the CCC to provide assistance to local government units in creating these LCCAP (local climate change action plan). <47> Ano ang ating papel bilang organisasyon? what is our role as an organization? <48> Una, ang komite sa adaptasyon ng Philippine Movement for Climate Justice (PMCJ) ang tumatayong kinatawan ng mga progresibong organisasyon upang tiyaking ang mga patakaran ng pamahalaan kaugnay sa isyu ng adaptasyon at nagbabagong klima ay maayos na naisasakatuparan. first, the committee on adaptation of the Philippine Movement for Climate Justice (PMCJ) is the acting representative of progressive organizations to ensure that policies of the government in connection with the issue on adaptation and climate change are properly implemented. <49> Ikalawa, maging kritikal at mapanuri, na ang ginagawa ng pamahalaan ay hindi sapat hangga't hindi nasisingil ang mga mayayamang bansa sa kanilang mga pananagutan. second, to be critical and discerning that what the government is doing is not enough unless rich nations are charged with their responsibilities. <50> Ikatlo, ang nagaganap na pagbabago ng klima ay dahil sa isang sistemang hindi inuuna ang kapakanan ng sambayanan kundi tubo para sa iilan, iilang bansa, iilang sektor (business sector), iilang tao (mayayaman), sistemang walang pagsasaalang-alang sa kinabukasan ng higit na nakararami. third, the climate change happening is due to a system that does not prioritize the welfare of society but the interest of the few, some nations, some sectors (business sector), a few people (rich), a system that does not consider future of the vast majority. <51> Ikaapat, pagsusulat at pagpapaabot sa pamamagitan ng mass media ng paninindigan at pagsusuri ng PMCJ sa mga nagaganap, tulad ng bantang pasasabugin (blasting) ng mga kabahayan sa danger zones para ilipat ang mga tao sa death zone. fourth, writing and extending through mass media the stand and criticism of PMCJ on what are happening like the threat of blasting (blasting) of households in danger zones to transfer the people to the death zone. <52> Ikalima, makipag-ugnayan at maging bahagi ang PMCJ sa mga NCCAP at LCCAP, o kaya'y sumubaybay (monitoring) ng mga ginagawa ng pamahalaan. fifth, for PMCJ to coordinate and be a part of NCCAPs and LCCAPs or to monitor (monitoring) the activities of the government.

DE LIMA, MAN OF THE HOUR Secretary De Lima, man of the hour. <2> STRIKE while the iron is hot. strike while the iron is hot. <3> Si Leila de Lima, secretary of justice, ang man of the hour ngayon dahil tinuturing ng marami na si De Lima ang nagwagi sa labanan nila ng Iglesia Ni Cristo. Leila de Lima, Secretary of Justice, is now the man of the hour because many consider de Lima as the winner in her fight with Iglesia ni Cristo. <4> Nag-rally ang Iglesia sa Padre Faura at sa kanto ng Shaw ngunit hindi natuloy ang one million na katao na ipinangako ng mga lider nito. Iglesia rallied at Padre Faura and at the corner of Shaw but the one million people, whom its leaders promised, did not come. <5> Bukod doon, hindi rin natuloy ang kanilang panawagan na tanggalin na si De Lima sa puwesto. aside from this, their appeal to have De Lima ousted from position did not also push through. <6> Palatandaan kaya ito na hindi ganoon kalaki ang mga kaanib ng Iglesia? is this a sign that the followers of Iglesia are not that many anymore? <7> Si De Lima ay nagbabalak kumandidato sa pagka-senador sa darating na halalan. De Lima is planning to run as a senatorial candidate in the coming election. <8> May mga nagsasabi na mahalaga ang boto as a block ng Iglesia kaya naman may panganib na matalo siya sa eleksyon na ito. there are some who are saying that the vote of Iglesia as a block is important, which is why there is a risk that she would lose in this election. <9> Mayroon namang nagsasabi na panahon na para kumandidato si De Lima sa pagka-Vice President sa ticket ni Mar Roxas na nagsasabi naman na panahon na rin na magkaroon uli ng isang Pangulong galing sa Visayan region. there are some who say that it is already time for De Lima to run for vice president under the ticket of Mar Roxas, who is saying that it is also the time to have a president from the Visayan region again. <10> Makabuo man ng one or two million votes ang Iglesia laban kay De Lima ay mukhang kukulangin pa rin ang sectang ito ng boto. even if Iglesia manages to accumulate one or two million votes against De Lima, it seems that this sect will still be short of votes. <11> Malakas ang simpatiya ng mga hindi miyembro ng Iglesia para kay De Lima. those who are not members of Iglesia have a strong sympathy for De Lima. <12> Dapat ay samantalahin ni De Lima ang pagkakataong ito bago pa lumamig ang usapang ito. De Lima should take advantage of this chance before this issue cools down. <13> May sinasabing may Catholic backlash, bukod pa sa mga Born Again at iba pang samahang protestante, at ito ang dapat alagaan ni Leila. it is said that there is Catholic backlash, aside from the Born Again and other protestant groups, and this is what Leila needs to take care of. <14> Bago pa lumamig ang controversy na ito ay dapat nang paandarin o pagulungin ang wheels of justice na maresolba na ang kaso ng mga ministro ng Iglesia ukol sa diumano ay serious illegal detention. before this controversy even cools down, the wheels of justice need to be put in motion or turned so that the cases of the Iglesia ministers regarding the alleged serious illegal detention can be resolved. <15> Sa kung mananalo naman si De Lima sa pagka-Bise Presidente ay kumporme naman kung kaya niyang talunin si Sen. Antonio Trillanes o si Alan Cayetano o dili kaya’y si Chiz Escudero. whether De Lima will win as vice president will depend on her ability to beat Senator Antonio Trillanes or Alan Cayetano or even Chiz Escudero. <16> Malamang sa pakilasa ko na hindi iboboto ng Iglesia si Trillanes. I have a feeling that Iglesia will not vote for Trillanes. <17> Malamang din na hindi iboboto ng maraming Katoliko si Chiz dahil mukha raw pro-Iglesia siya. it is also probable that many Catholics will not vote for Chiz because he allegedly seems to be pro-Iglesia. <18> DEEP FRIED/RAUL VALINO deep fried/Raul Valino
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_95079957 <1> HUMANAP KA PANGIT: Reflection for 4th Sunday of Lent Year B - March 15, 2015 - YEAR OF THE POOR look for someone ugly: reflection for 4th Sunday of Lent year B - March 15, 2015 - year of the poor. <2> May isang pari na tinatawag na "Parekoy" na kuwela at mahilig biruin ang kanyang mga parokyano lalong-lalo na ang mga nag-aaply ng kasal. there is one priest called "Parekoy", who is funny and likes to tease his parishioners, especially those who are applying for marriage. <3> Minsan may lumapit sa kanya at nagtanong,"Father, magkano po ang kasal sa inyong parokya?" once, someone approached him and asked, "father, how much is it to get married in your parish?". <4> Sinagot siya ng pari, "Aba, depende yan sa itsura ng mapapangasawa mo." the priest answered her, "well, it depends on what your betrothed looks like." <5> At dinala ng babae sa kanya ang kanyang gwapong nobyo at sabi ng pari, "Iha, sampung libo ang kasal mo dahil sa may itsura ang nobyo mo!" then the woman brought her handsome boyfriend and the priest said, "child, your marriage costs ten thousand because your boyfriend has good looks!". <6> Pagkatapos ay my nagtanong uli sa kanya, "Fadz (short for father), magkano ang kasal sa simbahan ninyo?" afterwards, someone asked him again, "Fadz (short for father), how much is it to get married in your church?". <7> Sumagot uli ang pari, "Aba, depende yan sa itsura ng mapapangasawa mo!" the priest replied again, "well, it depends on what your betrothed looks like!". <8> At pilit na hinila ng babae ang kanyang nahihiyang nobyo. and the woman insisted on dragging her embarrassed boyfriend. <9> Tiningnan siya ng pari mula ulo hanggang paa at ang sabi, "Iha, libre na lang ang kasal mo!" he was scanned by the priest from head to toe and said, "child, your marriage is for free!". <10> At pabulong na sinabi ng pari sa babae, "Bakit naman siya ang napili mong pakasalan? and the priest said in a whisper to the woman, "why is he the one you chose to marry?" <11> Napakalayo ng anyo ninyo. your appearances are so different. <12> 'Pag nakasal kayo, siya, parang nanalo sa lotto, ikaw naman, nasunugan bahay." "when you get married, it would seem like he won in the lottery, and you, as if your house got burned down." <13> At sinabi ng dalaga, "Father, minahal ko siya; hindi sa kanyang anyo kundi sa kanyang puso! and the young lady said, "father, I loved him; not for his appearance but for his heart!" <14> I fell in love not with his face. I fell in love not with his face. <15> I fell in love... with his heart!" I fell in love ... with his heart! <16> Kung minsan nga naman ay totoo ang kasabihang "love is blind!" indeed, sometimes the saying "love is blind" is true! <17> Iba kasi ang pamantayan ng mundo sa pagmamahal. the world has a different standard in love. <18> Kaya nga katawa-tawa ang kanta dati ni Andrew E na "Humanap ka ng pangit, ibigin mong tunay!" that is why the song of Andrew E before, which is "look for someone ugly and love him truly!" is so funny! <19> Ngunit kung ating titingnan ay ito ang ginawa ng Diyos ng ibinigay Niya ang kanyang bugtong na Anak. but if we analyze, this is what the Lord did when he gave his only Son. <20> Humanap Siya ng pangit at inibig Niyang tunay. he looked for someone ugly and loved him truly. <21> Naging pangit tayo dahil sa ating mga kasalanan. we became ugly because of our sins. <22> Ngunit sa kabila nito tayo ay lubos niyang minahal. but in spite of this, he loved us very much. <23> Sa Sulat ni Apostol San Pablo sa mga taga_Efeso ay sinabi niya: "Napakasagana ang habag ng Diyos at napakadakila ng pg-ibig na iniukol niya sa atin..." in the letter of the apostle, Saint Paul, to the Ephesians, he said: "the mercy of the Lord is so bountiful and the love that he gave us is so great..." <24> Sa Ebanghelyo ay inilahad ni San Juan kung paano ito pinatunayan ng Diyos: "Gayon na lamang ang pag-ibig ng Diyos sa sanlibutan, kaya ibinigay niya ang kanyang bugtong na Anak, upang ang sumampalataya sa kaanya ay hindi mapahamak, kundi magkaroon ng buhay na walang hanggan." in the gospel, Saint John narrated how this was proven by the Lord: "the love of the Lord for humanity is just like that, so he gave his only son, so that those who believe in him will not be harmed, but have an everlasting life." <25> Kaya nga't sa panahon ng Kuwaresma ay nararapat lang na maunawaan natin ang malaking pagmamahal ng Diyos sa atin at sana ay maging pamantayan din natin ito sa ating pagmamahal sa kapwa. which is why in the time of Lent, it is only right for us to understand the great love of God for us, and hopefully, this will also be our standard in loving our neighbor. <26> Ang pag-ibig ng Diys ay walang itinatangi. the love of God excludes no one. <27> Ang pagmamahal Niya ay walang kundisyon. his love has no condition. <28> Sana, tayo rin, pagkatapos nating maranasan ang pagmamahal at pagpapatawad ng Diyos ay magawa rin natin itong maipakita sa ating kapwa. hopefully, we too can manage to show this to our fellowmen after experiencing the love and forgiveness of God. <29> Ngayong panahon ng Kuwaresma sa Taon ng Mga Dukha (Year of the Poor) ay sikapin nating ipadama ang pagmamahal ng Diyos sa ating mga kapwang hikahos sa pamumuhay. during this season of Lent in the Year of the Poor (Year of the Poor), let us strive to make the love of God felt by our neighbors, who are struggling in life. <30> Makisa tayo sa kanilang paghihirap bilang pakikiisa sa paghihirap na dinanas ni Kristo. let us be one with them in poverty, as an act of unity with the suffering experienced by Christ. <31> Matuto tayong umunawa, magpatawad at magmahal ng walang kundisyon o hinahanap na kapalit. let us learn to understand, forgive and love without condition or looking for something in exchange. <32> Katulad ni Hesus, ibigin natin hindi lang ang mga kaibig-ibig. like Jesus, let us love not only those who are lovely. <33> Hanapin natin ang mga "pangit at ibigin nating tunay!" let us look for the "ugly and love them truly!".
