MATERIAL_BASE-1B_17968443 <1> Dayanara, makikipag-meet-up kina Aga, Cesar at Ariel Dayanara, will meet up with Aga, Cesar and Ariel <2> Posted by: Timmy Basil posted by: Timmy Basil <3> on January 30, 2017 on January 30, 2017 <4> in Showbiz in showbiz <5> HINDI pala muna aalis ng ‘Pinas si Miss Univese 1993, Dayanara Torres, isa sa judge sa Miss Universe kahit matapos na ang pageant dahil marami pa siyang mga ime-meet up na mga Pinoy artist na nakasama niya sa kasagsagan ng kanyang career. not leaving the Philippines just yet is Miss Universe 1993, Dayanara Torres, one of the judges in Miss Universe, even though the pageant is over because she still has a lot of Pinoy artists to meet up with who she worked with during the span of her career. <6> Gusto raw ni Yari (palayaw ni Dayanara) na makipagkita kina Cesar Montano, Aga Muhlach, Pops Fernandez, ang grupong Manoeuvres, Ariel Rivera, at Martin Nievera. Yari (nickname of Dayanara) wants to meet with Cesar Montano, Aga Muhlach, Pops Fernandez, the group Manouevres, Ariel Rivera, and Martin Nievera. <7> Nakasama ni Yari sina Pops, Martin, Ariel at Manoeuvres sa ASAP. Yari worked with Pops, Martin, Ariel, and Manoeuvres in ASAP. <8> Sa kabilang banda, Maganda pa rin si Dayanara at habang tinitingnan ko ang bago niyang mga larawan, nahahawig siya sa isang Brazilian model na naging artista na sa Manila, si Daiana Meneses. on the other hand, Dayanara remains beautiful and while I was looking at her recent photos, she has similarities with one Brazilian model who became an artist in Manila, Daiana Meneses. <9> For sure, flattered at excited na rin ang mga nakasama ni Dayanara sa ASAP na makita at makausap siya. for sure, flattered and excited are those who previously worked with Dayanara in ASAP to meet and talk to her. <10> Nagsama sina Dayanara at Aga sa pelikulang Basta’t Kasama Kita at sa Type Kita Walang Kokontra naman kay Cesar. Dayanara and Aga got together in the movie, Basta's Kasama Kita and Type Kita Walang Kokontra with Cesar.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_40762508 <1> Ibasura ang EDCA at labanan ang umiigting na panghihimasok ng imperyalismong US at pagkapapet ni Aquino scrap EDCA and fight the deepening intervention of imperialist US and Aquino being a puppet <2> Ma. Laya Guerrero Maria Laya Guerrero <3> Kabataang Makabayan Kabataang Makabayan <4> May 11, 2014 May 11, 2014 <5> Maituturing na pambansang pagtataksil ng rehimeng Aquino ang pakikipagkasundo sa imperyalistang amo nito sa muling pagbabalik ng base militar ng Amerika sa bansa at pagbubukas sa Pilipinas sa walang sagkang panghihimasok ng tropang militar ng US. the agreement of the Aquino regime with its imperialist boss in bringing back the military bases of America to the country and opening the Philippines to unobstructed meddling of US military troops can be considered treason. <6> Ang paglagda ng rehimeng Aquino sa Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA) noong Abril 28 ay paunang regalo sa pagdating ng puno ng imperyalistang US na si Barack Obama. the Aquino regime's signing of the Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA) on April 28 is an advance gift for the arrival of the head of the imperialist US Barrack Obama. <7> Naglalaman ito ng mga probisyong nagsusuko sa pambansang soberanya ng Pilipinas sa US at tahasang pagyurak ng teritoryal na integridad, demokrasya at karapatan ng mga Pilipino. it contains provisions giving up the national sovereignty of the Philippines to the US and bold trampling on territorial integrity, democracy and rights of the Filipinos. <8> Tinangka pang pabanguhin ang EDCA at isinama ang "humanitarian assistance and disaster relief" o HADR diumano sa sakop ng EDCA. there was even attempt to make the EDCA look better and include the "humanitarian assistance and disaster relief" or HADR supposedly to the scope of EDCA. <9> Ang mga HADR na ito ay mga nakakubling operasyong psywar at nakakomoplaheng operasyong militar ng US at AFP tulad ng patuloy na pananatili ng tropa ng US sa Silangang Visayas matapos ang bagyong Yolanda. these HADR are disguised PSYWAR operations and camouflaged military operations of the US and AFP like the ongoing stay of US troops in Eastern Visayas after typhoon Yolanda. <10> Sa pamamagitan ng EDCA, pinupormalisa ng rehimeng US-Aquino ang papalaking presensyang militar ng US sa ating bansa at pagbabase tulad ng 700-tropa ng US na nakabase sa Camp Navarro sa Zamboanga mula 2002. through EDCA, the US-Aquino government formalizes the increasing military presence of the US in our country and setting base like the 700 troops of the US based in Camp Navarro in Zamboanga since 2002. <11> Sakop ng EDCA ang kondukta ng mga tropang militar na walang-sagkang nakakapanatili sa ating teritoryo, pagdaan, paglalagi at pagtago ng mga kagamitang pandigma at armamentong-nukleyar ng US sa bansa, pagtatayo ng mga pasilidad pang-espiya at base militar, at pagyurak sa karapatan ng ating mga kababaihan, mga bata at mamamayan. the EDCA covers the conduct of military troops who freely remain in our territory, passing through, staying and hiding war equipment and nuclear weapons of the US in the country, setting up spying facilities and military bases, and trampling on the rights of our women, children and citizens. <12> Ang EDCA ay malinaw na mas masaklaw sa Visiting Forces Agreement (VFA) ng 1999 at mas masahol sa US-RP Military Bases Agreement (MBA) na nilagdaan noong Marso 1947. the EDCA is clearly more encompassing than the Visiting Forces Agreement (VFA) of 1999 and worse than the US-RP Military Bases Agreement (MBA) signed on March 1947. <13> Ang MBA ay nagbigay ng 99 taong karapatan sa US para sa paggamit ng mga base militar at ibang gamit sa loob ng mga enklabong sakop ng base. the MBA gave the US 99 years to use the military bases and other equipment inside the territory included in the base. <14> Halos magtatagal hanggang sa 2046 ang pagiral ng mga base ayon sa MBA, at naamyendahan lamang ito matapos ang mga protesta ng mamamayan at itinakdang ang 1991 bilang pagtatapos nito. the prevalence of the bases would last almost up to 2046 according to the MBA, and it was only amended after protests of the people and 1991 was marked as its end. <15> Sa EDCA walang taning ang pag-iral ng mga baseng militar, instalasyon at tropang-militar ng US sa bansa kahit pa lagpas sa 100 taon! in EDCA the prevalence of military bases, installation and military troops of the US in the country has no limit, even if it exceeds 100 years! <16> Nililinlang ng rehimeng Aquino at US ang mamamayang Pilipino ng kunwa-kunwaring paglalagay ng 10-taong termino sa EDCA samantalang ang eksaktong isinasaad ng EDCA na "This Agreement shall have an initial terms of ten years, and thereafter, it shall continue in force, unless terminated by either Party by giving one year’s written notice through diplomatic channels of its intention to terminate this Agreement" (Article XXII, Section 4) ay hindi eksaktong limitasyon at cumpolsory term limit kundi matapos ang 10-taon ay normalisasyon ng EDCA at patuloy na operasyon ng base at tropa ng US sa bansa. the Aquino regime and the US deceived the Filipino people, pretending to place a 10-year term on EDCA while the exact statement of EDCA "this agreement shall have an initial terms of ten years, and thereafter, it shall continue in force, unless terminated by either party by giving one year's written notice through diplomatic channels of its intention to terminate this agreement" (article XXII, section 4) is not an exact limit and compulsorily term limit and instead after 10 years the normalization of EDCA and continued operation of US bases and troops in the country. <17> "Neither confirm o deny" ang polisiya ng US patungkol sa mga kagamitang nukleyar kaya hindi matitiyak ng Pilipinas na walang dalang nukleyar na armas ang US at anumang inspeksyon ng gobyerno ng Pilipinas sa base ay hindi pahihintulutan ayon sa EDCA kung hindi ito naayon sa "seguridad at kaligtasan" na itinakda ng US. "neither confirm or deny" is the policy of the US about the nuclear equipment so the Philippines cannot be sure that the US did not bring nuclear arms and any inspection by the Philippine government on the bases is not permitted according to the EDCA if it is not in line with the "security and safety" set by the US. <18> Kahit na matapos mapatalsik ang mga base militar ng 1991, nagpatuloy ang pagdaong ng mga submarine na nuclear-capable at nuclear-carrier ships tulad ng USS Washington super-carrier, USS North Carolina, submarinong nuclear-capable USS Hawaii, missile-destroyer USS Milius at iba pa sa teritoryo ng Pilipinas. even after the expulsion of military bases in 1991, nuclear-capable submarines and nuclear-carrier ships like the USS Washington super-carrier, USS North Carolina, nuclear-capable submarine USS Hawaii, missile-destroyer USS Milius and others continued to dock on Philippine territory. <19> Tahasang pagsuko ng pambansang dangal ang pagpayag ng rehimeng Aquino sa EDCA na nagsasaad na walang hurisdiksyon ang Pilipinas ang mga korte sa bansa sa mga kaso o paglabag sa kurso ng paglagi ng mga tropang militar at kanilang kagamitan sa Pilipinas. the Aquino regime agreeing to EDCA which states that the Philippines the courts in the country have no jurisdiction in cases or violations in the course of the stay of military troops and their equipment in the Philippines is direct surrender of national dignity. <20> Pumayag din ang papet na gobyerno na hindi idudulog ang anumang kaso sa anumang internasyunal na tribunal o korte. the puppet agreement also agreed to not report any case to any international tribunal or court. <21> Ang mga mabibigat na kasong tulad ng panggagahasa kay Nicole noong 2005, pagbaril kay Buyong-Buyong Isnijal at mga paglabag tulad ng pagtatapon ng toxic waste at iligal na paglayag sa protektadong mga lugar tulad ng ginawa ng USS Guardian na humantong sa pagkasira ng Tubbataha Reefs, ay hindi kailanman pinanagutan ng US at mga tropa nito alinsunod sa batas ng Pilipinas. the serious cases like the rape of Nicole in 2005, shooting of Buyong-Buyong Isnijal and the violations like dumping of toxic waste and illegal navigation in protected places like what the USS Guardian did that ended in the destruction of the Tubbataha Reefs, were never answered by the US and its troops in line with the laws of the Philippines. <22> Maamong tupang nakayukod si Aquino at mga alipores sa paglagda ng EDCA at sa paggamit ng US sa Pilipinas bilang launching pad para sa planong militarisasyon ng Asya Pasipiko. Aquino and allies are meek sheep bowing in signing the EDCA and the US using the Philippines as launching pad for the planned militarization of Asia Pacific. <23> Nais ilipat ng US sa Asya Pasipiko ang 60% ng kanyang tropa at lakas-militar hanggang 2020 maliban pa sa kasalukuyang nakaistasyong US 7th Fleet sa ilalim ng US Pacific Command sa rehiyon. the US wants to transfer 60% of its troops and military forces to Asia Pacific until 2020 not to mention the currently stationed US 7th Fleet under the US Pacific Command in the region. <24> Ang US na ngayo’y nakakaranas ng matinding depresyong pang-ekonomya, ay ititutulak ang estratehiyang "Pivot to Asia and Pacific". the US which is currently experiencing severe economic depression, is pushing for the strategy "pivot to Asia and the Pacific." <25> Nais tiyakin ng US na masasakatuparan ang mga pangekonomyang interes nito sa rehiyon para sa kapitalistang super-tubo, at kinukurdonan din nito ang pagpapalakas ng Tsina, bilang pangunahing karibal na kapangyarihang pang-ekonomya ng US sa Asia Pasipiko at mundo. the US wants to ensure that its economic interest in the region for capitalist super-profits will be carried out, and it is cordoning off the strengthening of China, as primary rival of economic power of the US in Asia Pacific and the world. <26> Ginagatungan ng US ang hidwaan ng Pilipinas at iba pang bansa sa Silangang Asya laban sa Tsina. the US is fueling the conflict of the Philippines and other countries in East Asia against China. <27> Imbes na tumulong upang higit na maresolba sa diplomatikong paraan ang usapin ng Scarborough, pinapayagan pa ng papet na rehimeng Aquino na magronda at maglunsad ng fly-bys ang mga fighter jets ng US malapit sa pinagtatalunang bahagi ng South China Sea. instead of helping to resolve the Scarborough issue in a diplomatic manner, the puppet Aquino regime allowed US fighter jets to make rounds and launch fly-bys near the contested part of the South China Sea. <28> Nagkukunwaring tutulungan ng US ang Pilipinas sa usapin nito sa Tsina hinggil sa Scarborough Shoal at Spratlys at ginagamit ng rehimeng Aquino ang katwirang ito upang ipatanggap sa mamamayan ang EDCA at umiigting na panghihimasok ng US. the US is pretending to help the Philippines in its issue with China about the Scarborough Shoal and Spratlys and the Aquino regime is using this argument so the people can accept the EDCA and the deepening involvement of the US. <29> Sa ilalim ng dominasyon ng US sa lahat ng rehimeng nagdaan, ang estado ay hindi man lamang makapagbuo ng nagsasariling patakang panlabas ng hindi naayon sa interes ng US. under the US domination on all past regimes, the state has never created its own external policy that is not aligned with US interest. <30> Sa kasalukuyan pumupostura ang rehimeng Aquinong idadaan sa negosasyon ang hiwaan sa Tsina para sa pag-gigiit ng Pilipinas ng Exclusive Economic Zone (EZZ) sa ilang bahagi ng South China Sea sa isang diplomatikong aksyon sa UN. currently the Aquino regime is positioning to make the conflict with China undergo negotiation for the Philippines' insistence on an exclusive economic zone (EZZ) on some parts of the South China Sea in a diplomatic action in the UN. <31> Ngunit ginawa ito ng rehimeng Aquino kaalinsabay ng pang-uupat ng tensyon sa Tsina sa pamamagitan ng katambal nitong lubos na pangangayupapa sa US. but the Aquino regime made it at the same time as the increasing tension with China through its partner absolute obedience to the US. <32> Hindi makatotohanan ang pagtindig ni Aquino para sa prinsipyo ng pambansang soberanya at teritoryal na integridad habang buong-buong binubuyangyang nito ang teritoryo ng bansa sa paggamit at panghihimasok ng US. Aquino standing for the principle of national sovereignty and territorial integrity is not realistic while he wholly exposes the territory of the country to use and involvement of the US. <33> Sa kasaysayan, ilang beses ng ginamit ng US ang Pilipinas bilang lunsaran ng mga digmang agresyon nito sa mundo. in history, the US has used the Philippines several times as a launching pad of its war aggression on the world. <34> Kabilang dito ang pagsugpo ng Boxer Rebellion sa Tsina (1900), Pagpadala ng tropang militar sa Siberia upang tumulong sa Tsar (1918-1920), Pagpadala ng hukbong pandagat sa Quemoy-Matsu sa Tsina para suportahan si ChiangKaiShek na nagbase sa Taiwan (1958), paggamit ng mga base para sa lohistikal na pangangailangan ng US sa giyera sa Korea (1950-53), pagpapadala ng diktadurang Marcos ng tropa sa Vietnam at paggamit ng US ng Clark bilang himpilan ng mga eroplanong pang-atake sa Vietnam (1965-1975), pagamit sa Clark bilang lunsaran ng US Special Operations Forces na ipinadala sa Iran (1980), pagpapadala ng tropang militar ng Pilipinas sa giyera at okupasyon ng US sa Afghanistan at Iraq (2003). included here are suppressing the Boxer Rebellion in China (1900), sending military troops to Siberia to help the czar (1918-1920), sending navy troops to Quemoy-Matsu in China to support Chang Kai Shek who made a base in Taiwan (1958), using bases for logistical needs of the US in the war in Korea (1950-53), the Marcos dictatorship sending troops to Vietnam and the US use of Clark as station of planes for attacking Vietnam (1965-1975), using Clark as a launching pad of the US Special Operations Forces that was sent to Iran (1980), sending military troops of the Philippines to the war and occupation of the US on Afghanistan and Iraq (2003). <35> Dapat alalahanin ng bawat kabataang Pilipino at mamamayan ang madugong giyerang agresyon ng US sa Pilipinas mula 1898 at saklutin ang bagong kalayaang natamasa ng mga PIlipino matapos ang Rebolusyong Pilipino 1986-1898 laban sa paghahari ng Espanya sa bansa. every Filipino youth and citizen should remember the bloody war aggression of the US on the Philippines since 1898 and snatch the freedom experienced by the Filipinos after the Philippine Revolution 1986-1898 against the rule of Spain in the country. <36> Itinuturing sa pandaigdigang kasaysayan bilang Unang Byetnam, ang pananakop ng US sa bansa ay nagdulot sa henosidyo ng US na nagmasaker sa halos 700, 000 hanggang 1 milyong Pilipino na lumaban sa imperyalistang pananakop ng US. considered in world history as the First Vietnam, the US colonization of the country caused US genocide that massacred almost 700,000 up to 1 million Filipinos who fought the imperialist occupation of the US. <37> Sa pagtatapos ng Ikalawang Digmaang Pandaigdig, ginawang pabitin at tiniyak ng US na lubos na aasa sa ayuda mula sa US ang papet na gobyerno ng Pilipinas para sa rekonstruksyon dulot ng giyera. at the end of the Second World War, was made a prize and the US ensured that the puppet government of the Philippines would absolutely depend on the assistance of the US for the reconstruction caused by war. <38> Kapalit ng ayuda, itinulak nito ang ibat ibang kasunduan at tratado na pawang nagtitiyak sa imperyalistang kontrol ng US sa Pilipinas kahit hindi na ito direktang kolonya. in exchange of assistance, it pushed for different agreements and treaties that all ensure the imperialist control of the US on the Philippines even if it is not a direct colony anymore. <39> Ang US-RP MBA ng 1947 ay pagpipino sa Treaty of General Relations of 1946, na nagbigay ng ligal na batayan sa pananatili ng base militar ng US at isa sa mga kundisyon ng US sa huwad na pagbibigay ng 1946 independensya sa Pilipinas matapos ang direktang pagkolonya sa atin. the US-RP MBA of 1947 is a refining of the Treaty of General Relations of 1946, which gave legal basis for the stay of US military bases and one of the conditions of the US is the fake offering of the 1946 independence to the Philippines after directly colonizing us. <40> Ang Mutual Defense Treaty na nilagdaang noong Agosto 1951 ay ginagamit ng US at lahat ng papet na rehimeng nagdaan upang bigyang batayang ligal ang VFA, Mutual Logistics Support Agreement (MLSA) at EDCA. the Mutual Defense Treaty signed on August 1951 is used by the US and all past puppet regimes to give legal basis to the VFA, Mutual Logistics Support Agreement (MLSA) and EDCA. <41> Nagpatibay ito sa neokolanyal na relasyon ng Pilipinas sa US at nagkaladkad sa Pilipinas suportahan ang lahat ng digmaang kinasasangkutan ng US. it confirmed the neocolonial relations of the Philippines and the US and dragged the Philippines to support all the wars the US is involved in. <42> Ginamit din ng diktaturyang Marcos ang base militar upang kunin ang buong suporta ng US sa pasistang estado at maningil sa US ng bayad-renta at bilyong dolyar na pautang kapalit ng pagpapanatili ni Marcos sa base militar ng US sa bansa. the Marcos dictatorship also used the military base to gain the complete support of the US in the fascist state and collect rent and billion-dollar debts from the US in exchange for Marcos allowing the stay of US military base in the country. <43> Isinunod ng US ang pagtitiyak na makadomina pa rin sa ekonomya at pulitika ng bansa lagpas ng 1946 sa pamamagitan ng pagdikta sa mga sumunod na papet na gobyerno at lagdaan ang Bell Trade Act of 1946, Parity Rights Amendment sa 1935 na Konstitusyon. the US followed with ensuring dominance on the economy and politics of the country after 1946 by dictating to the following puppet governments and signing the Bell Trade Act of 1946, Parity Rights Amendment in the 1935 Constitution. <44> Nagbigay ang mga tratadong ito ng pantay na karapatan sa US na lubos na gamitin ang likas na yaman ng bansa, liberalisasyon sa kalakalan, murang pasahod at lakas paggawa para sa mga korporasyong itatayo ng US. these treaties gave equal rights to the US to completely use the natural resources of the country, liberalization in trade, cheap wages and work force for the corporations the US will set up. <45> Ang sumunod na mga papet na gobyerno ay nagmantina at nagpatibay ng relasyong tuta-amo ng Pilipinas-Amerika sa ilalim ng malakolonyal at malapyudal na katangian ng lipunang Pilipino. the next puppet governments mandated and strengthened the dog-owner Philippine-American relations under the colonial-like and feudal-like characteristics of Philippine society. <46> Sinasagkaan ng imperyalistang US ang pagtatamo ng sambayanan ng tunay na kasarinlan at kalayaan, pag-unlad at katarungang panlipunan. the imperialist US is restraining the people's attainment of true independence and freedom, progress and social justice. <47> Ang kasalukuyang rehimeng US-Aquino sa utos ng amo nitong imperyalistang US ay patuloy na nagpapatupad ng mga patakarang neoliberal na pabor lamang sa monopolyo-kapitalista ng US, dayuhan at malalaking lokal na kapitalista at panginoong-maylupa tulad ni Aquino. the current US-Aquino regime through the order of its boss the imperialist US continues to implement neoliberal regulations in favor of only monopoly-capitalist US, foreign and big local capitalists and landlords like Aquino. <48> Kaya ang mga kasunduang tulad ng EDCA at pakanang Chacha ngayon sa Kongreso ni Aquino ay pakikipagsabwatan sa imperyalistang amo nito upang patuloy na makapaghari ang US sa pulitika, ekonomiya, militar at kultura ng ating bansa. which is why the agreements like EDCA and planned Chacha today in the Aquino Congress is a collusion with its imperialist boss to continue the rule of the US on the politics, economy, military and culture of our country. <49> Mas ibayong ibinubukas ng Chacha ang bansa sa ibayong pagsasamantala ng US sa ekonomya at lalong maghahadlang sa layunin ng tunay reporma sa lupa at pambansang industriyalisasyon. Chacha further opens the country to further US abuse on the economy and increasingly block the goal of true land reform and national industrialization. <50> Sa Chacha ipinipilit ang pagbubukas tungo sa 100% ng pagmamayari ng dayuhan ng mga lupain, korporasyon, serbisyo tulad ng edukasyon, hospital at media sa bansa na ipinagbabawal sa kasalukuyan. Chacha will force the opening towards the currently prohibited 100% foreign ownership of land, corporations, services like education, hospitals and media in the country. <51> Hindi maibabagon ng lubos na pangangayupapa ng rehimeng Aquino sa imperyalismong US ang nakalugmok na ekonmiya at kahirapan ng mayoryang mamamayan, kawalang lupa, mababang pasahod at pagsasamntala sa mga manggagawa, kawalang trabaho at serbisyong panlipunan. the absolute obedience of the Aquino regime to the imperialist US cannot stop the weak economy and poverty of the majority of the people, lack of land, low pay and abuse of workers, lack of jobs and social services. <52> Ang pagsasamantalang ito ay patuloy na sinasagot ng paglaban ng mamamayan at rebolusyonaryong kilusan. this abuse is continuously answered by the fight of the people and revolutionary movement. <53> Nararapat balikan ng mga kabataan ang kasaysayan at ang paghahari ng imperyalismong US sa ating bayan. the youth should return to history and the rule of imperialist US on our country. <54> Kailangang pagkaisahain ang mga kabataan at mamamayan at paigtingin ang kampanya para sa pagbabasura ng EDCA at tropang militar, at kaugnay na neoliberal na mga patakaran at pakana tulad ng Chacha. the youth and the people should be united and strengthen the campaign for the scrapping of EDCA and military troops, and related neoliberal regulations and plans like Chacha. <55> Kailangang ilunsad ang malawakang pagmumulat, propaganda at edukasyong masa hinggil sa EDCA, CHACHA at ang ugat nito sa batayang mga suliranin ng lipunang PiLipino_ang imperyalismo, burukrata-kapitalismo at pyudalismo. widespread awakening, propaganda and mass education should be launched about EDCA, Chacha and its roots on the foundation of Filipino society's problems - imperialism, bureaucrat-capitalism and feudalism. <56> Ilunsad natin ang maramihang mga study circles at discussion groups sa mga paaralan at opisina, mga pulong masa sa pagawaan at komunidad at ibat ibang uri ng talakayan at porma ng pagapapataas ng pagkakaisa ng kabataan at mamamayan. let us launch numerous study circles and discussion groups in schools and offices, mass councils in the factory and community and different kinds of discussion and forms of increasing the unity of the youth and people. <57> Higit kailanman, ngayon ang kabatang Pilipino ay nararapat na tumindig laban sa nakamumuhing pagkapapet, pahirap, pasismo at pagsasamantala ng korup na rehimeng Aquino at mga alipores nito, at sa patuloy na paghari-harian ng imperyalistang US sa lahat ng larangan ng lipunang Pilipino. more than ever, the Filipino youth should now stand against the disgusting puppethood, oppression, fascism and abuse of the corrupt Aquino regime and its followers, and the ongoing rule of the imperialist US in all parts of Filipino society. <58> Ang malakas na protesta ng kabataan Pilipino kasama ang iba’t ibang sektor mamamayan laban sa EDCA, pagbabalik ng base-militar at tumitinding panghihimasok ng US ay mag-aambag sa patuloy na pambayang pakikibaka para sa tunay na pambansang kalayaan at demokrasya. the loud protest of the Filipino youth together with different public sectors against EDCA, return of military bases and deepening involvement of the US will contribute to the ongoing public struggle for true national freedom and democracy.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_12142249 <1> Si Rex at ang Kanyang Pamilya Rex and his family <2> Posted by penpowersong Posted by penpowersong <3> Si Rex at ang Kanyang Pamilya Rex and his family <4> ni Apolinario Villalobos by Apolinario Villalobos <5> Nagkurus ang landas namin ni Rex (ayaw niyang ipabanggit ang apelyido niya) sa 7-11 store, tapat ng Robinson’s-Imus. Rex (whose surname he doesn't want to be mentioned) and I have crossed paths in a 7-11 store, across Robinson's-Imus. <6> Nagkakape ako noon habang hinihintay ko ang pagbukas ng mall kung saan naroon ang store ng computers na may magaling na technician na naging suki ko na, si Allen. I was having coffee that time while waiting for the mall to open where there is a computer store with a skillful technician who I always go to, he's Allen. <7> Nang umagang yon, ang suot na pantalon at polo shirt ni Rex ay halatang hindi na-plantsa pero hindi naman gusot talaga, at ang sapatos na suot ay mumurahing rubberized na itim pero naka- medyas naman siya. that morning, the pants and polo shirt worn by Rex were obviously not pressed but it was not really that crumpled, and the shoes he was wearing was a cheap rubberized black but he was wearing socks though. <8> Napansin kong nakatingin siya sa kape ko kaya inalok ko siya, at nang tumanggi ay tumayo pa rin ako upang ibili siya. I noticed that he was looking at my coffee so I asked him to have some, and when he refused I still stood to buy him one. <9> Sa halip na inumin agad ang kape, medyo nahihiya pang nagtanong kung pwede daw akong magpasa sa kanya ng load dahil iti-text daw niya ang supervisor ng inaaplayan niyang grocery, bilang merchandiser. Instead of readily drinking the coffee, he slightly was shy in asking if I can possibly pass him some load because he will be texting the supervisor of the grocery he applied at, as merchandiser. <10> Papasahan ko na sana pero nalaman kong Globe ang gamit niya at ako naman ay Smart kaya hindi puwede. I was about to do the pass but I learned that he was using Globe and I was on Smart so it won't do. <11> Binigyan ko na lang siya ng sampung pisong pang-load. I instead gave him ten pesos for loading. <12> Bago umalis upang magpa-load ay saka pa lang siya nagpakilala at iniwan din ang belt bag. Before he left to do the loading is the only time he said who he was and also left his belt bag. <13> Nang makabalik pagkatapos magpa-load ay nag-text agad sa supervisor ng inaaplayan niya para i-confirm na darating siya. Upon returning after doing the load, he readily texted the supervisor where he applied to confirm that he was coming. <14> Ipinagtapat niya na naglakad lang daw siya mula sa kubo nila sa isang bukid na malapit sa isang kilalang subdivision. he confessed that he only walked from their hut in a farm that is near a popular subdivision. <15> Wala daw talaga siyang pera dahil ang kinita niya sa pagbenta ng ilang taling kangkong at talbos ng kamote sa palengke ng Imus, madaling araw pa lang ay ibinili niya ng dalawang kilong bigas at apat na pirasong tuyo para may makain ang dalawa niyang kapatid bago pumasok sa eskwela…. he really doesn't have money because his earnings from selling several bundles of swamp cabbage and sweet potato tops in Imus market, from early dawn he already used to buy two kilos of rice and four pieces of dried herring so his two siblings will have something to eat before they go to school... <16> siya ay hindi na nag-almusal para may matirang kanin at ulam sa nanay niyang maysakit. he didn't have breakfast so there will be leftover rice and viand for his mother who is sick. <17> Ang natirang barya ay ibinigay niya sa kanyang nanay para maipon at maipambili ng gamot. The remaining coins he gave to his mother to save and use for buying medicine. <18> Bago daw umalis ay naglaga na rin siya ng talbos ng kamote para pandagdag sa inihaw na tuyo – almusal ng kanyang nanay. Before he left he also boiled sweet potato tops to add to the grilled dried herring - breakfast of his mother. <19> Sa nabili niyang apat na tuyo, bale tig-isa sila at ang share niya ay kakainin niya sa tanghalian. in the four dried herring he bought, they will have one each and he will eat his share for lunch. <20> Ang pambayad sana sa pagpa-repair ng laptop ko ay ibinigay ko na lang sa kanya at sinabihan ko siyang kapag natanggap sa trabaho ay ipagpatuloy niya ang ginagawa niyang pag-alaga sa mga kapatid at maysakit na nanay. The payment meant for repairing my laptop I instead gave to him and I told him that if he is accepted for the job that he continue what he is doing caring for his siblings and sick mother. <21> Sa patuloy na pagkuwento niya, maliit pa lang daw sila ay iniwan na sila ng tatay nila, kaya kung saan-saan daw sila tumira, pati sa bangketa ng Baclaran hanggang makarating sila sa Imus kung saan ay nakakita sila ng matalahib na bukid. As he continues to tell his story, even when they were small their father left them, so they lived from place to place, even by the sidewalk in Baclaran until they reached Imus where they found a grassy field. <22> Nagpaalam daw sila sa may-ari ng lupa bago naglinis ng lalagyan nila ng tulugan – actually, tarpaulin na nagsilbing bubong. they asked permission from the landowner before cleaning a place for their bedding - actually, tarpaulin that served as roof. <23> Mga karton na palagi nilang dala ang higaan nila. Cartons that they always brought were their bed. <24> Nakaipon ng mga kahoy ang dalawa niyang kapatid na namumulot ng junks kung walang pasok kaya unti-unti nilang nabuo ang kubo. his two siblings who pick up junk when there are no classes were able to gather wood so they were slowly able to build their hut. <25> Noon ay tumambay daw siya sa Imus market upang magkargador at magtawag ng pasahero sa termina ng jeep. back then he hung out at Imus market in order to become a porter and call for passengers at the jeep terminal. <26> Pinayagan silang magtanim ng gulay sa paligid at ang tubig na pandilig ay galing sa poso (deep well pump) ng may-ari ng lupa. they were permitted to plant vegetables along the area and the water for sprinkling comes from the well (deep well pump) of the landowner. <27> Nang magkaroon ng pagkakataon ay nag-aral siya ng Refrigetation sa TESDA. When the opportunity came he studied refrigeration at TESDA. <28> Ang TESDA certificate ang ginamit niya bilang patunay ng tinamong educational attainment sa pag-apply ng trabaho bilang merchandiser. he used the TESDA certificate as proof of the educational attainment he obtained in applying for work as merchandiser. <29> Kahit matanggap bilang merchandiser, magtitinda pa rin daw siya ng kangkong at talbos ng kamote sa madaling araw. even if accepted as merchandiser, he will still sell swamp cabbage and sweet potato tops in the early dawn. <30> Kung palarin, baka madadagdagan ang paninda niya ng kalabasa dahil ilang buwan na lang ay malalaki na ang bunga. if lucky, maybe his merchandise may increase to include squash because in several months the fruits will be bigger. <31> Nag-usap na daw sila ng mga kapatid niya kung paano silang makatulong sa pag-ani ng mga talbos tuwing hapon na ibebenta naman niya sa madaling araw. he and his siblings already spoke on how they would be able to help in harvesting the tops every afternoon that will then be sold in the early dawn. <32> Ang dalawa niyang kapatid ay sa isang public school na nasa tabi ng LTO-Imus, nag-aaral…naglalakad sila sa pagpasok at pag-uwi. his two siblings study in a public school that is near LTO-Imus. they walk going to class and back home. <33> Si Rex ay 23 years old, sinundan siya ng 9 na taong gulang na kapatid na lalaki at ang bunsong babae ay 7 years old naman…ang nanay naman nila ay 52 years old. Rex is 23 years old, followed by his 9 year old brother and the baby sister is 7 years old... their mother is 52 years old. <34> Nangako akong papasyalan ko sila dahil alam ko naman ang binanggit niyang bukid. I promised to visit them because I know the field he mentioned anyway. <35> Kung ang KARAMIHAN MAN LANG SANA ng mga kabataang Pilipino ay tulad nina Rex at mga kapatid niya, SANA AY WALANG GAANONG PROBLEMA ang ating bansa…. if only majority of the Filipino youth are like Rex and his siblings, our country may not have that many problems...

Manzo November 10, 2016 Dinnes M. Manzo <3> ROMBLON, Romblon, Nob. 10 (PIA) --- Ang Department of Energy (DOE) ay muling nagbigay ng panibagong proyekto na Biomass Gasification Technology sa mga residente ng Bgy. Alad sa bayan ng Romblon. Romblon, Romblon, November 10 (PIA) - the Department of Energy (DOE) once again contributed a new project, a Biomass Gasification Technology, to the residents of Barangay Alad in the municipality of Romblon. <4> Ang DOE at Romblon Electric Cooperative (ROMELCO) Inc. ay nakipagpulong sa mga residente ng Sitio Bagong Silang, Bgy. Alad, Romblon upang ipaliwanag sa mga ito kung paano pailawan ang kanilang kabahayan sa pamamagitan ng Biomass System. DOE and Romblon Electric Cooperative (ROMELCO) Incorporated met with the residents of Sitio Bagong Silang, Barangay Alad, Romblon to explain to them the process of bringing electricity to their homes through Biomass System. <5> Iprinisinta rin ng mga kinatawan ng DOE sa mga Barangay official ng Alad ang kahalagahan ng proyekto at kung paano matulungang mai-angat ang kalidad ng pamumuhay ng mamamayan. delegates of DOE presented to the barangay official of Alad the importance of the project and how it could help improve the quality of living of the population. <6> Ayon sa pamunuan ng Romelco, ang ganitong uri ng pailaw sa mga tahanan ay malaking tulong upang magliwanag ang buong kabahayan lalo na sa gabi at hindi na rin mahihirapan ang mga bata sa kanilang pag-aaral ng leksiyon. According to Romelco officials, this type of electricity to homes is a big help to illuminate the whole household especially at night and so children would no longer have difficulty in studying their lectures. <7> (DM/PIA- MIMAROPA/Romblon) (DM/PIA- MIMAROPA/Romblon)

Jabagat Orlan C. Jabagat <4> PUERTO PRINCESA, Palawan, Mayo 9 (PIA) --- Kumpiyansa ang Commission on Elections sa Palawan na matatapos ng maayos ang halalan ngayon araw sa kabila ng mga ulat na nagkaroon ng aberya ang ilang Vote Counting Machine (VCM) sa pagsisimula ng botohan. Puerto Princesa, Palawan, May 9 (PIA) - the Commission on Elections in Palawan is confident that election on this day will end properly despite reports that some vote counting machines (VCM) had mechanical trouble at the start of election. <5> Ayon kay Provincial Election Supervisor Atty. Percival Mendoza, sapat ang back-up VCM sa Palawan sakaling magkaroon ng aberya ang mga nasabing makina. according to Provincial Election Supervisor Attorney Percival Mendoza, the back-up VCM in Palawan is enough in case the said machines have mechanical trouble. <6> Nakaantabay din ang mga technician ng Smartmatic sa mga clustered precincts upang magbigay ng teknikal na ayuda sa mga Board of Election Inspector. Smartmatic technicians are also on standby in clustered precincts to give technical assistance to the Board of Election inspector. <7> Kahapon dumating na rin ang isang Secured Digital o SD Card para sa VCM sa precinct no. 23 ng Barangay Ipilan sa Bayan ng Brooke’s Point. also yesterday a secured digital or SD card for the VCM in precinct number 23 in Barangay Ipilan in the town of Brooke's Point arrived. <8> Natuklasan ng COMELEC na walang kasamang SD Card ang VCM ng magsagawa ng final testing ang sealing kamakailan. the COMELEC discovered that the VCM did not come with an SD card when they did a final testing of the sealing recently. <9> Samantala, bago mag-alas-6 ng umaga ay nagsimula ng humaba ang pila ng mga botante sa iba’t-ibang voting places sa lungsod ng Puerto Princesa. meanwhile, before six o'clock in the morning the line of voters in different voting places in the city of Puerto Princesa has started to grow. <10> Kapansin-pansin din ang presensiya ng mga kapulisan at miyembro ng Armed Forces of the Philippines dito. also noticeable is the presence of the police and members of the Armed Forces of the Philippines here. <11> Binibigyan din ng priyoridad ang mga senior citizens at mga buntis na unang makaboto. senior citizens and the pregnant were given priority to vote first. <12> Mayroong kabuuhang 433 barangay, 583,057 registered voters at 514 voting centers ang Palawan. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_35362598 <1> DSWD sinisi ang LGUs sa ‘slow’ Bicol relief By Jun Tadios January 5, 2017Isinisi ng Department of Social Welfare and ­Development (DSWD) sa local government units (LGUs) ang nararanasang delay sa pagpapadala ng relief goods sa mga lugar na binayo ni bagyong ‘Nina’ partikular na sa Bicol. DSWD blames the LGUs in slow Bicol relief by Jun Tadios January 5, 2017 the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) has blamed the local government units (LGUs) in the delay experienced in the sending of relief goods to the places devastated by typhoon Nina particularly in Bicol. <2> Gayunman, nilinaw ni Secretary Judy Taguiwalo na hindi nagpapabaya ang pamahalaan sa pagpapadala ng relief goods sa mga lugar na binayo ng bagyong ‘Nina’. nevertheless, Secretary Judy Taguiwalo clarified that the government is not neglecting the sending of relief goods to the places devastated by typhoon Nina. <3> Maagap ang DSWD sa pag-aksyon sa mga lugar na tinamaan ng bagyo noong Pasko at garantisadong naibigay ang bawat pangangaila­ngan ng mga biktima ng bagyo alinsunod sa mandato o sakop ng tulong na kayang ibigay ng kagawaran. DSWD was alert in taking action in the places hit by the typhoon last Christmas and guarantees that each need of the victims of the typhoon is given in accordance to the mandate or covered by the aide that their department can give. <4> May insidente man umano nang mabagal na dating ng relief goods ay nasa lebel na aniya ito ng lokal na pamahalan dahil sila ang naatasang ma­migay sa mga apektadong barangay o lugar. there might be incidents that the arrival of former relief goods is slow, this is already in the level of the local government because they are mandated to distribute to the affected barangay or place. <5> Reaksyon ito ng DSWD sa pahayag ni Vice President Leni Robredo na mabagal ang da­ting ng tulong sa mga biktima ng bagyo sa Camarines Sur na hometown ng bise presidente. this is a reaction of the DSWD in the statement of Vice President Leni Robredo on the slow arrival of aide to the victims of typhoons in Camarines Sue which is the hometown of the vice-president. <6> “Bago pa man po mag-landfall si Nina sa mga affected areas, the DSWD had prepositioned food packs in addition doon sa sariling food packs ng mga LGUs dahil may kanya-kanya naman silang calamity funds. So hindi po dapat sa DSWD ang sinisisi sa ganitong mga pangyayari dahil we are pro-active and always ready to help our kababayan na nag-Pasko na may bagyo,” wika ng kalihim. "even before Nina has taken a landfall in the affected areas, the DSWD has prepositioned the food packs in addition to the respective food packs of the LGUs because they have each their own calamity funds. so, the DSWD should not be blamed in this kind of incident because we are pro-active and always ready to help our countrymen who are celebrating Christmas while there is a typhoon," the secretary said. <7> Gayunpaman, ­humingi ng paumanhin ang DSWD kung mayroon man aniyang delay ng distribution ng food packs mula sa national government. nevertheless, the DSWD asks for an apology if there are said delays in the distribution of food packs from the national government. <8> “This is a challenge to us. Mayroon palang ganitong insidente kaya hindi natin ito papayagang mangyari. We are here to help our kababayan and out mandate to serve them is our top priority,” giit ni Taguiwalo. "this is a challenge to us. this kind of incident actually is present, so, we should not allow this to happen. we are here to help our fellow countrymen and our mandate to serve them is our top priority," asserted by Taguiwalo.

Ian is also with Iza Calzado, Epi Quizon, Therese Malvar, Xyriel Manabat, and Harvey Bautista. <16> Ito ay sa direksiyon ni Dan Villegas. it is under the direction of Dan Villegas.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_73575619 <1> BAGONG ‘FISHERY REGULATION’ NG BANSANG TSINA MAY bago na namang alituntunin ang Tsina. new fishing regulation of the country China China has a new regulation. <2> Bawal ang mangisda sa kanilang “teritoryo.” fishing is prohibited in their territory. <3> Sasamsamin ang lahat ng huling isda at mga gamit pangisda at papatawan ng multang hindi hihigit sa 500,000 Yuan (o Php3.3 Milyon) ang mahuhuling lumalabag. confiscate all the fishes caught and fishing equipment and impose fine not more than 500,000 yuan or (Php 3.3 million) for those who will be caught violating. <4> Ang sinasabi nilang kanilang “teritoryo” ay ang nasasakupan ng walang basehang “nine-dash line.” At ang “siyam na guhit” sa mapa ng karagatang kanilang inaangkin (subalit walang basehan sa UNCLOS) ay sumasakop din sa malaking bahagi ng West Philippine Sea—kasama ang 200 Nautical Mile Exclusive Economic Zone ng Pilipinas. the territory they said as theirs is part of the baseless nine-dash line. and the nine dashes on the map of the ocean which they are claiming (but baseless in the UNCLOS) is covering a large part of the West Philippine Sea - including the 200 Nautical Mile Exclusive Economic Zone of the Philippines. <5> Maliwanag ang pattern ng Tsina sa pagbibigay ng mga pansariling deklarasyon. the pattern of China is clear in giving their own declaration. <6> Sinimulan muna nitong ipaalala muli sa mundo ang kanyang “nasasakupang” katubigan na napapaloob sa “nine dash line.” it started to make the world remember of the sea it covers within the nine dash line. <7> Matapos ‘yun, nagdeklara naman ang Tsina ng Air Defense Identification Zone (ADIZ) sa East China Sea na may layuning iitsapwera ang mga bansang kanugnog nito sa silangan na lumipad sa papawirin na “nasasakupan” nito. after that, China declared an Air Defense Identification Zone (ADIZ) at the East China Sea which aims to dismiss its neighboring countries in the east from flying over the airspace it "covers". <8> Hangad nitong makamit ang seguridad sa kanyang air space. it aims to achieve security in its air space. <9> Hindi nakapagtatakang ang kasunod na naging hakbang ng Tsina ay ang pinakahuli nitong deklarasyon. it is not even a wonder that the next step of China is its latest declaration. <10> Sa naturang pagbabawal sa pangingisda sa karagatang sakop ng South China Sea, walang makapangingisda sa dakong ‘yun nang walang pahintulot ng Tsina. in the said prohibition on fishing on the ocean which is part of the South China Sea, no one can fish on that part without China's permission. <11> Layon ng pagbabawal ang food security para sa kanyang mamamayan. the objective of the prohibition is the food security of its citizens. <12> Wala pa namang marahas na hakbang ang Tsina laban sa mga sumusuway sa kanyang mga deklarasyon. China has no violent step yet against those who are violating its declaration. <13> Subalit malinaw ang mga nakasulat sa pader, at ang mensahe ng Tsina ay tila: “Wala kaming sisinuhin.” but what is written on the wall is clear, and the message of China seems: "we do not exempt anyone." <14> Maraming insidente na ang napabalita kung saan ang kinikilalang nag-iisang superpower sa mundo, ang Amerika, ay kanya nang sinampolan. Napabalita ang nangyari sa barko ng Amerika na USS Impeccable kung saan sinasabing muntik na silang magkabanggaan ng isang barko ng Tsina matapos tawirin ng huli ang direksyong binabagtas ng una. many incidents have been reported where the only recognized superpower in the world, the America, has been made as its example. the incident happened to the ship of America, the USS Impeccable, was reported to have almost collided with a Chinese ship when the latter crossed the direction taken by the former. <15> Gayundin ang barkong USS John McCaine na ang kanyang towed array ay sinira ng isang submarinong diumano’y pag-aari ng Tsina. as well as the USS John McCaine ship whose towed array was destroyed by a submarine said to be owned by China. <16> Pinakahuli ay ang insidente na muntik nang magkabanggaan ang isang barkong pandigma ng Tsina at ang USS Cowpens noong ika-5 ng Disyembre 2013. the latest is the incident where China's warship and USS Cowpens almost collided to each other last December 5, 2013. <17> At ang pinaka-finale kumbaga ng pagpapakita ng Tsina ng kanyang military muscle ay ang paglulunsad at paglalayag ng kanyang pinakaunang aircraft carrier, ang Liaoning. and the most final, or the display of China of its military muscle, is the launching and sailing of its first aircraft carrier, the Liaoning. <18> Ang huling pagbabawal ng Tsina sa pangingisda sa karagatang “sakop” nila ay tuwirang nakaaapekto sa kabuhayan ng mga mamamayan sa mga bansang umaangkin sa pinag-aagawang teritoryo. the latest prohibition of China to fish on the ocean it covers is directly affecting the livelihood of the citizens of the countries claiming the disputed territory. <19> Sa ganang Pilipinas, nililinaw ng Kagawaran ng Ugnayang Panlabas kung anong ibig sabihin ng Tsina sa kanyang pagbabawal gayong ang lugar pangisdaang kanyang sinasaklawan ay bahagi pa ng ating 200 nautical mile EEZ. for the Philippines, the Commission on International Relations clarified what China meant in its prohibition while the fishing zone it covers is still part of our 200 nautical mile EEZ. <20> Mas malaman ang napaulat na sagot ng tagapagsalita ng kaparehong tanggapan sa bansang Vietnam. the report of the reply of the spokesperson of both department of the country Vietnam has a good content. <21> Aniya, iligal at walang basehan ang anomang aktibidad sa Paracels at Spratlys nang walang permiso ng kanyang bansa. according to him, any activity on the Paracels and Spratlys has no basis if it does not have a permit from its country. <22> Kung ating lilimiin, ang bansang may kakayahang ipatupad ang kanyang deklarasyon ay nananaig. if we pay attention to it, the country which has the ability to implement its declaration wins. <23> Ang mga mangingisdang Tsino ay pumapasok na sa loob ng EEZ ng Pilipinas. the Chinese fishermen are entering inside the EEZ of the Philippines. <24> Sa mapanirang pamamaraan, kinukuha nila ang mga yamang-dagat ng bansa. in a destructive way, they are taking the marine resources of the country. <25> At habang ginagawa nila iyon, nakamasid sa ‘di kalayuan ang mga bapor pandigma ng Tsina. while they are doing it, the warships of China are just watching not far from the distance. <26> Sa pagsasabing iligal ang anomang pangingisda sa teritoryo nito na walang permiso ng Vietnam, may malakas na Navy na may submarinong nagmamatyag upang magtaboy ng mga dayuhang papasok sa kanyang EEZ. in telling that any fishing is illegal in its territory without the permission of Vietnam, it has a strong Navy with a submarine observing to drive away the foreigners in its EEZ. <27> Noong magdeklara ng ADIZ ang Tsina sa East China Sea, lumipad ang mga eroplanong pandigma ng Hapon at ng South Korea sa mismong papawiring sakop ng ADIZ na idineklara ng Tsina na tuwirang humahamon at sumusubok sa pagbabawal. when China declared ADIZ in the East China sea, the war planes of Japan and South Korea flew on the skies covered by ADIZ itself which is declared by China as a direct challenge and attempt against the prohibition. <28> Sa iisang sitwasyong kinahaharap, mapayapang solusyon ang hanap ng ating bansa laban sa mapangahas na hakbangin ng Tsina. in facing a similar situation, our country is looking for a peaceful solution against the daring steps of China. <29> Dumulog tayo sa International Tribunal on the Law of the Sea (ITLOS) at nagsampa ng kaso. we went to the International Tribunal on the Law of the Sea (ITLOS) and filed the case. <30> Sapagkat sa kasalukuyang kalagayan ng ating bansa, hindi pa sapat ang ating kakayahang tanuran o patrulyahan ang malaking bahagi na ating nasasakupan. because in the current condition of our country, our capacity to watch over and patrol the large part of our territory is not enough. <31> Bagama’t nasa direksyong pagpapalakas na tayo ng ating Navy at Air Force, but we are on the direction of strengthening our Navy and Air Force. <32> mahaba-habang panahon pa ang gugulin bago natin makamit ang tinatawag nilang minimum credible deterrence dahil sa “magkakasalungat” na mga prayoridad. a longer time still needs to be spent before we can achieve what they called as minimum credible deterrence because of the contradictory priorities. <33> Maraming suliranin ang ating bansa: edukasyon, kalusugan, at iba pang serbisyong panlipunan. our country has a lot of problems: education, health, and other public services. <34> Wika nga ng iba nating kababayan, bago armasan ang gwardiya, pag-aaral at kalusugan muna ng mga anak. told by our other fellowmen, before arming the guards, education and health of the children first. <35> Subalit sa kasalukuyang mga kaganapan sa West Philippine Sea, hindi ba prayoridad ding may kakayahan tayong protektahan at masiguro ang kapakanan, kabuhayan, kalikasan, at kinabukasan ng ating mga kapwa Filipino at ng susunod pang henerasyon? however, in the current events in the West Philippine Sea, should we not also prioritize our capacity to protect and ensure the well-being, livelihood, nature and future of our co-Filipinos and the next generation? <36> Sa isang pulo-pulong bansa na tulad ng Pilipinas, ang malakas na Navy ang kailangan. in an archipelagic country like the Philippines, a strong Navy is needed. <37> Sa isang malakas na Navy, hindi ibig sabihin ay nais na nating makidigma. in a strengthened Navy, it does not mean that we want to have war. <38> Hangad natin ay dignidad at paggalang mula sa pamayanan ng mga bansa. we aspire for dignity and respect from the citizenry of countries. <39> Hindi natin hangad ang isang blue Navy na maglalayag sa pitong karagatan ng daigdig, hangad lamang natin ay isang Hukbong Dagat na may sapat na kakayahan upang maitaboy at mabawalan ang sinomang may masamang hangarin sa ating bansa, sa likas na yaman, at mamamayan nito. we do not aspire a blue Navy which sails the seven oceans of the world, we only aspire for a naval force which has enough capacity to drive and prohibit anyone who has a bad intention to our country, natural resources and its citizens. <40> Buksan natin ang ating isip. let us open our minds. <41> Panahon na para pag-ibayuhin natin ang kakayahan ng ating mga gwardiya. it is time to intensify the capacity of our guards.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_75343149 <1> Ang Bitukang Manok sa Pasig, Atimonan, Daet at sa Kasaysayan ng Katipunan Bitukang Manok in Pasig, Atimonan, Daet and the history of the Katipunan <2> ANG BITUKANG MANOK SA PASIG, ATIMONAN, DAET AT SA KASAYSAYAN NG KATIPUNAN ni Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. Bitukang Manok in Pasig, Atimonan, Daet and the history of the Katipunan by Gregorio V. Bituin Junior <3> Noong Oktubre 9, 2014, kami sa Climate Walk ay tumahak sa tinatawag na Bitukang Manok sa Atimonan, Quezon. on October 9, 2014, we at Climate Walk traveled to what is called Bitukang Manok in Atimonan, Quezon. <4> Iyon ang ikalawang Bitukang Manok na nalaman ko. that is the second Bitukang Manok I am aware of. <5> Dahil ang alam kong Bitukang Manok ay nasa Lungsod ng Pasig, na kadalasang tinatalakay namin sa usaping kasaysayan, lalo na sa Katipunan ni Gat Andres Bonifacio. because the Bitukang Manok I know is located in Pasig City, that we usually talk about in historical discussions, especially on the Katipunan of Gat Andres Bonifacio. <6> Mahalaga ang Bitukang Manok sa kasaysayan ng pakikibaka ng Katipunan dahil pinagpulungan iyon ng mga Katipunero sa pangunguna ni Bonifacio. Bitukang Manok is important in the history of the fight of the Katipunan because the Katipuneros held meetings there led by Bonifacio. <7> Tatlong historyador ang nagbanggit nito. three historians mentioned it. <8> Ang dalawa ay kaibigan ko at kasama sa grupong Kamalaysayan (Kaisahan sa Kamalayan sa Kasaysayan, na dating Kampanya para sa Kamalayan sa Kasaysayan). two are my friends and co-members in the group Kamalaysayan (Kaisahan sa Kamalayan sa Kasaysayan, formerly Kampanya para sa Kamalayan sa Kasaysayan). <9> Ang Climate Walk ay isang kampanya para sa Katarungang Pangklima o Climate Justice, at isang mahabang lakbayan, o lakaran mula sa Luneta (Kilometer Zero) hanggang sa Tacloban (Ground Zero) na aming isinagawa mula Oktubre 2, na Pandaigdigang Araw ng Hindi Paggamit ng Dahas (International Day on Non- Violence), hanggang Nobyembre 8, 2014, ang unang anibersaryo ng matinding bagyong Yolanda. Climate Walk is a campaign for Katarungang Pangklima or Climate Justice, and a long journey, or walk from Luneta (kilometer zero) to Tacloban (ground zero) that we held from October 2, the International Day on Non-Violence (International Day on Non-Violence), to November 8, 2014, the anniversary of the strong typhoon Yolanda. <10> Ang ikalawang Bitukang Manok na nalaman ko ay hindi isang ilog, kundi isang paliku-likong daan. the second Bitukang Manok I discovered is not a river, but a winding path. <11> Tinawag na Bitukang Manok dahil animo'y bituka ng manok na paliku-liko ang daraanan. called Bitukang Minok due to the winding path that resembles the intestine of a chicken. <12> Dito nga kami sa Climate walk tumahak, at habang naglalakad dito'y nagsulat ako ng tula sa aking maliit na kwaderno. it was here in Climate Walk we explored, and while walking here I wrote a poem on my small notebook. <13> Nakita ni kasamang Albert Lozada ng Greenpeace ang pagsulat ko ng tula, kaya ipinatipa niya iyon sa akin sa kanyang cellphone, na siya naman niyang ipinadala sa tanggapan ng Greenpeace upang i-upload sa kanilang website. companion Albert Lozada of Greenpeace saw me writing the poem, so he asked me to type it on his cellphone, which was then sent to the office of Greenpeace to be uploaded on their website. <14> Narito ang tula: here is the poem: <15> PAGTAHAK SA BITUKANG MANOK 11 pantig bawat taludtod exploring Bitukang Manok 11 syllables each line <16> Tinahak namin ang Bitukang Manok Na bahagi ng mahabang Climate Walk Kaysasaya naming mga kalahok Nag-aawitan, di nakakaantok we explored Bitukang Manok that was part of the long Climate Walk we participants were really happy singing, not drowsy <17> Napakahaba man nitong lakaran Ay makararating din sa Tacloban Lalo't kaysaya ng pagsasamahan Ang pagod ay tila 'di namin ramdam the path may be very long but it will still end up in Tacloban especially when the company is enjoyable we can't seem to feel fatigue <18> Sariwang hangin, walang mga usok Dito'y gubat na gubat pa ang bundok Kay sarap dito sa Bitukang Manok Kahit 'di namin narating ang tuktok. fresh air, no smog here the mountains are all forests how nice it is here in Bitukang Manok even if we didn't reach the top. <19> \- Bitukang Manok, Atimonan, Quezon, Octubre 9, 2014 - Bitukang Manok, Atimonan, Quezon, October 9, 2014 <20> Ang tulang ito'y nalathala sa website ng GreenPeace na in-upload doon ni Jenny Tuazon. this poem was published on the website of GreenPeace which was uploaded there by Jenny Tuazon. <21> Maraming salamat sa inyo, Greenpeace! thanks to you, Greenpeace! <22> Mabuhay kayo! more power to you! <23> Ang ikatlong Bitukang Manok ay nahanap ko sa internet. the third Bitukang Manok, I found through the internet. <24> At ito'y nasa rehiyon ng Bikol, nasa Daet, Camarines Norte. and it is in the Bicol region, in Daet, Camarines Norte. <25> Ito'y nasa kahabaan ng national highway malapit sa hangganan ng Camarines Sur at Camarines Norte, at nasasakupan ng Bicol National Park. it's along the national highway near the boundary of Camarines Sur and Camarines Norte, and under Bicol National Park. <26> Ang unang Bitukang Manok na alam ko, bago naging bahagi ng kasaysayan ng Katipunan, ay isang kaharian sa panahon ni Dayang Kalangitan (na isinilang ng 1450 at namatay ng taon 1515). the first Bitukang Manok I know, before becoming a part of the history of the Katipunan, is a kingdom during the time of Dayang Kalangitan (who was born in 1450 and died in the year 1515). <27> Siya ang tanging reynang namuno sa Kaharian ng Tondo, at nagtatag din ng maliit na kaharian sa makasaysayang Bitukang Manok, na nasasakop ng Pasig. she is the only queen to have ruled the Kingdom of Tondo, and also established a smaller kingdom in the historic Bitukang Manok, a part of Pasig. <28> Si Dayang Kalangitan ang panganay na anak ni Raha Gambang na itinuturing na isa sa pinakamakapangyarihang pinuno ng kaharian. Dayang Kalangitan was the eldest child of Raha Gambang who was considered one of the most powerful leaders of the kingdom. <29> Noong araw, nang hindi pa nasasakop ng mga Kastila ang bansa, nasasakop ng Tondo ang malaking bahagi ng lupain, kasama na ang Pasig. back in the day, when the Spanish had not yet conquered the country, Tondo covered a large part of the land, including Pasig. <30> Nang mamatay ang kanyang ama, si Dayang Kalangitan ang humalili. when her father died, it was Dayang Kalangitan who took over. <31> Napangasawa niya si Gat Lontok, na nang lumaon ay naging Raha Lontok, na hari ng Tondo. she married Gat Lontok, who eventually became Raha Lontok, the king of Tondo. <32> Sinasabing ang pamumuno ni Dayang Kalangitan ay katulad ng pamumuno ni Prinsesa Urduja ng Pangasinan. it is said that the leadership of Dayang Kalangitan was similar to the leadership of Princess Urduja of Pangasinan. <33> Napangasawa ng anak niyang babaeng si Dayang Panginoon si Prinsipe Balagtas ng Namayan, at anak ni Emperatris Sasaban. her daughter Dayang Panginoon married Prince Balagtas of Namayan, and offspring of Empress Sasaban. <34> Ang anak ni Dayang Kalangitan na si Salalila ang humalili sa kanya, at nang nagpasakop na si Salalila sa Islam, napalitan na ang kanyang pangalan ng Sulaiman, na sa kalaunan ay naging ang makasaysayang si Raha Sulaiman na siyang hari ng Tondo. the child of Dayang Kalangitan Salalila was the one who replaced her, and when Salalila surrendered to Islam, his name was changed to Sulaiman, eventually becoming the historic Raha Sulaiman who was the king of Tondo. <35> Ang nasabing Bitukang Manok sa Pasig ang naging pulungan ng mga Katipunero noong panahon ni Bonifacio. the said Bitukang Manok in Pasig became the meeting place of the Katipuneros during the time of Bonifacio. <36> Ayon kay Ed Aurelio Reyes (1952-2015) ng Kamalaysayan, noong maagang bahagi ng Mayo 1896, panahon ng peregrinasyon sa Birhen ng Antipolo, isang armada ng labimpitong bangka ang gumaod mula sa Quiapo, sakay ang mga pinuno ng iba't ibang konsehong panlalawigan ng Katipunan. according to Ed Aurelio Reyes (1952-2015) of Kamalaysayan, in the early part of May 1896, period of pilgrimage to the Virgin of Antipolo, an armada of seventeen boats paddled from Quiapo, carrying the leaders of different provincial councils of the Katipunan. <37> Pinangungunahan ito ni Gat Andres Bonifacio. it was led by Gat Andres Bonifacio. <38> Nakarating sila sa bahagi ng ilog na tinatawag na Bitukang Manok, at sinalubong sila ni Gen. they reached the part of the river called Bitukang Manok, and they were welcomed by General <39> Valentin Cruz, sa isang pagtitipon na tinawag na "Asamblea Magna". Valentin Cruz, to a gathering called "Asamblea Magna". <40> Sa Bitukang Manok idinaos ng mga Katipunero ang pulong kung saan napagpasyahan nilang simulan ang digmaan laban sa Espanya. it was in Bitukang Manok the Katipuneros held the meeting where they decided to start the war against Spain. <41> Bagamat may pag-aatubili ang ilan hinggil sa pasyang ito, lalo na si Emilio Aguinaldo ng Cavite, ang Pagpapasya sa Bitukang Manok ang isang desisyong pinagkaisahan at pinagtibay ng mga Katipunero mula Batanes hanggang Cotabato. even if some had doubts about this decision, especially Emilio Aguinaldo of Cavite, the decision at Bitukang Manok was a decision agreed on and ratified by the Katipuneros from Batanes to Cotabato. <42> Ayon naman ay Jose Eduardo Velasquez, ikalawang pangulo ng Kamalaysayan at batikang historyador ng Pasig na humalili kay Carlos Tech na nakapagsagawa ng panayam kay Heneral Valentin Cruz noong 1956, ang plano ng Katipunan sa matagumpay na Nagsabado sa Pasig ay pinagpulungan sa Bitukang Manok. according to Jose Eduardo Velasquez, second president of Kamalaysayan and known historian of Pasig who replaced Carlos Tech who was able to interview General Valentine Cruz in 1956, the plan of the Katipunan in the successful Nagsabado sa Pasig was discussed in a meeting in Bitukang Manok. <43> Kasabay ng pagkatalo ng mga Katipunero sa Pinaglabanan sa San Juan, nagtagumpay naman ang mga Katipunero sa Pasig noong Agosto 29, 1896, araw ng Sabado. along with the defeat of the Katipuneros in the battle of San Juan, the Katipuneros in Pasig were victorious on August 29, 1896, Saturday. <44> Pinangunahan ni Heneral Valentin Cruz ang mahigit dalawanglibong (2,000) Pasigenyo sa pagsalakay sa kuta ng mga gwardya sibil sa pinakamalaking garison sa labas ng Maynila. General Valentin Cruz led the more than two thousand (2,000) Pasiguenos in attacking the fort of the civil guards at the largest garrison outside of Manila. <45> Nakubkob nila ang kuta, at nakasamsam doon ng tatlong armas na Remington at labimpitong ripleng de piston. they seized the fort, and confiscated there were three Remington firearms and seventeen piston rifles. <46> Ang tagumpay na ito'y pinagdiriwang ng mga Pasigenyo hanggang ngayon bilang unang tagumpay ng mga Katipunero laban sa mapagsamantalang mananakop. this victory is celebrated by the Pasiguenos up to this day as the first victory of the Katipuneros against the abusive conquerors. <47> Isandaang taon matapos ang tagumpay ng Nagsabado sa Pasig, nananatiling buhay sa diwa ng mga Pasigenyo ang kabayanihan ng mga Katipunero at ipinagdiwang nila ang sentenaryo nito noong Agosto 29, 1996. one hundred years after the victory of Nagsabado sa Pasig, the heroism of the Katipuneros remain alive in the minds of Pasiguenos and they celebrated its centennial on August 29, 1996. <48> Ayon naman kay Pablo S. Trillana, mula sa Philippine Historical Association, sa pulong ng Mayo 4, 1896 sa Bitukang Manok, kinausap ni Supremo Andres Bonifacio si Dr. Pio Valenzuela upang kausapin si Jose Rizal hinggil sa sisimulang rebolusyon. according to Pablo S. Trillana, from the Philippine Historical Association, in the meeting on May 4, 1896 at Bitukang Manok, Supreme Leader Andres Bonifacio talked to Doctor Pio Valenzuela to contact Jose Rizal about the starting revolution. <49> Naganap ang pulong nina Rizal at Valenzuela sa Dapitan sa Mindanao noong Hunyo 21-22, 1896, dalawang buwan bago ilunsad ng Katipunan ang himagsikan. the meeting of Rizal and Valenzuela happened in Dapitan in Mindanao on June 21-22, 1896, two months before the Katipunan launched the revolution. <50> Tinanggihan ni Rizal ang alok ni Bonifacio, dahil para kay Rizal, hindi pa hinog ang himagsikan. Rizal turned down the offer of Bonifacio, because according to Rizal, the revolution was not yet ready. <51> Animo'y sawa ang kailugan ng Bitukang Manok na isang mayor na bahagi ng Ilog Pasig. the river at Bitukang Manok that is a major part of the Pasig River resembles a python. <52> Tinawag ito ng mga Espanyol noon na "Rio de Pasig" (o Ilog ng Pasig), ngunit patuloy pa rin itong tinawag ng mga mamamayan doon na Bitukang Manok. the Spanish back then called it "Rio de Pasig" (or Pasig River), but the residents there continue to call it Bitukang Manok. <53> Ang Bitukang Manok ay dumurugtong sa Ilog ng Antipolo. Bitukang Manok is connected to the Antipolo River. <54> Noong ika-17 hanggang ika-20 siglo, maraming lakbayan patungong Simbahan ng Antipolo ang tumatahak sa kahabaan ng Bitukang Manok. during the 17th to 20th centuries, many trips to the Antipolo Church traveled along the length of Bitukang Manok. <55> Kahit ang imahen ng Our Lady of Peace and Good Voyage ay labing-isang ulit na pabalik-balik na dumaan sa Bitukang Manok. even the statue of Our Lady of Peace and Good Voyage repeatedly passed through Bitukang Manok eleven times. <56> Noong ika-18 siglo, tinayuan ito ng mga mestisong Tsino ng kongkretong tulay na estilong pagoda na tinawag na Pariancillo Bridge, na sa kalaunan ay naging Fray Felix Trillo Bridge bilang pagpupugay sa kilalang pastor ng Pasig. during the 18th century, mestizo Chinese erected on it a concrete bridge in the style of a pagoda called Pariancillo Bridge, that eventually became Fray Felix Trillo Bridge in honor of the famous pastor of Pasig. <57> Ang Bitukang Manok ngayon sa Pasig ay isa nang naghihingalong ilog, dahil imbis na protektahan ang ilog ay tinayuan ito ng mga komersyal na establisimyento. Bitukang Manok today in Pasig is already a dying river, because instead of protecting the river commercial establishments were built on it. <58> Ito'y nasa 3.6 kilometro mula sa kinatatayuan ng McDonalds hanggang sa kinatatayuan ng pabrikang Asahi Glass sa Pinagbuhatan sa Pasig. it is about 3.6 kilometers from where a McDonalds is located up to where the factory of Asahi Glass in Pinagbuhatan in Pasig stands. <59> Tulad ng iba pang mahahalagang pook sa bansa, makasaysayan ang Bitukang Manok sa Pasig at hindi ito dapat mawala o masira. like many important locations in the country, Bitukang Manok in Pasig is historical and should not disappear or be ruined. <60> Dapat itong pahalagahan ng henerasyon ngayon at ng mga susunod pang henerasyon. it should be valued by the generation today and by future generations.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_48744503 <1> Alaska Milk Fun Run ratsada ngayon By Ramil Cruz Alaska Milk Fun Run accelerating by Ramil Cruz <2> June 11, 2016 June 11, 2016 <3> Itatampok ang kahalagahan ng tamang nutrisyon at ehersisyo na may 5K, 3K & 1K Fun Run sa pagdiriwang ng Alaska Milk Day ngayon sa McKinley West Taguig City, SM City-Naga City, SM City Davao City, at sa SM Seaside Cebu City. the importance of proper nutrition and exercise will be highlighted in the 5K, 3K and 1K Fun Run in celebration of Alaska Milk Day now at Mckinley West Taguig City, SM City-Naga City, SM City Davao City, and at SM Seaside Cebu City. <4> Kaugnay ito ng selebrasyon sa World Milk Day, tampok din sa AMD A tapos ng run na sisimulan sa 5:00 a.m., ang milk toast sa 6:00 a.m., Zumba sessions sa 6:30 a.m. at free breakfast sa lahat ng participants pagkaraan. this is in relation to the celebration of World Milk Day, highlighted also in the AMD after the run, which will be started at 5:00 a.m, is the milk toast at 6:00 a.m, Zumba sessions at 6:30 a.m and free breakfast for all the participants. <5> Ang registration ay free. registration is free. <6> Sa bawat participant, magdodonasyon ang Alaska ng kanilang mga produkto sa Children’s Hour. for each participant, Alaska will be donating their products at the Children's Hour. <7> May 5,000 runners na ang nag-registered sa Metro Manila leg pa lang. around 5,000 runners have registered for Metro Manila leg. <8> Pinalalakas ng Alaska Milk Day ang kabutihan ng pag-inom ng at pananati­ling malusog na pamumuhay. Alaska Milk is encouraging the youth and those who are aging to make a habit of drinking milk and have sports to achieve good health.
