MATERIAL_BASE-1B_99692218 <1> Ang 'porma' ng warrior sa Maguindanao (Central Mindanao adventures Part 1) the 'form' of the warrior in Maguindanao (Central Mindanao adventures part 1) <2> Bahagi ng taunang tradisyon ng Philippine Military Academy "Bantay-Laya" Class of 1994, binibisita namin ang himlayan ng aming mga nasawing mistahs sa Libingan ng mga Bayani sa Fort Bonifacio. part of the annual tradition of the Philippine Military Academy "Bantay-Laya" class of 1994, we visit the grave of our dead squad members in the Libingan ng mga Bayani in Fort Bonifacio. <3> Ang tradisyon na ito ay ginagawa namin tuwing 1st week ng Marso, jibed sa aming graduation day anniversary na nagaganap naman tuwing ika-6 ng Marso. we do this tradition every 1st week of March, jibed to our graduation day anniversary that happens every 6th of March. <4> By the way, ito na ang aming ika-20th year sa active service. by the way, this is already our 20th year in active service. <5> Most importantly, ang tradisyong ito ay ginagawa namin para gunitain ang mga magagandang alaala ng aming mga mistahs noong nabubuhay pa sila. most importantly, we do this tradition to remember the good memories of our squad members when they were still alive. <6> Dahil nasa Maynila lang ako nakadestino, minabuti kong sumama para muling mapadama sa aking mga namatay na mistah na hindi ko sila nakakalimutan. because I was destined only in Manila, I preferred to join to again express to my dead squad members that I have not forgotten them. <7> Bawat isa sa aking mga mistahs ay merong halaga sa akin. Ngunit, merong iilan na may fond memories na nakaukit na sa aking puso't isipan. each one of my squad members has value to me. but, there are some with fond memories carved to my heart and mind. <8> Nang nakita ko ang puntod ni Lt Col Ronaldo Sacatani ng Philippine Air Force, bigla kong naalala ang aming pinagsamahan sa Maguindanao noong 1997. when I saw the grave of Lieutenant Colonel Ronaldo Sacatani of the Philippine Air Force, I instantly remembered our companionship in Maguindanao in 1997. <9> Allow me to share my memorable experience sa aking assignment sa balwarte ng mga Moro Islamic Liberation Front sa Central Mindanao nang malipat dito ang aking kumpanya, ang 7th Scout Ranger Company, noong January 1997. allow me to share my memorable experience in my assignment to the fort of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front in Central Mindanao when my company was transferred there, the 7th scout ranger company, in January 1997. <10> Maguindanao adventures Maguindanao adventures <11> Dumating ako sa Maguindanao noong ika-3 ng February 1997. I arrived in Maguindanao on the 3rd of February 1997. <12> Nahuli akong dumating dito dahil sa ako ang nag-transport ng aming Kennedy Type Jeep lulan ng barko mula Maynila. I was late to arrive there because I was the one who transported our Kennedy type jeep aboard a ship from Manila. <13> Nang ako ay dumating, kakatapos lang ng aking kubo-kubo. when I arrived, my hut was just finished. <14> Yari ito sa niyog, as in 'all niyog' ang mga raw materials simula sa bubong, dingding at pati ang frame ng aking papag. it was made of coconut, as in the raw materials are 'all coconut' starting from the roof, ceiling and even frame of my bed. <15> Let me call that the Coconut Palace este Coco Hut. let me call that the coconut palace I mean coco hut. <16> Ayos naman ang aking new assignment although naninibago ako. my new assignment was all right even though I still felt new. <17> Ang aming kampo ay sa Bgy Mileb, Sultan sa Barongis, Maguindanao. our camp was in Barangay Mileb, Sultan in Barongis, Maguindanao. <18> Katabi namin ang kampo ng 78th Infantry Battalion at mga dalawang kilometro lang ang layo ay nandoon naman ang 11th Infantry Battalion. we were beside the camp of the 78th infantry battalion and only two kilometers away there was the 11th infantry battalion. <19> Mga 3-4 kilometro naman mula sa aming kampo, andoon naman ang Reina Regente Mountains at ang Liguasan Marsh na kung saan ay naglipana naman ang hanay ng MILF sa mga karatig na lugar. some 3-4 kilometers from our camp, there was the Reina Regente Mountains and the Liguasan Marsh wherein the ranks of the MILF had spread in nearby areas. <20> Sa ikalawang araw ko sa kampo, pinagtyagaan kong i-supervise mismo ang pag-gawa ng sandbags ang gilid ng aking kubo para masalo naman ang ibang mga punglo at mga shrapnel na umuuulan tuwing magkaroon ng harrassments. in my second day at camp, I myself diligently supervised the creation of sandbags the side of my hut to catch the other bullets and shrapnel raining down every time there are harassments. <21> Noong ika-5 ng Pebrero, nagpasya akong mamili ng dagdag na kagamitan sa bayan ng Tacurong na kung saan ay merong nag-iisang mall. on the 5th of February, I decided to shop for additional supplies in the town of Tacurong where there was a single mall. <22> Sideline ko na rin noon ang pagkabisado sa roadnets sa area at kung saan ang mga lugar na may ambush areas. it was also my sideline back then to memorize the road nets in the area and where are the places with ambush areas. <23> Bandang 7:00am noon, nang nagpaalam ako sa aking C.O. na si 1st Lt Jason Aquino para sa aking intensyon na mag-'malling' sa Tacurong. it was around 7:00am back then, when I told my C.O. 1st Lieutenant Jason Aquino about my intention to go 'malling' in Tacurong. <24> "I-regards mo ko sa mga nag-gagandahang mga Ilongga sa Tacurong, Harold! Ingat sa ambush sites sa pagitan ng Mileb at ng Lambayong," wika pa noon ng aking boss. 'give my regards to the beautiful Illongas in Tacurong, Harold! beware of ambush sites between Mileb and Lambayong,' said my boss back then. <25> Dahil sa narinig kong marami raw magagandang Ilongga na girls doon, kuntodo porma naman ako bago umalis. because I heard there were supposedly many beautiful Illonga girls there, I dressed up before leaving. <26> Suot-suot ko pa ang aking bull ring at ang aking golden pendant. I was even wearing my bull ring and my golden pendant. <27> Maliban doon, halos maligo ako ng perfume dahil ayaw ko namang mangamoy Musang sa kabihasnan. aside from that, I almost showered in perfume because I did not want to smell like a Musang in town. <28> Yon lang ang concept ko ng "winning the hearts" and minds sa panahon na iyon. that was my only concept of "winning the hearts" and minds at that time. <29> Hmmmm. hmm. <30> Saan na ang koneksiyon kay Lt Sacatani? where is the connection to Lieutenant Sacatani? <31> Wait lang tsong. just wait bro. <32> Let me continue. let me continue. <33> Malapit na. it is close. <34> So, binabaybay na namin ang kalsada papuntang Tacurong na sa estimate ay humigit kumulang 40 minutes ang byahe gamit ang aming Humvee. so, we traversed the road toward Tacurong that in estimate is more or less a 40 minute journey using our Humvee. <35> Natatanaw ko na noon ang Lambayong sa may unahan ng mapansin ko ang tawag sa aking dalang hand-held radio. Nasa kabilang linya si Lt Aquino. I could see Lambayong then by the front when I noticed the call on the hand-held radio I brought. on the other line was Lieutenant Aquino. <36> "Harold, abort mo yang iyong lakad. Me emergency situation dito. Kailangan ang iyong special skills ngayon na agad," sabi ng aking bossing na tila ay may pag-alala sa kanyang boses. "Harold, abort your trip. I have an emergency situation here. we need your special skills at once," said my boss seemingly with worry in his voice. <37> Sa ganong sitwasyon, no more mental reservations. in a situation like that, no more mental reservations. <38> Dapat aksyon agad at baka buhay ang nakasalalay. must act immediately and maybe life is at stake. <39> "Wilco instruction sir. "wilco instruction sir. <40> Turning around and coming back in 20 minutes or less." turning around and coming back in 20 minutes or less." <41> In short, halos paliparin na ni SSg Antonio, ang aking batikang driver ng Humvee ang aming sasakyan para makarating agad sa aming kampo. in short, Staff Sergeant Antonio, the veteran driver of the Humvee almost flew our vehicle so we can arrive instantly in our camp. <42> Hindi namin alam kung ano ang nature ng emergency ngunit handa kaming mag-responde kung kailangan. we did not know the nature of the emergency but we were ready to respond when necessary. <43> Nang dumating kami sa kampo, nakita ko na may dalawang Huey Chopper na umaandar sa may helipad iilang metro lamang sa labas ng perimeter fence. when we arrived at camp, I saw that there were two Huey choppers running by the helipad just a few meters outside the perimeter fence. <44> May naka-full battle gear nang mga tropa ang nakatayo sa labas ng aking barracks. Andon din si CO at ang aking Executive Officer na si Lt Mike Banua. there were troops already on full battle gear standing outside my barracks. also there was my CO and my executive officer Lieutenant Mike Banua. <45> "Uy sir, anong nangyari at bakit tila ay may deployment tayo?" "hey sir, what happened and why does it seem that we have a deployment?" <46> Don ko narinig ang pinakamabilis na mission briefing mula sa aking CO: "Na-pin down ang isang Infantry Company ng 61st Infantry Battalion sa baba ng Hill 292 sa Shariff Aguak. Kailangan ng sniper support at ikaw ang mag-lead kasama ang isang Section ng tropa. there I heard the fastest mission briefing from my CO: "one infantry company of the 61st infantry battalion was pinned down at the bottom of Hill 292 in Shariff Aguak. sniper support is needed and you will lead together with one section of the troop. <47> Ang complete mission briefing ay doon na sa headquarters ng 61st IB. the complete mission briefing will be there in the headquarters of the 61st IB. <48> Ang dalawang choppers na nasa labas ang sasakyan nyo. the two choppers outside will be your vehicle. <49> Alis na kayo after 5 minutes!" you leave after 5 minutes!" <50> Parang nabigla ako at na-shock. Takot? Kaba. Yes, kinabahan ako bigla sa di ko alam anong dahilan. it was as if I was surprised and shocked. fear? worry. yes, I was suddenly worried for reasons I did not know. <51> Marami kasi akong inisip. because I had many thoughts. <52> Mali ata kasuotan ko. Naka black suit ako. Me kurontong pa akong mga alahas. maybe my attire was wrong. I had on a black suit. I was even wearing jewelry. <53> Yong gamit ko eh dapat kumpletuhin ko sa aking combat pack. Ewan, basta dami ko biglang mental baggage. my equipment I had to complete in my combat pack. I don't know, I just suddenly had so much mental baggage. <54> "Sir, pwede after 5 minutes? "sir, perhaps after 5 minutes? <55> Yong back pack at special equipment ko pa, aayusin ko pa." my backpack and special equipment too, I still have to prepare." <56> Don naman nagsalita ang aking Ex-O na si Sir Mike: "Don't worry Harold, ako na nag-pack up para sa iyo. Sure na akong di ka magutom at may matulugan ka na rin. Andyan na ang iyong poncho at duyan." there my ex-o Sir Mike spoke: "don't worry Harold, I already packed up for you. I am sure you will not be hungry and have somewhere to sleep too. your poncho and hammock are there already." <57> Napatawa na lang ako. Mantakin mo namang si O-Ex pa ang mag-pack up para sa akin. Wala na akong rason. I just laughed. just think it was the o-ex who even packed up for me. I had no reason anymore. <58> Don ko hinarap ang aking mga kasama. 14 sila, kasama ang aking mga mandirigmang si Cpl Dimaano at Cpl Galamay, at ako ang pang-15. it was there I looked for my companions. they were 14, including my fighters Corporal Dimaano and Corporal Galamay, and I was the 15th. <59> "Gentlemen, mukhang ma-aksyon tong puntahan natin. "gentlemen, it looks like our destination is action-packed. <60> Di ko rin alam ang sitwasyon sa ground at mamaya pa ang final briefing natin. I also do not know the situation in the ground and our final briefing is still later. <61> Magtiwala lang tayo sa Diyos na hindi tayo mapahamak. let us just trust God that we will not be harmed. <62> Tayo na lang inaantay ng mga na-pin down nating mga kasamahan. we are the only ones our pinned down companions are waiting for. <63> Rangers Lead the Way, lets go!" rangers lead the way, lets go!" <64> Sinaluduhan ko para magpaalam sa aking mga opisyal. I saluted to say goodbye to my officials. <65> Nagbilin naman si Lt Aquino sa akin: "Ingatan mo ang tropa Harold. Kaya mo yan!" and Lieutenant Aquino ordered to me: "take care of the troop Harold. you can do it!" <66> Nang umangat na ang mga choppers na aming sinakyan, hinatid pa kami ng kaway ng aming mga kasamahan. when the choppers we were riding rose, our companions even waved us goodbye. <67> Iba ang aking pakiramdam. I felt differently. <68> Di ko maintindihan. I could not understand. <69> Nagdasal ako. I prayed. <70> Pinapanood ko ang malawak na kapatagan sa ibaba. I watched the wide plains below. <71> Na-picture out ko ang aking bagong hunting ground. I was able to picture out my new hunting ground. <72> Wala masyadong concealment maliban sa niyugan. not much concealment apart from the coconut plantation. <73> Malawak ang marshland. the marshland was wide. <74> Paano pag nandon ang labanan? what if the fighting is there? <75> Mag 9:00am noon nang lumapag kami sa kampo ng 61st IB sa Shariff Aguak. it was 9:00am then when we landed in the camp of the 61st IB in Shariff Aguak. <76> Sinalubong ako ng S3 na si Lt Ricky "Gary B" Bunayog, para magtungo sa kanilang briefing area. I was welcomed by S3 Lieutenant Ricky "Gary B" Bunayog, to head to their briefing area. <77> Sa labas ng kanilang opisina, nakasalubong ko ang isa sa aking close na mistah na si Lt Ronaldo 'Sac' Sacatani, na noon ay piloto ng MG Attack helicopter. outside their office, I came across one of my close squad members Lieutenant Ronaldo 'Sac' Sacatani, who back then was pilot of an MG Attack helicopter. <78> Magkasama kami ni Sac sa PMA Powerlifting Corps Squad at nakilalang 'magbabakal' sa academy dahil mahilig kaming mag-buhat ng daang kilong bakal tuwing athletic period. Sac and I were together in the PMA powerlifting corps squad and known as the 'steel men' of the academy because we liked to carry hundreds of kilos of steel during athletic period. <79> Syempre, dahil mistah na nagkikita sa field, nagkakamustahan kami bago kami pumasok sa briefing room. of course, because squad members seeing each other in the field, we greeted each other before entering the briefing room. <80> Di ko makalimutan ang kanyang kantyaw: "Bok, mabangis ka talaga. I cannot forget his teasing: "Bok, you really are wild. only today I learned that warrior rangers fought like that. even wearing jewelry and you smell really good!" <81> Tameme ako. I was speechless. <82> Hirap nga naman ipaliwanag. it was difficult to explain. <83> Ako lang ang naka-Black Suit sa panahong iyon. a huge donation is received from the different countries in the whole world, even the payment for the contractors to connect the wires to houses is needed to be depended on the Yolanda survivors? <8> Sa halos dalawang linggo akong nagpabalik-balik sa Tacloban at Ormoc City, halos iisa lang ang sinasabi ng mga tao, ang sana’y matulungan sila ng ating gobyerno. in almost two weeks that I have been going back and forth to Tacloban and Ormoc City, the people are saying of almost one thing, hope they will be aided by our government. <9> Gustong-gusto nang bumangon at makaahon ng mga taga-Leyte pero papaano nila ito magagawa kung hindi sila tutulungan ng national government? the residents of Leyte really want to rise and get up but how can they do this if they are not going to be helped by the national government? <10> Maging sa relief goods ay sinasabi rin ng ating mga nakausap na wala pa silang natatanggap na relief goods galing sa DSWD ni Sec. where did the billions of foreign aide granted to our government in the midst of the typhoon Yolanda have gone? <14> Ilan kaya sa mga taong gobyerno ang nakinabang at patuloy pang nakikinabang dito, at sino-sino kaya ang mga animal na ito? MATERIAL_BASE-1B_81499018 <1> Wednesday, August 14, 2013 Wednesday, August 14, 2013 <2> Planong Relokasyon ng Gobyerno, Tinutulan ng Maralita sa Estero relocation plan of the government, condemned by the squatters <3> PRESS RELEASE press release <4> PLANONG RELOKASYON NG GOBYERNO, TINUTULAN NG MARALITA SA ESTERO relocation plan of the government, condemned by the poor squatters <5> Suspindihin muna hanggat walang Garantiya ng Trabaho, Kabuhayan at Panlipunang Serbisyo suspend it yet until there is no guarantee in work, livelihood and social services <6> “Ang programang pabahay ng gobyernong Aquino sa kanyang Philippine Development Plan (2011-2016) ay nakaukit ang katagang, “Gaganda ang buhay kung may bahay at hanap-buhay,” maniwala kayo o hindi pero sumasang-ayon ang mga maralita sa kanilang tema pero mukhang tinalikuran na ito ng tuluyan ng mga opisyal ng gobyerno na nakapaloob sa Oplan Likas,” pahayag ni Jhun Manlulu, Pangulo ng Pinatag Neighborhood Association (PNA), isang organisasyon ng mga residente sa tabi ng ilog San Juan sa Tatalon sa Lungsod Quezon. "the housing project of the Aquino government in his Philippine Development Plan (2011-2016) is sculpted on the quote, "life is beautiful with a house and livelihood," believe it or not but the poor agree in their theme but it seems that the officials of the government involved in Oplan Likas are turning their backs," statement by Jhun Manlulu, President of Pinatag Neighborhood Association (PNA), an organization of residents beside San Juan river in Tatalon, City of Quezon. <7> Manlulu, isang dating OFW na ngayo’y bumabyahe ng kanyang tricycle ay umalma nang mabalitaan na ang naunang grupo inilipat sa Muzon, San Jose City sa Bulacan ay naobliga na lamang na tiyagain ang kapos na supply ng tubig at kuryente. Manlulu, a former OFW who is travelling in his tricycle, reacted when he heard that the first group transferred to Muzon, San Jose City, Bulacan is obligated to endure the insufficient supply of water and electricity. <8> “Kung tutuusin, ang kawalan ng tubig at kuryente ay ang bungad pa lang ng kanilang miserableng kalagayan, dahil mas matindi ang kawalan ng opurtunidad sa hanapbuhay at kabuhayan sa pinaglipatan sa kanila. "if summed up, the lack of water and electricity is the welcome to their miserable situation, because the lack of opportunity in work and livelihood where they are transferred. <9> Paniguradong may nag-a-abang na kapighatian sa lahat ng residenteng gustong ilipat ng gobyerno sa relocation sites nito,” babala ni Manlulu. surely, agony is expected to all residents which the government wants to transfer to these relocation sites," warned by Manlulu. <10> Dagdag pa ni Manlulu, “Walang debate, ang mga tabing-ilog ay mga danger zone at walang matinong tao ang pipiliin ang lugar na yun para sa kanyang pamilya ngunit walang namang ibang programa ang gobyerno liban sa paglilipat sa amin mula sa mapanganib na lugar patungo sa isang pang mas mapanganib na lugar, kung tutuusin, nakamamatay ito sa aming kabuhayan at pamilya”. Manlulu added, "no debate, the riverside is a danger zone and no sane person is going to choose that place for his family but the government has no other plans aside from transferring us from a dangerous place to a more dangerous place, where in fact, this is killing our livelihood and family." <11> Naniniwala ang mga residente ng Tatalon na kailangan munang suspendihin ng gobyerno ang programang ebiksyon at relokasyon dahil wala naman itong binibigay na garantiya ng trabaho, kabuhayan at kahit ang mga batayang panlipunang serbisyo at imprastraktura ay kulang na kulang para masabing desente at maka-tao ang mga relocation sites. the residents of Tatalon are believing that the government needs to suspend the eviction and relocation programs yet because it has not been giving work guarantee, livelihood and even the bases for public service and infrastructures are insufficient to say that the relocation sites are decent and humane. <12> Naniwala rin ang mga residente na iko-konsidera lamang nila ang relokasyon kapag kinumpleto na ng Department Department of Interior and Local Government, ng National Housing Authority at iba pang ahensya ang mga batayang rekisitos para sa disente at makataong pamumuhay. the residents also believe that they are only going to reconsider the relocation if the Department Department of Interior and Local Government, National Housing Authority and other agencies completed the basis of requisites for a decent and humane living. <13> “Isang lumalagapak na kapalpakan ang naghihintay sa buong programang pabahay ng gobyerno hindi dahil sa minadali nila ang pagpapatupad ng Oplan Likas kundi dahil hindi nila binigyan halaga ang pinakaimportanteng bahagi para kami’y mabuhay, ang hanapbuhay dahil kailangan naming mabuhay.. "a faltering failure is waiting the whole housing program of the government not because they rushed the implementation of Oplan Likas but because they have not given value to the most important part for us to live, the livelihood because we need to live.. <14> Kahit ang mismong Gobernador ng Bulacan ay nag-isyu ng moratorium sa pagpasok ng mga maralitang pamilya dahil alam nitong walang kapasidad ang lokal na pamahalaan para tumanggap ng napakaraming tao ng walang pumapasok na negosyo para lumikha ng hanapbuhay at opurtunidad para sa kabuhayan. even the governor of Bulacan issued a moratorium in the entry of poor families because he knows that the local government does not have the capacity to accept numerous people while nothing goes into the business to create livelihood and opportunity for livelihood. <15> Huwag kayong magulat kung may mga report na nagsisibalikan na sa Maynila ang mga inilipat para maghanap ng trabaho dito,” paliwanag ni Manlulu. do not be shocked if there are reports that those who are relocated have been transferring to Manila to search for jobs there," Manlulu explained. <16> Pinuna rin ni Manlulu ang agarang implementasyon ng Oplan Likas sa San Juan nung isang linggo. Manlulu criticized the quick implementation of Oplan Likas in San Juan last week. <17> “Ang gimik papogi nina Kalihim Roxas, Soliman, Singson at mga lokal na opisyal ng San Juan isa pa lang gimik pa-panget. "the scheme of Secretary Roxas, Soliman, Singson and other local officials in San Juan to look handsome is revealed to be a scheme to become ugly. <18> Panay-panay ang ngiti nila sa harap ng mga kamera na para bagang maganda ang kanilang nagawa pero ang tanging nagawa nila ay pwersahin ang mga residente na lumipat sa isang pang mas mapanganib na lugar para tirhan”. all smiles in front of the cameras as if they have done something good but the only thing they have done is to force the residents to relocate to a more dangerous place to live. <19> Nanawagan si Manlulu sa mga kapwa niya lider-maralita sa iba’t-ibang samahan sa mga ilog at estero na huwag matakot sa sinasabi ng mga opisyal ng gobyerno at magsanib pwersa para lumakas ang kanilang tinig laban sa bangkaroteng programang relokasyon. Manlulu is calling to his co-leaders for the poor in various organizations not to fear the statement of the government officials and join forces to strengthen their voices against the corrupt relocation program. <20> Suportado ng iba pang samahang maralita, nangako si Manlulu at iba pang residente ng Tatalon na sasama sila sa mga protesta kung hindi susupindihin ng gobyerno ang kanilang programa. supported by other organizations for the poor, Manlulu pleaded and other residents of Tatalon to join in the protest if the government will not suspend their program.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_87768454 <1> MATUTONG GUMAWA NG LISTAHAN learn how to make a list <2> NITONG 2013, kawalang pinansiyal na suporta ang pinakamarami pa ring kaso na kinaharap ng Bantay OCW. this 2013, lack of financial support is still the majority of cases faced by the Bantay OCW. <3> Halos araw-araw, hindi kami nawawalan ng mga hinaing mula sa mga asawang babae ng ating OFWs. almost everyday, we don't lose complaints from wives of our OFWs. <4> Maaaring nabawasan ang suporta, o ‘di kaya’y pumapalya, magpadala-dili o tuluyang hindi na talaga nagpapadala si mister. perhaps decrease of support, or just seldom, or a complete lack of support by the husband. <5> Maraming dahilan ang mga OFW. the OFWs have lots of excuses. <6> Ngunit kadalasan ang pagkakaroon nila ng kinakasama sa abroad. but usually, it's their mistress abroad. <7> At sa bandang huli, magkakaroon na ng sariling pamilya roon. and it will end up to them having a family of their own there. <8> Kaya iyan ang dahilan kung bakit nababawasan ang mga padala sa orihinal na pamilya, at tuluyan nang ihihinto iyon. that's the reason why sustenance for the original family is reduced, and will eventually completely stop. <9> Mabuti na lang kung may hanapbuhay naman si misis sa Pilipinas. it would have been better if the wife has an income in the Philippines. <10> Ang kaso nga, asang-asa lang ang marami sa mga ito at halos manlimos na lang sa mga asawang OFW, mapadalhan lamang sila. but the case is, many of them are dependent to their OFW husbands, almost begs just to be sustained. <11> Ang ilan pa nga, nagdadayalog na lang na okay lang sa kanila na mambabae si mister, o kahit pa nga may ibang pamilya na ito sa abroad, basta’t huwag lang ihihinto ang pinansiyal na suporta sa kanila. some even say that it's okay for their husband to have a mistress, or even have a different family in abroad, as long as they don't stop the financial support to them. <12> Minsan may misis ng OFW ang nagtungo sa Bantay OCW upang ireklamo si mister na tiyempo namang nagbabakasyon noon. one time, a wife of an OFW went to Bantay OCW to complain her husband who was chanced to be on a vacation at that time. <13> Alam na niyang may kinakasama ang asawa sa Qatar kaya ang pakiusap na lang niya ay gawing regular ni mister ang suporta sa pamilya. she already knows that her husband has a mistress in Qatar, but her only request is for the husband to give a regular support to the family. <14> May tatlong anak sila at pawang mga they have three children and are only <15> nagsisipag-eskuwela, may bahay pang hinuhulugan at walang trabaho si misis. students, there's still a house on installment, and the wife doesn't have a job. <16> Nang nalaman ni mister na nagsumbong sa Bantay OCW ang asawa, mas ginusto niyang sa amin magharap-harap at tapusin ang problema bago siya bumalik ng Qatar. when the husband learned that his wife complained to Bantay OCW, he opted to face us and end the problem before he goes back to Qatar. <17> Pinaglaanan namin ng sapat na panahon ang pagtatagpo ng mag-asawa sa studio ng Inquirer Radio sa Makati City. we gave an ample time for the meeting of husband and wife at the studio of Inquirer Radio in Makati City. <18> Palibhasa’y suporta ang isyu, hiningan namin si misis ng listahan ng mga gastusin sa bahay. because the issue is support, we asked the wife a list of expenses at home. <19> Paulit-ulit naming hinihingi kay misis ang listahan niya, ngunit parang hindi niya kami naririnig, wala lang siyang kibo. we repeatedly asked the wife her list, but it seemed like she didn't hear us, she wasn't responding. <20> Nang hanapin ko muli ang listahan, sinabi niyang wala siyang listahan kaya wala siyang maipakita. when I asked for the list again, she said he doesn't have a list, hence, doesn't have anything to show. <21> Sinimulan namin siyang turuan ng paggawa ng listahan para sa buwanang budget ng kanilang pamilya. we started to teach her how to make a list for the monthly budget of their family. <22> Nang matapos na namin iyon, saka namin ginawa ang nararapat at makatarungang pagsasaayos ng budget na dapat ipadala ni mister sa kanyang misis buwan-buwan. when we finished that, we then settled the right and just budget that the husband should send the wife monthly. <23> Parehong paborable sa kanilang dalawa ang pormulang ginamit namin. the formula we used was favorable to both of them. <24> Happy ang OFW nang maglaan kami ng automatic savings na 20% para sa kanya, at tamang kinuwenta naman namin ang buwanang gastusin ng pamilya. the OFW was happy that we set apart an automatic savings of 20% for him, and we properly calculated the monthly expenses of the family. <25> Matapos ang pirmahan nila sa naturang kasunduan, masayang nagpasalamat ang magkabilang panig dahil hindi na nga naman sila nagsampa pa ng kaso sa korte na totoo namang gugugol ng kanilang maraming oras at gastos pa. after their signing of the said agreement, both parties were thankful because they would not be filing a case in court, which would really use up a lot of their time and also be an expense. <26> Kasabay nito, hinimok naman namin si misis na maghanapbuhay at tumulong din sa asawang OFW na magdaragdag ng kabuhayan para sa lumalaki nilang pamilya. altogether, we urged the wife to look for a job and help the OFW husband that will add sustenance for their growing family. <27> At ang pinakamatindi, matuto sanang gumawa ng buwanang listahan ang mga misis upang may basehan kayo ng inyong hinihinging suporta sa inyong mga mister. and above all, hopefully, wives can learn how to make a monthly list to have a basis of requested support from the husband. <28> Kung may listahan, hindi naman magiging mahirap para sa OFWs na magbigay ng buwanang suporta dahil iyon nga naman ang kanilang pangunahing dahilan sa pag-a-abroad: ang mabigyan ng mabuting kinabukasan ang kanilang pamilya. if there was a list, it wouldn't be hard for the OFWs to give a monthly support because it really is their primary reason of going abroad: to give their family a good future. <29> O paano, mga misis, simulan na ninyong maglista at magiging maalwan ang inyong buhay, dahil bahagi ng pang araw-araw nating mga gawain ang paggastos at tamang pagbabadyet. what now, wives, start listing and your lives will be easier, because expenses and right budgeting is part of our daily lives. <30> Tiyak na maiiwasan ninyo ang mga hindi pagkakaunawaan. surely, you'll avoid disagreements.

Tax System, time to change!" "P-Noy and Sin Tax, the suffering of the masses" and "Tax Revolt, the answer to Regressive Taxation!" <8> Bilang pagkondena sa naganap na sin tax bicameral conference na sumang-ayon sa P35 bilyong target na kita sa sin tax ng gobyerno para sa taong 2013. as a condemnation to the held sin tax bicameral conference which agreed to P35 billion target profit from the sin tax of the government for the year 2013. <9> Ayon kay Gie Relova, Secretary-General ng Bukluran ng Manggagawang Pilipino - National Capital Region-Rizal (BMP-NCRR), "Abot-langit naming kinukondena ang naging pasya ng bicameral conference committee. according to Gie Relova, Secretary-General of the Organization of Filipino Laborers -National Capital Region-Rizal (BMP-NCRR), "we are strongly condemning the decision of the bicameral conference committee. <10> Sobrang nasusuklam ang mamamayang Pilipino sa katrayduran ng pagkakapasa ng sin tax bill. the Filipino citizens are vehement on the conspiratorial passing of the sin tax bill. <11> Taliwas ito sa 1987 Constitution na kung saan sinasaad nito na dapat ay paunlarin ang sistema sa pagbubuwis sa isang progresibong pamamaraan ngunit mas pinaboran ng mga mambabatas ang regresibong sistema na lalong magpapahirap sa mga miserable na ngang buhay ng taumbayan." this is contrary to the 1987 Constitution where it states that the taxation system should be developed in a progressive manner but the lawmakers have favored a regressive system which contributed more to the suffering of already miserable lives of the citizens. <12> Bagamat matindi ang disgusto ng mga miltante sa Bicam, mabilis na dinagdag ni Relova na, "milyong manggagawa at magsasaka sa buong bansa ang kumukondena kay Pangulong Benigno Aquino III dahil sa pagpayag nitong maging sunud-sunuran sa mga utos ng mga pandaigdigang institusyong pampinansiya gaya ng International Monetary Fund at isang dambuhalang dayuhang korporasyon. even though the militants have much disgust on Bicam, Relova quickly added, "millions of laborers and farmers in the whole country are condemning President Benigno Aquino III because of permitting to be obedient to the commands of the global financial institutions like the International Monetary Fund and to a one large foreign corporation. <13> Tutubo ng trilyong piso ang mga dayuhan nang walang lilikhaing hanap-buhay habang iniaalay sa altar ang ating lokal na industriya". the foreigners will raise trillions of pesos without creative livelihoods while our local industries are being offered at the altar. <14> Ang tinutukoy ni Relova ay dambuhalang kumpanyang naka-base sa London na British-American Tobacco (BAT) na muling pumasok sa Pilipinas makaraang umalis noong 2009. what Relova describes as the large company based in London is the British-American Tobacco (BAT) which will come back in the Philippines after it has left last 2009. <15> Ang pagbabalik ng BAT na gumagawa ng sigarilyong Lucky Strike ay magtatambak lamang ng sobra-sobrang tabako nito sa bansa. the return of BAT which is manufacturing the cigarette Lucky Strike is only piling its excessive tobacco in the country. <16> Ang kumpanyang BAT ang malinaw na makikinabang sa isang batas sa sin tax na siyang paraan naman nito para basagin ang monopolyo sa mekado ng isang lokal na kumpanya na mangangahulugan naman ng paglaki ng market share nito. the BAT company clearly benefits a law in sin tax which is its way to break the monopoly in the market of one local company which only means an increase of its market share. <17> Samantala, ayon naman kay Anthony Barnedo, Secretary-General ng Kongreso ng Pagkakaisa ng Maralita ng Lungsod - National Capital Region-Rizal (KPML-NCRR), isa sa nagtatag ng Peoples Coalition Against Regressive Taxation (PCART), "umaasa ang gobyerno na kikita sila sa pamamagitan ng sin tax pero sigurado, hinding-hindi hindi ito magaganap dahil sa taas ng presyo ng mga produktong tabako't alkohol, wala nang makakabili nito, tiyak na malulusaw ang industriya". meanwhile, according to Anthony Barnedo, Secretary-General of the Congress of the United Urban Poor - National Capital Region - Rizal (KPML-NCRR), one of the founders of the Peoples Coalition Against Regressive Taxation (PCART), "the government is hoping that it can profit through the sin tax but surely, this will never happen because of the higher price of tobacco and alcohol products, no one can afford these, surely, the industry melts down." <18> "Hindi na rin natin dapat asahan na mapapaunlad nga ng gobyerno ang mga programang pangkalusugan sa bansa kahit pa sabihin nating maabot nito ang target na kita mula sa sin tax. "we should not also expect the government to develop the health programs in the country even if we say that it can reach its target profit from the sin tax. <19> Ang pinangangalandakan nilang Universal Healthcare Program ay mananatili na lang panaginip na mauuwi sa bangungot kapag sinimulan na nila ang pagsasapribado sa dalawampu't anim na pampublikong ospital," dagdag pa nito. the Universal Healthcare Program that they are boasting remains a dream which will only arrive in nightmare if the privatization of twenty-six public hospitals will be started," he added. <20> "Habang ipinagbubunyi natin ang ika-64 anibersaryo ng Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), mas pinili ng ating mga "kagalang-galang" na senador at kongresista ang labagin ang ating mga karapatan sa paggawa at proteksyon sa kawalan ng hanap-buhay. "while we are celebrating the 64th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), our highly "respectable" senators and congressmen have chosen to violate our labor rights and protection from job loss. <21> At dahil sa nakaambang masaker sa mga trabaho't kabuhayan at sa sistema ng pagbubuwis na inilalatag sa rehimeng Aquino, liniligawan nito ang isang panlipunang rebolusyon na tiyak nilang pagsisisihan," dagdag pa ng BMP lider. and because of the impending massacre towards the work and livelihood and taxation system which is being prepared by the Aquino regime, it is courting a civic revolution which they will surely regret," the BMP leader added.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_64208138 <1> Saturday, August 03, 2013 Saturday, August 03, 2013 <2> Huling Araw Ko na Ngayon it's my last day today <3> Hindi pinag-uusapan kung saan ka ipinanganak, ano ang natapos mo, ang antas ng kalagayan mo sa buhay, at sa dami ng mga kakilala mo, bagkus kung ano ang ginagawa mo sa ngayon na kapaki-pakinabang at nakakatulong sa iyong kapwa. where you were born, what course did you finish, your status in life and how many people do you know will not be talked about but what you are doing right now that is beneficial and helpful to others. <4> Ito ang huling araw ko sa mundong ito. this is my last day on this planet. <5> Mamayang gabi muli akong matutulog at wala akong katiyakan kung muli din akong magigising. later at night I will sleep again with no assurance that I will still wake up. <6> Sa kinabukasan, sakali mang pinagpala akong gisingin muli ay mayroon na naman akong 24 na oras para magampanan ang aking takdang tungkulin. Tomorrow, if I am blessed to wake up again I will have another 24 hours to fulfill my designated duty. <7> At ako'y buong pusong nagpapasalamat sa biyayang ito. and I will wholeheartedly be thankful for this blessing. <8> Gagawin ko ang lahat sa abot ng aking makakaya na tuparin ang aking pagkakalitaw sa mundong ito. I will do my best to fulfill my existence on this planet. <9> Nais kong ipadama ang pagmamalasakit, pagmamahal, pang-unawa at anumang kabutihan gaano man ito kaliit nang walang hinihintay na anumang kapalit. I want to express compassion, love, understanding and any good deed no matter how small without expecting anything in return. <10> Ito ang aking panuntunan: Hindi ako isang banal na palasunod sa mga panuntunan ng ibang tao o tagapagsalita ng mga alituntunin at dogma ng relihiyon. this is my principle: I am not a holy man who follows the principles of other people or speaker of rules and dogma of religion. <11> At hindi maaaring mangyari ito sa akin hanggang sa lumisan ako sa mundong ito. and this will not happen to me until the day I leave this world. <12> Pakiusap ko lamang, huwag asahan o ipatupad sa akin ang mga bagay na hindi ko malirip at pawang pantasya. please, don't expect for me to follow things that I could not understand and nothing but fantasy. <13> Wala akong kakayahang bigyan ito ng kahulugan o ipaliwanag ang mga bagay na ito. I have no ability to give meaning or explain these things. <14> Sapagkat higit kong binibigyan ng pansin ang aking pagkakalitaw dito sa mundo; kung sino ako , saan ako patungo, at anong misyon ang itinalaga sa akin. because I am giving more attention to my existence on this world; who I am, where I am headed, and what mission is given to me. <15> May kanya-kanya tayong pakete na kailangang gampanan. we all have our own package that we need to play out. <16> Hangga’t wala akong ganap na kaalaman tungkol sa aking sarili, mistula akong tuyong patpat na inaanod ng rumaragasang tubig. as long as I do not have enough knowledge about myself, I am like a dried stick that is being carried away by a raging river. <17> Kahit saan direksiyon ay matulin akong ipapadpad. I am swiftly taken away with no clear direction. <18> Ayaw kong mangyari ito sa akin. I don't want this to happen to me. <19> Marami akong nararapat na gawin sa buhay kong ito. there are many things I need to do in this life. <20> Lalo na sa kapakanan ng aking mga mahal sa buhay. especially for the sake of my love ones. <21> Wala akong panahon sa mga bagay na walang katuturan at hindi magawang maipaliwanag nang lubusan. I have no time for useless things that cannot be fully explained. <22> Ang panahong uubusin ko para dito ay ilalaan ko na lamang na maging uliran at kapaki-pakinabang sa lipunang aking ginagalawan. the time I will spend on this I would rather spend to be exemplary and useful in the society I am in. <23> Tungkulin ko ang maging handa, maalam, at dumaramay kahit kaninuman. it is my duty be prepared, knowledgeable and compassionate to anyone. <24> Ginagawa ko ito nang walang hinihintay na kapalit o pangako ng mga bulaang propeta na paraiso. I am doing this without expecting anything in return or for the promise of false prophets for paradise. <25> Wala sa sistema ko ang magpaka-banal at maging maamong tupa sa mundong ito ng pakikibaka. it is not in my system to become holy and to become a gentle sheep in this world of struggle. <26> Bawa’t araw na dumaraan, kailangan lagi akong gising at nasa tamang katuwiran. every passing day, I always need to be awake and on the right reasoning. <27> Dahil kung ako ay pabaya, madudukutan ako nang gising. if I will be negligent, my awareness will be snatched. <28> Binanggit ng kaibigan naming dalawang madre, "Huwag magtiwala, at lubusang magtiwala." our two friends which are nuns said, "don't trust, and fully trust." <29> Sa perang dolyar ng mga Amerikano, nakasulat ang, "IN GOD WE TRUST" Pinatutunayan nito, na kapag tao ang kaharap mo, hindi ito perpekto at nagbabago ang kaisipan sa tuwina. in the dollar bill of Americans, it is written, "in God we trust" it proves, that when you face a person, he is not perfect and changes his mind often. <30> Palatandaan na huwag matulog nang gising. reminder to not sleep while awake. <31> Lagi kong binabanggit maging noong nasa elementarya pa ako, “ Hindi ako nasa eskuwela para makakuha ng mataas na grado, kundi ang may matututuhan.” I always say even back then when I was in elementary, "I do not go to school to get high grades, but to learn." <32> Sakali mang naging mataas ang marka ko, problema na ng guro ko ito. in case I get high grades, it's my teacher's problem. <33> Hindi ako nakikipag-paligsahan kahit kanino, ang kakumpetensiya ko ay ang aking sarili lamang. I do not compete with anyone, the only one I compete with is myself. <34> Pilit kong nilalagpasan anuman ang aking nagawa kahapon. I try to overcome whatever I did yesterday. <35> Ugali ko ang tignan nang masinsinan ang landas na aking tinatahak, at tanungin ang aking sarili: Ano ba ang aking intensiyon at ginagawa ko ito? it's my habit to look carefully at the path that I am walking on, and to ask myself: what is my intention and why am I doing this? <36> Ang landas bang ito ay may puso? does this path have a heart? <37> Kung umaayon at nasa tamang katuwiran ito, ang landas ay patungo sa kabutihan. if it agrees and on the right reasoning. the path is towards goodness. <38> At kung hindi naman, ay walang saysay na magpatuloy pa ako. and if not, there is no sense for me to continue. <39> Dahil pawang kabiguan lamang ang aking makakamit. because all I will ever get is failure. <40> Sa ganang akin, ang tanging katotohanan lamang ay maging tunay ka; sa isip, sa salita, at sa gawa: Ang maging tunay na Pilipino. as for me, the only truth is to be true; in mind, in words, and in actions: to become a true Filipino.

introduce to the public the author of this book, Ericson Acosta (Ka Eric here), imprisoned writer, composer, singer, columnist, and activist intellectual. <3> Ngunit walang katiyakan sa buong mundo. but there is no certainty in the entire world. <4> Sa kaharian ng Kapital lukob ang neokolonyang Pilipinas na (sa turing ni Ka Eric) isang malaking “penal colony,” lahat ng matatag (ang status quo) ay lumalambot, nalulusaw, nagsasabula. neocolonial Philippines (that ComradeEric considers) one big "penal company" is protected in the kingdom of Kapital, all the stable ones (the status quo) soften, melt, disappear. <5> Walang permanenteng sitwasyon saanmang lugar. there is no permanent situation anywhere. <6> Nagbabago, nag-iiba ang lahat–katawan, kulungan, gawi, institusyon, ikaw, ako, tayong lahat. everything transforms, changes - body, prison, habit, institution, you, me, all of us. <7> Gayon ang nangyari kamakailan. that is what happened recently. <8> Sa tulong ng mga kampanya ng SELDA, KARAPATAN at mga organisasyong internasyonal, pansumandaling nakalaya si Ka Eric, mahigit 23 buwang nakapiit, upang maikonsulta ang kalusugan. with the help of the company SELDA, KARAPATAN and international organizations, ComradeEric, more than 23 months imprisoned, was temporarily released so he can get health consultation. <9> Nagkaroon siya ng malubhang sakit na bunga ng tortyur at matinding parusa na ipinataw ng rehimeng Aquino buhat hulihin siya noong Pebrero 13, 2011 nang walang warrant at ilagak sa Calbayog City jail, Samar. he developed serious illnesses resulting from torture and grave punishment given by the Aquino regime when he was apprehended on February 13, 2011 without warrant and placed in Calbayog City jail, Samar. <10> Sakdal sa kanya: “illegal possession of explosives,” hinalang lihim na nakipagtalik sa kinumpiskang laptop kompyuter. charges on him: "illegal possession of explosives," suspected to have sex using a confiscated laptop computer. <11> was researching then about human rights and living conditions in San Jorge, Samar. <12> Krimen ba ‘yon? is that a crime? <13> Gamit ang kanyang mayamang karanasan at bihasang dunong bilang mamamahayag (UP Collegian; Manila Times; ABS-CBN, atbp), pinag-aaralan ni Ka Eric ang sitwasyon ng mga mamamayan kaakibat ng paglilingkod sa kolektibong pagsisikap umunlad. using his rich experience and expert knowledge as a journalist (UP Collegian; Manila Times; ABS-CBN, etcetera), ComradeEric studies the situation of the people together with serving the collective effort for progress. <14> Ngunit tulad noong panahon ng panananakop ng tropang Amerikano sa Balangiga circa 1901 (tingnan ang tulang “Jacob 1901”), ang pulo’y arena ng madugong tunggalian ng mga uri. but like the period of colonization of American troops in Balangiga circa 1901 (see the poem "Jacob 1901"), the island is an arena of bloody conflict of classes. <15> Napagitna ang makata; sa gipit at gulo dumagsa ang mga “ibong mandaragit”… Walang pakundangan sa batas, katuwiran, at karapatang pantao, ikinulong ang iskolar ng bayan at inabuso siya–hanggang sumiklab ang galit at protesta ng libulibong nakiramay, mula Amnesty sa London hanggang PEN International at United Nations, mga samahang inireklamo ang masahol at walang katarungang pagpaparusa sa taong walang sala kundi pag-alay ng kakayahan at talino sa ikabubuti ng bayan. the poet was at the center; in the pressure and conflict "birds of prey" flocked... with no respect for the law, reason, human rights, the nation's scholar was jailed and abused - until the anger and protest of thousands of sympathizers ignited, from Amnesty in London up to PEN International and the United Nations, organizations complained of the cruel and unjust punishment on a person who has no other sin but offering his abilities and knowledge for the betterment of the nation. <16> Nagmamadali ang takbo ng globalisasyon, ngunit sadyang makupad ang andar ng makina ng hustisya sa ating bansa. globalization is catching up, but the machinery of justice in our country is just too slow. <17> Pwede tayong maghintay bago arestohin ang sarili, siyasatin ang prehuwisyo’t haka-haka, bago tasahin at lasapin ang nakapaloob. we can wait until we are arrested, examine the prejudiced rumors, before concluding and using what is within. <18> Itinatampok dito ang katotohanan ng danas ng isang tao sa piitan at sa iba’t ibang sitwasyon, bago makipagsapalaran sa Samar at laruin doon ng tadhana. it features the real experience of one person in jail and in different situations, before going on an adventure in Samar and trying his luck there. <19> Testimonyong personal at pakikipagtalastasang tipikal kapwa ang naihulma dito. personal testimony and typical discourse were both shaped here. <20> Tiyak na makakadaupang-palad natin ang manlilikha, ang protagonista, pati na ang kanyang kinakausap. we will get to know the creator, the protagonist, as well as the person he is talking to. <21> Di na dapat magpalaboy pa, tuwiran nang sagupain at subuking alamin ang kariktan at gambala ng panitik. there is no need to wander, directly attack and attempt to find out the beauty and effect of the style. <22> Ngunit may ilang habilin na baka makapagpatalas sa pag-unawa’t pagkilatis. but there are some tips that may improve understanding and assessment.

dinadala sa buhay, tayo ay napapagod. when we have too many problems and get burdened in life, we get tired. <11> Kailangan nating magpahinga. we need to rest. <12> Napapagod ang katawan, napapagod ang isip, napapagod ang puso. the body gets tired, the mind gets tired, the heart gets tired. <13> Sa ating kapaguran, kailangan natin ng kapahingahan. in our tiredness, we must rest. <14> Alam ito nang Diyos kaya naman nag-utos siya na magkaroon nang Araw nang Pamamahinga. the Lord knows this that is why he commanded to have a day of rest. <15> Ito ay alam na alam nang mga Israelita. this is very known to the Israelite. <16> Dahil dito naging strikto sila at ito ay kailangang sundin. because of this they became strict and should be followed. <17> Nagbigay pa sila nang mga batas para ito tayo para talikuran ang kapwa tao. we having problems is not an excuse for us to turn our backs on other people. <25> Kapag tayo ay napagod, tayo ay magpahinga. when we get tired, we should rest. <26> MATERIAL_BASE-1B_80980286 <1> ‘Kalayaan Jobs Fair’ sa Koronadal City, kasado na "Independence Jobs Fair" in Koronadal City, already set <2> June 06, 2016 LUNGSOD NG KORONADAL , South Cotabato, Hun 6 (PIA) – Handa na ang lahat para sa gagawing ‘Kalayaan Jobs Fair dito sa lungsod sa Hunyo 10. Ito gaganapin sa KCC Mall of Marbel mula alas-otso ng umaga hanggang alas- singko ng hapon. June 06, 2016 City of Koronadal, South Cotabato, June 6 (PIA) - all is set for the "Independence Jobs Fair" to be conducted here in the city on June 10. according to the Department of Labor and Employment 12 Director Albert Gutib, the activity is part of the celebration of the 118th Independence Day of the Philippines on June 12. this will be held in KCC Mall of Marbel from 8 o'clock in the morning until 5 o'clock in the afternoon. <3> Ayon kay Gutib, lalahok sa jobs fair ang iba’t-ibang lokal at overseas recruitment agencies. according to Gutib, various local and overseas recruitment agencies will join in the jobs fair. <4> Pinaalalahanan naman ng opisyal ang mga aplikante na ihanda na ang mga dokumentong magpapatunay sa kanilang kakayahan tulad ng transcript of records, certificate of training, employment certificate at iba pa bago pumunta sa job fair. the officials are reminding the applicants to prepare the documents that will prove their abilities such as transcript of records, certificate of training, employment certificate and others before going to the job fair. <5> Makatutulong din kung magdala ng maraming kopya ng mga dokumento dahil maraming kompanya ang maaaring aplayan. it will also help to bring several copies of documents because there are many companies that can be applied for. <6> Maaari namang mag pre-register ang mga interesadong aplikante sa Koronadal City Public Employment Service Office o PESO upang mapagtugma ang kanilang qualifications sa mga trabaho na iaalok ng iba’t ibang kompanya na sasali sa jobs fair. the interested applicants can also pre-register in Koronadal City Public Employment Service Office or PESO to have their qualifications matched to the jobs which are offered by the various companies joining the jobs fair. <7> Ang Kalayaan Jobs Fair ay isa sa tatlong pinakamalaking jobs fair na inoorganisa ng DOLE taun-taon, kabilang na dito ang May 1 Labor Day Jobs Fair at DOLE anniversary jobs fair ginaganap tuwing Disyembre. the Independence Jobs Fair is one of the three biggest jobs fair that is organized by DOLE every year, included are the May 1 Labor Day Jobs Fair and DOLE anniversary jobs fair held every December. <8> Ang ika-118 selebrasyon ng Araw ng Kalayaan ay nakasentro sa temang “Kalayaan 2016: Pagkakaisa, Pag-aambagan, Pagsulong”. the 118th celebration of the Independence Day is centered on the theme "Independence 2016: Unity, Contribution, Advancement." <9> (ORVRivera-PIA12) (ORVRivera-PIA12)

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_39702591 <1> ‘Digmang bayan para sa kapayapaan’ 'national war for peace' <2> Ipinamalas ng rebolusyonaryong armadong kilusan sa Timog Mindanao ang lakas nito noong Disyembre 26. the revolutionary army movement in south Mindanao showed its force last December 26. <3> Ang mensahe naman nito: hangad ng mga mamamayan ang kapayapaang batay sa hustisya. its message: the residents desire a peace based on justice. <4> DAVAO CITY — Sa isang buong araw, naging sentro ng atensiyon ng buong bansa ang isang dati’y tahimik na baryo sa distrito ng Paquibato sa naturang lungsod. Davao city - in one whole day, the center of attention of the entire country is one formerly quiet town in the district of Paquibato in the said city. <5> Ito’y dahil sa bulubunduking lugar na ito ng isa sa pinakamalaking lungsod sa bansa, isinagawa ang isang pambansang asembleyang pangkapayapaan. this is because this mountainous place is of one of the biggest cities in the country, a country assembly on peace was done. <6> Kasabay nito, dito rin ipinagdiwang ang anibersaryo ng “tanging partido pulitikal sa buong bansa” (sabi ng maraming eksperto sa pulitikang Pilipino); ang partidong namumuno sa rebolusyong Pilipino ngayon: ang Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP), na itinatag 48 na ang nakararaan. along with it, this is also where the anniversary of the "only political party in the entire country" was celebrated (said by many experts on Filipino politics); the party leading the Filipino revolution today: the Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP), that was established 48 ago. <7> Tinatayang aabot sa 15,000 ang mga sibilyan, tagasuporta at kabahagi ng CPP ang lumahok sa buong-araw na pagtitipon noong Disyembre 26. it was estimated to reach 15,000 civilians, supporters and part of the CPP participated in the whole day gathering last December 26. <8> Kasabay nito ang mga pagdiriwang din sa iba’t ibang bahagi ng Mindanao at buong bansa. along with it the celebration also in different parts of Mindanao and the entire country. <9> Pero sa Paquibato, nagmartsa, sa unang pagkakataon sa publiko, ang buong Pulang Bagani Batallion ng New People’s Army (NPA). but in Paquibato, the entire Red Bagani Batallion of the New People's Army (NPA) marched, for the first time in public. <10> Ang imaheng ipinakita nila, imahen ng isang disiplinado, unipormado, makisig at masayang armadong puwersa ng rebolusyon. the image they are showed, image of a disciplined, uniformed, well-groomed and happy armed force of the revolution. <11> Dumalo ang Pinoy Weekly at PinoyMedia Center sa pagtitipong ito, na nagsimula sa isang formation inspection sa Pulang Bagani Batallion bilang pagpupugay sa CPP. pinoy weekly and PinoyMedia center attended this gathering, that started with a formation inspection in Red Warrior battalion to show respect to the CPP. <12> Ayon kay Porferio Tuna Jr., na kasama sa mga nanguna sa isinagawang formation inspection, “Nararapat lang nating pagpugayan at ipagbunyi ang mga pagsisikap at mga tagumpay na natamo ng ating Partido.” according to Porferio Tuna, Junior, who is included in those leading the conducted formation inspection, "it is only right that we show respect and acclaim the efforts and the victories achieved by our party." <13> Pero higit sa pagbubunyi sa lawak na inaabot ngayon ng rebolusyonaryong mga puwersa, okasyon ang asembleyang ito para mapag-usapan ang kalagayan ng usapang pangkapayapaan sa pagitan ng National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP, na kumakatawan sa rebolusyonaryong mga puwersa na pinangungunahan ng CPP at nilalahukan ng NPA) at administrasyon ni Pangulong Duterte. but more than celebrating the extent that was reached today by the revolutionary forces, this assembly is an occasion to talk about the status of the peace talks between the National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP, that represents the revolutionary forces that is led by the CPP and participated by the NPA) and the administration of President Duterte. <14> “Maraming ipinangako sa mga mamamayan si Pangulong Duterte…(S)a ganyang kalagayan, ang sarili nating lakas at pagsisikap ang magtutulak sa kanya upang tupdin ang kanyang mga pangako,” paliwanag ni Tuna. "a lot has been promised to the people by president Duterte... in that state, our own strength and effort will push him in order to fulfill his promises," explained by Tuna. <15> At ganoon nga ang naging tono ng maghapong pagtitipon: ang bigyang-pugay ang rebolusyonaryong mga puwersa (pati na ang mga nag-alay ng buhay sa pakikibaka), habang hinaharap ang kasalukuyang kalagayan ng pakikipagnegosasyon sa isang presidente na galing mismo sa Davao City at minsan nang nagpakilala sa sarili bilang “maka-Kaliwang presidente” na kaibigan ng rebolusyon. and that has been the tone of the whole day gathering: giving respect to the revolutionary forces (including those who offered their lives in fighting), while facing the current status of negotiation with a president who actually came from Davao city and at one time showed himself as a "leftist president" who is a friend of the revolution. <16> Bilang kinikilalang “kaibigan”, dumalo nga ang ilang pangungunang mga miyembro ng gabinete ni Duterte. as recognized "friend", a number of leading members of the cabinet of Duterte attended. <17> Nasa odyens din ang mga miyembro ng panel ng gobyerno sa pakikipagnegosasyon sa NDFP, sa pangunguna ni Labor Sec. Silvestre Bello III. also in the audience were the members of the panel of the government in negotiations with the NDFP, led by Labor secretary Silvestre Bello III. <18> Kaharap nila, na nagsagawa rin ng press conference sa lugar ng pagdiriwang, ang mga miyembro at konsultant ng NDFP na nakikipagnegosasyon sa gobyerno, sa pangunguna nina Luis Jalandoni (dating punong negosyador na ngayo’y senior adviser ng NDFP negotiating panel), Coni Ledesma, Tuna (konsultant na kumakatawan sa Mindanao), at iba pa. facing them, who also conducted a press conference in the place of celebration, the members and consultant of ndfp who are negotiating with the government, lead by Luis Jalandoni (former lead negotiator who is now a senior advisor of the NDFP negotiating panel), Coni Ledesma, Tuna (consultant representing Mindanao), and others. <19> Dumalo rin ang dating bilanggong pulitikal na pinalaya noong Agosto para makilahok sa peace talks–ang konsultant ng NDFP sa Visayas na si Concepcion “Concha” Araneta-Bocala. also attending is the former political prisoner free last August to participate in the peace talks-the consultant of NDFP in Visayas who is Concepcion "Concha" Araneta-Bocala. <20> “Ang akala ng gobyerno ni Duterte na matapos na kami’y mapalaya, hihinto na kami sa pagkilos. "the government of Duterte thought that after we were freed, we will stop our actions. <21> Hindi kami titigil hangga’ t hindi nahaharap ang batayang mga usapin lalo na sa larangan ng socio-economic reforms na siyang salalayan o dahilan ng pakikipagrebolusyon,” paliwanag ni Araneta-Bocala. we will not stop until the fundamental talks are not faced especially in the field of socio-economic reforms that is the support or reason of the revolutionary," explained by Araneta-Bocala. <22> Tulad noong nakaraan, inilinaw ni Jalandoni na handa ang NDFP na pag-aralan ang mga panukalang reporma ng rehimeng Duterte, kabilang ang itinutulak na sistemang pederal. like in the past, Jalandoni clarified that the NDFP is prepared to study the proposed reforms of the Duterte regime, including the federal system being pushed. <23> “Kung ang federal system ay makakatulong sa mga mamamayan at gusto ito ng masa, maaaring maging bukas ang kilusan upang ito’y mapagaralan at matiyak na ang ganansiya ay para sa ikabubuti ng masang Pilipino,” paliwanag niya. "if the federal system will be helpful to the people and it is liked by the mass, the movement may become open in order to study this and ensure that the benefit is for the good of the Filipino mass," he explained. <24> Gayunman, paliwanag ni Tuna, kailangang kilalanin ng gobyernong Duterte ang pagkakaroon ng hiwalay na rebolusyonaryong gobyerno sa Pilipinas na pinangungunahan ng NDFP. however, explained by Tuna, the Duterte government need to recognize having a separate revolutionary government in the Philippines that is lead by the NDFP. <25> “Ang gobyerno ng masang api’y may sariling gobyerno, hukuman, sandatahan at kongkretong mga programa tulad ng rebolusyong agraryo (kabilang ang) pagpapamahagi ng lupa sa magsasaka, napapababa ang usura at kolektibong napapaunlad ang agrikultural na produksiyon,” ani Tuna. "the government of the oppressed mass has its own government, court, army and concrete programs like the agrarian revolution (including the) distribution of land to farmers, decreasing the usury and collectively progress the agricultural production," Tuna said. <26> May sarili umanong programa sa kalusugan, edukasyon, at iba pang serbisyong pangkalusugan ang NDFP sa kanayunan ng Pilipinas. the NDFP allegedly has its own program on health, education, and other heath services in the barrios in the Philippines. <27> “Kaya nating tumindig ayon sa sariling lakas kung kaya’t ano pa man ang marating ng peace talks ay handa tayong mga rebolusyonaryo,” sabi pa niya. "we can stand according to our own strength so wherever the peace talks reaches we revolutionaries are ready," he also said. <28> Paliwanag naman ni Eduardo Genelsa, kapwa konsultant ng NDFP sa Mindanao, may “sariling konteksto” ang rebolusyonaryong pakikibaka sa Mindanao. explained by Eduardo Genelsa, fellow consultant of the NDFP in Mindanao, the revolutionary fight in Mindanao has its "own context". <29> “Iniluwal ito ng mahabang karanasan at mahigpit na disiplina upang igpawan ang mga kahinaan. "this was born by the long experience and tight discipline in order to overcome weaknesses. <30> Sa matinding pagtraydor ng mga pasistang militar sa masa at kilusan nakayanan nitong tumayo at magpakahusay kapwa sa taktikal at estratehikong paglaban.” in the intense betrayal of the fascist military of the mass and movement it was able to stand and be skillful both in tactical and strategic fighting." <31> Ibig sabihin, sa suporta ng mga mamamayan ng Mindanao, naitatag at naitaguyod sa kanayunan nito ang rebolusyonaryong gobyerno. this means, in the support of the people in Mindanao, the revolutionary government was founded and established in this town. <32> Handa ang NPA, CPP at NDFP na palakasin at palawakin ang saklaw ng rebolusyonaryong gobyernong ito sa kapakanan ng mga mamamayan may usapang pangkapayapaan man o wala. the NPA, CPP and NDFP are prepared to strengthen and widen the scope of this revolutionary government for the welfare of the people with or without peace talks. <33> Sa naturang presscon, nakinig at dumalo ang ilan sa mga masa na tagasuporta ng rebolusyon. in the said press conference, a number of the mass that are supporters of the revolution listened and attended. <34> Naging pagkakataon na rin ito para iulat sa kanila ang kalagayan ng mga negosasyon, habang pinatitibay ang komitment para ipagpatuloy ang rebolusyon–may peace talks man o wala. this also became an opportunity to report to them the status of the negotiation, while fortifying the commitment to continue the revolution - with or without peace talks. <35> Pero siyempre, malaki ang pagkilala nilang magandang pagkakataon ang usapang pangkapayapaan para maitulak ang rebolusyonaryong programa ng NDFP sa mga negosasyon para sa repormang sosyo-ekonomiko, at pulitikal-konstitusyonal. but of course, they largely recognized the good opportunity of the peace talks to push the revolutionary program of the NDFP on the negotiations for the socio-economic reform and political-constitutional. <36> Bago natapos ang araw, nagpailaw at nagpalipad ang ilang nagsidalo sa asembleya ng mga parol bilang simbolo ng hangaring kapayapaan batay sa hustisya. before the day ended, a number of the assembly participants lighted and flew lanterns as symbol of the desired peace based on justice. <37> “People’ s War is for People’s Peace” ang tema ng pagtitipon, at malakas na naiparating ang mensaheng ito ng mga rebolusyonaryo sa mga nagsipagdalo at sa publiko na makakatunghay sa asembleyang ito sa pamamagitan ng midya. "people's war is for people's peace" is the theme of the gathering, and this message was strongly sent by the revolutionaries who attended and the public who witnessed this assembly through the media.

but we also know where the convenient door leads never ending danger! <40> Maging matalinong Kristiyano tayo. let us be wise Christians. <41> Ngayong Taon ng Awa ay palakasin natin ang ating paniniwala na may Diyos ng Habag na patuloy na nagpapakita sa atin ng malasakit at pang-unawa. this year of mercy let us strengthen our belief that there is a god of compassion who continuously shows us concern and understanding. <42> Alam niya ang pagnanais nating makapasok sa pintuan ng langit at batid niya ang kahinaan ng ating pagpapasya sa pagpili ng mabuti at masama... ng tama at mali! he knows our desire to enter the door of heaven and he is aware of our weakness in deciding to choose good and bad of right and wrong! <43> May gantimpalang naghihintay sa atin kung magtitiwala tayo sa kabutihan ng Diyos na hindi Niya tayo pababayaan sa ating pagsisikap dahil mahal Niya tayo. there is a reward waiting for us if we trust in the goodness of god that he will not neglect us in our effort because he loves us. <44> May "langit" tayong mararating kung magsisikap tayong sumunod sa kanyang kalooban, magtitiyaga at mapagkumbaba nating susundin ang Kanyang mga utos. there is a "heaven" we can reach if we endeavor to follow his will, persevere and be humble as we follow his commandments. <45> Tandaan mo... isa lang ang daang patungo kay Kristo... at ang hahantungan mo ay nakasalalay sa pintuang pipiliin mo. remember there is only one way to Christ and where you end up depends on the door you will choose.

Casanova. <7> Si Gosiengfiao ay isang Iskolar ng Bayan at cum laude pa ng Business Administration sa U.P. Diliman. Gosiengfiao is an Iskolar ng Bayan, and a cum laude of Business Administration in the University of the Philippines Diliman. <8> Malawak din ang kanyang work experience sa labas ng bansa. he has an extensive work experience outside the country. <9> Si Casanova naman ay U.P. Law graduate at ka-batch ng aming napakaabilidad na congressman sa Marikina na si Miro Quimbo. while Casanova is a University of the Philippines law graduate and from the same batch as our very able congressman in Marikina, Miro Quimbo. <10> Produkto rin siya ng Kennedy School of Government ng Harvard. he is a product of the Kennedy School of Government in Harvard. <11> Nagtuturo siya sa Ateneo School of Government at aktibo siya sa Kaya Natin Movement on Good Governance, kasama sina namayapang Jesse Robredo, Grace Padaca at si Among Ed Panlilio. he teaches at the Ateneo School of Government and very active in the Kaya Natin Movement on good Governance, together with the late Jesse Robredo, Grace Padaca and Among Ed Panlilio. <12> Kakaiba ang BCDA ngayon dahil hinahabol at hinahabla nila John Hay. <14> ‘Di nila talaga palalagpasin ang napakalaking utang ni businessman Bob Sobrepeña. they will really not overlook the huge debt of businessman Bob Sobrepeña. <15> Ang gaganda pa ng Clark Green City, the six ongoing projects in SCTex worth 207 million pesos, the one in Poro Point and many others. <16> Sa SBMA naman ay nagsa-shine itong si Chairman at Adminstrator Roberto Garcia. Oriental at Motolite batteries. he was the former president and COO of Oriental and Motolite batteries. <19> AIMM graduate itong si Garcia at sa La Salle nagtapos ng kolehiyo at sa Ateneo naman para sa high school. Garcia is an AIMM graduate and he finished college in La Salle and in Ateneo for high school. <20> Sa darating na Agosto 4 ay ire-release ng SBMA ang P93. on August 4 the SBMA will release P93. <21> 7-milyon na LGU revenue shares para sa unang semester ng 2014 sa walong bayan na katabi ng SBMA. 7 million LGU revenue shares for the first semester of 2014 for the eight surrounding areas of SBMA. <22> Ito ay ang Olongapo City; Subic, San Marcelino, San Antonio, at Castillejos sa Zambales; at mga bayan ng Dinalupihan, Hermosa, at Morong sa Bataan. these are Olongapo City, Subic, San Marcelino, San Antonio, and Castillejos in Zambales; and towns of Dinalupihan, Hermosa, and Morong in Bataan. <23> Commitment daw nila ito sa neighboring LGUs para naman mapabilis ang pag-unlad sa mga lugar na ito at para lalong makamit ng mga ito ang minimithing inclusive growth ni Pangulong Aquino. this is their commitment to the neighboring LGUs to hasten the progress in these areas and to fully achieve the desired inclusive growth of President Aquino. <24> Nawa’y sa ilalim ng pamumuno nina Garcia, Gosiengfiao at Casanova ay mas lalo pang mapaunlad ang SBMA at BCDA para mas malaki ang maiambag sa pondo ng pamahalaan. hopefully, under the leadership of Garcia, Gosiengfiao and Casanova, SBMA and BCDA will further grow to contribute more to the funds of the government. <25> ABISO/Paul Edward P. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_62017590 <1> Mark H., sa 2018 na pakakasalan si Winwyn! By Jojo Gabinete June 16, 2016 Nagsalita nang tapos si Mark Herras sa presscon ng Sa Piling Ni Nanay na si Winwyn Marquez na ang huling babae sa buhay niya at dalawang taon mula ­ngayon, plano ng lead actor ng bagong afternoon ­drama series ng GMA 7 na pakasalan ang kanyang girlfriend. Mark H., will marry Winwyn in 2018! by Jojo Gabinete June 16, 2016 at the press conference of Sa Piling Ni Nanay Mark Herras spoke with finality that Winwyn Marquez is the last woman in his life and two years from now, the lead actor of the new afternoon drama series in GMA 7 plans to marry his girlfriend. <2> Ayon kay Mark, si Winwyn ang sagot ng Diyos sa kanyang mga dasal. according to Mark, Winwyn is God's answer to his prayers. <3> “Actually, yes. Ipinagdasal ko siya. Sabi ko, I want a partner na hindi na kailangan na dumating ang panahon na maghahanap ako ng panibago. I want a partner na panghabambuhay na kasi I’m not getting any younger. I’m ­turning 30 years-old. I want a family na talagang legit na talagang mag-iipon ako for them. Magka­karoon ako ng business with the love of my life. "actually, yes. I prayed for her. I said, I want a partner who when the time comes I don't have to look for another. I want a partner for a lifetime because I'm not getting any younger. I'm turning 30 years old. I want a family whom I'll legit save for them. have a business with the love of my life. <4> “Everytime I pray kay Lord, nagpapatulong ako sa Kanya, sa Daddy ko, sa lola ko and now, sa Mommy ko. Kahit papaano, I have 3 guardian angels sa itaas. Talagang humihingi ako ng tulong sa kanila. "every time I pray to the Lord, I ask help from him, from my daddy, from my grandmother and now, from my mommy. in some way, I have 3 guardian angels above. I really ask help from them. <5> “Pinag-uusapan namin ni Winwyn na we want to get married after 2 years. I’m very happy, I’m very thankful na everything’s going well with my career, with my lovelife. "Winwyn and I discuss that we want to get married after 2 years. I'm very happy, I'm very thankful that everything's going well with my career, with my love life. <6> Nagpapasalamat talaga ako na after all these years, there’s someone na ­talagang nakahanda for you and I’m hoping na ­magawa ko lahat for Win. I am really thankful that after all these years, there's someone who is really set for you and I'm hoping I can do everything for Win. <7> Gagawin ko lahat for her para hindi siya ma-disappoint. I will do everything for her so she will not be disappointed. <8> “Siya na talaga ang gusto ko na maging nanay ng anak ko in the future,” ang punumpuno ng pag-asa at pagma­mahal na kuwento ni Mark tungkol sa kanyang bagong inspirasyon. "she really is the one I want to be the mother of my future children," Mark shares his new inspiration full of hope and love. <9> Nagpapasalamat din si Mark sa GMA 7 dahil sa magagandang projects na ibinigay sa kanya, ang Sa Piling Ni Nanay na mag-uumpisa sa June 27 at ang sitcom na Conan My Beautician na mapapanood tuwing Linggo nang hapon, simula sa June 26. Mark is also thankful to GMA 7 because of the good projects given to him, Sa Piling ni Nanay that will start on June 27 and the sitcom Conan My Beautician that can be seen every Sunday afternoon, starting June 26. <10> “I’m so thankful naniniwala pa rin sa akin ang GMA 7 after all these years. Siguro, nakita naman nila na maayos ako na magtrabaho. "I'm so thankful GMA 7 still believes in me after all these years. maybe, they have seen that I do my job properly. <11> “Hindi talaga ako sumuko, ­hindi lang ako nag-expect. Minsan kasi, mas nabibigyan ka ng chance na mailabas mo talaga ‘yung ­acting skills sa different roles. Ako, ­before, sino ba ang mag-aakala na magiging maganda ang resulta ng una kong (guesting) sa Karelasyon na bad ‘yung role ko. "I never gave up, I just didn't expect. because sometimes, you will be given more chance to really express your acting skills in different roles. me, before, who would expect that my first (guesting) in Karelasyon with a bad role will bring good result. <12> “Masarap din ‘yung makapag-try ng iba’t-ibang klaseng roles. "it also feels nice to be able to try different kinds of roles. <13> Hindi lang ‘yung palagi kang mayaman, boyfriend ka ni ganito or mahirap ka, ayaw sa’yo ni magulang ni ganito,” ang opinyon ni Mark tungkol sa pagbalik niya sa leading man status sa mga programa ng Kapuso Network. you're not always rich, boyfriend of this or poor, the parent of this doesn't want you," Mark's opinion about his return to leading man status in the programs of the Kapuso Network.
