MATERIAL_BASE-1B_58459532 <1> Hebreo Series 29: Abraham, kahanga- hangang pananampalatayaBy Zayith Hebron November 8, 2016 “Sa pananampalataya si Abraham, nang tawagin, ay sumunod upang pumunta sa isang lugar na kanyang tatanggapin bilang pamana; at siya’y pumunta na hindi nalalaman ang kanyang pupuntahan. Hebrews series 29: Abraham, amazing faith by Zayith Hebron November 8, 2016 "by faith Abraham, when called, obeyed to go to the place he will receive as an inheritance; and he went without knowing where he will go." <2> Sa pana­nampalataya siya’y dumayo sa lupang pangako na tulad ng sa ibang lupain, at nanirahan sa mga tolda na kasama sina Isaac at Jacob, na kapwa mga tagapagmana ng gayunding pangako. by faith he migrated to the promise land like every other lands, and settled in tents with Isaac and Jacob, both heirs of the same promise. <3> “Sapagkat siya’y umaasa sa lunsod na may mga kinasasaligan, na ang nagplano at nagtayo ay ang Diyos.” "for he relies on the city with foundations, which was planned and built by God." <4> (H­ebreo 11:8-10)Matapang si A­braham, malakas ang loob. Hindi niya pinagdudahan ang mga pangako ng kanyang Diyos. At kung minsan ay nagpakita siya ng kahinaan at takot, hindi pa rin nawala ang pana­nalig niya na ang Diyos ay tapat at hindi siya pababayaan kailanman. (Hebrews 11:8-10) Abraham is brave, courageous. he did not doubt the promises of his God. and sometimes he displays weakness and fear, his faith that God is faithful and will not neglect him remained. <5> Paano nga niya pagdududahan si Yahweh? how can he doubt God? <6> Hindi ba’t nagdalantao ang kanyang asawang si Sarah sa edad na 99? Sa normal na sitwasyon ay hindi na maaaring manganak si Sarah dahil sa sobrang katandaan. is it not that his wife got pregnant at the age of 99? normally, Sarah should no longer be able to give birth because of very old age. <7> Subalit pinili sila ng Diyos upang pagmulan ng lahing Israel, at sa pamamagitan ng kanyang anak na si Isaac matutupad ang mga pa­ngako. but they were chosen by God to give birth to the people of Israel, and by his son Isaac the promises will be fulfilled. <8> “Gagawin kitang isang malaking bansa, ikaw ay aking pagpapalain, gagawin kong dakila ang iyong pangalan, at ikaw ay magiging isang pagpapala. Pagpapalain ko ang magbibigay ng pagpapala sa iyo, at susumpain ko ang susumpa sa iyo; at sa pamamagitan mo ang lahat ng angkan sa lupa ay pagpapalain.” "I will make you a great nation, I will bless you, I will make your name great, and you will be a blessing. I will bless those who bless you, and curse those who curse you; and with you all the families of the earth will be blessed." <9> (Genesis 12:2-3)Mula sa lahi ni A­braham, sa lahing I­srael, nagmula ang M­esias na namatay sa krus para sa ikaliligtas ng buong sangkatauhan. Ang Mesias na iyon ay ang Panginoong Jesus; Anak ng Diyos na nagkatawang-tao, ipinagbuntis ni Maria, ipinanganak sa isang sabsaban sa Betlehem at lumaki sa bayan ng Nazareth. Anong malay ba ni Abraham na magiging gayon kalaki ng papel niya sa plano ng kaligtasan na inilatag ng Diyos para sa buong mundo? Sa sobrang pag-ibig ni Yahweh-Adonai sa tao, hindi Niya hinaya­ang manatiling lubog sa kasalanan ang lahi nina Adan at Eba. Ang pananatili sa gayong kalagayan ay manga­ngahulugang pananatili sa ilalim ng sumpa ng kamatayan magpakailanman; walang-hanggang kamatayan sa impiyerno; walang hanggang pagkawalay sa tunay na Diyos. Kinailangang magpadala ng Diyos ng Taga­pagligtas; si Jesus nga ang gumanap ng papel na iyon. At ang lahat ng mga bagay na iyan ay nasa puso’t isipan na ng Maykapal nang utusan Niya si Abraham na “umalis…sa iyong lupain, sa iyong mga kamag-anak, sa bahay ng iyong ama, at pumunta ka sa lupaing ituturo ko sa iyo.” (Genesis 12: 2-3) from the descendants of Abraham, to the people of Israel, the Messiah who died on the cross for the salvation of all mankind. that Messiah is the Lord Jesus; son of God in the flesh, born of Mary, born in a manger in Bethlehem and grew up in the town of Nazareth. Abraham had no idea that his role will be great in the plan of salvation that God has laid for the whole world? with the exceeding love of God-Adonai for man, he did not allow the descendants of Adam and Eve to remain submerged in sin. to stay in that state would mean to stay in under the curse of eternal death; eternal death in hell; eternal separation from the true God. God needed to send a Savior; Jesus was the one who played that role. and all those things are in the heart and mind of the Creator when he ordered Abraham to "leave... your land, your relatives, the house of your father, and go to the land that I will show you." <10> (Genesis 12:1)Ikaw ba, friend, ano sa palagay mo? Susunod ka rin ba sa Diyos kaagad kung ikaw ang nasa kalagayan ni Abraham? Pinag-eempake ka ng gamit at pinabibiyahe patungo sa isang lugar na hindi mo alam? Sa natural na pag-iisip, mahirap iyon, ‘di ba? May isa pang kaha­nga-hangang patunay ng pananampalataya si Abraham. Nang iutos sa kanya ng Diyos na patayin niya ang minamahal na anak na si Isaac at ialay doon sa Bundok ng Moriah. Ang child sacrifice o human sacrifice ay ginagawa noon ng mga tao sa Canaan. Wala pa ang pahayag ng batas ng Diyos sa pamamagitan ni Moises kaya marahil ay inisip ni Abraham na seryosong kahilingan talaga ng Diyos sa kanya ang pagpatay sa kanyang anak. Pero paano ang pangako? Sinabi ng Diyos na sa pamamagitan ni Isaac dadami ang kanyang binhi! (Genesis 12:1) how about you, friend, what do you think? will you obey God if you were in Abraham's position? packing your things to travel to a place you don't know? naturally thinking, that is difficult, right? there is more amazing in the faith of Abraham. when God commanded him to kill his beloved son Isaac and offer him in Moriah mountain. child sacrifice or human sacrifice were being done by the people of Canaan. there is still no declaration of the commandments of God through Moses so Abraham probably thought that God really wanted him to kill his son. but how about the promise? God said that through Isaac his descendants will multiply. <11> Ito ang dahilan na binabanggit ng manunulat ng Hebreo na tumakbo sa isipan ni Abraham noong mga panahong iyon: “Itinuring niya na ma­ging mula sa mga patay ay maaaring buhayin ng Diyos ang isang tao…” (Hebreo 11:19)Kahanga-hangang pananampalataya. this is the reason that the writer of Hebrews speaks of regarding what is running in the mind of Abraham at those times: "he believed that from the dead God can bring back a man to life..." (Hebrews 11:19) Amazing faith. <12> Ang gantimpala: Isang anghel ang ipinadala ng Diyos upang pigilin si Abraham sa gagawing paghahandog. the reward: God sent an angel to stop Abraham from making the offering. <13> Namatay si Abraham nang hindi nakikita ang buong katuparan ng mga pangako ng Diyos sa kanya. At ito’y dahil itinuring niya ang sarili bilang ‘dayuhan at manlalakbay sa ibabaw ng lupa’ lamang. Abraham died without seeing the completion of the promises of the Lord to him. this is because he only considered himself as a foreigner and wanderer in the surface of the earth. <14> Ang kanyang tunay na tahanan ay ang presensiya ng Diyos. his true home is in the presence of God. <15> Kaibigan, eye- opener iyan para sa atin; isang mahalagang paalala. Kung ibinibigay ng manunulat ng Hebreo sina Abraham, Abel, Enoc at Noe bilang mga matitibay sa pananampalatayang dapat nilang pamarisan, gayon din ang mensahe ng Diyos para sa atin ngayon. friend, this is an eye-opener for us; one important reminder. if the writer of Hebrews gave Abraham, Abel, Enoch at Noah as strong in the faith they should precede, God has the same message for us. <16> Si Abraham ay hindi nakakapit sa kanyang mga materyal na ari- arian, sa kanyang ba­yan, sa kanyang sari­ling pamilya. Abraham did not rely in his material possessions, in his country, in his own family. <17> Tanging ang Diyos lamang ang kanyang kinapitan at nagtagumpay siya sa kanyang lakbayin dito sa lupa. he relied only in God and he succeeded in his journey in this world. <18> Kumustahin natin ating mga sarili: Gayon din bang pananampalataya ang kinauuhawan nating mapasaatin? Gaano natin kamahal ang Panginoong Jesus? let's check ourselves: is that the kind of faith we are thirsty to have? how much do we love the Lord Jesus? <19> Katumbas ba ng lahat-lahat sa atin? does it mean our everything? <20> Matitinding mga tanong; tanging ang Banal na Espiritu ang makagagalaw sa ating mga buhay upang ibigay sa atin ang pananampalatayang busilak sa pani­ngin ng Diyos. hard questions; only the Holy Spirit can move our lives to give us the faith pure in the sight of God. <21> Lumapit tayo kay Jesus upang maligtas, at makilala nang tunay ang Diyos. draw near to Jesus to be saved, and to know the true God. <22> Shalom and God bless! Shalom and God bless!
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_68185514 <1> “It’s more dead in the Philippines” By Jeany Lacorte "it's more dead in the Philippines" by Jeany Lacorte <2> September 3, 2016 September 3, 2016 <3> Laman ng pahayaga­n nitong mga nagdaang araw ang reklamo ng dating jueteng star witness Sandra Cam, na noon pa raw sana niya ibinunyag ang koneksyon ni Sen. Leil­a de Lima sa drug menace sa New Bilibid Prison (NBP) pero tatlong mambabata­s daw ang humadlang sa kanya. newspapers of the past few days contain the complaint of former jueteng star witness Sandra Cam, that she revealed back then the connection of Senator Leila de Lima to the drug menace of New Bilibid Prison (NBP) but supposedly three lawmakers stopped her from doing so. <4> Ang mga mambabatas na ito ay sina Senate Pre­sident Aquilino ‘Koko’ Pimentel, Sen. Franklin Dri­lon at Ilocos Norte Rep. Rodolfo Fariñas na pawang mga miyembro ng makapangyarihang Commission on Appointments (CA). these lawmakers are Senate President Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel, Senator Franklin Drilon and Ilocos Norte representative Rodolfo Fariñas who are all members of the powerful Commission on Appointments (CA). <5> Noong isalang daw sa CA ang kumpirmasyon ng appointment ni De Lima bilang kalihim ng Department of Justice (DOJ), hindi raw siya binigyan ng pagkakataon na makapagsalita sa mga nalalaman niya kay De Lima. supposedly when the confirmation of the appointment of De Lima as secretary of the Department of Justice (DOJ) was served, she was not given a chance to speak of what she knows about De Lima. <6> Sa gagawing imbestigasyon ng Kamara sa pag­laganap ng iligal na droga sa NBP sa panahon ni De Lima, sinabi ni Cam na isusumite niya ang kopya ng tape ng CA hearing para mapatunayan ang kanyang mga sinasabi. in the investigation to be held by the legislative chamber on the distribution of illegal drugs in the NBP during the time of De Lima, Cam said she will submit a copy of the tape of the CA hearing proving what she is saying. <7> Ngunit agad naman siyang sinupalpal ng CA secretary na si Hector Villacorta. but CA secretary Hector Villacorta immediately stopped her. <8> “Sandra Cam was gi­ven more than enough time and was not prevented from blocking the confirmation of Sen. Leila de Lima as secretary of Justice before the Commission on Appointments in June 2014, based on the record and transcript of CA deliberations.” "Sandra Cam was given more than enough time and was not prevented from blocking the confirmation of Senator Leila de Lima as secretary of Justice before the Commission on Appointments in June 2014, based on the record and transcript of CA deliberations." <9> “Ms. Cam was given ample time to expose the alleged illicit drug scheme and shabu factory inside the NBP during her testimony at the 2-hour CA hearing on June 4, 2014. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_68994301 <1> Filipino hero in foreign land Pinoy – tagapangalaga ng kapayapaan sa ibang bayan! Filipino hero in foreign land Filipino - guardian of peace in other country! <2> Nang minsang magtungo ako sa Chicago ay nakilala ko ang isang Filipinong pulis doon – si Detective Edwin Dantes. when I went to Chicago once, I met a Filipino police there, Detective Edwin Dantes. <3> Tubong Cabanatuan City ang pamilya ni Edwin. Edwin's family is raised in Cabanatuan City. <4> Isang nurse ang kanyang ina at ang kanyang ama naman ay isang pulis sa kanilang bayan. his mother is a nurse and his father is a police in their town. <5> Nang ipetisyon ng isang ospital sa Chicago ang kanyang ina upang doon na magtrabaho ay sumunod doon ang kanilang ama. when a hospital in Chicago petitioned his mother to work there, their father followed. <6> Taong 1969, sa edad na pito ay nakarating at nagsimulang manirahan si Edwin sa Chicago kasama ang kanyang dalawa pang kapatid. in the year 1969, at the age of seven, Edwin reached and started living in Chicago with his two siblings. <7> Pinetisyon sila ng kanilang mga magulang. they are petitioned by their parents. <8> Sa nasabing bansa na siya nag-aral at lumaki. he studied on the said country and grew up there. <9> At bagama’t noong una ay nahirapan siya sa pag-a-adjust sa lengguwahe doon, hindi nagtagal ay nakasanayan na rin niya ito. and even though at first, he had a difficulty in adjusting with the language there, not long after he became used to it. <10> Wala sa plano ni Edwin ang maging isang pulis, subalit tila nasa dugo nga yata niya ito sapagkat noong nasa kolehiyo siya ay naisipan na niyang pumasok sa military bilang miyembro ng security police sa airforce. Edwin did not have a plan to become a police, but somehow, it is already been in his blood because when he was in college, he already thought of entering the military as member of the security police in air force. <11> “Noong una nasa airforce ako, apat na taon akong nasa Clark airbase,” kwento niya. "in the beginning, I was in the air force, I was at the Clark airbase for four years," he narrated. <12> Sa Clark Airbase sa Pampanga niya piniling magpadestino sapagkat nais niyang makauwi sa bansa. he chose to be assigned at Clark Airbase Pampanga because he wanted to go home to the country. <13> Matapos ang kanyang destino sa Clark, bumalik siya sa U.S. after his assignment at Clark, he went back to U.S. <14> Doon niya naisipan na maging isang pulis. there, he thought of becoming a police. <15> Noong una, sa suburbs siya nadestino bilang isang patrolman, subalit nalipat siya sa Chicago. in the past, he was assigned in suburbs as a patrolman, but he was transferred to Chicago. <16> Mula sa kwento ni Edwin ay aking napagtanto na hindi biro ang pinagdaraanan ng isang pulis, sapagkat bukod sa pag-aaral at pagpasok sa academy ay kinakailangan ding maipasa ang iba’t ibang physical exam at training. from Edwin's story, I realized that the experiences of a police are not a joke, because aside from studying and entering the academy, various physical exams and training need to be passed. <17> “Paglabas ko sa academy, may FTO (Field Training Officer). "when I went out of the academy, there is an FTO (Field Training Officer). <18> Kailangan na sa loob ng tatlong buwan, may kasama kang FTO bago may one year probation,” saad niya. within three months, you should be accompanied by an FTO before a one-year probation," he said. <19> Iba’t ibang departamento rin ang napasukan niya, kabilang na rito ang street crime and fake program unit at tactical team, na naglalayong alisin ang mga gang, drug at mga baril sa kalsada upang mabawa-san ang karahasan. he has entered different departments, included here are the street crime and fake program unit and tactical team, with a goal to remove the gangs, drug and guns on the streets to lessen violence. <20> Mula sa pagiging isang patrolman na gumagawa ng mga preliminary investigation sa isang kaso ay naging FTO siya at naibahagi niya ang kanyang kaalaman at naging gabay ng mga bagong pulis. from being a patrolman conducting preliminary investigation in a case, he became an FTO and shared his knowledge and became a guide to new policemen. <21> Hindi nagtagal ay nagbunga ang mga pagsisikap ni Edwin sapagkat mula sa pagiging isang FTO ay muli siyang na-promote at naging isang detective. not long after, Edwin's hard work bore fruit because from being an FTO, he was promoted and became a detective. <22> Kinailangang muling sumai-lalim sa training at pag-aaral sa detective school ni Edwin upang higit na magkaroon ng kaalaman sa trabahong hahawakan niya, at dahil sa tiyaga at pagsisikap ay nalagpasan niya ang mga pag-subok na iyon. Edwin needed to undergo training and studies again from detective school to gain more knowledge on the job that he would be handling, and because of perseverance and hard work, he surpassed those challenges. <23> Hindi madali ang trabaho ng isang detective na gaya ni Edwin, sapagkat bukod sa posibilidad na balikan siya ng mga criminal na inaresto niya ay mabigat na tungkulin rin ang nakaatang sa mga balikat niya- ang maglingkod sa bayan at siguraduhing ligtas ang mga mamamayan- ngunit kung may puso at compassion na nararamdaman para sa pagseserbisyo sa kapwa nasa sariling bayan man o hindi, kahit gaano pa kabigat na tungkulin ay magiging magaan. the work of a detective like Edwin is not easy, because, aside from the possibility that the criminals he has arrested will go back to him, a heavy duty is also put on his shoulders - to serve the nation and make sure the citizens are safe - but if there is a heart and compassion felt for the service of the people, whether on his own country or not, no matter how heavy the duty might be, it will become lighter.

Lucena City, June 17 (PIA) - an award ceremony for nutrition is scheduled to be held at the Quezon Convention Center in July as part of the celebration of Nutrition Month in the province of Quezon. <4> Sa idinaos na pagpupulong, sinabi ni panglalalawigang agrikultor Roberto Gajo, provincial nutrition action officer, na bago isagawa ang parangal ay magkakaroon muna ng pagtatasa ang pamahalaang panlalawigan sa pamamagitan ng provincial multi-sectoral council upang tingnan ang proyekto ng mga municipal nutrition action officer, barangay nutrition action officer at municipal nutrition council sa pagpapatupad ng mga programa sa nutrisyon sa kani-kanilang bayan. Provincial Agriculturist Provincial Nutrition Office Roberto Gajo said at the recent meeting that prior to the awarding ceremony there will be an assessment of the projects of the municipal nutrition action officer, barangay nutrition action officer and municipal nutrition council in their respective areas to implement the nutrition programs by the provincial government through the provincial multi-sectoral council. <5> Sinabi pa ni Gajo na ang mapipiling natatanging municipal nutrition action officer ay tatanggap ng premyo na P20,000 samantalang ang mapipiling natatanging barangay nutrition council ay tatanggap ng P40,000 at ang natatanging municipal nutrition council ay P100,000 na ibibigay sa idaraos na gawad-parangal. Gajo also said that the winning municipal action offer will receive the prize of 20,000 pesos while the winning barangay nutrition council will receive 40,000 pesos and 100,000 pesos to the winning municipal nutrition council which will be given at the awarding ceremony. <6> Layunin ng aktibidad na mapalakas pa ang programa sa nutrisyon sa mga bayan sa lalawigan ng Quezon at mapababa o malutas ang problema sa malnutrisyon sa ilang mga bayan sa pamamagitan ng pagpapatupad ng iba’t-ibang mga programa sa nutrisyon kagaya ng operation-timbang, feeding program at iba pa. the goal of the activity is to strengthen the nutrition program in the towns of Quezon province and to lower or solve the malnutrition problem in several towns through the implementation of various programs such as weighing-operation, feeding program and others. <7> Ang tema ng pagdiriwang ng buwan ng nutrisyon ngayong taon ay “1st 1000 days ni baby, pahalagahan para sa malusog na kinabukasan’ . the theme of the Nutrition Month this year is "give value for the 1st 1000 days of the baby for a healthy future." <8> Ang iba pang mga nakahanay na aktibidad ng pamahalaang panlalawigan ng Quezon ay ang pambansang paglulunsad ng buwan ng nutrisyon sa lungsod ng Lucena sa Hulyo 1; pag-host ng flag raising ceremony ng provincial multi-sectoral nutrition council sa Hulyo 11; Mothers class sa Quezon Medical Center sa lungsod ng Lucena sa Hulyo 15; pagdaraos ng ika-2 barangay nutrition scholar provincial convention sa Quezon Convention Center, Lucena City sa Hulyo 25 at ang gawad-parangal sa nutrisyon. other activities lined up by the provincial government of Quezon includes the launching of the national nutrition month in Lucena on July 1, hosting of the flag-raising ceremony of the provincial multi-sectoral nutrition council on July 11, mothers' class in Quezon Medical Center in Lucena City on July 15, celebration of the 2nd barangay nutrition scholar provincial convention at the Quezon Convention Center, Lucena City on July 25 and the awarding ceremony on nutrition. <9> Ang pagsusulong ng programa sa nutrisyon ay isa rin sa mga programang isinusulong ng pamahalaang panlalawigan sa pangunguna ni Gobernador David Suarez. the promotion of the nutrition program is one of the programs advocated by the provincial government headed by Governor David Suarez. <10> (MCA/RO, PIA-Quezon) (MCA/RO, PIA-Quezon)

City of Quezon, 30th of May (PIA) - the collaboration of the Philippine Coast Guard and the Department of Health Mimaropa to increase those knowledgeable of water search and rescue or WASAR continues. <5> Ayon kay DOH-Mimaropa Regional Director (RD) Eduardo Janairo, ito ay para matiyak ang kaligtasan ng mga kababayang dumadayo sa mga resorts. according to DOH-Mimaropa regional director (RD) Eduardo Janairo, this is to ensure the safety of our fellowmen visiting resorts. <6> Sa kasalukuyan, umabot na sa 336 katao sa Palawan ang nakapasa sa limang araw na DOH WASAR Training. at present, up to 336 people in Palawan have passed the five-day DOH WASAR Training. <7> Ang bilang ay mahigit sa kalahati ng 500 katao na tinatarget ng DOH-Mimaropa para sa rehiyon. the number is more than half of 500 people targeted by DOH-Mimaropa for the region. <8> Pinakahuling pagsasanay ay ginanap sa bayan ng Coron kung saan 17 ang nakapasa noong Mayo 23-27. the latest training was held in the town of Coron where 17 people passed on May 23-27. <9> Sa pamamagitan ng kasanayan sa WASAR, naniniwala si RD Janairo na makakatulong agad sa mga nalulunod ang mga sinanay. through knowledge of WASAR, RD Janairo believes that the trainees can immediately help those drowning. <10> Bukod dito, mababawasan pa ang panganib na kakaharapin ng mga mag- liligtas o rescuers anu pa man ang kalagayan ng tubig: tahimik, maalon, baha o ilog. aside from this, the dangers faced by rescuers or rescuers will decrease whatever the condition of the water may be: calm, full of waves, flood or river. <11> Ang DOH WASAR Training o pagsasanay sa lifeguards at emergency responders ay bahagi ng mas malaking programa---ang Health in Tourism---na inilunsad ng DOH-Mimaropa noong Marso 24 sa Puerto Princesa. the DOH WASAR Training or training of lifeguards and emergency responders is part of a bigger program - the Health in Tourism - launched by DOH-Mimaropa on March 24 in Puerto Princesa. <12> Kabilang sa Health in Tourism ay ang pagkontrol sa daga at disinpeksyon, kalinisan sa pantalan at mga barko, paglalagay ng mga signage sa mga istratehikong lugar, paglikha ng mga samahan ng mga klinika, pagtatayo ng mga boya (buoys), tore ng lifeguard, pagsusuri ng tubig at wastong pagtatapon ng basura. included in Health in Tourism are the control of rats and disinfection, cleanliness in ports and ships, placing signage in strategic locations, creation of associations of clinics, setting up buoys (buoys), lifeguard tower, inspection of water and proper waste disposal. <13> (DOH- Mimaropa/LP) (DOH- Mimaropa/LP)

City of General Santos, June 9 (PIA) - newly-elected officials of the city took an oath of office last Monday, led by Mayor Ronnel Rivera for his second term as the head administrator of the local government of Gensan. <4> Ayon sa ulat ng City Public Information Office (CPIO) pinagasiwaan ni Regional Trial Court (RTC) Executive Judge Oscar Noel Jr. ang panunumpa sa katungkulan ng naturang mga opisyal sa isang seremonya na idinaos sa harap ng gusali ng City Hall at dinalohan ng mga empleyado ng lokal na pamahalaan, representante ng iba’t-ibang pampublikong ahensya, at pribadong organisasyon. according to the report of the City Public Information Office (CPIO), Regional Trial Court (RTC) Executive Judge Oscar Noel Junior presided over the taking of oaths of office by the said officials in a ceremony that was held in front of the city hall building and was attended by employees of the local government, representatives and various public agencies and private organizations. <5> Dagdag pa sa ulat kasamang nanumpa ni Mayor Rivera ang Bise Mayor nitong si Shirlyn Bañas-Nograles na uupo para sa ikatlo at huling termino nito bilang pinuno ng lehislatibong sangay ng lungsod. also added in the news, Mayor Rivera took an oath with his vice mayor, Shirlyn Bañas-Nograle, who was taking the position for her third and last term as head of the legislative branch of the city. <6> Nanumpa rin sa tungkulin ang 12 myembro ng Sangguniang Panlungsod na kinabibilangan nina Elizabeth Bagonoc, Bobby Pacquiao, Rosalita Nuñez, Jose Orlando Acharon, Atty. Dominador Lagare Jr., Atty. Franklin Gacal, Shandee Llido-Pestaño, Atty. Jose Edmar Yumang, Vandyk Congson, Lourdes Casabuena, Atty. Ramon Melliza, at Brix Tan. 12 members of the city council, including Elizabeth Bagonoc, Bobby Pacquiao, Rosalita Nuñez, Jose Orlando Acharon, Attorney Dominador Lagare Junior, Attorney Franklin Gacal, Shandee Llido-Pestaño, Attorney Jose Edmar Yumang, Vandyk Congson, Lourdes Casabuena, Attorney Ramon Melliza, and Brix Tan, also took an oath of office. <7> Samantala, umaasa naman si Rivera na sa pagkakaupo nito bilang Mayor ng lungsod sa ikalawang pagkakataon ay mas matututokan nito ang pagpapalago sa ekonomiya ng lungsod at pagsasaayos ng problema sa transportasyon sa lugar. meanwhile, Rivera is hoping that in his election as mayor of the city for the second time, he could focus more on making the city's economy grow and fixing the transportation problem in the area. <8> (PGFruylan/PIA-Gensan) (PGFruylan/PIA-Gensan)

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_36079027 <1> Friday, December 27, 2013 Friday, December 27, 2013 <2> Mapalad Ka Ba? are you lucky? <3> Ang mga mabababaw na tao ay naniniwala sa suwerte. shallow people believe in luck. <4> Ang mga malalalim na tao ay naniniwala sa sanhi at epekto, sa aksiyon at reaksiyon, sa gawa at resulta. intellectual people believe in cause and effect, action and reaction, action and result. <5> Ang pagiging masuwerte o mapalad ay depende sa mga aksiyon ng maraming tao na karelasyon mo. being lucky or fortunate depends on the actions of many people related to you. <6> Kung alam mo ang sekreto tungkol dito, makukuha mo ang iyong mga naisin nang walang anumang alinlangan kaninuman, saanman, at kailanman. if you know the secret about it, you will achieve your desires without any doubt from anyone, anywhere, anytime. <7> Dalawa ang mahalagang mga elemento nito: Una, Ang masidhi at masikhay na paggawa lamang ay hindi nakakatiyak na ikaw ay magtatagumpay; Pangalawa, Ang tunay na susi ng mapapalad na tao para magtagumpay ay ang kaalaman kung papaano mahahalina at makukuha ang kooperasyon ng iba na tulungan sila at maidulot sa kanila ang magandang mga oportunidad. two are its important elements: first, intense and diligent work only will not ensure you will succeed; second, the real key of lucky people to succeed is the knowledge of how to attract and obtain the cooperation of others to help them and provide them good opportunities. <8> Nagagawa nito na maging madali ang buhay at nagkakaroon ka ng ibayong kahalagahan para sa iba na tulungan ka sa abot ng kanilang makakaya. it makes life easier and you will have double the value for others to help you to the best of their ability. <9> At, ang mainam pa dito ay natututuhan mo kung papaano bawasan at maiwasan ang mga kamalian o masamang kapalaran na dumarating sa iyo. and, what's good here is you learn to lessen and avoid mistakes or bad luck coming your way. <10> 7 Sekreto ng Matatagumpay na Tao 7 secrets of successful people <11> 1\. Gawing madali ang pangmasid sa buhay---ngunit huwag itong laruin at ipagwalang bahala. 1. make it easy to observe life - but do not play with it and ignore it. <12> 2\. Linangin na maging magiliw kaninuman---kahit na ikaw ay mahiyain. 2. study how to become affectionate to anyone - even if you are shy. <13> 3\. Makilala na parang bata sa kakulitan na matuto at maging mahusay sa gawain---walang hintong pagsaliksik at pagsasanay upang paunlarin ang mga kaalaman at mga kakayahan. 3. be known to resemble a kid due to insistence to learn and excel in tasks - non-stop research and training to improve knowledge and skills. <14> 4\. Gawing madali at masigla ang buhay ng iba---kapag masaya ka---nagagawa nito na maging masaya din ang iba na nakapaligid sa iyo. 4. make the life of others easy and lively - if you are happy - this makes the people around you happy too. <15> 5\. Hayaan ang makapangyarihan at maimpluwensiyang mga tao na maangkin ang bahagi ng pagkatao mo---ibahagi anumang kakayahan na makakatulong lalo na sa may mga tungkulin para sa maramihan at madaling paglilingkod. 5. allow powerful and influential people to own a part of your self - share any skill that can help especially to those with duties for abundant and easy service. <16> 6\. Patatagin at bantayan ang iyong mga tulay---kahit papaano iwasang nakakaligtaan ang mga "tulay" na tangi mong daan para sa iyong mga relasyon, komunikasyon, at mga makabuluhang bagay na nakakatulong sa iyo. 6. level and guard your bridges - in some way avoid forgetting the "bridges" that are your only path to your relationships, communication, and meaningful things that help you. <17> 7\. Gawin ang mga tagumpay na maging mapapalad na kabanata---bawa't yugto na dumaan sa iyo ay mahahalaga bilang mga leksiyon para lalong humusay ka para maging mapalad sa tuwina. 7. make your successes lucky chapters - every installment that comes your way is an important lesson for you to improve more to always be lucky. <18> Nakakiling ang pagkakataon sa preparadong isipan. opportunity is inclined towards a prepared mind. <19> Sapagkat kung ikaw ay may plano, 50 porsiyento ng iyong gawain ay tapos na. because if you have a plan, 50 percent of your task is done already. <20> Subalit kung hindi ka nagplano, nagplano ka para tuluyang mabigo. but if you did not plan, you planned to eventually fail. <21> Isang katalinuhan ng isang walang karanasang tao, ang huwag magbaka-sakali at hindi maniwala sa suwerte. one wisdom of an inexperienced person is, to not leave things to chance and not believe in luck. <22> Kung nais mong maging mapalad sa tuwina, isagawa mo kaagad ang iyong pangarap. if you want to always be lucky, enact your dream immediately. <23> Sa araw na ito, maaari mo nang gawin ang iyong hinaharap upang maging mapalad, hindi ang maghintay at asahang ito ay kusang darating para sa iyo. on this day, you may act out your future to become lucky, not wait and expect that it will voluntarily come to you.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_40997580 <1> EYEWITNESS | ‘Nanggaling sa pulis ang mga putok’ EYEWITNESS | 'The shots came from the police' <2> by Pinoy Weekly by Pinoy Weekly <3> Dalawang lider Moro ang naging saksi sa masaker sa Kidapawan City. two Moro leaders bore witness to the massacre in Kidapawan City. <4> Basahin ang kuwento nila. read their story. <5> Editor’s Note: Humigit-kumulang 6,000 magsasaka mula sa mga bayan ng Makilala, Mlang, Tulunan, Magpet, Roxas, Antipas, Arakan, at lungsod ng Kidapawan sa North Cotabato ang lumahok sa apat-na-araw na barikada malapit sa warehouse ng National Food Authority o NFA para igiit ang panawagang 15,000 sako ng bigas para sa mga biktima ng tagtuyot dahil sa El Nino. editor's note: more or less 6,000 farmers from the town of Makilala, Mlang, Tulunan, Magpet, Roxas, Antipas, Arakan, and the city of Kidapawan in North Cotabato participated in the four-day barricade near the warehouse of the National Food Authority or NFA to call for the 15,000 sacks of rice intended for the victims of drought due to El Nino. <6> Sa kabila ng pangakong ito ng pamahalaan, tumanggi si Cotabato Gov. Lala Mendoza na ibigay ang kanilang hiling. despite it being promised by the government, Cotabato Governor Lala Mendoza refused to give in to their request. <7> Nag-alok na lang ito ng tatlong kilong bigas sa bawat biktima sa loob ng tatlong buwan. instead, she offered three kilograms of rice to each victim in the span of three months. <8> Siyempre, tinanggihan ito ng mga magsasaka, at ipinagpatuloy ang protesta. of course, the farmers refused this offer and continued in their protest. <9> Kahapon, alas-10 ng umaga, naganap ang pagdispers sa barikada na inilarawan nina Bai Ali at Jerome. Yesterday, 10 o'clock in the morning, the dispersal of the barricade took place as described by Bai Ali and Jerome. <10> Di pa rin kumpleto ang mga detalye, sa pagkakasulat ng artikulong ito. the details remain incomplete as this article is being written. <11> Gayunman, napagtanto ng Anakpawis Party-list na tatlo sa nabalitang limang napaslang ay sina Rotello Daelto ng Brgy. Binoongan, Arakan; Victor Lumandang ng Brgy. Alobayon, Magpet; at Enrico Pabrica ng Kidapawan. However, the Anakpawis Party-list realized that three of the five who were allegedly killed were Rotello Daelto from the town of Binoongan, Arakan; Victor Lumandang from the town of Alobayon, Magpet; and Enrico Pabrica of Kidapawan. <12> Di pa nakikilala ang dalawang babae na napaslang diumano sa naturang insidente. two females allegedly slain during the incident have yet to be identified. <13> Samantala, di-bababa sa 30 katao ang sugatan, kasama si Jerome at Sheena Duazo ng Bayan-SMR. meanwhile, no less than 30 people were injured, including Jerome and Sheena Duazo of Bayan-SMR. <14> Jerome Succor Aba Jerome Succor Aba <15> Suara Bangsamoro Suara Bangsamoro <16> Anim na buwan nang nakararanas ng El Nino at wala pa ring tulong na dumarating sa mga 36,000 indibidwal na apektado nito. El Nino has been around for six months already and the 36,000 individuals affected by it still have not received any assistance. <17> Kaya nagpasya ang mga magsasakang Lumad na magbarikada sa national highway ng Kidapawan City para ipresyur ang gobyerno na ilabas ang calamity fund. That's why the Lumad farmers decided to barricade the national highway of Kidapawan City in order to pressure the government to release the calamity fund. <18> Enero 2016, nagdeklara ang local government ng state of calamity, pero hindi pa nila ni-release ang pondo. January 2016, the local government declared a state of calamity but did not yet release the fund. <19> Kaya iginiit ng mga magsasaka ‘yung 15,000 sacks of rice na ipamahagi na. thus, the farmers insisted on the distribution of the 15,000 sacks of rice. <20> Napakatigas ng provincial government. the provincial government was adamant. <21> Sa nagdaang negotiations, ginigiit natin ang 15,000 sako na i-release nila. in past negotiations, we insisted they release the 15,000 sacks. <22> Pero ang kanilang counter proposal ay three kilos of rice na quarterly. but their counter proposal was three kilograms of rice quarterly. <23> Patuloy nating dinepensahan ang barikada sa presensiya ng pulis at militar. let us continue to defend the barricade in the presence of the police and the military. <24> Ito lang ata ang rali na hinaharapan ng long firearms ang mga nagbabarikada. this may be the only rally where those barricading were faced with long firearms. <25> At hinarapan ng bombero, siyempre. and the firefighter faced it, of course. <26> Sa ngayong araw, pang-apat na araw ng barikada, napatawag si Gov. Lala Mendoza ng mga makikipagnegosasyon. this day, the fourth day of the barricade, Governor Lala Mendoza called for negotiators. <27> Tanghali, may negotiation. By noon, there was a negotiation. <28> Pagkatapos nito, magpapatawag dapat kami ng presscon. after this, we were supposed to call for a press conference. <29> Hindi natuloy ang aming presscon dahil biglang dumating si Mayor Joseph Evangelista ng Kidapawan City at Col. Alex Tagum, ang senior superintendent ng Philippine National Police (PNP) dito sa probinsiya, sa barikada. Our press conference got called off because of the sudden arrival of Mayor Joseph Evangelista of Kidapawan City and Colonel Alex Tagum, Senior Superintendent of the Philippine National Police (PNP) here in the province, in the barricade. <30> At may kasama silang barangay chairman na mayroong pinapapirmahan sa atin na nakasulat doon na tanggalin ang barikada. they were accompanied by a barangay chairman who asked us to sign a document stating that the barricade be removed. <31> Sobrang nakakaabala na raw ang barikada. they said the barricade was causing a great inconvenience. <32> “Sir, hinahantay po namin yung negotiations kay Gov. Lala,” sabi namin. "sir, we are waiting for the negotiations with Governor Lala," we said. <33> Pero sagot ni Col. Tagum: “Walang nego-negotiations. but Colonel Tagum answered, "there are no negotiations. <34> Tapos na ang negotiation.” the negotiation is finished." <35> Kaya nagkomand siya na sabi niya, “Men, ready. Tulak!” that's why he commanded, "Men, ready. Push!" <36> Tinulak nila. they pushed. <37> Dinepensahan natin ang hanay natin sa pagbatuta ng mga pulis. we defended our line from the striking of the policemen. <38> Hindi talaga nabuwag ang hanay dahil napakaliit ng pulisya. the line really did not break because there were very few policemen. <39> Nasa 200 ‘yun laban sa 6,000 na mga nagbabarikada. it was 200 against 6,000 protestors. <40> Kaya ang last resort nila, mag-open fire. that's why their last resort was to open fire. <41> Pinagbabaril ang mga magsasaka. the farmers were shot. <42> Pinagpapatay. were killed. <43> Walang ibang may baril doon kundi ang PNP. no one else was armed other than the PNP. <44> At kitang-kita ko, kitang kita naming nina Sheena Duazo, ni Bai Ali Indayla na dun sa harap, ang mga nangatumba, doon sa tabi namin na mga magsasaka na natamaan ng bala ng ripleng M-16. Sheena and I clearly witnessed, as did Bai Ali Indayla in front of us, those who had fallen, the farmers beside us who were hit by the bullets of an M-16 rifle. <45> Kaya walang ibang may utos ng pagbuwag ng barikada kundi si Gov. Lala Mendoza, Mayor Evangelista, at si Col. Alex Tagum ng PNP. that's why no one other than Governor Lala Mendoza, Mayor Evangelista, and Colonel Alex Tagum of the PNP ordered for the dispersal of the barricade. <46> Unang araw pa lang ng barikada, nandun na ang mga Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) at PNP sa taas ng bombero na mga naka-long arm na riple. on the very first day of the barricade, the Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) and PNP were already there on top of the firemen with long-armed rifles. <47> Matapos ang pamamaril, umatras kami. after the shooting, we withdrew. <48> Pumunta kami sa United Methodist Church. we went to the United Methodist Church. <49> Doon pa rin nagpaputok pa rin sila. they were still shooting there too. <50> Tapos yun tinamaan ng bato si Sheena ng Bayan SMR. after that, Sheena of Bayan SMR was hit by a rock. <51> Duguan ang kanyang ulo. Her head was bleeding. <52> At ako naman, nabiyak ang aking buto sa binti, dahil doon sa tama ng shield at batuta kanina. I, on the other hand, broke my leg due to the hits I took from the shields and police clubs earlier. <53> Kanina dinala kami nina Sheena sa Kidapawan Medical Hospital. earlier, Sheena and I were brought to Kidapawan Medical Hospital. <54> Bai Ali Indayla Bai Ali Indayla <55> Gabriela Women’s Party Gabriela Women's Party <56> Kaninang umaga mga bandang alas-diyes, nagpoprograma pa kami dito sa barikada sa Kidapawan City National Highway, napansin namin na nakaalerto na ang mga pulis. earlier this morning at around 10 o'clock, while we were having our program at the barricade in Kidapawan City National Highway, we noticed the police were already on alert. <57> Nag-anunsiyo na sila sa pamamagitan ng kanilang sound system na talagang bayolenteng bubuwagin na nila ang barikada ng mga magsasaka. they announced via their sound system that they would violently disperse the barricade of farmers. <58> Sinubukan pa naming makausap pa rin yung hepe nila, ng pulis, na si Provincial Dir. Alexander Tagum. we still tried to speak with the policemen's boss, Provincial Director Alexander Tagum. <59> Kinausap ko siya, sinabi ko sa kanya na mayroon pang negotiation na mangyayari sa pagitan ng farmers at ni Governor Lala Talino Mendoza. I spoke to him, I told him that negotiations were to take place between the farmers and Governor Lala Talino Mendoza. <60> Hindi nila puwedeng gamitin ang dahas para lang takutin ang mga magsasaka. they cannot use force just to scare the farmers. <61> Pero sinagot lang ako ni Col. Tagum na wala nang negosasyon na mangyayari, kailangan nang umalis ng mga magsasaka dahil talagang bubuwagin nila ang barikada. but Colonel Tagum answered that there would be no negotiations, that the farmers had to leave because they really were going to disperse the barricade. <62> Kaya nangyari na nga ang pagbuwag nila. and so the dispersal took place. <63> Nakita ko mismo dahil nasa unahan ako ng barikada, pinagpupukpok nila ng batuta at itinulak na ang mga kasama namin na mga magsasaka at gayundin gumamit sila ng bombero upang dahasin ang mga magsasaka. I saw it myself because I was at the front of the barricade, how they struck with their batons and pushed our farmer companions and even used firefighters to force back the farmers. <64> Una, tulak at saka pukpok, palo. First, pushing and striking, whacking. <65> Tapos gumamit na nga ng bombero. Then they used the firefighters. <66> Nung hindi pa mabuwag ang barikada at talagang patuloy na nagtutulak ang mga magsasaka sa piketlayn, napaatras ang mga kapulisan kaya tuluy-tuloy ang paggamit nila ng water cannon. When the barricade did not disperse and the farmers continued to push the picket line, the police fell back and continued to use the water cannon. <67> Nung grabe na ang pambabatuta ng mga pulis, napilitang pumulot ng bato ang mga magsasaka. when the striking of the police intensified, the farmers were forced to pick up rocks. <68> At saka lumaban na rin sa pasismo ng kapulisan. And fought against the fascism of the police. <69> Noong nagkaroon na ng paghahagis ng mga bato, bumato rin ang mga kapulisan hanggang sa hindi talaga mabuwag ang barikada. when the throwing of rocks started, the policemen did the same but the barricade really did not disperse. <70> Kaya, gumamit na ng baril ang kapulisan. thus, the police used their guns. <71> Nakita ko mismo doon sa piketlayn ang dalawa sa aming mga kasamahan na nabuwal. I myself saw two of our companions at the picket line get shot. <72> Ang isa tinamaan sa kanyang mukha at sa kasamaang palad ay hindi nga naka-survive. one was hit in the face and, unfortunately, did not survive. <73> Yung isa naman nadala pa sa ospital, ngunit namatay din po habang ginagamot. the other was brought to the hospital but eventually died while being treated. <74> Ang pangalan niya, yung namatay, ay si Rogelio Daelto. his name, the one who died, was Rogelio Daelto. <75> Siya ‘yung tinamaan sa mukha at naging dahilan ng kanyang agarang kamatayan. he was the one who got shot in the face, which became the reason for his immediate death. <76> Marami ang mga nasugatan kanina dahil sa matagal na pamamaril ng mga kapulisan. many were injured earlier due to the relentless shooting of the police. <77> Sa harapan po ng barikada (nanggaling ang mga putok). at the front of the barricade (was where the shots came from). <78> Sa hanay ng kapulisan. From the line of policemen. <79> Ang hanay ng kapulisan ay nakaharap sa national highway papunta ng Davao City. the ranks of policemen faced the national highway towards Davao City. <80> Ang nagbarikada ay nakaharap sa direksiyon na papunta sa Cotabato City. those who barricaded faced the direction going to Cotabato City. <81> Ngayon, doon sa pamamaril ng kapulisan at meron na ngang mga tinamaan, napilitan ang mga magsasaka na pumasok sa Spottswood, sa compound ng United Methodist Church at hanggang sa mismong gate ng methodist church sumunod po doon ang mga kapulisan at patuloy na nagpaputok. now, in the midst of the police's shooting, and there were already casualties, the farmers were forced to enter Spottswood in the United Methodist Church compound and even up to the gate of the Methodist church, they were followed by the police who continued to shoot. <82> Mapayapa na nagbarikada ang mga magsasaka, malinaw ang mensahe na ibigay ang 15,000 na sako, 15 thousand sacks of rice na hiling ng mga magsasaka na sa loob ng anim na buwan ay naging biktima ng El Nino, ng drought at walang makain dahil walang maani. the farmers peacefully protested. it was clearly stated that they were to be given 15,000 sacks, 15 thousand sacks of rice requested by the farmers who, for six months, became victims of El Nino, of drought and didn't have anything to eat because there was nothing to harvest. <83> Walang puwedeng maitanim dahil ang kanilang mga kalupaan ay tuyung-tuyo na dahil sa El Nino. nothing could be planted because their lands were barren due to the El Nino. <84> Sa kabila ng panawagan na ito ng mga magsasaka nagmatigas ho si Governor Lala Talino Mendoza na ibigay ang P130-Milyon na calamity fund sa pamamagitan ng pagbibigay ng bigas sa mga magsasaka. Despite the call of the farmers, Governor Lala Talino Mendoza firmly refused to give them the P130-million calamity fund through distribution of rice to the farmers. <85> Sa halip dahas, bala, baril, mismong pagpatay sa mga magsasaka ang pinakita ng gobyerno na ito ni Noynoy Aquino at ni Gov. Lala Talino Mendoza. Instead, force, bullets, guns, and the killing of farmers were shown by the government of Noynoy Aquino and Governor Lala Talino Mendoza. <86> Saan galing yung putok? Where did the shots come from? <87> Nakita namin mismo dahil nakaharap kami sa kanila. we saw them ourselves because we faced them. <88> Nakapagtago kami, ako, si Sheena Duazo ng Bagong Alyansang Makabayan – Southern Mindanao Region at si Jerome Aba na spokesperson ng Suara Bangsamoro. we were able to hide, me, Sheena Duazo of Bagong Alyansang Makabayan - Southern Mindanao Region, and Jerome Aba, spokesperson of Suara Bangsamoro.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_69063852 <1> Replay: Pagkilos ng kabataan at mamamayan noong 2011 sa saliw ng pop songs replay: youth and people movement in 2011 to the accompaniment of pop songs <2> by Vencer Crisostomo January 21, 2012 by Vencer Crisostomo, January 21, 2012 <3> Parang bonggang “baby you’re a firework” ang naging mga pagkilos ng kabataan at mamamayan para sa pagbabago noong nagdaang taon. the youth and the people's movement for change last year seemed like a grand "baby you're a firework". <4> Habang “everyday I’m shufflin’” at nagkakandarapa ang hikahos na mamamayan, today “I feel like not doing anything” ang Malakanyang sa mga hinaing ng bayan. Kaya naman sawang-sawa na sila na “just the way you are” lang ang mga bagay at dumagundong ng “boomburumbumum” ang mga protesta. while "everyday I'm shufflin" and people are struggling in poverty, today "I feel like not doing anything" of Malacañang to the grievances of the nation. that's why they are fed up with things "just the way you are" and the protests roared with "boomburumbumum". <5> Sa lalong pagtindi ng krisis, tila dumami ang “someone like you” na napa-“moves like jagger” sa samu’t saring mga picket protests, campus strikes, unity march, transport caravan, planking protests, occupy at campouts. because of the worsening crisis, it seems a combination of picket protests, campus strikes, transport caravans, planking protests, occupy and campouts increased because of "someone like you" that "Moves Like Jagger". <6> MRT / LRT fare, Oil Price Hikes Soundtrack: Price tag (It’s not about the money) / Party Rock (Everday we’re shufflin) Sa mga unang bahagi ng taon, “everyday ay shufflin’” ang mga banta ng mga nagtataasang presyo: langis, kuryente, tubig, matrikula, gulay, MRT/ LRT. MRT / LRT fare, Oil Price Hikes Soundtrack: Price tag (It's not about the money) / Party Rock (Everday we're shufflin). in the early part of the year, "everyday is shufflin" the looming increase in prices of oil, electricity, water, tuition fees, vegetables, MRT/LRT <7> “It’s not about the money” na dahil sa sobrang taas ng presyo, talagang wala nang money at butas na ang bulsa. "It's not about the money" because of the very high price, there is really no more money and pockets are empty. <8> Kaya naman halos araw-araw din pinukpok ng protesta ang mga pahirap na ito. Sa maagang bahagi, pinangunahan ng mga kabataan ang Strike the Hike Movement at mga aksyon kontra pagtataas ng pamasahe sa MRT at LRT, na kalaunan ay iniatras ng gubyerno dahil sa mga protesta. that's why everyday these suffering were struck with protests. in the early part, the youth led the Strike the Hike Movement and the activities against the increase in MRT and LRT fares that was eventually retracted by the government because of protests. <9> Kabi-kabila ang inilunsad na mga transport strike at people’s protests laban sa oil price hikes. transport strike and people's protests against oil price hikes were launched one after the other. <10> Rumurok ang mga protesta sa malaking pagkilos ng mamamayan noong May 1. the pinnacle of the protests was the public mass action last May 1. <11> Anti-budget cut strikes, fight for education Soundtrack: Born this way (jingle link) Dance step: planking at freeze mob anti-budget cut strikes, fight for education soundtrack: born this way (jingle link) dance step: planking at freeze mob <12> “Pagkat ang edukasyon / ay ating karapatan / tumindig ka isko para sa ting bayan No to commercialization / at sa privatization / tumindig ka isko tayo ay lumaban” "because education / is our right / stand-up scholars for our nation no to commercialization / and privatization / stand-up scholars let us fight" <13> Nakaka “gaga” naman na talaga ang muli na namang pagkakaltas ng pondo ng edukasyon at ng mga serbisyong panlipunan. we get "gaga" about the reduction of the budget for education and public services. <14> Kaya naman muling hinarap ng mga kabataan at mamamayan ng kabi-kabilang protesta at ng isang pambansang welga ang budget cuts ni Aquino. thus, the youth and the people addressed the budget cuts of Aquino with protests after protests and a national strike. <15> Mahigit 20,000 ang nagstrike, nagplanking, nagfreeze mob, at nag long march sa buong bayan. more than 20,000 people participated in strikes, planking, freeze mob, and long-march in the whole country. <16> Nagprotesta din ang mga kabataan laban sa tindi ng pagtaas ng matrikula at mga miscellaneous fees na nagtulak sa Malakanyang na mangako ng bagong tuition policy (na hanggang ngayon, by the way, ay wala pa din.) Inilantad ng kawalang-aksyon sa mga protesta na mukhang “born this way” ang Commission on Higher Education, pabor sa mga kapitalista-edukador. the youth also protested against the high increase in matriculation and miscellaneous fees that forced the Malacañang to promise a new tuition policy (which until now, by the way, there is none). the Commission on Higher Education was exposed of inaction that appears to be "born this way" in favor of capitalist-educators. <17> May mga naging tagumpay din matapos ang matutunog na protesta sa University of Sto. Tomas (UST) laban sa no promissory note policy at pagpapasara sa Philippine Maritime Institute (PMI). there were also successes after the resounding protests at the University of Santo Tomas (UST) against the no promissory note policy and the closing of the Philippine Maritime Institute (PMI). <18> Clinton Visit Protests Soundtrack: Hey Soul Sister / Just the way you are “I don’t want to miss a single thing you do” ng walang protesta — yan ang pangako ng mga kabataan sa pagdating ni Hillary Clinton sa bansa. Clinton visit protests soundtrack: hey soul sister / just the way you are "I don't want to miss a single thing you do" of no protest - was the promise of the youth at the arrival of Hillary Clinton in the country. <19> Dala ni “sister” ang higit pang pagtindi ng interbensyon ng US dito at “pagkakaibigan” ng US at Pilipinas sa pagmimintina ng di pantay na mga tratado gaya ng VFA at iba pa. "sister" brought the further extreme intervention of the US here and "friendship" of the US and the Philippines through maintaining of unfair treaties like the VFA and others. <20> Kaya naman “when they saw her face face face” inambush ang kanyang convoy at face to face siyang sinigawan sa inorganisang forum. that's why "when they saw her face face face" her convoy was ambushed and was yelled at the organized form in person. <21> Ang panawagan, baguhin na ang ang di pantay na relasyon at hindi na pwedeng “just the way you are” lang. their appeal was to change the unequal relations and "just the way you are" is no longer possible. <22> Ka Roger Tribute Soundtrack: Firework “Baby you’re a firework.” Pasabog naman talaga ang buhay ni Ka Roger Rosal kaya nang mabalitaan ng bayan ang kanyang pagpanaw, mga parangal ay pagpupugay ang inialay ng bayan, iba’t ibang sektor, maralita, mga kasapi ng media at mga kabataan sa kanya. Ka Roger tribute soundtrack: firework "baby you're a firework." ComradeRoger Rosal's life was really passionate so when the nation heard about his passing, honor and tribute were offered by the nation, various sectors, the poor, members of the media and the youth. <23> Mahalagang inspirasyon si Ka Roger sa mamamayan at halimbawa sa mga nagnanais lumaban sa bulok na sistema at sa mga aktibistang nagpupunyagi na mamuhay ng simple at maging mga tagapagsalita ng mamamayang api. ComradeRoger was an important inspiration and example to those who want to fight the rotten system and the activists desiring to live simply and be a spokesperson for the oppressed. <24> Hangga’t bulok ang sistema at mahirap ang mga tao, mas maraming mga Ka Roger pa ang magbibigay liwanag sa kadiliman ng gabi at magbibigay tanglaw sa taumbayan. as long as the system is corrupt and the people are poor, there are many ComradeRoger who will give light to the darkness of the night and will shed light to the people. <25> Fight for Luisita Soundtrack: The Lazy Song Hacienderong haciendero ang moda ni Noynoy Aquino: “today I feel like not doing anything” tungkol sa pamamahagi ng Hacienda Luisita. fight for Luisita soundtrack: the lazy song farm owner mode of Noynoy Aquino: "today I feel like not doing anything" about the distribution of Hacienda Luisita. <26> Pero dahil sa lakas ng paggigiit at paglaban ng mga magsasaka at taumbayan, nalabanan ang pakanang Stock Distribution Option sa Luisita at pumabor ang Korte Suprema sa pamamahagi nito. due to the strong insistence and opposition of the farmers and the people, the Stock Distribution Option maneuver of Luisita was thwarted and the Supreme Court favored its distribution. <27> Sa kabila ng atas ng korte, “yes, I said it because I can” si Noynoy na ibigay umano ang “just compensation” sa kanyang mga kapamilya. in spite of the order of the court, "yes, I said it because I can,"  Noynoy supposedly wants to give "just compensation" to his relatives. <28> Hindi pa sapat ang pahirap nila sa mga magsasaka sa lupang ninakaw nila, gusto pa nilang kumita? isn't it enough, the suffering they gave to farmers with the land they stole, that they still want to earn? <29> Dapat ang ibigay sa kanila: “nothing at all.” Occupy Mendiola / Campout Soundtrack: Superbass (boom boroomboomboom) Tila kinabog ng parang “boomburumbumbum” ang dibdib ni Noynoy Aquino sa planong Occupy Mendiola o Campout protest ng mga kabataan at mamamayan noong Disyembre. Layon ng pagkilos na labanan ang bulok na sistema ng iilan at dayuhan sa ilang araw na pananatili sa Mendiola at pag-occupy dito. they should be given "nothing at all". occupy Mendiola / campout soundtrack: Superbass (boom boroom boom boom) it seems the chest of Noynoy Aquino was pounded with "boom burum bum bum" by the Occupy Mendiola Plan or Campout protest of the youth and the people last December. the goal of the action was to fight the rotten system of the few and foreigners in a few days stay in Mendiola and to occupy it. <30> Agad nagdeploy ng sangkatutak na pulis ang Malakanyang bago pa man magsimula at dinahas ang planong protesta. Malacañang quickly deployed a multitude of policemen before the planned protest even began and was violent. <31> Hindi naman nagpatinag ang mga kabataan at mamamayan, naggiit ng kanilang karapatan at itinuloy sa iba’t ibang lugar sa Kamaynilaan ang ilang raw na campout. the youth and the people were not shaken, they asserted their rights and they continued the camp-out in various places in Metro Manila. <32> Sa huli, mas marami ang namulat na walang pinag-ba ang gubyerno ni Aquino sa marahas na pamumuno ni Arroyo at ang kailangan ay ang malalaking pagkilos at magiting na paglaban para baguhin ang bulok na sistema. in the end, many saw that there is no difference between the Aquino government and the violent leadership of Arroyo and the need for a massive action and bold fight to change the rotten system. <33> Pananagot kay Arroyo, kainutilan ni Aquino Soundtrack: Someone like you / Moves like Jagger Matapos ang isang taon ng obvious na kasunduan nina Aquino at Arroyo hinggil sa hindi pananagot sa ikalawa dahil sa kawalan ng kasong isinampa, uminit ang tunggalian ng mga nasa kapangyarihan ng mag “moves like Jagger” na si Arroyo at muntik nang makatakas dahil sa kainutilan ni Aquino. accountability of Arroyo, worthlessness of Aquino soundtrack: someone like you / moves like Jagger. after a year of the obvious agreement of Aquino and Arroyo regarding the unaccountability of the latter because of the absence of charges filed, the conflict of those in power intensified when Arroyo "moves like Jagger" and nearly escaped because of Aquino inutility. <34> Nagkandarapa si Aquino sa huling mga sandali at nailantad na kaya naman palang magsampa ng kaso ng mabilis, bagay na hindi nito ginawa sa nagdaang 500 araw. Aquino scurried in his last few moments and was exposed that they could speedily file a case, something that they didn't do in the past 500 days. <35> Hanggang sa kasalukuyan, mga magagaang kaso pa din ang isinampa ni Aquino laban kay Arroyo at tila may special treatment pa sa hospital arrest kay Gloria. until now, only light charges were filed by Aquino against Arroyo and it seems there's a special treatment with Gloria's hospital arrest. <36> Para ilayo nito sa kapalpakan ng kanyang sarili ang atensyon, at pagmukhaing seryoso siya sa pagpapanagot kay Arroyo, kinampanya ni Aquino ang impeachment ni SC CJ Corona. to divert the attention from his mistakes, and to look like he is serious to make Arroyo accountable, Aquino campaigned for the impeachment of SC CJ Corona. <37> Kalikasan at mga trahedya Soundtrack: Party Like 2012 / Teach me how to Dougie Habang parang end of the world na sa mga nasalanta ng trahedya, nabuking na nagpaparty at nagteteachme how to Dougie si Aquino sa Palasyo. environment and tragedy soundtrack: party like 2012 / teach me how to doggie while it was almost like the end of the world for those who were devastated in the tragedy, Aquino was exposed to have been partying and teaching how to doggie in the Palace. <38> Mas malaking pananagutan ni Aquino ang pakikiparty at pagpayag sa mga malalaking kumpanya ng pagmimina at loggers na magpiyesta sa resources ng bayan ng walang pakundangan at walang konsiderasyon sa buhay ng mga Pilipino. Aquino has a greater liability in partying and allowing big mining and logging companies to feast using the resources of the nation without respect and consideration to the lives of the Filipinos. <39> Matagumpay at makabuluhan ang 2011 para sa mga kabataan at sa kilusang protesta. 2011 was victorious and meaningful for the youth and the protest movement. <40> Mas malalaki pang tagumpay ang hinahrap ng mga kabataan at mamamayan sa 2012. a greater victory awaits the youth and the people in 2012. <41> Hindi pa end of the world. it is not yet the end of the world. <42> Nagsisimula pa lang ang mas malalaking paglaban para tapusin na at baguhin ang sistemang panlipunan. the big battles to end and change the social system are just beginning.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_71308597 <1> Ombudsman: Makati most transparent city Ombudsman: Makati most transparent city <2> December 13, 2014 December 13, 2014 <3> Written by Atty. written by Attorney <4> Jay De Castro Published in Opinion Read: 1170 NITONG Huwebes, kinilala ng Office of the Ombudsman ang administrasyon ni Mayor Junjun Binay sa matagumpay nitong pag-alis o pagbawas ng “red tape” sa pagtatayo ng negosyo sa Makati, na nagbigay sa investors rito ng madali at mabilis na pagrehistro ng mga bagong negosyo o renewal ng business permit sa lungsod. Jay De Castro published in Opinion Read: 1170 this Thursday, the Office of the Ombudsman identified the administration of Mayor Junjun Binay for its success to eradicate or minimize "red tape" in setting up a business in Makati, that gave its investors an easy and fast registration of new businesses or renewal of business permits to the city. <5> Binigyan ng Ombudsman ng Blue Certification o piinakamataas na grado ang Makati, bilang pagkilala sa mabilis, maayos at walang “lagay” na pagbibigay nito ng business registrations at permits, sa mga bagong nagnenegosyo sa lungsod, na tinuturing na primerang financial district ng bansa. the Ombudsman gave a Blue Certification or the highest grade to Makati, as recognition for a fast, systematic and no bribery in giving out business registrations and permits to those who are venturing into business in the city, considered as the primary financial business district in the country. <6> Ang award ay binigay ng PACPO (Public Assistance and Corruption Prevention Office) ng Ombudsman, na nag-aaral at humahanap ng solusyon sa mga katiwalian, kurapsyon at maling pamamaraan, kaugnay ng pagtatayo ng negosyo, upang ito’y mawala at maging maayos at matagumpay ang pagnenegosyo sa bansa. the award was given by PACPO (Public Assistance and Corruption Prevention Office) of Ombudsman that studies and seeks for a solution to anomalies, corruption, and wrong system regarding setting up businesses, so it can be eradicated and have a decent and successful business venture in the country. <7> Sa tatlong lungsod na kinumpara ng Ombudsman (Taguig, Marikina at Makati), ang siyudad na dating pinamunuan ni Vice-President Jejomar Binay, ang napiling pinaka-episiyente sa larangan ng pagbibigay ng mga kaukulang lisensya sa mga baguhang nagnenegosyo sa pinakamayamang lungsod sa Metro Manila. in the three cities compared by Ombudsman (Taguig, Marikina, and Makati), the city that was formerly governed by Vice-President Jejomar Binay, was chosen as the most efficient in issuing relevant licenses to new businesses in the richest city in Metro Manila. <8> Ang naging batayan ng Ombudsman sa pagpili sa Makati ay, information technology, level of customer convenience o satisfaction at mga sistema nito na naggagarantiya na pag-apruba ng lisensya, kung saan ang mga investor ay hindi kinakailangang maglagay sa mga tinatawag na “fixer”. the bases by the Ombudsman in choosing Makati are information technology, level of customer convenience or satisfaction and its system that guarantees approval of license, wherein investors do not need to bribe fixers. <9> Ibinigay ni Assistant Ombudsman Evelyn Baliton ang Blue Certification Award kay Mayor Junjun Binay sa opisina nito sa Makati, kung saan sinabi ng alkalde na “transparent ang pagnenegosyo sa Makati” at natutuwa siya sa pagkilala ng mismong Ombudsman sa “maayos at walang halong kurapsyon na pagtatayo ng negosyo sa kanilang lungsod.” Assistant Ombudsman Evelyn Baliton gave the Blue Certification Award to Mayor Junjun Binay in its office in Makati, where the mayor said that doing business in Makati is transparent and he is happy on the recognition by the Ombudsman itself about its systematic and no corruption involved in putting up a business in their city. <10> Ang maayos na pagtatayo ng negosyo sa lungsod ng Makati, na nagdulot ng kaunlaran rito, ay bunga na rin ng masipag at matapat na pagtratrabaho ng Administrador nito, na si Atty. Jun Mendoza, na walang sawang naglilingkod, kasama si Mayor Junjun, para sa kapakanan at kabutihan ng mga mamamayan ng kanilang lungsod. the systematic business creation in the city of Makati that brings it progress is also the fruit of the diligence and honest work of its administrator, Attorney Jun Mendoza, who serves tirelessly, together with Mayor Junjun, for the welfare and goodness of the people in their city. <11> * * *Kaugnay nito, ang nasabing award na ibinigay ng Ombudsman sa lungsod, ay masasabing magandang balita sa mga mamamayan ng Makati, sa dahilang alam ng lahat na nitong mga nagdaang buwan ay walang humpay na binatikos ng tatlong senador, sina Alan Peter Cayetano, Antonio Trillanes at Koko Pimentel, si Vice President Jojo Binay, tungkol sa di-umano’y mga maanomalyang kontrata o pagnenegosyo sa Makati. - in relation to this, the said award that was given by the Ombudsman to the city, can be regarded as a positive news for the people of Makati, because as everyone knows Vice President Jojo Binay was criticized unabatedly by three senators, Alan Peter Cayetano, Antonio Trillanes and Koko Pimentel in the past months about the alleged anomalous contracts and business ventures in Makati. <12> Hindi kaila sa ating mga kababayan, na simula’t simula sa tuwing mapag-uusapan ang 2016 presidential elections, ay si VP Binay na ang bukod tanging nangunguna sa survey ng presidentiables. it is not unknown from our fellow countrymen that ever since, every time the 2016 presidential elections is discussed, VP Binay is the only one leading the presidential surveys. <13> Dahil rito, ang dalawang senador ng Nacionalista Party, sina Cayetano at Trillanes, na nagpahayag ng kanilang intensyong tumakbo bilang Pangulo at Pangalawang Pangulo sa 2016 ay hindi nag-aksaya ng panahon upang iangat ang kanilang pangalan sa pamamagitan ng pagsira sa pangalan ni VP Jejomar Binay. because of this, two of the senators of the Nacionalista Party, Cayetano and Trillanes, who signified their intention to run for president and vice president in 2016 did not waste time to let their name be known by ruining the name of VP Jejomar Binay. <14> Batay sa resulta ng mga kalilipas na survey, maaaring sabihin na nagtagumpay ang nasabing tatlong senador sa kanilang paninira kay VP Binay, sapagkat nabawasan o bumaba ang rating ng Pangalawang Pangulo. based on the results of the previous surveys, it can be said that the three senators were successful in their ruination of VP Binay, because there was a reduction or decrease in the rating of the Vice President. <15> Sa kabila nito, mayroon ring pinatunayan ang kanilang paninira -- hindi tumaas o nag-improve ang kanilang ratings sa mga nagdaang survey ng SWS at Pulse Asia, sa katunayan silang kapwa nangunguna sa paninira kay VP Binay ay kapwa nakakuha ng pinakamababang pwesto o kulelat sa kandidato para Presidente at Bise-Presidente sa 2016. on the other hand, their vilification also proved something. their rating did not increase or improve in the previous surveys of SWS and Pulse Asia, in fact both of them who leads the defamation of VP Binay, got the lowest positions as candidates for president and vice-president in 2016. <16> At ang nanatiling nangunguna pa rin sa latest survey ng presidentiables sa 2016 ay si VP Jejomar Binay. VP Jejomar Binay still remained ahead in the latest survey for president candidates in 2016. <17> Mahigit isa at kalahating taon pa ang presidential election sa May 2016. the presidential election in May 2016 is still more than a year and a half away. <18> Pagdating nito ay magsasawa na ang ating mga mamamayan sa pakikinig sa mga bintang laban kay VP Binay, sapagkat alam na nila na ang mga paninirang ito ay mula sa bibig ng mga kandidato sa 2016 at samakatuwid ay maliwanag na pamumulitika lamang. when it comes, our people would tire of hearing about the accusations against VP Binay, because they know that these accusations are from the mouths of the candidates in 2016 and therefore, it is clearly just politicizing. <19> Pagsapit ng panahong iyon, ang mapag-uusapan na lamang ay ang mga istatistika, tulad mg ibinigay na award ng Ombudsman, na nagpapatunay na walang halong kurapsyon ang magnegosyo sa Makati at dahil rito, ito ang pinakamayamang lungsod sa buong Pilipinas. when that time comes, what will be talked about are the statistics like the award given by Ombudsman, which proves that no corruption is involved to have a business in Makati and because of this it is the richest city in the whole Philippines.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_47398140 <1> Bigyan ng katuparan ang pangarap By Kuya Rom December 5, 2016Dear Kuya Rom,Hindi ako ganito noon. ‘Pag nakikita ko ang aking sarili sa salamin ngayon, sa tingin ko ako ay mataba, pangit, at matanda. Pero ang totoo, bata pa ako, 32-anyos lang. bring reality to dreams by Kuya Rom December 5, 2016 dear Kuya Rom, I was not like this before. when I see myself in the mirror now, I think I am fat, ugly, and old. but in fact, I am still young, only 32 years old. <2> Ako ay may trabaho, may asawa at dalawang anak. I have a job, have a wife and two children. <3> Pero nadi-depress ako ‘pag naiisip kong tumatanda na ako, ang buhok ay nagiging manipis, at ang tiyan ko ay lumalaki. but I get depressed when I think I am getting old, my hair is thinning, my tummy is growing. <4> Pati ang misis ko ay napapangitan na yata sa akin. even my wife probably thinks I am ugly. <5> Bumili siya ng isang magazine tungkol sa fitness and nutrition. Basahin ko raw. she bought a magazine about fitness and nutrition. according to her I should read it. <6> Kasali siya sa isang grupo ng mga kababaihan, at tatlong beses sa isang linggo, sumasayaw sila ng zumba bilang exercise. Maganda ang resulta, sexy siya talaga. she belongs to a group of women, and three times a week, they dance Zumba as exercise. the result is good, she really is sexy. <7> Alam kong mahalaga ang magkaroon ng malusog at malakas na katawan, pero naiinis ako sa napakaraming exercise na kailangang gawin, nakakapagod, at mahabang oras ang kailangan. Hindi ko magawa, abala ako sa maraming bagay. I know it is important to have a healthy and strong body, but I hate the many exercises to be done, they are tiring, and demands a lot of time. I cannot do it, I am busy with many things. <8> Wala akong pangarap na ibalik ang dati kong pangangatawan. I have no dream of bringing back my older body. <9> Pero may masamang epekto ba talaga ang pagiging mataba sa buhay ng mag-asawa? but does being fat really have a bad effect on the life of a married couple? <10> — RonnieDear Ronnie,Alam mo ang totoo, na ikaw ay bata pa sa edad mo. Kaya alisin mo sa isip ang kasinugalingang nagsasabing matanda ka na at pangit. - Ronnie dear Ronnie, you know the truth, that you are still young for your age. so erase in your mind the lie saying you are already old and ugly. <11> Lahat ng taong ipinanganak sa mundo na nabiyayaan ng buhay ay tumatanda. Pero hindi ibig sabihin na wala na ang hangad na magtagumpay at wala nang kabuluhan ang mabuhay. all the people born into the world who are blessed with life grow old. but it does not mean there is no more desire to succeed and life no longer has meaning. <12> Habang ang tao ay may hininga, siya ay may pag-asang magtagumpay na gawin at abutin ang isang bagay na inaasam niya. while a person is still breathing, he has the chance to successfully do and reach for one thing he desires. <13> Ang maagang tagumpay mo sa buhay — ang pagkakaroon ng matatag na trabaho at mapagmahal na pamilya — ay patunay na kaya mong bigyan ng katuparan ang iyong pangarap. your early success in life - having a stable job and loving family - is proof that you can bring your dream to a reality. <14> Dahil ang misis mo ay may suporta sa iyo, mas madali para sa iyo ang magkaroon ng malusog at malakas na pangangatawan. because your wife supports you, having a healthy and strong body is easier for you. <15> Dahil siya ay may alam sa fitness and nutrition, mas madali para sa iyo na isama ang buong pamilya na kumain ng mga pagkaing masarap pero hindi nakakataba. because she is knowledgeable in fitness and nutrition, it is easier for you to include your whole family in eating delicious but non-fattening foods. <16> Buong pamilya kayong lumabas ng bahay para mag-exercise, mag-jogging, at mag-biking. Sa ganitong paraan, magiging isang katuwaan ng pamilya ang panatilihing malusog ang katawan. Kapag ginawa ninyo ito na bahagi ng pag-uugali ng buong pamilya, madalas at regular na gawin ninyo ito, sa loob ng isang taon, makikita mo ang pagbabago — magkakaroon ka ng mas maliit na tiyan. go out as a whole family to exercise, jog, and bike. this way, maintaining a healthy body will become a hobby of your family. if you make it a habit for your whole family, do it often and regularly, within a year, you will see change - you will have a smaller tummy. <17> Lulundag ka sa tuwa kapag nakita ang sarili mo sa salamin. you will jump with joy when you see yourself in the mirror. <18> Ibig sabihin, ang pananatili sa tamang timbang ng katawan ay hindi nagagawa ng madalian. which means, maintaining the right body weight cannot be done instantly. <19> Ang posibleng dahilan ng iyong pagiging depressed ay gusto mong bukas, agad-agad, may maliit na tiyan ka na. a possibly reason for your depression is you want to have a smaller tummy tomorrow, immediately. <20> Isipin mo ito — hindi biglang naging malaki ang tiyan mo. think of this - your tummy did not immediately become big. <21> Maraming taon ang dumaan bago ka nagkaroon ng malaking tiyan. many years passed before you had a large tummy. <22> Kaya bigyan mo ng panahon ang pagpapaliit ng tiyan. so give tummy slimming time. <23> Tandaan, malaking gastos ang magkasakit, kaya mahalaga ang malusog at malakas na pangangatawan sa buhay ng mag-asawa at buong pamilya. remember, getting sick is a huge expense, so having a healthy and strong body is important in the life of a married couple and the whole family.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_68726681 <1> 63 magsasaka ng Bataraza, Palawan, nabiyayaan ng sariling sakahan 63 farmers of Bataraza, Palawan, granted their own farm land <2> August 25, 2016 Leila B. Dagot August 25, 2016 Leila B. Dagot <3> PUERTO PRINCESA, Palawan, Agosto 25 (PIA) --- Tinanggap kamakailan ng mga magsasaka ng Barangay Marangas sa Bataraza, Palawan ang Certificates of Land Ownership Award (CLOA) mula sa Department of Agrarian Reform (DAR). Puerto Princesa, Palawan, August 25 (PIA) - the farmers of Barangay Marangas in Bataraza, Palawan recently received the Certificates of Land Ownership Award (CLOA) from the Department of Agrarian Reform (DAR). <4> Ito ay matapos na magtagumpay ang DAR na maipasa sa 63 mga magsasaka ang pag- aari sa 43 ektaryang lupain na dati ay sa Agro-Marine Industrial Corporation na nasa ilalim ng Comprehensive Agrarian Reform (CARP). this was after DAR succeeded to pass to the 63 farmers the ownership of the 43 hectares of land, which was formerly owned by the Agro-Marine Industrial Corporation, under the Comprehensive Agrarian Reform (CARP). <5> “Para kaming nabunutan ng tinik, parang imposible, parang isang panaginip na masasaka na namin ang lupang ibinigay ng gobyerno sa amin”, ani Allan Bello, Presidente ng Boli Ponti Agrarian Reform Beneficiaries’ Association (BPARBA). "like a thorn was pricked out of us, seemed impossible, like a dream that we can finally farm the land given by the government to us," said Allan Bello, President of the Boli Ponti Agrarian Reform Beneficiaries' Association (BPARBA). <6> Ang Asosasyon ay binuo ng mga magsasaka na ang pangunahing hangarin ay maigiit sa gobyerno na maibigay sa kanila ang pag-aaring sakop ng CARP. the Association is composed of farmers whose primary wish is to be asserted in the government that the ownership covered by CARP be given to them. <7> Nito lamang Hulyo 28 hanggang 29, tinungo ng mga opisyales ng DAR ang lugar kasama ang tropa ng Philippine National Police (PNP), Marine Battalion Landing Team (MBLT) 12 at ilang personnel ng Commission on Human Rights (CHR) upang pangunahan ang mga benepisyaryong magsasaka at maka-puwesto ng ligtas sa nasabing lupain. only this July 28 until 29, DAR officials went to the places along with the troops of the Philippine National Police (PNP), Marine Battalion Landing Team (MBLT) 12 and few personnel of the Commission on Human Rights (CHR) to lead the farmer beneficiaries and to settle safely in the said land. <8> Sinimulan din agad ng mga magsasaka ang pagtatayo ng pansamantalang tirahan sa lugar matapos na maipasa sa kanila ang pagmamay-ari ng lupain na naigawad ng gobyerno. the farmers immediately started the building of temporary shelter in the place after the ownership of the land is passed to them which is granted by the government. <9> Ayon sa DAR, sa kabuoang 206 ektaryang lupain sa ilalim ng CARP alinsunod sa Republic Act 6657, nasa 193 ektarya na ang naipamamahagi sa 151 na mga magsasakang benepisyaryo. according to DAR, in the total of 206 hectares of land under CARP, in accordance to Republic Act 6657, about 193 hectares is already distributed to the 151 farmer beneficiaries. <10> Ang iba pang bahagi ng lupain ay natukoy na hindi angkop para sa agrikultura. the other part of the land is determined as inappropriate for agriculture. <11> (LBD/PIAMIMAROPA-Palawan) (LBD/PIAMIMAROPA-Palawan)
