instead, she was only told to write her name and profile. <10> Ito ang ipinagmamalaki ng AFP na binigyan nila antemano ng karampatang atensyong medikal. this is being prided by the AFP that they have given an attentive appropriate medical attention. <11> Nang ilipat sa Camp Bagong Diwa (CBD), nagpatuloy ang pasakit na dinanas ng maselang kundisyon ni Andrea. when transferred to Camp Bagong Diwa (CBD), the torture experienced by the delicate condition of Andrea continues. <12> Walang pagsasaalang-alang sa kundisyon niya at isiniksik siya sa isang maliit at mainit na silid kasama ang 31 iba pang bilanggo, walang bentilasyon maliban sa isang maliit na bintana. without consideration on her condition and she was just cramped in a small and hot room together with 31 other prisoners, no ventilation aside from a small window. <13> Hinayaan siya ng mga otoridad na matulog sa semento at maging ang mga kagamitan tulad ng banig, tubig at pagkain mula sa pamilya at kaibigan ay hindi pinahihintulutang makapasok o di kaya naman ay papatawan ng kung anu-ano pang pahirap bago maipasok sa piitan. the authorities just let her sleep on the cement and even things like mat, water and food from her family and friends are not allowed to enter or else imposed with various difficulties before permitting to be entered to the prison cell. <14> Upang makapagpalaboratoryo kailangang ihingi ng pahintulot sa korte - korteng instrumento ng reaksyunaryong estado upang ibinbin at parusahan ang mga bilanggong pulitikal na pinatawan ng mga inimbentong kaso. to have a laboratory examination needs a permission to be asked from the court - a court which is an instrument of the reactionary state to detain and punish the political prisoners who are imposed with invented cases. <15> Nagtuturuan ang mga pasista kung sino ang may pananagutan sa sinapit ng mag-ina. the fascists are pointing fingers of who have the accountability to what the mother and child experienced in the end. <16> Nais mother and child was granted to them. <17> Isang malaking kabalintunaan sapagkat hindi nakatikim ng angkop na atensyong medikal na naaayon sa maselang kundisyon ng mga inang nagdadalantao si Andrea. a Andrea to a private hospital for an ultrasound was that the family of Andrea themselves had actually paid just to examine the condition of the infant inside her womb. <19> Ang kahilingang ipaospital Bagong Diwa. but only on May 16 that Andrea was brought to the hospital after going back and forth to Camp Bagong Diwa. <23> Diumano, hindi pa manganganak kaya ibinalik ng BJMP ang kawawang si Andrea sa utos ni Deputy Warden Teresa Cabanero. as it was told, the pitiful Andrea was not yet in labor, therefore, they brought her back to the BJMP through the command of Deputy Warden Teresa Cabanero. <24> Iginiit ng mga doktor ni Andrea na kagyat na syang ibalik sa ospital dahil malalagay ito at ang kanyang isisilang sa panganib. the doctors of Andrea insisted to immediately return her to the hospital because she and the baby she was about to give birth to would be put in danger. <25> Ngunit binalewala at nagbingi-bingihan si Deputy Warden Teresa Cabanero ng BJMP. but Deputy Warden Teresa Cabanero of the BJMP disregarded this and turned a deaf ear. <26> Malalim na ang gabi bago muling dalhin ng BJMP si Andrea sa ospital. the night was deep before the BJMP brought Andrea again to the detenidong pulitikal. the tragic condition and the inhumane treatment to Andrea inside the prison until she can give birth is a clear violation of her human rights as a woman and a political detainee. lack of giving importance of the reactionary regime to life and human rights of ordinary citizens. <33> Malinaw kung sino ang kinikilingan ng rehimeng BS Aquino at ng reaksyunaryong batas. it is clear MATERIAL_BASE-1B_40460685 <1> Ika-80 kaarawan ni Dr. Bienvenido Lumbera, Guro at Artista ng Bayan, ipagdiriwang 80th birthday of Doctor Bienvenido Lumbera, teacher and artist of the people, celebrated <2> by Rommel Rodriguez by Rommel Rodriguez <3> April 13, 2012 April 13, 2012 <4> Dr. Bienvenido Lumbera, Pambansang Alagad ng Sining sa Panitikan Doctor Bienvenido Lumbera, National Artist for Literature <5> Kilalang manunulat at iskolar ng kultura at panitikan, si Bienvenido Lumbera ay ipinanganak noong Abril 11, 1932 sa Lipa, Batangas. a renowned writer and scholar of culture and literature, Bienvenido Lumbera was born on April 11, 1932 in Lipa, Batangas. <6> Nag-aral sa Unibersidad de Santo Tomas noong 1950 at sa Indiana University noong 1967. he studied in the University of Santo Tomas in 1950 and in Indiana University in 1967. <7> Naging propesor din siya sa Osaka University at University of Hawaii sa Manoa, gayundin din sa iba’t ibang unibersidad sa bansa. he also became a professor in Osaka University and University of Hawii at Manoa, as well as in different universities in the country. <8> Hindi matatawaran ang kontribusyon ni Bien sa larangan ng sining at panitikan. Bien's contribution in the field of art and literature cannot be discounted. <9> Nakapaglimbag na siya ng mga panandang-bato na antolohiya, nakapagsulat ng iba’t ibang dula tulad ng Tales of the Manuvu, Nasa Puso ang Amerika at Hibik at Himagsik nina Victoria Laktaw. he has published landmark anthologies, written different plays like Tales of the Manuvu, Nasa Puso Ang Amerika and Hibik at Himagsik nina Victoria Laktaw. <10> Pinarangalan siya bilang Pambansang Alagad sa Sining at nagkamit na rin ng gawad mula sa Ramon Magsaysay Awards para sa Pamamahayag. he was awarded as a National Artist and earned recognition from the Ramon Magsaysay Awards for Journalism. <11> Sa kabila ng buhay sa sining, hindi nakaligtaan ni Bien ang halaga at ugnayan ng kanyang pagiging iskolar, guro at artista sa lipunan at bayan. despite a life of art, Bien did not forget the value and connection to society and the country of his being a scholar, teacher, and artist. <12> Kinikilala ang kanyang ambag sa larangan ng pagtatayo ng mga organisasyong nagtataguyod ng pambansang demokrasya. his contribution is recognized in the areas of establishing organizations supporting national democracy. <13> Bukod sa pagiging Professor Emeritus sa UP Diliman, siya rin ang Chairman Emeritus ng Concerned Artists of the Philippines at Congress of Teachers/Educators for Nationalism and Democracy. aside from being a professor emeritus in UP Diliman, he is also chairman emeritus of the Concerned Artists of the Philippines and Congress of Teachers/Educators for Nationalism and Democracy. <14> Siya rin ang naging tagapanguna sa pagkakatatag ng Alliance of Concerned Teachers, Philippines na nangangalaga naman sa kagalingan ng mga guro sa Pilipinas. he became the spearhead of the establishment of the Alliance of Concerned Teachers, Philippines that cares for the welfare of teachers in the Philippines. <15> Maraming beses na rin nakasama si Bien sa mga pambansang kilos-protesta. Bien has also been a part of national protests many times. <16> Patuloy siyang nakikibahagi sa pagsulong ng makatuwirang sahod at karapatan ng mga manggagawa. he continues to join the movement for fair wages and labor rights. <17> Inilapat niya sa kanyang mga akda ang buhay at himagsik ng mga magsasaka. he included in his writing the lives and revolt of farmers. <18> Naging lunan ng kanyang mga karanasan noong batas militar ang mga obrang tula at awitin. his experiences during martial law became a vehicle for his poems and songs. <19> Sa lahat ng ito, isang dakilang patunay si Bien na ang sining ay marapat lamang magsilbi sa mga uring inaapi at pinagsasamantalahan, habang ito rin ay mabisang paraan upang humukin ang mamamayan na makiisa tungo sa paglaya ng bayan. in all of this, Bien is a distinguished proof that art should serve the oppressed class and the abused, while it is an effective way of encouraging the people to unite for a national independence. <20> —————————————————————- --------- <21> Muy Bien: Guro at Artista ng Bayan muy bien: teacher and artist of the people <22> “Kung tayo man ngayo’y may piring na luha "if at present we have eyes covered with tears <23> Bukas, pagkamulat hanapin ang tuwa; tomorrow, upon waking up search for joy; <24> Kalagin ang gapos ng ating tadhana, break free from the chain of our destiny, <25> Kung kikilos tayo, tayo ay lalaya!” if we will take action, we will be free!" <26> -Bien Lumbera -Bien Lumbera <27> Ipagdiwang ang buhay ng guro ng bayan, itanghal ang sining ng artistang makabayan. celebrate the life of the people's teacher, perform the art of patriotic artists. <28> Para sa 80th kaarawan ng Pambansang Alagad sa Sining Bienvenido Lumbera, inihahandog ang for the 80th birthday of the National Artist Bienvenido Lumbera, to be offered is <29> Muy Bien: Guro at Artista ng Bayan. Muy Bien: Teacher and Artist of the People. <30> Sumama sa pagpupugay at pasasalamat kay Bien sa Abril 15, 2012 3:00n.h. join the recognition and thanks for Bien on April 15, 2012 3:00 p.m. <31> AS Steps, Unibersidad ng Pilipinas, Diliman. AS Steps, University of the Philippines, Diliman. <32> Tampok ang kanyang mga likhang obra kasama ang Philippine Philharmonic Orchestra, Kontra-Gapi, Tanghalang Pilipino, Artists Incorporated, Dulaang UP, Los Indios Bravos, Tudla Productions, mga makabayang musikero, artista sa entablado, mga makata, mandudula, visual artists, filmmakers, at rap artists. featured are his works together with the Philippine Philharmonic Orchestra, Kontra-Gapi, Tanghalang Pilipino, Artists Incorporated, Dulaang UP, Los Indios Bravos, Tudla Productions, patriotic musicians, stage artists, poets, playwrights, visual artist, filmmakers, and rap artists. <33> Sa pakikipagtulungan ng Opisina ng Presidente ng UP Diliman, UP Kolehiyo ng Arte at Literatura, in cooperation with the Office of the President of UP Diliman, UP College of Arts and Letters, <34> UP Kolehiyo ng Sosyal Sayans at Pilosopiya, CONTEND-UP, CENPEG, UP Asterisk, UP College of Social Science and Philosophy, CONTEND-UP, CENPEG, UP Asterisk, <35> Concerned Artists of the Philippines at Cultural Center of the Philippines. Concerned Artists of the Philippines and Cultural Center of the Philippines. <36> Para sa karagdagang impormasyon, maaaring makipag-ugnayan sa telepono bilang 09088841170. for additional information, you contact phone number 09088841170. <37> Hanapin si Walkie Miraña. look for Walkie Miraña.

happening or if there is any... where? <12> Sino-sino ang mga nakinabang? who are those who benefited? <13> Mga Pinoy ba o si PNoy at mga bataan ni PNoy? are those the Filipinos or PNoy and PNoy's lackeys? <14> Sa Enero 25, sa unang anibersaryo ng SAF 44, malamang na may event na inihanda ang mga SAF para sa kanilang mga katoto bilang paggunita na kabayanihan ng mga napaslang. on January 25, the first anniversary of SAF 44, most likely there will be an event prepared by the SAF for their fellow comrades as memorial of their heroism when they were killed. <15> Sisiputin naman kaya ng Pangulo ang okasyon? will the president even attend the occasion? <16> Malabo siguro lalo na’t wala pang nangyayari sa kaso para sa kawawang mga pulis natin. highly unlikely especially since nothing has happened in the case for our pitiful police. <17> Bukod sa malaki ang posibilidad na balewalain lang ito ng Palsyo dahil noon nga, nang dumating ang mga labi ng 44 sa airport, ay walang paki si PNoy este, mali pala kundi may mas nauna at importante siyang appointment noon – ang pagdalo sa okasyon ng Mitsubishi. aside from the huge possibility that the Palace will ignore this because back hindi sa walang paki ang Pangulo. so that was why, it is not because the president does not care. <19> Intindihin naman ninyo ang Pangulo natin, total e bilang na ang araw niya sa Malacañang. you have now, the justice for his murder - by traitors, what more for the SAF 44. <22> ‘Di ba mahal na Pangulo? isn't it right, dear president? <23> Kayo naman mga kababayan, nangako na nga sa pamilya ng SAF 44, gusto ninyo tuparin pa? so fellow countrymen, the promise was made to the families of SAF 44, do you want it fulfilled too? <24> Ngayon, mainit na naman ang isyu sa SAF 44 hindi lamang dahil sa wala pang nangyayari sa kaso kundi nais ng ilang mambabatas na buksan uli ang kaso o imbestigasyon hinggil dito. presently, the issue of SAF 44 is once again hot, not only because nothing is happening no signs of self interest. <29> Alam naman natin na election fever na para sa 2016 national and local elections. we all know that the election fever is on for the 2016 national and local elections. nang maging mainit na isyu ang SAF 44, bumagsak ang popularity rating ni PNoy at siyempre, nadamay dito ang kanyang kandidatong si Mar Roxas lalo na’t wala siyang kinalaman sa operasyon noon. we might remember, when the issue of SAF 44 was hot, the popularity rating of PNoy dropped and of course, this affected his candidate Mar Roxas especially since he had nothing to do with the operation back then. <32> Kaya sana, kung sakaling bubuksan nga uli ang imbestigasyon sa SAF 44, ang tunay na makinabang ay ang mga napaslang gayondin ang kanilang mga iniwan na mga mahal sa buhay at hindi ang mga and not our shameless candidates or politicians.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_54499393 <1> South Cotabato kinilala ng Nat'l Solid Waste Commission South Cotabato recognized by the National Solid Waste Commission <2> February 16, 2016 February 16, 2016 <3> LUNGSOD NG KORONADAL, South Cotabato, Peb 16 (PIA)-- Isang plaque of recognition ang natanggap kahapon ng pamahalaang panlalawigan ng South Cotabato mula sa National Solid Waste Management Commission bilang pagkilala sa mga nagawa ng lokal na pamahalaan. Koronadal City, South Cotabato, February 16 (PIA) - a plaque of recognition was received yesterday by the provincial government of South Cotabato from the National Solid Waste Management Commission as acknowledgment of the efforts of the local government. <4> Kasabay ng flag raising ceremony sa Provincial Capitol, iniabot ng mga kinatawan ng Environmental Management Bureau ng Department of Environment and Natural Resources 12 ang plaque of recognition kay South Cotabato Gov. during the flag raising ceremony at the Provincial Capitol, a representative from Environmental Management Bureau under the Department of Environment and Natural Resources 12 handed over the plaque of recognition to South Cotabato Governor <5> Daisy Avance -Fuentes. Daisy Avance - Fuentes. <6> Ang pagkilala ay bunsod ng pagkabuo at pagpasa ng pamahalaang panlalawigan at 10 munisipyo at lungsod ng Koronadal ng kani-kanilang 10- year Solid Waste Management Plan alinsunod sa alituntunin ng Ecological Solid Waste Management Act of 2000 o Republic Act 9003. Kaugnay riro nagpasa rin ang Regional Development Council ng isang resolusyon na na pumupuri sa pamahalaang panlalawigan ng South Cotabato sa pagkilalang natanggap. The recognition was due to the completion and passing of the provincial government, 10 municipalities, and city of Koronadal to each of their 10-year Solid Waste Management Plan in accordance to the law Ecological Solid Waste Management Act of 2000 or Republic Act 9003. In connection to this, the Regional Development Council passed a resolution praising the provincial government of South Cotabato in their recognition. <7> Ayon kay Dominador Samilin ng EMB 12, hanga ang Komisyon sa nagawa ng South Cotabato dahil magkasabay na binuo at inaprubahan ang 10-year Solid Waste Management Plan ng probinsiya, 10 munisipyo at lungsod ng Koronadal. according to Dominador Samilin of EMB 12, the Comission was amazed of South Cotabato's accomplishment because of the simultaneous completion and approval of the 10-year Solid Waste Management Plan of the province, 10 municipalities, and Koronadal City. <8> Lubos naman ang pasasalamat ni Gov. Fuentes sa natanggap na mag pagkilala. Governor Fuentes was grateful for the recognition that they received. <9> Aniya, sa buong bansa dalawang lalawigan lamang ang nabigyan ng ganitong parangal. she said, only two provinces in the whole country was given the award. <10> (DEDoguiles-PIA 12) (DEDoguiles-PIA 12)

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_78393089 <1> Isulong ang rebolusyonaryong kilusan sa reporma sa lupa advance the revolutionary movement on land reform <2> Partido Komunista ng PilipinasHunyo 11, 2013Translation: Advance the revolutionary land reform movement Communist Party of the Philippines July 11, 2013 translation: advance the revolutionary land reform movement <3> Sa loob ng 25 taon, malinaw na ipinakita ng reaksyunaryong Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program (CARP) na ito'y isang malaking panlilinlang. within 25 years, clearly shown by the reactionary Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program (CARP) that it is a big deceit. <4> Patuloy na pinangingibabawan ng atrasado at kontra-kaunlarang uring panginoong maylupa ang ekonomya at pulitika ng Pilipinas. the economy and politics of the Philippines is continued to be overruled by backward and anti-progressive class of landlord. <5> Patuloy na isinasailalim ng mga panginoong maylupa ang milyun-milyong magsasakang PIlipino sa pyudal at malapyudal na pagsasamantala sa pamamagitan ng kanilang mga asyenda at iba pang pyudal na ari-arian. the landlords continue to subjugate millions of Filipino farmers in feudal and semi-feudal exploitation through their hacienda and other feudal properties. <6> Walang ipinagkaiba ang CARP at ang pinalawig na programa nito, ang CARPer, sa Presidential Decree #27 ng diktadurang Marcos at sa lahat ng mga nakaraang huwad na programa sa reporma sa lupa mula pa noong pagsisimula ng estadong neokolonyal. the CARP has no difference and its expanded program, the CARPer, in Presidential Decree #27 of the Marcos dictatorship and all of the past fake programs on land reform even before the beginning of a colonial state. <7> Matapos ang pitong dekada, nananatiling walang lupa ang mga Pilipinong magbubukid at isinasailalim sa matinding pagsasamantala at pang-aapi. after seven decades, the Filipino farmers remain landless and being subjugated in intense exploitation and abuse. <8> Ang CARP at ang lahat ng mga naunang huwad na programa sa reporma sa lupa ay mga proyekto ng panlilinlang ng reaksyunaryong estadong dominado ng mga panginoong maylupa. the CARP and all of the initial fake programs on land reform are projects of deceit of the reactionary state dominated by landlords. <9> Nilalayon lamang nitong balewalain ang laganap na kahilingan sa lupa at apulain ang demokratikong pakikibaka ng masang magsasaka para sa tunay na reporma sa lupa. it is only aiming to disregard the widespread plea for land and extinguish the democratic struggle of the farmer masses for an authentic land reform. <10> Pinatatampok ang pagiging huwad ng CARP ng katotohanang nananatiling hindi nagagalaw at nasa monopolyong kontrol ng malalaking panginoong maylupa ang malalaking asyenda, matapos ang 25 taon ng implementasyon. covered in the falseness of the CARP is the truth that the huge hacienda remains untouched and in the monopolizing control of big landlords after 25 years of implementation. <11> Ibayo pa itong pinatitingkad ng katotohanang kasalukuyang pinangangasiwaan ang reaksyunaryong estado ni Benigno Aquino III, inapo ng angkan ng mga panginoong maylupang Cojuangco. this is intensely highlighted of the truth that the reactionary state is currently governed by Benigno Aquino III, grandson of the Conjuangco landlords. <12> Ang Hacienda Luisita, ang pinakamatingkad na simbolo ng pyudal na paghahari, ay nananatiling nasa kontrol ng mga Cojuangco sa pamamagitan ng panlilinlang, burukratikong manipulasyon at armadong panunupil. the Hacienda Luisita, the most brightly colored symbol of feudal kingship, remains in the control of the Cojuangcos through deceit, bureaucratic manipulation and armed suppression. <13> Patuloy na dinodominahan ng malalaking asyenda ang kanayunan. the villages are continued to be dominated by huge haciendas. <14> Nagtatampisaw sa maluhong pamumuhay ang mga pamilyang Aquino, Roxas, Araneta at iba pang pamilya ng malalaking panginoong maylupa. the families Aquino, Roxas, Araneta and other families of huge landlords are wading through luxurious lifestyles. <15> Nakatira sila mga mala-palasyong tahanan, nagsusuot ng mahahaling damit, kumakain ng imported na karne, nalulungo sa mamahaling alak, nagpipiging sa nagtatayugang hotel, pabalik-balik sa ibang bansa at nakikipagkarera para maaliw sa kanilang mga kotseng matakaw sa gasolina. they live in palace-like houses, wearing expensive clothes, eating imported meat, drunk in expensive liquor, feasting in high-rise hotels, going back and forth to other countries and racing their cars gluttonous of gasoline just to have fun. <16> Manhid sila sa karukhaan at pagdarahop ng mga magsasaka at iba pang masang anakpawis. they are numb about the poverty and destitution of the farmers and other masses of the children of sweat. <17> Ang pinakalitaw na pagpapamalas ng kawalan ng tunay demorasya sa Pilipinas ay ang kawalan ng tunay na reporma sa lupa. the most surfacing exhibition of the lack of real democracy in the Philippines is the lack of authentic land reform. <18> Ang mayorya ng sambayanang Pilipino na binubuo ng mga magsasakang walang lupa at mahihirap na manggagawang bukid ay araw-araw na pinagdurusa sa mataas na upa sa lupa, napakababang sahod, mataas na gastos sa agrikultural na produksyon, mababang presyo ng kanilang produktong-bukid, mataas na interes sa utang at iba pang anyo ng pyudal at malapyudal na pagsasamantala at pang-aapi. the majority of the Filipino nation, which is composed of farmers without land and poor farming workers, is suffering everyday in high rental of the land, low wages, high expenses on agricultural production, low prices of farming products, high interests on debts and other forms of feudal and semi-feudal exploitation and abuses. <19> Daan libong magbubukid ang napalalayas sa kanilang mga lupa dahil sa malawakang pagpapalit-gamit ng mga panginoong maylupa ng mga lupaing agrikultural tungong di-agrikultural upang ikutan ang batas sa reporma sa lupa at mabilis na makapagkamal ng tubo. a hundred thousands of farmers are driven away from their lands because of landlords' widespread conversion of the use of agricultural lands to non-agricultural to make a roundabout on land reform laws and quickly gain interest. <20> Ibayo pang napapalayas sa kanilang lupain ang mga pambansang minorya ng pagdagsa ng mga dayuhang kumpanya sa pagmimina na lumalason sa lupa at mga ilog. the national minority are intensely sent away from their lands in the flock of foreign mining companies which are poisoning the land and rivers. <21> Walang-walang kaunlarang pang-ekonomyang na makapagbibigay ng trabaho sa modernong industriya sa lakas paggawa sa kanayunan. there is no economic progress that can give jobs in the modern industries than the work force in the villages. <22> Ang kanayunan ng Pilipinas ay isang malaking dagat ng mga wala at kulang sa trabaho, kung saan napakababa ng kita at lubog sa gutom at karukhaan ang masa. the villages of the Philippines is a big ocean of those who have nothing or lack of jobs where the wages are too low and the masses are drowned in hunger and poverty. <23> Walang katarungang panlipunan sa ilalim ng CARP ng reaksyunaryong estado. society with no justice under the CARP of the reactionary state. <24> Ibinasura na ng mga organisasyon ng magsasaka ang CARP bilang isang purong transaksyong real estate na ang pyudal na mga lupain ay binibili sa estado sa mas mataas na presyo kaysa sa tunay nitong halaga. the CARP is thrown as garbage by the organization of farmers as a pure real estate transaction in which the feudal lands are bought by the state in higher prices than its real worth. <25> Ang mga tinaguriang certificate of land transfer (dokumento ng paglilipat ng pag-aari sa lupa) ng mga magbubukid ay naglalaho dahil sa kanilang kawalang-kaayahang magbayad ng napakamahal na tantos ng amortisasyon. those considered certificate of land transfer (document of transferring the ownership of the land) of the farmers is vanished because of their inability to pay a high interest amount of amortization. <26> Sa ngalan ng "economies of scale" (malakihang ekonomya), ang mga tinaguriang benepisaryo ay inoobligang sumapi sa mga "argarian reform communities" para pwersahin silang isanib sa sistema ng malaking plantasyon para sa produksyon ng saging, tubo, goma, oil palm at iba pang produktong pang-eksport. in the name of "economies of scale" (larger economy), the identified beneficiaries are obligated to join in the "agrarian reform communities" to force them to join the system of big plantation for the production of banana, sugarcane, rubber, oil palm and other export products. <27> Pinabibili sila ng mga binhi at gamit sa agrikultura at pinupwersang ibenta ang kanilang produkto sa malalaking panginoong maylupa at mga eksporter. they are asked to buy seedlings and equipment in agriculture and forced to sell their products to big landlords and exporters. <28> Patuloy na sinasamantala ng mga dayuhang monopolyo kapitalista ang pyudal at malayudal na sistema at ang atrasadong produksyong agrikultural upang makahuthot ng supertubo at dambungin ang yaman ng Pilipinas. the feudal and semi-feudal systems and backward agricultural production are continued to be taken advantaged by the foreign capitalist monopoly in order to bribe a huge interest and plunder the wealth of the Philippines. <29> Ang malalaking panginoong maylupa at malalaking burgesya kumprador ang pinakamapagkakatiwalaang kaalyado ng mga imperyalista. the big landlords and big bourgeoisie buyers are the most trusted allies of the imperialists. <30> Nagsisilbi silang tagasuplay ng murang hilaw na materyales at daluyan ng mga produktong sarplas mula sa mga bansang imperyalista. they are serving as suppliers of raw materials and channel of surplus products from imperialist countries. <31> Ang paghahangad sa tunay na reporma sa lupa ang nananatiling pinakamalaking demoratikong kahilingan ng sambayanang Pilipino. the aspiration for a real land reform remains the biggest democratic wish of the Filipino nation. <32> Ito ang pangunahing laman ng demokratikong rebolusyon ng bayan na naglalayong iwasto ang istoriko at inhustisyang panlipunan na humahagupit sa masang magsasaka, at palayain sila mula sa pyudal at malapyudal na pagsasamantala at pang-aapi. this is the primary content of the democratic revolution of the nation which aspires to correct historic and societal injustice which is whipping the masses of farmers, and free them from the feudal and semi-feudal exploitation and abuses. <33> Sa pagpapatupad ng tunay na reporma sa lupa na katuwang ng pambansang industriyalisasyon, mapapakawalan ang buong kakayahan ng mga produktibong pwersa sa Pilipinas. in the implementation of real land reforms together with the national industrialization, the whole ability of productive forces in the Philippines will be released. <34> Ang paggigiit sa tunay na reporma sa lupa ang patuloy na gumagatong sa digmang bayan. the assertion of real land reform is continually fueling the civil war. <35> Sa araw-araw, nagpaplano ang mga Pulang mandirigma ng Bagong Hukbong Bayan (BHB) at mga rebolusyonaryong pwersa sa ilalim ng pamumuno ng PKP ng mga kampanya sa reporma sa lupa alinsunod sa Programa para sa Demokratikong Rebolusyong Bayan. in every day, the red warriors of the New People's Army (NPA) and the revolutionary forces under the leadership of the PKP are planning campaigns for land reforms in accordance to the Programs for the People's Democratic Revolution. <36> Ipinatutupad sa buong bansa ang minimum na programa sa reporma sa lupa. implemented in the whole country is the minimum program for land reform. <37> Sa ilalim ng Pambansang Katipunan ng mga Magbubukid (PKM), isang alyadong organisasyon ng National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP), inoorganisa at pinakikilos ang masang magsasaka upang kumprontahin ang mga panginoong maylupa sa pamamagitan ng paggigiit sa pagpapababa ng upa sa lupa, pagpapataas ng sahod ng mga manggagawang bukid, pagpapababa ng tantos sa interes sa utang at itaas ang presyo ng kanilang produktong-bukid. under the National Federation of Farmers (NFF), an allied organization of the National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP), the masses of farmers are organized and mobilized to confront the landlords through asserting the lowering of rent for the land, raising the wages of farming workers, lowering the percentage of interest in debt and raise the price of their agricultural products. <38> Sa gabay ng PKP, inoorganisa ng PKM ang mga panimulang anyo ng kooperasyon at kolektibisasyon upang itaas ang produksyon at magkaroon ng dagdag na kita. through the guidance of the PKP, the PKM is organizing the beginning form of cooperation and collectivization to raise the production and have an additional profit. <39> Iwinawagayway ng PKP ang bandila ng tunay na reporma sa lupa upang wasakin ang baseng pang-ekonomya ng pagsasamantala at pang-aapi ng mga panginoong maylupa. the PKP is waving the banner of authentic land reform to dismantle the economic bases of exploitation and abuse of landlords. <40> Sa pagsasakatuparan nito, matagumpay na nakauugat nang malalim ang mga rebolusyonaryong pwersa sa kanayunan, naitatayo ang Bagong Hukbong Bayan at nabubuo ang mga organo ng kapangyarihang pampulitika sa ilalim ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan. in its implementation, the revolutionary forces in the villages are triumphantly rooted deeply, the New People's Army is raised and the organization of political power under the People's Democratic Government is formed. <41> Malaki ang positibong epekto ng rebolusyonaryong kilusan sa reporma sa lupa sa masang magsasaka. the positive effect of the revolutionary movement on land reform for the masses of farmers is huge. <42> Ang malaking mayorya ng mga Pulang mandirigna ng BHB ay binubuo ng pinakamabubuting anak ng masang magsasaka. the huge majority of the red warriors of the BHB is composed of the best children of the masses of farmers. <43> Patuloy na nag-aalimpuyo ang digmang bayan sa buong bansa. a tornado of civil war continues in the whole country. <44> Susulong ito sa mas mataas na antas sa mga susunod na taon kasabay ng malalaking pagsulong sa rebolusyonaryong kilusan sa reporma sa lupa. it will advance to a higher level in the next years together with the advancement of the revolutionary movement on land reform. <45> (Inilabas ang pahayag na ito kasabay ng ika-25 taon ng CARP na isinabatas ni Corazon Cojuangco Aquino noong Hunyo 10, 1998.) (this statement is released along with the 25th year of CARP which was made into law by Corazon Cojuangco Aquino last June 10, 1998).
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_61197901 <1> EDITORIAL: Kailangan nang baguhin ang estiloDecember 20, 2016 Malinaw ang mensahe ng huling survey sa publiko: gusto ng mga Pinoy ang kamay na bakal at seryosong giyera laban sa illegal drugs pero ayaw nila ang nangyayaring kaliwa’t kanang bulagtaan. editorial: the style needs to be changed December 20, 2016 the message is clear in the last public survey: Pinoys want the iron hand and serious war against illegal drugs but they don't want the killings left and right that are happening. <2> Tama ang walang puknat na operasyon ng pulisya laban sa mga drug personalities pero dapat ay buhay na nahuhuli, nakakasuhan at nahahatulang maparusahan ang mga sangkot sa illegal drugs. the non-stop operation of the police against drug personalities is right but they should be caught alive, prosecuted and sentenced to be punished for being involved in illegal drugs. <3> Hindi dapat na basta sinasayang ang buhay. life should never be easily wasted. <4> Naniniwala pa rin ang mayoryang Pinoy na lahat ng tao ay may tsansang magbago at hindi dapat tinatanggal ninuman ang pagkakataong ito. the majority of Pinoys believe that everybody has a chance to change and this chance should not be removed by anyone. <5> Kahit pa ng popular na lider na gaya ni Pangulong Digong Duterte. even a popular leader like President Digong Duterte. <6> Kahit pa napakaraming butas at kabulastugan ng justice system sa bansa, gusto pa rin ng mga Pinoy na idaan sa ganitong proseso ang paghahatol sa mga drug suspects. even if the justice system in the country has many holes and bluffs, Pinoys would still like to undergo this process of convicting drug suspects. <7> Dito kasi sa kasalukuyang sistema ng ‘bulagtaan’, walang pruweba, walang klarong proseso ng batas, kahit ang boses ng mga testigo nilulunod ng malakas na salita at deklarasyon ng Pangulo na, “salot ang droga at proteksyon at pagsagip sa susunod na henerasyon ang ginagawa ko.” here in this current system of "killings", no proof, no clear process by law, even the voices of the witnesses are drowned by loud words and declaration of the President that says, "drugs is a pest and protecting and rescuing the next generation is what I am doing." <8> Paulit-ulit ang sinasabi niya na magpapatuloy ang patayan hangga’t may nakatayong drug dealer at tulak sa kalsada. he repeatedly says that the killings will continue until there is a drug dealer and pusher standing in street. <9> Pero ang hindi maintindihan ng tao ay kung bakit si Peter Lim na pinangalanan na mismo niya (Pangulong Duterte) na isa sa bigtime drug lord sa Pilipinas at sinabi pa niyang siya mismo ang papatay oras na tumapak sa airport ng Pilipinas, hanggang ngayon ay malayang na-e-enjoy ang kanyang buhay. but what the people doesn't understand is why Peter Lim which he named himself (President Duterte) as one of the big-time drug lords in the Philippines and also said that he himself will kill him at the moment the moment he would step foot in the airport in the Philippines, until now freely enjoys his life <10> Nang makipagkita ito sa Pangulo, sinabi pa mismo ni Pangulong Duterte na “help us help you clear your name.” when he met with the President, President Duterte said himself "help us help you clear your name". <11> Mga salitang hindi sinasabi ng Pangulo sa mga karaniwang drug suspects sa kalye. words that the President does not say to the ordinary drug suspects in the streets. <12> Iyong mga walang ‘access’ na makausap siya. those who do not have "access" to speak with him. <13> Iyong mga naka-tsinelas lang, nakahubad na nagpapadyak ng pedicab o iyong tadtad ng tattoo na nahulihan ng isang paketeng shabu. those who only wear slippers, naked while paddling a pedicab or the ones covered with tattoos who were caught with a pack of meth. <14> Sa ganitong mga pagkakataon, napapaisip ang tao kung bakit tila magkaiba ang pagtrato ng Pangulo mismo sa mga drug personalities. in such cases, people are thinking why is there a difference on how the President treats drug personalities.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_34720868 <1> CHUBIBO: Abu Sayyaf — Dinuduro si DU30? By Dennis Garcia Chubibo: Abu Sayyaf - pointing at DU30? by Dennis Garcia <2> June 17, 2016 June 17, 2016 <3> Marami sa ating mga kababa­yan ang nalungkot at nagalit sa ba­li­tang may pinugutan na naman ang bandidong grupong Abu Sayyaf. many of our fellowmen were saddened and angered by the news that the bandit group Abu Sayyaf beheaded another. <4> Ang napugutan ay si Robert Hall, isang Canadian citizen na kinidnap ng mga bandido kasama ang tatlo pang bihag mula sa Canada, Norway at isang Pilipina. beheaded were Robert Hall, a Canadian citizen kidnapped by the bandits together with three other hostages from Canada, Norway, and one Filipina. <5> Unang pinatay sa grupo noong Abril si John Ridsdel, isa ring Canadian, nang mabigong makuha ng mga bandido ang hinihinging P300M ransom. Jonn Ridsdel, another Canadian, was the first in the group to be killed when the bandits failed to get the P300M ransom they requested. <6> Tinaas na sa P600 million ang ransom na ginigiit ng Abu Sayaff para sa mga nabihag. the ransom insisted by the Abu Sayaff for the hostages has increased to P600 million. <7> Kamakailan, nakausap ni President-elect Rodrigo Duterte si Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. recently, President-elect Rodrigo Duterte talked to Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. <8> Humingi siya ng paumanhin sa nangyari kay Ridsdel at nangakong wala na mu­ling mamamatay na Canadian sa kamay ng anumang bandido. he asked an apology for what happened to Ridsdel and promised that no more Canadian will die in the hands of any bandits. <9> Pero ang pangako ay napako nang pugutan si Robert Hall. but the promise was broken when Robert Hall was beheaded. <10> Hula who. guess who. <11> Magandang ehemplo ang pinapakita ng isang nanalo noong nakaraang halalan: tinanggihan niya ang isang magarbong tanggapan pagkat may kataasan ang buwanang upa rito. one winner in the previous election shows a good example: he refused an extravagant office because the monthly rent for it is high. <12> Imbes na engrande, mas pumabor siya sa simpleng opisina sa Quezon City na mukhang mas malapit sa kanyang puso. instead of the extravagant, he favored a simple office in Quezon City that seems to be closer to his heart. <13> Kaya lang, binibigyan ng malisya ang kanyang desisyon pero sa takdang panahon ay malalaman natin kung may katotohanan ang mga umuugong na tsismis na may napupusuan siya sa lungsod na ito. however, his decision was given malice but at the right time we will know if the rumors going around are true that he likes someone in this city. <14> 50 ang patay at 53 ang sugatan nang pumasok si Omar Mateen, isang Afghan-American, sa isang gay night club sa Orlando, Florida. 50 are dead and 53 are wounded when Omar Mateen, an Afghan-American, entered a gay night club in Orlando, Florida. <15> Nilabas ang sandatang pandigmaan at pinagbababaril ang mga nagsasalsang parokyano ng club. he drew out a military weapon and shot the dancing patrons of the club. <16> Gamit niya ay isang AR15 – isang bigating assault rifle na gamit sa seryosong ratratan. he used an AR15 - a heavy assault rifle that is used in serious attacks. <17> Tapos ng tinuring na pinakamadugong massacre sa America, sobrang lumakas ang benta ng AR15 na nagkakahalaga nang halos $800. after what is considered the bloodiest massacre in America, sales of the AR15 that costs almost $800 really increased. <18> Nagbilihan ang maraming Amerikano dahil natatakot sa napapadalas na karahasan. many Americans bought it due to fear of increasing violence. <19> Pangalawang dahilan ay City of Naga, April 28 (PIA) - the Department of Agriculture gave an award to the local government of the City of Naga as top 16 rice producing cities in the whole country. <4> Tinanggap ni city agriculturist Edna Bongalonta ang tropeo at tseke na nagkakahalaga ng P1 milyon mula kina Department of Agriculture (DA) Secretary Proceso J. Alcala at Assistant Secretary Edilberto M. De Luna. received by city agriculturist Edna Bongalonta are the trophy and check worth P1 million from Department of Agriculture (DA) Secretary Proceso J. Alcala and Assistant Secretary Edilberto M. De Luna. <5> Ang Agri-Pinoy Rice Achivers Award (APRAA) 2015 ay idinaos sa Resort World sa Pasay City, Manila noong Abril 20, 2016 . the Agri-Pinoy Rice Achievers Award (APRAA) 2015 was held in Resorts World in Pasay City, Manila last April 20, 2016. <6> Ang lungsod ng Naga ay nanguna sa ibat-ibang lungsod at bayan sa buong rehiyon Bicol sa pamagitan ng highest production growth ng 50.12% mula sa 6,298.94 metric ton ng taon 2014 na umabot na sa 9,456.06 metric ton ng nakalipas na taon 2015. the city of Naga led the various cities and municipalities in the whole Bicol region through the highest production growth of 50.12% from the 6,298.94 metric ton in the year 2014 which already reached up to 9, 456.06 metric ton from the past year 2015. <7> Ayon kay DA 5 spokesperson Emily B. Bordado, ang lungsod ng Naga ay nagkaroon ng yield growth ng 28%. according to DA 5 spokesperson Emily B. Bordado, the city of Naga acquired a yield growth of 28%. <8> Mula sa 4.05 metric ton bawat ektarya ay umabot na sa 5.20 metric ton kada ektarya ang ani ng palay. from 4.05 metric ton each hectare, the rice harvest reached up to 5.20 metric ton per hectare. <9> Sinabi ni Bordado na nadagdagan din ang rice area ng 16% mula sa 1,555. Bordado said that the rice area was also added with 16% from 1,555. <10> 7 ektarya ay umabot na rin sa 1,817.65 ektaryang palayan. 7 hectares have also reached 1, 817.65 hectares of rice. <11> Nagtala rin ng sobra sa 64% ang nadagdag sa high quality seeds utilization sa Lungsod ng Naga. recorded also a surplus more than 64% in high quality seeds utilization in the City of Naga. <12> Ang Lokal na Pamahalaan ng Lungsod ng Naga ay nagkaroon ng budget allocation sa kanilang Rice Program ng 25.36% mula sa Internal Revenue Allotment (IRA) na may katumbas ng 3 milyong piso. the Local Government of the City of Naga acquired a budget allocation of 25.36% in their Rice Program from the Internal Revenue Allotment (IRA) which has an equivalent of 3 million pesos. <13> Ipinapatupad rin ng lokal na pamahalaan ang 13 proyekto na may kaugnayan sa rice at agriculture programs ng siyudad bilang suporta sa mga magsasaka. the local government is also implementing the 13 projects which have a relation to the rice and agriculture programs in the city as a support to the farmers. <14> Ang Agri-Pinoy Rice Achivers' Award ay kasama sa regular na programa ng naturang ahensiya na nagbibigay ng insentibo sa mga lokal na yunits ng gobyerno maging lalawigan o kaya munisipalidad, mga Irrigators Association, Small Water Impounding System Associations (SWISAs), Agricultural Extension Workers (AEWs) at Local Farmer Technicians (LFTs). Ang naturang programa ay bilang pagkilala sa kanilang ambag na mapataas ang ani ng mga magsasaka sa kanilang lugar, madagdagan ang kanilang kita, makatulong para matugunan ang pagkukulang ng bigas sa bansa. The Agri-Pinoy Rice Achievers Award is part of the regular program of the said agency which is giving an incentive to the local units of the government as well as the provinces or the municipalities, the Irrigators Association, Small Water Impounding System Associations (SWISAs), Agricultural Extension Workers (AEWs) and Local Farmer Technicians (LFTs). the said program is for the recognition of their contribution to raise the harvest of the farmers in their place, augment their profit, to be able to aide in order to address the insufficiency of rice in the country. <15> Ang Rice Achievers Award ay nasa ilalim ng National Rice Program ng Department of Agriculture. The Rice Achievers Award is under the National Rice Program of the Department of Agriculture. <16> (DCA-PIA5/Camarines Sur) (DCA-PIA5/Camarines Sur)

Bituin Jr. by Gregorio V. Bituin Junior <5> Masayang nag-uusap ang damo at ang bato sa isang liwasan. the grass and the stone are happily talking with each other in a park. <6> Nang maya-maya'y dumating ang isang maya. when suddenly a sparrow came. <7> Anang maya, "Mga kaibigan, nais ko sana kayong kapanayamin. the sparrow said, "friends, may I interview you?" <8> Bago iyon, kinapanayam ko ang ilang nilalang kung saan ba sila masaya. before that, I interviewed a few beings and ask them what makes them happy. <9> Ngunit karamihan ay nagsabing hindi sila masaya. but most of them said that they are now happy. <10> Tinanong ko ang uod kung masaya ba siya. I asked the worm if he is happy. <11> Ang sabi niya'y hindi pagkat wala pa siyang pakpak na maganda tulad ng paruparo. he said he's not happy because he doesn't have beautiful wings like that of a butterfly. <12> Tinanong ko ang paruparo kung masaya ba siya. I asked the butterfly if he is happy. <13> Ang sabi niya'y hindi pagkat di pa niya nasimsim ang pinakamarikit na rosas sa hardin. he told me that he's not happy because he is still not able to sip from the most beautiful rose in the garden. <14> Tinanong ko ang rosas kung masaya ba siya. I asked the rose if he is happy. <15> Ang sabi niya'y hindi pagkat di pa dumarating ang binatang pipitas sa kanya upang ibigay sa pinipintuhong dalaga. he said that he is not happy because the young man that would pick and give him to the fairest young lady is still to come. <16> Tanong ko lang, mga kaibigang damo at bato, kayo ba ay masaya?" I ask you, my friend grass and stone, are you happy? <17> Tumugon ang damo, "Masaya ako sa kung ano ako ngayon. the grass answered, "I am happy for what I am now." <18> Di alintana ang init ng araw o patak ng ulan. not paying attention to the heat of the sun or the drops of rain. <19> Kaysarap damhin ang ihip ng hangin. it's nice to feel the breeze of the wind. <20> Masaya ako dahil ako'y ako." I am happy because I am me. <21> Anang bato, "Ako'y moog na nakatutulong upang makapamuhay ng maayos. the stone said. "I am a stone and I help to make living better." <22> Pundasyon ng bahay at gusali, ginagamit ding graba, tungko, at marami pa. foundation of houses and buildings, used as gravel, construction material and many more. <23> Masaya ako sa silbi ko sa mundo." "I am happy with my purpose in the world." <24> Dagdag ng damo, "Gayunpaman, bago ka dumating ay aming pinag-uusapan ng bato na hindi kami masaya sa nangyayari ngayon sa maraming nilalang sa mundo. the grass added, "however, before you came we were talking about how we are not happy with the things that are happening with many other beings in the world." <25> Ginagamit ng mga tao ang aming pangalan para sa kanilang mga bisyo. the humans uses our names for their vices. <26> Tinatawag nilang damo ang hinihitit nilang mariwana na karaniwang nagiging dahilan ng pagkasira ng kanilang kinabukasan." they call the marijuana that they smoke weed which often becomes the reason for the destruction of their future." <27> Dagdag naman ng bato, "Gayundin naman, bato ang tinatawag ng mga tao sa kanilang bisyong shabu na nagiging dahilan din ng pagkasira ng kinabukasan ng maraming mamamayan." the stone added, "the same as well, stone is what they call the vice named meth that causes the future of many people to be destroyed. <28> Muli ay nagsalita ang damo, "Masaya ako bilang ako, ngunit sana'y huwag sirain ng tao ang mabuti naming pangalan." the grass spoke again, "I am happy the way I am, but I wish that the humans would stop ruining my good name." <29> "Gayon din ako," anang bato. "I have the same thoughts," said the stone. <30> Sumagot ang maya, "Marahil nalalapit na ang pagkalinis ng inyong pangalan. the sparrow answered, "it is possible that your names would be cleared soon." <31> Dahil tinutugis na ng kapulisan ang mga gumagamit ng damo at bato. because the police are now capturing those who uses grass and stone. <32> Kung hindi mamatay ay makukulong ang mga taong gumagamit ng maling katawagan sa inyo." "those who use your names for wrong will die, if not, they will be imprisoned" <33> Sabay na tugon ng damo at bato, "Sana nga’y tuluyan nang luminis ang aming pangalan. Hihintayin namin ang pagdating ng araw na iyon." in unison the grass and stone answered, "we really hope that our names would be cleared. we will wait for that day to come"

noong 1993, hanggang ngayon hindi pa sila nalilipol. but there have already been multiple comprehensive operations against the ASG since 1993 and until now they haven't been eradicated. <5> Nauunawaan natin ang silakbo ng damdamin ng Commander-in-Chief at mga punong bayan at lalawigan ng ARMM. we understand the outburst of emotions from the commander-in-chief and the councilmen of the region of ARMM. <6> Subalit batid ng kasundaluhan at dapat maunawaan ng ating mga kababayan, na hindi ganoon kadali ang lubusang paglupig sa ASG. but the army is aware and our fellowmen should understand that completely defeating the ASG is not that easy. <7> Simula noong 1993 nang unang maglunsad ng malawakang opensiba ang Navy-Marines laban sa ASG marami na ang nalagas sa kanilang hanay. since 1993, when the first comprehensive offensive by the Navy-Marines against the ASG was launched, several men from their ranks have already fallen. <8> At sa mga sumunod pang taon ng mga operasyon kasama ang Army at Air Force, napatay na ang mga kinikikilalang lider nila gaya nina Janjalani, Abu Sabaya, Kumander Robot at iba pa. and for the following years of the operation with the Army and Air Force, they already killed known leaders such as Janjalani, Abu Sabaya, commander Robot and others. <9> Subalit sa halip na maglaho, nagpapatuloy at mas nagiging marahas at mapangahas ang bandidong grupo sa kanilang kriminal na gawain. but instead of disappearing, the terrorist group persevered and became more violent and daring in their criminal activities. <10> Pinupugot ng ASG ang ulo at tinatanggalan ng mga ari ang mga sundalo na kanilang napapatay. the ASG beheads and neuters the soldiers they have killed. <11> Ang mga kababaihang kanilang nabibihag o napupusuan at kinukuha nang pwersahan ay ginagahasa. the women that they capture, or like then take by force, are raped. <12> At ang mga karumal-dumal nilang krimen ay ibini-video pa at minsan ay inia-upload pa sa social media. and these detestable crimes that they commit are sometimes recorded in video and uploaded to social media. <13> Nagiging malawakan na ang kriminal na gawain ng ASG gaya ng kidnapping for ransom. the criminal activities of the ASG, including kidnapping for ransom, are expanding. <14> Kung ang unang naitala ay ang pagkidnap nila sa isang batang noon ay 5-taong gulang na si Luis Anthony Biel noong 1993 sa Basilan, kung saan-saan na sila umaabot upang mangidnap ng biktima. if the first recorded kidnapping case of the 5-year old Luis Anthony Biel in 1993 was in Basilan, they are now venturing into different places to look for kidnap victims. <15> Buhat sa Basilan at Sulu, umaabot na ang ASG sa Sipadan Resort sa Malaysia o sa Dos Palamas Resort at iba pang mga lugar sa Palawan. with their roots in Basilan and Sulu, the ASG has already reached the Sipadan Resort in Malaysia or the Dos Palmas Resort and other places in Palawan. <16> Pinakakawalan lamang ang mga bihag matapos magbayad ng ransom o “board and lodging”. they only release the captives after the ransom or "board and lodging" payment has been made. <17> At ang pinakahuling napabalitang umano’y bayaran ng ransom na umaabot sa P250-milyon ay para sa pagpapalaya ng 2 German national na kinidnap sa Palawan at dinala sa Sulu. and allegedly, the latest reported ransom payment reached P250 million for the release of 2 German nationals who were kidnapped in Palawan and brought to Sulu. <18> Ang tanong ngayon, kaya bang lipulin ng militar ang Abu Sayyaf? the question now is, is the military able to eradicate the Abu Sayyaf? <19> Kung ang tangi at lumang istratehiya na militar lamang ang kikilos upang lipulin ang bandidong grupo, nakatakda silang muling mabigo. if the only and dated strategy of the military is that only the military will act to eradicate the terrorist group, they are doomed to fail. <20> Kailangan nating makita at makilala ang tunay na “mukha” ng problema ng ASG. we need to see and know the true "face" of the problem which is the ASG. <21> Ang “paglipol” sa ASG, gaya ng utos ni Pangulong PNoy, ay hindi isyu lamang ng armas at kakayahan (bagaman hindi na rin matatawaran ang kakayahan at makabagong armas ng bandidong grupo). the "eradication" of the ASG, like the command given by President PNoy, is not only an issue of armaments and ability (however, the ability and the modern armaments of the terrorist group could no longer be discounted). <22> Salamat sa limpak na salaping ransom na ipinambibili nila ng makabagong armas. thanks to the vast amounts of ransom money they use to buy modern armaments. <23> Mga kagamitan na kung hindi man nakahihigit, ay kayang tumapat sa armas na taglay ng mga kawal ng pamahalaan. equipment that can stand off, if not overpower, the armaments being used by the government forces. <24> Bukod sa kabisado ng ASG ang kabundukan ng Sulu at Basilan ay napakadali rin para sa kanila ang makihalubilo at makipamuhay sa kalahatan ng mamamayan. besides the fact that the ASG is already well versed in the mountains of Sulu and Basilan, it is also easy for them to mingle and live with the citizens. <25> Kamag-anak nila ang karamihan sa mga naninirahan doon na maaaring nakikinabang sa kanila o nagkakanlong sa kanila o pareho. most of the settlers there are their relatives who may be benefiting form them or sheltering them or both. <26> May mga suliranin at kakulangan na nagbubunsod sa mga ordinaryong mamamayan upang sumapi ng ASG. there are problems and deficiencies that compel ordinary citizens to join the ASG. <27> Halimbawa ng mga ito ay kakulangan sa edukasyon, kahirapan, o kawalan ng hanapbuhay. examples of these are the lack of proper education, poverty, or lack of sources of income. <28> At ang higit na masaklap ay ang paglaganap ng bago, sigurado, at mas madaling paraang kumita ng malaki — kidnapping for ransom. and the worst is the widespread of the new, secured, and easier way to earn a lot of money - kidnapping for ransom. <29> At sa isang lugar na hikahos gaya ng Sulu at Basilan na kung saan kultura na ng ating mga kapatid na Muslim ang pag-aari ng armas, ang salapi at baril napakadaling ipanghikayat ng aanib sa bandidong grupo. and for places that are struggling like Sulu and Basilan where it is in the culture of our Muslim brethren to own armaments, the promise of money and arms is an easy way to convince citizens to join the terrorist group. <30> Sa ngayon naging tila industriya na ang pangingidnap at pagpapatubos ng ransom. currently, kidnapping for ransom is almost becoming an industry. <31> Naging tila mas organisado at may sistema nang sinusunod. seemed to have become more organized and already have a system to follow. <32> May mga taong hindi naman talaga kaanib ng ASG na sila ang kikidnap ng biktima at pagkatapos dadalhin sa kuta ng at iti-turnover nila sa ASG kapalit ng kakarampot ng bayad. there are people who are not really members of the ASG that kidnap victims themselves and bring them over to the ASG camp afterwards to be turned over in exchange for a small payment. <33> Ang mga propesyonal na negosyador na ng ASG ang makikipag-usap sa lokal na pamahalaan (o sa ibang bansa kung isang banyaga) upang ipatubos ang bihag at sa kung magkanong halaga. the professional negotiators of the ASG will be the ones talking with the local government (or to foreign governments if the victim is foreign) to facilitate an exchange of the victim for a specified amount. <34> Kahalintulad ay mga mangangalakal na matapos makakuha ng bote at dyaryo ay isusulong ang mga iyon sa junkshop kapalit ng kaunting halaga. similar are the dealers who after collecting bottles and newspapers bring them over to the junk shop in exchange for a small sum. <35> At ang junkshop na ang bahalang magluwas noon sa Maynila kapalit ng mas malaking halaga. and the junk shop will be responsible for bringing them over to Manila in exchange for a huge sum. <36> Marami nang gustong maging “mangangalakal ng bote at dyaryo”. a lot of people want to become "dealers of bottles and news papers". <37> Kung hindi, paano maipaliliwanag na ang mga turistang gaya nina Martin at Gracia Burnham na kinidnap mula sa Sipadan, Malaysia o ang dalawang German na nagbabakasyon sa isang resort sa Palawan ay matunton at makilala upang kidnapin? if not, how can one explain tourists like Martin and Gracia Burnham who were kidnapped in Sipadan, Malaysia or the two Germans having their vacation in a resort in Palawan being located and targeted for kidnapping? <38> Ang ibig-sabihin ay malamang may kakutsaba ang mga ASG na nasa mga resort na s’yang nagti-tip kung sino ang kikidnapin. this means that the ASG probably has accomplices who are at resorts and give them tips on who to kidnap. <39> Marunong ang mga bandido. the terrorists are clever. <40> Ginagamit nila ang perang nakukulimbat upang bilhin ang katapatan ng mga taong hikahos. they are using the stolen money to buy the trust of the struggling people. <41> At kapalit ng salapi, ikakanlong at ipagtatanggol ng mga tao ang mga ASG na sa mata nila’y mga “Robin Hood” – nagnanakaw upang ipamudmod ang salapi sa mga mahihirap. in exchange for the money, the people are sheltering and defending the ASG who, in their eyes, are like "Robin Hoods" - stealing money to distribute to the poor. <42> Kung ganito kasalimuot ang problema sa ASG, paano ito susugpuin o lilipulin ng sandatahang lakas? if the problem with the ASG is this complicated, how will they be defeated and eradicated by the armed forces? <43> ‘Yan ang ating tatalakayin bukas sa kolum ding ito. that is what we will discuss tomorrow in this column. <44> Para sa inyong reaksyon, sumulat sa edarevalo90@yahoo.com o mag-tweet sa atty_edarevalo. for your reactions, send them to edarevalo90@yahoo.com or tweet @atty_edarevalo. <45> PUNTONG MARINO/ATTY. EDGARD AREVALO a mariner's point / Attorney Edgard Arevalo
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_67084722 <1> Cloud seeding sa N. Cotabato sinimulan na cloud seeding in N. Cotabato already started <2> February 18, 2016 February 18, 2016 <3> LUNGSOD NG KIDAPAWAN, North Cotabato, Peb. 18 (PIA)- Inumpisahan na ng pamahalaang panlalawigan ang pagpapatupad ng cloud seeding sa buong probinsya kahapon. City of Kidapawan, North Cotabato, February 18 (PIA) - the provincial government already started the implementation of cloud seeding in the whole province yesterday. <4> Ang Cloud Seeding Operation Kick- off Ceremony na ginawa sa Central Mindanao Airport sa Barangay Tawan- Tawan, M’lang ay pinangunahan ng Office of the Provincial Agriculturist (OPAg) at Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Division ng Provincial Governor’s Office (DRRMD). the Cloud Seeding Operation Kick-off Ceremony which was held in Central Mindanao Airport in Barangay Tawan-Tawan, M'lang was led by the Office of the Provincial Agriculturist (OPAg) and the Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Division of the Provincial Governor's Office (DRRMD). <5> Kabilang din sa nakiisa sa aktibidad ang Department of Agriculture 12 – Bureau of Soils and Water Management (DA-BSWM). included also in those who joined in the activity is the Department of Agriculture 12 - Bureau of Soils and Water Management (DA-BSWM). <6> Ayon kay Provincial Agriculturist Engr. Eliseo Mangliwan, abot sa P3. according to Provincial Agriculturist Engr. Eliseo Mangliwan, reached up to P3. <7> 4 milyon ang pondong inilaan ng pamahalaang panlalawigan na nagmula sa calamity fund nito para sa pagsasagawa ng cloud seeding na magtatagal ng 60 araw. 4 million is the fund allocated by the provincial government which has come from its calamity fund for the implementation of the cloud seeding that will last for 60 days. <8> Sinabi ni Mangliwan na mahalaga ang cloud seeding o pagsagawa ng artipisyal na ulan upang madagdagan o mapa- angat ang lebel ng tubig sa mga irigasyon at iba pang mga nagsusuplay ng tubig sa mga sakahan. Mangliwan said that cloud seeding or making an artificial rain is important to add or to raise the level of water to the irrigations and others that supply water to the farming fields. <9> Naglaan naman ang DA 12 ng pondong abot sa P700,000 bilang suporta o augmentation sa cloud seeding operations ng lalawigan. the DA 12 also allocated a fund which reached P700,000 as a support or augmentation in the cloud seeding operations of the province. <10> Nabatid na bawat lipad o sortie ng eroplano ay karga nito ang abot sa 15 sako na naglalaman ng mula 25 hanggang 50 kilo ng asin. realized that each flight or sortie of the airplane, it carried up to 15 sacks containing from 25 to 50 kilos of salt. <11> Una nang hiniling ni Governor Emmylou Mendoza sa Sangguniang Panlalawigan na isailalim sa State of Calamity ang probinsya dahil sa El Niño phenomenon. initially wished by Governor Emmylou Mendoza to the Provincial Council to put the province under the State of Calamity due to the El Niño phenomenon. <12> Dahil sa matinding tagtuyot, libu- libong ektarya ng taniman ng palay, mais, kape at iba pa ang napinsala. because of severe drought, thousands of hectares of planting fields for rice, corn, cacao and others are damaged. <13> (SJDuerme-PIA12 wth report from JSta. Cruz-NorthCot Media Center) (SJDuerme-PIA12 wth report from JSta. Cruz-NorthCot Media Center)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_43410463 <1> Sa ngalan ng kaligtasan in the name of safety <2> (Unang nalimbag ang akdang ito sa isyu 3 ng Philippine Collegian noong 27 Hunyo 2012.) (this article was first published in issue 3 of the Philippine Collegian on 27 June 2012) <3> ni Anne Vitug by Anne Vitug <4> Sakay ang sariling motorsiklo, iniikot ni Lawrence Mappala ang National Science Complex bilang bahagi ng pang-araw-araw niyang duty. riding his own motorcycle, Lawrence Mappala goes around the National Science Complex as part of his daily duty. <5> “Ako na ang nagpapagasolina sa motorsiklo ko para magamit sa pagronda. Sa kakulangan ng kagamitan para sa amin sa SSB, minsan kailangan naming magsakripisyo para lang magawa namin nang maayos ang mga trabaho namin.” "I am the one paying for the gasoline of my motorcycle to be used in making rounds. with the lack of equipment for us in the SSB, sometimes we need to make sacrifices so that we can do our jobs properly." <6> | Chris Martin Imperial | Chris Martin Imperial <7> Araw-araw silang nakikipagbuno sa init ng araw, sa puyat, at higit sa lahat, sa banta ng dahas at panganib. every day they wrestle with the heat of the sun, with lack of sleep, and most of all, with the threat of violence and danger. <8> Naroon sila kahit saan, sinisigurong maayos ang takbo ng seguridad sa loob ng unibersidad. they are everywhere, ensuring security properly operates inside the university. <9> Hindi sila security guards, hindi rin naman pulis. they are not security guards, and also not the police. <10> Hindi man sila gaanong kilala ng lahat dahil sa kanilang bihis sibilyan, patuloy pa rin nilang sinisiguro ang seguridad ng mga estudyante at empleyado ng UP. they may not be that well-known by everyone because of their civilian attire, yet they continue to ensure the safety of the students and employees of UP. <11> Ang tagapagtanggol the defenders <12> Binuo ang Special Services Brigade (SSB) noong 2005 bilang katuwang ng mga pulis at security guards sa pagpapaigting ng seguridad sa UP. the Special Services Brigade (SSB) was created in 2005 as partners of the police and security guards in improving safety in UP. <13> Isa sa mga pinakaunang naging miyembro nito si Manong Lawrence Mappala, 45 anyos. one of its first members is Manong Lawrence Mappala, 45 years old. <14> Sa loob ng pitong taon sa serbisyo, ginugugol niya ang bawat araw sa walang kapagurang pag-iikot sa iba’t ibang lugar sa unibersidad. Palagi siyang handa sa tawag ng serbisyo, araw man o gabi. Ito ang dahilan kung bakit itinuturing siya ng kanyang mga kasamahan bilang isa sa pinakamaasahang miyembro ng SSB. in his seven years of service, he spends each day restlessly making rounds in different parts of the university. he is always prepared for the call of service, day or night. this is the reason why his coworkers consider him as one of the most reliable members of the SSB. <15> Mula sa Aurora, Isabela si Manong Lawrence ngunit lumaki siya sa Quezon City. Manong Lawrence is from Aurora, Isabela but he grew up in Quezon City. <16> Bata pa lamang siya, pangarap na niyang maging sundalo ngunit naudlot ito nang mapatay ng isang holdaper ang kanyang ama na siyang tanging naghahanapbuhay noon sa kanilang pamilya. even when he was a child, he dreamed of becoming a soldier but this was cut short when his father who was the sole breadwinner for their family back then was killed by a thief. <17> Hayskul pa lamang ay natuto nang magbanat ng buto si Manong Lawrence bilang construction worker kapag may libreng oras. Dahil dito, at dahil na rin sa matiyagang paglalabandera ng kanyang ina, nagtapos siya bilang General Radio Operator sa Samson College. even during high school Manong Lawrence learned to work as a construction worker if he has free time. because of this, and also because his mother diligently did the laundry of others, he graduated as a general radio operator in Samson College. <18> Bago maglingkod bilang SSB sa unibersidad, naging intelligence officer si Mang Lawrence sa Economic Investigation and Intelligence Bureau, isang ahensya ng gobyerno na nabuwag noong 2000. before serving as SSB in the university, Mang Lawrence became an intelligent officer in the Economic Investigation and Intelligence Bureau, a government agency that was abolished in 2000. <19> Nagtapos ang operasyon ng ahensya nang may makaalitan silang malalaking pangalan sa mundo ng pulitika na nasangkot sa nasabat nilang ilegal na kargamento. the operations of the agency stopped when they went against big personalities in the world of politics involved when they confiscated some illegal cargo. <20> Nakaranas si Manong Lawrence at higit sa isang libong empleyado ng paninikil at pananakot mula sa mga pulitiko hanggang sa tuluyan na ngang mabuwag ang ahensiya. Manong Lawrence and more than one thousand employees experienced pressure and threats from politicians until the agency was eventually dissolved. <21> Ilang buwan din siyang nahirapan makahanap ng trabaho na makatutugon sa pangangailangan ng kanyang pamilya. for a few months he experienced difficulty finding a job that can answer to the needs of his family. <22> Sa bandang huli ay muli siyang naglingkod bilang barangay tanod sa Pook Dagohoy sa loob ng unibersidad. at the end he again served as a barangay sentry in Pook Dagohoy inside the university. <23> Ayon sa kanya, higit pa sa pangangailangang pinansiyal, nakatulong ang mga karanasan niya sa trabaho sa pagganap sa kanyang tungkulin bilang SSB. according to him, more than the financial needs, his experience from work helps him fulfill his role as SSB. <24> Sa kabila ng hirap at panganib na hatid ng kanyang trabaho, para kay Manong Lawrence, isang pribilehiyo ang maging SSB. despite the difficulty and danger his job brings, for Manong Lawrence, being an SSB is a privilege. <25> Sa sweldong P481kada araw at sa tulong na rin ng asawang librarian sa UP College of Law ay natutugunan naman umano ang pangangailangan ng kanilang pamilya. with a salary of P481 per day and help from his wife who is a librarian in the UP College of Law they can answer to the needs of their family. <26> Katulad ng maraming magulang, pangarap ni Manong Lawrence na sa UP makapag-aral ang kanyang tatlong anak na lalaki. like many parents, it is Manong Lawrence's dream for his three sons to study in UP. <27> Sinubukang tuparin ng kanyang panganay ang pangarap na ito ngunit hindi siya pumasa sa UPCAT. his first child tried to achieve this dream but he did not pass the UPCAT. <28> Sa kabila nito ay hindi siya nawalan ng loob at ngayon ay malapit nang magtapos ng kursong Criminology sa Republican College. despite this he did not lose confidence and is now close to finishing the course Criminology in Republican College. <29> Patuloy naman na naghahangad si Manong Lawrence na maging matagumpay ang mga anak niya sa anumang larangang mapili nila. Manong Lawrence continues to wish for his children to succeed in whatever field they choose. <30> Maraming tungkuling ginagampanan si Manong Lawrence bilang SSB. Manong Lawrence fulfills many roles as SSB. <31> Sa kanyang trabaho, nakakatulong siya sa pagtitiyak ng kaayusan at seguridad ng pamantasan. in his job, he helps ensure the order and safety of the university. <32> Takbo ng trabaho operation of work <33> Hindi tulad ng mga pulis at security guard, walang uniporme ang mga SSB. unlike the police and security guards, the SSB do not have uniforms. <34> Matagal na rin silang hindi gumagamit ng kahit anong armas gaya ng batuta. they also have not used any weapon like the baton for a long time. <35> Tanging liksi ng katawan at talas ng isip ang armas ni Manong Lawrence at ng 51 na iba pang miyembro ng SSB upang matupad ang kanilang mga tungkulin. only the agility of the body and sharpness of the mind are the weapons of Manong Lawrence and 51 other members of the SSB in fulfilling their responsibilities. <36> Araw-araw ay may iba’t-ibang lugar sa unibersidad na kailangan bantayan ang mga SSB. every day there are different places in the university that the SSB need to guard. <37> Responsibilidad nilang magmatiyag at maging alerto sa mga posibleng ilegal na gawain at mga kahina-hinalang tao. it is their responsibility to observe and be on alert for possible illegal activities and suspicious people. <38> Naatasan din silang pagbawalan ang mga ilegal na manininda, palaboy, mga tinatawag na watch-your-car boys at mga traysikel at pedicab na pumasok sa unibersidad. they are also assigned to stop illegal sellers, strays, what are called watch-your-car boys and tricycles and pedicabs from entering the university. <39> Sa mga pagkakataong may mahuling lumalabag sa batas, hindi maaaring mang-aresto ang SSB. at times when they catch violators, the SSB cannot make an arrest. <40> Maaari lamang nilang banatayan ang nahuli at hintayin ang mga pulis na rumesponde sa kaso. they can only guard those caught and wait for the police to respond to the case. <41> Sa ganitong takbo ng trabaho nakilala ni Manong Lawrence ang UP at ang mga estudyante nito. Manong Lawrence got to know UP and its students through this line of work. <42> Malinaw pa sa kanyang mga alaala noong hindi pa problema sa unibersidad ang pagtaas ng matrikula. he can still clearly remember when tuition increase was not yet a problem in the university. <43> Walang mahahabang pila ng mga estudyante para makapag-loan o mag-apply sa STFAP. there were no long lines of students who want to get a loan or apply for STFAP. <44> Naniniwala siya na ang edukasyon ay dapat libre para sa lahat. Para sa kanya, ang pagkaltas sa badyet ng UP ay tahasang pagpapahirap sa mga magulang. he believes that education should be free for all. for him, cutting the budget of UP is a definite burden for parents. <45> “Sa sobrang hirap ng buhay ngayon, grabeng pasanin iyan sa magulang,” aniya. "with life being so hard now, that is a serious burden for parents," he says. <46> Bilang isang naglilingkod sa unibersidad, personal niyang nasasaksihan ang iba’t ibang sitwasyon na kinasasadlakan ng mga magulang at ng estudyante ng UP. as one who serves the university, he personally witnesses different situations that parents and students of UP experience. <47> Bilang magulang, alam ni Mang Lawrence ang halaga ng mabigyan ang mga anak ng mahusay na edukasyon, at nauunawaan niya ang hirap ng mga magulang na magtrabaho at mag-ipon upang matustusan ang nagtataasang tuition, maging sa mga pamantasang pinatatakbo ng estado. as a parent, Mang Lawrence knows the value of giving children good education, and he also understands the hardships of parents in working and saving to be able to afford the increasing tuition, even in universities run by the state. <48> Kulang na kulang really lacking <49> Hindi maipagkakailang marami nang karanasan si Mang Lawrence sa iba’t-ibang mukha ng krimen. it is undeniable that Mang Lawrence already has much experience with different faces of crime. <50> Hindi umano niya malilimutang ang paghabol sa isang magnanakaw malapit sa Ilang-Ilang Residence Hall at paghuli sa isang rapist sa E. Jacinto. according to him he will not forget chasing a robber near Ilang-Ilang Residence Hall and capturing a rapist in E. Jacinto. <51> Bilang isang pampublikong espasyo, malaki ang problema ng UP sa seguridad dahil malayang nakapapasok at nakalalabas ang sinuman. as a public space, UP has a big problem with security because anyone can freely enter and exit. <52> Ang mga krimen gaya ng pagnanakaw ay talamak sa kampus dahil hindi madaling malaman kung sino ang mga taga-UP at sino ang hindi. crimes like theft are widespread on campus because it is not easy to identify who is from UP and who is not. <53> Maging ang kawalan ng uniporme o dress code ng mga estudyante ng unibersidad ay nagiging bentahe sa mga magnanakaw na malayang nakakalabas-masok sa kampus. even the absence of a uniform or dress code for students of the university becomes an advantage for robbers who freely enter and exit the campus. <54> Isa sa mga posibleng solusyon sa problemang ito ay ang pagdadagdag ng mga taong magbabantay sa kampus. Ngunit sa ngayon, mahirap itong ipatupad dahil sa kakulangan sa badyet ng unibersidad. one possible solution to this problem is adding people who will guard the campus. but currently, it is difficult to implement because of the university's lack of budget. <55> Problema rin ng mga SSB ang kakulangan sa mga kagamitan gaya ng mga motorsiklo at mobile cars. Napalaki ng unibersidad at sa lawak ng banta ng krimen sa araw-araw ay mahirap para sa mga SSB ang mabantayan ang buong kampus kung iilan lamang sa kanila ang nakagagamit ng sasakyan. another problem of the SSB is the lack of equipment like motorcycles and mobile cars. the university is extremely large and with the amount of crime threats every day it is difficult for the SSB to guard the whole campus if only a few of them can use vehicles. <56> Isa pang problema ay ang kakulangan sa training ng mga kasalukuyang miyembro ng iba’t ibang security group sa UP katulad ng SSB. Isang halimbawa dito ang paggawa ng mga ulat ukol sa mga kasong kanilang nirerespondehan. Ani Prof. Emerino Dagdag, Chief Administrative Officer ng SSB, hindi pa ganoon kabihasa rito ang SSB. Mahalaga ang maayos na paggawa ng ulat dahil isa ito sa pinagbabatayan ng karagdagang aksyon sa mga kaso. another problem is the lack of training for current members of different security groups in UP like the SSB. one example of this is the filing of reports about the cases they respond to. according to Professor Emerino Dagdag, Chief Administrative Officer of the SSB, the SSB are not yet experienced here. proper filing of reports is important because it is one of the basis for additional action on cases. <57> Bukod pa rito, ayon kay Prof. Dagdag, nangangailangan din sila ng malawakang pagsasanay sa pag-iimbestiga upang makakalap ng sapat na impormasyon at ebidensiya sa mga kaso. aside from this, according to Professor Dagdag, they also need extensive training in investigation in order to collect enough information and evidence on cases. <58> Dito makikita ang katotohanang na maraming kinakaharap na suliranin ang UP bilang komunidad. the reality that UP as a community faces a lot of problems can be seen here. <59> Bilang SSB, si Manong Lawrence ay bahagi ng komunidad na ito at may malaking papel na ginagampanan sa pagsasaayos ng sistema ng seguridad sa UP. as SSB, Manong Lawrence is part of this community and he has a big role to fulfill in fixing the security system of UP. <60> Biktima rin siya ng mga problema ng unibersidad tulad ng kawalan ng pondo para sa mga pangangailangan ng SSB. he is also a victim of the problems of the university like lack of funds for the needs of the SSB. <61> Ang mga kakulangang ito ang dahilan kung bakit marahil hindi pa gaano ka-epektibo ang SSB sa pagpapanatili ng kaayusan at seguridad sa kampus. these shortcomings are the reason perhaps why the SSB are still not that effective in maintaining order and safety in campus. <62> Sa bandang huli, habang pinoprotektahan ng mga miyembro ng SSB ang mga estudyante at empleyado, responsibilidad din ng unibersidad na tugunan ang kanilang mga pangangailangan tungo sa epektibong pagtupad nila sa kanilang tungkulin. in the end, while the members of the SSB protect the students and employees, it is also the responsibility of the university to attend to their needs towards effective execution of their responsibilities.
