MATERIAL_BASE-1B_36820082 <1> 17 paaralan sa South Cotabato binigyan ng solar power kits 17 schools in South Cotabato are given solar power kits <2> February 17, 2016 February 17, 2016 <3> LUNGSOD NG KORONADAL, South Cotabato, Peb 17 (PIA) \-- Abot sa 17 paaralan sa mga liblib na lugar sa South Cotabato ang nabiyayaan kamakailan ng mga solar home lighting kit system na donasyon ng ng nv vogt Philippines Solar Energy One, Inc. City of Koronadal, South Cotabato, February 17 (PIA) - reached up to 17 schools in the far-flung places in South Cotabato are granted recently with solar home lighting kit system which is a donation of the NV Vogt Philippines Solar Energy One, Inc. <4> Ang nv vogt ang pinakamalaking solar power investor sa Mindanao. the NV Vogt is the largest solar power investor in Mindanao. <5> Ito rin ang nagtayo ng 5 megawatt solar farm sa Barangay Centrala, Surallah, South Cotabato. this one also built the 5 megawatt solar farm in Barangay Centrala, Surallah, South Cotabato. <6> Kabilang sa mga nabigyan ng solar photovoltaic home lighting system ang mga paaralan sa Sitio Lubol at Kiantay sa Upper Sepaka at Basag sa Salacafe; Sitio Demamis, Dangkong at Salabanog sa Laconon; Sitio Kebuling sa Basag; Sitio Talambong at Motokling sa Mongkayo; Sitio Balnabo, Datal Tablo, Coong, Datal Colon at Bengue sa Maan, lahat sa bayan ng Tboli. included in those who are given with solar photovoltaic home lighting system are the schools in Sitio Lubol and Kiantay in Upper Sepaka and Basag in Salacafe; Sitio Demamis, Dangkong and Salabanog in Laconon; Sitio Kebuling in Basag; Sitio Talambong and Motokling in Mongkayo; Sitio Balnabo, Datal Tablo, Coong, Datal Colon and Bengue in Maan, all in the municipalities in Tboli. <7> Nabigyan din ng parehong pasilidad ang paaralan sa Sitio Lembuto sa Lamlahak, Sitio Tboyong sa Lamfugon, at Sitio Bulol Lahak sa Klubi sa bayan ng Lake Sebu. given also with similar facilities are the schools in Sitio Lembuto in Lamlahak, Sitio Tboyong in Lamfugon, and Sitio Bulol Lahak in Klubi in the municipality of Lake Sebu. <8> Ang bawat paaralan ay binigyan ng tig-dalawang solar photovoltaic home lighting system. each school is given two solar photovoltaic home lighting system. <9> Isinagawa ang turn over ceremony noong Lunes sa covered court ng Provincial Capitol. the turn over ceremony was done last Monday in the covered court of the Provincial Capitol. <10> Kalakip sa solar photovoltaic home lighting system ang dalawang LED lamps, home lighting system, AC-DC adaptor, mobile charging cord at 10-watt photovoltaic panel with stand set. together with the solar photovoltaic home lighting system are two LED lamps, home lighting system, AC-DC adaptor, mobile charging cord and 10-watt photovoltaic panel with stand set. <11> Nagpa-abot naman ng lubos na pasasalamat ang South Cotabato Schools Division sa bigay ng nv vogt Philippines. the South Cotabato Schools Division sent out their utmost gratitude for the gifts of the NV Vogt Philippines. <12> Sa kanyang mensahe, sinabi ni Assistant Schools Division Superintendent Mario Madrero na isang magandang pagkakataon ito na makaranas ang mag mag-aaral sa napakaliblib na mga bahagi ng lalawigan na magkaroon ng ilaw sa kanilang silid-aralan. in his message, Assistant Schools Division Superintendent Mario Madrero said that this is a good opportunity for the students in the most far-flung parts of province to experience having light in their classrooms. <13> Umaasa rin si Madrero na mas marami pang paaralan ang mabibiyaan ng kaparehong pasilidad sa mga darating na mga araw. Madrero also expects that more schools will be granted with the similar facility in the coming days. <14> Mas mainam din aniya kung mabigyan ang mga paaralan ng solar power kits na may kakayahang magpa-andar ng computer at computer printer upang hindi na kailangang lumuwas pa sa bayan ang mga guro upang mag-encode at mga print ng kanilang mga isusumiteng report at gumawa ng mga instructional material. it is better, according to him, if the schools will be given with solar power kits which has the ability to operate a computer and computer printer so that the teachers will not need to travel to the town to encode and print the report that they are going to submit and make the instructional material. <15> (DEDoguiles-PIA 12) (DEDoguiles-PIA 12)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_83308025 <1> Ang MNLF 'Integree' sa Silangkan (Leadership Experience Part 11) the MNLF 'integree' in Silangkan (leadership experience part 11) <2> Nasa kalagitnaan ako ng aking breath pause habang inaaninag ang nag-iingay na target sa may kasukalan mga kalahating kilometro mula sa bungad ng Barangay Silangkan nang namukhaan ko ang aming target. I was in the middle of my breath pause while making out the noise-generating target by the forest half a kilometer from the boundary of Barangay Silangkan when I recognized our target. <3> "Sanamagan! Baboy damo!" "son of a gun! wild boar!" <4> Pabulong na sambit ng Bisayang sundalo,"Ihalas!" a Visayan soldier said in a whisper, "ihalas!" <5> Ang laki ng baboy damo na tumawid mga 50 metro lang ang layo mula sa aming skirmishers formation. the wild boar that crossed about 50 meters away from our skirmishers formation was big. <6> Parang nabuhusan kami ng malamig na tubig. it was as if we were plunged with cold water. <7> Akala ko ay umaatikabong aksyon na naman laban sa mga bandido. I assumed it was lively action again against the bandits. <8> Napakarami kasing naglipanang baboy sa islang lalawigan ng Sulu at halu-halo ang species na andito. because there are so many pigs around the island province of Sulu and in here are all sorts of species. <9> Parang maliit na kalabaw ang aking nakita sa kanyang haba at tangkad. what I saw was like a small water buffalo because of its length and height. <10> Palagay ko ay isa yon sa variety o sub-specie ng tinatawag na Bornean wild boar na lumalangoy at tumatawid papuntang mga isla ng Sibutu sa Tawi-tawi. my guess is it is one variety or sub-specie called Bornean wild boar that swims and crosses towards the islands of Sibutu in Tawi-tawi. <11> Dahil Muslim ang 99% sa mga residente sa Sulu, di na kailangan ng conservation project dito dahil hindi naman nila ginagalaw ang mga hayop na ito. because the residents of Sulu are 99% Muslim, a conservation project is no longer necessary there because they do not touch these animals. <12> Bihira ang nagha-hunting nito na Muslim at ibinebenta sa mga Kristiyano lalo na sa mga sundalo. Muslim hunters are rare and snitched to the Christians especially the soldiers. <13> Nag-reorganize kaming muli at ibinato ko sa aming Batcom sa pamamagitan ng radyo ang aming observation. we reorganized again and passed our observation to our BATCOM through radio. <14> Pati sila ay naka-alerto sa may likuran sakaling kalaban nga yong aming nakita. even those in the back were on alert in case what we saw really was an enemy. <15> Nang makuha ko ang kautusan na ipagpatuloy ang movement, lumakad na kaming muli. when I received the order to continue movement, we walked again. <16> Bandang alas-sais na noon ng umaga nang malapitan namin ang bungad ng bahayan. it was around six o'clock in the morning when we approached the front of the houses. <17> Ihininto ko ang patrol mga 200 metro mula sa bahayan para makapag-recon. I stopped the patrol about 200 meters from the houses to recon. <18> Gamit ang 10x power Nimrod sniper scope at ang Steiner binoculars, nag-scan kami sa paligid para makilatis na mabuti ang lugar. using a 10x power Nimrod sniper scope and the Steiner binoculars, we scanned the surroundings to study the area well. <19> "Sir, merong dalawang armado. "sir, there are two armed men. <20> Naka-BDA uniform," sabi ni Cpl Gil Galsim, isa sa aking Team Leader at sniper. wearing BDA uniform," said Corporal Gil Galsim, one of my team leader and sniper. <21> Nakumpirma ko ang kanyang obserbasyon at minabuti kong usisahin itong mabuti. I confirmed his observation and preferred to study it thoroughly. <22> Nakita ko na ang armado ay naka-M16 Rifle at nakasuot ng pulang patch ng 1st Infantry Division. I found that the armed men had M16 rifles and wore the red patch of the 1st infantry division. <23> "Tabak patch yan. "that is a Tabak patch. <24> Tatsulok na pula at merong itak sa gitna," sagot ko. red triangle with a dagger in the middle," I answered. <25> Ang patch kasi ng 1st ID ay hango sa tabak ng Scout Ranger. because the patch of the 1st ID is based on the dagger of the scout ranger. <26> Ayon sa mga matatandang musang, ang nag-compose sa pinakaunang personnel ng Tabak Division sa Nueva Ecija noong araw ay mga Scout Rangers. according to the older Musangs , scout rangers composed the first personnel of the Tabak division in Nueva Ecija back in the day. <27> Syempre, ayaw nilang talikuran ang pagiging Musang kaya Tabak ang ginawa nilang unit patch, bilang tanda na mga mandirigma rin sila na nanggaling sa hanay ng mga musang. of course, they do not want to turn their backs on being a Musang so they made their unit patch the Tabak, as mark that they are also fighters that came from the ranks of the Musang . <28> Sa aming pag-uusyoso at paninilip sa lugar, namataan din namin ang 4 pang armadong kalalakihan na samo't-sari ang mga armas. in our snooping and peeping at the area, we also saw 4 more armed men with all sorts of weapons. <29> Merong naka-tsinelas, merong naka-shirt lang at merong tila ay nag-bitbit ng attache case sa istilo ng pagdala ng kanyang baril. some wore slippers, some wore shirts only and there are some who seemed to be carrying an attaché case in the manner of carrying his gun. <30> Sa bandang likuran ng pwesto nila ay merong mga naglalarong bata at matanda na tila ay nag-rerelax at ini-enjoy ang preskong ihip ng hangin ng Sulu Sea. by the back of their location there were children playing and elders as if relaxing and enjoying the fresh gust of wind of the Sulu Sea. <31> "Ito na po ang sinasabi. Labo-labo na. Di na malaman sino ang mga iyan," sambit ko na me halong inis kasi nasa sitwasyon na naman kami na alanganin. "this is what was being said. it is unclear already. we cannot figure out who they are," I muttered with a mix of annoyance because we were again in a tricky situation. <32> Problema lagi namin na alamin sino kalaban at sino hindi. it is always our problem to figure out who is the enemy and who is not. <33> Sa estimate of the situation, ang pakiwari ko ay hindi sila Abu Sayyaf pero maaari ding meron doong bandido na kaanak nila. in estimating the situation, my guess is they are not Abu Sayyaf but they may have relatives there who are bandits. <34> Nang ikumpirma ko ang location sa mapa, nasa vicinity na kami ng 'recognized MNLF camp' sa lugar na iyon. when I confirmed the location in the map, we were in the vicinity of the 'recognized MNLF camp' in that area. <35> Dapat kong malaman kung talagang kalaban sa kahit anong paraan. I really need to know the true enemy no matter how. <36> Pinili kong hindi sila pagbabarilin kasi ayaw kong magsisisi sa hulihan at marami ang madadamay. I tried not to shoot at them because I do not want to be blamed in the end and many will be involved. <37> Kaya man naming ipatimbuwang ang mga armadong kalalakihan sa unang bugso pa lang ng putok, ngunit di mapigilang merong madamay na mga inosenteng sibilyan na nagkalat sa paligid nila. we may be able to send the armed men to fall on their backs in only the first round of gunfire, but it cannot be helped that there will be innocent civilians around their location who will get involved. <38> Doon ko nabuo ang isang desisyon: lapitan ang mga armado nang harapan at sila ay kakausapin. there I made a decision: approach the armed men directly and talk to them. <39> Batid ko na isang sugal ang aking gagawin kaya naman ay nag-plano kami ng pamamaraan para mabawasan ang risks at masuportahan kaming maayos. I knew that what I will do is a gamble so we planned a way to minimize risks and for us to be properly backed up. <40> Ang una kong ginawa ay i-marka sa mapa ang grid location ng posisyon namin sa Objective Rally Point (ORP) at ang posisyon ng napagsuspetsahang kalaban (target). the first I did was mark on the map the grid location of our position in objective rally point (ORP) and the position of the suspected enemy (target). <41> Kinausap ko ang lahat ng Team Leaders. I talked to all the team leaders. <42> "Ang team ni Boni at ni Tayros ang sasama sa akin," sabi ko sa aming briefing. "the team of Boni and of Tayros will come with me," I said in our briefing. <43> "Ang team ni Panganiban at ni Cayabyab ang support elements na dumugtong sa amin sakaling magkaputukan." "the team of Panganiban and of Cayabyab are support elements who will join us in case of gunfire." <44> "Ang team ni Galsim at Sabarre ang mag-provide ng support by fire. "the team of Galsim and Sabarre will provide support by fire." <45> Ang sniper ay dapat sa pinaka-harap na armadong mga kalalakihan ang tutok. the sniper should aim at the front of the armed men. <46> Wag mamumutok hanggat hindi sila naunang mag-taas ng baril at kami ay paputukan," mahigpit kong bilin. do not shoot until they raise their gun first and shoot at us," I strictly advised. <47> Kampante ako na di kami lugi. I was confident that we were not disadvantaged. <48> Sa layong 200 metro, peanuts lang sa aking mga tropa ang magpatama ng bandido. at a distance of 200 meters, hitting the bandits were just peanuts to my troops. <49> Sa snipers, kahit palagitnaan pa ng mata ang marka ng 7.62mm round. for snipers, even if the mark of the 7.62mm round is between the eyes. <50> Ipinasa ko ang aking plano sa Battalion at nag-request ako na i-lay ang 81mm Mortar para kami ay masuportahan. I passed on my plan to the battalion and requested for the 81mm mortar to be laid to support us. <51> Napabilib din kasi ako sa kagalingan ng mortar section ng 32nd SF Company sa una naming bakbakan. because I was impressed by the skill of the mortar section of the 32snd SF company in our first encounter. <52> Dahil accurate at nasa 35 metro ang kill radius nito, mahiya-hiya rin yong mga makipaglaban sa amin. because its kill radius was accurate and at 35 meters, those fighting us will be ashamed. <53> Kailangan lang talaga na magaling ang Fire Direction Center, ang mga operator nito at syempre, ang Forward Observer na syang mag-adjust ng fires. the fire direction center just has to be good, its operators and of course, the forward observer who will adjust the fires. <54> Kapag isa sa kanila ay palpak, mabatuktukan kami ng mortar rounds sa aming posisyon. if one of them fails, we will be hit by mortar rounds in our position. <55> Isa rin sa delikado sa sitwasyon namin na iyon ay nasa gun target line kaming nasa harapan. one more danger to our situation there is that we at the front were in the gun target line. <56> Konting palpak sa pagbigay ng range (distance), kasama kami sa mapahamak. a few mistakes in giving the range (distance), we will be included in the casualties. <57> Ipinagpaubaya ko na lang kay Sir Bobby Morales ang lahat kasi ito ang itinapos nya sa Fort Benning, Georgia na kung saan ay sa layong 3km ay pinapatamaan nila ang mga T72 tanks ng mortar rounds. I handed over everything to Sir Bobby Morales because this is what he studied in Fort Benning, Georgia wherein at a distance of 3km they hit T72 tanks with mortar rounds. <58> Bahala na si Batman este si Batcom. Batman I mean BATCOM will be in charge. <59> At the same time, naka-alerto rin ang 20th SRC na pinamunuan ni Lt Sam Yunque, ang 12th SRC na noon ay dala ni Lt Binalla at ang SF company ni Lt Nick Banzuela para kami ay tulungan sakaling balak ng kaaway na kami ay kukuyugin. at the same time, also on alert were the 20th SRC led by Lieutenant Sam Yunque, the 12th SRC that back then was brought by Lieutenant Binalla and the SF company of Lieutenant Nick Banzuela to help us in case the enemy plans to mob us. <60> Walang iwanan! no one left behind! <61> Bago namin tuluyang lisanin ang ORP, nag-bigay ako ng mga paalala sa aking mga kasama: before we finally left ORP, I gave reminders to my companions: <62> "Lapitan natin sila na tila ay naka-relax lang. "let us approach them as if relaxed. <63> Low carry ang baril ngunit loaded ang chamber. low carry the gun but the chamber is loaded. <64> Dapat hindi tayo threatening sa kanila. we should not be threatening to them. <65> In case paputukan tayo, skirmishers front agad at bugahan ng volume of fire habang dahan-dahan mag-execute ng break contact." in case we are shot at, skirmishes to the front immediately and blast them with volume fire while carefully executing break contact." <66> Kagaya ng dati, kailangan kong mag-emphasize ng aming number one rule: like before, I needed to emphasize our number one rule: <67> "Kahit anong mangyari, walang iwanan!" "no matter what happens, no one is left behind!" <68> Ramdam ko ang na tensyonado kaming lahat habang papalapit. I felt that we were all experiencing tension while approaching. <69> Sa 1st Team ako sumama at nang ako mismo ang unang makakausap ng mga armado. I joined the 1st team so I myself will be the first to talk to the armed men. <70> Alam kong napaka-delikado ang aming gagawin pero iyon ang nakikita kong paraan para makumpirma kung kalaban ba talaga o hindi. I know what we would be doing was very dangerous but that was the only way I saw to confirm if they were really enemies or not. <71> Di ko naman masikmura na makapatay ng 'friendly forces' at maging dahilan pa sa dagdag kaguluhan. I cannot stomach killing 'friendly forces' and be the cause for additional conflict. <72> Kasama na sa aming P240.00 combat pay at P120.00 hazard pay yong pagsuong sa panganib. included in our P240.00 combat pay and P120.00 hazard pay is that, facing danger. <73> Mga 100 metro mula sa posisyon ng mga armado, nakikita na nila kami dahil tinumbok namin ang mismong kalsada na patungo sa kanilang barangay. about 100 meters from where the armed personnel positioned, they can already see us because we hit the very road going to their barangay. <74> Nakita ko na kumakaway yong isa. I saw one wave. <75> Ang ibang armado ay pasimpleng nagtago sa likurang bahagi ng bahay, samantalang ang tatlo ay kalmado lang at lumakad paharap at sinasalubong kami. the other armed men simply hid at the back part of the house, while three were just calm and walked forward to welcome us. <76> Nakatitig ang isa sa kanila sa suot kong 'pispis' (anting-anting) sa aking ulo. one them stared at the 'pispis' (amulet) I wore on my head. <77> Nakita ko ring meron sya at kinilatis ko ang kanyang uniporme. I saw that he also had one and examined his uniform. <78> Battle Dress Attire nga ng 1st ID at sya ay isang opisyal. really a battle dress attire of the 1st ID and he was an official. <79> Naka-smile syang lumapit sa aming team at naunang nagsalita. he approached our team smiling and first spoke. <80> "Sarge, sino sa inyo ang opisyal?" "sarge, which one of you is an official?" <81> Lumingon si Pfc Dumago sa akin na tila ay ayaw namang sabihin na ako yong kanyang Company Commander. Private First Class Dumago looked back to me as if not wanting to say that I was his company commander. <82> Binitawan ko ang aking naka-sling na AUG Steyr at sya ay kinamayan. I released my slung AUG Steyr and shook hands with him. <83> "Salam brother, ako si 1st Lt Cabunoc, ang kanilang Commander." "Salam brother, I am 1st Lieutenant Cabunoc, their commander." <84> Niyakap nya ako ayon sa kagawian ng mga Muslim. he hugged me according to the customs of the Muslims. <85> "Alaikumusalam! Ako si 2nd Lt Aberin. "Alaikumusalam! I am 2nd Lieutenant Aberin. <86> Binantayan ko ang mga kaanak ko dito sa Silangkan." I guarded my relatives here in Silangkan." <87> Nagtataka ako paano sya nadeploy doon eh samantalang na-integrate na sya kaya dapat doon sya sa kanyang mother unit. I wondered how he was deployed there when he should have been integrated and be there with his mother unit. <88> Kasama sya sa 5,500 na mga dating miyembro ng MNLF forces na isinama sa hanay ng Army (maliban sa 1,500 na isinama sa hanay ng PNP) simula noong 1997, ayon sa nakasaad sa GRP-MNLF Peace Agreement noong 1996. he is part of the 5,500 former members of the MNLF forces included in the ranks of the army (aside from the 1,500 included in the ranks of the PNP) starting 1997, according to what is stated in the GRP-MNLF Peace Agreement in 1996. <89> "Paano ka napunta dito? Andito ba ang unit mo nakadestino?" "how did you end up here? is your unit assigned here?" <90> Marami syang sinabi. he said a lot. <91> Kesyo ayaw daw nya madamay ang mga kaanak nya sa military operations. like he did not want his relatives to be affected by military operations. <92> Kesyo ni-request daw sya ni Maas (Prof Nur Misuari). like he was supposedly requested by Maas (Professor Nur Misuari). <93> Presko pa rin kasi sa isipan ko ang briefing sa akin ng taga intel na sa buwan ng Pebrero 2000 ay dalawa sa mga MNLF 'integree' na sina Pfc Tating Asbarin na miyembro ng 51st Infantry Battalion, 1st Infantry Division, at si Pvt Abdun Isnari ng Marine Training Unit, ang nasawi kasama ang apat na mga Abu Sayyaf sa isang bakbakan ng mga Marines doon sa bulubunduking lugar. because it was still fresh in my mind the briefing to me by those from intel that on the month of February 2000 two of the MNLF "integree" Private First Class Tating Asbari who was a member of the 51st infantry battalion, 1st infantry division, and Private Abdun Isnari of the marine training unit, who were killed together with four Abu Sayyafs in an encounter by the marines there in the mountainous area. <94> Mas marami namang matitino sa kanila at loyal sa AFP ngunit di maiwasan na meron ding nagpapasaway. there were much more decent ones of them and loyal to the AFP but it cannot be helped that there will be disobedient ones. <95> Alam kong merong problema sa ginawa niya kasi hindi sya nag-serve sa kanyang unit at tila, doon pa sya nag-serve sa MNLF unit sa Silangkan. I knew there was a problem with what he did because he did not serve in his unit and it seemed as if he even served in the MNLF unit in Silangkan. <96> Ganon pa man, wala na akong magawa doon maliban sa i-report ang aking nakita. still, I could not do anything there aside from reporting what I saw. <97> Ang importante sa akin, di nagkaputukan. what is important to me, is there was no gunfire. <98> Naglabasan sa mga bahayan ang mga kalalakihan. the men came out of the houses. <99> Ang iba me baril, ang iba sumisilip lang sa bintana. others had guns, others just peeked through windows. <100> Ang lugar pala na iyon ay parte na mismo sa 'recognized' MNLF camp. so that place was itself already a part of the 'recognized' MNLF camp. <101> Ang labo naman kasi, di mo malaman ang hangganan ng kanilang kampo. it was vague, you do not know the boundary of their camp. <102> Di ito kagaya sa Camp Aguinaldo o Fort Bonifacio na klaro ang mga outer limits nito. this was not like Camp Aguinaldo or Fort Bonifacio whose outer limits were clear. <103> Dagdag pa doon, hindi naman sya hitsurang kampo bagkus ay parang karaniwang barangay lang. in addition to that, it did not resemble a camp instead was just like an ordinary barangay. <104> Ang kaibahan, may mga fox holes sa gilid ng kalsada at may running trenches ang ilalim ng bahayan. the difference, there were fox holes at the side of the road and some houses had running trenches. <105> Pang-gyera ang kanilang komunidad. their community was meant for war. <106> Ini-report ko ang aking sitwasyon sa Battalion TCP. I reported my situation to battalion TCP. <107> Sinabi ko na kami ay nasa bungad ng MNLF camp. I said we were on the threshold of an MNLF camp. <108> Nang sumunod sa akin ang tropa ni Lt Yunque, napabulalas sya sa ganda ng dagat at dalampasigan doon. when the troop of Lieutenant Yunque followed me, he ended up exclaiming about the beauty of the sea and coast there. <109> "Bay, parang Boracay!" "bay, like Boracay!" <110> Paano naman kasi, ang pino ng buhangin at ang linaw ng tubig. it is because, the sand is fine and the water is clear there. <111> Parang nag-iimbita ang tanawin sa amin para magtampisaw na tila ay nasa island resort kami. as if the scenery is inviting us to wade like we were in an island resort. <112> "Okay dito bay, parang Boracay nga sa ganda. "it is okay here, bay, really like Boracay in its beauty." <113> Nakakawala ng battle stress. makes you lose battle stress. <114> Wag ka lang lumingon sa likuran dahil manlumo ka na makita ang gubat ng Indanan at Talipao na kung saan ay naglipana ang mga bandido!" just do not look behind because you will be overwhelmed to see the forest of Indanan and Talipao where the bandits have spread!" <115> Napabuntong-hininga na lang ako. I ended up sighing. <116> Nasasayangan ako sa ganda ng mga lupain na angkin ng mga apo ni Rajah Baguinda at ni Sultan Jamalul Kiram. I felt that the beauty of the lands owned by the descendants of Rajah Baguinda and by Sultan Jamalul Kiram were wasted. <117> Kung di lang sana magulo ang lugar, dapat ay nag-aagawan ang mga turista sa buong mundo para bisitahin itong napakagandang lugar. if only the place was not troubled, tourists from the whole world should be scrambling to visit this very beautiful place. <118> Nahimasmasan ako sa aking pagmuni-muni. I was brought back from my thoughts. <119> May misyon pa pala kami. we still had a mission. <120> "Animal ka Robot, saan ka nagtatago ha!" "you are an animal Robot, where did you hide!"

mga patayan kaugnay ng droga at hinihimok pa ang mga mamamayan na magsalita laban dito. the Bishops said that they will not keep silent on the ongoing killings in relation to drugs and encourages the citizens to speak against it. <3> Lumabas ang mga ito sa isang pastoral letter na binasa sa lahat ng mga simbahang Katolika nitong nakaraang Sabado at Linggo. they released a pastoral letter which was na nagpapakalat ng droga na nakasisira sa tao, pamilya at komunidad. although there were some who agreed to it, many also wants the war to happen and continue, especially since there are still a lot drug lords, pushers, and addicts, and also involved in drugs are dishonorable police and other authorities, with them are those who kidnap and ransom people like the ones related to the case of Korean national Jee Ick Joo. <9> TALIWAS SA MGA OBISPO Paglabas sa simbahan matapos ang mga misa, iba naman ang sinasabi ng maraming mamamayan sa sinasabi ng mga Obispo. contrary to the bishops upon exiting droga at may mga nanalo rin dahil ginastusan sila ng mga druglord na miyembro ng pamilya at iba pang mga kamag-anak o kaibigan. they are scared to lose votes from clans controlling drugs and there are sa group sex at nanggugulo at nagnanakaw sa kapamilya, lahat dahil sa droga. it has also stopped house-climbers, numerous teenagers who get into fights day and night, teenagers who get involved in May 25, 2016 City of Koronadal, South Cotabato, May 25 (PIA) - up to 90 malnourished children in Alabel, Sarangani, including around 20 child laborers are the current beneficiaries of a feeding program by the Department of Labor and Employment Sarangani Field Office. <3> Katuwang ng DOLE-Sarangani ang RS Po Foundation ng Century Pacific Food sa pagpapatupad ng feeding program sa Pag-asa Integrated Elementary School sa Barangay Pag-asa sa bayan ng Alabel. the RS Po Foundation of Century Pacific Food is helping DOLE-Sarangani in implementing the feeding program in Pag-asa Integrated Elementary School in Barangay Pag-asa in the town of Alabel. <4> Ang unang bugso ng feeding program ay magtatagal ng 45 at sinimulan ngayong bakasyon bilang paghahanda na rin sa kabataan sa pasukan. the first round of the feeding program will last 45 and was started this vacation to prepare the children for school. <5> Maliban sa feeding program, tinulungan din ng DOLE Sarangani Field Office and mga magulang ng 20 child laborers na mabigyan ng pansamantalang pangkabuhayan sa ilalim ng DOLE-Tulong Panghanapbuhay sa Ating Disadvantaged Workers (DOLE-TUPAD) program. aside from the feeding program, the DOLE Sarangani Field Office also helped the parents of 20 child laborers to be given temporary livelihood under the DOLE-Tulong Panghanapbuhay sa Ating Disadvantaged Workers (DOLE-TUPAD) program. <6> Ayon kay Sarangani Field Office OIC Head Alma Borela , isa ang Barangay Pag-asa sa pinakaapektado ng El Nino, dahilan para mawalan ng pangkabuhayan ang mga magulang; ang ilan sa kanila ay napilitang pagtrabahuin ang mga anak. according to Sarangani Field Office OIC head Alma Borela, Barangay Pag-asa is one of the most affected by El Nino, causing the parents to lose livelihood; some of them were forced to make their children work. <7> El Nino rin ang tinuturong dahilan ng pagdami ng malnourished na mga bata sa nasabing lugar. the reason for the increase of malnourished children in the said area is also attributed to El Nino. <8> Paalala ni Borela sa mga magulang, dapat pumapasok sa paaralan ang mga bata at hindi pinapayagang magtrabaho para kumita para sa pamilya. Borela reminded the parents, the children should be going to school and not allowed to work to earn for the family. <9> (DEDoguiles-PIA 12) (DEDoguiles-PIA 12)

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_37040658 <1> Sining ng Pagbalikwas art of turning down <2> Sheila Abarra Sheila Abarra <3> Bitbit ng mga pambansang minorya ang kanilang musika at makukulay na kasuotan sa bawat sitwasyong kanilang kinahaharap—patunay na buhay pa rin ang kanilang pine-preserbang sining. the country's minority carried their music and colorful clothing in every situation they face - proof that the art they're preserving is still alive. <4> Gayunman, para kay Nanay Liya Asinas, 58 anyos na bead-maker ng tribong Higaonon sa Bukidnon, malakas ang pangamba para sa kanilang natatanging sining at kultura. nevertheless, for mother Liya Asinas, 58 year old bead-maker of the Higaonon tribe in Bukidnon, they strongly fear for their unique art and culture. <5> Malaking banta sa mga ito ang lumalalang karahasang dulot ng militarisasyon sa kanilang sariling lupain. the largest threat for it is the worsening violence caused by the militarization in their own land. <6> Mahalaga ang mga ginagawang palamuti ng mga bead-maker na gaya ni Nanay Liya sa mga katutubo—bukod sa makukulay nilang mga kasuotan, malaki ang ambag ng mga palamuti sa kanilang pagkakakilanlan. the crafted accessories made by the bead-makers like mother Liya are important for the natives-aside from their colorful clothing, these accessories hugely contribute to their identities. <7> Salay ang tawag sa mga ito na isinusuot sa tuwing may mga pagtitipon gaya ng Dumalondong. these are called Salay which are worn during gatherings like Dumalondong. <8> Mayroon itong iba’t ibang uri: ang kumbong na isinusuot sa ulo at bakos na isinusuot ng mga mananayaw sa baywang. these have different kinds: a veil worn in the head and a belt worn by dancers in their waist. <9> Labing-anim na taong gulang si Nanay Liya nang magsimulang gumawa ng mga palamuti. Mother Liya was sixteen years old when she started making accessories. <10> Sa kabila ng mga paghihirap sa kanyang buhay, hindi niya pinabayaan ang kanyang sining. despite the hardships in her life, she did not take her art for granted. <11> Tuloy pa rin siya sa paggawa sa kabila ng pagkawala ng kanyang asawa at mga anak—apat na beses nang nakunan si Nanay Liya at hindi na nabiyayaan ng anak dahil pumanaw na rin ang kaniyang asawa noong 2011 dahil sa sakit. she continued to make these despite losing her husband and children-four times, mother Liya suffered miscarriage and was not blessed with a child after because her husband passed away in 2011 due to illness. <12> Bukod sa likha niyang sining, nagsisilbi rin siya sa kanyang komunidad sa ibang paraan. aside from creating her art, she serves in her community in other ways. <13> Dati siyang guro sa paaralan ng mga Higaonon na Rural Missionaries of the Philippines. she was formerly a teacher in a school for Higaonon, the Rural Missionaries of the Philippines. <14> Nang tumanda na siya at hindi na kayang umakyat sa bundok patungong paaralan, sumapi siya sa Health-Bukidnon, isang grupo ng mga community health workers ng Bukidnon. when she grew old and could no longer climb the mountain going to the school, she joined Health-Bukidnon, a group of community health workers of Bukidnon. <15> Ngunit lubos na nagbago ang buhay ni Nanay Liya nang dumating ang mga militar. the life of mother Liya completely changed when the military came. <16> Sinasaktan at hinunuli ng mga militar ang mga katutubo sa tuwing isinusuot ng mga ito ang kanilang mga makukulay na damit at palamuting tanda ng kanilang pagiging Higaonon. the military hurt and arrest the natives whenever they wear their colorful clothing and accessories as a symbol of them being Higaonon. <17> Dahil sa panggigipit at pandarahas na ito, nagkaroon ng kakabit na takot ang dating simpleng sagisag lamang ng kanilang pagkakakilanlan. because of these pressure and violence, fear got associated in wearing the previously simple symbol of their identities. <18> Binabastos at dinarahas ng mga militar maging ang kanilang mga paaralan. the military disrespect and commit violence even in their schools. <19> Binabansagan ang mga ito bilang “paaralan ng mga NPA,” samantalang puro kabataang katutubo ang nag-aaral doon. they labeled them as "school of the NPA," when only native children studying there. <20> Sanhi ng panggigipit ng mga militar, naipasara ang mga paaralang muli lamang nabuksan nang makipagdayalogo ang mga katutubo sa lokal na pamahalaan. due to the pressure from the military, schools were closed down and were only opened back when the natives had a dialogue with the local government. <21> Gayunman, nananatili pa rin ang takot hatid ng banta ng militarisasyon. nevertheless, the fear delivered by the threat of militarization stays <22> Sa kabila ng lahat ng ito, nagsisikap pa rin ang mga bead-maker na gaya ni Nanay Liya na panatilihin ang kanilang sining. despite all of these, the bead-makers like mother Liya still work hard to preserve their art. <23> Marami pa ring Lumad ang gumagawa ng mga palamuti. there are still many Lumad who make accessories. <24> Hindi lamang ito sagisag ng kanilang pagkakakilanlan—pinaniniwalaang may mga pang-medisinal ding gamit ang mga ito. these are not only symbols of their identities - it is believed that these have medicinal uses too. <25> Pinagsusuot nila ang mga katutubo ng mga palamuting ito sa parte ng katawang may bali o pilay upang maisaayos ang pagdaloy ng dugo at maibsan ang sakit. they make the natives wear the accessories in the parts of their bodies that have fractures or sprain to correct the flow of blood and ease the pain. <26> Ang mga pambansang minorya ang nakapagpanatili ng kulturang Pilipino sa kabila ng mga impluwensyang kolonyal na kinaharap ng bansa sa kamay ng mga dayuhan. the country's minority are the ones who preserve the Filipino culture despite the colonial influences faced by the country in the hands of foreigners. <27> Malaking kawalan kung magpapatuloy ang pandarahas at pagpapaalis sa kanila sa kanilang lupang ninuno. it will be a big loss if they will be continuously violated and displaced from their ancestral lands. <28> Ani Nanay Liya. said mother Liya. <29> “Tumanda na ako sa pagiging bead-maker at tulad ng pag-protect namin dito [bead-making], dapat lang na protektahan din ang aming mga karapatan.” "I've grown old being a bead-maker and like how we protected it (bead-making), it is fitting that we also protect our rights."

Luisito Magnaye, to prepare for the security to be given to the athlete and her family. <5> Maliban sa ibinibigay na seguridad ng PNP kay Hidilyn, sinabi ni Climaco na iniutos rin niya sa PNP na kailangan na ring bigyan ng seguridad sa bahay mismo nina Hidilyn para na rin sa kaligtasan ng kanyang pamilya. aside from the security given by the PNP to Hidilyn, Climaco said that she had mandated the PNP that a security is needed in the house of Hidilyn itself for the security of her family. <6> “Even before she arrive the Philippines, my ins­truction to Col. "even before she arrive the Philippines, my instruction to Colonel <7> Magnaye was already to provide security for her and I will be following up again because not only security to be provided with her but also to the periphery of their homes,” pahayag ni Climaco. July 20, 2016 President Rodrigo Duterte gave a good send-off gift to our 2016 Rio Olympics-bound athletes. <3> Sa courtesy call ng pambansang atleta sa pangulo ng Malacañang kamakalawa, sinorpresa sila ni President Duterte nang ihayag na ang dating US$1,000 allowance nila ay gagawing $3,000. in the courtesy call of the national athletes to the president in Malacañang two days ago, President Duterte surprised them by announcing that their former allowance of US$1,000 will become $3,000. <4> Pati nga ang mga opisyal ay nadamay din dahil mula sa $3,000 ay magiging $5,000 na ang kanilang allowance. even officials were included because from $3,000 their allowance became $5,000. <5> Pero, sana binaliktad na lamang ni Pangulong Digong na $5,000 sa mga atleta at tinutuo niya ang biro na mayaman naman ang mga opisyal kaya P500 pesos na lamang sila. but, wish President Duterte just switched it around so that athletes got $5,000 and he made real the joke that officials are rich so they only get P500 peso. <6> Gayunpaman, dahil sa ginawa ni Pangulong Digong, nagkaroon tuloy ng dagdag-inspirasyon ang mga atleta sa kanilang paglahok sa Olympics. still, because of what President Digong isip din pala ng pangulo ng bansa ang kapakanan ng mga atleta. it is gladdening that the president of the country also has the welfare of athletes in mind. <10> Inihayag din niya na susuportahan niya ang training ng mga national athletes at ang perang gagamitin ng kanyang administrasyon ay ang makoko­lekta mula sa mga tax evaders. he also announced that he will support the training of national athletes and the money his administration will use will be the collection from tax evaders. <11> Pero mas maganda siguro kung isasama na lamang ni Pangulong Duterte sa 2017 national budget ang pondo na ipangsu-suporta sa ating mga pambansang atleta. but it is probably better if President Duterte will just include the funds for supporting our national athletes into the 2017 national budget. <12> Sa pamamagitan nito, taun-taon ay nakakasiguro na ang mga national athletes ng pondo mula sa ating pamahalaan. through this, our national athletes will be ensured of funds from our government every year.

Panaligan. Calapan, Oriental Mindoro, June 11 (PIA) - the new leadership of the federation of senior citizens association of Calapan City (FESCACC) recently took oath which is headed now by Imelda Dacillo for Calapan city Mayor Arnan C. Panaligan. <4> Kasama ni Dacilllo na nanumpa ang iba pang opisyales ng kanilang asosasyon na sina Angel Albo bilang pangalawang-pangulo; Francisco Mercene, secretary; Fely Del Mundo, treasurer; Nieva Manansala at Angel Tuquero, mga auditor; at Honoria Romero at Ricardo Lineses bilang mga PRO. other officers from their respective associations that swore an oath with Dacillo are Angel Albo as vice president; Francisco Mercene, secretary; Fely Del Mundo, treasurer; Nieva Manansala and Angel Tuquero, auditors; and Honoria Romero and Ricardo Lineses as PROs.. <5> Ayon kay Panaligan, ang tatag at pagiging buhay ng isang samahan ay hindi lamang sa mga opisyal dapat nakasalalay kundi nasa pagkakaisa din ng bawat kasapi. according to Panaligan, the strength and being alive of an organization does not only depends on their officials but in the unity of every member. <6> Dahil dito, hiniling ni Panaligan kay Dacillo na hikayatin pa ang mga miyembro na makilahok sa kanilang mga gawain dahil naniniwala siya na kayang- kaya nilang isakatuparan ang magagandang mithiin ng kanilang samahan. because of this, Panaligan asked Dacillo to encourage the members to participate in their activities because he believes that they can easily fulfill the good intentions of their organization. <7> Ayon pa sa punong lungsod, dapat na ring maamyendahan ang ordinansa ng Gold Card nang maipasok na rito ang pagpapalawak ng mga benepisyo nito kagaya ng libreng Ultra Sound, To The Echo at CTScan na napakahalaga sa mga senior citizen. according to the mayor, the gold card ordinance must also be amended to include the extension of its benefits such as free ultra sound, to the echo and CT scan which are of great importance to senior citizens. <8> Ibibigay rin ang gold card sa mga senior citizen depende sa kategorya ng kanilang pamumuhay. the gold card will be given to the senior citizen's depending on the category of their living. <9> (CIO/LTC/PIA-Mimaropa/Calapan) (cio/ltc/pia-Mimaropa/Calapan)

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_75761640 <1> Sabado, Hulyo 26, 2014 Saturday, July 26, 2014. <2> TUNAY NA KAYAMANAN (Revised / Reposted): Reflection for the 17th Sunday in Ordinary Time Year A - July 27, 2014 - YEAR OF THE LAITY true wealth (revised / re-posted): reflection for the 17th Sunday in ordinary time year a - July 27, 2014 - year of the laity. <3> Ano kaya ang mangyayari sa 'yo kapag sinabing nanalo ka ng 50 million pesos sa lotto? what will happen to you if you are said to have won 50 million pesos in the lotto? <4> Malamang hihimatayin ka sa tuwa o kung di naman ay aatakihin ka sa puso sa sobrang kagalakan! you will probably faint from happiness or have a heart attack in extreme joy! <5> May isang kuwento na minsan daw ay may isang lola ang walang kaalam-alam na nanalo s'ya sa lotto ng 50 milyong piso. there is a story that once there was a grandmother who had no idea that she won 50 million pesos in the lotto. <6> Ang problema ng kanyang mga kasambahay ay kung paano nila ito sasabihin sa kanya sa kadahilanang may sakit siya sa puso at matanda na! the problem of her housemates was how to tell her because she has a heart ailment and is already old! <7> Naisip nilang imbitahan ang kanilang kura-paroko dahil kaibigang matalik ito ng kanilang lola at isa pa ay matagal din siyang naglintgkod sa simbahan bilang isang Legion of Mary. they thought of inviting their parish priest because he was a close friend of their grandmother and another thing was she has been serving in church as a Legion of Mary for a long time. <8> Hiniling nila sa pari na s'ya na ang magbalita sa kanilang lola sa maingat na paraan na hindi niya ikabibigla. they requested the priest to break the news to their grandmother in a careful manner that will not shock her. <9> Sumangayon naman ang pari at isang gabi ay dumalaw ang pari sa bahay at kinausap ang matanda: "Lola, kamusta na ang lagay ninyo?" the priest agreed and one night he came to their house and spoke to the elder: "grandma, how are you?" <10> Sagot ng matanda: "Mabuti naman po padre..." the elder answered: "I am well, father..." <11> At nagkuwentuhan sila ng matagal. and they chatted for a long time. <12> Nang mapansin ng pari na nalilibang na at relax na ang matanda ay tinanong niya ito: "Lola, kung sakaling manalo kayo ng Php 50 million sa lotto... when the priest noticed that the elder was entertained and relaxed, he asked her: "grandmother, in case you would win 50 million pesos in the lottery ... <13> anung gagawin ninyo sa pera?" what would you do with the money?" <14> "Aba padre," sabi ni lola, "kung ako ang mananalo ng 50 million sa lotto ay ibibigay ko ang kalahati sa Simbahan." "well, father," said the grandmother, "if I would win 50 million pesos in the lotto I would give half to the church." <15> Nang marinig ito ng pari ay inatake siya sa puso at namatay! hehehe... when the priest heard this, he had a heart attack and died! hehehe ... <16> Sino nga ba ang di hihimatayin sa gayong kalaking kayamanan? who would not faint with wealth that is this great? <17> Wala naman sigurong taong matino ang pag-iisip ang ayaw yumaman. possibly, no person in his right mind would not want to get rich. <18> Dati rati ang kayamanan, hinuhukay, sinisisid, nilalakbay ng malayo. long ago, wealth was dug up, dived for, and traveled far for. <19> Ngayon siguro mas madali, tumaya ka lang sa lotto o kaya naman ay sumali sa mga contests na may malaking cash price at instant yaman ka na! today might be easier. you just have to make a bet in the lotto or join contests with a big cash prize and you will instantly become rich! <20> Ang talinhaga ng nakatagong kayamanan at mamahaling perlas ay nagsasabi sa atin na dapat ay handa nating isakripisyo ang lahat mapasaatin lamang ang kayamanang nais nating makamtan. the paradox of hidden wealth and expensive pearls tells us that we should be ready to sacrifice everything just to obtain the treasure that we want to get. <21> Hinalintulad ito ni Jesus sa "Kaharian ng Diyos." Jesus compares this to the "Kingdom of God". <22> Kung kaya nating magsakripisyo para sa kayamanang makamundo na nabubulok at nasisira ay dapat gayun din sa mga bagay na espirituwal. if we can sacrifice for riches that are worldly, which would rot and break, this should also be the case for spiritual things. <23> Ang "kaharian ng Diyos" ay ang pagharian tayo ng Kanyang biyaya at mabuhay bilang mga tapat niyang anak. the "kingdom of God" is for us to be ruled by his blessings and to live as his faithful children. <24> Dapat ay matuto tayong magpahalaga sa mga bagay na dapat unahin sa ating buhay. we should learn to value the things that we should prioritize in our life. <25> Kapag ang pagsisimba ay ipinagpapalit mo sa mga lakad mo sa araw ng Linggo ay hindi ka pa handang pagharian N'ya. if you are trading going to church on Sundays for your errands then you are not yet ready to be ruled by him. <26> Kapag sinasabi mong wala akong oras magdasal o gumawa ng mabuti sa iba ay hindi mo pinahahalagahan ang Kaharian ng Diyos sa iyong buhay. if you are saying I have no time to pray or to do something good for others then you are not giving importance to the kingdom of God in your life. <27> Kapag mas mahalaga sa iyo ang mga bagay na materyal kaysa ispirituwal, kapag labis mong pinagtutuunan ng pansin ang iyong katawan at napababayaan mo ang iyong kaluluwa ay malayo ka pa sa paghahanap sa tunay na kayamanan. if material things instead of spiritual ones are more important to you, when you give too much attention to your body and ignore your soul, then you are still far from looking for true wealth. <28> Ano ba ang tinuturing mong kayamanan ngayon sa buhay mo? what do you consider as wealth in your life right now? <29> Ngayong Taon ng mga Layko ay piliin natin ang maging matapang sa mga pagpapahalaga sa ating buhay. in this year of the laity, let us choose to be brave in giving importance to our life. <30> Marahil ay dapat nating unahin ang tamang pagapapahalaga sa ating sarili lalong lalo na sa ating dignidad bilang mga tao. maybe we should prioritize the right way of appreciating ourselves, especially our dignity as persons. <31> Isunod natin ang pagpapahalaga sa ating pamilya. let us next give importance to our family. <32> Hindi natin pinili ang ating pamilya. we did not choose our family. <33> Ito ay regalo ng Diyos sa atin kaya't dapat nating itaguyod ito at mahalin. this is a gift from God to us, which is why we need to uphold and love it. <34> At siyempre, ang pinamakamataas na pagpapahalaga ay ang sa Diyos na nagbigay sa atin ng ating buhay. and of course, the highest appreciation is towards God, who gave us our life. <35> Bigyan natin ng importansya ang ating buhay espirituwal at isabuhay ang ating pananampalataya. let us give importance to our spiritual life and practice our faith. <36> Kaya't kung pagninilayan lamang natin ng mabuti ay makikita natin na may tunay tayong mga kayamanan na dapat nating pinahahalagahan. so if we would only reflect well, we would see that we have real riches that we should value. <37> Piliin natin ang higit na mahalaga sa ating buhay Tandaan mo na kung nasaaan ang kayamanan mo... naroroon ang iyong puso. let us choose what is most important in our life. remember that wherever your wealth is ... that is where your heart is.

lady of Vhong Kim Domingo was not portrayed sexily in the film, but because her chest is overflowing the sexiness of the Kapuso star appears voluntarily. <13> Laging nauudlot ang kanilang kissing scenes, pero may eksenang ginapang at pinatungan ni Kim si Vhong habang natutulog ito. their kissing scenes are always halted, but there is a scene where Kim crawled on and topped Vhong while he was sleeping. <14> Hindi mo lalagyan ng malisya ang eksenang ‘yon dahil ‘may sapi’ si Kim at biglang nagbabago ang anyo nito habang nakapatong kay Vhong. you will not place malice on that scene because Kim is 'possessed' and her appearance suddenly changes while she is on top of Vhong. <15> Pambata at pampa­milya ang pelikula kaya hindi ka malalaswaan sa pagkubabaw ni Kim kay Mang Keps. the film is for children and families so you will not feel indecent about Kim topping Mang Keps. <16> Birthday wish ni Vhong na sana ay kumita ang pelikula niya, na mukhang ibinigay naman sa kanya. Vhong's birthday wish is for his movie to earn, which seems like it will be given to him. <17> In fairness sa masipag at mabait na alaga ni D­irek Chito Roño, ang ganda ng pasok ng kanyang 2017 dahil ang dinig namin ay may sequel kaagad ang Mang Kepweng Returns. in fairness the ward of Director Chito Roño is hardworking and kind, 2017 welcomed him beautifully because we heard Mang Kepweng returns already has a sequel. <18> Ang sabi ng producer nito na Cineko Productions, The Adventures of Mang Kepweng ang pamagat ng susunod na installment ng mo­vie remake. the producer of Cineko Productions said, The Adventures of Mang Kepweng is the title of the next installment of the movie remake.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_78509183 <1> Sabado, Mayo 9, 2015 Saturday, May 9, 2015 <2> MAY FOREVER!: Reflection for 6th Sunday of Easter Year B - May 10, 2015 - YEAR OF THE POOR there is forever!: reflection for 6th Sunday of Easter year b - May 10, 2015 - year of the poor <3> Naniniwala ka bang "walang forever?" do you believe that "there is no forever"? <4> Kung isa ka sa mga miyembro ng W.F.T. (Wala Talagang Forever) ay isa ka sa mga taong "bitter"... kasimpait ng ampalaya ang iyong buhay! if you are a member of W.F.T. (there really is no forever) then you are on of those "bitter" people your life is as bitter as bitter melon! <5> Ipinagpalit lang ng boyfriend sa iba wala na agad forever... bitter ka lang te! only because his boyfriend replaced her with another there is no forever already you are only bitter sister! <6> Sa halip na maging bitter dapat siguro mas maging "better" ang ating pagtingin sa buhay... may forever! instead of being bitter maybe our view in life should become more "better" there is forever! <7> Lalo na sa ating mga Kristiyano ay dapat maniwala tayong MAY FOREVER! more so on us Christians we should believe there is forever! <8> May forever sapagkat ang ating Diyos ay PAG-IBIG tulad ng sabi ni San Juan sa kanyang unang sulat at ang Kanyang pagmamahal sa atin ay... FOREVER! there is forever because our god is love like what saint john said in his first writing and his love for us is forever! <9> Ito rin ang binigyang diin ni Jesus nang sinabi niyang "Kung paanong iniibig ako ng Ama, gayon din naman, iniibig ko kayo, manatili kayo sa aking pag-ibig!" this is also what Jesus emphasized when he said "the way my father loves me, I also love you, remain in my love! <10> Manatili magpakailanman, magpasawalanghanggan... FOREVER! remain forever, never ending forever! <11> Ano ang katangian ng pag-ibig na ito? what is the attribute of this love? <12> Ang unang katangian ng pag-ibig ay ang kakayahang magsakripisyo alang-alang sa kapakanan ng iba. the first attribute of love is the capability to sacrifice for the sake of the welfare of others. <13> "Walang pag-ibig na hihigit pa sa pag-ibig ng isang taong nag-aalay ng kanyang buhay para sa kanyang mga kaibigan." "there is no love that can surpass the love of one person who offers his life for his friend." <14> May isang lugar sa Chicago na ang tawag ay Oliver Milton's Park. there is one place in Chicago that is called Oliver Milton's park. <15> Ito ay ipinangalan sa isang sundalo na dinapaan ang isang granada upang mailigtas ang kanyang mga kasama sa tiyak na kamatayan. this was named after one soldier who knelt on a grenade to save his companions from death. <16> Ang tunay na nagmamahal ay inuuna ang kapakanan ng iba bago ang sarili. a person who truly loves puts the welfare of others first before his. <17> Nangangahulugan ito ng pagbibigay ng sariling oras, kakayahan, karunungan, at kahit kayamanan sa mga taong nangangailangan. this means giving of own time, abilities, knowledge, and even wealth to the needy people. <18> Wala sa diksiyonaryo ng taong nagmamahal ang katagang: "Wala akong pakialam!" "I don't care!" are words not in the dictionary of a person who loves. <19> Ang ikalawang katangian ng pag-ibig ay ang kakayahang magmahal sa lahat na walang itinatangi. the second attribute of love is the capability to love all without favoritism. <20> May kuwento ng isang sundalong sumulat sa kanyang mga magulang na uuwi na siya at may dadalhin siyang isang kaibigang sundalo na makikitira sa kanilang bahay. there is a story of one soldier who wrote to his parents that he is coming home and will bring one soldier friend who will live in their house. <21> Ipinaliwanag niya na ang sundalo ay walang dalawang paa sapagkat nasabugan ito ng landmine sa kasagsagan ng giyera. he explained that the soldier does not have two feet because it was bombed by a landmine in the heat of the war. <22> Ayaw pumayag ng mga magulang at sinabing wag na lang sapagkat magiging pabigat lamang ang taong ito sa kanila. the parents won't allow it and said not to because the person will only become a burden to them. <23> Iyon na ang huling pag-uusap nila. that was their last conversation. <24> Paglipas ng ilang taon nagkita muli sila sa isang morgue nang mabalitaan nilang namatay ang kanilang anak sa isang aksidente at gayun na lamang ang pagkagulat nila ng makitang ang kanilang anak ay walang dalawang paa. as years passed they met again in a morgue when they heard the news that their child died in an accident and they were utterly surprised when they saw that their child had no two feet. <25> Ang pagmamahal na walang itinatangi ay nangangahulugan ng pagtanggap sa ating kapwa ng walang kundisyon. a love that has no favoritism means acceptance of our fellowman without condition. <26> Katulad ito ng ipinakita ni Jesus ng nag-alay siya ng kanyang buhay para sa atin lalo na sa ating mga makasalanan. this is like what Jesus showed when he offered his life for us especially for us sinners. <27> Hindi Niya tiningnan ang ating depekto o pagkukulang, maging ang kapangitan bilang tao dala ng ating patuloy na pagkakasala. he did not look at our defect or shortcoming, even our ugliness as people brought by our continuous sinning. <28> Ang kaligtasang ibinigay sa atin ni Jesus sa pamamagitan ng pag-aalay ng kanyang buhay ay para sa lahat ng tao: ano man ang relihiyon, lahi, kultura, kasarian, pag-uugali niyang taglay. the redemption given to us by Jesus by offering his life is for all people: whatever religion, race, culture, gender, custom he possesses. <29> Dapat ang ating pagmamahal ay gayun din. our love should also be like that. <30> Kalimitan, kinasusuklaman natin ang ating kaaway at malambing lamang tayo sa ating mga kaibigan. oftentimes, we loath our enemies and we are affectionate only to our friends. <31> Ngunit hindi ito ang gawi ng Panginoon. but this is not the way of the lord. <32> Ang Panginoon ay nagpakita ng habag at pagmamahal sa mga taong hindi kaibig-ibig, sa mga taong makasalanan. the lord showed compassion and love for people who are unlovable, and people who are sinners. <33> Sana tayo rin ay kayang maghanap sa mga taong hindi nabibigyang pansin, sa mga kapus-palad, sa mga naliligaw ng landas, sa mga kapos sa pagmamahal. we also hope that we can find people who are not given attention, the less fortunate, those who strayed from the path, those lacking in love. <34> Ito pa rin ang mensaheng nais niyang iparating sa atin: "Mag-ibigan kayo tulad ng pag-ibig na ipinakita ko sa inyo!" isang pag-ibig na hindi makasarili, isang pag-ibig na nakatuon sa lahat, isang pag-ibig na handang mag-alay ng kanyang sarili para sa kanyang kaibigan. this is still the message that he wishes to deliver to us: "love each other like the love I showed you!" one love that is not selfish, one love that if focused on everyone, one love that is ready to offer itself for his friend. <35> Ito ang pag-ibig na ipinamalas ng Diyos sa atin at nais niyang ipakita at iparamdam natin sa iba... this is the love shown by god to us and he wishes for us show it and make it be felt by others. <36> isang pag-ibig na nagsasabing may FOREVER! one love that says there is forever!

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_56948139 <1> Bagong tax bill, kasado rin By Arie­s Cano July 2, 2016 Naghain ng bago at pinabisang income tax measure si Marikina Rep. Miro Quimbo. new tax bill, ready as well by Aries Cano July 2, 2016 Marikina representative Miro Quimbo proposed a new and improved income tax measure. <2> Sa ilalim ng inihain nitong House Bill 20 ay inaasahang mabibigyan ng adjustment indivi­dual income tax brackets alinsunod sa inflation at mababawasan ng pasa­ning buwis ang mahigit anim na milyong manggagawang Pinoy. under his proposal House Bill 20 more than six million Filipino workers are expected to be given individual income tax brackets adjustments according to inflation and lowering of tax burdens. <3> Sa kabila ng kabiguang maaprubahan sa naka­raang Kongreso ang panukalang magpapababa sa sinisingil na buwis sa ordinaryong manggagawa sanhi ng pagsalungat ng Department of Finance (DOF) ay mas determinado si Quimbo na isulong ang reporma sa kasalukuyang income tax system. despite the previous congress failing to approve the proposal to lower the tax charged to ordinary workers due to the opposition of the Department of Finance (DOF) Quimbo is more determined to push for the reform of the current income tax system. <4> Ang inihain nitong panukala ay mas simple, episyente at equitable tax system lalo na’t nagpahayag ng kahandaan ang Duterte administration sa pagtataguyod ng panukala alinsunod na rin sa 10-point econo­mic agenda nito. the proposal he submitted is simpler, efficient and an equitable tax system especially now that the Duterte administration has expressed support for the proposal in accordance with its 10-point economic agenda too.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_64720138 <1> Hapagkainan dining table <2> ni Emmanuel Jerome Tagaro by Emmanuel Jerome Tagaro <3> Dati ko nang ugali ang maging mapagmasid sa daan, lalong-lalo na tuwing pupunta sa mga kainan. Laging may dalang ligaya ang dala sa akin ng pagmamasid tuwing napapansin ko ang bawat galaw ng mga nasa paligid ko. Para sa akin, isa itong pagtakas mula sa araw-araw kong pagkasuya sa buhay. it has long been my habit to observe on the road, most especially when I go to eateries. observing always brings me joy when I notice each move of those around me. for me, it is an escape from my everyday boredom in life. <4> Ngayon, nakaupo na naman ako sa isang kainan, at pansin na pansin ko ang bawat pitik ng mga kamay sa kabilang mesa, ‘yung pa-simpleng sulyap ng lalaki sa kasama niya sa tuwing nakatingin ito sa malayo, o kahit ‘yung gusot sa damit ng babaeng nasa dulong mesa. today, I am seated at a restaurant again, and I really notice each flick of the hand in the opposite table, the simple glances of the man to his companion every time he looks in the distance, or even the creases in the dress of the woman in the farthest table. <5> Kakilala ko man o hindi ang mga customer sa kahit saan na kainan, laging may mga natatanging tauhan sa mumunting espasyong ito. whether I personally know or not the customers wherever I eat, there are always notable characters in these small spaces. <6> Security guard security guard <7> Unang-una na bubungad pagpasok pa lamang sa isang kainan ang bruskong security guard. Madalas siyang mag-isa, minsan nagmamasid-masid sa paligid o babati ng “Welcome po!” Baton lamang ang hawak niya at isang baril na walang lamang bala. Maaaring ito lamang ang kailangan sa mga kainan, dahil kapag may dumating na mga masasamang loob, madali lang namang humingi ng tulong. Sana lang hindi sila ganoon kadami para hindi siya mabuyo bago dumating ang back-up niya. the very first to welcome you upon entering a restaurant is the muscly security guard. he is often alone, sometimes observing the place or greeting "welcome po!" he holds a baton and a gun without bullets. they may be the only ones needed in restaurants, because if some evildoers arrive, it is easy to ask for help. hopefully they won't be that many so that he will not be plowed before his backup arrives. <8> Crew crew <9> Susunod na sasalubong ang masisipag na crew. Lagi silang may ngiti sa mukha, handang-handa nang kunin ang order ng mga customer. next to welcome you are the hardworking crew. they always have smiles on the face, ready to get the order of customers. <10> Madalas man silang contractual at mababa ang sahod, patuloy silang kumakayod upang mayroong maipakain sa pamilya. they may be often contractual and with low pay, but they continue to work hard to have something to feed their family. <11> Chef chef <12> Lagi man siyang natatago at ’di man siya nakikita madalas, ang taga-luto pa rin ang susunod na magbibigay serbisyo. he may always be hidden and not always seen, it is still the cook who next offers service. <13> Buong araw siyang nagluluto ng pagkaing hindi niya naman nakakain, at nakaharap sa kusinang hindi niya naman pag-aari. he cooks food he cannot eat the whole day, and facing the kitchen he does not own. <14> Hindi ko rin alam kung nakakain na ba siya, o kung kaya niya man lang bilhin ang niluluto niya, pero siya ang gumagawa noon para sa mga customer at para sa pamilya niya. I also do not know if he has eaten, or if he can even afford what he cooks, but he is the one who makes it for the customer and for his family too. <15> Dapat siyang pasalamatan. he should be thanked. <16> Manager manager <17> Napakaraming manager na ang nagdaan sa itinagal ng kainan, at bawat isa sa kanila ay magkakaiba ng palakad. for the long run of the restaurant it has undergone so many managers, and each one of them has a different style. <18> Mayroong mga tutulog-tulog, mahigpit sa oras, o tutok sa trabaho, pero may isang katangian ang hawak ng karamihan sa kanila — at ‘yun ay unahin ang interes ng kainan, na tiyaking marami pa rin ang kita, higit pa sa kapakanan ng mga customer. there are the sleepy ones, strict with time, or focused on work, but many of them possess one characteristic - and that is putting the interest of the restaurant first, ensuring that the revenue is still high, more than the welfare of the customers. <19> Customer customer <20> Walang nakakaalam kung magiging sino at ano ang bawat customer na lalabas sa kainan, pero nasa pangangalaga sila ngayon ng kainan. no one knows who and what each customer that will come out of the restaurant be, but they are now in the care of the restaurant. <21> Binabayaran man ng bawat customer ang pagkain nila, nananatiling may maliit na kalayaan sa loob ng kainan. each customer may pay for their food, but they continue to have little freedom inside the restaurant. <22> Dapat laging may pagkilala na ang bawat isang butil ng bigas na inihahain ay pawis at dugo ng mga taong nagtatrabaho rito. there should be acknowledgement that each grain of rice served is the sweat and blood of the people working here. <23> Madalas napapangiti na lang ako sa tuwing nahuhuli ko ang sarili kong pinag-iisipan ito sa bawat kainang nasusubukan ko. often I end up smiling when I catch myself thinking about this in each restaurant I try. <24> Ngunit siguro ay maigi lamang na maibahagi ko sa mga makababasa nito na ang lahat ng ito ay sumasalamin sa mas masalimuot pang negosyo sa lipunan. but maybe it is just better for me to share to those reading that all of this reflects the complicated business of society.

gustong sabihin kahit na masamain ng iba o kahit na magbu-boomerang sa kanya pagkatapos. saying what he wants to say even if others disapprove or if it would boomerang to him afterwards. <4> Wala siyang pakialam! he does not care! <5> Ito ‘yung Pangulong Duterte ang nagsasalita kamakalawa na umaamin na sa limang sinabi niya ay dalawa lang ang tama at dapat seryosohin o paniwalaan ng tao. this was the president Duterte who spoke the day before yesterday who admitted that in the five things he states only two are true and should be taken seriously or believed by people. <6> Dahil ‘yung tatlo, panay kalokohan ‘yun o biro lang. because the other three are purely nonsense or only jokes. <7> Gusto lang daw niya magpatawa. he just wanted to be funny. <8> Kaya naman hindi nakakapagtaka na sa kada bitaw ng salita ng Pangulo ay palagi­ na lang natataranta ang kanyang mga galamay, lalo na ang communications group ng Malacañang, kung paano ito ipapaliwanag sa tao. which is why it is no wonder why every time a word is said by the president, his staff gets flustered, especially the communications group of Malacañang, on how they would explain it to the people. <9> Alin ba ang totoo at alin ang joke sa sinabi ng Pangulo? which ones are the truth and which ones are the joke in the statements of the president? <10> Napakahirap nito para sa bansa. this is hard for the country. <11> he faces the public. <12> Inaabangan ang bawat salita niya hindi para tumawa kundi­ para pakinggan kung ano ang ipag-uutos niya, kung paano niya reresolbahin ang isang problema, kung ano ang posisyon ng Pilipinas sa ganitong isyu. his every word is looked forward to not to find laughs but to listen to what his commands are, how he would resolve a problem, what position will the Philippines take on an issue. <13> Ang bawat buga o binibitawang salita ng isang Presidente ay dapat lamang na seryosohin dahil siya ang polisiya ng isang bansa. every blow or released word of a president should be taken seriously because these are the policies of a country. <14> Ang bawat salita niya, parang batas na sinusunod, lalo na ng kanyang mga tapat na tagasunod. his every word, like a law being followed, specially by his loyal supporters. <15> Pwede namang maging komikero at magpatawa pero hindi sa mga seryosong usapin. it is allowed to be comedic and funny but not on serious topics. <16> Lalo na kung may kinalaman sa relasyon sa ibang bansa o kaya ay tungkol sa extrajudicial killings, peace process at peace and order situation, drug personalities, bad cops, inflation, tax at kung anu-ano pa. especially if it involves the relationship to other country or about the extrajudicial killings, peace process and peace and order situation, drug personalities, bad cops, inflation, tax and many more. <17> Kahit ang mga campaign promises mukhang mas marami ang ‘joke’ lang. even campaign promises have what look like 'joke' only. <18> Tulad na lang nitong ‘endo’ na hanggang ngayon ay salita lang at ang naibigay sa mga contractual na government employees ay P2,000 bonus imbes na regularization. take for example the 'endo' which until now is just spoken word and what was given to contractual government employees is a P2,000 bonus instead of regularization. <19> Wala pa ring balita sa coco levy na agad daw niyang ipapamigay sa mga magniniyog pagkaupo. there is no news on coco levy which he said he would immediately give away to coconut farmers upon getting seated. <20> Mukhang joke pa rin ang dagdag na P1,000 sa senior citizens dahil may ilang matatanda ang nagrereklamo na
