Dequina <3> SABLAYAN, Occidental Mindoro, Peb 16 (PIA)—Sumailalaim sa Agricultral Technology Training (ATT) ang 120 mga magsasaka mula sa apat na barangay ng bayan ng Sablayan kamakailan. Sablayan, Occidental Mindoro, February 16 (PIA) - 120 farmers from four barangays of Sablayan recently underwent the Agricultural Technology Training (ATT). <4> Ang mga dumalo, na nagmula sa barangay Ibud, Sto. Niño, San Francisco at San Vicente, ay tinuruan ng makabagong teknolohiya at paraan ng pagsasaka, kabilang ang rice at corn production, animal livestock at poultry pati na rin sa pangisdaan. the attendees from Barangay Ibud, Sto. Niño, San Francisco and San Vicente, were taught modern technology and methods of farming, including rice and corn production, animal livestock and poultry as well as fishery. <5> Ayon kay Sofronio Baranda, Assistant Provincial Agriculturist (APA), pinangunahan ng mga magaaral mula sa Occidental Mindoro State College (OMSC) ang naturang pagsasanay. according to Sofronio Baranda, Assistant Provincial Agriculturist (APA), students from the Occidental Mindoro State College (OMSC) led the training. <6> “Mga magsisipagtapos ng kursong Bachelor of Agricultural Technology ang mga batang ito, at may kakayahan na magturo sa ating mga magsasaka”, paliwanag ni Baranda. "these students are graduating from Bachelor of Agricultural Technology course and they have the ability to teach our farmers," explained Baranda. <7> Hindi lamang nagbigay ng kapakinabanag ang programang ATT sa mga dumalong magsasaka, nakakuha rin ng karanasan sa pagtuturo ang mga maaaral. the ATT program was not only useful to the farmers who attended, but also to the students who gained a teaching experience. <8> (VND/LBR/PIA 4B/Occ Min) (VND/LBR/PIA 4B/Occ Min)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_79970414 <1> Ang pagtuloy na trahedya sa mga biktima ni Yolanda at ng gobyerno by Pher Pasion November 7, 2014 Isang araw bago ang komemorasyon sa malagim na paghagupit ng bagyong Yolanda, kasamang nagmartsa ng mga progresibong grupo patungong Mendiola ang ilang biktima. the ongoing tragedy of the victims of Yolanda and the government by Pher Pasion November 7, 2014 one day before the commemoration of the grim assault of typhoon Yolanda, progressive groups marched to Mendiola together with some victims. <2> Bakas pa rin sa kanila ang hinagpis, panghihinayang at galit dahil sa kapabayaan ng gobyerno. there are traces of grief, regret and anger in them caused by the government's neglect. <3> Isang taon matapos ang trahedya, nasa mga mata pa rin ni Mabini Cajes, 38, mula Salvacion, Samar ang mga alaala ng bagyong Yolanda. one year after the tragedy, the memories of typhoon Yolanda remain on the sight of Mabini Cajes, 38, from Salvacion, Samar. <4> Patuloy din na mananatili sa kanyang puso ang kaniyang asawa at dalawang anak na nasawi sa pananalasa ng bagyo his wife and two children who passed away in the typhoon's assault will also remain in his heart. <5> Isa si Cajes sa daan-daang nagtungo sa Mendiola sa Maynila sa sa bisperas ng anibersaryo ng pananalasa ng bagyong Yolanda para iparating sa gobyerno ang patuloy na kapabayaan sa kanila. Cajes is one of the hundreds who went to Mendiola in Manila on the eve of the anniversary of the destruction of typhoon Yolanda to convey to the government its continuing neglect of them. <6> Isang magsasakang walang sariling lupa si Cajes at itinataguyod ang kanilang pamilya na may limang anak. Cajes is a farmer without his own land and supports his family with five children. <7> Dahil kulang na kulang ang P100 na kinikita sa pagsasaka, umaasa sa utang si Cajes at nakikipangisda din. because the P100 he earns from farming is really not enough, Cajes relies on loans and goes fishing too. <8> Kung minsan, nakiki-ekstra sa construction bilang pandagdag sa gastusin. sometimes, he works part-time in construction to add to his budget. <9> Sa kanyang kuwento sa Pinoy Weekly, nauna niyang natagpuan ang bunso at asawa na kapwa niya inilibing. he tells Pinoy Weekly, he saw his youngest child and wife first which he both buried. <10> Inabot naman ng limang araw bago niya makita ang panganay na anak na natabunan ng mga kahoy. it took five days before he saw his oldest child who got buried by wooden debris. <11> Lumobo ang katawan at nangangamoy na. the body swelled and was already smelling foul. <12> Dinala muna niya ang panganay sa simbahan para mabendisyunan bago agad na inilibing kahit pa namamaga ang sarili niyang mga paa. he brought his eldest child to the church first to be blessed before immediately burying him even if his own feet were swelling. <13> “Kinabukasan pagkalibing ko sa mag-ina ko. "the next day after I buried my wife and child. <14> Sabado yata yun. it was probably Saturday. <15> Nakakita ako ng tali, pumanhik ako sa second floor ng bahay, nasa isip ko kitilin ko ang buhay ko. I saw a rope, climbed to the second floor of the house, I was thinking of taking my own life. <16> Hindi ko kayang tanggapin na tatlo ang nawala sa akin,” ayon kay Cajes. I couldn't accept that three were taken from me," according to Cajes. <17> Nailigtas siya ng dalawa niyang pinsan sa tangkang pagpapakamatay dahil binantayan sa payo ng isang kaibigan dahil kakaiba na raw ang kinikilos nito. he was saved from his suicide attempt by his two cousins who were on guard due to the advice of a friend because he was acting differently. <18> Tinagka niya uling magpakamatay, sa pagkakataong iyon, pag-inom naman ng sobrang gamot para ma-overdose siya. he attempted suicide again, and that time, drinking too much medicine so he will overdose. <19> Pero hindi ito tumalab. but it did not work. <20> Kwento ng trahedya Ayon kay Cajes, lumikas sila sa bahay ng kaniyang tiyuhin bago ang bagyo dahil tiyak na hindi kakayanin ng kanilang tinirhan dahil sa gawa lamang ito sa light materials. story of tragedy according to Cajes, they evacuated to the house of his uncle before the typhoon because their house will surely not stand it because it was just made of light materials. <21> Pero maging ang konkretong bahay ng kaniyang tiyuhin hindi kinaya ang bagyo. but even the concrete house of his uncle did not withstand the typhoon. <22> “Inangat ko sa kisame ang pamilya ko dahil mabilis na pumasok ang tubig. "I carried my family to the ceiling because water was rushing in fast. <23> Nang lalong tumaas ang tubig, pinilit kong baklasin ang yero. when the water further rose, I tried to dismantle the roof. <24> Pinagsisipa ko. I repeatedly kicked it. <25> Pero parang papel lamang nang liparin na nang hangin,” aniya. but it was just like paper when the wind blew it away," he said. <26> Dahil sa sobrang lakas ng hangin, pinili na lamang niyang manatili silang nakakapit sa kisame dahil maaaring tangayin ang mga bata sa lakas ng hangin. because of the very strong wind, he chose for them to remain hanging on to the ceiling because the children can be blown away by the strong wind. <27> “Sabi ko dito na lang tayo sa loob ng kisame, bahala na kung anong mangyari sa atin basta wag lang tayong magkakahiwalay. "I told them let us just stay here inside the ceiling, come what may as long as we do not get separated. <28> Kinuha ko yung bunso ko sa asawa ko para wala na siyang iisipin kundi iligtas ang sarili nya,” sa pagpapatuloy ng kuwento ni Cajes. I grabbed my youngest child from my wife so she has nothing to think about but saving herself," Cajes continued his story. <29> Dagdag niya, nang dumating ang mga malalakas ng alon, nawasak ang mga pader ng bahay ng tiyuhin niya. he added, when the strong waves arrived, the walls of his uncle's house were destroyed. <30> Matapos magiba ang pader, nawala sa paningin niya ang kanyang asawa at dalawang anak. after the wall collapsed, he lost sight of his wife and two children. <31> Napako naman ang paa niya at ang isa naman ay nadaganan ng mga kahoy habang pilit na kumakapit sa kanya ang isang anak na hindi marunong lumangoy. one of his feet was nailed down and the other was buried by wood while his child who does not know how to swim continues to hold on to him. <32> “Kahit na alam kong nakabaluktot ang pako, pinilit kong tanggalin dahil kung hindi, hindi kami makakaalis doon malulunod kami. "even if I knew the nail was bent, I tried to remove it because if I don't, we cannot escape there we will drown. <33> Pagkatanggal ko sa paa ko, ‘tsaka naman ako tinamaan ng kahoy sa ulo at nawalan ako ng malay. when I released my foot, that's when I was hit on the head by wood and lost consciousness. <34> Nabitawan ko ang bunso ko,” ayon kay Cajes. I lost hold of my youngest child," said Cajes. <35> Nagkaroon lamang siya uli ng malay nang gisingin ng anak. he gained consciousness again when his child woke him up. <36> Tinangay sila ng tubig sa isang puno ng suha kung saan naroon ang kaniyang tiyuhin. they were carried away by the water to a pomelo tree where his uncle was. <37> Doon niya inilagay ang kaniyang mga anak. he placed his children there. <38> Iniabot ang kaniyang walang malay na panganay sa tiyuhin. he handed his unconscious eldest child to his uncle. <39> Pero muli silang hinambalos ng malakas na alon. but they were struck by strong waves again. <40> Nawala na nang tuluyan ang kaniyang panganay. his eldest child was lost for good. <41> Sa isang puno ng mangga sila nagkita-kita ng tatlo pa niyang mga anak at doon sila nanatili hanggang humupa ang bagyo at tubig. he and his three other children met up at a mango tree and stayed there until the typhoon and water subsided. <42> “Doon, wala na akong pag-asa na makita ko pa ang tatlo kong mahal sa buhay. "there, I no longer had hope of seeing my three other loves of my life. <43> Iyak na lang ako nang iyak,” sabi niya. I just cried and cried," he said. <44> Tanging ang tato niyang anak na natitira ang nagbibigay sa kanya ng lakas ng loob para magpatuloy. only his three remaining children give him the strength to move on. <45> Wala pang tulong ang gobyerno no assistance from the government yet <46> Ang hinanakit ni Cajes,mag-iisang taon na pero wala pa rin silang natatanggap na tulong mula sa Department of Social Work and Development (DSWD). Cajes resents, it has been almost a year but they still have not received any assistance from the Department of Social Work and Development (DSWD). <47> Miyembro ang namayapang asawa ni Cajes sa Pantawid Pamilyang Pilipino Program (4P’s) ng administrasyong Aquino. the deceased wife of Cajes is a member of the Pantawid Pamilyang Pilipino Program (4P's) of the Aquino administration. <48> Pero pinahihirapan daw siya ng nasabing ahensya para mailipat sa kanya ang pagiging miyembro nito. but according to him the said agency is making it difficult for him to transfer her membership to him. <49> Sa kasalukuyan,para muling makabangon sa pananalasa ng bagyos, tinutulungan siya ng ACT Alliance, isang pribadong sektor, iginiit niyang wala siyang natatanggap na tulong mula sa gobyerno. currently, to be able to recover from the typhoon's assault, he is aided by the ACT Alliance, a private sector, he insists that he does not receive any aid from the government. <50> Kagaya din niya sina sina Miriam Rosario, 28, at Jesusa Hiponia, 33, na mula naman sa mula Estancia, Iloilo, na hinagupit din ng bagyong Yolanda. like him are Miriam Rosario, 28, and Jesusa Hiponia, 33, from Estancia, Iloilo, who were also affected by typhoon Yolanda. <51> Isang taon makalipas wala pa ring natatanggap na tulong ang mga kagaya nila mula sa gobyerno. one year has passed yet the likes of them have not received any aid from the government. <52> Sa kuwento ni Rosario, pagkatapos ng bagyo, nabuhay sila sa pag-ani ng kanilang mga tanim na kamote kahit hindi pa dapat anihin ang mga ito. Rosario shares, after the typhoon, they lived by harvesting their sweet potato crops even if they were not meant to be harvested yet. <53> Napilitan pa silang isaing ang basang bigas para lamang magkalaman ang mga sikmura. they were even forced to cook wet rice in order for their stomachs to be filled. <54> Ang malungkot. namalimos ang mga bata sa sa mga sasakyang nagsisidaan sa kalsada. what is sad, the children beg from the vehicles passing through the roads. <55> Ayon kay Rosario, hindi nila sapat na napaghandaan ang bagyo dahil hindi rin naman daw sapat ang impormasyon na kanilang nakuha. according to Rosario, they were not able to adequately prepare for the typhoon because the information they received was not enough too. <56> Kung sakali mang palikasin sila, wala umanong evacuation center na malapit sa kanilang lugar para puntahan. in case they were made to evacuate, there was no evacuation center close to their place that they can go to. <57> Isang buwan matapos ang bagyo bago dumating ang mga tulong mula sa pribadong sektor pero sabi niya hindi ito sumasapat sa kanilang lahat. aid from the private sector arrived one month after the typhoon but she said it is not enough for all of them. <58> Aniya, wala silang natatanggap na anumang cash assistance hanggang sa ngayon bukod sa ayuda mula sa food for work ng DSWD. according to her, they have not received any cash assistance up to now aside from the assistance from the DSWD's food for work. <59> Pero dahil sa malapit sa kabundukan ang tintirhan nina Rosario, isang buwan bago sila mabigyan ng gobyerno nang ayuda mula sa kanilang pinagtrabahuan na “food for work.” but because Rosario's residence is near the mountains, it takes one month before the government can give them assistance from the "food for work" they work for. <60> “Iyong food for work, kami ang pinagtrabaho para linisin ang lugar namin kami na itong mga biktima. "that food for work, we are ordered to clean up our own place when we are the ones who are victims. <61> Tapos pipila kami sa plaza pagkatapos noon para lamang kunin ang bigas, noodles at sardinas. then we will queue at the plaza after that just in order to get rice, noodles and sardines. <62> Yun ang masakit,” sabi ni Rosario. that is what hurts," said Rosario. <63> Dagdag pa niya, “Hanggang ngayon pinababayaan pa rin kami nga gobyerno doon. she even added, "up to now the government neglects us there. <64> Wala kaming natatanggap na cash assistance kahit sa lokal na gobyerno. we receive no cash assistance even from the local government. <65> Sa barangay namin wala kaming natatanggap.” we receive nothing from our barangay." <66> Kaya naman, masama ang loob ni Rosario nang mabalitaan niya ang pagkabulok ng mga relief goods sa kamay ng DSWD. so, Rosario felt bad when she heard about the relief goods rotting in the hands of the DSWD. <67> Gayundin, sa mga tulong na natatanggap ng gobyerno pero hindi nakakarating sa kanila. also, with the assistance the government receives but does not reach them. <68> “Malaking galit sa puso ko sa totoo lang. "honestly I have great anger in my heart. <69> Kasi doon sa Ilo-ilo sa Estancia napabayaan kami. because we in Estancia in Ilo-ilo have been neglected. <70> Hindi naman kami naiinggit sa Tacloban. we do not envy Tacloban. <71> Dapat lang din naman silang tulungan. they must be helped as well. <72> Pero huli na kaming napansin doon sa Ilo-ilo. but we are the last to be noticed there in Ilo-ilo. <73> Hindi pa tapos ang obligasyon nila (gobyerno) sa amin,” ayon kay Rosario. their (the government's) obligation on us is not over yet," said Rosario. <74> Samantalang malapit naman sa dagat nakatira si Hiponia. meanwhile Hiponia lives near the sea. <75> Sa dagat ang kanyang kabuhayan bago ang dumating bagyo. before the typhoon arrived her livelihood is from the sea. <76> sa kasagsagan ng bagyong Yolanda, nagkaroon daw ng oil spill sa kanilang lugar kaya sila inilikas. in the peak of typhoon Yolanda, there was supposedly an oil spill in their place so they were evacuated. <77> Ika-23 pa ng Nobyembre nang ilikas sila sa evacuation center. they were evacuated to an evacuation center on the 23rd of November. <78> at inabot pa ng dalawang lingo bago sila nakatanggap ng tent mula pa sa pribadong sektor. and it took two weeks before they were able to receive a tent from the private sector. <79> Ayon sa kanya, hindi na sila pinabalik sa dati nilang lugar mula noon. according to her, they were not asked to return to their former place since then. <80> “Hindi na kami tinulungan ng gobyerno, ginipit pa kami. "the government does not help us, then we are pressured too. <81> Hindi kami pinabalik sa lugar namin dahil maaari daw kaming magkasakit. we were not made to return to our place because supposedly we can get sick. <82> Pero nandun naman ang mga militar na walang suot na masks man lang. but the military are there without even wearing masks. <83> Kaya ‘yung iba hindi nagpatakot sa militar, binalikan ang kanilang kabuhayan sa aming lugar,” ayon kay Hiponia. so some did not fear the military, they returned to their livelihood in our place," said Hiponia. <84> Sa kasalukuyan, nasa bunk house pa rin nakatira sina Hiponia kasama ang kaniyang nag-iisang anak, at dahil sa oil spill, nabubuhay na lamang sila sa pagtitinda ng kaniyang pananim na gulay. currently, Hiponia still lives in a bunk house together with her only child, and because of the oil spill, they survive just by selling her vegetable crops. <85> Singkuwenta pesos lamang ang kita niya kada araw. she earns only fifty pesos per day. <86> “Mas yung anak ko na lang iniisip kong pakainin. "I prefer to think of feeding my child. <87> Gutom mo kaya mong tiisin pero hindi yung sa anak mo. you can endure your hunger but not your child's. <88> Kaya sinasabayan ko na lang tubig o kung may konti pang gulay mapagkasya lang,” aniya. so I accompany it with water or if there are still some vegetables in order to have enough," she said. <89> Masakit din sa loob ni Hiponia, nang sabihan sila ng isang empleyado sa kanilang munisipyo na puro na lamang sila pasanin at puro hingi ang mga nasa evacuation center. Hiponia also felt bad, when an employee in their municipal hall said that those in evacuation centers are all burdens and always freeloads. <90> “Sabi ko, kung humingi man kami karapatan lang namin yun. "I said, if we ask for assistance it is only our right to do so. <91> Hindi naman sa bulsa ninyo galing yan, sa LGU (local government unit) yan, anong karapatan na sabihan kami ng ganyan? it does not come from your pockets, but from the LGU (local government unit), so what is your right to tell us that? <92> Hindi naman namin ginusto na magkaroon ng ganitong bagyong Yolanda na ganito kalakas,” ayon kay Hiponia. we did not wish to have a typhoon like Yolanda that is this strong," said Hiponia. <93> Relief goods mula sa dayuhang kumpanya naman tanging naaalala ni Janine Dizor, 21, mula Magallanes (coastal area) sa Tacloban City. Janine Dizor, 21, from Magallanes (coastal area) of Tacloban City remembers only the relief goods from foreign companies. <94> Nakaligtas sila nang lumikas sa bahay ng kanilang tiyahin sa San Jose na may kataasan ang lugar. they survived by evacuating to their uncle's house in San Jose whose place was a bit elevated. <95> Sabi niya. she said. <96> hindi niya kailanman kinakitaan ng tulong ang gobyerno. she never did see any assistance from the government. <97> “Sa gobyerno? "from the government? <98> Hindi ko alam kung ano ang naibigay nila. I do not know what they have provided. <99> Parang wala namang remarkable na naitulong. seems like there was no remarkable assistance. <100> Wala nga kaming na-received na cash assistance o anuman lang,” sabi ni Dizor sa panayam ng Pinoy Weekly. we received no cash assistance or anything," Dizor said in an interview with Pinoy Weekly. <101> Ang tanging tulong na pagkain na natanggaap niya ay nang dumating sila dito sa Manila sakay ng C130 mula Samar. the only food assistance she received was when they arrived here in Manila aboard a C130 from Samar. <102> Kinailangan nilang magkapatid na maglakad mula Tacloban hanggang sa Sta. she and her sibling needed to walk from Tacloban up to Santa <103> Rita, Samar para puntahan ang kanilang mga magulang na nasa Hiporloas, Eastern Samar. Rita, Samar in order to go to their parents who are in Hiporloas, Eastern Samar. <104> Dagdag pa niya, sinikap nilang makapunta sa Guiuan, Samar para makasakay ng C130 dahil hindi na sila makabalik sa Tacloban dahil sa kumakalat na balitang magulo na raw ang lugar. she added, they tried to go to Guiuan, Samar to be able to ride a C130 because they could not return to Tacloban because of the news spreading that the place was already chaotic. <105> Aminado si Dizor na mas dismayado siya sa naging aksyon ng gobyerno sa pagresponde sa kanilang mga biktima matapos ang bagyo. Dizor admits that she is more dismayed by the government's actions in responding to victims after the typhoon. <106> “Disappointed (sa gobyerno) unang-una sila dapat ang unang rumesponde sa mga tao pero bakit puro NGOs (non-government organizations) ang nakikita?” ayon kay Dizor. "disappointed (with the government) they should first respond first of all to the people but why do we see NGOs (non-government organizations) only?" according to Dizor. <107> Pagbangon at paglaban Maraming mahihirap at masasakit na alaala ang iniwan ng bagyong Yolanda para sa mga biktima. recovery and fighting back typhoon Yolanda left many difficult and painful memories for its victims. <108> Pero nananatiling pa ring realidad at hindi alaala ang patuloy na pagpapabaya sa kanila ng gobyerno matapos ang isang taon. but the government's neglect on them remain a reality and not a memory after one year. <109> Para sa mga biktima, nanatili sa ang responsibilidad ng gobyerno sa kanila na hindi lamang kapos sa kagyat na pangangailangan gaya ng relief goods, pabahay, at kabuhayan. for the victims, the responsibility of the government on them remains and not just about a shortage of basic needs like relief goods, housing and livelihood. <110> Kapos din ang gobyerno na makatao silang harapin at tratuhin bilang mga biktima ng isa sa pinakamalakas na bagyo sa bansa. the government also lacks the humanity to face them and consider them victims of one of the strongest typhoons in the country. <111> Bukas, Nobyembre 8, dadaluyong sa Tacloban City ang libo-libong mga biktima para singilin ang gobyernong Aquino sa patuloy na kapabayaan nito sa mga nasalanta ng ga kalamidad. tomorrow, November 8, thousands of victims will surge to Tacloban City to demand payment from the Aquino government for their ongoing neglect of those affected by the calamity.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_49751847 <1> Programang pangkaunlaran ng OrMin, inaprubahan ng PDC OrMin development program, approved by PDC <2> November 13, 2016 November 13, 2016 <3> CALAPAN, Oriental Mindoro, Nob. 13 (PIA) – Apat na mahahalagang programang pangkaunlaran ng lalawigan ang inaprubahan kamakailan ng Provincial Development Council (PDC). Calapan, Oriental Mindoro, November 13 (PIA) - four important development programs of the province were recently approved by the Provincial Development Council (PDC). <4> Kabilang sa mga inaprubahan ay ang mga sumusunod: Disaster Risk Reduction/Climate Change Adaptation-Enhanced Provincial Development and Physical Framework Plan (DRR/CCA-PDPFP) 2016-2025; Provincial Development Investment Program (PDIP) 2017-2019; Annual Investment Program 2017; at ang Provincial Commodity Investment Plan for Calamansi and Coconut 2017-2019 ng Oriental Mindoro na nasa ilalim ng Philippine Rural Development Project (PRDP). among the approved are the following: disaster risk reduction/climate change adaptation - enhanced provincial development and physical framework plan (DRR/CCA-PDPFP) 2016-2025; provincial development investment program (PDIP) 2017-2019; annual investment program 2017; and the provincial commodity investment plan for calamondin and coconut 2017-2019 of Oriental Mindoro under the Philippine Rural Development Project (PRDP). <5> Ayon kay Gob. Alfonso V. Umali, Jr., ito ang kauna-unahang pagpupulong ng inireorganisang PDC base sa kaniyang nilagdaang Executive Order No. 80 series of 2016, na nagsasaad ng pagrereorganisa ng PDC at iba pang layuning may kaugnayan dito. according to Governor Alfonso V. Umali, Junior, this is the first meeting of the reorganized PDC based on his Executive Order No. 80 series of 2016, that states the reorganization of the PDC and its other related objectives. <6> Sa nabanggit na pagpupulong, iprinisenta ni OIC-Provincial Planning and Development Coordinator Lydia Muñeca S. Melgar ang DRR/CCA -PDPFP 2016-2025. at the said meeting, OIC - Provincial Planning and Development Coordinator, Lydia Muñeca S. Melgar presented the DRR/CCA -PDPFP 2016-2025. <7> Ito ay ang pinagsamang Physical Framework Plan at Provincial Development Plan na kinapapalooban ng long term vision ng lalawigan, mga tunguhing pangkaunlaran, istratehiya, layunin at target at mga programa at aktibidad na magsisilbing basehan ng paglalatag ng provincial investment, ang paglalaan ng pondo at ang implementasyon ng mga ito. this is the joint Physical Framework Plan and Provincial Development Plan which involves the long term vision of the province, development goals, strategies, objectives and targets, and programs and activities which will serve as basis for the provision of provincial investment, allocation of funds and their implementation. <8> Ipinahayag din ng gobernador ang kanyang executive agenda para sa taong 2016-2019 na kinapalooban ng 10-point agenda ng Pamahalaang Panlalawigan kung saan higit pang titiyakin ang pagpapaunlad sa agrikultura at eko-turismo bilang mga pangunahing industriyang magsusulong sa pag-asenso ng lalawigan. the governor also announced his executive agenda for the years 2016 - 2019 which includes the 10-point agenda of the Provincial Government to ensure the advancement of agriculture and eco-tourism as the key industries that will further the province's development. <9> Samantala, ang makapagkaloob ng abot-kaya at para sa higit na nangangailangang serbisyong pangkalusugan, de kalidad na edukasyon na may pagpapahalaga sa kultura at tradisyon at episyenteng serbisyong panlipunan ang mga pangunahing layunin ng Social Services Sector na tinalakay ni Provincial Social Welfare and Development Officer Zarah C. Magboo. meanwhile, to provide an affordable health services especially for those most in need, quality education that gives importance to cultural and traditional values and efficient social services are the primary goals of the Social Services Sector discussed by the Provincial Social Welfare and Development Officer Zarah C. Magboo. <10> Ang tiyaking may sapat na suplay ng pagkain, maunlad na turismo at oportunidad sa pagnenegosyo, mahusay na napangangalagaan ang kapaligiran at likas-yaman at ang magkaroon ng maayos na sistema ng komunikasyon at mga serbisyong pampubliko naman ang iprinisenta ni Provincial Agriculturist Christine M. Pine. to ensure there is an adequate food supply, prosperous tourism and business opportunities, preservation of the environment and natural resources, a well-established communication system and public services was presented by Provincial Agriculturist Christine M. Pine. <11> Isang responsable at aktibong pamahalaan na may integridad at nakatutugon sa pangangailangan ng mamamayan, maayos na relasyon at pakikipagtuwang sa ibang ahensya ng pamahalaan at pribadong sektor at may mahusay na kakayahang pampinansya ang mga tunguhin ng General Public & Other Services Sector na tinalakay ni Provincial Budget Officer Nennette M. Pineda. a responsible and an active government with integrity that meets the needs of its people, good relationship and partnership with other government agencies and private sectors, and good financial capabilities are the goals of General Public and other Services Sector discussed by Provincial Budget Officer Nennette M. Pine also discussed the Provincial Commodity Investment Plan for calamondin and coconuts. <13> Isa itong programa na nakapaloob sa PRDP kung saan pauunlarin ang iba’t ibang produkto ng lalawigan. it is one of the programs of the PRDP where various products of the province will be developed. <14> Bukod sa calamansi at niyog, isusunod pa ang mga programa para sa mga produktong virgin coconut oil, saging, seaweeds at palay. aside from calamondin and coconut, programs for virgin coconut oil, banana, seaweeds and rice products will follow. <15> (CPRSD/LTC/PIA-Mimaropa/Calapan) (CPRSD/LTC/PIA-Mimaropa/Calapan)

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_96062668 <1> Salamin ng Buhay mirror of life <2> Salamin ng Buhay mirror of life <3> ni Apolinario B Villalobos by Apolinario B Villalobos <4> Hindi nakikita ng tao ang kanyang mukha hangga’t hindi siya tumingin sa salamin. a person cannot see his face unless he looks at a mirror. <5> Sa ganoong pagkakataon pa lamang niya makikita ang kabuuhan ng kanyang mukha, na siya pala ay may dungis na dapat niyang punasan upang matanggal… na siya pala ay may nunal sa ilalim ng kaliwang mata… na siya pala ay may mga ngipin na hindi pantay… na siya pala ay may matamis na ngiti, atbp. he will be able to see his whole face only in that way, that he has dirt he needs to wipe in order to be removed... that he has a mole under his left eye... that he has uneven teeth... that he has a sweet smile, etc. <6> Sa araw-araw nating pamumuhay, kailangan din nating magkaroon ng “salamin” upang malaman kung may mga ginawa tayo na hindi maganda, masagwa, o mabuti. in our everyday life, we also need to have a "mirror" in order to know if we are doing something not good, vulgar, or kind. <7> Sa pagkakataong ito, ang “salamin” natin ay ang ating kapwa. in this occasion, our "mirror" is our fellowman. <8> Sa kanila natin masasalamin at malalaman na may mga ginawa tayo na masagwa pala kaya dapat nating iwasang gawin uli. through them we will see and know that we have done vulgar things so we can avoid repeating them. <9> Sa mga ginawa din nila natin masasalamin ang mga kabutihang ginawa na natin, nguni’t hindi natin alam. through their actions we will also be able to see the kindness we have done, but are not aware of. <10> Nguni’t may bisa lamang ang paggamit natin ng ating kapwa bilang salamin kung kaya nating tanggapin ang ating kamalian. but using our fellowman as a mirror is effective only if we can accept our faults. <11> Hangga’t hindi natin ito kayang gawin, hanggang papuri na lamang tayo kung may makikita tayong magandang ginawa ng ating kapwa at pangkukutya sa kanila kung gumawa sila ng masama – na ginawa din pala natin. until we cannot do this, we are limited to giving compliments when we see our fellowmen doing something good and condemning them if they do something bad - that we have done as well. <12> Dahil diyan ay walang silbi ang ating pananalamin sa pamamagitan ng ating kapwa. because of that looking through a mirror via our fellowman is useless. <13> Sa mga pagkakataong dapat ay mayroon tayong natutunan pero pinalampas natin, wala tayong dapat sisihin kundi ang sarili natin – kung tayo ay naghihirap dahil sa palaging kakapusan sa pera, may mga suwail na anak, nawalan ng trabaho, hiniwalayan ng asawa, atbp. in instances where we should have learned something but let it pass, we have no one to blame but ourselves - if we are suffering because of frequent shortage of money, disobedient children, loss of work, separation of spouse, etc. <14> Magsisi man tayo…ay huli na. we may regret it... but it is too late.

Datu Carlo Lorenzo J. Datu <4> LUNGSOD NG SAN FERNANDO, Pampanga, Abril 23 (PIA) -- Humigit kumulang 31,000 trabahong lokal at pang ibayong dagat ang iaalok sa mga Labor Day Job Fairs sa Gitnang Luzon ngayong taon. City of San Fernando, Pampanga, April 23 (PIA) - more or less 31,000 local and overseas jobs will be offered on the Labor Day Job Fairs in Central Luzon this year. <5> Ayon kay Department of Labor and Employment Regional Director Ana Dione, nasa 24,870 lokal na trabaho ang iaalok ng may 265 na kumpanya habang 6,104 na bakanteng trabaho sa ibayong dagat ang nais punan ng may 28 na recruitment agencies. according to Department of Labor and Employment regional director Ana Dione, around 24,870 local jobs will be offered by around 265 companies while 28 recruitment agencies want to fill up 6,104 vacant positions overseas. <6> Kabilang sa mga bakanteng trabahong lokal ang Customer Care Representatives, Call Center Agents, Production Operators, Production Workers, Sewers, Sales Clerks, Welders, Masons, at Sales Associates. included in the vacant local positions are customer care representatives, call center agents, production operators, production workers, sewers, sales clerks, welders, masons, and sales associates. <7> Sa kabilang banda, hinahanap sa ibayong dagay ang mga Electrical/Mechanical Engineers, Production Operators, Factory Workers, Nurses, Staff Nurses, House Keepers, Helpers, and Service Crews. on the other hand, electrical/mechanical engineers, production operators, factory workers, nurses, staff nurses, house keepers, helpers, and service crews are wanted overseas. <8> Sabayang idaraos ang mga May 1 Job Fairs sa mga SM malls in Baliuag, Pampanga, Clark, San Fernando Downtown, Cabanatuan, at Tarlac. the May 1 Job Fairs will simultaneously be held in SM malls in Baliuag, Pampanga, Clark, San Fernando Downtown, Cabanatuan, and Tarlac. <9> Meron din sa KB gymnasium, Capitol compound sa lungsod ng Malolos, at municipal gym ng Masinloc, Zambales. KB Gymnasium, Capitol Compound in the City of Malolos, and the municipal gym of Masinloc, Zambales will have it too. <10> Bukod dito, may kahalintulad na aktibidad rin sa Mayo 3 sa New Municipal Building sa Marilao, Bulacan at Freedom Park Capitol Grounds sa lungsod ng Cabanatuan. aside from these, there are also similar activities on May 3 in the New Municipal Building in Marilao, Bulacan and Freedom Park Capitol Grounds in the city of Cabanatuan. <11> May nakatakda rin sa Mayo 6 sa People’s Center, Provincial Capitol Compound sa lungsod ng Balanga at Rizal Triangle sa lungsod ng Olongapo. the People's Center, Provincial Capitol Compound of the city of Balanga and Rizal Triangle in the city of Olongapo are set to have it too on May 6. <12> Naka-angkla ang ika-114 selebrasyon ng Philippine Labor Day sa temang “Kinabukasan Sigurado sa Disenteng Trabaho.” (CLJD-PIA 3) the 114th celebration of Philippine Labor Day is anchored on the theme "sure future in a decent job". (CLJD-PIA 3)

they are fearless, aren't they? <18> Buong loob na sinigawan ni Orrozco ang mga bandido. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_97609163 <1> KAYA NATIN: Bigyan dapat priyoridad ang agrikultura at kalusuganBy Harvey Keh we can: priority should be given to agriculture and health by Harvey Keh. <2> August 23, 2016 August 23, 2016 <3> Ngayong linggo ay nag-umpisa na ang pagtalakay sa hinihinging P3.3 trilyon na budget para sa 2017 ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte. this week, the discussion began for President Rodrigo Duterte's requested P3.3 trillion budget for 2017. <4> Ang nakakagulat sa halagang ito ay ang biglang paglobo ng budget ng opisina ni Duterte na noong panahon ni dating Presidente Benigno ‘Noynoy’ Aquino III ay may budget na tatlong bilyong piso lamang pero sa hinihinging budget ni Duterte ay lumobo ito sa P20 bil­yon. what's shocking in this amount is the sudden increase of budget of the office of Duterte which during the time of President Benigno 'Noynoy' Aquino III had a budget of only three billion pesos but in the requested budget of Duterte it increased to P20 billion. <5> Ayon kay Budget Sec. Benjamin Diokno, limang bilyong piso sa budget na ito ay gagamitin para sa pagsasagawa ng ASEAN conference rito sa ating bansa sa susunod na taon pero ganu’n pa man, napakalaki pa rin ng inangat ng budget ng Office of the President. according to Budget Secretary Benjamin Diokno, five billion pesos of this budget will be used to organize the ASEAN conference here in our country next year, but still the increase in the budget of the Office of the President is enormous. <6> Siyempre kung umangat ang budget ng isang opisina, may ilang mga departamento naman ang natapyasan ng budget at ang isa sa mga pinakamalaking tapyas ay ang Department of Health (DOH) kung saan kulang kulang P30 bilyon ang nabawas. of course, if the budget of the office is increased, there are number of departments where budgets are deducted, and one of the biggest deduction is from Department of Health (DOH) where an estimated 30 billion pesos was inferred. <7> Kung matutuloy ang pagtapyas na ito, maraming mga serbisyong pang kalusugan ang siguradong mababawas para sa mga ordinaryong mga mamamayan. if this deduction will push through, many health services will surely be minimized for ordinary citizens. <8> Ngayon pa lang nga ay kulang na ang mga gamot at ibang kagamitan sa ating mga pampublikong mga ospital, paano pa kaya sa susunod na taon kung nabawasan nang husto ang budget ng DOH. even now, we already have inadequate medicines and other equipment in our public hospitals; how much more in the next years when there will be a big deduction in the budget of DOH? <9> Mahalaga ang kalusugan sa ating lipunan dahil kapag may sakit ang isang miyembro ng pamilya, nauubos ang suweldo o ang sa­vings ng pamilya. health is important in our community; because if one member of the family is sick, the salary or savings of the family are used up. <10> Kung ang magkakasakit ay ang mismong nagdadala ng kita para sa pamilya, siguradong gutom ang aa­butin ng kanilang pamilya. if the bread winner of the family gets sick, surely, it will bring hunger to the family. <11> Ito rin ang isa sa mga pangunahing dahilan kung bakit nababaon sa utang ang mga kababayan natin kaya sa halip na makapag-ipon sila para sa kanilang kinabukasan ay nauubos lamang ito para makabili ng gamot para sa kanilang mahal sa buhay. this is also one of the reasons why our fellow citizens are buried in debts; instead of saving for their future, it is consumed in buying medicines for their loved ones. <12> Kung magiging maayos lamang ang sistema ng kalusugan sa ating bansa, mas malalabanan natin ang kahirapan. if only the healthy system in our country is organized, we can fight poverty better. <13> Isa pang natapyasan na departamento ay ang Department of Agriculture (DA). another department that got a cut is the Department of Agriculture (DA). <14> Pinangako ni Duterte na bibigyan niya ng pansin ang ating mga magsasaka at mangingisda kaya sana ay inakyat niya ang budget ng DA para mas mabigyan pa ng tulong ang mga nagpapakain sa ating bayan. Duterte promised to pay attention to our farmers and fishermen, hence, he should have increased the budget of DA to give more help to those who feed our country. <15> Maraming problema ang ating mga magsasaka at isa na rito ay tuwing bumabagyo ay nauubos ang kanilang pananim kaya kailangan na sila umutang muli para makapagtanim muli. our farmers have lots of problems; one is the destruction of crops during typhoon, which consequently requires them to loan money to plant again. <16> Dahil dito ay nababaon na rin sila sa utang at nahihirapan na silang makabangon kaya sana ay mabigyan din ng mataas na budget ang DA para matulungan ang ating mga magsasaka sa kanilang mga kinakaharap na problema. because of this, they are buried in debt and makes it difficult for them to rise; hence, DA should be given a higher budget to help our farmers with the problems they're facing.

"the migrants and the families need to unite against the interference of the US government wherever in the world," stated Garry Martinez, president of Migrante International. <10> “Kung hindi abuso, karahasan at giyera ang dulot nito, laging nanganganib ang buhay ng ating mga migranteng Pilipino.” "if not abuse, violence and war are caused by this, lives of our migrant Filipinos are always endangered." <11> Isang OFW survivor mula sa Syria (Darius Galang) one OFW survivor from Syria (Darius Galang) <12> Nananatiling nasa panganib ang libu-libong Pilipino sa Gitnang Silangan dahil sa mga sigalot. thousands of Filipinos remain in danger at the Middle East because of the conflict. <13> Ibinahagi ng Migrante ang pagkasawi ni Meran Prieira Montezor, isang 23 anyos na tubong Camarines Sur, sa Homs, Syria sa gitna ng isang ambus. Migrante shared the death of Meran Prieira Montezor, a 23 year old native of Camarines Sur, at Homs, Syria in the middle of an ambush. <14> Kasama ng Pilipino ang anak ng kanyang amo nang paulanan ng bala ang kotseng sinasakyan nila ng mga hindi kilalang tao. with the Filipino is the child of her employer when their car got rained down by bullets by unknown people. <15> Panawagan ni Martinez ang mas aktibo at mas sistematikong pagpapabalik sa bansa ng mga OFW. Martinez pleads for a more active and systematic regress to the country of the OFWs. <16> Hinamon din niya si Pangulong Aquino na pumosisyon kontra sa interbensiyon ng puwersang US-NATO sa Syria. he also challenged President Aquino to position against the intervention of US-NATO forces at Syria. <17> Sa huli, iginiit ng Migrante ang pagtigil sa Labor Export Policy at inudyok ang administrasyon na lumikha ng mga trabaho sa loob ng bansa. in the end, Migrante insisted the cease of the Labor Export Policy and encouraged the administration to create more jobs within the country. <18> “Habang may kawalan ng lupa, walang trabaho sa loob ng bansa, at patuloy na tumataas ang mga presyo ng bilihin, puwersadong umalis ang mga Pilipino patungo sa mga bansa kahit pa umiiral ang pandaigdigang krisis pang-ekonomiya. "while there are lack of land, no work within the country, and continued increase in the prices of goods, Filipinos are forced to leave the country even though there is a worldwide economic crisis. <19> Patuloy na nailalagay ang mga OFW sa napipintong panganib. OFWs are constantly put into imminent danger. <20> Isa itong siklo na hindi titigil hangga’t walang isinasagawang pundamental na repormang panlipunan,” pagtatapos ni Martinez. this is one cycle that would not stop unless no fundamental social reform is put into action," ends Martinez. <21> Pangulong Aquino, kinondena sa di pagposisyon sa giyerang agresyon ng US-NATO sa Syria, at sa pagpapatuloy ng labor export policy na naglalagay ng mga OFW sa panganib. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_31500508 <1> Sumama sa Agos go with the flow <2> Pawalan at hayaan, nang may kalabasan. . . Subalit kapag pinakialaman at sinubukan nang sinubukan, let go and let it be, so there will be a result ... but if you meddle with it and tried over again, <3> wala itong kakahinatnan. this is pointless. <4> Naranasan ko na ito, kapag nakasakay ka sa isang balsa at tinatangay ito ng malakas na agos at ikaw ay nahulog, huwag mong kalabanin ang ragasa ng agos, kundi ang tumihaya nang tuwid, magpalutang, at magpatianod, sumikad at ikampay ang mga kamay at sumabay sa agos, dadalhin ka nito sa tahimik na lugar para sa iyong kaligtasan. I have already experienced this, when you're riding a raft and it is carried away by the current and you fell, don't resist the rush of the current, instead lie straight on your back, float and allow to be carried away, kick and swing your hands and go with the flow, this will bring you to a silent place for your safety. <5> Subalit kung aagsaw at walang habas kang magkakampay at magsisikad, nilalabanan mo ang matuling agos. but if you relentlessly swing your arms and kick, you are resisting the fast current. <6> Sa katagalan, ay papanawan ka ng lakas at hahampas pa sa batuhan. in the long run, you will be deprived of strength and even hit the rocks. <7> Ito ang magpapahamak sa iyo; ang masugatan at mawalan ng ulirat upang malunod. this will cause you harm; to be wounded and lose consciousness to drown. <8> Ganito din ang pagtahak sa buhay, maraming mabigat na mga bagay o sitwasyon ang walang simpleng kasagutan o kalunasan. this is also how life is explored, there are many heavy things or situation with no simple answer or solution. <9> Kailangang hayaan natin ang panahon ang siyang magtakda nang ikakalutas nito. we need to let time set the solution. <10> Mahalaga na tanggapin natin ang katotohanan na wala tayong magagawa sa mga bagay na wala tayong kinalaman at walang katiyakan. it is important that we accept the truth that there is nothing we can do with things that don't concern us and are uncertain. <11> Sa halip, umasam tayo na ang lahat ay mga pagpapala at patungo sa kabutihan ng lahat. instead, let us long for everyone to have blessings and on the path of good for everyone. <12> Walang nakakaalam kung bakit ang isang bagay o sitwasyon ay nagaganap sa ating buhay. nobody knows why a thing or situation happens in our life. <13> Kung ito ay isang pagpapala o isang sumpa, ang tangi lamang nakakaalam ay ang Dakilang Manlilikha. if this is a blessing or curse, the only one who knows is the great creator. <14> Manatiling bukas ang isipan sa buhay, dahil kusa at patuloy nitong isinisiwalat and nakatakda mong buhay. keep an open mind in life, because it deliberately and continuously reveals your fate. <15> Ito ang susi upang maging payapa sa kabila ng mga nagngangalit na daluyong na ipinupukol sa iyo ng tadhana. this is the key to be at peace amidst the furious surge that is thrown at you by fate. <16> Kapag naharap ka sa isang seryosong problema na wala kang kontrol at kakayahan, ang matalinong paglutas dito ay magpatianod sa agos. if you are faced with a serious problem beyond your control and ability, the wise solution here is to get carried away by the current.

May nagpapa-test na mga artista on their own pero mas mahalaga ‘yung test sa harap ng awtoridad. “Meron kasing sistema na nagpapa-test after not taking it after some time, pero alam naman naming heavy user. “Meron din namang may tine-take na ibang gamot para mag-negative ang drug test. Magkakaalaman din ng totoo sa huli.” said one official of the Dangerous Drugs Board about the news on showbiz personalities who went to be tested first and posted negative results of drug testing: "a blood test is more important than a drug test. there are artists who get tested on their own but a test done in front of the authorities is more important. there is a system of getting tested after not taking it after some time, but we know he is a heavy user. there are also some who take another medicine for the drug test to turn out negative. the truth will be known in the end".
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_93499554 <1> ANG TUNAY NA MAPALAD: Reflection for 22nd Sunday in Ordinary Time Year B - September 2, 2012 the truly lucky: reflection for 22nd Sunday in ordinary time year b - September 2, 2012 <2> Paano ba nausukat ang pagiging relihiyoso ng isang tao? how is the religiousness of a person measured? <3> Sapagkat nagsisimba ba ay maituturing ng relihiyoso? just because one goes to church can he be considered religious? <4> Nakagawian na ni "Pepeng Mandurukot" ang dumaan sa Simbahan ng Quiapo at magdasal sa kanyang paboritong patrong Poong Nazareno pagkatapos ng maghapong pagtratrabaho. "Pepeng Mandurukot" has made it a habit to pass by the Quiapo Church and pray to his favorite patron the Holy Nazarene after a whole day of work. <5> "Poong Nazareno, maraming salamat po at binigyan mo ako ng matalas na mata! "Holy Nazarene, thank you for giving me sharp eyes! <6> Nakadukot ako ng cellphone sa katabi ko kanina sa bus na walang kahirap-hirap!" I was able to steal a cellphone from my seatmate in the bus earlier without difficulty!" <7> Bigla siyang may narinig na mahiwagang tinig: "Mapalad ka Pepe... mapalad ka!" he suddenly heard a magical voice: "you are lucky Pepe ... lucky!" <8> Nagulat siya sa sagot na kanyang tinanggap. he was shocked at the reply he received. <9> Hindi niya ito gaanong binigyang pansin. he did not pay much attention to it. <10> Kinabukasan pagkatapos ng kanyang "trabaho" ay muli siyang dumaan sa simbahan. the next day after his "job" he again passed by the church. <11> "Poong Nazareno, maraming salamat po at binigyan mo ako ng mabilis na kamay at paa. "Holy Nazarene, thank you for giving me quick hands and feet. <12> Hindi ako inabutan ng pulis na humahabol sa akin!" the police who were chasing me did not catch up with me!" <13> Muling lumabas ang mahiwagang tinig na ang wika: "Mapalad ka Pepe... mapalad ka!" again a mysterious voice appeared saying: "you are lucky Pepe ... lucky!" <14> Nagulumihanan si Pepe at sa puntong ito ay di na napigilang magtanong. Pepe was confused and at this point could not stop himself from asking. <15> "Panginoon, ikaw ba yan? "Lord, is that you? <16> Anung ibig sabihin mong mapalad ako?" what do you mean that I am lucky?" <17> At sumagot ang tinig: "Mapalad ka Pepe at mabigat itong krus na pasan-pasan ko. and the voice replied: "you are lucky Pepe that the cross I bear is heavy. <18> Kung hindi ay ibinalibag ko na ito sa iyo!" if not I would have thrown it at you!" <19> hehehe... Marahil ay kuwento lamang ito ngunit may inihahatid sa ating mahalagang aral: Ang tunay na relihiyon ay wala sa panlabas na pagpapapakita ngunit nasa panloob na paniniwala at pagsasabuhay nito. hehehe ... perhaps this is just a story but has an important lesson to offer. true religion is not in outer appearances but in inner belief and application. <20> Ano ang sabi ni Hesus tungkol sa mga Pariseo? what did Jesus say about the Pharisees? <21> “Tama ang hula ni Isaias tungkol sa inyo. "Isaiah's prophecy about you is true. <22> Mapagpaimbabaw nga kayo, gaya ng kanyang isinulat: ‘Paggalang na handog sa ‘kin ng bayan ko’y paimbabaw lamang, sapagkat sa bibig at hindi sa puso ito bumubukal." you are hypocrites, like he wrote: 'respect offered by my people are merely superficial, because it comes from the lips and not from the heart." <23> Paano ko ba ipinapakita ang pagiging Kristiyano? how can I demonstrate being a Christian? <24> Baka naman natatali lang ako sa mga ritwal na panlabas na pagsamba at nakakalimutan ko ang higit na mahalaga? maybe I am just tied to rituals that are external worship and forget what is more important? <25> Mahalaga ang pagrorosaryo, pagsama sa prusisyon, pagdedebosyon sa mga santo, pagsisimba tuwing Linggo. praying the rosary, joining processions, devoting to saints, going to church every Sunday are important. <26> Ngunit dapat nating tandaan na hindi lamang ito ang ibig sabihin ng relihiyon. but we must remember that that is not the only meaning of religion. <27> May mas mahalagang hinihingi si Hesus sa atin. Jesus asks something more important from us. <28> Ang sabi nga ng isang sikat na mangangaral na obispo: "Kung paanong ang pumapasok ng talyer ay hindi nagiging kotse... ganun din ang pumapasok ng simbahan ay hindi agad matatawag na Kristiyano." as a famous preacher bishop said: "like when one who enters a garage does not become a car ... in the same way that whoever enters the church cannot immediately be called a Christian." <29> Hindi sapagkat nagsimba ka ay Kristiyano ka na! just because you attended mass you are not already a Christian! <30> Hindi garantiya ang litanya ng mga debosyon, ang paulit na ulit na pagsambit ng panalangin, ang araw-araw na pagtitirik ng mga kandila kung ang lumalabas naman sa ating bibig ay paglapastangan sa kapwa, masasamang salita, paninira, paghuhusga sa kamalian ng iba. the prayers of the devoted, the repeated mention of prayer, the daily lighting of candles are not guarantees if what comes out of our mouths are disrespect for others, bad words, defamation, judging the mistakes of others. <31> Sikapin nating magpakatotoo sa ating pagiging Kristiyano! let us try to be real in our being Christians! <32> Unawain natin at sundin ng matapat ang mga utos ng Diyos. let us understand and follow truthfully the will of God. <33> Pakikinig na may pagkilos ang tunay na pagpapakita na tayo ay sumusunod sa Kanya. listening with action is the real display that we are following him. <34> Ang sabi nga ni apostol Santiago: "Kung ito’y pinakikinggan lamang ninyo ngunit hindi isinasagawa, dinadaya ninyo ang inyong sarili." like what Saint James said: "if you only listen to it and not act it out, you only deceive yourselves." <35> Ang tunay na "mapalad" ay ang mga nakikinig sa Panginoon at nagsasabuhay ng Kanyang Salita. those who are really "lucky" are those who listen to the Lord and live by his words. <36> Ang sarap marinig sa Panginoon ang mga katagang: "Mapalad ka (pangalan mo)... MAPALAD KA!" it is nice to hear from the Lord the words: "you are lucky (your name) ... you are lucky!"
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_77279382 <1> Daan-daang magniniyog na lumusob sa NAPC, di hinarap ng ‘coco levy fund mafia’ Hundreds of coconut farmers attack the NAPC, were not addressed by the 'coco levy fund mafia' <2> Sa ikatlong pagkakataon ng paglusob sa National Anti-Poverty Commission (NAPC), hindi hinarap ni NAPC Sek. Joel Rocamora ang mga magniniyog na iginigiit ang kagyat na distribusyon ng pondong coco levy. during the third attack on the National Anti-Poverty Commission (NAPC), Secretary Joel Rocamora refused to address the coconut farmers who insist on the immediate distribution of coco levy funds. <3> Daan-daang magsasaka mula sa Bicol, Quezon, Aurora at Cagayan ang tumalon sa bakod o lumusot sa ilalim ng kinandadong gate ng NAPC para makausap sana si Rocamora. hundreds of farmers from Bicol, Quezon, Aurora and Cagayan either jumped over the fence or went under the locked gate of the NAPC in the hopes of speaking with Rocamora. <4> Binarikadahan ng mga guwardiya ang pintuan ng NAPC at binugahan ng mga fire extinguisher ang mga magniniyog. guards barricaded the door to the NAPC and blasted the coconut farmers with fire extinguishers. <5> Naglabas din ng M-16 armalayt ang isang pulis, bagay na ikinagalit ng mga demonstrador. one policeman relinquished an M-16 armalite, which angered the demonstrators. <6> (Tingnan ang mga larawan sa ibaba) (view the images below) <7> Ayon kay Sr. Supt. Richard Albano, direktor ng Quezon City Police District, ipinaaabot umano ni Rocamora na dapat ay “sumulat” na lamang ang mga magniniyog para makapag-iskedyul ng dayalogo. according to Senior Superintendent Richard Albano, director of the Quezon City Police District, Rocamora allegedly suggested that the coconut farmers should "write" in order to schedule a dialogue. <8> Ngunit ayon kay Willy Marbella ng Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP), matagal na silang hindi hinaharap ni Rocamora, na bahagi ng tinawag niyang “coco levy fund mafia.” however, according to Willy Marbella of the Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP), they have long been avoided by Rocamora, who is part of what he called the "coco levy fund mafia." <9> Tinutukoy niya ang Presidential Task Force on the Coco Levy Funds na binuo ni Pangulong Aquino para pangasiwaan umano ang paggamit sa pondong coco levy. he is referring to the Presidential Task Force on the Coco Levy funds formed by President Aquino which was supposed to manage the use of coco levy funds. <10> Inihayag ng NAPC na gagamitin ang pondo, kung saan P56 Bilyon ang nai-remit na sa National Treasury noong nakaraang taon, sa Conditional Cash Transfer at Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program. the NAPC announced that the funds, P56 Billion of which was already remitted to the National Treasury last year, will be used for the Conditional Cash Transfer and Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program. <11> Tinututulan ito ng mga magniniyog. coconut farmers opposed this. <12> “Walang karapatan si Noynoy Aquino at anumang ahensiya niya na gamitin ang coco levy funds sa ano mang programa nila o sa ano pa mang kadahilanan. "Noynoy Aquino and any agency of his has no right to use the coco levy funds for any of their programs or for any other reason. <13> Ang coco levy funds ay pera ng mga magniniyog kaya ang mga magniniyog lamang ang may solong karapatan na magdesisyon kung ano man ang gagawin dito,” ayon kay Nestor Villanueva, Southern Tagalog coordinator ng grupong Claim (Coco Levy Funds Ibalik Sa Amin). the coco levy funds are the coconut farmers' money, thus only the coconut farmers have the sole right to decide on what to do with it," says Nestor Villanueva, Southern Tagalog coordinator of the group Claim (Coco Levy funds Return it to Us). <14> “Hindi panatag ang mga magniniyog na ang pera nila ay nasa kamay ng Hacienderong Pangulo…Kaya hindi tayo umaasa na mababawi natin ang coco levy funds sa pamamagitan lamang ng pakiusap kundi sa pamamagitan ng paggigiit ng aming mga karapatan,” dagdag ni Villanueva. "the coconut farmers are uneasy knowing that their money lies in the hands of a wealthy, landlord president. That's why we no longer expect to take back the coco levy funds merely by means of dialogue, but by insisting on our rights," adds Villanueva. <15> Samantala, ibinulgar naman ng KMP na humihingi si Rocamora ng P1.6-B na “advance” mula sa pondong coco levy. meanwhile, the KMP disclosed that Rocamora asked for a P1.6 billion "advance" from the coco levy funds. <16> Para umano ito sa “anti-peasant poverty reduction roadmap” ng industriya ng niyog. it was allegedly for the "anti-peasant poverty reduction roadmap" of the coconut industry. <17> Pero ayon sa mga magniniyog, may regular nang pondo ang mga programa ng NAPC. however, according to the coconut farmers, there is already regular funding for the programs of the NAPC. <18> Pangamba nila, gagamitin ang pondo sa darating na halalan, partikular sa kampanya umano ni Akbayan Rep. Risa Hontiveros, na tatakbo sa ilalim ng senatorial slate ni Aquino. they fear that the funds will be used in the upcoming election, particularly in the campaign of Akbayan Representative Risa Hontiveros, who is running under the senatorial slate of Aquino. <19> Si Rocamora ay dating tagapangulo ng Akbayan. Rocamora was a former chairman of Akbayan. <20> “Hindi lamang ang bulsa nila ang kanilang pinatataba, kundi pati ang campaign chest ng kanilang partido,” sabi ni Marbella. "they are fattening not only their own pockets, but their party's campaign chest as well," says Marbella. <21> Nananawagan ang KMP at CLAIM ng distribusyon ng coco levy funds sa pamamagitan ng “social benefits” gaya ng pensyon at benepisyo sa kalusugan at edukasyon. KMP and CLAIM are calling for the distribution of coco levy funds through "social benefits" such as pensions and health and education benefits. <22> Isinusulong nila ang House Bill 3443 o Coconut Levy Funds Administration and Management Act ni Anakpawis Rep. Rafael Mariano. they are promoting House Bill 3443 or the Coconut Levy funds Administration and Management Act of Anakpawis Representative Rafael Mariano. <23> Layon ng HB 3433 na mabuo ng konseho na kinabibilangan mismo ng mga magniniyog. the purpose of HB 3433 is to form a council that includes the coconut farmers themselves. <24> Samantala, sa isang pahayag na ipinamahagi sa midya, sinabi ni Rocamora na “malaki ang pagkakapareho” ng panukalang HB 3433 at NAPC Roadmap. meanwhile, in a statement to the media, Rocamora said that the proposed HB 3433 and the NAPC Roadmap had "many similarities". <25> Aniya, sinasalubong niya ang pagiging mapagmatiyag ng mga magniniyog. he said he welcomes the vigilance of the coconut farmers. <26> “Let us work on our common goals,” aniya. "let us work on our common goals," he said.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_58801168 <1> Liham: Marapat na idiskwalipika ang Akbayan letter: rightful to disqualify Anakbayan <2> by Liham sa Patnugot by letter to the editor <3> October 22, 2012 October 22, 2012 <4> Orly Marcellana ng Kasama-TK (Darius Galang) Orly Marcellano of Fellows-TK <5> Naninindigan ang militanteng kilusang magbubukid sa rehiyon ng Timog Katagalugan na tama at lehitimo ang mainit na panawagang huwag pahintulutan ang grupong Akbayan na tumakbo sa party-list elections. the militant movement of farmers in the region of Southern Tagalog are standing on the principle that the heated call to disallow the Akbayan group from running in the party-list elections is right and legitimate. <6> Sa pagdami ng maralita sa kanayunan na nabuklod at naorganisa sa militanteng tradisyon ng pakikibaka sa lupa, desperado pa rin ang estado sa pagsuporta at paghahasik sa mapanlinlang na kaisipan sa pamamagitan ng mga nagpapanggap na samahang magsasaka (pseudo-farmer’s organization). with the increase of the poor in the villages which combined and organized the militant tradition of struggle for land, the state is still desperate in supporting and spreading a deceitful ideology by those pretending as farmer's organization (pseudo-farmer's organization). <7> Kabungguang-balikat ng AKBAYAN ang mga grupong tulad ng UNORKA, PAKISAMA, PARRDS, PARAGOS, PAMMBUKID-KA, KASAKA-TK, KMBP, CARET, AR NOW, CENTRO-SAKA at PEACE Foundation (Araro PL) sa mga nagkukunwaring maka-magsasakang organisasyon. the groups such as UNORKA, PAKISAMA, PARRDS, PARAGOS, PAMMBUKID-KA, KASAKA-TK, KMBP, CARET, AR NOW, CENTRO-SAKA and PEACE Foundation (Araro PL) are associates of Akbayan which are pretending as farmer's organizations. <8> Ang mga samahang ito ang nagsisilbing espesyal na ahente sa psywar ng gobyerno at AFP para ilihis ang landas ng masang magsasaka sa mapagpalayang adhikain nito at panatilihin ang paghaharing pyudal at mala-pyudal sa kanayunan. these organizations are serving as special agents of the psychological war of the government and the AFP to deviate the path of the masses of farmers from the liberal aspirations and maintain the feudal and semi-feudal reign in the villages. <9> Nakapagtala ng may dalawampung (20) maliliit na grupo ng repormista at nagpapanggap na organisasyong magbubukid sa rehiyon. recorded 20 (20) smaller groups of reformists and pretending as farmer's organization in the region. <10> Nagtatangka silang ibulid sa repormismo ang uring magsasaka – wasakin ang base ng militanteng kilusan at pagkakaisa ng maralita sa kanayunan upang patuloy na makapagsamantala at makapaghari ang mga panginoong maylupa at mga kasabwat nito. they are attempting to tie the class of farmers to reformation, destroy the base of the militant movement and cooperation of the poor in the villages to continue the exploitation and reign of landlords and their accomplices. <11> Mahaba ang rekord ng panlilinlang ng Akbayan at mga kasapakat nitong pseudo-farmer’s organization sa masang magsasaka sa bansa. the record of deceit of Akbayan is long and its accomplices of pseudo-farmer's organization to the mass of farmers in the country. <12> Matutuyuan ng tubig ang mga irigasyon sa kanayunan, pero hindi ang maruming listahan ng panlilinlang, panggagantso at pangungulimbat ng Akbayan at mga kagrupo nito sa kakapurit na ngang kabuhayan ng magsasaka. the irrigation in the villages will be dried out of water, but not the dirty list of deceit, snatching and stealing of Akbayan and its groups to the meager livelihood of farmers. <13> Ang mga nalilinlang na magsasaka ang pangunahing balon ng pinagpapasasaang pondo at pekeng-kapangyarihan ng Akbayan! the deceived farmers are the primary well of funds and fake power enjoyed by Akbayan! <14> Ahente ng Lupa land agent <15> Laganap ang bentahan ng lupa at pagpapasuko sa karapatan ng mga magsasaka sa Southern Tagalog na pinangunahan ng Akbayan. the selling of land is widespread and asking the farmers in Southern Tagalog to surrender their rights led by Akbayan. <16> Kunwang oorganisahin ang magsasaka, ibubuyo sa komprontasyon sa Department of Agrarian Reform (DAR) para diumano’y ipatupad ang peke ring reporma sa lupa na Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program (CARP). pretending to organize the farmers, will blow a confrontation to the Department of Agrarian Reform (DAR) as if implementing the fake land reform which is the Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Program (CARP). <17> Isusuong sa gasgasang-rali at mahahabang kampuhan sa harapan ng DAR. advance a clinching rally and long camping in front of DAR. <18> Paglao’y sasabihing papasok na ang kanilang laban sa win-win solution sa pamamagitan ng pagtanggap ng Certificate of Land Ownership Award (CLOA) na lingid sa kaalaman ng mga magsasaka ay nauna nang nai-deal ng mga hinayupak na lider at organisador ng Akbayan sa mga panginoong maylupa at real estate developer! and then later, their fight will be told as something in the win-win solution by receiving the Certificate of Land Ownership Award (CLOA), which is unknown from the knowledge of the farmers, has already been dealt by the animal leaders and organizers of Akbayan to the landlords and real estate developer! <19> Muling eeksena ang DAR sa iskemang bigay-bawi ng CLOA sa mga simpleng dahilan na non-agricultural ang lupa, not suited for agriculture, zoning ordinance at kung anu-ano pang palusot na buong-tapang-ang-hiyang tatanggapin ng Akbayan para isubo sa mga magsasaka na hayaan na lamang bawiin ang CLOA tutal ay babayaran naman sila ng damage compensation. DAR will make a scene again in a give-taken-back scheme of the CLOA in a simple reason that the land is non-agricultural, not suited for agriculture, zoning ordinance and whatever reason which will be bravely accepted with shame by Akbayan to feed to the farmers to just let them take back the CLOA, anyway, they will be paid with a damage compensation. <20> Ang matututunan ng kaawa-awang si Pedro Pilapil, tanggapin na ang CLOA dahil naibebenta naman ito! what can be learned from the pitiful Pedro Pilapil, accept the CLOA because this has already been sold! <21> Pagkatapos ng bayaran, paldo-ang-bulsa ng mga lider at organisador ng Akbayan sa laki ng komisyong nakuha nila sa pag-aahente ng lupa. after the payment, the pockets of the leaders and organizers of the Akbayan are full with the huge commission that they have gotten as agents of the land. <22> Hindi nga ba’t ang kuwento noong kasagsagan ng bentahan ng lupa sa Cavite ay saku-sako kung magdala ng pera ang mga lider ng Unorka sa mga baryo ng magsasaka? isn't it what the story is all about during the trend of selling lands in Cavite that the leaders of Unorka are carrying sacks of money to the villages of farmers? MATERIAL_BASE-1B_57439534 <1> UNTI-UNTING NAGIGIBA ANG DAANG MATUWID TSK! TSK! TSK! the straight path is slowly breaking down. <2> ANO na ang nangyayari sa Matuwid na Daan?
