It's falling apart in its own rust and it doesn't need to be broken for it to completely fall apart. <5> Aba dalawang matataas na opisyal at pinuno ng mahahalagang ahensya ng pamahalaan, parekoy, ang sentro ng usapan sa kasalukuyan. well, dude, two high-ranking officials and leaders of important government agencies are currently the hot topic. <6> Una, ukol kay Arthur Juan na boss ng National Food Authority. first, about Arthur Juan, boss of the National Food Authority. <7> Nangikil umano si Juan at ang kasanggga nitong si Atty. Patricia Galang ng halagang P15-milyon mula sa nahuli umanong mandurugas sa bigas. Juan and his ally, Attorney Patricia Galang, allegedly extorted 15 million pesos from an alleged rice hoarder who was caught. <8> Sa raid nina Juan, kasama sina Interior Secretary Mar Roxas at Agriculture Modernization Secretary Kiko Pangilinan, natagpuan umano ang 32,000 kabang bigas ni Jomerito “Jojo” Soliman sa Bulacan na may halong feeds o pampakain sa mga hayup pero ibinebentang magandang uri ng bigas. during the raid of Juan, along with Interior Secretary Mar Roxas and Agriculture Modernization Secretary Kiko Pangilinan, Jomerito "Jojo" Soliman's 32,000 sacks of rice, which were mixed with animal feeds but were being sold as high quality rice, were allegedly found in Bulacan. <9> Sabi ng NBI, may pruweba sa cellphone at text messages ni Juan na nangikil ito kay Soliman kapalit ng hindi pagsasampa ng kaso rito at pagbabalik ng lisensya na makapagnegosyo muli ito? The NBI says that there is proof in Juan's cellphone and text messages that he asked for money from Soliman in exchange for not pressing charges and returning his business license. <10> Ikalawa, dalawang kasong pandarambong naman ang isinampa laban kay PNP chief Alan Purisima batay sa mga hindi maliwanag na yaman nito. second, two plunder cases were filed against PNP Chief Alan Purisima based on his unclear properties. <11> Hindi maliwanag dahil payak na impormasyon lang ang nakalagay sa Statement of Assets, Liabilities ang Networth nito ukol sa mahabang listahan ng mga ari-arian nito. they were unclear because only limited information regarding his long list of properties was given in his Statement of Assets, Liabilities and Net Worth. <12> Ang natatandaan natin, mismong si Pangulong Noynoy ang nag-utos sa imbestigasyon kay Juan at lagi namang sinasabi nitong hayaan ang katotohanan na lumabas sa mga imbestigasyon, kabilang na ang mga isinasagawa laban sa kanyang mga KKK. as we recall, President Noynoy himself ordered the investigation on Juan and he always said the truth would come out of the investigation, including those being carried out against his KKK. <13> Para sa akin, parekoy, bigyan natin ng benefit of doubt si PNoy. for me, my man, let's give PNoy the benefit of the doubt. <14> Malay nating sa kabila ng pagtatanggol niya sa kanyang mga tauhan, eh, naririyan din ang pagtanggap niya ng katotohanang mayroon ding hindi tumatahak sa Matuwid na Daan? who knows? despite defending his staff, there is also his acceptance of the truth that there are really those who don't follow the righteous path. <15> Kung nagagawa niyang i-expose ang kanyang mga kalaban sa pOlitika, magagawa rin niya ito sa hanay ng kanyang mga kasangga. if he can expose his political enemies, he can also do the same to his allies.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_64461152 <1> DSWD tutok sa family planning By Jun Tadios DSWD is focused on family planning by Jun Tadios <2> January 22, 2017 January 22, 2017 <3> Tututukan ng Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) ang implementasyon ng social protection program para sa mga Filipino partikular ang family planning at reproductive health. the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) will focus on the implementation of the social protection program for the Filipinos, particularly, the family planning and reproductive health. <4> Ayon kay Secretary­ Judy Taguiwalo, isa ang DSWD sa naatasan ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte na manguna sa implemetasyon ng Exe­cutive Order No.12 o ang “Attaining and Sustaining ‘Zero Unmet Need for Family Planning’ Through the Strict Implementation of the Responsible Parenthood and ­Reproductive Health Act, Providing Funds Therefor, and For Other Purposes.” according to Secretary Judy Taguiwalo, DSWD is one of those mandated by President Rodrigo Duterte to lead the implementation of Executive Order No. 12 or the "Attaining and Sustaining 'Zero Unmet Need for Family Planning' through the Strict Implementation of the Responsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Act, Providing Funds, therefore, and for other Purposes." <5> Kabilang sa 10-point socio-economic agenda ng Duterte administration ang pagpapalakas at pagpapalaganap sa Res­ponsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Act of 2012 (RPRH) bilang pangunahing option ­para sa financial at family planning. included in the 10-point socio-economic agenda of the Duterte administration is the strengthening and propagation of the Responsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Act of 2012 (RPRH) as primary option for financial and family planning. <6> “We want couples and families to engage in family planning because it will help ensure the health of mothers, ­unborn babies, and young children,” wika ni Taguiwalo.- "we want couples and families to engage in family planning because it will help ensure the health of mothers, unborn babies, and young children," Taguiwalo said.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_22797975 <1> ‘DOH, di handa sa banta ng Ebola’ 'DOH, unprepared to the threat of Ebola' <2> Hindi totoong handa ang gobyerno ng Pilipinas sa banta ng Ebola virus kung mapunta ang nakamamatay na sakit dito sa bansa, ayon sa mga kawaning pangkalusugan, na nagprotesta sa harap ng tanggapan ng Department of Health (DOH). it is untrue that the Philippine government is ready to the threat of Ebola virus in case the deadly illness comes into the country, according to health sector employees, who protested in front of the office of the Department of Health (DOH). <3> Taliwas ito sa sinasabi ni DOH Sec. Enrique Ona na handa umano ang pamahalaan para sa Ebola. this is contrary to the statements of DOH secretary Enrique Ona when he said that the government is ready for Ebola. <4> Nakahanda na raw ang mga pasilidad partikular sa Research Institute for Tropical Medicine, San Lazaro Hospital, at Lung Center of the Philippines. he claimed that facilities are ready particularly at the Research Institute of Tropical Medicine, San Lazaro Hospital, and Lung Center of the Philippines. <5> Itinuturing na nakakaalarmang epidemiko ang Ebola virus sa buong mundo na kumitil na sa buhay ng libu-libong mamamayan sa Africa ngayong taon. Ebola virus is considered as an alarming epidemic worldwide which claimed the lives of thousands of people at Africa this year. <6> Hindi totoong handa being prepared is untrue <7> Ayon sa Alliance of Health Workers (AHW), hindi magawang tugunan ng gobyerno ang mga sakit na pumapatay sa Pilipino araw-araw gaya ng tuberculosis (TB) at tigdas (na pawang may mga lunas), kaya walang kasiguraduhan ang gobyerno na matutugunan nito ang sakit na Ebola. according to the Alliance of Health Workers (AHW), the government cannot manage the diseases that kill the Filipinos daily like tuberculosis (TB) and measles (which has cures), therefore, there is no assurance that the government can manage the Ebola disease. <8> Ayon sa datos mismo ng DOH, nasa 63 katao ang namamatay araw-araw dahil sa sakit na TB. according to the data of DOH itself, around 63 people die everyday due to the TB disease. <9> Nasa 97 porsiyento naman ng 16,743 naitalang kaso ng tigdas ang namatay mula Enero 1 hanggang Agosto 9, 2014 ng DOH. around 97 percent of the recorded 16,743 cases of measles died since January 1 until August 9, 2014 from DOH. <10> “Taun-taon, libu-libong bata ang namamatay sa pagtatae at pulmonya bago umabot sa edad na limang taon sa Pilipinas. "anually, thousands of children die of diarrhea and pneumonia before reaching the age of five in the Philippines. <11> Hindi pa rin nasasagot ng gobyerno na pito sa bawat sampung Pilipinong namamatay ang hindi man lang nakakakita ng doktor. the government still cannot answer that seven out of ten Filipino die without ever seeing a doctor. <12> Ano ang kahandaan ng gobyerno sa Ebola?” ayon kay Sean Velchez, presidente ng National Orthopedic Health Workers Union-AHW. what preparedness do the government have against Ebola?" according to Sean Velchez, president of National Orthopedic Health Workers Union-AHW. <13> Dagdag pa ni Velchez, ang Amerika na isang makapangyarihang bansa at may mas abanteng teknolohiya sa medisina para sa Ebola ay may isang ang kumpirmadong namatay. Velchez added, America, which is one of the most powerful countries and has more advanced medical technology for Ebola, has one confirmed dead. <14> Kabilang din ang dalawa pang nurse na napaulat na nahawa. including two more nurses who are said to be infected. <15> Naaalarma din ang nasabing grupo sa sinabi ng DOH sa Senado at sa mga mamamayan na handa ang mga ospital pero sa aktuwal na walang nakahandang pasilidad para sa mga pasyente ng Ebola maliban sa container vans. the said group is alarmed of the statement by DOH at the Senate and to the nation that hospitals are ready but in actuality, no facilities are prepared for patients of Ebola aside from container vans. <16> Wala rin umanong trainings na isinasagawa pa ang DOH at walang sapat na protective equipments para sa mga health workers, sabi ni Jossel Ebesate, pangulo ng AHW, sa Pinoy Weekly. no trainings were ever conducted by the DOH and there is not enough protective equipment for the health workers, said Jossel Ebesate, president of AHW, at Pinoy Weekly. <17> “’Yung BSL (biosafety level) na kailangan para sa Ebola ay nasa level 4. "the BSL (biosafety level) needed for Ebola is at level 4. <18> Nasa level 2 pa lang ang Pilipinas sa kasalukuyan. Philippines is at level 2 at present. <19> Ganitong pagtingin pa lamang paano ang gagawin sa mga pasyenteng may Ebola,” ayon kay Ebesate. still only at this regard, what will be done to patients with Ebola," according to Ebesate. <20> Overworked, Underpaid overworked, underpaid <21> Sa kabila ng banta ng Ebola, nanatili pa rin kalagayan ng mga kawaning pangkalusugan sa mga pampublikong ospital. despite the threat of Ebola, state of health workers remain the same at public hospitals. <22> “Nanatiling overworked at underpaid ang mga nurse at kawani sa mga pampublikong ospital natin. "remaining as overworked and underpaid are the nurses and employees of our public hospitals. <23> Mapanganib din (ito) para sa health workers dahil mismong mga gamit sa ospital ay wala para maproteksiyunan sila. this is dangerous also for health workers because supplies itself at the hospital are unavailable for use to protect them. <24> May health workers nga na sila ang bumibili ng sarili nilang protective gears sa pang-araw-araw,” ani Robert Mendoza, pangkalahatang kalihim ng AHW. some health workers even buy their own protective gears for everyday," said Robert Mendoza, general secretary of AHW <25> Sa kasalukuyan, tumatanggap ang isang health worker ng salary grade 1 o P9,000 kada buwan. presently, a health worker receives a salary grade 1 or P9,000 per month. <26> Tumatanggap naman ang nurse 1 ng salary grade 11 na P18,600 kada buwan. meanwhile, a nurse 1 receives a salary grade 11 which is P18,600 per month. <27> “Ang mga sahod namin ay maaaring mas mataas kumpara sa ibang pribadong ospital tulad ng sinasabi ni Usec. Ted Herbosa. "our salaries may be higher compared to other private hospitals as said by Undersecretary Ted Herbosa. <28> Pero hindi pa rin ito sapat para sa gastusin ng aming pamilya kada buwan. but this is still not enough for the expenses of our families every month. <29> Kinakailangan pa naming mag-loan kung saan-saan. it is has become necessary for us to get loan from everywhere. <30> Sadyang mababa ang natatanggap namin sa cost of living na P32,000 kada buwan (base sa datos ng Ibon Foundation) para sa isang pamilya na may anim na miyembro. we certainly earn less with the cost of living which is P32,000 per month (based from data of Ibon Foundation) for a family with six members. <31> Kailangan naming P25,000 kada buwan para sa nurse 1 pagpasok nito,” ayon kay Ebesate. we need P25,000 per month for a nurse 1 upon their entry," according to Ebesate. <32> Mas mababa naman ang natatanggap ng community nurses na nasa P5,000 kada buwan at pawang mga kontraktuwal, ayon kay Emy Ilag, mula sa Nars ng Bayan. community nurses even receive lower with P5,000 per month and all of whom are contractual, according to Emy Ilag, from Nars ng Bayan. <33> Maglaan ng sapat na pondo allocate enough funds <34> Para sa mga kawaning pangkalusugan, dapat maglaan ang gobyerno ng sapat na pondo para sa sektor ng kalusugan. for the health workers, the government should allocate enough funds for the health sector. <35> Pero imbes na seryosong pondohan ang pampublikong mga ospital, isinasailalim ito sa pagsasapribado sa ilalim ng programang Public-Private Partnerships (PPP) ng adminstrasyong Aquino, ayon sa AHW. but instead of seriously funding government hospitals, they are subjected to privatization under the program Public-Private Partnerships (PPP) of the Aquino administration, according to AHW. <36> “Imbes na dagdagan ang badyet para sa mga ospital, tulad ng Philippine Orthopedic Center (POC) na nangangailangan ng P5.6 Bilyon para sa modernisasyon ng ospital, isinailalim ito ng DOH sa PPP kasama ang Megawide World Citi Consortium,” ayon kay Velchez. "instead of increasing the budget for hospitals, like the Philippine Orthopedic Center (POC) which need P5.6 billion for the modernization of the hospital, DOH subjected it to PPP together with Megawide World City Consortium," according to Velchez. <37> Tumatanggap ang POC ng 6,000 hanggang 7,000 pasyente kada taon. POC receives 6,000 to 7,000 patients every year. <38> Nasa 80 hanggang 90 porsiyento nito ang mula sa pinakamahihirap na pamilya. around 80 to 90 percent of this come from the poorest family. <39> Paliwanag ni Velchez, kahit sa pampublikong mga ospital ay halos di na rin abot-kamay sa mahihirap. Velchez explained, even public hospitals become unreachable for the poor. <40> Marami sa mahihirap na may-sakit, hindi na nagpapagamot at nabibilang sa mga namamatay na di man lang nakakapagpatingin sa doktor. many of the poor are sick, would not get treatment and included in the deaths were not able to even consult a doctor. <41> Nasa 72 pampublikong ospital pa sa bansa ang nakatakdang isailalim sa PPP ng administrasyong Aquino. around 72 public hospitals in the country are subject to PPP of the Aquino administration. <42> Kabilang sa iba pang sasailalim sa pribatisasyon o “korporatisasyon” ang Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center, Cagayan Valley Medical Center, Baguio General Hospital and Medical Center, Bicol Medical Center, Quirino Memorial Medical Center, Amang Rodriguez Medical Center, at San Lazaro Hospital. some of those subject for privatization or "corporatization" include Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center, Cagayan Valley Medical Center, Baguio General Hospital and Medical Center, Bicol Medical Center, Quirino Memorial Medical Center, Amang Rodriguez Medical Center, and San Lazaro Hospital. <43> Kasama pa rito ang Eastern Visayas Regional Medical Center, Western Visayas Medical Center, Northern Mindanao Medical Center, Southern Philippines Medical Center, Zamboanga City Medical Center, Cotobato Regional and Medical Center, Caraga Regional Hospital, Davao Regional Hospital, at iba pa. also included are Eastern Visayas Regional Medical Center, Western Visayas Medical Center, Northern Mindanao Medical Center, Southern Philippines Medical Center, Zamboanga City Medical Center, Cotobato Regional and Medical Center, Caraga Regional Hospital, Davao Regional Hospital, and more. <44> PPP ang programa ng administrasyong Aquino para hikayatin ang mga negosyante at malalaking korporasyon na pasukin ang dating pampublikong mga ospital at pasilidad para diumano sa pagmomodernisa sa mag kagamitan nito. PPP is a program of the Aquino administration encouraging businessmen and large corporations to enter old public hospitals and facilities to supposedly modernize the equipment there. <45> Pero binabatikos ito ng maraming kritiko at grupo, na nagsasabing pagnenegosyo at hindi serbisyo publiko ang pakay ng pribadong sektor kaya lalong nahihirapan ang mahihirap na magpagamit sa nasabing mga ospital. but this is criticized by many critics and groups, saying that business and not public service is the purpose of the private sector which will only make it harder for the poor to have access to the said hospitals. <46> “Kailangang baguhin ang sistemang nagpapabaya sa ating departamento. "change is needed to the system that is neglecting our department. <47> Pabaya at sinungaling ang DOH. DOH is negligent and liar <48> Kailangang may managot sa sistematikong pagpapabaya sa mga mamamayan. someone needs to be responsible for the systematic negligence of the citizens. <49> Dapat patalsikin na sa puwesto si Sec. secretary should be ousted of his position. <50> Ona,” ayon kay Velchez. Ona," according to Velchez.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_49970763 <1> Freedom Freedom <2> by Maria Concepcion Montajes by Maria Concepcion Montajes <3> March 14, 2012 March 14, 2012 <4> Hindi ko alam kung paano uumpisahan ang kwento ng aking anak na si Freedom. I don't know how to start the story of my child, Freedom. <5> Siya si Maricon Montajes. she is Maricon Montajes. <6> Si Freedom ngayon ay isang bilanggong pulitikal sa Batangas Provincial Jail. Freedom is now a political prisoner in Batangas Provincial Jail. <7> Ang aming mag-anak ay mula sa siyudad ng Dabaw, sa Silangang Mindanao. our relatives are from the city of Davao, in Southern Mindanao. <8> Ang alam ko lang, ipinanganak ko siya noong Pebrero 25. all I know is, she was born in February 25. <9> Makabuluhan ang petsang ito para sa marami sa atin na sinupil, sinikil at nawalan ng laya’t mga mahal sa buhay sa panahon ng diktadura. this date is significant for many of us who were terrorized, who were oppressed and who lost their freedom and loved ones during the time of dictatorial. <10> Noong Pebrero 25, nagtapos ang madilim na yugtong iyon sa ating kasaysayan. on February 25, that dark chapter of history ended. <11> Kaya nga ang naging palayaw ni Maricon ay Freedom. hence, Maricon's nickname is Freedom. <12> Hindi niya masyadong mabigkas nang mabuti ang “f” sa “freedom” kaya nang lumaon ay tinawag siyang “Eedom” ng karamihan. she can't properly pronounce the "f" in "freedom", hence, as time passed, she was called "Eedom" by most. <13> Minsan nabasa ko sa blog niya na hindi niya pala masyadong gusto itong palayaw niya. some time, I read in her blog that she doesn't like this nickname that much. <14> Pero panahon na rin lang ang naging dahilan at naintindhan na niya ang ibig sabihin ng palayaw na ito. but it's only time that she finally understood the meaning of the nickname. <15> Estudyante si Eedom at kumukuha ng kurso sa Pelikula sa UP Diliman. Eedom is a student taking up a course of Film in UP Diliman. <16> Hunyo 3, 2010: Inaresto siya bahay ng isang magsasaka sa Taysan, Batangas kasama ang mga kabataang sina Ronilo Baes and Romiel Canete. June 3, 2010: she was arrested in the house of one farmer in Taysan, Batangas, along with teenagers, Ronilo Baes and Romiel Canete. <17> Sinampahan sila ng mga kriminal na kaso. a criminal case was filed against them. <18> Isa si Freedom sa pinakabatang bilanggong pulitikal sa bansa. Freedom is one of the youngest political prison of the country. <19> Dalawang beses na kaming nagdiwang ng kaarawan ni Freedom sa loob ng bilangguan. we celebrated Freedom's birthday in prison twice already. <20> Kaya ang Freedom, hindi ko na makita, at minsan, hindi ko na alam ang kahulugan. Freedom, I can't see it anymore, sometimes, I don't even know what it means. <21> Kasunod ng kaarawan niya ang iskedyul ng hearing sa korte nitong Pebrero 29. after her birthday is her schedule of hearing in court this February 29. <22> Halos isa’t kalahating taon na sa piitan sina Eedom nang sa wakas ay matuloy ang pre-trial ng kaso nila noong Nobyembre. it's been almost a year and a half that Eedom's in prison, and finally, her pre-trial case will push through. <23> Nito pa lang nagsimula ang mga pormal na pagdinig. the formal hearings have just started. <24> Unang dininig ang kasong frustrated homicide na isinampa laban kay Ronilo Baes. the case of frustrated homicide filed against Ronilo Baes was first heard. <25> Hindi sumipot ang opisyal ng Air Force na paksa ng reklamo at binaril diumano ni Ronilo. official of Air Force, subject of complaint and allegedly shot by Ronilo, didn't come. <26> Sumunod naman ang pagbista sa illegal possession of explosives and ammunition na kasong isinampa sa kanilang tatlo. caught with illegal possession of explosives and ammunition was the next case filed against the three. <27> Dahil maselan ang mga ebidensya, hindi ito ipinrisenta sa korte. because the evidences are delicate, it wasn't presented at court. <28> Magkakaroon na lamang daw ng ocular inspection bago ang susunod na hearing sa Abril 25. there will be an ocular inspection before the next hearing on April 25 instead. <29> Pagkatapos noon, ang susunod na hearing ay gaganapin sa Hunyo 13. after that, the next hearing will be on June 13. <30> Ang kasunod sa hearing na iyon ay sa Agosto 22 pa. the next hearing after that will be on August 22. <31> At iyon ay kung masunod lang ang mga iskedyul — at hindi mapo-postpone na gaya ng karaniwan sa loob ng dalawang taon naming pagsubaybay sa kanilang kaso. and that's if the schedule will be followed - and not postponed like the usual, as what we have observed with the case, the past two years. <32> Hindi simpleng inip at bagot ang nararamdaman ko. I don't feel just a simple impatience and boredom. <33> Hindi lang simpleng pagkasaid ng pinansya o pasensya ang aking pinagdaraanan. not just a simple exhaustion of finance and patience is what I'm going through. <34> Habang binibilang ko ang bawat araw ng pagkakait ng kalayaan at katarungan para kay Freedom, hindi ko na matanaw ang daang matuwid na sinasabi ng Pangulo. while I counted the days of freedom and justice deprived from Freedom, I can't see the right road the President says. <35> Mas lalong hindi ko maintidihan ang sinasabi niya na “Kayo ang boss ko!” habang ipinapahayag din ng pamahalaan na “Walang bilanggong pulitikal sa Pilipinas.” what I can't really understand is his statement, "you are my boss!", while the government also says "there's no political prisoner in the Philippines." <36> Sa ilalim ni PNoy, mahigit 80 na ang inaresto at ibinilanggo nang walang kasalanan. under PNoy, more than 80 people who had no offense were arrested and put to jail. <37> Mahigit 340 na ang patuloy na nakapiit at binabansagan ng pamahalaan na mga “kriminal,” dahil sa kanilang mga paniniwala at paninindigang pampulitika. more than 340 are in jail and identified by the government as "criminals," because of their political stand and belief. <38> Ngayong buwan ay Buwan ng Kababaihan. this month is Women's month. <39> Nitong Marso 8, ipinagdiwang ng mundo ang Araw ng Kababaihan. last March 8, the world celebrated Women's day. <40> Ano nga ba ang dapat ipanawagan? what do we really need to call for? <41> Ang alam ko lang ay may 36 na kababaihang bilanggong pulitikal sa bansa, kasama doon ang anak kong si Freedom, si Charity… si Vanessa.. what I know is we have 36 women political prisoners in the country, which includes my daughter, Freedom, Charity, Vanessa. <42> Dalawang taon na kaming nananawagan para sa kanilang kagyat na pagpapalaya. it has been two years since we've been calling for their immediate freedom. <43> Ang alam ko lang ay may mahigit 340 bilanggong pulitikal sa buong Pilipinas. what I know is we have more than 340 political prisoners in the Philippines. <44> Ang alam ko lang ay kaliwa’t kanan na ang mga panawagan upang igawad sa kanila ang inaasam na kalayaan. what I know is it has been a left and right call for them to be given the freedom they've been looking forward to. <45> Ang alam ko lang ay dapat umalpas ang lahat sa dilim na kinasasadlakan natin sa ngayon. what I know is everyone should be freed from the darkness we are trapped in now. <46> Freedom! Freedom! <47> …Freedom… Sadyang totoo lamang ang salitang ito bilang palayaw ng aking anak. Freedom! this word is only true to my daughter's nickname.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_11887695 <1> South Cotabato nakatakdang magsagawa ng anti-malaria operations South Cotabato is scheduled to perform anti-malaria operations. <2> June 06, 2016 June 06, 2016 <3> LUNGSOD NG KORONADAL , South Cotabato, Hun. 6 (PIA) – Apat na anti-malaria border operations ang nakatakdang isagawa ng Provincial Malaria Team ng South Cotabato sa ikalawang bahagi ng taon, ayon sa isang opisyal dito. City of Koronadal, South Cotabato, June 6 (PIA) - four anti-malaria border operations are scheduled to be done by the Provincial Malaria Team of South Cotabato during the second part of the year, according to one official here. <4> Sa isang panayam, sinabi ni Jose Barroquillo, provincial mosquito-borne disease focal person, na kaugnay pa rin ang gawain sa pagsisikap ng pamahalaang panlalawigan na maipagpapatuloy ang estado na lalawigan na walang kaso ng malaria na sa ngayon na nasa ika-anim na taon na. in one interview, Jose Barroquillo, provincial mosquito-borne disease focal person, said that the activity is still in relation to efforts of the provincial government to continue with the status of the province, which has no case of malaria that it now on its sixth year. <5> Ani Barroquillo, sakop ng anti-malaria border operations ang 18 barangay na nasa pagitan ng mga bayan ng Tboli sa South Cotabato at Maasim sa Sarangani at mga barangay sa pagitan ng Lake Sebu at Maitum sa Sarangani at sa mga barangay sa pagitan ng Lake Sebu at mga bayan ng Bagumbayan at Palimbang sa Sultan Kudarat. according to Barroquillo, included in the anti-malaria border operations are the 18 villages between the towns of Tboli in South Cotabato and Maasim in Sarangani, and the villages between Lake Sebu and Maitum in Sarangani, and the villages between Lake Sebu and the towns of Bagumbayan and Palimbang in Sultan Kudarat. <6> Bukod sa pagtiyak kung may mga lamok na maaring magdala ng sakit na malaria sa mga naturang lugar, mamamahagi rin ang malaria team ng mga kulambo na may panlaban sa lamok, pamalit sa ibinigay sa mga residente mga limang taon na ang nakalipas. aside from checking if there are mosquitoes that could bring malaria disease in the said places, the malaria team will also distribute mosquito nets that have protection against mosquitoes, as a replacement for what was given to the residents about five years ago. <7> Mahalaga ang anti-malari operations, ayon kay Barroquillo upang mapanatili ang kalagayan nito na walang kaso ng malaria kahit na may naiulat na 170 na kaso ng malaria sa karatig lalawigan ng Sultan Kudarat noong nakalipas na taon. the anti-malaria operations is important, according to Barroquillo, in order to maintain its status of having no cases of malaria even if 170 cases of malaria were reported in the neighboring province of Sultan Kudarat during the past year. <8> Matatandaang simula 2000 hanggang sa kasalukuyan wala nang naitalang “indigenous” na kaso ng malaria sa buong South Cotabato. it can be recalled that since 2000 up to the present, there has been no recorded "indigenous" case of malaria in entire South Cotabato. <9> Kasalukuyan itong sumasailalim sa evaluation ng World Health Organization upang kilalaning “malaria-free province.” it is currently going through an evaluation by the World Health Organization to be recognized as a "malaria-free province". <10> (DEDoguiles-PIA 12) (DEDoguiles-PIA 12)

sumama na ako sa pangkat ng CBHP (Community Based Health Program) na nagbalik-dalaw sa ilang lugar na sinalanta ng bagyong Pablo sa Surigao del Sur at Davao Oriental. after an interview about the livelihood assistance project for farmers in Surigao del Sur, I joined the team of CBHP (Community Based Health Program) in revisiting some areas devastated by typhoon Pablo in Surigao del Sur and Davao Oriental. <3> Umalis kami sa Tandag ng ala-una ng madaling araw at narating namin ang unang baryo na sinisilbihan ng CBHP nang bandang alas-8 ng umaga. we left Tandag at one o'clock in the morning and arrived at the first village served by CBHP at around 8 o'clock. <4> Bagama’t nakita ko na sa telebisyon ang mga imahen ng pinsalang dulot ng bagyo, matindi pa rin ang aking gulat-hinagpis nang mapaloob ako mismo sa tunay na eksena ng mga wasak na kabahayan at mga pananim. although I have seen images of the damage caused by the typhoon on television, I was still shocked as I myself faced the scene of destroyed homes and crops. <5> Mabilis na sumagitsit sa aking isipan ang mga nakakapangilabot na larawan ng Hiroshima, Vietnam, at Iraq matapos ang pambobomba ng Amerika. immediately, dreadful images of Hiroshima, Vietnam, and Iraq after being bombed by America entered my mind. <6> Sa sandaling iyon, lubusan kong naramdaman ang malubhang pinsala ng bagyong Pablo, hindi lamang sa mga tirahan, kabuhayan, kapaligiran, at kalusugan ng mga tao kundi pati na rin ang malubhang epekto ng pagbabago sa klima, kasakiman ng malalaking negosyo (pagmimina, plantasyon ng saging, atbp) at ng kapabayaan ng gobyerno. in that moment, I deeply felt not only the immense damage brought about by typhoon Pablo on the houses, livelihood, surroundings, and well-being of the people, but the serious effects of climate change, corporate greed (mining, banana plantation, et cetera), and government neglect as well. <7> Sa nagngangalit kong kalooban, hindi ko na alintana ang pamamanhid ng aking mga paa sa mahigit tatlong oras na pagkasalpak sa likod ng motorsiklong kung tawagin ay “habal-habal.” in my anger, I didn't even care about the numbing of my feet from more than three hours of riding on the back of a motorcycle called "habal-habal." <8> Apat kaming sakay nito at nakaipit ako sa likuran ng drayber. there were four of us riding on it and I was squeezed behind the driver. <9> Marami sa mga biktima ang malayo sa sentro ng barangay at kabayanan at hindi naaabutan ng tulong ng gobyerno, media at mga karaniwang organisasyong sibiko. many of the victims lived far away from the heart of the village and the city, and could not access government assistance, media, and civic organizations. <10> Ang mga lugar na ito ang pangunahing binibigyang pansin ng CBHP at ng mga kaalyado nitong mga samahan, kabilang na ang kilusang magbubukid sa rehiyon. these areas were prioritized by the CBHP and its allies, including the farmer movement in the region. <11> Pinuntahan na rin namin ang isa sa mga pinakamatinding apektado ng bagyo sa Davao Oriental, ang bayan ng Cateel, na katabi ng mga apektadong lugar sa Surigao del Sur. we also went to one of the areas most affected by the typhoon in Davao Oriental, the town of Cateel, which is situated right next to the affected areas in Surigao del Sur. <12> Grabe talaga ang pinsala, parang binagsakan ng bomba atomika talaga! The damage was so great, it really seemed an atomic bomb had been dropped on the area! <13> Wasak na wasak ang halos lahat ang mga istruktura at mga halaman, lalo na ang mga niyog. all the buildings and plants were utterly destroyed, especially the coconut trees. <14> Ang bayan ng Cateel ang madalas naipapakita sa telebisyon at marami ang mga ahensya ng gobyerno at mga organisasyong sibiko ang pumupunta na rito, bagama’t hindi pa rin sapat ang mga tulong na umaabot sa mga mamamayan dahil sa labis na pinsala at sa kakulangan ng maayos na sistema ng pamamahagi ng tulong galing sa iba’t ibang grupo. The town of Cateel is often shown on television and many government agencies and civic organizations have since visited it. However, the assistance they provided remain greatly insufficient for the victims due to excessive damage and the lack of a proper distribution system for assistance from various groups. <15> Bandang alas singko ng hapon, humiwalay na ako sa pangkat CBHP ng Tandag at sumakay na ako ng bus patungong Davao City upang sumama naman sa medical mission ng BALSA Mindanao, ang multisektoral na organisasyong binuo ng mga progresibong grupo para tumulong sa taong-bayan sa mga ganitong uri ng kalamidad. at around five o'clock in the afternoon, I left the team of CBHP in Tandag and rode a bus going to Davao City to join the medical mission of BALSA Mindanao, the multi-sectoral organization formed by progressive groups to help victims in these types of calamities. <16> Sa dinaanan ng aking sinakyang bus, marami pa rin akong nakitang mga nasirang kabahayan na tila hindi nadadatnan ng tulong. as I rode the bus, I still saw many devastated homes along the way that did not get any assistance. <17> Dumating ako sa looban ng UCCP (United Church of Christ), ang sentro ng BALSA Mindanao sa Davao, lampas hatinggabi na. by the time I arrived at the UCCP (United Church of Christ), the center of BALSA Mindanao in Davao, it was already past midnight. <18> Bumiyahe ang aming pangkat alas kwatro ng umaga kaya halos wala rin akong tulog nang gabing iyon. our team traveled at four o'clock in the morning so I had little to no sleep at all that night. <19> Dumating kami sa Laak, Compostela Valley bandang alas-10 ng umaga. we arrived at Laak, Compostela Valley around 10 o'clock in the morning. <20> Matindi rin ang epekto ng bagyo roon at napakahirap puntahan dahil sira-sira ang mga daan at tumawid pa kami ng ilog na halos hanggang dibdib ang lalim. The area was also greatly affected by the typhoon and it was incredibly difficult to get there due to the damaged roads, and we even had to cross a river that was chest-deep. <21> Mabuti na lang at malaking dump truck ang sinakyan namin. good thing we rode a fairly large dump truck. <22> Kumain muna kami ng almusal-tanghalian bago nag-umpisa ng medical clinic at namigay ng pagkain at gamit pantawid kalamidad. we ate brunch first before the medical clinic started and we distributed food and relief goods. <23> Dalawa lang kaming doktor, kasama ko si Dr. only two of us were doctors. I was with Doctor <24> Lynn Redoble, dati kong estudyante na nag-full-time sa CBHP-Southern Mindanao. Lynn Redoble, a former student of mine who is now a full time medical practitioner at CBHP-Southern Mindanao. <25> Karamihan sa may sakit ay mga bata; ubo’t sipon, trangkaso, brongkitis, sakit sa balat, sugat, atbp. most of those needing medical assistance were children with cough and colds, flu, bronchitis, skin disorders, wounds, et cetera. <26> May dalawang pasyente na kailangan i-refer sa ospital kaya problema kung paano madadala sa ospital (hihingi ng tulong sa lokal na pamahalaan at sa iba pa dahil hindi kaya ng BALSA Mindanao na tustusan ang gastusin). there were two patients that needed to be brought to the hospital, which brought about the problem of how to transport them to the hospital (ask for assistance from the local government and other organizations because BALSA Mindanao couldn't shoulder the expenses). <27> Mahigit 200 ang naging pasyente namin. we had more than 200 patients. <28> Nagsara sa pagtanggap ng pasyente pagsapit ng alas-5 ng hapon dahil baka raw hindi kami makatawid sa ilog pabalik sa Davao. we stopped taking in patients at 5 o'clock in the afternoon because we may no longer be able to cross the river back to Davao. <29> Medyo mabigat ang aking damdamin nang magsara dahil mayroon pang ilang katao na galing pa sa malayo na humahabol pa sanang magpakonsulta. my feelings were quite heavy when we closed because there were still a few people from far-off places who wanted to catch the consultation. <30> Ganunpaman, kinailangan na namin ang umalis, hindi kami maaaring magtagal pa sa lugar ayon sa mga nag-organisa. however, we needed to leave, since we couldn't stay any longer in that area according to the organizers. <31> Nakarating kami sa UCCP Davao halos hatinggabi na rin. it was almost midnight when we arrived in UCCP Davao. <32> Sa tindi ng pagod at puyat, hindi ko na nakuhang maligo, diretso na ako sa higaan. due to fatigue and lack of sleep, I couldn't bring myself to take a bath and went straight for the bed. <33> Subali’t hindi rin ako nakatulog nang maayos dahil tumindi ang ubo ko (na nag-umpisa na sa Surigao pa lamang) at dahil na rin sa nag-aalimpuyong damdamin at kaisipan sa mga pangyayaring aking namasdan at naranasan. however, I had a hard time sleeping due to the severity of my cough (which started in Surigao) and also due to the constant emotional and mental distress brought about by everything I had seen and experienced. <34> Tumitilaok na halos ang manok nang ako’y maidlip, matapos akong uminom ng lagundi at sinta. The rooster was already crowing by the time I fell asleep after I drank lagundi tea and beloved. <35> Nagpahinga na lamang ako hanggang tumungo ako sa airport ng Davao pauwing Maynila. I just rested until I headed to Davao airport on the way back to Manila.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_54943891 <1> Mga graduating college students hinahanda ng DOLE sa pagpasok sa trabaho graduating college students are being prepared by DOLE for going to work. <2> March 28, 2016 March 28, 2016 <3> LUNGSOD NG KORONADAL, South Cotabato, City of Koronadal, South Cotabato, <4> Mar. 28 (PIA) -- Isang seminar ang isinasagawa ngayon ng Department of Labor and Employment 12 upang ihanda ang mga graduating students sa kanilang pagpasok sa sektor ng mga mangagawa. March 28 (PIA) - a seminar is now being conducted by the Department of Labor and Employment 12 to prepare graduating students for their entry into the sector of workers. <5> Layunin ng programa na Labor Education for Graduating Students (LEGS) ang maturuan ang mga magtatapos ng pag-aaral at mga naghahanap ng trabaho ang tamang pag-uugali bilang mangagawa at kultura ng produktibo at desenteng paggawa at katulad ng mga usapin, ayon kay DOLE 12 Regional Director Ofelia Domingo. it is the goal of the program, Labor Education for Graduating Students (LEGS), to teach those who are about to finish their studies and are looking for work about the proper attitude as a worker and a culture of a productive and decent labor and similar topics, according to DOLE 12 Regional Director Ofelia Domingo. <6> Itinuturo rin sa seminar ang mga kailangang gawin habang nag-aaplay ng trabaho, mga karapatan ng manggagawa at mga amo, mga benepisyong dapat matanggap tulad ng PhilHealth at SSS coverage at marami pang iba. also taught in the seminar are things that need to be done while applying for work, the rights of workers and employers, benefits that should be received like PhilHealth and SSS coverage, and many more. <7> Katuwang ng DOLE 12 sa pagpapatupad ng LEGS ang mga Public Employment Service Office (PESO). Public Employment Service Office (PESO) is the partner of DOLE 12 in implementing LEGS. <8> Sa datos ng DOLE 12, sa kasalukuyan umabot na sa mahigit 30,000 graduating students at mga naghahanap ng trabaho sa SOCCSKSARGEN Region ang sumailalim sa LEGS Seminar. currently, in the data of DOLE 12, almost 30,000 graduating students and job seekers in SOCCSKSARGEN Region are undergoing the LEGS seminar. <9> Sa pagtatapos ng school year 2015-2016, inaasahang halos 21,000 ang madadagdag sa labor force ng Rehiyon 12, ayon sa datos ng Commission on Higher Education 12. at the end of school year 2015-2016, it is expected that almost 21,000 will be added to the labor force in Region 12, according to data of the Commission on Higher Education 12. <10> Dagdag ni Director Domingo, maaring humiling sa DOLE 12 ang mga paaralan para sa pagsasagawa ng LEGS seminar para sa kanilang mga graduating classes. Director Domingo added, schools can ask DOLE 12 to conduct LEGS seminar for their graduating classes. <11> Kailangan lamang sumulat sa pinakamalapit na DOLE Provincial Office. (DEDoguiles-PIA 12) it is just required to write to the nearest DOLE Provincial Office. (DEDoguiles-PIA 12)

Harry Espela, hindi umano inaasahan ng Mati City Police ang nabanggit na drug testing na ipinag-utos ng Acting Chief of Police ng lungsod na si Chief Insp. Noel Asumen. according to DOPPO Director Supt. Harry Espela, the Mati City Police did not expect the mentioned drug testing which was mandated by the Acting Chief of Police of the city, Chief Insp. Noel Asumen. <3> Base sa resulta ng labo­ratory sample, nagpositibo sa paggamit ng shabu sina SPO4 Nollo Barsaman at PO2 Jesus Mante Jr. based on the results of the laboratory sample, SPO4 Nollo Barsaman and PO2 Jesus Mante Junior were positive in the use of meth. <4> kaya agad inaresto ang mga ito at sinampa­han ng kaso. therefore, they are immediately arrested and filed charges. <5> Nahulihan pa ng mga drug paraphernalia si Barsaman habang nahaharap naman sa kasong administratibo si Mante. drug paraphernalia is confiscated from Barsaman while Mante is facing an administrative case. <6> Sinabi ni Espela, magsasagawa pa sila ulit ng random drug testing bilang baha­gi ng inumpisahang crackdown ng Police Regional Office (PRO) 11 sa lahat ng police units ng DOPPO para matiyak na mali­nis ang kanilang mga tauhan. Espela said, they are going to conduct random drug testing again as part of the crackdown started by the Police Regional Office (PRO) 11 in all police units of DOPPO to ensure that their members are clean.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_37516175 <1> Tumalima sa mga alituntunin ng gubyernong bayan hinggil sa kampanya sa eleksyon comply with the regulations of the people's government regarding the election campaigns <2> Communist Party of the PhilippinesFebruary 17, 2013 Communist Party of the Philippines February 17, 2013 <3> Translation of: Abide by people's government guidelines regarding election campaigns translation of: abide by the people's government guidelines regarding election campaigns <4> Lahat ng kandidato at kanilang mga partidong lalahok sa eleksyon sa Mayo na planong magsagawa ng kanilang pampulitikang aktibidad sa loob ng teritoryo ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan ay dapat sumunod sa lahat ng umiiral na alituntunin at tiyaking makakuha ng permiso sa mga awtorisadong rebolusyonaryong komite. all candidates and their parties joining the election on May who plan to conduct their political activities inside the territory of the People's Democratic Government should follow all the ruling guidelines and make sure to obtain permission from the authorized revolutionary committee. <5> Tinitiyak ng mga gabay na ito na ang reaksyunaryong eleksyon ay maisasagawa na hindi malalabag ang mga karapatan at interes ng mamamayan at sa paraang mapayapapa, maayos at kapaki-pakinabang sa mamamayan. these guidelines are assuring that the reactionary election will be done without violating the rights and interests of the citizens and in a peaceful, orderly and beneficial way for the citizens. <6> Pahihintulutang makapasok sa mga teritoryo ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan ang mga kandidato at mga kinatawan nila upang makapangampanya kung susunod sila sa mga gabay kaugnay ng kondukta ng mga pampulitikang kampanyang may kaugnayan sa reaksyunaryong eleksyon. the candidates and their representatives are permitted to enter the territories of the People's Democratic Government to be able to campaign if they are going to follow the guidelines in relation to the conduct for political campaigns in relation to the reactionary election. <7> Pagbabawalan silang magsama ng kanilang pribadong armadong goons o militar, pulis o mga paramilitar na alalay. they are prohibited to bring along their private armed goons or military, police or paramilitary aide. <8> Hindi sila dapat hayaang takutin, bantaan o pwersahin ang mamamayan o gumamit ng dahas laban sa mga karibal na kampong pampulitika. they should not be tolerated to scare, threat or force the citizens or use violence against the opposing political camp. <9> Hindi sila dapat pahintulutang bumili ng boto o manuhol sa mga lider ng mga komunidad kapalit ng boto. they should not be allowed to buy votes or bribe the leaders of the communities in exchange of a vote. <10> Susunod sila sa mga iskedyul na itatakda ng mga lokal na komite upang maiwasang sumapaw sa iskedyul ng ibang kandidato at para di maging dahilan ng pagkaabala sa pang-ekonomya, pampulitika at pangkulturang mga aktibidad sa lugar. they are going to follow the schedules set by the local committees to avoid in overlapping the schedule of other candidates and for this not to be the cause of hassle in economical, political and cultural activities in the place. <11> Hihiikayatin silang magsagawa ng harapang pakikipagdayalogo sa mamamayan upang magkaroon sila ng pagkakataong marinig ang hinaing ng mamamayan at maipahayag ang kanilang opinyon at mailatag ang kanilang plataporma de gubyerno. they will be encouraged to do a face to face dialogue with the citizens in order for them to have a chance to listen to the complaints of the citizens and express their opinion and spread their platform of governance. <12> May karapatan ang Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan na pagbawalang pumasok ang mga kandidatong may mga seryosong krimen sa mamamayan at sa rebolusyonaryong kilusan. the People's Democratic Government has a right to prohibit the candidates with serious crimes to the citizens and to the revolutionary movement. <13> Kabilang dito ang mga sagadsaring korap na upisyal ng gubyerno, yaong may malalalang kaso ng pang-aabuso sa mga karapatang-tao, mga drug lords at yaong mga taong nagpapatakbo at nagbibigay-proteksyon sa mga kriminal na sindikato. included here are those downright corrupt officials of the government, those with severe cases of abuses on human rights, drug lords and those people who are running and giving protection to the criminal syndicates. <14> Babawalan din yaong mga kandidatong ginagamit ang kampanaya sa eleksyon para papasukin ang mga ahente sa paniktik ng militar at pulisya sa mga erya na nasa hurisdiksyon ng rebolusyonaryong awtoridad. will be prohibited also are those candidates who are using the election campaign to let the entry of spy agents of the military and police in the areas within the jurisdiction of the revolutionary authorities. <15> Ginawa ang mga gabay na ito ayon sa kahilingan ng sambayanang Pilipino. these guidelines are made in accordance to the plea of the Filipino people. <16> Malaon na silang biktima ng bulok na sistemang elektoral. long have they been victims of rotten electoral system. <17> Sa ilalim ng naghaharing sistema, nakapangyayari ang maruruming reaksyunarong pulitko, mga tiranikong panginoong maylupa at brutal na mga warlord at isinasailalim ang mamamayan sa pamumuwersa, pananakot at panunuhol sa kanilang tulak na “mahalal”. under the reigning system, exterminating are the dirty reactionary politicians, tyrant landlords and brutal warlord and subjugating the citizens through force, threat and bribe in their push to be elected. <18> Hindi kailanman tungkol sa demokratikong diskurso ang mga reaksyunaryong eleksyon, bagkus, pinagpapasyahan ito ng armadong lakas at yaman upang mamwersa at makapanuhol para makaupo sa poder. the reactionary election has never been about democratic discourses, instead, these are being decided on by the armed force and wealth to force and bribe in order to sit on power. <19> Kapag nasa poder, ginagamit na ng mga reaksyunaryong pulitikong ito ang burukrasya at mga mapaniil na instrumento nito upang pag-ibayuhin ang panunupil at pagsasamantala sa mamamayan. if already in power, these reactionary politicians are using the bureaucracy and the oppressive instruments to intensify the suppression and in taking advantage of the citizens. <20> Ang paglitaw at pagkakaroon ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan habang umiiral pa ang reaksyunaryong gubyerno ng malalaking panginoong maylupa at burgesya kumprador ay nagbibigay ng instrumento sa mamamayan para harapin ang reaksyunaryong eleksyon, labanan ang pinakabrutal at anti-demokratikong aspeto nito at makakuha ng pakinabang mula rito. the surfacing and having a People's Democratic Government while there is still a reigning reactionary government of huge landlords and bourgeoisie buyers is giving an instrument to the citizens to face the reactionary elections, fight against its most brutal and anti-democratic aspect and can get benefits from these. <21> Sa pagpapatupad ng mga alituntunin nito, epektibong nabawasan ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan ang mga insidente ng karahasang kaugnay ng kondukta ng reaksyunaryong eleksyon sa mga lugar ng hurisdiksyon nito. in implementing these guidelines, the People's Democratic Government effectively lessen the incidents of violence in relation to the conduct of reactionary election in the places within its jurisdiction. <22> Sa nakaraang mga taon, hinahamak ng reaksyunaryong rehimen at aramadong pwersa nito ang mga alituntuning sumasaklaw sa reaksyunaryong eleksyon sa loob ng mga lugar ng nasasakupan ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan. in the past years, the reactionary regime and its armed forces are degrading these guidelines encompassing the reactionary election in the places of jurisdiction by the People's Democratic Government. <23> Layon ng mapanirang kampanyang itong pagtakpan ang katotohanang epektibong gumagampan ang rebolusyonaryong kilusan ng kapangyarihang pang-estado at ang gayong kapangyarihang pang-estado ay malawak na kinikilala at nirerespeto. objective of this destructive campaign is to cover the truth that the revolutionary movement effectively fulfill its obligation of stately power and that same stately power is hugely known and respected. <24> Sa kabila ng gayong kontra-rebolusyonaryong propaganda, lumalapit ang mga kandidato at mga partidong pulitikal sa rebolusyonaryong awtoridad upang tumalima sa mga gabay at patakaran ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan. despite of those anti-revolutionary propaganda, the candidates and political parties are coming closer to the revolutionary authorities to comply with the guidelines and rules of the People's Democratic Government. <25> Malayang idinadaos ang mga pulong sa pambansa, panrehiyon, pamprubinsya at lokal na antas upang talakayin ang mga suliranin ng mamamayan, ang mga plataporma ng mga kandidato at ang mga programa at patakaran ng rebolusyonaryong kilusan. the meetings on national, regional, provincial and local ranks are freely conducted to discuss the problem of the citizens, the platforms of the candidates and the programs and rules of revolutionary movement. <26> Nagbibigay ng oportunidad ang gayong mga pulong upang talakayin ang mga bagay ng posibleng kooperasyon at koordinasyon kabilang ang pagtataguyod ng produksyong pang-agrikultura, pagpapataas ng kita sa kanayunan at pagsusulong ng edukasyon, literasiya, pangangalagang pangkalusugan at iba pang mga programa ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan. those meetings are giving opportunities to discuss the things of possible cooperation and coordination including the support on agricultural production, raising the profit in the provinces and advancing education, literacy, taking care of health and other programs of the People's Democratic Government. <27> Bahagi ang kabulukan ng reaksyunaryong eleksyon at ang reaksyunaryong burukratikong sistema, ng mapanupil at magpasamantalang naghaharing sistemang layong ibagsak ng sambayanang Pilipino at palitan ng isang tunay na demokratikong sistema ng paggugubyerno. part is the rottenness of the reactionary election and reactionary bureaucratic system, of subjugating and advantageous reigning system which has a goal to fail the Filipino citizens and replace it with a real democratic system of governance. <28> Sa loob ng mga lugar ng hurisdiksyon ng Demokratikong Gubyernong Bayan, ginagampanan at pinauunlad ang gayong sistema ng demokratikong pamamahala kung saan nagsasagawa ang mamamayan ng tunay na demokratikong eleksyon upang ihalal ang kanilang upisyal at kinatawan mula sa kanilang hanay at lubos silang nakalalahok sa mga gawaing pampulitika at pang-estado. within the places of jurisdiction of the People's Democratic Government, the said system of democratic governance is fulfilling its duty and progressing where the citizens are making a real democratic election to elect their officials and representatives from their ranks and participate fully in the political and state actions.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_19446760 <1> Hinaing ng maralitang lungsod, dapat pakinggan calls of the unfortunate province, should be heard. <2> by Darius Galang by Darius Galang <3> December 2, 2016 December 2, 2016 <4> Magsasagawa ng Lakbayan ang libu-libong maralitang tagalungsod ngayon. the thousands of unfortunates in the province will conduct a Lakbayan now. <5> Kakatukin nila ang gobyernong Duterte na nangako ng pagbabago. they will knock on the doors of the Duterte government who promised change. <6> Makatwiran ang maningil sa gobyerno. it's only right to demand from the government. <7> Ito ang mensahe ng maralitang tagalungsod sa paglulunsad nila ng isang Lakbayan para irehistro ang kanilang mga hinaing sa kalagayan ng kanilang mga kabuhayan at pabahay. this is the message of the unfortunates in launching a Lakbayan to register their calls for their livelihood and housing. <8> Ayon sa pananaliksik ng Kalipunan ng Damayang Mahihirap, ipinapakita ng 2014 datos mula sa National Statistics Coordinating Board na isang kapat (1/4) ng mga Pilipino ay nasa ilalim ng poverty line, 78 porsiyento pagtaas mula 2013. according to the research of Kalipunan ng Damayang Mahihirap, the 2014 data from National Statistics Coordinating Board showed that quarter (1/4) of Filipinos is under the poverty line, 78 percent higher since 2013. <9> Dagdag pa, ipinapakita ng 2015 datos mula sa Philippine Statistics Authority na 8.1 porsiyento ng Pilipino ay nasa matindi o subsistence poverty, o isang-kahig-isang-tuka. an addition to that, the 2015 data from Philippine Statistics Authority showed that 8.1 percent of Filipinos is in extreme or subsistence poverty, or living one day at a time. <10> Di maitatanggi, kalunus-lunos ang kalagayan ngayon ng mga maralitang tagalungsod. it's undeniable, the situation of the unfortunates is tragic. <11> Sa gitna ng kanilang ambag sa iba’t ibang industriya, sila ang isa sa pinagsasamatalahang sektor. in spite of their contribution to different industries, they are the one being abused by the sector. <12> Napakaliit na ng sahod nila, mataas pa ang kawalan ng trabaho at kabuhayan. their incomes are already very low, and there's even a high rate of loss of jobs and livelihood. <13> Kung trabahador man, mas madalas ay kontraktuwal at hindi nabibigyan ng mga benepisyo. and for the employees, it's usually contractual, and not given benefits. <14> Isasagad pa ng kawalan ng akses sa edukasyon at serbisyong pangkalusugan, maging ng kabi-kabilang demolisyon na umaayon lamang para sa mga pribadong entidad. they're even pushing to lack of access to education and health services, amidst the back to back demolition that only benefits the private sectors. <15> Isang Lakbayan ang kanilang ikinasa upang mairehistro sa gobyernong Duterte ang kanilang mga panawagan. they launched a Lakbayan so that their pleas to the Duterte government can be enlisted. <16> Pangunahin sa kanilang panawagan ang libre at pangmasang pabahay. their primary call is free housing for the masses. <17> Mahabang panahon na ang binuno ng maralitang tagalungsod sa kabi-kabilang demolisyon sa kanilang mga komunidad, at patuloy ang panawagan nilang hindi demolisyon ang solusyon sa kanilang hinaing, bagkus para lamang ito sa interes ng mga mayayaman. the unfortunates invested a long time in the back-to-back demolition in their community; and their call that demolition is not the solution to their complaints, but only for the interest of the rich, continues. <18> Kaakibat ng panawagan sa pabahay ang kanilang laban para sa regular na trabaho, at P750 National Minimum Wage. in line with their call for housing is their fight for regular jobs, and P750 National Minimum Wage. <19> Malaki ang maiaambag nito sa kanilang kalunus-lunos na kabuhayan sa lungsod. this will be a big help to their terrible livelihood in the province. <20> Mainit ang kanilang sigaw na itigil na ang pamamaslang sa ilalim ng giyera kontra droga, dahil ang malaking bilang ng mga nasawi rito’y nagmumula sa maralitang tagalungsod. their calls to stop the the murder under the war against drugs is intensified, because majority of killed because of this is from the province. <21> Panawagan rin nila ang paglayas ng militar sa mga komunidad ng mahihirap. they also call for the departure of military from the community of indigents. <22> Higit pa sa pabahay at regular na trabaho, malaki rin ang maitutulong ng tunay na reporma sa lupa, maging ang pambansang industriyalisasyon. more than the housing and regular jobs, a legitimate land reform, even national industrialization will be a really big help. <23> Kalakhan naman ng tumungo sa kalunsuran ay nagmula sa kanayunan sa pag-asang mas mataas ang magiging kabuhayan nila sa lungsod. majority of those who came to the city are from the countryside, in hopes of having a higher income in the city.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_21373371 <1> Thursday, February 28, 2013 Thursday, February 28, 2013 <2> Magtiwala Upang Pagkatiwalaan trust in order to be trusted <3> Kailangan ba ang mangarap? is it necessary to dream? <4> "Mangarap anuman ang nais mong mapangarap, pumunta kung saan nais mong makarating, panatilihin ang kasiyahan na iyong nadarama, at matiwasay na gampanan kung sino ang nais mong maging ikaw. "dream anything you want to dream, go anywhere you want to go, maintain the happiness that you feel, and calmly play whoever you want to become." <5> Sapagkat mayroon ka lamang isang buhay at isang pagkakataon na gawing lahat ang mga bagay sa lahat ng iyong mga naisin sa buhay. because you have only one life and one chance to do all the things in all your goals in life. <6> Natatakot lamang ang karamihan sa atin na sundan ang mahahalaga nilang mga pangarap, sapagkat ayon sa kanila ay hindi sila karapatdapat, o wala silang kakayahan na makamtan ang mga ito. many of us are only scared to follow their important dreams, because according to them they are not deserving, or they have no ability to achieve them. <7> Gayong ang posibilidad ng pagkakaroon ng pangarap na maging totoo ito, ang siyang lumilikha na maging kamangha-mangha at maganda ang buhay." whereas the possibility of having a dream come true, is the one that makes life amazing and beautiful." <8> Bakit mangyayari ito? why will it happen? <9> "Sapagkat kapag may nais ka, at tahasang kailangan mo ito upang magawa mong matupad ang lahat mong mga pangarap, ... ang buong sansinukob ay magkakaisa at pag-uugnayin ang lahat ang mga bagay sa iyong daraanan para tulungan ka na makamtan ang lahat ng mga ito." "because if you have a wish, and definitely need it to be able to achieve all your dreams ... the whole universe will cooperate and connect all the things to your path to help you achieve them." <10> Papaano kung magulo at pulos alitan ang namamagitan sa aming pagsasama? what if our relationship is messy and full of arguments? <11> "Walang sinuman sa atin na aaksayahin na lamang ang kanyang buhay na puspos ng kaguluhan at kapaitan. "no one of us will only waste his life full of conflict and bitterness. <12> Kaya lamang na tahasang ginagawa ito ng iba, para magbanta at manakot bilang uri ng pagkontrol. others definitely do it, only to threaten and frighten as a form of control. <13> Kung nagpapatuloy man ang pagsasama, isa sa kanila ang nagpaparaya. if the relationship ever continues, one of them lets go. <14> gustuhin man niya o hindi ay wala siyang magawa. whether he wants it or not he cannot do anything. <15> Nasa linya ito ng, 'It takes two to tango.' it is in line with, 'it takes two to tango.' <16> Walang mamamagitang alitan kung walang kapahintulutan ang mga kasangkot. there will be no argument between if the involved do not allow it. <17> Kung wala kang pahintulot, walang alitang iiral. if you do not have permission, no argument will prevail. <18> At nagpapatuloy lamang ito, dahil nais at sinasang-ayunan mo. and it only continues, because you want and agree to it. <19> Bahagi na lamang ng drama ang mga pagtutol at pagpapadala sa silakbo ng mga damdamin. objecting and being carried away by the passion of emotions are just part of the drama. <20> Lahat tayo ay may kakayahang isaayos ang anumang alitan, kung nanaisin lamang natin. all of us have the ability to fix any argument, if only we want to. <21> Dangan nga lamang para sa iba, ang pang-aaway o alitan ay kasiyahan at kinahumalingan na." for others, fighting or arguing has become a joy or delight. <22> Ang ibig mo bang sabihin, hindi nila alam ang kanilang ginagawang pananakit ng damdamin? do you mean, they do not know they are hurting feelings? <23> "Kung tunay ang iyong pag-ibig, hindi mo magagawang saktan ang damdamin ng iyong iniibig. "if your love is real, you will not be able to hurt the feelings of your beloved. <24> Sapagkat may responsibilidad ka na paligayahin ang iyong minamahal. because you have responsibility to make your beloved happy. <25> Ang buong mundo mo'y umiikot lamang para sa kanya. your whole world will revolve only around him. <26> May tungkulin tayo sa ating mga sarili, sa ating mga nadarama, at resulta ng ating mga kapasiyahan. we have a duty to ourselves, to our feelings, and the result of our choices. <27> Wala tayong nararapat na sisihin sa anumang emosyon na umiiral sa atin. we have no one to rightfully blame for any emotion that prevails in ourselves. <28> Dahil ito ang totoo at hindi natin kailangang ipagpaumanhin kahit na kanino. because it is the truth and we do not need to apologize to anyone. <29> Marami ang hindi nakakaalam; na kapag ikaw ang nanakit lalo na sa malalapit sa iyong puso, ikaw ang kauna-unahang masasaktan." many do not know; that if you are the one who hurt especially those close to your heart, you are the very first one to be hurt." <30> Ano ba ang kasabihang, “Umunawa muna, bago magpasiya!” what is the saying, "understand first, before deciding!" <31> "Ang simpleng sagot dito ay huwag mag-akala, at personalin ang usapan. "the simple answer here is don't assume, and discuss it personally." <32> Isipin ang magiging kalalabasan ng gagawing kapasiyahan. think of the outcome of the decision you will make. <33> Kadalasa'y mabuti at tama ang intensiyon, dangan nga lamang ay mali at taliwas ang pamamaraan. often the intention is good and right, only that the technique is wrong and contrary. <34> Makikita ang lahat sa naging resulta nito, kung ito'y tama o mali. everything will be seen in its result, if it is correct or wrong. <35> At kapag ikaw ay nagagalit, huwag na huwag kang magbibitiw ng mga salita, lalo na ng mga pagbabanta, na sa kalaunan ay tatama sa iyo na siyang ikakapahamak mo. and if you are angry, never ever say words, especially of threats, that eventually will hit you and harm you. <36> Laging ilagay mo ang iyong sarili na suot ang sapatos ng iba. always put yourself in the shoes of others. <37> Kung ito’y nagpapasakit sa iyo, makakatiyak kang ito man ay kasakitan din para sa kanya. if it hurts you, you will be sure that it will also hurt for him. <38> At pigilan ang mabilis na paghatol nang hindi nag-isip muna, para makaiwas sa nakaambang hindi pagkakaunawaan. and stop quickly making decisions without thinking first, to avoid impending misunderstanding. <39> Hangga't kapiling mo ang mga pagkatakot, kawalan ng katiwasayan, at mga pagdududa ay mananatiling kayakap mong lagi ang mga ibinubunga nitong mga kapighatian." as long as you are alongside fear, lack of peace, and suspicions you will remain always in contact with the grief they bring forth." <40> Kailangan bang laging tama ang bawa't sasabihin mo??? do you have to be always correct in everything you say? <41> "Ito ay nasusulat. "it is written. <42> Ang lahat ay nagsimula sa kataga. everything started with words. <43> Ang walang ingat at marahas na pananalita ay nag-iiwan ng alitan. careless and violent speech leave behind conflict. <44> Ang malupit na kataga ay winawasak ang isang buhay. rude words destroy a life. <45> Ito ay sumisira ng katinuan at nagdudulot ng mga karamdaman. it destroys sanity and causes illnesses. <46> Ang mahinahong kataga na nasa tamang pagkakataon ay nakakaginhawa sa pagkabagot at pinatatatag ang iyong pag-asa. calm words at the right moment can be relief from boredom and reinforce your hope. <47> Ang salita na may pagsamo ay nagdudulot ng pagtitiwala at pananalig, subalit ang higit na nakakalunas ... at may pagpapala sa lahat, ay mga kataga ng pagmamahal." words that plea create trust and faith, but more healing ... and blessed most of all, are words of love." <48> Papaano naman kung wala kang karanasan o natutuhan para masabi ito? what if you do not have experience or have not learned to say it? <49> "Anumang pagtatalo o alitang namamagitan, ngumiti ka lamang. "whatever argument or conflict going on, just smile. <50> Ang tunay na pag-ibig ay nagsisimula sa pagsilay ng isang ngiti, sinusundan ito ng pagyakap at halik, na nagtatapos sa pagpatak ng luha. true love starts at the sight of a smile, followed by caress and kiss, that ends when a tear drops. <51> Hindi ang luhang may pait at pagtangis, bagkus yaong luha na batbat ng kaligayahan. not a tear of bitterness and mourning, instead that tear filled with joy. <52> Alalahanin, nang ikaw ay ipanganak, ikaw ay umiiyak at ang lahat sa paligid mo ay nakangiti at maligaya. remember, when you were born, you were crying and everyone around you was smiling and happy. <53> Mabuhay nang maligaya dahil sa iyong pagyao, ikaw ang nakangiti at ang lahat na nasa paligid mo ang siya namang umiiyak. live with joy because in your passing, you are the one smiling and everyone around you will be the ones crying. <54> Sa katapusan, hindi mahalaga kung gaano karami ang nagawa mong paghinga, bagkus kang gaano karami ang mga sandaling nawalan ka ng hininga sa mga kaligayahang sumapuso sa iyo. in the end, it is not important how many breaths you made, instead how many moments you lost your breath from the happiness that consumed you. <55> At ito’y maibibigay mo lamang kapag may pag-ibig sa puso mo.” and you can only give it if there is love in your heart." <56> Papaano kung sawimpalad ka sa pag-ibig? what if you are unlucky in love? <57> “Walang kinalaman ang sawimpalad dito, dahil kung may pag-ibig ka sa iyong puso, patuloy kang magmamahal. "misfortune has nothing to do with this, because if there is love in your heart, you will continue to love. <58> Kung wala ito sa iyo, wala kang maibibigay. if it is not in you, there is nothing you can give. <59> Ito ang kasawian ng marami sa atin. this is the misfortune of many of us. <60> Yaon lamang may mga pagmamahal sa sarili ang makagagawang magmahal ng iba. only those with self-love can love others. <61> Sakaliman ang buhay ay binibigyan ka ng maraming kadahilanan para umiyak, ipakita sa buhay na mayrooon kang sanlibong mga kadahilanan para ngumiti. in case life gives you many reasons to cry, show life that you have a thousand reasons to smile. <62> Ang buhay ay patuloy at hindi ka nito hihintayin. life goes on and it will not wait for you. <63> Papaano ito magagawa? how is it done? <64> "Simpleng mga pagkilos lamang. "simple actions only. <65> Magtrabaho na parang hindi mo kailangan ang pera, magmahal nang hindi kailanman ikaw ay nasugatan, at sumayaw hanggang nais mo na tila walang nakakakita sa iyo. work as if you do not need money, love as if you have never been hurt, dance as long as you want as if no one can see you. <66> At ipamuhay ang buhay na nais mo. and live the life that you want. <67> Lagi kong alam na kapag binalikan ko ang aking mga pagluha, ako ay matatawa, subali’t ang hindi ko alam kapag binalikan ko ang mga pagtawa, ako pala ay mapapaiyak. I always know that if I look back at my tears, I will laugh, but I did not know that when I return to my laughter, I will be reduced to tears. <68> Magkagayunman, tamasahin ang buhay, … minsan lamang ito." still, enjoy life, ... it happens only once. <69> Eh, kung maulit muli? hmm, what if it happens again? <70> Kung may naganap, may epekto. if something took place, there will be effect. <71> Lahat ng bagay ay nagaganap lamang minsan, at kailanman ay hindi na mauulit pang muli. everything happens only once, and will never happen again. <72> Subalit ang bawa't bagay na naganap ng dalawang ulit, ay makakatiyak ka na magaganap pang muli ito sa pangatlo. but each thing that happens twice, you can be sure will happen again on a third time. <73> At kung kinahumalingan na at sinapian na ng pagkabaliw, ay ritwal na ito para sa kanila. and if charmed and possessed with insanity, it is already a ritual for them. <74> Sa aking pagkakaalam, napapanis din kung minsan ang Pag-ibig, totoo ba ito? to my knowledge, love sometimes goes stale, is this true? <75> "Pagkalunod ang tinutukoy mo. "you are referring to drowning. <76> Huwag pakinggan ang sinasabi ng iba at maging ang kanilang mga panunulsol ay pakaiwasan. do not listen to what others are saying and avoid even their provocations. <77> Ang pag-ibig kailanman ay hindi napapanis. love never goes stale. <78> Makilala ito sa mga katangian ng isang tao at sa kanyang mga ginagawa. it will be recognized in the qualities of a person and in his actions. <79> Kahit na minsan, makalawa, makatatlo, o isang dosenang pag-ibig ang naranasan mo, ... even if you have experienced love once, twice, thrice, or a dozen times ... <80> palaging mahaharap ka sa panibagong sitwasyon. you will always be faced with a new situation. <81> Kung ikaw ay tapat, walang magaganap, subalit kapag ikaw ay marupok, ito ang masusunod. if you are honest, nothing will happen, but if you are weak, it will prevail. <82> Ang pag-big ay walang kinalaman at kahulugan dito. love is not related and has no meaning here. <83> Sapagkat ang pag-ibig ay dadalhin tayo maging sa paraiso at impiyerno. because love will bring us even to paradise and hell. <84> Masasagot ito ng mahusay ng mga nagliligaw at ng mga may-asawa na. this can be answered well by suitors and those already married. <85> Doon sa una, ibibigay ang buong mundo niya. in the first, he will offer his whole world. <86> At dito sa huli, kapag may mabuting asawa, ay umuunlad ang buhay at matiwasay na yumayabong ang pagsasama. in the latter, if there is a good spouse, life improves and relationship peacefully grows. <87> Subalit kung makasarili ang asawa, ay masalimoot, walang pag-unlad at nagiging timawa. but if the spouse is selfish, it is complicated, does not grow and becomes despicable. <88> Tandaan lamang na sa sandaling simulan natin na umibig, ang pag-ibig ay magsisimula ding lunurin tayo." just remember that the moment we start to fall in love, love will also start to drown us."
