MATERIAL_BASE-1B_50402742 <1> SA TRILLANES VS CAYETANO: RESPETO NAMAN! — KOKO By Eralyn Prado September 17, 2016 Magrespetuhan naman tayo sa isa’t isa. Pakiusap ito ni Se­nate President Aquilino ‘Koko’ Pimentel III matapos na hindi nito magustuhan ang nangyaring asaran at sigawan nina Sens. Alan Cayetano at Antonio Trillanes sa pagdinig kamakalawa ng Senate commite on justice and human rights kaugnay sa extrajudicial killings. in Trillanes versus Cayetano: respect also! - Koko by Eralyn Prado September 17, 2016 let us respect each other. this is the plea of senate president Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel III after he disliked the sarcasm and shouting that happened with senators Alan Cayetano and Antonio Trillanes in the hearing the day before yesterday of the senate committee on justice and human rights related to the extrajudicial killings. <2> Partikular na hindi nagustuhan ni Pimentel at tinawag niyang “foul” ang ginawa ni Trillanes na pagpatay sa mikropono ni Cayetano. Pimental particularly disliked and he called "foul" what Trillanes did in turning off the microphone of Cayetano. <3> “Yung pinapatay pa yung microphone, ‘yun po yung hindi magandang makita, kasi ang Senado e legislative body po ‘yan. Talagang ang mga weapons dyan mga salita kasi deliberative body talaga yan. Pero sana po wala na po yung physical interference, ng physical space ng tao na aabot ka at papatayin mo ‘yung mikropono noong tao,” ayon kay Pimentel. "turning off the microphone, that is not nice to see, because the senate is a legislative body. the real weapons there are words because it is really a deliberative body. but I wish there will be no more physical interference, of physical space of people where you reach out and turn off the microphone of the person," according to Pimentel. <4> Dahil dito, apela ni Pimentel sa mga kasamahan na panatilihin ang respeto sa isa’t isa upang matiyak na magiging produktibo ang Senado at hindi maapektuhan ng anumang mga personal na hindi pagkakaunawaan. because of this, Pimentel appealed to his colleagues to maintain respect with each other in order to ensure that the senate will become productive and not affected by any personal misunderstandings. <5> “Kasi kung wala kaming respeto sa isa’t isa mahirap po kaming maka-achieve ng anything,” dagdag pa ni Pimentel. "because if we have no respect with each other it will be difficult for us to achieve anything," Pimentel added. <6> Nag-ugat ang banggaan matapos kuwestiyonin ni Trillanes ang mahabang pagtatanong ni Caye­tano sa witness na lumampas na sa 10 minutong itinakdang oras ng komite. the conflict started after Trillanes questioned the long interrogation by Cayetano on the witness that exceeded 10 minutes of the allotted time by the committee. <7> Samantala, may payo naman si Senate Mino­rity Leader Ralph Recto sa publiko na huwag agad maniwala sa mga testimonya ng mga whistleblower bagkus dapat mapatunayan muna ang alegasyon. meanwhile, senate minority leader Ralph Recto also has an advise to the public not to easily believe the testimonies of the whistle blowers instead their allegations should be proven first. <8> Kaalinsunod na rin ito sa pasabog ng isang self-confessed member ng Davao Death Squad na si Edgar Matobato kontra kay Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte partikular ang pagdawit sa extra judicial killings sa Davao City. this also conforms with the explosion by one self-confessed member of the Davao death squad who is Edgar Matobato against president Rodrigo Duterte particularly in the involvement in extra-judicial killings in Davao city. <9> “My advice to the public is not to immediately believe in testimonies of whistleblowers. He or she must prove his allegations first,” ayon pa kay Recto. "my advice to the public is not to immediately believe in testimonies of whistleblowers. he or she must prove his allegations first," also according to Recto.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_97498163 <1> 10 factors that Coup d'etat stories in the Armed Forces of the Philippines are not true 10 factors that Coup d'état stories in the Armed Forces of the Philippines are not true <2> Napakarami na namang nailathalang istorya tungkol sa kudeta at marapatin kong ipamahagi ang mga factors na maging basehan na ang mga iyon ay hindi makatotohanan: there are numerous stories published again about the Coup d'état and I consider it as worthy to share the factors as basis that those are unrealistic: <3> 1\. Dalang-dala na ang mga sundalo sa pagsasama sa aktwal na kudeta o sa mga tangka na pataubin ang gobyerno. 1. the soldiers are too exhausted in joining an actual Coup d'état or in attempts to overthrow the government. <4> Hindi mabilang ang nasira ang buhay dahil sa kasasali dito. the lives which are destroyed because of joining this could not be counted. <5> Ang pinakamasama ay yong namamatay sa madugong kudeta na walang benepisyong natatanggap. the worst are those who are getting killed in bloody Coup d'état without receiving any benefits. <6> Merong nagkakahiwalay ang mag-asawa at nabulabog ang buong pamilya. there are couples who got separated and the whole family is disrupted. <7> May isa akong kasama sa Basilan na naging tigabantay na lang ng palaisdaan. I have a colleague in Basilan who just became a mere guard of a fish pond. <8> May isang Scout Ranger na nag-uuling sa Northern Luzon. there is a Scout Ranger who makes charcoal in Northern Luzon. <9> Ang iilan sa mga iyon ay naglapit sa akin para magpahanap ng trabaho. few of those approached me for me to find them a job. <10> Ang pinakamadali nilang mapasukan ay pagiging gwardya. the easiest they can apply is being a guard. <11> Dating astig na sundalo, naging Security Guard na lang dahil sa kudeta. once a masculine soldier just became a security guard because of Coup d'état. <12> Dahil nakakausap ko sila at kakilala ko ang pamilya nila, lalong naaawa ako sa kanila. because I am able to talk to them and I know their families, I am pitying them more. <13> Mapapait ang karanasan ng mga sumali sa mga nakaraang kudeta. the experience is bitter for those who have joined the previous Coup d'état. <14> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we do a Coup d'état? <15> 2\. Napakarami na ang naisulong na modernisasyon sa AFP na syang nag-angat sa morale ng mga sundalo. 2. a lot of modernization has been pushed forward in the AFP which raised the morale of the soldiers. <16> Halimbawa, noong ako ay tenyente, wala kaming Combat Life Saver (CLS) Kit. example, when I was a lieutenant, we did not have a Combat Life Saver (CLS) Kit. <17> Tinatalian lang namin ng pinunit na damit na may dahon ng bayabas ang sugat ng kasamang natatamaan sa mga bakbakan. we are just tying the wounds of our colleagues who are hit in a firefight with tattered clothes with guava leaves. <18> Ngayon ay may squad level CLS kit na, may individual issue pa. now there is already a squad level CLS kit, there is still an individual issue. <19> Kung dati ay pinaglumaang M14 Rifle at M16 Rifle, at may mga M203 40mm ammos na ayaw pumutok ang ginagamit, ngayon ay may mga M4 Carbine Rifles, K3 SAW na. if before, old secondhand M14 Rifle and M16 Rifle and there were M203 40mm which would not fire were used, now there are already M4 Carbine Rifles, K3 SAW. <20> Maliban doon, dahan-dahang bumabalik ang tikas ng Air Force at Navy sa mga bagong kagamitang pakikidigma na nabili. aside from that, the stature of the Air Force and Navy is slowly coming back in the new warfare equipment which is bought. <21> Hindi ko na banggitin ang marami pang ibang aspeto ng modernisasyon at nasisigurado ko ay, 'better than before!'. I will not mention the many aspects of modernization anymore and what I am sure of is, "better than before!". <22> Mas kampante kasi ang mga sundalo na magtaya ng buhay sa pagsagawa ng misyon kung batid nya na lamang sila sa teknolohiya, kaalaman at sa support systems na naidudulot ng modernization program. the soldiers are more confident to gamble their lives in implementing the mission if he is aware that they are better in technology, knowledge and in support systems being brought by the modernization program. <23> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we do a coup d'état? <24> 3\. Sa kasalukuyang administrasyon, tumaas ang aming sweldo. 3. in the current administration, our salary increased. <25> Dahil dito, kaya na naming matustusan ang pangangailangan ng aming pamilya. because of this, we are able to provide for the needs of our family. <26> Sa totoo lang, kung iwasan lang ang bisyo at planuhin ng mabuti ang pamilya, ang sweldo ng sundalo ay pwede nang pang-sustain sa pamilya. in reality, if vices are just avoided and plan the family well, the salary of a soldier can sustain the family. <27> Of course, dagdag na diskarte ng sundalo ang pag-invest, pag-negosyo at pag-aral ng Financial Literacy 101. of course, investing, having a business and studying Financial Literacy 101 are added strategies of a soldier. <28> Di ba't di pa rin magkasya yan kung asal milyonaryo kami? truly, that won't still be sufficient if we act like a millionaire? <29> Kahit may nagsabing kulang pa ang aming sweldo, batid naming may magagawa rin kaming paraan para pagkasyahin ito. even if someone said our salary is insufficient, we are aware that we can still make a way to make it fit. <30> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we do a coup d'état? <31> 4\. Nadagdagan ang programang pabahay para sa mga sundalo. 4. the housing programs for the soldiers are increased. <32> Maliban sa on-base housing ng AFP, meron din ang kasalukuyang pamahalaan na programa ng off-base housing na wala noong unang panahon. aside from the on-base housing of the AFP, the current government has also an off-base housing program which was not there before. <33> Napakarami na ng mga sundalo ang nakinabang sa pabahay na ito ng kasalukuyang administrasyon. there are already a lot of soldiers who have benefited this housing program of the current administration. <34> Batid namin na hindi pa ito tapos at patuloy na isinusulong ng gobyerno para sa kapulisan at kasundaluhan. we are aware that this is not yet finished and continually pushed by the government for the police and military. <35> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we do a coup d'état? <36> 5. Wala kaming kinalaman sa away pulitika. 5. we do not have any connection in political conflict. <37> Naiinis at nahihimatay man kami sa nakakarimarim na kwentong kurapsyon na nagpapahirap sa bayan, batid namin, lalo na ng mga opisyal na hindi dapat kami makikisawsaw dito bilang mga sundalo. even we are angry and fall unconscious of the loathing corruption stories which is making the country suffer, we are aware, especially the officials that we should not get involve here as soldiers. <38> Batid namin ang kahihinatnan kung ang armadong grupo kagaya ng sundalo ay nangingialam sa mga bagay na para lamang sa mga politicians. we are aware of the outcome if the armed groups such as soldiers who are getting involved in things which are for the politicians only. <39> Batid namin na bilang propesyonal na sundalo ay ang pagsulong pa ng reporma sa AFP, pagsagawa ng aming constitutional mandates ang dapat naming pagkaabalahan. we are aware as professional soldiers that pushing through the reforms of the AFP, implementing our constitutional mandates should occupy our tasks. <40> Kung may nagtutunggaliang mga pulitiko, wala kaming pakialam sa away nila. if there are opposing politicians, we have no care about their quarrels. <41> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we do a coup d'état? <42> 6\. Mas dumadami ang mamamayang nagtitiwala at nakikiisa sa mga sundalo. 6. the citizens who are trusting and unifying with the soldiers are becoming numerous. <43> Matagal din ang masamang epekto ng martial law na kung saan ay marami ang nasaktang mga Pilipino. the bad effects of martial law is long-lasting where many Filipinos are hurt. <44> Kung dati ay nagtatago, nanginginig ang ibang taumbayan lalo na sa mga liblib na lugar tuwing makakakita ng sundalo, ngayon ay hindi na. if in hiding before, other country folks were trembling especially in far-flung places every time they can see a soldier, not now. <45> Nakakataas ng morale ang makasalamuha ang taumbayan na nag-appreciate sa serbisyo ng sundalo. it raises the morale in being able to interact with the masses who appreciate the services of a soldier. <46> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we do a coup d'état? <47> 7\. Nakikita rin namin ang pag-unlad ng ekonomiya. 7. we are also seeing the progress of the economy. <48> Nakamit ng Pilipinas ang pinakamataas sa kasaysayan na credit rating upgrade na kung saan ang Standard & Poor ang nagbigay sa ating bansa ng Investment Grade status. the Philippines has achieved the highest in the history of credit rating upgrade where the Standard and Poor is the one who has given our country the Investment Grade status. <49> High-fallutin' (at di maintindihan) man yon para sa karamihan, nakikiisa rin kami sa mas nakararaming taumbayan na gustong umunlad ang ating bansa. high-fallutin' (and not understandable) might be for the majority, we are one with the most number of masses who want our country to progress. <50> Gusto rin naming magdagsaan dito ang mga investors, dadami ang income opportunities at mabawasan ang naghihirap na Pilipino. we also want the investors to flock here, the income opportunities are going to increase and lessen the suffering Filipinos. <51> Gusto rin namin na magsipagbalikan na ang mga OFWs sa panahong andito rin lang sa Pilipinas ang hinahanap nilang kaginhawaan sa buhay para sa kanilang pamilya. we also want the OFWs to come home in the time where they can find right here in the Philippines the relief in life that they are searching for their families. <52> Dagdag pa doon, di ba't isa ring dahilan ang kahirapan kung bakit may nauto ng CPP-NPA-NDF na sumapi sa armadong pakikibaka? in addition to that, really, poverty is also one of the reasons why the CPP-NPA-NDF can fool to join in the armed struggle? <53> So, mga kapatid, kung umuunlad ang ating ekonomiya, bakit kami magkudeta? so, my siblings, if our economy is progressing, why should we do a coup d'état? <54> (Para palayasin natin ang mga foreign investors at mga turista at malugmok ang ang ating bansa?) (for us to drive away the foreign investors and tourists and let our country drown?) <55> 8\. Ayaw namin ng karahasan lalo na sa kapwa Pilipino. 8. we do not want violence especially in our co-Filipinos. <56> Di ba't lagi naming isinusulong ang peaceful resolution of armed conflicts? really, why are we always pushing through with the peaceful resolution of armed conflicts? <57> Fully committed kami sa peace process na isinusulong ng gobyerno dahil batid naming walang magandang naidulot ang patayan ng kapwa Pilipino sa labanan ng kasundaluhan at ng secessionist groups sa Mindanao at maging sa mga miyembro ng bandidong NPA. we are fully committed in the peace process that the government is campaigning because we are aware that murdering co-Filipinos in the war of the military and the secessionist groups in Mindanao and even the members of the NPA bandits will not bring any good. <58> Kung ayaw namin ng patayan bilang solusyon sa problema, bakit kami magkudeta? if we do not want murder as a solution to the problem, why should we do a coup d'état? <59> 9\. Hindi kami susunod sa pang-uudyok at panghihikayat ng mga retiradong opisyal. 9. we are not going to follow the incitement and encouragement of retired officials. <60> Sa totoo lang, wala ni isang kwento o ugong na naririnig na may nanghihikayat, nambobola at nang-uudyok na mga retired o kaya former military personnel para kami ay mag-alsa. in fact, there is neither a story nor a whisper being heard that there is an encouragement, foolery or incitement by the retired or former military personnel for us to revolt. <61> Kung meron man, ano sila hilo? if there is, what are they, fools? <62> Halimbawa, ang mga nadadawit sa pangalan sa kasalukuyang rumors ay mga senior officers ng AFP na dati ay nagkukumahog na pigilan ang mga kudeta. example, the names involved in the current rumors are senior officers of the AFP which were formerly trying their best to stop many coup d'état. <63> I don't think na sila na ngayon ay magsasabing, 'Magkudeta na nga kayo ngayon!". I don't think that they are the ones now saying, "have a Coup d'état now!". <64> Naniniwala kaming active military personnel na hindi babaliktarin ng mga nirerespeto naming mga retired senior officers ang kanilang pinagsasabi noong araw laban sa kudeta, at yong matindi nilang paalala na lagi kaming mag-observe ng Chain of Command. we, the active military personnel, believe that the retired senior officers that we respected would reverse what they had said in the past days against coup d'état, and their serious reminder for us to always observe the Chain of Command. <65> Maliban pa doon, pinakikinggan ng aming mga pinuno ang aming mga feedbacks. aside from that, our leaders are listening in our feedbacks. <66> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we do a coup d'état? <67> Sar-com (Sariling command) ba kami? are we a Sar-com (personal command)? <68> 10\. Alam namin na pag may magkukudeta, magkakasakitan ang kapwa sundalo. 10. we know that if there are those who are going to make a coup d'état, fellow soldiers are going to hurt each other. <69> Kung mangyari uli ang kaganapan noong 1989 na nagbabarilan ang kapwa sundalo, magpapalakpakan ang tunay na kalaban ng sambayanang Pilipino: Ang nang-aagaw ng teritoryo natin sa West Philippine Sea at ang mga bandidong NPA na ang tunay na gusto ay ang mga bossing nilang nasa pulitika ang maghahari sa ating bansa. if the incident back in 1989 will happen again wherein fellow soldiers shot each other, the real enemies of the Filipino people are going to applaud: those who are snatching our territory in the West Philippine Sea and the NPA bandits whose real desire is for their bosses in politics to rule our country. <70> Bakit kami magkudeta? why should we make a coup d'état?

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_21779237 <1> POPCOM 3, inaanyayahan ang mga kabataan na makibahagi sa social media campaign nito para sa World Population Day POPCOM 3, invited the youth to join its social media campaign for the World Population Day. <2> July 05, 2016 Marie Joy L. Simpao July 05, 2016, Marie Joy L. Simpao <3> LUNGSOD NG SAN FERNANDO, Pampanga, Hulyo 5 (PIA) -- Inaanyayahan ng Commission on Population o POPCOM ang mga kabataan sa Gitnang Luzon makibahagi sa social media campaign nito kaugnay sa selebrasyon ng World Population Day o WPD Hulyo 11. City of San Fernando, Pampanga, July 5 (PIA) - the Commission on Population or POPCOM invited the youth of Central Luzon to be a part of its social media campaign related to the celebration of World Population Day or WPD on July 11. <4> Ayon kay POPCOM Regional Director Eleanor Cura, layunin ng Selfie Kabataan, Sali na Kabayan na iangat pa lalo ang kamalayan ng mga kabataan sa mga isyung may kaugnayan sa mabilis na pagtaas ng pandaigdigang populasyon at labanan ang mataas na insidente ng premarital sex at teenage pregnancy sa rehiyon. according to POPCOM Regional Director Eleanor Cura, the goal of Selfie Youth, Come Join Fellow Citizens is to raise the awareness of the youth on issues related to the rapid increase of world population and fight the high incidents of premarital sex and teenage pregnancy in the region. <5> Hangad din nito na magkaroon ng pagkakataong marinig ang saloobin ng mga kabataan kung paano sila makatutulong sa pagsusulong ng kanilang mga karapatan sa edukasyon, kalusugan, at trabaho sa pamamagitan ng pagbibigay proteksyon sa kanila mula sa mga reproductive health issues. it also aims to give an opportunity to hear the thoughts of the youth on how they can help advocate their rights to education, health, and employment by protecting them from reproductive health issues. <6> Dapat i-like ng mga interesadong kalahok ang POPCOM Region III Facebook fan page (facebook.com/POPCOM3). the interested participants should like the POPCOM Region III Facebook fan page (facebook.com/POPCOM3). <7> Paliwanag ni Cura, dapat iupload ng mga kalahok dito ang kanilang selfie kasama ang kanilang sagot kung paano nila pangangalagaan ang sarili mula sa mga isyung tulad ng maagang pakikipagtalik, maagang pagbubuntis, maagang pag-aasawa, tumataas na kaso ng mga sexually transmitted infections kabilang na ang HIV-AIDS, at mga peligrosong sexual at non-sexual na kasanayan. Cura explained that the participants should upload their selfies together with their answers on how they can protect themselves from issues such as pre-marital sex, early pregnancy, early marriage, rising cases of sexually transmitted infections including HIV-AIDS, and dangerous sexual and non-sexual practices. <8> Paalala niya, ang mga entries ay dapat may hashtag na #worldpopulationday, #investinginteenagegirls, at # popcomregion3. she reminds that the entries must have the hashtags #worldpopulationday, #investinginteenagegirls, and #popcomregion3. <9> Ang deadline ng pagsumite ay hanggang sa Hulyo 11. the submission deadline is until July 11. <10> Ang limang entries na may pinakamaraming likes sa pagtatapos ng kampanya ay mananalo at tatanggap ng tig isang libong pisong halaga ng gift certificate. the five entries that have the most number of likes at the end of the campaign will win and will receive a thousand pesos worth of gift certificates. <11> (CLJD/MJLS-PIA 3) (CLJD/MJLS-PIA 3)

by Pinoy Weekly Staff September 15, 2013 <3> Mas maliit man kaysa sa naunang pagtitipon noong Agosto 26, malakas pa ring inirehistro ng humigit-kumulang 15,000 katao sa Luneta ang paglaban sa pork barrel. even if this was smaller compared to the previous gathering on August 26, more or less 15,000 people in Luneta still loudly demonstrated their opposition against pork barrel. <4> Hindi ipinagbawal, bagkus ay hinimok pa, ng mga organisador ng #ForwardMarch ang pagdadala ng mga plakard, banners, streamers, watawat, effigy at kung anu- ano pang porma ng biswal na protesta. placards, banners, streamers, flags, effigy and other visual forms of protest were not prohibited but were encouraged by the organizers of #ForwardMarch. <5> May mataimtim na pananalangin, pero mayroon ding maingay na pagtugtog ng mga banda at musikero, ang narinig mula sa entablado. there was a solemn prayer, and loud music from bands and musicians were also heard from the stage. <6> Dahil dito, isang makulay, malikhain at matunog na protesta ang inirehistro ng mga mamamayan noong Setyembre 13. because of this a colorful, creative and vibrant protest was demonstrated by the people on September 13. <7> Nilahukan, siyempre, ang protesta ng organisadong hanay ng mga mamamayan. of course, organized ranks of the people joined the protest. <8> Bahagi ang militanteng mga grupo, mga alyado nila, at progresibong mga indibidwal at netizens sa Abolish the Pork Barrel Movement (#AbolishPork) na nag-organisa sa protestang iyon. militant groups, their allies, and progressive individual citizens and netizens of the Abolish the Pork Barrel Movement (#AbolishPork) organized the protest. <9> Pero bukod dito, lumahok din ang iba’t ibang eskuwelahan, mula sa pampublikong mga pamantasan hanggang sa eksklusibo at Katolikong eskuwelahan. aside from these, various schools from public universities to exclusive and Catholic schools also joined. <10> Samantalang nagtipon sa Liwasang Bonifacio ang mga organisasyon sa ilalim ng Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan), naglunsad naman ng banal na misa ang mga pari at relihiyoso sa simbahan ng San Agustin sa Intramuros, bago nagmartsa patungong Luneta. while organizations under the New National Alliance (Bayan) were assembling in Liwasang Bonifacio, priests and the religious celebrated a holy mass in San Agustin Church in Intramuros before marching to Luneta. <11> Patungo sa parke, tinagpo nila ang mga kapwa-relihiyoso mula sa mga Kristiyanong Protestante, kasama ang whistleblowers sa pangunguna ni Jun Lozada. going to the park, they met with fellow religious people from the Protestant Christians along with whistleblowers headed by Jun Lozada. <12> Nakasama pa ng mga relihiyosong Protestante si dating Chief Justice Reynato Puno. the religious Protestants was with former Chief Justice Reynato Puno. <13> IKILIK ANG LARAWAN PARA MAKITA NANG MALAKI. click the picture to enlarge it. <14> #ForwardMarch sa Luneta Park, 13 Setyembre 2013. #ForwardMarch in Luneta Park, 13 September 2013. <15> (Mga larawang pinagdikit, ni Pher Pasion) Sa Luneta, muling naglunsad ng ecumenical service ang mga relihiyosong Katoliko, Protestante, at Muslim. (pictures attached by Pher Pasion) in Luneta, an ecumenical service was again held by religious Catholics, Protestants and Muslims. <16> Tinapos ito ng talumpati ni Archbishop Emeritus Oscar Cruz, na matapang na nananawagan ng pananalangin at pagkilos. it was ended by a speech from Archibishop Emeritus Oscar Cruz who boldly called for prayer and action. <17> “Magdasal tayo,” sabi ni Cruz. "let us pray," Cruz said. <18> “Pero kumilos din tayo. "but let us also act. <19> Maganda ang dasal pero hindi sapat ang dasal.” "prayer is good but prayer is not enough." <20> Sinabi niya na makapangyarihan ang dalawang ito — panalangin at pagkilos — para tutulan ang “kababuyang” nagaganap sa bansa ngayon. he said that these two are powerful - prayer and action - to object to the immorality happening in the country today. <21> Inunahan na rin niya ang inaasahang pagmamaliit ng Malakanyang at midya sa pagkilos ng mga mamamayan noong araw na iyon. he also mentioned the anticipated belittling of Malacañang and the media about the protest of the people that day. <22> “Kung may magsasabi na ang taong wala rito (sa Luneta) ay sang-ayon sa pork barrel system mo (Pangulong Aquino), nagkakamali ka,” ani Cruz. "if someone says that people who are not present here (in Luneta) agree to your pork barrel system (President Aquino), you are mistaken," said Cruz. <23> Maaari umanong “wala lang pamasahe, o walang laman ang tiyan” ng mga mamamayang hindi nakalahok sa protesta. people who did not participate in the protest might have no fare or have an empty stomach. <24> “Pero imposible na payag sila sa mga nangyayari sa bayan natin ngayon,” pagtatapos ng Arsobispo. "but it is impossible that they agree to the things happening in our nation today," the Archbishop concluded. <25> Dumulo ang programa sa mga talumpati at pagtatanghal, at konsiyerto — tinaguriang “Rock and Rage” — ng mga musikerong malakas na nagpahayag ng pagtutol sa sistema ng pork barrel, sa korupsiyon sa pamahalaan, at sa pagsasamantala ng iilan sa nakararaming mamamayan. towards the end of the program, there were speeches, performances and a concert titled "Rock and Rage" of musicians who boldly declared disapproval against the pork barrel system, corruption in the government, and exploitation by some of the majority of the people. <26> Nangako silang magpapatuloy ang mga protesta. they promised to continue the protests. <27> May nakatakda na, sa Setyembre 21, pero bago at matapos ang petsang ito, inaasahang magpapatuloy ang pagpapahayag ng pagtutol sa lahat ng porma ng pork barrel — hanggang mabasura ito, o mabasura ang mga nagtataguyod nito. one is set on September 21 but before and after this date, it is expected that expression of opposition will continue against all forms of pork barrel until it is abolished or its promoters removed.

ComradeArman Albarillo: revolutionary leader, brave fighter, communist hero! <2> Eduardo LabradorPambansang Katipunan ng mga Magbubukid-Southern TagalogJuly 6, 2012Nagpupugay ang Pambansang Katipunan ng mga Magbubukid (PKM) sa kabayanihan ni Kasamang Arman Albarillo at lahat ng rebolusyunaryong martir ng Bagong Hukbong Bayan sa San Narciso, Quezon na nag-alay ng buhay sa pagtatanggol sa kapakanan ng mga maralita sa kanayunan. Eduardo Labrador National Alliance of Farmers - Southern Tagalog July 6, 2012 the National Alliance of Farmers (PKM) salute the heroism of companion Arman Albarillo and all the revolutionary martyrs of the New People's Army in San Narciso, Quezon who offered their lives in protecting the welfare of the poor in the barrio. <3> Kinikilala at dinadakila ng rebolusyonaryong kilusang magbubukid ang mga kumander at mandirigma na matapang na humarap sa mga kaaway ng mamamayan. the revolutionary movement of farmers recognize and honor the commander and fighter who bravely faced the enemies of the people. <4> Dating pangkalahatang kalihim ng Bagong Alyansang Makabayan sa rehiyon si Ka Arman. ComradeArman was former overall secretary of the New Patriotic Alliance in the region. <5> Taong 2009 nang magpasya siyang sumanib sa Bagong Hukbong Bayan. year 2009 was when he decided to join the New People's Army. <6> Dahil sa gawa-gawang kaso laban sa kanya at sa 71 iba pa, pinili niyang lisanin ang lansangan at tumugon sa panawagan ng kanayunan upang maipagpatuloy ang kanyang paglilingkod. because of the made-up case against him and 71 others, he chose to leave the streets and answer to the call of the barrio to continue his service. <7> Matagal niyang ipinaglaban ang hustisya para sa kanyang mga magulang na pinaslang ng rehimeng Arroyo noong 2002 kabilang ang marami pang biktima ng karahasan ng estado. he has long fought for justice for his parents who were killed by the Arroyo regime in 2002 including many more victims of violence of the state. <8> Paulit-ulit siyang nabigo. he repeatedly failed. <9> Sa Hukbong Bayan lamang niya nakita na mabibigyang katarungan ang kanyang pagkaulila. only in the People's Army did he see that his orphanhood will be given justice. <10> Sa isang bansang itinuturing na krimen ang pagiging makabayan at terorismo ang paglilingkod sa sambayanan, karangalan ang mamatay nang lumalaban. in a country where it is considered crime to be patriotic and serving the people is terrorism, it is an honor to die while fighting. <11> Nagpamalas siya ng di-matitinag na paninindigan para sa interes ng nakararami at kahandaang ibuwis ang kanyang buhay para sa prinsipyong kanyang pinaniniwalaan. he also displayed unwavering resolve for the interest of many and readiness to sacrifice his life for the principle he believed. <12> Di-matatawaran ang kanyang dedikasyon sa pagsusulong ng pambansa demokratikong panawagan. his dedication in pushing for a national democratic call cannot be discounted. <13> Malugod niyang tinanggap ang pakikibakang ipinamana ng kanyang mga magulang. he happily accepted the fight passed on to him by his parents. <14> Niyakap niya ang sakripisyo at kahirapang kaakibat ng kanyang responsibilidad sa bayan. he embraced the sacrifice and poverty that came with his responsibility to the nation. <15> Hanggang sa huling sandali, hindi niya tinalikuran ang uring magbubukid. up to the final moment, he did not turn his back on the farmer class. <16> Katulad ng marami nang nabuwal na bayani ng uring anakpawis, magsisilbing tanglaw ang buhay at pakikibaka ni Ka Arman sa lahat ng mamamayan. like many fallen heroes of the working class, the life and fight of ComradeArman will serve as a guide to all the people. <17> Mananatiling buhay si Ka Arman sa alaala ng masa sapagkat hindi dito nagwawakas ang kanilang kasaysayan. ComradeArman will remain alive in the memory of the masses because their history does not stop here. <18> Nagtamo man ng pinsala, lalong napapanday ang mga maralita sa kanayunan sa buhay-at-kamatayang pakikibaka para sa demokratikong interes ng mayorya ng sambayanan. despite sustaining damages, the poor in the barrios are further forged into the life-and-death struggle for the democratic interest of majority of the nation. <19> Kahit kailan, hindi isinuko ng mga magbubukid ang armadong rebolusyon. no matter when, the farmers never gave up the armed revolution. <20> Hindi tatalikuran ng masang magbubukid ang kanyang tungkuling itaguyod ang Bagong Hukbong Bayan. the farmer class will not turn his back on his responsibility to support the New People's Army. <21> Laging nakabukas ang pinto ng dampa ng mga magbubukid sa Bondoc Peninsula upang kupkupin ang hukbo, tulungan sila at kapit-bisig na gapiin ang mga sanggano at maton ng mga asyendero. the hut of the farmers in Bondoc Peninsula is always open to take in the army, help them and arm-in-arm defeat the loafers and bullies of the plantation owners. <22> Buong giting na ipagtatanggol ng Hukbong Bayan at mamamayan ang mga inaning tagumpay sa rebolusyong agraryo. the People's Army and people will protect wholeheartedly the success reaped by the agrarian revolution. <23> Kabiguan ang naghihintay sa konsentradong opensiba ng Oplan Bayanihan ng Rehimeng US-Aquino. failure awaits the concentrated offensive of Oplan Bayanihan of the US-Aquino regime. <24> Hindi magtatagal, unti-unting mauubusan ng hangin ang walong batalyong golpe-de-gulat ng mga pasista habang nagkakamit ng solidong tagumpay ang Hukbong Bayan at mamamayan. it won't be long, the eight battalion attack of the fascists will run out of steam while the People's Army and people obtain solid victory. <25> Mabuhay ang alaala ni Kasamang Arman! long live the memory of companion Arman! <26> Mamamayan at Hukbong Bayan, Magkaisa! people and People's Army, unite! <27> Biguin ang Oplan Bayanihan ng Rehimeng US-Aquino! foil Oplan Bayanihan of the US-Aquino regime!

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_30035934 <1> Mamamayan ng Puerto Galera, benepisyaryo ng KPSM Serbisyo Ora Mismo Residents of Puerto Galera, beneficiary of KPSM Instant Service <2> September 28, 2016 September 28, 2016 <3> CALAPAN, Oriental Mindoro, Setyembre 28 (PIA) – Nagsagawang muli ng serbisyo publiko para sa mga mamamayan ng Puerto Galera ng regular na 'Kapitolyo Para Sa Mamamayan (KPSM)-Serbisyo Ora Mismo'. CALAPAN, Oriental Mindoro, September 28 (PIA) - Public service was again carried out for the residents of Puerto Galera by the regular "Capitol" for the Residents (KPSM)-Instant Service. <4> Iba’t ibang serbisyong panlipunan tulad ng medical at dental at iba pang mahahalagang serbisyo ng pamahalaan ang libreng naibigay sa mga mamamayan ng Puerto Galera. Various community services like medical and dental and other important services of the government were given free to the residents of Puerto Galera. <5> Sa serbisyong medikal na isinagawa sa Puerto Galera Hospital, 509 na mamamayan ang nabigyan ng libreng konsultasyon. in the medical services that was carried out by the Puerto Galera Hospital, 509 residents were given free consultation. <6> Sa pamamagitan naman ng mobile dental clinic, 450 ang libreng na-check up at nabunutan ng ngipin, 165 ang napakain sa libreng soup kitchen, 741 nabigyan ng libreng gamot, 180 ang naging kliyente ng PhilHealth. Through the mobile dental clinic, 450 had free check-ups and tooth extraction, 165 were fed in the free soup kitchen, 741 were given free medicine, 180 became clients of PhilHealth. <7> Mula naman sa Education and Employment Services Division (EESD), 19 na set ng sports materials ang naipagkaloob sa pamamagitan ng Provincial School Board habang 13 barangay ang nabigyan ng sports equipment ng Special Concerns Division (SCD). From the Education and Employment Services Division (EESD), 19 sets of sports materials were granted through the Provincial School Board while 13 barangay were given sports equipment by the Special Concerns Division (SCD). <8> Nagsagawa naman ang Provincial Tourism, Investment and Enterprise Development Office (PTIEDO) ng film viewing tungkol sa produksyon ng seafood snacks at namigay din ng Gabay sa Negosyo brochure sa 24 na katao. The Provincial Tourism, Investment and Enterprise Development Office (PTIEDO) conducted a film viewing about the production of seafood snacks and also gave away Guide to Business brochure to 24 people. <9> Mayroon ding walong indibidwal ang sumangguni sa Provincial Legal Office (PLO) tungkol sa pagresolba ng iba't ibang kaso at usaping legal. there were also eight individuals who consulted with the Provincial Legal Office (PLO) about resolving various cases and legal matters. <10> Nasa 13 barangay ang nabigyan ng butong pananim ng Provincial Agriculturist's Office samantalang 600 forest seedlings naman ang naipamahagi ng Environment and Natural Resources Office. there are 13 barangays given with plant seeds by the Provincial Agriculturist's Office while 600 forest seedlings were distributed by the Environment and Natural Resources Office. <11> Sa pamamagitan ng Provincial Veterinary Office (ProVet), 52 mga hayop ang nabakunahan kontra-rabies, kabilang na rito ang mga alagang pusa at aso na kinapon. Dito ay naging katuwang ng ProVet ang mga doktor mula sa lalawigan ng Marinduque. Through the Provincial Veterinary Office (ProVet), 53 animals were vaccinated with anti-rabies, included here were the castrated pet cats and dogs. Here the doctors became the support of ProVet from the province in Marinduque. <12> Samantala, mayroon namang 65 katao ang lumahok sa symposium ng isinagawa sa lugar ng Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) hinggil sa anti-drug campaign ng pamahalaang nasyunal. Meanwhile, there are 65 people who participated in the symposium conducted in the place by the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) about the anti-drug campaign of the national government. <13> Ang KPSM Serbisyo Ora Mismo ng kapitolyo ay nakasentro sa konsepto ng mabilis at agarang paghahatid ng mga pangunahing serbisyong panlipunan ng iba't ibang dibisyon ng Pamahalaang Panlalawigan at mga ahensya ng pamahalaang nasyunal sa mga mamamayan sa lahat ng bayan sa lalawigan. The KPSM Instant Service of the capitol is centered on the concept of fast and quick delivery of primary community services of various divisions of the Provincial Government and the agencies of the national government to the residents of all towns in the province. <14> (CPRSD/LTC/PIA-Mimaropa/Calapan) (CPRSD/LTC/PIA-Mimaropa/Calapan)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_95000064 <1> Sa ika-43 taong anibersaryo ng Bagong Hukbong Bayan: Digmang Bayan ang sagot sa papatinding kahirapan on the 43rd anniversary of the New People's Army: people's war is the answer to the intensifying poverty <2> Fortunato MagtanggolRCTU - Southern TagalogMarch 29, 2012Pinakamataas na rebolusyonaryong pagbati ang ipinapaabot ng Revolutionary Council of Trade Unions-National Democratic Front-Southern Tagalog sa ika-43 anibersaryo ng pagkakatatag ng Bagong Hukbong Bayan (New People’s Army)! Fortunato Magtanggol RCTU-Southern Tagalog March 29, 2012 highest revolutionary greeting is being sent out by the Revolutionary Council of Trade Unions - National Democratic Front - Southern Tagalog on the 43rd anniversary of the foundation of the New People's Army (New People's Army)! <3> Mataas na pagpupugay sa mga Pulang kumander at mandirigmang walang sawang naglilingkod at nag-aalay ng kanilang lakas, talino, at buhay para sa sambayanan at rebolusyon. high honor to the red commanders and warriors who untiringly serving and offering their strength, intelligence and life for the countrymen and the revolution. <4> Sa kasalukuyang panahon kung kailan kinakaharap ng mamamayan ang matinding kahirapan at karahasan dulot ng pagkabulok at tuluyang pagbagsak ng sistemang kapitalista sa pandaigdigang saklaw, walang ibang landas kundi ang lumaban sa pamamagitan ng armadong rebolusyon. in the current times, when the citizens are facing severe poverty and violence caused by the rotten and eventual fall of the capitalist system in the global scope, there is no other path but to fight through the armed revolution. <5> Higit na kinakailangang palakasin ang ating hukbong bayan upang ganap na maisulong ang armadong pakikibakang maghahawan ng daan upang maitayo ang lipunang may ganap na kasarinlan, katarungan at pagkalinga sa kanyang mamamayan. our people's army is needed to be strengthened more to fully advance the armed struggle that will clear the path to build a society with fullness of freedom, justice and care for its citizens. <6> Itinayo ng Partido Komunista ng Pilipinas (PKP) ang BHB noong Marso 29, 1969 bilang kanyang pangunahing rebolusyonaryong organisasyong masa. the Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP) founded the BHB last March 29, 1969 as its primary revolutionary mass organization. <7> Bilang hukbong pangmilitar, pampulitika, pang-ekonomiya, at pangkultura, komprehensibong isinusulong ng BHB ang mga tungkulin ng kasalukuyang yugto ng pambansa-demokratikong rebolusyon hanggang sa kasunod na yugtong rebolusyong sosyalista. as a military force, political, economic, and cultural, the BHB is comprehensively advancing the duties of the current chapter of the national democratic revolution until the next chapter of socialist revolution. <8> Simula nang maitayo ang BHB, maraming buhay na ang ibinuwis upang maitayo ang mga bakal at matayog na moog ng rebolusyon sa kanayunan. since the foundation of the BHB, more lives are given up to build the iron and high walled tower of the revolution in the villages. <9> Dahil sa walang tigil na paglulunsad ng mga mga programang kontra-rebolusyon ng mga nagdaang rehimen, naging masalimuot ang pinagdaanan ng BHB at buong rebolusyonaryong pwersa. because of the unceasing launching of the anti-revolutionary programs of the past regimes, the paths trodden by the BHB and the revolutionary forces became complicated. <10> Bagama’t may mga panahong nabalot ng pagkakamali, nagwasto ang BHB at muli nitong hinigpitan ang paghawak sa Marxismo-Leninismo-Kaispiang Mao Zedong bilang pang-ideyolohiyang gabay; naglunsad ng armadong pakikibaka ayon sa lapat na estratehiya at taktika; at nagsaayos at nagpatatag ng organisasyon mula sa walang tigil na pagpuna at pagpuna-sa-sarili at pagsunod sa demokratikong sentralismo bilang pangunahing prinsipyong pang-organisasyon ng buong rebolusyon. though there are times when wrapped with mistakes, the BHB corrected and again it tightened its grasp in the Marxist-Leninist-Mao Zedong Thought as an ideological guide; launched an armed struggle according to the suitable strategy and tactics; and organized and strengthened the organization from the unceasing criticism and criticism to itself and obedience to the centralized democracy as a primary organizing principle of the whole revolution. <11> Sa pamamagitan ng tuluy-tuloy na pag-oorganisa at pagpapasapi ng mga bagong mandirigma, unti-unting lumakas at lumawak ang kasapian ng BHB. through the continuous organization and recruitment of the new warriors, the membership of the BHB slowly gets stronger and expansive. <12> Naitayo ang mga baseng bukid at sonang gerilya sa malawak na kanayunan. the farm bases and guerrilla zones are built in huge villages. <13> Sa kasalukuyan, aabot na sa relatibong malawak na saklaw ang mga pulang gobyernong naitatayo sa pamamagitan ng armadong pakikibakang pinamumunuan ng PKP. currently, the red government being built reaches to a relatively expansive scope through the armed struggle led by the PKP. <14> Kaiba sa reaksyunaryong gobyerno at mga armadong pwersa nito, mapagkumbabang tumatanggap ng kamalian at natututo sa karanasan ang BHB. different from the reactionary government and its armed forces, the BHB is humbly accepting mistakes and learning from experiences. <15> Hindi tulad ng pulisya at militar na nasasangkot sa mga sindikato at naghahasik ng terorismo sa masa, ang BHB ay nananatiling nagsisilbi sa interes ng masang inaapi kung kaya ito ay patuloy na umaani ng suporta sa malawak na sambayanan. unlike the police and military who are involved in the syndicates and spreading terrorism to the masses, the BHB remains serving for the interest of the oppressed masses so therefore it continues to reap support from the larger society. <16> Masalimuot man ang napagdaanan, muli at tuluy-tuloy na nagpapalakas ang BHB. though complicated was the path trodden, the BHB yet again and continuously strengthening. <17> Sa gitna ng napakatinding pandaigdigang krisis na tumatagos sa bawat tahanan ng masang anakpawis, wala nang ibang masulingan ang mamamayan kundi ang lumaban. in the midst of the most severe global crisis which pierces through each homes of masses of children of the sweat, the citizens have no other recourse but to fight. <18> Sa patuloy na pagsasamantala ng imperyalistang US at ng kanyang mga lokal na papet na malalaking panginoong maylupa at malalaking burgesya komprador, walang ibang solusyon ang mamamayang Pilipino kundi ang pagsusulong ng digmang bayan. in the continual exploitation of the US imperialist and its local puppets who are the huge landlords and big bourgeoisie buyers, the Filipino citizens have no other solution but to advance the people's war. <19> Sa Timog Katagalugan matatagpuan ang mahigit kalahati ng special economic zones (SEZs) sa buong bansa. more than half of the special economic zones (SEZs) in the whole country can be found in Southern Tagalog. <20> Sa paghahabol ng mga kapitalista ng kanilang supertubo at upang isalba ang kanilang mga kompanya sa pandaigdigang krisis ng kapitalismo na sila ding may likha, dumaranas ng papatinding kahirapan ang maraming manggagawa. in the chase of the capitalists for their super high interests and to save their companies from the global crisis in capitalism whom they themselves have created, more workers are experiencing an intensifying poverty. <21> Malaon nang minamasaker ang regular na hanapbuhay, walang sapat na sahod at benepisyo, at sinusupil ang mga demokratikong karapatan sa pag-uunyon at pagwewelga. long has been massacred are the regular livelihood, lack of sufficient wages and benefits, and suppression of democratic rights on creating unions and rallying. <22> Habang nagpapakasasa ang mga kapitalista mula sa murang lakas-paggawa ng manggagawa, hilaw na materyales at government incentives gaya ng tax holidays at 100% ownership sa Pilipinas, harap-harapan ding pinagkakaitan ng gobyerno ang mga manggagawa ng karapatan sa pabahay, panirikan, kalusugan, edukasyon, at iba pang serbisyong panlipunan. while the capitalists are savoring from the cheap labor force of the workers, raw materials and government incentives such as tax holidays and 100% ownership in the Philippines; face to face, the government also denies from the workers the right for housing, land to build on, health, education, and other social services. <23> Bunga ng walang tigil na pagsipsip sa lakas, talino at kabuhayan ng uring manggagawa, natutuyot na parang dahon ang kanilang kinabukasan. result of the incessant sipping of the strength, intelligence and livelihood of the working class, their future is withered like a leaf. <24> Gayunpaman, ang pagkatuyot na ito ay batayan upang mas mabilis na pasiklabin ang apoy ng rebolusyon na magtatapos sa kahirapan at magsisimula ng tunay na pagbabago. nevertheless, this withering is the basis to quickly ignite the fire of the revolution that will end the poverty and will begin the authentic change. <25> Ang maghimagsik ay makatwiran. to revolt is justifiable. <26> Dahil sa patuloy na paghihikahos, maraming manggagawa at mamamayan ang naghahangad ng reboluyonaryong hustisya sa pamamagitan ng armadong pakikibaka. because of the continuing exhaustion, more workers and citizens are aspiring for a revolutionary justice through armed struggle. <27> Maraming manggagawa, magsasaka, kabataan, maralita at iba pang mamamayan ang patuloy na sumasapi at nagtatanghal sa BHB. more workers, farmers, youth, destitute and other citizens continue to join and perform in the BHB. <28> Sa pamamagitan ng tuluy-tuloy na pagpapatupad ng rebolusyong agraryo at pagtatayo ng mga moog ng rebolusyon sa kanayunan, tuluyang maibabagsak ang gobyernong kontrolado ng imperyalismong US at lokal na mga naghaharing uri. through the continuous implementation of agrarian reform and building of the walled towers of the revolution in the villages, the government controlled by the US imperialist and locals of the reigning class will totally be toppled down. <29> Tanging sa paglahok ng mga manggagawa at mamamayan sa Bagong Hukbong Bayan at pangunguna sa rebolusyonaryong kilusan sa kalunsuran, maitatayo ang demokratikong gobyernong bayan sa pamumuno ng uring proletaryado. only the involvement of the workers and citizens in the New People's Army, and in leading the revolutionary movement in the cities that the people's democratic government will be built through the leadership of the proletariat class. <30> MABUHAY ang Bagong Hukbong Bayan! long live the New People's Army! <31> New People’s Army: Tunay na hukbo ng sambayanan! New People's Army: real army of the nation! <32> Lubusin ang mga tungkulin ng demokratikong rebolusyong bayan! complete the duties of the people's democratic revolution! <33> Manggagawa at mamamayan, SUMAPI SA NPA! workers and citizens, join the NPA!
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_33645225 <1> Sunday, September 16, 2012 Sunday, September 16, 2012 <2> Maging Mapili sa mga Relasyon be selective with relationships <3> Sabihin mo sa akin kung sino ang mga kaibigan mo, at sasabihin ko sa iyo kung sino ka. tell me who your friends are, and I'll tell you who you are. <4> 21- Italaga na makiumpok at nakikiisa sa mga taong nakakatulong at nagpapahalaga sa iyo. 21- commit to mingle and be cooperative with the people who are able to help and value you. <5> Dalawa ang pangunahing pagpili sa buhay: tanggapin ang kinasadlakan mo bagama’t walang mainam na pagbabagong nangyayari, o tanggapin ang katotohanan na responsibilidad mo na paunlarin ang iyong sarili. two are the main options in life: accept your situation despite no good changes happening, or accept the truth that it is your responsibility to improve yourself. <6> At magaganap lamang ito kung sadya kang mapili sa mga taong nakapaligid at nakakasama mo sa araw-araw. and that will only happen if you are intentionally selective of the people around and spend time with you every day. <7> Narinig na natin ito, “Huwag isama ang bulok na mangga sa kaing ng mga mangga at mahahawa pa ang iba.” we have heard this, "do not include the rotten mango in the basket of mangoes because the others will be contaminated." <8> Sa lahat ng larangan o anumang aktibidad; tulad ng mga manlalaro sa basketbol, mga kasapi ng samahan, o maging grupo na kalahok sa paligsahan, sila ay magkakasama bilang kaisang-pangkat. in all fields or any activity; like players of basketball, members of an organization, or even a group participating in a contest, they are together as one team. <9> May pagkakaisa, bayanihan at nagtutulungan. there is unity, cooperation and helping one another. <10> Masusing pinapangalagaan ang reputasyon ng samahan, subalit mayroon pa ring lumilitaw sa samahan na may sariling agenda o nakatagong paghahangad. the reputation of the group is carefully looked after, but in the group there appears someone with a personal agenda or hidden desire. <11> Ito ang ‘bulok na mangga’ na nakakaapekto sa lahat, mapanira at lumalason sa moral ng buong samahan. this is the 'rotten mango' that affects everyone, destructive and poisoning the morale of the whole group. <12> Hangga’t maaga inihihiwalay na ito para hindi makasira sa pangkat. as early as possible it is separated so it cannot harm the group. <13> Iniiwasan ang mga ganitong tao, sa halip na makatulong ay siya pang nakakasira. people like these are avoided, instead of helping are the ones who cause harm. <14> Aliwan na nila ang manibugho, mainggit, mangutya at manira ng kapwa. their pastime is to be jealous, criticize and slander their neighbor. <15> Mabait sa harapan ngunit traydor sa likuran. nice when in front of you but a traitor behind your back. <16> Walang paggalang sa pagkatao ng iba, makuha lamang ang hinahangad na kapakinabangan o kasikatan. no respect for the character of others, just to obtain the desired benefit or fame. <17> Ang ganitong mga uri ng tao ay tinatakbuhang palayo, dahil aliwan na nila ang maghanap ng karamay. these kinds of people are avoided at all costs, because it is their hobby to find sympathizers. <18> Kung ang kapasiyahan mo ay sumunod na lamang sa agos, alalahanin na ang ragasa nito ay pababa at hindi pasalunga, na kadalasan ay tinatangay ang mga basura sa dinadaanan at mga kapaitan sa buhay. if your decision is to just go with the flow, remember that its current is downwards and not across, which usually carries garbage along the way and bitterness in life. <19> At sa katapusan, magigising ka na lamang na ginagawa din ang mga gawain ng iba na iyong sinamahan. and in the end, you will just wake up doing the actions of your other companions. <20> Malaya tayo na piliin ang matuwid na landas, at makakamtan lamang ito sa mga matutuwid na tao. we are free to select the straight path, and it can only be achieved through honest people. <21> Kung nais mong makatiyak ng tagumpay, palibutan mo ang iyong sarili ng mga matatagumpay na tao. if you want to ensure success, surround yourself with successful people. <22> At kung nais mo naman na pawang kabiguan ang laging makamit, luminya ka at makisama sa mga taong may galit sa mundo, paladaing, mapagpuna, mahilig sa tsismis at mga panooring walang katuturan. and if you want to always achieve failure, align yourself and hang out with people who have a grudge against the world, always complaining, critical, like gossip and shows with no sense. <23> Sila ay mga palaasa at tinanggap nang kusa ang kawalan ng pag-asa. they are optimists and voluntarily accepted the lack of hope. <24> Huwag pansinin ang pangungutya ng iba na hindi ka marunong makisama, sistema lamang nila ito para ka makiramay sa kanila. do not heed the jibe of others that you do not know how to get along, it is just their technique for you to sympathize with them. <25> Hindi mo makakayang baguhin ang kanilang pag-iisip, ang bagay na may kontrol ka lamang ay sa iyong sarili. you cannot change their thinking, the only thing you have control of is yourself. <26> Pupunahin at pipintasan ka na makasarili sa iyong mga pag-iwas sa kanila at wala kang magagawa para dito. you will be criticized and be picked at for being selfish in your avoidance of them and you cannot do anything about it. <27> Ang makakaya mo lamang ay pagpasiyahan kung papaano mo ipamuhay ang tamang buhay na nakatakda para sa iyo. what you can only do is decide how to live the right life set for you. <28> Tandaan: Lahat tayo ay mayroong kapasiyahan na piliin kung sinong mga tao ang ating sasamahan at magiging karelasyon. remember: all of us have the capacity to choose which people we will hang out and have relationships with. <29> Sa katapusan, ang mga pagpili na ito ang lumilikha kung sino tayo at kung ano ang ating magiging kapalaran. in the end, these choices create who we are and what our fate will be. <30> Sa relasyon, dalawang pagpili lamang ang nakalaan para sa iyo: Una, sa kapaligirang nakagisnan mo, ay maging katulad ka nila, kusang tagasunod at umaayon ka na magustuhan ng lahat. in relationships, only two choices are set for you: one, in the environment you are accustomed to, to be like them, voluntarily following and agreeing to be liked by all. <31> Pangalawa, ang maging ikaw sa nais mong uliran na pagkatao at makagawa ng kaibahan sa iba. second, to be you in your desired ideal personality and create a difference for others. <32> Mapabuti o mapasama, ito'y katulad ng rumaragasang ilog, patungo lamang sa isang direksiyon at hindi ka na makakabalik pa. whether good or bad, it is like a rushing river, heading only to one direction and you cannot go back anymore. <33> Bakit? why? <34> Sapagkat anumang naikintal at naihinang mo sa iyong kaisipan ay mahirap nang mabura, mangangailangan ito nang matinding pagbabago ng ugali, para mawasak at maglaho ang dating ugali. because whatever you have impressed and welded on your mind is difficult to erase, it will need an extreme change in personality, to destroy and vanish the old attitude. <35> At sa puntong ito, napakarami sa atin ang walang kakayahan at higit na ipinagpapatuloy ang nakasanayan at nakahumalingan na. and at this point, there are too many of us with no skill and further continue what we are used to and like. <36> Kung mapili tayo sa ating mga relasyon; ang ating koneksiyon sa ating mga mahal sa buhay, mga kaibigan, at mga kasamahan ay nagiging malalim, matalik at makahulugan. if we are picky with our relationships; our connection with our loved ones, friends, and colleagues becomes deep, close and meaningful. <37> Nagagawa nito na maging busilak at wagas ang ating mga relasyon sa kanila, at nagpapalakas ng pagtitiwala sa ating mga sarili. it can make our relationships with them clean and pure, and strengthen our self-confidence. <38> 10 Mga Kahalagahan ng Relasyon sa Pamayanan 10 importance of relationships in the community <39> 1- Mabuti ito para sa iyong kalusugan. 1- it is good for your health. <40> Ipinapakita sa mga pag-aaral na ang pagkakaroon ng isang mabuting pangkat o samahan ay malaki ang naitutulong sa iyong buhay, nagpapanatili ito ng iyong kalusugan, at inilalayo ka sa pagkabagot, paghina ng isip at depresyon. studies show that having a good group or association has a huge benefit in your life, it maintains your health, keeps you away from boredom, weakening of the mind and depression. <41> 2- Nakakatagpo ka ng mga bagong kakilala. 2- you find new acquaintances. <42> Pinalalawak nito ang iyong sirkulo ng mga kaibigan at pinalalakas ang iyong inpluwensiya sa pamayanan. it widens your circle of friends and strengthens your influence in the community. <43> Malaki ang naitutulong nito para mapanatili mo ang iyong kahalagahan at mga pagkakataon kung may mga pangangailangang dumarating sa iyong buhay. it will help you a lot in maintaining your value and opportunities if adversities come to your life. <44> 3-Nakakaroon ka ng mga bagong kaibigan. 3-you get new friends. <45> May mga pagkakataon kang makakilala ng mga kaibigan na makikipagtulungan sa iyo sa mga gawaing makabuluhan at nakakatulong sa samahan pati na sa iyong sarili. you have opportunities to discover friends who will collaborate with you in meaningful activities and can help the association and even yourself. <46> 4- Natututo ka ng mga bagong kakayahan. 4- you learn new skills. <47> Sa pagbu-boluntaryo sa mga serbisyong pambayan ay nagagawa mong mapag-aralan ang gawaing nakaatang sa iyo. in volunteering for community service you are able to study the tasks assigned to you. <48> Bilang miyembro ng komite – natututo ka ng publikong pamamahala, pagplano sa negosyo, pagpapairal ng mga alituntunin ng samahan, atbp. as a committee member - you learn public governance, planning a business, carrying out the regulations of the association, etc. <49> 5- Mabuti ito para sa pamayanan. 5- it is good for the community. <50> Hangga’t maraming tao ang nagtutulungan sa mga gawain, natututuhan nilang maging pamilyar kung papaano ginagawa ang mga bagay sa kanilang kapaligiran, lalong dumarami ang nagnanais na makiisa at makipagtulungan sa ikakaunlad ng komunidad. as long as many people help each other in tasks, they learn to be familiar with how things are done in their environment, those who want to join and cooperate for the improvement of their community further increase in number <51> 6- Masusundan mo ang iyong mga interes o kinalulugdang mga bagay. 6- you can follow your interests or things you are delighted by. <52> Anuman ang iyong kinagigiliwang magawa o libangan, mayroon ding mga tao na katulad ng iyong interes at nagnanais na makipag-ugnayan para dito. whatever your favorite activities or hobbies, there are also people with the same interest as yours and want to connect over it. <53> Sumapi sa grupo ng mga ito para masuportahan ang bawa’t isa at maibahagi ang iyong pasiyon. join groups about it to support each other and share your passion. <54> 7- Mapapaganda mo ang iyong mga katangian. 7- you can improve your qualities. <55> Kung kasapi ka sa isang organisasyon at humahawak ng posisyon, karagdagang inpormasyon ito sa iyong mga kuwalipikasyon at reputasyon. if you are a member of an organization and hold a position, it is additional information in your qualifications and reputation. <56> Magagamit mo itong batayan sa paglipat o sa pagkuha ng bagong trabaho para malaman ang iyong makabuluhang paglilingkod sa pamayanan. you can use it as basis in transferring or getting a new job so that your meaningful service to the community can be known. <57> 8- Napag-aaralan mong maging matibay at matatag. 8- you learn to be strong and tough. <58> Sa karanasang natututuhan mo sa bayanihan o pagtutulungan sa komunidad, lumalawak ang iyong karapatan at inpluwensiya sa mga naka-posisyon sa pamahalaan at nanunungkulan para pakinggan ang iyong mga hangarin na makatulong sa komunidad. in your experience helping or cooperating in the community, your rights and influence in those positioned in the government and administration spread so your ambitions to help the community can be heard. <59> 9- Makakagawa ka ng kontribusyon. 9- you can make contributions. <60> Bilang mamamayan, ang makagawa ng kaibahan sa iyong mga kababayan, kapaligiran, at pamayanan ay isang dakilang misyon sa ikakaunlad ng bawa’t isa. as a citizen, making a difference in your fellow countrymen, surroundings, and community is a noble mission that will improve one another. <61> 10-Mabuti ito para sa ating bansang Pilipinas. 10-it is good for our country the Philippines. <62> Kailangan natin ang isang malakas at makapangyarihang lipunan para sa lahat, na kung saan ang pamahalaan at pangangalakal ay nagtutulungan at hindi pinatatakbo ang bawa’t bagay, at mayroong sambayanan na may kanya-kanyang organisasyon para sa mga lunggati na nagpapaunlad ng mga pamayanan. we need a strong and powerful society for everyone, where the government and economy help each other and do not run everything, and there is a society with their own organizations for the strong desire to improve the community. <63> Hindi mo magagawang magpatuloy na tahakin ang matuwid na landas at makarating ka sa baluktot na destinasyon. you are not able to continue taking the straight path and end up in a twisted destination. <64> Malinaw na piliin ang mga taong makakasama mo sa iyong paglalakbay, nasa iyong mga tamang pagkilos ang tunay na repleksiyon ng iyong mga lunggati. clearly choose the people who will be with you in your journey, the true reflection of your desires is in your right move. <65> Kung may mga katanungan, ay may mga kasagutan. if there are questions, there are answers. <66> \- Pinipili mo ba ang iyong kakilala base sa kanilang maitutulong sa iyo? do you choose your acquaintances based on what they can help you with? <67> -Nagbibigay ka ba para may makuha? -do you give in order to receive? <68> At umaasang may kapalit o kabayaran ang nagawa mong pagtulong? and expect something in return or payment for the help you did? <69> -Naniniwala ka ba na kaya ka gusto ng ibang tao ay dahil sa mga ibinibigay mo sa kanila? -do you believe that other people like you because of what you give to them? <70> -Hangga’t maaari ayaw mong tumanggap ng anuman sa iba, dahil nangangamba ka bang magkautang ng pabor sa kanila? -as much as possible you do not want to accept anything from others, because you worry that you will owe them a favor? <71> -Hindi ka ba panatag hangga’t wala kang kontrol sa asal ng iba? -are you not contented until you have control over the attitude of others? <72> -Nag-aaksaya at kinakarkula mo ba kung papaano mapapasunod ang iba nang naaayon sa iyong kagustuhan? -do you waste and calculate how to make others obey according to your wants? <73> -Napapabayaan mo ba ang iyong sarili sa pag-aasikaso sa kapakanan ng iba? -do you neglect yourself in attending to the welfare of others? <74> At ibayong iniisip ang kanilang mga problema sa araw-araw? and worry double about their problems every day? <75> -Napipilitan ka bang magbigay kapag ikaw ay nahilingan? -are you forced to give when you are asked? <76> Matapos ang maghapon; ang mainam na katanungan sa ating sarili, ay ang magtatakda sa uri ng mga taong kasalamuha natin ngayon, na siyang magiging uri ng pagkatao natin. after the day has passed; the good question to ask ourselves, will decide the kind of people we encounter today, that will become the type of our personality. <77> Nagiging interesado lamang tayo sa kanila kapag ang kanilang asal ay ginising ang katulad na asal na tinataglay natin. we only become interested in them when their attitude awakens a similar attitude we possess. <78> Madali na ang magpasiya kapag batid natin kung ano ang higit nating pinahahalagahan sa buhay. deciding is easy once we know what we value more in life. <79> Tagumpay o Bigo? success or failure? <80> Panalo o Talo? victory or defeat? <81> Masaya o Malungkot? happy or sad? <82> Kaligayahan o Kapighatian? joy or grief? <83> Alinman dito, ay nasa iyong kapangyarihan ang pumili. whichever of these, it is in your power to choose. <84> At ito ang iyong magiging kapalaran. and it will become your destiny. <85> Jesse Guevara Jesse Guevara <86> Lungsod ng Balanga, Bataan City of Balanga, Bataan <87> Subaybayan ang 31 na mahahalagang mga paksa: subscribe to the 31 important topics: <88> Matatag na Sariling-Pugay at Tanging Pag-ibig strong self-respect and special love

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_48085574 <1> CHALLENGE ACCEPTED challenge accepted <2> ANG buhay ng tao ay punom-puno ng mga pagsubok na humahamon at sumusubok sa ating lakas at tatag. the life of a person is full of trials which are testing and challenging our strength and firmness. <3> Sa marami-rami na ring bansa na aking napuntahan, iba’t ibang tao na ang aking nakilala at nakasalamuha. I have met and interacted with different kinds of people in quite a lot of countries that I have been to. <4> Magmula sa mga CEO, COO, doctor, abogado, teacher hanggang sa mga simpleng empleyado ay aking nakapanayam at nakasama, at sa istorya ng kanilang mga buhay at tagumpay ay hindi nawawala ang mga problema at pagsubok na dumarating, tunay ngang tila parte na ng buhay ng tao ang mga ito. I have interviewed and mingled with CEO, COO, doctor, lawyer, teacher to simple employees, and in the stories of their lives and successes, the arrival of problems and challenges cannot be missing, these seem to be part of the life of a person. <5> Subalit sabi nga ng linya sa isang kanta – “ mga pagsubok lamang ‘yan, ‘wag mong isuko ang laban.” but as the line of the song tells - "those are just challenges, do not surrender the fight." <6> Sa Macau ay isang Filipinang domestic helper ang aking nakilala. I have met a Filipina domestic helper in Macau. <7> Siya si Nanay Josie at ibinahagi niya sa akin ang istorya ng patuloy na pakikibaka niya sa mga hamon ng buhay. she is Mother Josie and she shared to me the story of her continuing struggle in the challenges of life. <8> Tubong Mabatan, Abucay sa Bataan si Nanay Josie, masaya at maginhawa ang kanyang buhay kasama ang kanyang tatlong anak. Mother Joise is raised in Mabatan, Abucay in Bataan, her life is happy and prosperous with her three children. <9> Mayroon siyang katulong at hindi niya gasinong problema ang mga gastusin upang matustusan ang pag-aaral ng kanyang mga anak na noon ay nagsisipag-aral pa, sapagkat ang kanyang asawa ay may magandang trabaho sa bansang Saudi Arabia. she had a helper and it was not much of problem to provide for the expenses of education of her children who were still studying, because her husband had a good job in Saudi Arabia. <10> Aniya ay kontento na siya sa kanilang masaya at tila perpektong buhay kaya hindi niya inasahan ang isang malaking hamon na sa kanya ay susubok- nagkahiwalay sila ng asawang nasa Saudi. for her, she was contented with their happy and seemingly perfect life so she had not expected that a huge challenge would test her - she separated from her husband who was in Saudi. <11> Tila gumuho noon ang mundo ni Josie at dahil sa matinding kalungkutan at pighati dahil sa nangyari ay nagdesisyon siyang mangibang bansa upang kahit papaano ay mabawasan ang lungkot na kanyang dinaranas at upang kumita ng salapi para sa gastusin ng kanilang pamilya. seemed that Josie's world crumbled then and because of too much sadness and grief due to what happened, she decided to go abroad so that somehow the sadness that she was experiencing will be lessened and to earn money to be spent for their family. <12> Dinala siya ng kapalaran sa bansang Macau, na noon ay hindi pa gaanong maunlad kung ikukumpara sa kasalukuyan nitong estado. she was brought by fate in the country Macau, which was not so progressive before compared to its current state. <13> Halos isang buwan din siyang walang trabaho noong unang buwan niya roon, kaya’t iba’t ibang trabaho ang kanyang pinasok gaya ng pagtitinda ng mga pagkain at pagma-manicure, upang kahit papaano ay matustusan niya ang kanyang mga pangangailangan doon. on the months that she was there, she did not have work for almost a month, so she entered various jobs such as selling food and giving manicure so that somehow she could provide for her needs there. <14> Patuloy lamang na tinanggap at hinarap ni Nanay Josie ang bawat hamon na dumarating at nagtatangkang igupo siya. Mother Josie continues to accept and face each challenge coming and attempting to take her down. <15> Hanggang sa makapagtrabaho siya bilang isang domestic helper, kung saan ay natulungan siya ng kanyang boss na isang Portuguese, upang magkaroon ng blue card at maging ligal ang pananatili niya sa Macau. until she was able to work as a domestic helper where she was helped by her Portuguese boss to acquire a blue card and make her stay in Macau legally. <16> Aminado si Nanay Josie na mahirap man ang naging adjustment para sa kanya sapagkat ang dating magandang buhay sa Pilipinas ay nauwi sa pagiging isang katulong sa Macau ay nagpapasalamat pa rin siya sa Maykapal sapagkat binigyan siya nito ng katatagan at lakas ng loob upang harapin ang mga pagsubok na naging daan upang higit niyang makilala ang kanyang sarili at matuklasan ang iba pa niyang kakayahan at potensyal. Nanay Josie admitted that the adjustment for her was difficult because of her previous good life in the Philippines which ended up as a maid in Macau, but she was still grateful to God because she was given with firmness and internal strength to face the challenge she was going through so she could know herself better and discover her other abilities and potential. <17> PASAPORTE/JR Langit passport/ Junior Langit

just because you're a non-Ranger what do you think of us Rangers? thieves? <19> Suntukan na lang!". let's just box!". <20> Naawat ko naman sila. I was able to restrain them, though. <21> Dahil dito, gamitin ng tama ang naturang terminolohiya at baka 'ma-Ranger' tayo. because of this, use the said terminology properly. otherwise, we might get "Ranger-ed".

Soriano Elsha Marie B. Soriano <4> CALASIAO, Pangasinan, Nobyembre 21 (PIA) – Naging matagumpay ang isinagawang blood donation drive ng Bombo Radyo Dagupan sa Robinsons’ Place sa bayan ng Calasiao noong Sabado. Calasiao, Pangasinan, November 21 (PIA) - the blood donation drive held by Bombo Radyo Dagupan at Robinsons' Place in the town of Calasiao on Saturday was a success. <5> Ayon kay Josie Sarmiento, manager ng Bombo Radyo Dagupan, ang aktibidad kung saan kasama ang Philippine Red Cross (PRC)-Pangasinan Chapter ay nakakolekta ng 190 units ng dugo mula sa mga donor at empleyado ng Bombo Radyo na nakibahagi sa blood donation drive. according to Josie Sarmiento, manager of Bombo Radyo Dagupan, the activity together with the Philippine Red Cross (PRC)-Pangasinan Chapter collected 190 units of blood from donors and employees of Bombo Radyo who participated in the blood donation drive. <6> Ani Sarmiento, layon ng taunang blood donation project na makatulong na mabigyan ang mga nangangailan ng sapat at ligtas na dugo sa lalawigan. according to Sarmiento, the annual blood donation project aims to help give sufficient and clean blood to those in need in the province. <7> Dagdag niya, ang aktibidad na ngayon ay nasa ika-14 na taon, ay ginaganap tuwing Nobyembre kasabay ng buwan ng kaarawan ng chairman ng Bombo Radyo Philippines na si Dr. Rogelio Clorete na may layunin na ibalik sa komunidad ang biyaya na natatanggap ng istasyon sa pamamagitan ng pagsasagawa ng boluntaryong pagbibigay ng dugo para sa mga nangagailangan nito. she added, the activity which is now on its 14th year, is held every November coinciding with the birthday month of Bombo Radyo Philippines chairman Doctor Rogelio Clorete with the aim of giving back to the community the blessings received by the station by holding voluntary blood donation for those needing it. <8> “Lubos na nagpapasalamat ang aming tanggapan at PRC-Pangasinan Chapter sa lahat nakibahagi sa proyekto at sa walang sawang suporta sa pag-donate ng dugo kada-taon upang makatulong sa kapwa natin na nangangailan ng dugo,” saad ni Sarmiento. "our office and PRC-Pangasinan Chapter are absolutely thankful to all who participated in the project and ceaselessly support the donation of blood every year to help our neighbors who need blood," Sarmiento stated. <9> Samantala, ang aktibad kung saan sabayang ginanap sa buong Pilipinas, ay isinagawa rin sa Plaza Enrique Braganza Complex sa lungsod ng Alaminos kung saan nakolekta naman ang higit 30 units ng dugo na may katumbas na 450 cubic centimeters kada unit. meanwhile, the activity which was simultaneously held in the whole Philippines, was also held in Plaza Enrique Braganza Complex in the city of Alaminos where more than 30 units of blood with the equivalent of 450 cubic centimeters per unit were collected. <10> (JNPD/EMBS/PIA-1, Pangasinan) (JNPD/EMBS/PIA-1, Pangasinan)
