MATERIAL_BASE-1B_26764300 <1> Ang Noche Buena ng Scout Rangers Ang isa sa pinakaaabangang yugto ng mga hukbo na nakatalaga sa field ay ang makakauwi sa kapaskuhan para makapiling ang mga kapamilya. the noche buena of the scout rangers, one of the most anticipated chapters by troops assigned in the field, is coming home at Christmas to be together with family. <2> Noong ako ay Company Commander ng 10th SRC, nakalatag na ang schedule ng bakasyon sa Nobyembre pa lamang. when I was company commander in the 10th SRC, vacation schedule is already laid out by November. <3> Pinag-uusapan ng mga members ng teams kung paano sila salitang magbakasyon sa Pasko at sa Bagong Taon. the team members already talk about how they will alternate vacation on Christmas and New Year. <4> Ang Pasko ay may kaakibat na tradisyon na kung saan ay panay kasayahan kasama ang mga mahal sa buhay at ang pinakaimportante sa lahat ay ang kainan tuwing Noche Buena. Di po ba? Christmas has an accompanying tradition where it is all festivity together with loved ones and the most important of all is the meal during noche buena. right? <5> Walang katapusang kainan ng masasarap na pagkain na tipong sa Pasko mo rin lang matitikman ang iba. endless eating of delicious food in which some it is only in Christmas you get to taste them. <6> Syempre, sa ating mga Pilipino, pag-ipunan natin ang Pasko para ang Noche Buena ay talagang bonggacious kagaya ng larawan sa ibaba. of course, for us Filipinos, we save up for Christmas so noche buena is really extravagant like the photo below. <7> Ang Noche Buena ng mga Musang Malaking porsyento ng mga sundalo ay mga Kristiyano at kalimitan ay mga Katoliko. Ito ang dahilan kung bakit ang mga yunit ay nagkakaroon din ng mga selebrasyon na alinsunod sa ginagawa ng karamihang sibilyan. the noche buena of the Musang a large percent of the soldiers are Christians and often are Catholics. this is the reason why the units also have celebrations following what is done by many civilians. <8> Pagkatapos ng isang engkwentro namin noong Disyembre 17, 2000 sa Patikul ay nagkaroon kami ng pagkakataon na magpahinga ng 3 araw sa Barangay Taglibi para magpa-resupply ng bala at mga pagkain para sa operations. after one of our encounters on December 17, 2000 in Patikul we had the chance to rest for 3 days in Barangay Taglibi to resupply bullets and food for the operations. <9> Kinuha ko na rin iyon na pagkakataon para magpadala ng karneng manok, baka, isda at pati tinapay at pancit miki na syang ihahanda para sa aming munting salu-salo. I also took that as a chance to send for chicken meat, beef, fish and even bread and pancit miki that will be prepared for our small banquet. <10> Once in a blue moon din lang na hinahayaan ko silang tumikim ng alak. it is also once in a blue moon I allow them to taste alcohol. <11> Tikim lang talaga kasi isang lapad lang bawat team. just a taste because there is only one bottle for each team. <12> Bawal kasi malasing kapag nasa kasagsagan ng combat operations. because it is forbidden to get wasted in the midst of combat operations. <13> Ang ginagawa namin ay naka-distribute sa bawat teams ang mga sangkap at kanya-kanyang assignment ng putahe. what we do is the ingredients are distributed to each team and their own dish assignments. <14> Division of labor ika nga. division of labor as they say. <15> Sa kanilang munting pagpupulong, ipinasa ng Platoon Sergeant ang aking kautusan. in their small meetings, the platoon sergeant relays my order. <16> "Team 1, adobong manok!" "team 1, chicken adobo!" <17> "Team 2, pancit miki guisado!" "team 2, sautéed pancit miki!" <18> "Team 3, nilagang buto ng baka!" "team 3, stewed beef bone!" <19> "Team 4, escabeche at kinilaw na isda!" "team 4, marinade and raw fish!" <20> Syempre, paminsan lang din naman kaming maghahanda ng ganoon kagaya ng may unit anniversary o birthday celebration ng tropa. of course, we have a feast like that only occasionally like if there is a unit anniversary or birthday celebration of the troop. <21> Ang kaibahan lang sa amin, iniba namin ang oras ng Noche Buena. the only difference for us, we changed the hour of noche buena. <22> Instead na sa hating-gabi ay ginagawa namin bago ang tinatawag na End of Evening Nautical Twilight, o bago tuluyang dumilim. instead of midnight we do it before what is called the end of evening nautical twilight, or before it eventually darkens. <23> Bakit? why? <24> Syempre, mahirap yatang kumakain sa gitna ng dilim! of course, it can be difficult to eat in the middle of darkness! <25> Pre, baka magtanong ka kung 'Noche Buena' pa ba yon? bro, you might ask if that is still 'noche buena'? <26> Alam ko naman na "Good night" ang ibig sabihin noon salitang iyon pero syempre practical kami sa field. I know that the meaning of that term is "good night" but of course we are practical in the field. <27> Mas mahalaga ang safety ng tropa kaysa naman mag-flashlight kami para makapaglatag ng kainan sa hating-gabi. the safety of the troop is more important instead of us using flashlight to lay out a meal at midnight. <28> Okay, sabihin na lang nating, "Buenas Tardes" (Good afternoon) ang aming handaan dahil bago gumabi namin kinakain ang handa na pang-Noche Buena. okay, let us just say, our feast is "buenas tardes" (good afternoon) because we eat our food for noche buena before evening. <29> Ang importante sa lahat, solved kami. the most important of all, we are done. <30> Naka-smile ang lahat at nalilimutan ang lungkot na nararamdaman ng mga mandirigma na naiiwang makikipaglaban sa mga bandido sa kapaskuhan. everyone is smiling and forgets the sadness felt by soldiers left fighting against bandits at Christmas. <31> Well, maswerte kami noon kasi nasa 'admin area' kami para sa resupply operations. well, we were lucky then because we were in the 'admin area' to resupply operations. <32> Paano naman pala kung nasa gitna ng gubat kami inabutan ng Pasko? what if we were caught in the middle of the forest on Christmas? <33> Syempre, pang-tactical din ang Noche Buena. of course, our noche buena is tactical too. <34> Actually, pinadalhan ako ng larawan ng mga mandirigma na nasa kagubatan ng Patikul ngayong Pasko ng 2014. Nasa parehas silang lugar na aking ginagalugad sampung taon lang ang nakalipas. actually, the fighters in the forest of Patikul sent me a photo this Christmas of 2014. they were in the same area we explored only ten years ago. <35> Nang aking kinausap ang Platoon Leader, ipinaabot nya ang mensahe ng kanyang yunit na walang humpay ang paghahalughog sa kasukalan para tugisin ang mga bandido na may hawak pa ring mga hostages. when I talked to the platoon leader, he passed on the message of his unit who have not stopped searching the forest to pursue the bandits still holding hostages. <36> "Sir, para maramdaman namin ang diwa ng Pasko, naghahanda pa rin kami ng espesyal na menu. "sir, in order for us to feel the spirit of Christmas, we still prepare a special menu. <37> Pinaaabot namin sa ating mga kababayan ang aming mainit na pagbati ng Merry Christmas mula dito sa kagubatan ng Patikul." we send to our fellowmen our warm greeting of Merry Christmas here from the forests of Patikul." <38> Sa nakikita ko noong aking kapanahunan at ngayon, halos parehas lang ang aming pakikiisa sa Noche Buena. in what I see from my time and now, our celebration of noche buena is almost the same. <39> Ang importante sa amin ay nararamdaman namin ang pagiging pamilya ng aming mga kasamahang tropa at nalilimutan ang nararamdamang kalungkutan tuwing naaalala namin ang kanya-kanyang pamilya sa aming tahanan. what is important to us is we become family with our companions in the troop and forget the sadness felt every time we remember our own families at home. <40> Ganon lamang kasimple ang aming handa at kung ano man ang available ay aming pinagkakasya. our meal is that simple and whatever is available, we make do. <41> Ang importante sa amin ay tuloy-tuloy na magagampanan ang sinumpaang tungkulin na ipagtanggol ang ating kababayan sa pwersa ng masasama. what is important to us is to continue fulfilling our sworn duty to protect our fellowmen from forces of evil.

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_89940620 <1> PPP sa LGU inilunsad sa SOCCSKSARGEN Region PPP launched in SOCCSKSARGEN Region <2> September 27, 2016 September 27, 2016 <3> LUNGSOD NG KORONADAL, South Cotabato, Set. 27 (PIA) -- Inilunsad ng Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) sa Koronadal City ang inisyatibong magsusulong ng pagtutulungan ng mga lokal na pamahalaan at pribadong sektor para sa magpapatupad ng mga proyektong pang-imprastraktura at pampublikong serbisyo. City of Koronadal, South Cotabato, September 27 (PIA) - the Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) in Koronadal City launched the initiative that will advance the cooperation of the local government and private sectors for the implementation of the infrastructure projects and public services. <4> Tinatawag ang programa na Public Private Partnership for the People Initiative for the Local Governments (LGU P4). the program is called Public Private Partnership for the People Initiative for the Local Governments (LGU P4). <5> Sa isang panayam sinabi ni DILG 12 Regional Director Reynaldo Bungubung na ang launching ng LGU P4 sa Koronadal City noong Biyernes ay ang kauna-unahang regional kick off sa naturang programa. in one interview, DILG 12 Regional Director Reynaldo Bungubung said that the launching of the LGU P4 in Koronadal City last Friday was the first regional kick-off of the said program. <6> Paliwanag naman ni Anna Liza Bonagua, director ng Bureau of Local Government Development (BLGD) ng DILG, layon ng LGU P4 na isulong ang konsepto ng PPP sa mga barangay, munisipyo, lungsod at lalawigan sa layong makatulong sa pagsulong sa kaunlarang pang-ekonomiya sa mga lokal na pamahalaan. explained by Anna Liza Bonagua, director of the Bureau of Local Government Development (BLGD) of the DILG, objective of the LGU P4 is to advance the concept of the PPP in barangays, municipalities, cities and provinces in the goal to help in the advancement of economic progress in the local governments. <7> Paliwanag pa ng opisyal, sa ilalim ng programa maaring ang lokal na pamahalaan ang lumapit sa mga pribadong mamumuhunan para alukin na pondohan ang mga proyektong naghihintay na pondohan ng pamahalaang nasyunal at ibang donor. explained by the official, under the program, the local government may approach the private investors to offer in funding the projects which are waiting to be funded by the national government and other donors. <8> Maaari ring ang pribadong sektor ang mag-alok na pondohon at ipatupad ang mga proyektong sa tingin nito ay kakakailanganin ng LGU. the private sector may also offer to fund and implement the projects that it perceives to be needed by the LGU. <9> Diin pa ng Bonagua, walang limitasyon sa liit o laki ng proyekto ang maaaring ipapatupad sa LGU P4. Ang mahalaga aniya ay mapagkasunduan ng dalawang panig ang pagkakasosyo at masigurong kikita ang dalawang panig. insisted by Bonagua, there is no limitation in the smallness or largeness of the project that can be implemented in LGU P4. the important is, according to him, the two parties will be able to agree in their partnership and assure that both parties will gain profit. <10> Ilan sa mga proyektong maaaring ipatupad ay pamamahala ng pagkolekta ng basura kalsada, tulay, pasilidad na mabibigay ng serbisyong pampubliko at marami pang iba. few of the projects that can be implemented are the management in the collection of garbage on the roads, bridges, facilities that will give public service and many others. <11> (DEDoguiles-PIA 12) (DEDoguiles-PIA 12)

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_51828773 <1> Sundalo - Sa Aking Karanasan soldier - my experience <2> Maliit pa lang kaming magkakapatid, isinasama na kami ng tatay kong sundalo sa paninirahan sa isang kampo sa Mindanao. when my siblings and I were still young, my father who is a soldier brought us to live with him in a camp in Mindanao. <3> Nakakaawa kasi si tatay kung mag-isa lang siya sa kampo. because it was a pity to see father alone in camp. <4> At mas iba talaga kapag buo ang pamilya. and it really is different if the family is complete. <5> Marami din namang mga sundalo ang nagdadala ng pamilya sa kampo kaya nakisabay na rin siguro sa agos at nakapagdesisyon nang ganoon si nanay. there are also many soldiers who bring their family to camp so maybe mother went along with the flow and decided that way. <6> Lumaki kami kasama ang mga sundalo. we grew up together with the soldiers. <7> Kung saan sila madidestino, ay kasama din kaming mga pamilya. wherever they are stationed, we the family also go along. <8> Natirhan namin ang South Cotabato, Davao del Sur, North Cotabato, at Maguindanao. we have lived in South Cotabato, Davao del Sur, North Cotabato, and Maguindanao. <9> Kaya hindi na bago sa amin kung marami kaming paaralan at kahit kaming magkakapatid ay hindi pare-pareho ng ALMA MATER. so it is not new to us if we have many schools and even us siblings do not have the same alma mater. <10> Lahat kaming mga bata sa kampo, iniidolo ang trabaho ng aming mga tatay. all of us kids at camp, idolize the job of our fathers. <11> Bakit? why? <12> Dahil ginagawa nila ang kanilang makakaya para ilihis ang mga taong nais manggulo at para hindi masaktan ang mga sibilyan. because they do what they can to divert the people who want to cause trouble and so that civilians do not get hurt. <13> Mula sa mga rebelde, nagkaroon nang sagupaan ang mga sundalo sa Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) sa probinsiya ng Maguindanao at ilang bayan sa North Cotabato. from the rebels, the soldiers had an encounter with the Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) in the province of Maguindanao and some towns of North Cotabato. <14> May pagkakataon pa nga na kaming mga kabataan ang nagdadala ng bala ng kanyon mula sa taguan nito para ibigay sa gunner na siyang hihila ng tali para ito paputukin. there were even times when we children were the ones who brought the ammunition of the cannon from its storage to give to the gunner, who will pull the rope to make it explode. <15> Iyon ay dahil wala ang mga tatay namin at kakaunti ang mga sundalong naiwan sa kampo. that is because our fathers were absent and the soldiers left at camp were few. <16> Noong naging integrated ang MNLF at nagkaroon ng Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (ARMM), medyo mapayapa na. when the MNLF became integrated and the Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (ARMM) came to be, it was somewhat peaceful already. <17> Ngunit, ilang buwan lang ang itinagal nito dahil dumating ang isang sigalot kung saan ang mga Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) ang naging katunggali ng pinagsanib na puwersa ng AFP at Integrated MNLF. but, it lasted only a few months because a conflict arrived wherein the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) became the opponent of the joint force of the AFP and Integrated MNLF. <18> Taong 2000, kasagsagan ng mga giyera sa Maguindanao, napadaan kami sa isang eskuwelahan sa bandang Buldon. year 2000, the peak of the fighting in Mindanao, we passed by a school near Buldon. <19> Kagagaling lang namin noon sa isang school press contest na idinaos sa Visayas at tanging ito lang ang daan (Marawi to Cotabato route) na malapit pauwi sa Parang, Maguindanao. we were just coming from a school press contest held in Visayas and this was the only way (Marawi to Cotabato route) near the way home to Parang, Maguindanao. <20> Kahit ordinaryong eskuwelahan ito pero mararamdaman mo ang tensyon. even if it was an ordinary school you could feel the tension. <21> Isa din kasi ito sa lugar na laging binobomba ng militar. because it was also one of the places that was always bombed by the military. <22> Nakuha ng atensyon ko ang isang estudyante na may bitbit na baril. one student carrying a gun caught my attention. <23> At animo'y galit sa akin nang malaman na ako'y anak ng sundalo. and as if he was angry at me upon learning that I am the child of a soldier. <24> Ang mga kaklase niya ang pumigil at nagpatahan sa kanya. his classmates were the ones who stopped and calmed him down. <25> Narinig ko sa kanila na "Hindi yan kasali, Inosente yan". I heard from them that "he is not included, he is innocent". <26> Estudyante lang din siya katulad ko pero may ipinaglalaban na siya. he was just a student like me but there was something he was already fighting for. <27> All-Out-War! all-out-war! <28> Matindi ang bakbakan. the fighting is intense. <29> Ang rutang minsan kong nadaanan ay hindi na ligtas. the route I sometimes passed through is no longer safe. <30> Nag-aaral na ako sa kolehiyo nang nasugatan ang tatay ko sa isang engkuwentro. I was studying in college when my father was wounded in an encounter. <31> At sa semestral break ng klase ay ang uga nang pagsabog ng kanyon ang bumulaga sa bakasyon ko. and in my semester break from class the shaking from the firing of a cannon welcomed my vacation. <32> Marami ang namatay. many died. <33> Ang ilan sa kanila, malapit na kaibigan ng tatay. some of them, were close friends of dad. <34> Minsan hindi ko maipaliwanag ang giyera sa Maguindanao. sometimes I cannot explain the war in Maguindanao. <35> May pagkakataon kasi na kahit malapit na ang grupo ng mga rebelde sa kampo ay wala namang bakbakan na naganap. because there are times when the rebels are already near camp but no fighting that takes place. <36> Wika nga nila, "pag walang utos, walang giyera". as they say "if there is no instruction, there is no war". <37> Hindi ko rin maunawaan kung bakit pa kailangang mag-away gayong puwede naman palang mamuhay nang tahimik at walang gulo. I also cannot understand why there is a need to fight when it is possible to live peacefully and without conflict. <38> Ang Terorista at ang Bangsamoro Basic Law. the terrorist and the Bangsamoro Basic Law. <39> Marami akong nakasalamuha na mga Muslim. I have encountered many Muslims. <40> Karapat-dapat naman talaga sa kanila ang pagbabago at kapayapaan. they are truly deserving of change and peace. <41> Malamang ang BBL ang maging susi nito. the BBL will likely be the key to it. <42> Ganunpaman dahil ito ay isinusulong ng bandidong grupo, para sa akin, ito ay malabong mangyari. still, because the bandit group is supporting it, for me, it is unlikely to happen. <43> Paano ba maitatayo ang bandila ng kapayapaan kung ngayon pa lang ay marami nang dahas ang nagagawa nila? how can the flag of peace be erected if even now they are committing so much violence? <44> Huwag sanang kalimutan ang mga sibilyan na pinatay sa Lanao del Norte noon at maya't mayang pagsabog ng bomba na sibilyan ang puntirya sa ngayon. hopefully the civilians killed in Lanao del Norte back then and the round-the-clock bomb explosives that target civilians today will not be forgotten. <45> Paano na kaya kung ang kanilang lakas militar ay maging lehitimo? what if their military power becomes legitimate? <46> Paano na ang mga militar ng gobyerno? what of the government militaries? <47> Kaya nga iisa lang ang tandang sa aming alagang manok dahil nagsasabong kapag dalawa sila. which is why there is only one rooster in our pet chickens, because they fight if there are two of them. <48> Kung mula sa MNLF ay nabuo ang MILF, at dahil sa MILF ay may BIFF, hindi pa ba nadala ang gobyerno na mas lalong lumalaki ang problema? if the MILF was made from the MNLF, and because of the MILF there is the BIFF, has the government not learned from the further increasing problem? <49> Nanganganak lamang ito. it just gives birth. <50> Mas malakas ang MILF kaysa MNLF, at mas tuso ang BIFF kaysa MILF, ano pa kaya ang kayang gawin ng susunod na sangay nito? the MILF is stronger than the MNLF, the BIFF is slyer than the MILF, what are their next branches capable of? <51> Ang mga grupo na ito ay may kapasidad na magkanlong ng mga terorista at gumawa ng mga kaguluhan sa iba't ibang parte ng Mindanao. these groups have the capacity to take in terrorists and cause trouble in different parts of Mindanao. <52> Sang-ayon ako sa Bangsamoro Basic Law pero ang pakikipagbati sa isang grupo na alam naman natin kung ano ang istilo ng pamamahala at pananaw ay di ko sinasang-ayunan. I agree with the Bangsamoro Basic Law but I do not agree on reconciliation with a group whose style of government and perspective we already know. <53> Ang batas na ito ay dapat para sa mga Muslim na mapayapang naninirahan sa Mindanao at hindi para sa kapakanan ng iisang grupo. this law should be for the Muslims peacefully living in Mindanao and not for the benefit of one group. <54> Isipin sana na hindi lahat ng muslim sa Mindanao ay kasapi ng MILF. consider that not all Muslims in Mindanao are members of the MILF. <55> Sana ay may pangmatagalang solusyon ang gobyerno para dito. hopefully the government has a long-term solution for this. <56> Hindi iyong pansamantala lang. not just a temporary one. <57> Iyong pulido at hindi tapal lang. one that is polished and not just a patch. <58> Dahil kahit sabihing normal na lang ang giyera sa lugar na ito ay napapagod din ang aming mga tenga sa putok at iyakan. because even if it is said that war in this place is only normal, our ears also become tired of shots and cries. <59> Pagluluksa sa 44 Bayani ng PNP-SAF. mourning for the 44 heroes of the PNP-SAF. <60> Nakikidalamhati ako sa mga namatay na pulis sa nangyaring sagupaan sa Mamasapano. I grieve for the police killed in the encounter that happened in Mamasapano. <61> Maraming Salamat at Saludo ako sa Inyo! thanks a lot and I salute you! <62> Tunay kayong bayani sa mata ng buong sambayanan. you are true heroes in the eyes of the whole nation. <63> Hangad ko din ang HUSTISYA sa inyong paglisan. I also desire for justice on your passing. <64> Para sa amin na may kapamilya at kamag-anak na nasa puwersa ng militar, ramdam namin ang pakiramdam nang mawalan ng mahal sa buhay dahil sa isang operasyong militar. for us who have family and relatives in the military force, we know the feeling of losing a loved one because of a military operation. <65> Ganunpaman, ito ay aming napaghandaan dahil sa kanilang sinumpaang tungkulin at pagpapanatili ng kapayapaan. still, it is something we can prepare for because of their sworn duty and maintenance of peace. <66> Hindi lamang sa magugulong bayan sa Maguindanao kundi sa buong parte ng Mindanao at ng bansa. not only in the troubled towns of Maguindanao but in the whole of Mindanao and the country.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_95130301 <1> Occ Min, idineklarang ‘Conflict Manageable and Ready for Development’ ng AFP Occ Min, declared "Conflict" Manageable and Ready for Development' by AFP <2> November 04, 2016 Voltaire N. Dequina November 04, 2016 Voltaire N. Dequina <3> SAN JOSE, Occidental Mindoro, Nob 4 (PIA) – Opisyal na idineklara ng Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) ang lalawigan bilang ‘Conflict Manageable and Ready for Development’ kamakailan sa Provincial Training Center, Mamburao. San Jose, Occidental Mindoro, November 4 (PIA) - Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) officially declared the province as "Conflict" Manageable and Ready for Development' recently at the Provincial Training Center, Mamburao. <4> Sa mensaheng ipinahatid ni AFP Chief of Staff Lt. Gen Ricardo Visaya kay Southern Luzon Command Lt. Gen. Ferdinand Quidilla, batid aniya ng hepe ng Sandatahang Lakas, ang malaking potensyal ng lalawigan upang umunlad. in the message delivered by AFP Chief of Staff Lieutenant General Ricardo Visaya to Southern Luzon Command Lieutenant General Ferdinand Quidilla, it is known to the chief of Armed Forces, the huge potential of the province for growth. <5> Ayon pa dito, kapag may seguridad ang isang pamayanan ay nakatuon ang atensyon ng mga mamamayan sa pagpapaunlad ng kanilang mga kabuhayan, na may malaking epekto sa pagsulong ng bayan. according to him, if there is security within the community the attention of the citizens is on the development of their businesses, which hugely affects the growth of the nation. <6> “Only through peace can we realize progress and prosperity (tanging sa kapayapaan lang natin makakamtan ang pagunlad at kasaganahan)”, dagdag pa ng heneral. "only through peace can we realize progress and prosperity (only through peace can we realize progress and prosperity), added the general. <7> Nagpahatid din ng mensahe si Philippine National Police (PNP) Regional Director PC Supt Wilben Mayor kay Provincial Director PS Supt Reynaldo Jagmis at sinabing ang deklarasyon (Conflict Manageable and Ready for Development) ay isang imbitasyon ng lalawigan sa mga mamumuhunan o investors. A message was also delivered by Philippine National Police (PNP) Regional Director PC Supt Wilben Mayor to Provincial Director PS Supt Reynaldo Jagmis and said the declaration (Conflict Manageable and Ready for Development) is one invitation of the province to investors. <8> Ayon pa sa direktor, makakatuwang na ng kapulisan ang Philippine Army sa pagpapatupad ng batas lalo na sa paglaban sa droga. according to the director, the Philippine Army will be helping the police force in implementing the law especially in the fight against drugs. <9> Ipinaalala rin ni Mayor na kahit may usapang pangkapayapaan sa pagitan ng makakaliwang grupo at pamahalaan ay dapat maging handa pa rin ang lahat. mayor also reminded that although there are talks of peace between the leftist group and government, everybody must remain prepared. <10> “Let us remain vigilant and ready to defend against terrorist threat and aggression whether domestic or foreign (Panatilihin natin ang pagiging mapagmatyag at handang magtanggol sa banta ng terorista at karahasan na maaring magmula sa loob o labas ng bansa)”, ayon pa sa PNP Regional Director. 'let us remain vigilant and ready to defend against terrorist threat and aggression whether domestic and foreign (let us remain vigilant and ready to defend against terrorist threat and aggression whether domestic and foreign)," said the PNP Regional Director. <11> Pinasalamatan naman ni Governor Mario Gene Mendiola ang AFP at PNP sa patuloy nitong pagpapanatili ng katahimikan at kaayusan sa lalawigan. meanwhile, Governor Mario Gene Mendiola thanked AFP and PNP in their continued efforts in keeping peace and quiet in the province. <12> Sinabi pa ng gobernador na ang sanhi ng pakikibaka ay kahirapan kung kaya’t ito umano ang pilit na hinahanapan ng kasagutan ng kanyang administrasyon. the governor said that the cause of struggles is poverty which is why they keep looking for solutions in his administration. <13> Kabilang aniya sa mga proyekto na patuloy na pinagyayaman ng pamahalaang panlalawigan ay pagpapagawa ng mga irigasyon at farm-to-market roads, pamamahagi ng mga makabagong makinarya sa mga kooperatiba, tulong pinasyal sa mga magsasaka at mangingisda at pagpapaunlad sa kalagayang medikal ng lalawigan. he stated that included in his many projects is the continued enrichment by the provincial government in creating irrigation and farm-to-market roads, providing modern machinery to cooperatives, financial assistance to farmers and fishermen, and improving the health condition of the province. <14> “Palalakasin pa natin ang agrikultura at turismo sa lalawigan”, ayon pa kay Mendiola. "let us strengthen the agriculture and tourism in the province," according to Mendiola. <15> Dumalo sa naturang aktibidad ang mga local government units, Local Chief Executives ng labing isang bayan sa lalawigan, PNP, AFP gayundin ang iba pang ahensya ng pamahalaan. the said activity were attended by local government units, Local Chief Executives from eleven cities of the province, PNP, AFP, and other agencies of the government. <16> (VND/PIA MIMAROPA/Occ Min) (VND/PIA MIMAROPA/Occ Min)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_28725247 <1> SIDEKICK NI LOPEZ MAY RAKET sidekick of Lopez has a racket. <2> NAKADUDUDA nang iutos ni DENR Secretary Gina Lopez ang pagsasara sa ilang maliliit na mining company samantalang pinayagan niyang magpatuloy ang operasyon ng mga malalaking kompanya na talamak sa environmental violations. it was suspicious when DENR Secretary Gina Lopez ordered the closure of several small mining companies, while she allowed the operations of big companies with a lot of environmental violations to continue. <3> Taliwas ito sa ipinangako ni Lopez nang hirangin siya ni Pangulong Duterte na maging kalihim. it was contrary to what Lopez promised when she was appointed by President Duterte as secretary. <4> Nangako itong ipasasara ang mga minahan na matagal nang nang-aabuso sa ating likas na yaman. she promised to close down mines that have been abusing our natural resources for a long time. <5> Kaya may mga nagtatanong: May tililing ba itong si DENR Secretary o may iba pang dahilan kaya kaagad tinalikuran ang kanyang pangako? so there are some who ask: is the DENR secretary crazy or does she have another reason for immediately going back on her promise? <6> Minarapat kong mag-imbestiga at nalaman ko nga mula sa DENR insiders na isang ranking official at adviser ni Lopez ang isang “silent partner” ng mga operator ng erring mining firms. I decided to investigate and I found out from DENR insiders that one "silent partner" of operators of erring mining firms is a ranking official and adviser of Lopez. <7> No wonder now! no wonder now! <8> At heto nga ang ilang kompanya na tinukoy na hindi pumasa sa DENR audit and inspection ngunit pinapayagan na makapagpatuloy sa panggagahasa sa kalikasan: Libjo Mining Corp; AAMPHIL Natural Resources and Development Corp; Krominco, Inc; Carrascal Nickel Corp; Marcventures Mining and Dev. Corp; Filmenera Resources Corp; Strongbuilt Mining Dev. Corp; Sinosteel Phil. Mining Corp; Oriental Synergy Mining Corp; Wellex Mining Corp; Oriental Vision Mining Phil. Corp; CTP Const. and Mining Corp; Agata Mining Ventures, Inc; Hinatuan Mining Corp; Benguet Corp; Lepanto Consolidate Mining Company; Oceana-Gold Phil. Inc; Adnama Mining Resources Inc; SR Metals, Inc. Nahalata yata ito ng Commission on Appointments kaya hindi mabasbasan ang pagkakahirang dito sa palpak na pagkapili ni Manong Digong. and here are some companies that were identified to have not passed the DENR audit and inspection, but are being allowed to continue abusing the environment: Libjo Mining Corporation; AAMPHIL Natural Resources and Development Corporation; Krominco, Incorporated; Carrascal Nickel Corporation; Marcventures Mining and Develeopment Corporation; Filmenera Resources Corporation; Strong-built Mining Develeopment Corporation; Sinosteel Philippines Mining Corporation; Oriental Synergy Mining Corporation; Wellex Mining Corporation; Oriental Vision Mining Philippines Corporation; CTP Construction and Mining Corporation; Agata Mining Ventures, Incorporated; Hinatuan Mining Corporation; Benguet Corporation; Lepanto Consolidate Mining Company; Oceana-Gold Philippines Incorporated; Adnama Mining Resources Incorporated; SR Metals, Incorporated. this was seemed to be noticed by the Commission on Appointments, which was why her appointment through the faulty selection of Brother Digong cannot be approved. <9> Manong Digong should think twice before extending Lopez as DENR chief. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_64866660 <1> PNP Romblon, tinatanggap pa ang aplikasyon ng mga nais maging pulis PNP Romblon, the application of those who want to become a police is still accepted <2> February 28, 2016 Dinnes M. Manzo ROMBLON, Romblon, Peb 28 (PIA) --- Patuloy na tumanggap ng mga aplikasyon ang PNP-Romblon para sa mga nagnanais maging pulis. February 28, 2016 Dinnes M. Manzo Romblon, Romblon February 28 (PIA) - the PNP-Romblon continues to receive the applications for those who are desiring to become police. <3> Ang pamunuan ng Romblon Police Provincial Office (RPPO) ay nagre-recruit ng mga tauhang papasok sa serbisyo bilang Police Officer. the leadership of Romblon Police Provincial Office (RPPO) are recruiting members who are going to enter into service as Police Officer. <4> Ang mga kwalipikadong aplikante na nagnanais maging pulis ay kinakailangang magsumite ng mga sumusunod na rekisitos. the qualified applicants who are desiring to become police are needed to submit the following requisites. <5> Kailangan pumasa ang isang aplikante sa psychiatric at psychological, drug at physical test sa kahit alinmang PNP-Napolcom accredited hospital, college graduate, walang masamang record o kaso sa pulisya, military at ibang sangay ng gobyerno. the applicant needs to pass in the psychiatric and psychological, drug and physical test in any of the PNP-Napolcom accredited hospital, college graduate, no bad record or cases in the police, military and other branches of the government. <6> Ang aplikante ay dapat nagkaka-edad ng mula 20-30 anyos. the applicant must be in age of 20-30 years old. <7> Magsadya lamang ng personal sa Admin Division ng police provincial office na matatagpuan sa Bgy. Capaclan, Romblon, Romblon at hanapin si PO2 Mark Karry Madeja. just personally visit the Admin Division of the Police Provincial Office which can be found in Barangay Capaclan, Romblon, Romblon and look for PO2 Mark Karry Madeja. <8> Kasabay rin nitong isasagawa ang pagsusulit para sa mga ibig umangat ang ranggo sa pagiging alagad ng batas. an examination will be held along with this for those who want their ranks to be raised as servants of the law. <9> Magdala rin ng halagang P400 na pambayad sa mga kukuha ng PNP Entrance at Police Officer Exams, P450 para sa Senior Police Officer Exam, P500 para sa Police Inspector Exam at P600 naman para sa Police Superintendent Exam. also bring an amount of P400 as fee for those who are going to take the PNP Entrance and Police Officer Exams, P450 for Senior Police Officer Exam, P500 for Police Inspector Exam and P600 for Police Superintendent Exam. <10> Ang pagsusulit ay gaganapin sa Odiongan National High School sa Abril 24, 2016. (DM/PIA-IVB/Romblon) the examination will be held at Odiongan National High School on April 24, 2016. (DM/PIA-IVB/Romblon)
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_61149922 <1> Estilong Tambiolo* lottery style* <2> ni Mary Joy Capistrano by Mary Joy Capistrano <3> NAKAKAGALIT. KASUMPA-SUMPA. Kung nakamamatay lang ang paggamit ng malalaking letra sa bawat salita, marami na siguro akong naging biktima. revolting. disgusting. if the use of capital letters in each word can cause death, perhaps I would have many victims already. <4> Maagang natapos ang klase ko kanina dahil nagkaroon lang kami ng konsultasyon sa propesor, kaya dumiretso agad ako sa dorm para simulan na sana ang mga papel na hindi ko matapos-tapos. my classes finished early today because we just had a consultation with the professor, so I went straight to the dorm to hopefully start on papers that I can't seem to finish. <5> Pero limang minuto ko pa lang na kaharap ang may dalawang paragraph na word document, nawalan na ako ng gana. Kaya ayun, sa Facebook na naman ako napadpad. but when I had faced the word document for only five minutes, I lost interest already. so there, I ended up on Facebook. <6> Unang tumambad sa akin ang mga artikulo tungkol sa pagkakahuli ng dating detinidong pulitikal na si Ericson Acosta. Kalalaya lamang niya, pero balik kulungan na naman ang dating Kultura editor ng Kule. the article about the capture of former political detainee Ericson Acosta first presented to me. he had just been released, but the former culture editor of Kule is back in prison again. <7> Idol ko siya hindi lang dahil sa husay magsulat kundi dahil din sa galing niyang magsulat at umawit ng sarili niyang mga kanta. he is my idol not just for his skill in writing but also for his skill in writing and singing his own songs. <8> Bukod sa kanya hinuli rin ng mga berdugong pulis ang mga kasamahan niyang sina Anakpawis Partylist Representative Fernando “Ka Pando” Hicap at—ang lalo kong ikinabahala—kasama rin ang kapwa nating estudyante na si Karl Mae, na nakilala ko sa UP Ugnayan ng mga Manunulat at naging kaklase ko rin dati. aside from him the executioner police officers also apprehended his two companions Anakpawis party-list representative Fernando "Ka Pando" Hicap and - I was more worried about - our fellow student as well Karl Mae, whom I got to know in the UP Writer's Association and was also a former classmate. <9> Palabati siya at palangiti sa tuwing magkakasalubong kami sa daan. whenever we encounter each other outside he always greets and smiles. <10> Nagtungo sa Hacienda Luisita ang grupo para magsagawa ng imbestigasyon sa sistemang “tambiolo” o palabunutang patakaran sa pamamahagi ng lupa sa asyenda ng angkan ng Pangulo at ang pagbawas sa kabuuang lawak ng lupa na matagal na dapat naipamamahagi sa mga magsasaka batay sa nauna nang desisyon ng Korte Suprema. the group headed to Hacienda Luisita to conduct an investigation on the "lottery" system or lottery scheme of distributing hacienda land of the relatives of the president and the decrease of overall size of land that should have been distributed to the farmers based on an earlier decision by the Supreme Court. <11> Hindi ko na mapigilang tuliuyang magalit nang mabasa ko ang komento ng ilang tao tungkol sa pagkakahuli nina Ka Pando at Karl Mae. I could not help but be completely angry when I read the comments of some people on the capture of ComradePando and Karl Mae. <12> Ayon sa mga komento, pribadong lugar daw ang asyenda kaya tama lamang na hinuli sila. according to the comments, the hacienda is supposedly a private location so it is right that they were apprehended. <13> Nanggugulo lamang daw sila at sinasamahan pa ng congressman na ginagamit ang kapangyarihan para lamang makapasok sa isang pribadong lugar. they were supposedly just causing trouble and were even joined by a congressman who is using his power in order to enter a private property. <14> Kung pwede ko lang tawirin ang virtual space para busalan ang mga bibig nila para hindi na nila mapahiya pa ang kanilang mga sarili, ginawa ko na—katulad ng matagal ko nang pangarap na pagbusal sa bibig ni Kris Aquino tuwing magsasalita siya sa telebisyon. if I could just cross the virtual space to muzzle their mouths so that they will not embarrass themselves, I would have done it - like my long-time goal of muzzling the mouth of Kris Aquino whenever she speaks on television. <15> Sa dami ng maliliit na isyu niya sa buhay, halos hindi niya yata makita ang nakagagalit na mga isyung kinasasangkutan ng kanyang angkan. with the number of minor issues in her life, she almost cannot see the infuriating issues her family is involved in. <16> Ilang dekada na nga bang ipinaglalaban ng mga magsasaka ang lupa ng HLI? how many decades have the farmers fought for the land of HLI? <17> Ilang buhay na ang nasawi mula sa hanay ng mga magsasaka dahil sa kalupitan ng estado at ang labis na paggamit ng kapangyarihan at salapi ng pamilya Conjuangco-Aquino? how many lives have been taken from the ranks of the farmers because of the cruelty of the state and overuse of power and money by the Conjuangco-Aquino family? <18> Kung tutuusin matagal nang naglabas ng desisyon ang korte ukol sa pamamahagi ng lupa sa mga magsasaka subalit naging usad-pagong pa rin ang takbo ng proseso ng reporma sa asyenda. considering the court has long released a decision about the distribution of land to farmers but the reform process in the hacienda runs at a turtle's pace. <19> Kung tutuusin, kapalit pa ng pamamahagi kuno ng lupa ang sapilitang pagpirma ng kasunduan o ang Application Purchase and Farmers Undertaking (APFU) sa pagitan ng mga magsasaka at DAR ukol sa pagbabayad ng napakamahal na amortisasyon at buwis. considering, the supposed distribution of land is in exchange of the forced signing of the agreement or the Application Purchase and Farmers Undertaking (APFU) between the farmers and DAR about the payment of very expensive amortization and tax. <20> Sino nga ba naman ang hindi pipirma kung napapalibutan ka ng ilang bilang ng mga militar habang “ipinamamahagi” umano ang lupa? who really will not sign if you are surrounded by a number of military while land is supposedly "distributed"? <21> Patunay lamang na itong sistemang tambiolo ay huwad lamang na reporma at ngayo’y lalo pang naging masahol dahil sa pandarahas mga taong aktibong pumapanig sa interes ng mga magsasaka. it is just proof that this lottery system is just a fake reform and now it is worse because of the threats on people actively siding with the interest of the farmers. <22> Malinaw na hindi kailanman kusang bibitawan ng pamilya Conjuagco-Aquino ang ang mga lupang nagpayaman at nagpapayaman sa kanila. it is clear that the Conjuangco-Aquino family will never let go of the lands that made them powerful and rich. <23> Saksi ang kasaysayan sa pagbubuwis ng buhay ng mga magsasaka sa kanilang karapatang magmay-ari ng lupang sila naman mismo ang nagbubungkal, subalit hanggang ngayon hindi sila ang nakikinabang sa puhunan nilang pawis at dugo. history is witness to the farmers sacrificing their lives for their right to own land that they themselves cultivated, but up to now they are not the ones benefiting from their investment of sweat and blood. <24> Habang isinusulat ko ito panaka-naka ko pa ring tinitingnan ang newsfeed ko para sa mga bagong update tungkol sa mga nahuli ngayong araw sa asyenda. while I am writing this I kept looking at my newsfeed a bit for new updates about those captured today in the hacienda. <25> Dalawa lang ang hinihiniling ko sa ngayon—ang kaligtasan nila at ang hustisya. I just have two wishes today - their safety and justice.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_76457024 <1> Isa pang Krimen ni Palparan another crime of Palparan <2> by Teo S. Marasigan by Teo S. Marasigan <3> August 18, 2014 August 18, 2014 <4> Talumpating hindi nabigkas sa piket sa harap ng National Bureau of Investigation noong umaga ng 12 Agosto. speech that wasn't delivered in the picket in front of National Bureau of Investigation last morning of August 12. <5> Mga kasama at mga kababayan! May isa pang krimen si dating Major General Jovito Palparan sa sambayanang Pilipino bukod sa napakaraming kaso ng ekstrahudisyal na pagpaslang, pagdukot at iba pang paglabag sa karapatang pantao. friends and family! Major Genereal Jovito Palparan has another crime to the Filipinos, aside from the many extrajudicial cases of murder, kidnapping, and other violation of human rights. <6> At ang krimen na iyan ay nasa paraan kung paano niya ginawa ang mga paglabag sa karapatang pantao. Ginawa niya ang mga ito nang lantaran, bulgaran, para bang inaanunsyo. and that crime is in line with how he violated human rights. he did this brazenly, and bluntly, almost as if announcing it. <7> Darating siya sa isang rehiyon at darami ang mga paglabag sa karapatang pantao doon. he comes to one region, and the violation of human rights will increase there. <8> Pero walang kurap niyang sasabihin, kahit sa harap ng kamera, na hindi ang mga tauhan niya ang pumaslang, na wala ang nawawala sa kampo ng militar, na hindi siya ang may kasalanan. but he says it without a blink of an eye, in front of a camera, that it wasn't his people who killed, that there were no missing from the military camp, that it wasn't his fault. <9> Sa isang interbyu, sinabi niyang nagbibigay lang siya ng “inspirasyon” para sa mga paglabag. in one interview, he said that he only gives "inspiration" for the violations. <10> Wala rin siyang tigil sa pagsasalita para bigyang-katwiran ang mga ito — kasama na ang paniniil sa mga baryo ng karaniwang tao. he also was unstoppable in giving excuses for this - along with the tyranny in villages of ordinary people. <11> Sa isang State of the Nation Address o SONA mismo, pinuri siya ni Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo. in one State of the Nation Address or SONA, Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo even praised him. <12> May panahong naging karaniwan na para sa mga aktibista na makatanggap ng mensaheng text tungkol sa mga kapwa-aktibista na pinakabagong biktima ng pagpatay at pagdukot — magkakasunod sa loob lang ng ilang araw. there was a time that it became ordinary for activists to receive text messages about co-activists that were recent victims of murder and kidnapping - in consecutive days. <13> Naging laman ng midya, lalo na ng alternatibong midya, ang mga larawan ng mga pinaslang at dinukot, minsan kasama ang mga duguang bangkay nila — silang mga nanay, tatay, asawa, anak, kapatid, kaibigan, at kasama sa pakikibaka. the photos of the murdered and kidnapped; sometimes even with bloody corpse- the mother and father, wife, children, sibling, friend, and co-activists was all over the media, especially the alternative media. <14> Mga kasama at mga kababayan! Ininsulto ni Palparan ang sambayanang Pilipino! friends and family! Palparan is insulting us Filipinos! <15> Bawat pagpaslang, pagdukot at paglabag sa karapatang pantao ay pagdura sa mukha ng sambayanan. every murder, kidnapping, and violation of human rights is a spit to the face of the town. <16> Ipinamukha niya sa atin na wala tayong magagawa, hindi natin siya mapipigilan, at wala tayong kapangyarihan para papanagutin siya. he slapped to our faces that we can't do anything, that we can't stop him, and that we don't have any power to hold it against him. <17> Pero ngayong umaga, mga kasama at mga kababayan, tumitindig tayo dito sa harap ng NBI dahil pinatunayan ng sambayanan na mali si Palparan. but this morning, friends and family, we're standing here in front of NBI to prove that Palparan is wrong. <18> Mali si Palparan! Palparan is wrong! <19> Hindi ilulutang ng gobyerno ni Noynoy Aquino si Palparan kung hindi lumalakas ang mga protesta at pagkondena ng sambayanan sa Pork Barrel King dahil sa katiwalian sa pamahalaan. government of Noynoy Aquino will not lift Palparan unless there are strong protests and disapproval of the people to the Pork Barrel King because of his corruption in the government. <20> Naghahanap si Noynoy ng pampabango sa publiko at pagdidiin na si Gloria pa rin, diumano, ang kalaban. Noynoy is searching for a way to smell good to the public, and is further condemning Gloria as the enemy, according to him. <21> Ilinaw natin: Hindi utang ng sambayanan sa gobyernong Aquino ang paglutang kay Palparan; matagal nang utang ito ng gobyernong Aquino sa atin! let's make it clear: the people doesn't owe the government of Aquino for lifting Palparan; this has been a long time debt of the government of Aquino to us! <22> Hindi rin ilulutang si Palparan kung hindi dahil sa pagpupunyagi sa loob ng maraming taon ng sambayanan na ilantad siya bilang berdugo. Palparan won't also be lifted if it weren't for the efforts of the people in many years to unveil him as a murderer. <23> Hindi ilulutang si Palparan kung hindi dahil sa pagpupunyagi sa loob ng maraming taon ng sambayanan na labanan si Gloria na mandaraya, korap, pahirap, pasista at papet. Palparan won't be lifted if it weren't for the efforts of the people in many years to fight Gloria, a cheater, corrupt, fascist, and puppet. <24> Tandaan natin: inilabas ang warrant of arrest kay Palparan noong gustong ipakita ng gobyernong Aquino na seryoso ito sa pagpapanagot kay Gloria! let's remember: warrant of arrest was drawn to Palparan when the Aquino government wanted to show how serious they are in holding Gloria responsible. <25> Mga kasama at mga kababayan. Hindi dito nagtatapos ang pakikibaka natin para kamtin ang katarungan at papanagutin si Palparan; ang totoo, bagong simula lang ito para sa ating pakikibaka. friends and family. our protests to achieve peace and to hold Palparan responsible doesn't end here; in fact, this is just the start of of our protests. <26> Kailangan nating tiyaking walang espesyal na pagtrato sa kanya, na mahahatulan siyang maysala, at mabubulok siya sa bilangguan. we need to assure that there will be no special treatments for him, that he will be sentenced guilty, and rot in jail. <27> Ang gusto lang nating sabihin: Wala mang tunay na katarungan para sa sambayanan sa ilalim ng sistemang pinaghaharian ng iilang mayaman at makapangyarihan, magagawa nating magpanagot, sa iba’t ibang paraan, lalo na ng pinakamalalaking berdugo sa sambayanan. what we want to say: there might be no true justice for the people under the system ruled by some rich and powerful, we can make them responsible in different ways, especially the biggest murderer of the town. <28> Gaano man kabagal ang takbo ng gulong ng katarungan kapag para sa sambayanan, magagawa nating magpanagot! regardless of how slow the wheel of justice for the people will turn, we can make them pay! <29> Ngayong araw, nagkaroon tayo ng dagdag na patunay para sabihing: Dahil patuloy na lumalaban ang sambayanan, at dahil patuloy na lumalakas ang paglaban ng sambayanan, may araw rin ang mga pasista. May araw rin sila! this day, we have more proof to say: because of the continuous fight of the people, because of the stronger fight of the people, there will be a day for the fascists. they will have their day! <30> Mabuhay ang sambayanang lumalaban! long live the people who fight! <31> Patuloy nating isisigaw at ipaglalaban: Katarungan, katarungan, katarungan! we continue to shout and fight: justice, justice, justice! <32> 18 Agosto 2014 18 August 2014
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_37051638 <1> Edukasyon hindi condom education not condom <2> Posted by: hataw tabloid posted by: Hataw Tabloid <3> on December 7, 2016 on Devember 7, 2016 <4> in Opinion in opinion <5> HINDI kaya nag-iisip itong si Health Secretary Paulyn Ubial nang sabihin niya na sa susunod na taon ay magsisimula na silang mamahagi ng condom sa mga paaralan para iiwas ang mga kabataan sa patuloy na pagtaas ng kaso ng HIV/AIDS? was the health secretary not thinking when she said that next year they will start giving away condoms in schools to prevent the continuous increase in cases of HIV/AIDS among the youth? <6> Ngayon pa lang ay ramdam na ang init ng pagtutol hindi lamang ng Simbahang Katolika kundi ng mga magulang at iba’t ibang grupo sa plano ng DOH. as early as now, objection can be felt not only from the Catholic church but also from parents and different groups against the plan of the DOH. <7> Kung bakit hindi muna asikasuhing mabuti ng kagawaran ang pagpapaigting sa information campaign tungkol sa HIV/AIDS at kung anong mga problemang pinag-uugatan nito gaya ng premarital sex, pagkakaroon ng maraming sexual partners at pagpaplano ng pamilya nang tama, mapa-natural way man ‘yan o gamit ang contraceptive. why the department is not properly focusing on information campaigns about HIV/AIDS and the problematic root causes like premarital sex, having multiple sexual partners and correct family planning, either through natural ways or through the use of contraceptives. <8> Hindi dapat isinubo ng DOH ang plano nitong pagbibigay ng condom sa mga kabataan sa mga paaralan dahil lalo lamang nitong binibigyan ng ideya ang mga bata na dahil may condom na ay ayos nang makipag-sex o ok lang makipag-sex silang mga kabataan basta protektado. the DOH should not have pressed on with their plan of giving condoms to the youth in schools because it will only worsen the situation and give ideas to the children that having sex is okay because they have condoms or sex is okay as long as they are protected. <9> Nakikita natin ang marubdob na adbokasiya ng DOH na makontrol ang paglaganap ng HIV/AIDS sa bansa, pero hindi ito sa pamamagitan ‘lang’ nang pamamahagi ng condom. we can see the DOH's strong advocacy to control the spread of HIV/AIDS in the country, but not through the distribution of condoms only. <10> Pinakamainam pa rin ang edukasyon bilang tugon at panlaban sa patuloy na paglala ng kaso ng nakamamatay na sakit. education is still the best response and defense against the continuing increase in cases of this deadly disease.

characteristics nila na maaaring ma-associate mo sa iyong sariling personalidad. these celebrities should be observed and evaluated, especially the characteristics of theirs that you may associate with your own personality. <18> Posible kasing ang mga characteristics na ito ay katulad ng mga bagay na dapat mong kilalanin o i-incorporate sa iyong sarili. this is because it's possible that these mo sa iyong panaginip. there may also be a relationship between you and the roles or role being played by the celebrities that you see in your dreams. <20> Kahit hindi mo kilala talaga ng personal ang koneksiyon sa iyo ng bungang-tulog mo. even though you don't personally know the famous celebrities you see in your dreams, the roles they take on that you watch or your view and perception of their character may give you a clue to or understanding your connection to your dreams. <21> Sa kabilang banda, maaaring bunga lang ng napanood mo sa TV o pelikula o kaya ay nabasa mong istorya sa mga in tabloids and showbiz magazines, causing them to show up in your dreams. <22> Kung ganito nga ang kaso, wala talagang significant na kahulugan sa iyo ang mga artistang ito at incidental lang ang pagkakapasok nila sa iyong bungang-tulog. if that's the case, then these celebrities don't have any significant meaning to you and their entry into your dreams is purely incidental. <23> Señor H. MATERIAL_BASE-1B_17187703 <1> Usapang Uste: Ang pagkalinga ng Unibersidad sa wikang pambansa UST discussion: the university's care of the national language <2> By Managing Editor - February 1, 2017 by managing editor - February 1, 2017 <3> NAGING mainit na paksa na noon pa man sa pagitan ng mga akademiko ang bisa ng paggamit ng Filipino bilang pangunahing wika sa mga pamantasan. the effectiveness of using Filipino as the main language in universities became a hot topic before among academics. <4> Sa isyu ng Varsitarian noong 1962, inilahad sa pangulong tudling nito ang mungkahing palaganapin ang Filipino bilang pang-araw-araw na wika sa loob ng Unibersidad. in the 1962 issue of Varsitarian, the main editorial stated the suggestion to spread Filipino as the everyday language inside the university. <5> Kasabay ito ng nakahihigit na paggamit ng Ingles lalo na sa mga pang-akademikong usapin na bunsod ng pananakop ng mga Amerikano sa Filipinas. this coincides with the superior use of English especially in academic discussion due to the American colonization of the Philippines. <6> Ayon sa artikulo, mainam na pook sana ang Unibersidad upang hulmahin ang pang-unawa ng mga kabataan, partikular na ng mga Tomasino, hinggil sa lupang kinalakhan nila. according to the article, the university would have been a good place to mold the understanding of the youth, particularly the Thomasians, about the land they grew up in. <7> Pinabulaanan din nito ang paniniwalang maaaring luma na ang ating katutubong wika kaya hindi na dapat ito gamitin. it also contradicted the belief that our native language may be antiquated so it should not be used anymore. <8> “Ang wika ay hindi maaaring ihalintulad sa isang bangkong kinalawang na sa matagal na pagkakaupo, kaya’t ibig nang palitan ng mahusay-husay. "language cannot be compared to a chair that has rusted due to prolonged seating, so it should be replaced with a better one. <9> Ito ay walang hugis, walang kulay, walang anyo,” pagdidiin nito. it does not have shape, color, or form," it stressed. <10> Mungkahi pa ng editoryal, ang Unibersidad dapat ang nagsisilbing ikalawang tahanan ng mga mag-aaral upang paghandaan ang kanilang mga kinabukasan bilang bahagi ng lipunan. the editorial even suggests, the university serves as the second home of students to prepare their futures as members of society. <11> Kung pananatilihin ang paggamit ng Filipino at sisimulan ito sa mga pamantasan, tiyak na mananatiling buhay ang mga katutubong wika sa mga susunod na henerasiyon. if the use of Filipino will be maintained and it will begin in universities, native languages will surely remain alive in the future generations. <12> Tomasino siya he is a Thomasian <13> Bagaman malayo na ang narating bilang mediko, malapit pa rin si Juan Sanchez sa mga mahihirap na komunidad kung saan maraming pasyente ang kapos sa kakayahang pinansiyal upang magpagamot. despite accomplishing a lot as a medic, Juan Sanchez is still close to the poor in the community wherein he has many patients lacking financial capability to get treatment. <14> Taong 1980 nang magtapos siya ng medisina sa Unibersidad. it was year 1980 when he finished medicine in the university. <15> Sa kalaunan, ipinagpatuloy ni Sanchez ang pagsasanay ng General Surgery sa Veteran’s Memorial Medical Center (1982-1986) at ng Plastic Reconstructive Surgery naman sa Makati Medical Center (1988-1991). eventually, Sanchez continued his training in general surgery at the Veteran's Memorial Medical Center (1982-1986) and in plastic reconstructive surgery at Makati Medical Center (1988-1991). <16> Tumungo siya noong 1992 sa Virginia sa Estados Unidos upang pormal na magsanay ng Aesthetic, Craniofacial and Microvascular Surgery sa Eastern Virginia Medical School. in 1992 he went to Virginia in the United States to formally train in aesthetic, craniofacial and microvascular surgery at Eastern Virginia Medical School. <17> Noong 1987, nanguna siya sa Philippine Board of General Surgery gayundin sa Philippine Board of Plastic Surgery naman noong 1991. in 1987, he headed the Philippine Board of General Surgery as well as the Philippine Board of Plastic Surgery in 1991. <18> Tumatayo siya bilang lead surgeon sa buwanang pagbisita ng Rotary Club of San Francisco del Monte’s DOCS Mobile Surgical Unit sa ilang bahagi ng lungsod Quezon, Payatas, siyudad ng Marikina, Bulacan at iba pa. he serves as lead surgeon in the monthly visit of the Rotary Club of San Francisco del Monte's DOCS Mobile Surgical Unit in some parts of Quezon City, Payatas, Marikina City, Bulacan, and others. <19> Nagsimula ang nabanggit na Monthly Surgical Missions noong Setyembre 2007. the said monthly surgical missions started in September 2007. <20> Kabilang din siya sa ilan pang mga misyon tulad ng Gawad Kalusugan, Operation Smile, at Filipino-American Club of North Texas na naglalayong panatilihing mabuti ang kalagayan ng bawat Filipino sa loob at labas ng bansa. he is also a part of other missions like Gawad Kalusugan, Operation Smile, and Filipino-American Club of North Texas that aims to maintain the good condition of each Filipino inside and outside the country. <21> Upang ibahagi ang kaniyang kaalaman sa larangan ng medisina, sumulat din si Sanchez ng ilang mga aklat tulad ng “Oriental Rhinoplasty,” “Local and Regional Anesthetic Blocks Made Simple (2002)” at “Doctors’ Practices, Strategies and Guides to Success (2003)”. to share his knowledge in the field of medicine, Sanchez also wrote some books like "oriental rhinoplasty," "local and regional anesthetic blocks made simple (2002)" and "doctors' practices, strategies and guides to success (2003)". <22> Noong 2009, nominado naman siya sa ilang malalaking parangal tulad ng Ten Outstanding Filipino Physicians at Ten Outstanding Filipinos. in 2009, he was nominated for some major awards like the ten outstanding Filipino physicians and ten outstanding Filipinos. <23> Sa loob ng dalawang taon (2009-2010), siya ang hinirang na Most Outstanding Rotarian of the Rotary Club of San Francisco del Monte. within two years (2009-2010), he was honored as the most outstanding Rotarian of the Rotary Club of San Francisco del Monte. <24> Sa kasalukuyan, patuloy na ginagamit ni Sanchez ang kalinangan sa medisina upang mabigyan ng paglilingkod at malasakit ang mga pinakanangangailangan nito. currently, Sanchez continues to use his skills in medicine to offer service and concern to those who need it the most.
MATERIAL_BASE-1B_62816968 <1> Sabado, Agosto 2, 2014 Saturday, August 2, 2014 <2> Makatang Pablo Neruda, namatay sa kanser o pinaslang? poet Pablo Neruda, died in cancer or murdered? <3> MAKATANG PABLO NERUDA, NAMATAY SA KANSER O PINASLANG? ni Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. poet Pablo Neruda, died in cancer or murdered? by Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. <4> Apatnapung taong singkad nang namayapa sa kanyang himlayan ang makatang si Pablo Neruda (Hulyo 12, 1904 - Setyembre 23, 1973), ngunit malaking kontrobersya hinggil sa pagkamatay niya ang yumanig sa mundo. exactly forty years when the poet Pablo Neruda (July 12, 1904 - September 23, 1973) rested in peace in his graveyard, but a big controversy about his death has shaken the world. <5> Hindi raw namatay sa kanser si Pablo Neruda kundi siya raw ay nilason. Pablo Neruda had been said not to have died but he was poisoned. <6> Kilalang makata si Pablo Neruda, hindi lamang sa kanyang bansa, kundi sa iba't ibang panig ng daigdig. Pablo Neruda is a famous poet, not only in his country, but also in the various parts of the world. <7> Katunayan, mas nakilala ko siya nang ilathala sa ating bansa ang aklat na "Pablo Neruda, Mga Piling Tula" noong 2004. in fact, I have known him better when his book "Pablo Neruda, Selected Poems" is published last 2004 in our country. <8> Isa itong proyekto ng pagsasalin ng mga makatang Filipino sa ating wika ng mga tula ni Neruda. this is a project of Filipino poets in translating the poems of Neruda to our language. <9> Sina national artist Virgilio S. Almario at si UP Prof. Romulo P. among them are national artist Virgilio S. Almario and UP Prof. Romulo P. <10> Baquiran Jr. ang mga editor ng nasabing aklat. Baquiran Jr. the editors of the said book. <11> Pablo Neruda ang sagisag-panulat ng Chilenong makatang si Neftali Ricardo Reyes Basoalto. Pablo Neruda, the pen name of the Chilean poet Neftali Ricardo Reyes Basoalto. <12> Hinango umano niya ang sagisag-panulat niyang ito mula sa makatang Czech na si Jan Neruda. said to have based this pen name from the Czech poet Jan Neruda. <13> kasapi siya ng Partido Komunista ng Chile. he is a member of the Communist Party of Chile. <14> Si Pablo Neruda ay nagawaran ng Lenin Peace Prize noong 1953 at nagkamit ng Nobel Prize for Literature noong 1971. Pablo Neruda was awarded a Lenin Peace Prize last 1953 and achieved a Nobel Prize for Literature last 1971. <15> Kaya ang balitang pinalang si Neruda at hindi namatay sa kanser ay nakakabigla, lalo na sa mga umiidolo sa kanya bilang makata ng daigdig. so the news that Neruda was murdered and had not died in cancer was shocking, especially those who idolize him as a world poet. <16> Tinawag siyang "pinakadakilang makata ng ika-20 siglo sa anumang wika" ng namayapa nang nobelistang Colombianong si Gabriel Garcia Marquez. he is hailed as "the greatest poet of the 20th century in any language" of the late Colombian novelist Gabriel Garcia Marquez. <17> Ayon kay Manuel Araya, na tsuper ni Neruda noon, pinaslang si Neruda. according to Manuel Araya, driver of Neruda before, Neruda was murdered. <18> Inindyeksyunan umano ng lason ang makata habang nakaratay sa isang klinika. the poet was said to have been injected with poison while he was lying on the clinic. <19> Ayon sa ilang ulat, isang misteryosong Mr. Price ang nag-indyeksyon, na sa ilang imbestigasyon ay sinasabing isang ahente ng CIA (Central Intelligence Agency). according to the report, a mysterious Mr. Price had injected, which in some investigations identified him as an agent of the CIA (Central Intelligence Agency). <20> Namatay si Neruda labindalawang araw matapos magtagumpay ang kudeta ni Heneral Augusto Pinochet, at mapatalsik ang sosyalistang pangulong si Salvador Allende. Neruda died twelve days after the successful coup d'état of General Augusto Pinochet, and ousted the socialist president Salvador Allende. <21> Ang makatang si Neruda ay isa sa matinding tumuligsa laban sa kudeta at kay Pinochet. the poet Neruda is one of those who are severely criticizing against the coup d'état and Pinochet. <22> Wala pang dalawang linggo ay namatay na ang makata. not more than two weeks, the poet died. <23> Plano pa naman umano niyang umalis ng bansa sa susunod na araw. he was said to have been planning to leave the country the next day. <24> Dahil sa pagbubulgar na ito ni Araya, nagkainteres ang Partido Komunista ng Chile kaya't nanawagan ito ng muling pag-awtopsiya sa bangkay upang malaman ang totoo. because of this revelation by Araya, the Communist Party of Chile is taking interest so it is calling for an autopsy again on the corpse in order to know the truth. <25> May ikatlong partido umano ang sangkot, ayon kay Atty. Eduardo Contreras, abogado ng Partido Komunista ng Chile. there is said to have been a third party involved, according to Atty. Eduardo Contreras, lawyer of the Communist Party of Chile. <26> Kaya nag-atas si Hukom Mario Carroza ng pagsusuri sa bangkay noong Pebrero 2013. that is why Judge Mario Carroza mandated for the examination of the corpse last February 2013. <27> Gayunpaman, ayaw ng pinuno ng Pablo Neruda Foundation, na si Juan Agustin Figueroa, na muling hukayin ang bangkay upang suriin, dahil pagyurak umano ito sa alaala ng makata. nevertheless, the leader of the Pablo Neruda Foundation, who is Juan Agustin Figueroa, does not want to exhume the corpse for examination, because this is a spit on the memory of the poet. <28> Ang Pablo Neruda Foundation ay itinatag ng biyuda ni Pablo Neruda upang itaguyod at panatilihin ang pamana ng makata sa mga susunod na henerasyon. the Pablo Neruda Foundation is founded by the widow of Pablo Neruda in order to support and retain the legacy of the poet to the next generation. <29> Apatnapung taon nang naililibing ang makata, at sa haba ng panahong iyon ay tiyak na naagnas na ang kanyang bangkay. the poet has been buried for forty years, and at the length of that time, surely, the corpse has already disintegrated. <30> Kaya may agam-agam si Dr. Luis Ravanal na isang imbestigador mula sa Ombudsman ng Chile. Dr. Luis Ravanal, an investigator from the Ombudsman of Chile, has doubts. <31> Ayon sa kanya, "Napakabigat na salik ang panahon, dahil isang salik itong maaaring bumura sa ebidensya. according to him, "time is a heavy aspect, because this is an aspect which may erase the evidence. <32> Naaagnas ang laman, at sakali mang may gamiting lason sa pagkamatay ay maaaring wala na ring bakas." the flesh is going to rot, and if there is a poison used in the murder, it is possible that there has been no traces." <33> Noong ika-8 ng Nobyembre 2013, matapos ang pitong buwan ng imbestigasyon ng 15-kataong bumubuo ng forensic team, ay inilabas nila ang resulta. last 8th of November 2013, after seven months of investigation of the 15 members composing the forensic team, they released the result. <34> Ayon kay Patricio Bustos, pinuno ng medical legal service ng Chile, walang anumang bakas ng kemikal o lason na maiuugnay sa pagkamatay ni Neruda. according to Patricio Bustos, head of the medical legal service of Chile, no trace of chemical or poison that can be related to the death of Neruda. <35> Isang magaling na makata si Neruda na kinikilala sa daigdig, maging dito sa ating bansa. Neruda is a great poet known in the world, even here in the country. <36> Dahil dito'y isinalin ko sa wikang Filipino ang dalawa niyang tula - ang Clenched Soul, na isang tula ng pag-ibig, at ang tulang Chant to Bolivar, na alay niya kay Simón Bolívar (1783 - 1830), isa sa mga magagaling na pinuno ng rebolusyon laban sa imperyo ng España, at nagsilbing inspirasyon ni Pangulong Hugo Chavez ng Venezuela at ng iba pang bansa sa Latino Amerika para sa rebolusyong Bolivariano. because of this, I have translated in Filipino his two poems - the Clenched Soul, a love poem, and the poem Chant to Bolivar, which he dedicated to Simon Bolivar (1783-1830), one of the great leaders of the revolution against the imperialism of Spain, and serves as an inspiration of President Hugo Chavez of Venezuela and other countries in Latin America for Bolivian revolution. <37> Kumatha na rin ako ng soneto hinggil sa kanyang pagkamatay. I also wrote a sonnet about his death. <38> KINUYOM NA DIWA tula ni Pablo Neruda salin ni Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. Clenched Soul, poem by Pablo Neruda, translated by Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. <39> Kita’y nawala sa takipsilim Ngayong gabi’y walang nakakita sa ating magkahawak-kamay habang dumaratal sa mundo ang bughaw na magdamag. we have lost even in twilight. no one saw us this evening hand in hand while the blue night dropped on the world. <40> Natanaw ko sa aking durungawan ang pagdatal ng dilim sa kalapit lang na kabundukan. I gaze through my window the arrival of darkness in the nearby mountains. <41> Minsan ilang bahagi ng araw ay sumusunog na tila barya sa aking kamay. sometimes a piece of sun burned like a coin in my hand. <42> Dumadalaw ka sa gunita ng kuyom kong diwa sa kalungkutan kong naaarok mo. I remembered you with my soul clenched in that sadness of mine that you know. <43> Nasaan ka ng mga panahong yaon? where were you during those times then? <44> Sino pa ang naroroon? who else was there? <45> Anong ipinahahayag? saying what? <46> Bakit biglang dumatal sa akin ang kabuuan ng paggiliw kung kailan ako malungkot at ramdam kong napakalayo mo? why will the whole of love come on me suddenly when I am sad and feel you are far away? <47> Lumagpak ang aklat na laging pinid sa takipsilim at ang bughaw na pangginaw ay nakatiklop tulad ng nasaktang aso sa aking paanan. the book fell that always closed at twilight and my blue sweater rolled like a hurt dog at my feet. <48> Lagi, lagi kang lumilisan sa mga gabi patungo sa takipsilim ng napapawing bantayog. always, always you recede through the evenings toward the twilight erasing statues. <49> AWIT KAY BOLIVAR tula ni Pablo Neruda salin ni Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. Chant to Bolivar poem by Pablo Neruda translated by Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. <50> Ama Namin, sumasalangit ka, sa tubig, sa hangin sa lahat ng aming tahimik at malawak na agwat lahat ay nagtataglay ng iyong ngalan, Ama sa aming tahanan: ang ngalan mo'y nagpapatamis sa tubó ang lata ni Bolivar ay may ningning ni Bolivar lumilipad ang ibong Bolivar sa ibabaw ng bulkang Bolivar ang patatas, ang salitre, ang mga aninong natatangi, ang mga batis, ang mga ugat ng batong siklaban ang lahat ay nagmula sa iyong pinuksang buhay pamana mo ang mga ilog, kapatagan, batingaw sa moog pamana mo ang aming kinakain sa araw-araw, O, Ama. our Father thou art in Heaven, in water, in air, in all our silent and broad latitude everything bears your name, Father in our dwelling: your name raises sweetness in sugarcane Bolivar tin has a Bolivar gleam the Bolivar bird flies over the Bolivar volcano the potato, the saltpeter, the special shadows, the brooks, the phosphorous stone veins everything comes from your extinguished life your legacy was rivers, plains, bell towers your legacy is our daily bread, oh Father. <51> SA IYONG KAMATAYAN, KA PABLO NERUDA tula ni Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. In Your Death, Brother Pablo Neruda poem by Gregorio V. Bituin Jr. <52> 15 pantig bawat taludtod 15 syllables for each verse <53> ilang araw matapos ang kudeta ni Pinochet noong ikaw ay pumanaw sa panahon ng lupit ikaw ba'y talagang namatay sa kanser mong sakit? few days after the coup d'état of Pinochet when you passed away in the time of cruelty did you really die in your cancer illness? <54> o kaaway mo'y pinaslang ka sa matinding galit? or murdered in the hands of your enemy whose anger was great? <55> apatnapung taon nang ikaw sa mundo'y lumisan nang binulgar ng tsuper mo ang nangyaring pagpaslang kaylaki ng iyong pamanang sa mundo'y iniwan kaya pagpaslang sa iyo'y walang kapatawaran forty years from this world you have left when your driver revealed the murder that happened how great is legacy in the world the reason why the murder is unforgivable <56> nakabibigla, ito nga'y malaking kontrobersya hanggang hinukay ang iyong labi, inawtopsiya anang pamahalaan, di ka pinaslang, Neruda labi'y walang bakas ng lason, ayon sa kanila shocking, this is really a big controversy until your body is exhumed, autopsied, said the government, you were not murdered, Neruda, your remains did not have traces of poison, according to them <57> mabuhay ka at ang iyong pamana sa daigdig tula mo'y patuloy na babasahin, maririnig long live and your legacy to the world your poems will be read continuously, heard

MATERIAL_BASE-1B_72916769 <1> Zambales fishermen namamangka na sa WPS By Jojo Perez September 3, 2016Ikinatuwa ng mga mangingisda sa lalawigan ng Zambales ang gina­wang pagpayag ng bansang China upang sila ay makapangisda na sa Scarborough Shoal sa West Philippine Sea (WPS). Zambales fishermen now sail in WPS by Jojo Perez September 3, 2016 fishermen of Zambales city rejoiced China's permission for them to fish in Scarborough Shoal in West Philippine Sea (WPS). <2> Ang pagpayag umano ng bansang China na muling pumalaot sa Pana­tag Shoal ang mga mangi­ngisda ay resulta ng ginawang pakikipagpulong ni Pangulong Duterte kay Chinese Ambassador Zhao Jianhua kahapon. the approval of China for fishermen to sail in Panatag Shoal is the result of President Duterte's meeting with Chinese Ambassador Zhao Jianhua yesterday. <3> Sa panayam ng Abante sa mangingisdang si Ruben Correa na taga Masinloc, Zambales, matapos umano ang matagal na panahong pagbabawal sa kanila na makakuha ng ikinabubuhay sa dagat sa bahagi ng WPS ay lubos ang kanilang pasasalamat kay Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte. in the interview of Abante with fisherman, Ruben Correa of Masinloc, Zambales, he said that after a long time of prohibiting them to continue their livelihood in WPS, they're very grateful to President Rodrigo Duterte. <4> “Ilang taon din kami nakikipaghabulan at nagtatago para makapangisda sa Panatag (Shoal) kaya lang ayaw namin sumugal noon kasi natatakot kami sa coast guard ng China,” ayon pa kay Correa. "it has also been a couple of years of tiptoeing just to fish in Panatag (Shoal), although we didn't want to gamble before because we were afraid of the coast guard of China," according to Correa.
